review_body: I had stayed here on a stop back through in August (staycation) between an Australia trip and San Diego to Canada. So, when it came time to share it with the man in my life, he too said he found it to have an authentic Hawaiian feel. He also liked the view of the park from our lanai. It was his first time on Oahu, and it made the right impression (thank you). We were glad to get this in right before the shutdowns began!

I revisited Hawaii after many years and found the island to be as friendly and welcoming as before. The staff treated me as a friend. All of my questions were answered. I received excellent tips on sights to see and treated royally.

Luana used to be a decent hotel but the cracks turned to creators. Terrible crisis response from hotel upper management. Historically unexpected virus crisis, yes... but do not coldly strip away guest amenities without replacing it with kindness and aloha. This is not “sharing our concern.” Zero communication to guests. We calmly reported all matters to professional front desk staff and Aqua Aston reservations phone number yet no response or notice from on-site Luana manager. In time of need, hotels should step up hospitality not coldly rip it away from guests. Hand sanitizer (as mentioned by other review) not visible at lobby water station or anywhere near any elevators. One bottle behind front desk and 1 wet wipe can. Water stations missing from pool and lobby; at least put out free bottled water, the hotel is 90% vacant, it’s a crisis and guests are in need of supplies, support & resources. Cleaning staff drastically reduced, at least keep the cleaning staff onboard during a virus pandemic. No updates on the many local Waikiki closures or shelter-in-place declarations. Free shuttle hours 10:30am posted by management erroneously it’s still 8:30am. And no guest help from the hotel manager to get to supplies or food during this crisis. Free wine and cheese event can be substituted with room delivery to those that enjoy the hospitality. Just a nice Luana care package with practical emergency supplies would have been awesome. Basically if something goes down, you’re on your own folks. Glad to be home in the mainland, felt like a contestant on Survivor. Luana in the early 2000’s was top notch hospitality, I’ve stayed 3 times previous, but since new manager stepped in it hasn’t stepped up.

We somewhat enjoyed our stay but is it so difficult to have hand sanitizer stations on every floor and near the elevator? There is a call for it during the coronavirus outbreak. Please don’t be clueless. It’s become the new standard for public places and businesses.

All around great staff, the front desk folks are so helpful and peasant. The bellmen are great guys, friendly, fun and go out of their way to please. Have been returning to the Luana for years and the staff play a huge part in my decision to return.

Nice hotel - average room with Kitchenette. Well stocked - staff were very friendly. Room was always cleaned.  Had a small problem with our safe and it was fixed about 10 minutes after we had talked to the people at the front desk. Fish Hook Cafe - part of the hotel very good food. Only thing would have been if it had stayed open past 2pm. No restaurant in the hotel for dinner. We were close to other good restaurants.

OH MY GOODNESS! CAN I START OFF BY SAYING MAHALO TO ALL STAFF OF THIS HOTEL!! My husband & I just got married & we are celebrating our honeymoon here in Hawaii before moving to Japan. I am from the Philippines & so this is my first ever time here in the United States. What a great idea was it to not only come to Hawaii for our honeymoon. But staying in this hotel by far has been absolutely amazing! Everything from cleanliness, professionalism & customer service. I wish we never left!!!! I felt guilty because there was a guest behind me waiting to be served by your wonderful front desk staff. But their customer service was so great that they actually listened to my husband’s terrible dad jokes..... which I think they laughed a little too hard about because he’s really not that funny. But thank you Alexis, Kim & Martha for taking one for me and listening to him talk up a storm. The restaurant they have on property on the lobby level was as locals say “broke da mouth laddat” which I think means very delicious. So delicious in fact that I nearly had a “kanak attack” - I think means food coma because even if I was already so full, it was so good I ate it all. I could go on & on about how great my stay was but then I’ll really be my husband’s wife. Haha!! Mahalo again Luana ohana, especially again to Alexis, Kim & Martha!!

This was my first time staying at the Luana. My friends and I had a wedding to attend and because of the out of town guests, we decided to spend some time together in Waikiki. We chose the Luana because of the Location and also the affordable rates they had to offer. From the time we booked our reservations, to the day of check-in, and check-out, our expectations of their customer service were definitely exceeded! A special thank you to the Front Desk agents- Kim, Alexis, and Martha who helped us with our reservations from day one. They went above and beyond to help accommodate our large group and made sure we were taken cared of upon our arrival. We had two rooms, which were spacious and clean. They even accommodated an early check in and check out that we had requested, which we were informed was not guaranteed but based upon availability of the day of. Also, James and Chet were more than helpful on the day of check in assisting us with our cars and luggage! Kim, Alexis, Martha, James, and Chet exuded the true meaning of "ALOHA" and made us feel at home!!

This review is way overdue but as a frequent traveler who constantly relies on reviews to book my hotels, I'm compelled to write this review. I moved to Oahu last Fall and stayed at Luana Waikiki over 2 months before I moved to my new house. I had plenty of hotel options in Waikiki and around the island but Luana won me. It is conveniently located in Waikiki and close to the beach, Ala Moana, and lots of restaurants. And most importantly the rates were reasonable and affordable. The rooms are individually owned but they do a great job maintaining them. There's Hook Cafe that offers some quality food...if you go there you must try the egg shooter..so yummy! The front desk staff was friendly and always willing to help. Martha at the reception always had a smile while greeting guests, and made you feel welcomed and acknowledged. If I had a hospitality or customer service business, I'd want people like Martha to be the face of my business. Very professional, gives one full attention, and always took the time to make sure my questions were answered. The hotel does a wine Wednesday where hotel guests get to drink wine and socialize. They have bbq grills and they offer fresh lime/cucumber water every morning. Overall I enjoyed my stay here and I've already recommended a few people to the hotel. I'd stay here again.

We spent 4 nights at the Luana at Christmas and could not have been more impressed. The location is perfect, about a five minute walk to Waikiki Beach but without the crushing prices of staying on the beach. The room was quiet and beautiful. We will definitely stay here in the future.

Decent location... Ten minute walk to the beach also the shopping district in Waikiki. Very friendly staff. Responded right away to room issues. Small pool but very nice. The units are actually individually owned condos. Stayed in two different rooms, one nice and one that smelled old and moldy. Overall it was ok. I probably would look elsewhere next time in Waikiki but would stay here again if convenient.

Hotel had a good reception area. No problems checking in. The room was clean and had a kitchenette so we were able to make a meal in the room. This saves a little on cost. The concierge was amazing and so helpful. We were able to get to a few tourist attractions. Only problem was that we didn't realize it was a no smoking building. But they had a designated area outside. The pool was small and not a lot of chairs available.

Great experience here! Extremely clean spacious rooms, friendly staff and possible upgrades! A walk to the beach and Luana supplies the beach towels! Very convenient for shuttles right outside the hotel. A walk to shops too....already booked again for next year!

I strongly recommend the Luana Waikiki hotel. The hotel has been there a while and is very comfortable. The room I had included a kitchenette which was great to have. It is next to Fort Derussy Park which is a large green space in Waikiki.This is a good option for people who don't mind not being right on the beach and would like to stay in a bit of a calmer option.

Located right at one end of the "strip", so much less hectic, but still close enough to the activity. The hotel is clean, and comfortable; some renovations while we were there, but nothing bothersome (seems the hotel made sure of this). The staff is very helpful, very friendly and knowledgeable. Housekeeping was good. Rooms have been renovated, but a microwave in each room would be a definite plus. Pool is great and clean. BBQ area is clean and functional. There is a "meet and greet" three nights a week (wine, beer, cheese and crackers & entertainment) what a nice touch. Vouchers for the restaurant attached to the hotel is a great perk. Beach is a less than 10 minute walk. Stayed there for 9 nights, would certainly do it again.

The Staff treated me Like Family Or A like a Good Neighbor, It was easy to talk with them every day while my stay which was for more than 45 Days...They offer Free bike and Dvd movie use..Weight room and pool...etc. Gas station and stores Next door and the Beach and Shopping Only I Mean ONLY a Few blocks a way Like 5min In a Car!!!You can See the Ocean From my balcony....I would like to Thank All of the STAFF Here I MEAN ALL and these are some // Martha,KIM,James.W,Jessica,Joan,BETH,JACE,REbecca,TONY,JESSE,JOHN,AL JOHN,ALEXIS..etc Whole staff Made Me Welcome and Safe and I look forward planning my next time Here..WKMoody Rm 1014 oct 8 - nov 22 2019

First time in Hawaii but we really enjoyed our stay at Luana. It was far enough away to be quite but close enough to go out and about. We had 2 kids 4 & 7 and they found the walk fine and very safe. We walked back late most nights and always felt safe and we didn’t see any homeless around the motel.The park is lovely and green and great to wake up to every morning. The walk to duke statue was a bit long if that’s where you wanted to swim but to go straight through the park wasn’t long to the beach. Plenty of shops to look at while walking to your destination and there is plenty of walking to be done if not in central Waikiki. Also being positioned where it is was great for the Waikiki Trolley. And it was also easy to walk down around Discovery bay which is a bit slower than The main area of Waikiki. I took a bike one morning which was great to get out and see the town a different way. Staff were all nice when we were coming and going. They have chairs and umbrellas which is part of the ammenities fee. The room was nice. It was very clean and comfortable, loved the bed. We had a 1 bedroom and we had 3 adults and 2 children and found it to have plenty of room. Asked for a few things during the stay and they were brought up really fast. Remember most of Hawaii keeps the traditional feel so things seem old but they aren’t and if they are old they are well looked after.We would stay here again for the price as it was cheaper than central Waikiki places but it definitely lived up to our high expectations.

The Luana Waikiki Hotel worked out great for our family of 4. I have older girls, so the couch was not the greatest, but the VIEW we had was worth it!! This hotel was our 2nd choice, but I am glad we ended up here! We did opt for the full kitchen suite. If we go again, I would say a kitchenette would suffice, as we only cooked breakfast one time. We were out exploring the island most of the days we were there. Even though we had to valet park each time, the valet attendants were all nice and helpful, shout out to Mr. James & Jesse! My daughter wanted me to mention alll of the employees and staff were very courteous, saying hello to us, asking if we needed anything on our way out. The Fish Hook Cafe was okay for grabbing quick pastries or lunch, but pricey. The food we did order all was tasty! The credit vouchers we received from the resort fee along with the promo we had received during booking allotted us enough credit for the cafe to grab a few meals/snacks for our days out on the island. Biggest downside to the Cafe was the limited hours, only open from 7a-2pm.Amenities: their pool area is a little small, but we never used it since the beach was only a 10 minute walk through the park. They did have a nice gym, but again, our exercise was out on the island lol. We did take advantage of the beach chairs, beach towels, and umbrella use for one of our excursions which is included in their resort fee. Traffic in this area was heavy for the most, but we were in a great spot.

It’s an old hotel but the suite we booked and was upgraded to was spacious for the party of 5. Huge kitchen, 2 bedrooms and a washer and dryer were so convenient. We booked an ocean view room and was upgraded to a bigger 2 bedrooms instead of 1 but t no ocean view. The only person who was complaining about it was my mom. She wanted an ocean view room. She also always prefers newer hotels so she wouldn’t stop complaining about how old it was. I mean old windows, old AC, old washer and dryer . Z everything was old. But again spacious. We had maintenance workers come in few times while we were in the room to gain an access to our lanai where there was a hanging gondola thing was at - we didn’t mind it but it would definitely be a disturbance to some people... and it might concern some parents because it’s just hanging right above your head in the lanai. I didn’t let my toddler go to lanai.Tiny pool but our toddler loved it.It’s about 15 min walk to pretty much every popular spots like shopping centers and beaches. We were with seniors and a toddler so we Ubered a lot. The best thing about this hotel is that Fish Hook cafe downstairs. We got four vouchers for $40 off to use at the restaurant and their food was a bomb. I repeat - for the space and price we paid I think it was good but definitely an old hotel that needs serious upgrade. One of the hair dryers made a really loud sound I hesitated using it at night. You can’t tell the temperature on the old display panel. One window didn’t shut all the way.

I am thoroughly happy and enjoyed my stay at Luana! The staff was amazing and was very helpful in getting us whatever we needed! Although the room was a little antiquated, the beds were very comfortable and the rooms was spacious and the restaurant below the hotel was very affordable! We were given a $10 voucher for each day we stayed! The towel service in addition to a free DVD rental was another perk! I highly recommend this location for its excellent price, location, and service from the staff at Luana!

I stayed for a week and appreciated the location, close to the beach and shopping. The room itself was average, the tile floors didn’t appear to get cleaned each day so were gritty underfoot, the shower was big but the shower hose was positioned so water went all over the floor and there wasn’t anywhere to put your products except balanced on the rails and no where for bar of soap.

We stayed 4 days at the Luana. Was going to give this hotel a solid 3 stars out of 5 but while waiting to be picked up by our transfer shuttle I decided I better use the restroom before getting on the shuttle. I was told that I must have a room key to use the restroom......this was 10 minutes after handing mine in. Due to poor customer service I can only give 2 stars. The pool closes at sunset!!! What hotel has these rules?? Had we known about this prior to booking we would have definitely passed. They also advertise that there is a bar, we never seen it open and the restaurant is only open for minimal hours in the morning. Very outdated. Not sure how they can charge a “Resort Fee”.....

I had a great stay at the luana hotel. I had an issue with the first room I was in and Kim and Jessica at the front desk worked hard to solve my problem with an upgrade to allow me to cook during my long stay there. Besides that, all of the staff was amazing, from the valet to the housekeepers to the pool staff. The hotel is always clean, the pool area was great, and the location is perfect. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

The hotel was in a convenient location. It is just a short walk to the beach and local shops. The staff was also very friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and had the usual amenities. My only complaint is the bed and bedding. The bed was not very comfortable and the bedding was something you would expect from a one star motel. It was cheap and there was only a single sheet on the bottom that did not stay tucked in and made for a very restless night.

A real feeling of belonging here. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, the real Aloha spirit! The room was a suite with small kitchen, 2 burners for cooking, and all of the utensils needed. We cooked daily, which saved our budget for special eating out occasions. I enjoyed their Fish Hook restaurant for breakfast. The cooks and servers made us feel so at home. Very good bacon! Generous portions.The hotel is kept so clean, and smells so good when you enter. Peaceful Hawaiian music is piped into the lobby and open Mezzanine levels, as well as the workout room. Complimentary pool towels and beach towels, as well as beach equipment, at no cost. Swimming pool is small but nice. Barbecue grills available for cooking out by the pool. Gardens to explore on both sides of the hotel with mant exotic plants and birds. Walking distance to many stores and restaurants. Valet parking for everyone. Balcony with great view.We just loved our time here.

Had a stay with the family (including 2 kids) and had a positive experience. Positive aspects about our stay:--The room came with a kitchenette, which came quite in handy. It included a fridge that was larger than most hotel room mini-fridges I am used to seeing in high-end hotel rooms. It also came with cupboards stocked with some kitchen supplies, such as coffee cups, mugs, and some other dishes, and a sink. Note, the fridge had an upper shelf that seemed to be meant to function as a freezer, but it didn't really succeed at getting anything to frozen state. Also, we didn't find any silverware. --The room came with a safe, which worked as it should. It was somewhat hard to use at times, though. An error message would come up when it's supposed to open, occasionally. We found that it opens ok when we press hard on the door. Not really an issue.--There's one outdoor swimming pool area for the hotel. Clean, nice, with deck lounge chairs and a couple of covered areas. Not huge or fancy like the kind one might find at an all-inclusive resort, but good enough for a regular hotel. My youngest child insists that every lodging have a pool and will not be satisfied with any vacation that does not include enjoyment of the pool at some point. Fortunately, we managed to fit in a quick stop at the pool for her on the last day before checkout.--This hotel offers loaner beach chairs and beach umbrellas, available from the bell desk, free of charge. This came in handy. Love this feature! --Beach towels are available from front desk. There's no check-in/sign-in book, but instead you need to leave your beach towel card, which is provided upon check-in with the room key card, as collateral.--Valet parking, for a fee per day. This is pretty much par for the course to lodge in Waikiki or any large, dense city where public parking is a challenge. With In-and-out privileges, this arrangement is preferable to choosing alternate parking, at some commercial lot without in-out privileges, for example. Note, street parking is extremely difficult in Waikiki and probably not the way to go. It was nice to have parking available here. However, each time we needed to stop by the hotel for just a few minutes to grab something from the room, valet required us to leave the car key with him. This is not always the requirement at every hotel, in my experience, but I understand that not every hotel in every city has a valet receiving area of such a tight outdoor area that is situated close to the sidewalk of a well-traveled avenue. --within walking distance to the beach and quite a few shops and restaurants. 7 to 9 minute walk to Kahanamoku Beach at Hilton Village. About 15 - 20 mins walk to Waikiki (Royal Moana) Beach. About 5 mins to an ABC store. The main drag, at which this hotel is situated, has a lot of brand-name stores heading downtown. Quite a few shopping centers / malls in that direction as well. There a lot of Uber cars around.--The front desk, bell hop, house keeping, and valet personnel were all very nice. --After we checked out, we asked to leave our luggage with bell desk because we weren't ready to go to the airport yet and had more to do in Waikiki, for a few more hours or so. They were very accommodating about it and the gentleman on bell duty was pleasant and charming. (Not every hotel / lodging at comparable price point accommodates this). --During the day, there are dispensers of ice water in the lobby, one with lemon slices and one with orange slices. There is also a dispenser of ice water with orange slices near the First Floor elevator, at the pool towel cubby area before the swimming pool deck. Some other observations:--The layout of the hotel building was somewhat confusing. It took a while to figure out how the stairs worked. There's no direct staircase from the "first" floor, which is where we had our room, to the lobby floor. One has to take a flight of stairs to the mezzanine, and then go across the mezzanine to another staircase that is not clearly visible from the mezzanine elevator or the lobby because it's tucked around a bend (at left front corner when facing the street). I think the only other stairway leading from first floor to lobby level leads outdoors to the side of the building, but I didn't check. --There was a minor snafu about bathroom towels/supplies replenishment. They only left enough for three guests, somehow forgetting we had a fourth in our room. --We grudgingly called front desk to request one bath towel that was missing, as mentioned above. When a staff member came to drop it off, I thanked him with a smile and handed him a tip, and he thanked me before leaving. Before the door closed all the way, however, I caught a glimpse of some kind of expression on his face, from the side as he was walking away. I don't think he meant for me to see it, and it was probably not standard protocol for hotel staff. It gave me a strange feeling that I'm not accustomed to having during a hotel stay, even at a lower price point. It wasn't a big deal enough to complain to management or anything like that.Overall, but for a few minor hiccups, our stay went smoothly and comfortably. I would be open to coming back upon another visit to Waikiki.

Suite with small kitchenette . Clean. Location is good , beside a car rental. Staff extremely nice. Small resto open for breakfast and lunch, had a surprisingly good salmon .Melissa was at the desk when we checked in.....could not find Expedia reservation. No drama....find us a great room...great service

Melissa at the Front Desk was awesome! She is so pleasant and helped us when we checked in and answered all our questions. We wanted to switch to a bigger room with a full kitchen and she helped us with the room change. She told us the options and difference in rates which made our decision stressful. I have stayed at the Luana Waikiki a few times before and Melissa has never let us down - we love how she greets all the guests with her beautiful smile! Very professional and she exhibits true Aloha Spirit!

I have been traveling for work to Honolulu every month since October '18 and have stayed exclusively at the Luana Waikiki due to Melissa and crew having treated me like family! From the management to the valet and bell servers, these folks are the best! Great rates, beautiful views and some fantastic dining, I highly recommend the Luana to anybody traveling to Honolulu.

Why? Because Melissa who works at the front desk was so helpful, extremely friendly, willing to answer any and every question I threw at her, and had an unmatched sense of humor. Also, her face looks good. Melissa made me and my friend feel comfortable and at home. She treated us like we were elite members and we felt that our business with the Luana Waikiki was valued.If I could tell Melissa one thing, it would be THANK YOU for making our stay and experience with you folks a positive one.

Stayed here for a quick romantic retreat before island hopping. Ms. Martha always had our questions answered about beach towels and places to walk near the hotel for food and fun. Always smiling and happy to help. The rooms were clean and tidy. The bell staff Mr Jase never kept us waiting. Thank you for the aloha service. The only downside that became a nuisance was the lack of privacy & 2nd hand smoke from the divider on the balconies (new but poorly designed). Huge see through holes make it impossible to have private conversations and moments. Romantic buzz kill for sure. Hope the whole hotel won’t install these dividers on every balcony. We could literally see netflix movies on the next balcony’s smartphones. See photo. Aloha everyone!

Good location. Short walk to the beach. ABC store across the hotel. Free beach towels just use your towel card. Free cold water at the lobby. Plus is the fish hook cafe which is located right down at the hotel.Booked thru costco travels. Got $100 dining credit plus $10 each person credit from Luana which totalled $150 which we used for Fish Hook Cafe.Stayed in a studio with kitchenette. Basic things needed are there. You may cook simple foods if you want to. Features are old though, faucet in the kitchen is leaking, bathroom handle wobbly, but otherwise everything else worked good. We had one bed and one pull out bed. Would have been better if we had 2 double beds but they said they only have pull out beds. Room was cleaned daily which is really great, new towels everyday, clean room everyday. Kudos to the housekeeping staff who work hard everyday. There is a shuttle going to Ala Moana mall fr the hotel too.Walking distance to the beach, international market, marukame udon, abc stores. We had the street view but still a good view bec we were at the 10th floor.They said you can see the Hilton fireworks fr the pool area but do not watch fr there bec you will only see half of the fireworks, not a good place to see the fireworks if you want to enjoy it. Go somewhere else.Lobby people are friendly.This place is recommended as a good place to be while in Waikiki.

Check in was quick and easy. Love coming back to my room clean and spotless from an exhausted day at work. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful especially Martha at the front desk, James the bell and valet Jesse, Chet and Jawaiian. They have that Aloha spirit you hear before coming to the islands. My days are coming to an end and I’m glad I chose to stay at the Luana.

If you want to be in Waikiki, but away from the central hustle & bustle, this is the hotel for you. The lobby and mezzanine have been recently renovated and they are starting on the floors with guest rooms now. There is a lovely wine and cheese reception on the mazzanine floor on certain evenings, free yoga classes, and free beach towels/chairs/boogie boards. The hotel is close to bus stops, is a short to moderate walk to shopping, restaurants and my favorite...the beach. They even have pet Betta fish that you can adopt for the day! The hotel gives you $10 vouchers to use at the Fish Hook Cafe on the 1st floor of the hotel, fantastic! There are comfortable cushioned rocking chairs and benches curbside for you to wait for your excursion shuttle pickup. All the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. My only 2 complaints are 1) I was in a non-smoking room but the person in the room next door was smoking on their patio. This smoke was being drawn in through our room air conditioner at 2:30 a.m. I complained later that morning and was told that management would place a letter under the smoker's door. I don't know if they ever received it, because the next morning the guest was smoking in the patio again. When I mentioned this to the front desk, I was given an e-mail to correspond to. I submitted an e-mail including photos of the offending cigarette packs. Nobody ever responded to my e-mail or offered to move us to a different room. 2) Although we had a room refrigerator and coffee maker, it would have been nice to have a small, simple microwave.

I booked a studio with kitchenette for a multiple-month business trip. Easy reservation and check in process. The staff here makes it one of the better experiences I've had in an extended-stay situation. I had a rental car shared between my coworkers, and they never gave us a hard time for leaving a key at the front desk in case one of us wasn't in the hotel and needed the car for later. We used the valet for the first two days and then switched to the Hale Koa parking for the long term rates. The workers at the front desk even recommended it, which shows that they care more about folks having a great experience than charging for their valet. They're never too busy to listen to concerns or make recommendations. Most of my interactions have been with the afternoon staff. Martha and Alexis have been particularly excited to hear about what adventures I have planned for the few days off I get. When my trip got extended, the thought of going to a condo crossed my mind, but this workforce has been so great and accomodating, it wasn't worth the risk to have more space, but less service. They really have made this hotel feel like a home away from home.The studio kitchenette had an ocean view facing Diamond Head. You can also see the main road the hotel is on. On the weekends you can get a great view of all the catamarans. It doesn't have a direct view of Friday night fireworks, but I could see them from the stairs on the ocean side of the hotel just fine. July 4th was great! Didn't have to leave the hotel and fight the tourists. I had a two-stove burger and a mini-fridge that made it easy to store leftovers and small frozen desserts (think pint-sized ice cream carton). I asked for a queen sized bed and sofa pull-out. The mattress is definitely on the firmer side of a box spring, but I'm usually exhausted by the end of the day. Some of my coworkers have found them uncomfortable . I remedied any discomfort by bringing my own body pillow and standard pillow. I don't expect everyone to want to do this on their vacation, but since I was staying long-term, it was the easiest for me to just drive to walmart and spend a few dollars. Never had a problem with housekeeping. Even if I didn't want my room cleaned, I could always count on my Auntie to ask if I'd like fresh towels, coffee or tea when she'd spot me in the hallway, even at the end of her shift. Any cleaniless issues were solved within 12 hours.I chose a hotel rate without amenities, but can comment on what my coworkers who were paying for amenities had too. Without amenities, you're still able to get free beach towels that you can return when you're done at the front desk. There's also dvd rental and a PS3 in the room (I didn't use these as I brought my own gaming system with streaming services). Ice machine was on the first floor. The laundry room is on the first floor (coin-operated, but I think it has a drop-off service that I haven't used), along with a gym and pool. As most of the shorter-staying folks are also roomed on that floor, it can get a little crowded, so it's best to try and do laundry when most families are out of the hotel. With the amenities fee, my coworkers received a $10/day coupon for the Fish Hook Cafe, with I opted not to. The hours are from 7a-2p, but I could really only go on Sundays due to my schedule. The hotel also has a shuttle that goes to the other hotels in Aqua Aston chain and to the mall, which is great for those trying to grab food or shop without a vehicle.As mentioned before, if you're bringing a car, the Hale Koa parking garage is the closest public parking to the hotel. You get a better rate if you're a government / DOD employee. Access to the beach is great and walkable in about five minutes or less. The lagoon behind the Hilton and the part of Waikiki Beach are very tourist-friendly. If you're into military history, there's a lot of statues at Fort DeRussey park and also an Army Museum nearby. Since I've been here, the hotel has been promoting that our room key can be used for free admission to the Bishop Museum and discounts at other local attractions. There's also an Expedia agent on site for those who don't want to hassle with the vendors on the street selling excursions. I booked round trip transportation with my one-day adventure tour at Kualoa, and the pickup point was within a 10-minute walk from this hotel. The Waikiki Trolley, The Bus, Biki bikes, and Hui car shares are close by. Uber and UberEats have been great transportation and food delivery options. The Ala Moana mall is about a 20-30 minute walk depending on your pace. The area is very pedestrian friendly. The greatest hazard are tourists with biki bikes riding on the sidewalks and trying to weave in and out of walkers.

What a great trip. We had a kitchenette in our hotel room. We had the choice to make a meal or eat out. Waikiki is a gorgeous place to visit. Beautiful an extremely clean. Nice restaurants. Beaches we clean and well maintained. I give this a 5 stars.

The hotel is nicely located. Not on the beach but walkable to beach, evening walks, etc. the staff is really nice and helpful. We left our jackets and they shipped it back to us! Thank you to the staff and to Melanie. We did not use the pool and fitness room but it’s nice and saw other using it. I have the last circle to make it 5 star based on the staff.
user_name:
djpmdp219
New York City, New York

review_body: I spent two weeks here. I stay at this hotel every year. I can not think of other hotels. Because very nice Jessica is at the front desk. She is very kind. She always welcomes us with a smile.We also like the facilities in Luana.The water in the pool is so warm ,my daughter swims with pleasure. I stayed at partial ocean view room that the view is very nice. I can see many green trees and the beautiful sea in front of my eyes. Luana's kitchen is very clean and easy to cook. We will stay at this hotel again in next year!

Service was outstanding in particular Alexis at the front desk was awesome in getting us a room that fit our family. All facets of the hotel staff were ready to accommodate our every need. Rooms were very clean with comfortable beds and small kitchenette. Sitting on the edge of Fort Derussey it is a short walk to the beach.

My work sent me to Hawaii short notice. Luana came highly recommended. We stayed 10 days and even though I had to work the last 5 we had an excellent family vacation. Rooms are clean, Staff is family friendly and professional. I would definitely stay here again if my job is mean enough to send me to work in Hawaii again (humor for you). What a beautiful place.

We spent a week here. Loved the room, great ocean view, easy walk to the beach and Hale Koa beach bar. Easy walk to down town Waikiki and 5 mins on the trolley to Ala Moana shopping. Guest laundry facilities were very handy. Happy hour free drinks and nibbles Mon, Wed and Fri for guests to mingle. If I was to add a negative it would be the pool closes at sundown, far to early. For the price, you can’t go past the Luana hotel and suites.

We love this place! The location is great, you can walk to all the shops and restaurants with ease. The hotel is super clean and the staff is friendly and very helpful. The Luana is our go to spot when staying in Waikiki, Martha at the front desk always remembers us and greets us like old friends.

This was always my mums favourite place to stay before she passed away this time last year, she would come every year without fail! It has great views, the perfect location, fabulous amenities and the staff are super nice - especially Jessica who went above and beyond for us... she was a total legend!

Luana Waikiki staff members made my 1st visit to Hawaii an very memorable experience, from the 1st day to the last the staffs made me feel welcome and taken care of. I wanted to personally thank a few of them in particular that made my stay here so wonderful.Alexis was so friendly and patient, since I never been to Oahu before i had a lot of questions and she gave me lots of recommendations around town and really took her time to answer all my questions without making me feel rushed. the hotel is very centered around Waikiki and walking distant to the beach and with lots of great restaurants.Melissa and Martha was quick to check me in and made sure I was enjoying my stay every day, if i had any issues with my room they were quick to solve them as well. These ladies really made my vacation so much more enjoyable and smooth.On the 2nd to last day of my vacation I sprained my ankle while hiking and when I was limping my way up the stairs Robert (always had a smile on his face) who was working as the valet that day was so kind to run up to get me a bag of ice for my ankle! That to me is going above and beyond and an exceptional way of looking out for their guests. Also wanted to extend my thanks to housekeeping for that always had a clean room and made bed when i came back from a long day of exploring the island. The hotel was also kept very clean and neat, my room was clean and had a nice balcony with view of the ocean, they even offer free wine and cheese on certain days with live music. Absolutely the best experience and for the price it's a great value, i would 100% recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.Thanks again for a great stay.

The most welcoming crew I have ever met on the island. Their smiles are definitely the brightest part of our stay. Alexis, Melissa and Martha are attentive and a great source for information on where to go. They have a map available to ensure that you have options that are walking distance from the hotel.

The Luana Waikiki is an average mid-range hotel in Waikiki (aging building, lots of wear, but clean and functional). Service, however, is terrible-- they are renovating the floor above my room, with loud drilling and hammering all day long. No notice at check-in, no signs up anywhere on the property, you just come back to your room mid-day with obnoxiously loud noise pounding through the walls. I asked to use another room one day for my three-year-old to finish his nap in (he'd fallen asleep while we were out), and the manager flat out refused unless I wanted to pack up all of our stuff. (With a sleeping three year old, what?) My son woke up frightened by the banging noises (and the rest of the afternoon was fantastic with a sleep-deprived toddler). I wouldn't stay at another Aston property again.

This small property has the potential of delivering a five start service. It can do that by creating a culture where everyone in the staff believes in that mission. Three people I encountered made me question wether or not I mattered as a guest—that’s not a good experience. Getting out of a taxi on a rainy day, I was carrying a sleeping 18 month old, umbrella, bag and stroller. A young man sweeping was near and I asked him to please get the porter so they could send my bag and stroller to my room. He said go to the front desk and he kept sweeping. Then I got locked out of my room and with all 3 kids I approached  asked the house keeping lady for help, she said go to the front desk. And at the front desk, going to pick up the adopted beta fish, a young lady seemed to ignore me standing there in the small and quiet lobby for an awkward moment until I asked her if she was open. Finally, the young man taking out the garbage in my suite, sent me to ask the front desk because he didn’t know, when I asked if the Royal Hawaiian was on this same street. A simple smile, a simple may I help you, are inexpensive and 100% about corporate culture. I truly believe you can do better with your people—this is the easy part for most properties. And other small properties succeed in giving a 5 star quality service. The good stuff is the breakfast credit is good, the towel card is overkill for your tiny pool, the permanent puddle in front of your property is a plumbing issue -fix it. The TV in my suite was tiny in an old cabinet -fix it. The A/C needs some attention—clean the filter. My toilet had to be serviced twice because of a loud whistling noise (to your point each time we called maintenance was there in under 5 minutes). We reserved a double queen, you failed and gave me a cot. Get AC in hallway...it’s hot and humid—fix it. The bathroom needs an extractor—the bathroom odors lingering —fix it! And make sure the mattress fits the bed—very easy fix. Jessica, Tyler and James and (the other porter with ponytail) were helpful. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay but would not reconsider unless you made these changes!

We had the best time with the best view! Hotel is close to the military hotel in the beginning of Waikiki. The girl at the counter, Jessica was A++++! The valet boys were also exceptional Thank you folks for a wonderful experience, especially you, Jessica.

Bring lots of money! Hawaii is outrageously expensive. Whether you have a short or long stay, the rooms are very nice and have a fridge. Here is the good stuff:  fridge in room - rooms are spacious and clean,- pool is well kept they have laundry machines.The service was good and friendly. Valet parking a reasonable price and there is a resort fee ( there is no escape) The fee includes food voucher of 10 for ea day Stay here! It is good value

Hello I want to commend a couple of Customer Service Representatives at this Hotel for their excellent service. Alexis and Martha have both conveyed an outstanding, friendly, helpful and professional attitude each and every time I have asked for assistance. These young ladies should be recognized for their outstanding performance. Best Regards,Joe Gonzales 7608460991

Great boutique hotel with very friendly staff and very clean rooms. Beautiful walk through the park to the beach and close to all amenities in Waikiki. Complimentary yoga classes and wine and cheese most nights.

Been staying here for 6 months for work and no matter what Martha will always take care of us. Always helpful on where to go all over the island of Oahu for anything you want to do like surfing, snorkeling, scuba diving etc. Ask her for any advice if you stay here!

Alexis was very welcoming and a great help with checking in and giving local listings for amazing eats around the area, she is very knowledgable and made my stay here a more pleasant one, the room and amenities are great, as they give coupon vouchers for food every day you visit which you can use at breakfast or the restaurant attached to the front entrance of the hotel, and the gym is also nice which islocated by the pool with a great view of the city of Honolulu. I will definitely come back again.

Everyone was great during my month’s stay. Martha was kind and always helpful and smiling. The valets were outstanding. I appreciated their willingness to change my room due to the length of my stay! We will be back.

We just returned from a 3 week stay at the Luana Waikiki. This was our fifth time staying at this hotel and we are looking forward to the next trip. This was our second time having a one bedroom suite with full kitchen, and this is definitely the way to go. We were fortunate to be on the 16th floor, with a spectacular view of Fort DeRussy Park, Diamond Head and the ocean, it truly is paradise! The hotel provides everything we need to have a wonderful stay. We love the BBQ area, you meet so many interesting people down there. We enjoy the managers receptions; they are a great time to meet other guests and make new friends. The staff are superb, they are helpful and polite and cannot do enough to help with any request. They are an outstanding example of excellent customer service. And everyone always has a smile on their face!We find the location of the Luana Waikiki to be perfect. It is much quieter at that end of Kalakaua while being close enough to everything in Waikiki. It is so peaceful being surrounded by Fort DeRussy Park, truly the perfect place to stay.We highly recommend staying here!

Some coworkers and I are currently staying here. Martha and Melissa at the front desk are very friendly and we’re extremely helpful in making some changes I needed. I’d definitely recommend this place and will stay here next time.

We booked this hotel for our short layover on Oahu after reading great reviews. When checking in Chastity assisted us. She was quick and efficient. We arrived a little earlier than our check in time and were surprised that our room was ready. Chastity also stated that we were upgraded to a One Bedroom suite due over sale in the category that we booked. We thanked her and said it was an awesome surprise as it was our honeymoon. After checking in we headed up to the room and went to explore. The hotel is located in a great location in Waikiki, very close to shops and nightlife. When we got back to our room we were surprised yet again with a bottle of wine and a small box of chocolates with a personalized note from chastity wishing us a great stay. Thank you to chastity for making our stay so enjoyable!!

Secret gem in Waikiki. Not your typical high end resort but more of a home away from home. Enjoyed my stay at the Luana! Many thanks to FD agent, Chastity, who was very accommodating with our early arrival and helped to find us a room for early check in! She saw that we have been traveling all day and all we wanted to do was get some shut eye. Kudos to Luana for great staff like her!

Clean, lovely accommodating staff, drinks and cheeses night with Hawaiian music and dance - beautiful... Location very close to everything. Highly recommend and will stay here again. Shuttle bus available to affiliating hotels and Alomoana mall, driver extremely informative regarding what to see and best way to get there.

With wine nights every other night and yoga in the morning, I had an amazing time at the Luana Hotel. We wanted to be on the strip, but didn't want to pay the price for a beachfront property, so Luana was a great compromise because it's located at the end of the strip, but just a short walk to restaurants and the beach. You should be getting your steps in right? Chastity and the staff were also great to work with. Fish Hooks is a cafe at the hotel with the best poke!

ALOHA LUANAAs you walk into the hotel you are greeted with genuine smiles and welcome fragance of Hawaii, which lifts up your mood after been on a long flight, and James the concierge friendly welcome making me feel good been there.I also was welcomed by Chasity, front desk officer she was so friendly and informative and I did not know about all the extras that came with when staying at the Luana (meaning Happy) and that how you feel when you walk into Luana and you are greeted by Luana staff. Food vouchers, DVD hire vouchers, Beachtowel vouchers to hire, more than expected and very generous. The cafe staff were so friendly and took small time to have a chat with me and other customers which is great to see.The room was exactly as pictured in the bookings and very very clean, spacious with amenities and self-contained kitchen more than expected. I booked queen size but I think it was king size as it was massive. I cannot fault this place as I travel for a living, and have stayed in some not so good hotels but Luana is definitely the hotel that I would stay and recommend to all who is reading my review.Thank you so much Chasity for your excellent and friendly customer service, also to Mellissa for taking my calls and being so obliging.Thanks James (Kevin Hart lookalike) you have a great sense of humor and passion for great service.Luana Managers you have a great friendly team that I met and the fragrance is so welcoming when you walk into your hotelI cannot wait to come backMAHALO

We were greeted by friendly, obliging staff for our five-day stay in Waikeke. Special thanks to Chastity who made us feel very welcome and brought forward an early check-in room for us.Our room had that Hawaiian feel about it. Amenities in the room and on site (clean, efficient laundry) were very good. The room provided a cook-top, a microwave oven, a fridge, an ample supply of crockery and cutlery and coffee/ tea facilities.Housekeeping was efficient and the room was well maintained.We enjoyed the "Meet and Greet" afternoons (Mon, Wed and Fri) to chat with fellow visitors and appreciate the entertainment.The free bus shuttle was very convenient and nearby bus stops made the local bus service readily available.If we return to Waikeke for a holiday, we'd have no hesitation in staying at Luana Hotel.

Luana hotel is truly an excellent place to stay while in Hawaii. The staff and service they provide is a step above alot of other hotels that are available. Alexis and Martha were exceptionally helpful during our stay. They were extremely nice, professional, and helpful with the stay here. If you are looking for a great experience and a wonderful hotel to stay at Luana is the place for you.

First things first I have to say that this is a great location (right downtown in the Waikiki area walking distance from most things), spacious, clean and AWESOME customer service (shout out to Alexis and Martha). I’ll definitely come back.

This hotel offers great value for your money and its location is perfect. It is close enough to the beach while being just on the skirt of the very busy Waikiki Beach strip. While it was true that the rooms are somewhat dated, they were clean and comfortable. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We have taken many cruises and we found that the staff were as friendly as cruise ship staff. The cost of the buffet breakfast is a little steep but you can use the $10.00 per day credit and take out your breakfast. The croissants are very good! The dine-in meals prepared by the Chef at the Fish Hook are excellent. The staff at the Fish Hook are also very friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel.

I have stayed multiple times, and luckily ive been helped by the same girl mellissa, she is the best of the best, very professional and helpful. will be back for sure because of her help(she knows all the good places to go in Hawaii)

Great location and amenities! Martha was great and helped me patiently when I had lost my booking info and Alexis’ recommendation for breakfast was perfect! Overall great staff and facility lead to a great stay!

From the beginning, the Luana had great curbside appeal. The staff was warm, welcoming, and always greeted you with the amazing energy that the Hawaiian island is known for! The best part about our stay at the Luana was MARTHA at the front desk! Martha was amazing! Martha made the hotel experience so much more enjoyable and always welcomed us with a beautiful smile whenever we walked into the hotel! Martha was always so helpful and considerate, our stay was ridiculously pleasant! Our needs were always taken care of whenever we requested at anytime of the day! This hotel will forever be our “Hawaiian Home” away from home! Thank you Martha for being the best ambassador of Hawaii!

Great hotel compared to others in the area. The rooms were clean and well maintained. Beautiful rooftop pool. Martha at the front desk was exceptionally nice and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again.

me an my girlfriend booked a room through a 3rd party agency and we were promised a room with a view, upon arrival that wasn't the case but the 2 ladies at the counter (chastity & Melissa) were very nice an accommodating and ended up giving us a room with a much better view! Very pleased with the customer service here 10/10 would recommend staying

Luana was right where we needed it in the city and Martha at the front desk always takes care of our team like family. Rooms are great and spacious. The rest of the staff is great as well, fulfilling every request we have.

Martha at the front desk is an absolute gem. I have never felt more welcome in a hotel. She was very quick to make sure we were comfortable and had what we needed. I will absolutely be staying here again and recommending to everyone I know travelling to Waikiki.

We stayed in Luana 3rd wk of February. We were very happy we stayed there. Joan in the guest services was very helpful and provided all our needs. Also Roy from the bus shuttle honestly returned a cap of my husband when it got lost in the shuttle bus. Also from the valet parking people were so nice. Cons: we waited almost 1hr for shuttle, expensive valet parking. But we definitely going back to Luana Waikiki!

This is the second time we have stayed at Luana, and as happy with this time as the first.The staff are always very pleasant and professional. Melissa on the front counter is extremely good, very pleasant, and always very helpful.The facility is always excellent condition, very clean and kept that way. Good amenities and wonderful place to stay.Without a doubt, we will stay here again in the future.Far enough from downtown Waikiki that it’s not as loud, but still close enough to walk to.

It was such a great stay-cation. Martha the desk clerk was such a great help. Very knowledgeable and helpful and accommodating. Gonna stay here again soon. Great partial ocean Waikiki view. Ask for Martha and listen to the great advice for an enjoyable stay

We stayed at the Luana the second week in February and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet location and great value for their dollar. We were more than satisfied with our room which was a kitchenette. We had everything we needed for our stay. We were very pleased with the location which is beside a park so you don't have the feeling of being surrounded by highrise buildings - so nice and quiet there. It is a short walk to Waikiki Beach, the zoo, the aquarium and a multitude of shopping. There is a shuttle to the beach and the Ala Moana Mall as well which we used quite a bit because the weather was not very good that week.I had a trip and fall accident on the street right outside the hotel and I couldn't be more appreciative of the help I received from the valet and the front desk staff. They were very attentive and made sure I got to hospital to get stitches. Every time I went through the lobby the staff enquired about how I was feeling.Also a huge thank you to our maid, Eugenia - she did an excellent job of keeping our room clean everyday.The Fish Bowl Cafe offers some delicious choices for breakfast as well and several times I got sandwiches and some of their delicious cookies to take with us for the day.We didn't find the hotel dated as I've read in some reviews but perhaps our floor had already been renovated. We were very comfortable there and would highly recommend this hotel.

Staying at the Luana was the best decision ever. The rooms are spacious and very clean! The front desk always has employees ready to help, especially Alexis, if you ever need anything, she is always ready to help with the biggest smile! I am seriously considering extending my time here just because of all the hospitality that has come with my stay. I truly recommend the Luana!

If you like staying at hotels with an incredibly friendly and helpful staff, THIS is the place to be. Both Alexis and Martha are tons of fun and always say hello after a long days work. Clem, one of the managers, is from where I work from! Everything is within close walking distance. Highly HIGHLY recommend that you stay here while on island... you wont regret it!

Booked for one night for three family members. Got two queen beds which were comfortable. Unit had old stick-in-wall AC unit which didn't really work too well and was very noisy but it wasn't hot outside. Room was clean and had a kitchenette which we didn't use. Attend the wine and cheese event with ukelele and hula dancer which was entertaining. Hotel could use some updating everywhere but it was less expensive than the other Waikiki hotels and for one night, was fine.

We were in visiting our son that is serving in the military, Hale Koa was booked up, and we didn't want to spend a large amount on a room when we had no plans to be there during the day and no need for the pool and other amenities. Our son was staying with us and finding a room with two queen beds was nearly impossible and then I found this hotel. We were able to book the one bedroom suite with a kitchen and sofabed and got the military rate. The hotel is in a great location and in the evening we were able to walk to dinner. Valet was also easy! We had a nice stay and found the staff to be helpful and hospitable, I do recommend it.

We liked this location on the north end of Waikiki near Fort DeRussy. It's still close to the Waikiki attractions, but actually prefer DeRussy Beach as less crowded and even affording some decent snorkeling. The rooms are well-equipped, even offering a consistent pineapple décor from the furnishings to the plates. Rooms and property kept very clean. Free beach amenities and DVD rental are a plus. We found it to be a good value, especially the vouchers that can be used in the on-site café for breakfast or lunch (we thought lunch was a better value). Social receptions every other day were fun and accompanied by local music. Daily newspaper was also a nice plus.The responsive service was really a plus--we had a few minor issues with the room, and they were taken care of promptly and took steps to accommodate the inconvenience. Overall great value

I hate to write this review because it lets the best kept secret out but here we go...First of all LOCATION. The hotel sits near the corner of Kalakaua and Ala Moana. You have a delightful walk thru Ainahau Triangle/Ft DeRussey to get to world famous Waikiki Beach. The convention center is a short 7-10 minute walk along with world class shopping at Ala Moana. Be sure to say hi to my cousin who manages #Local Motion on the third floor. The hotel will give you beach towels, chairs and bikes to check out as part of your resort fee. The staff is super friendly and always ready to give you a tip for something to do or a great restaurant to try. The rooms are spacious, clean and best of all, they have two burners, a convection microwave and mini fridge and a garbage disposal in the sink. The balcony is great with two chairs and a table perfect to enjoy a glass of wine at the end of the day and look out at the ocean. I read a recent review that states that the "curtains didn't even cover the window". I'm not sure what happened in their room but the curtains are wonderful and black out the entire window. There is a sheer curtain if you want light and privacy and there is a black out curtain that completely blocks the light and there is a "fixed" half curtain for decoration only. This is our go to hotel when we visit Oahu. We feel it is great and budget friendly.

This was our second stay at this hotel. Upon check in there was a problem with our room size and bed configuration however that was quickly sorted out by Chastity at reception. Only issue was we could not have early check in and had to wait til 3pm to check in. Not a big deal considering we were upgraded to a room that comfortably suited 2 adults and 3 teenage children. Thank you for another wonderful stay.

The hotel is not bad because of the amenities. Beach towels, umbrellas, bikes, yoga, fitness center, dvd rental, and $10 food credit per day. I wish the fitness center closed later but that’s not a big deal. All the staff was really nice! It can get noisy at night if your room faces the streets! The hotel does not have earplugs. I booked and requested double beds but they weren’t available when I checked in. I asked the front desk immediately and they said none available but if I want to switch for the last night, I can check again. I stayed for three nights. There’s a sofa bed but it was VERY dusty inside so I didn’t use it, I just slept on the couch. The actual bed is old because it sinks in the middle. One gross situation was that a web of larvae or eggs of some big cake down from the ceiling light in the bathroom. It was the most disgusting thing because there were hundreds and tiny. They fell from ceiling into the sink and countertop and on me when I went inside so I called the front desk to clean it up. Someone came and had to clean it up several times because they were impossible. I took a video of the moving eggs. I just grabbed towel in the end to wipe up everything to make sure! Other than that... I did like the stay. It could be much better.

Pretty poor that you can’t guarantee a twin room... And to top it off we couldn’t even close our curtains to block out the light...Location was fine.Make sure you check you book a transfer as they never wrote ours down and we had to wait.

Hotels in the Honolulu area are exponentially expensive and sad to say many have not so flattering reviews. However, the Luana did a very nice job.Helps that we visited this location during off season. Prices were reasonable. The room is beautiful and very modern. Easy to tell this is probably a 1970's hotel but has recently been redone. Tile floors, flat screens, HUGE rooms. Nice pool.VERY nice staff. Always happy to help and be friendly.The hotel is NOT water front. But no fear. The beach is 2 blocks away.Breakfast is very limited for the $19 fee. Not worth it. A cost to watch for. Car parking. You have only one choice, valet. And this is $35 a night. Highly unreasonably expensive in my opinion. But this seems to be a trend in the area.Another cost, this seems to be a sort of tax. The Amenities Fee. It is $25 for this hotel. This covers the pool, towels, wifi, etc. For some reason it was waived during my stay.To conclude. Did I like my stay. Absolutely YES. Would I stay again at this hotel. Absolutely YES.

Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations!Booked (and found) this hotel through Costco. Stayed for 9 nights. Party of 4.Food: not much food options at this hotel. There is the morning Buffett (Fish Bowl) 7-11am and the Fish Hook Cafe 7am-2pm. Outside of these hours, you are on your own. The buffet food was average and got boring after 4-5 days. It was pretty much the same items everyday... selection of fruit, yogurt, cereals, granola, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fried rice, pastries and toast/bagels. Potatoes and pancakes rotated every 2nd day. Juice and coffee included. Coffee was good (a Kona blend). The price for Buffett was $18.95 adult and $12.95 for kids.Our Costco package includes a buffet for 2, certainly saved us money... we had a breakfast and coffee each morning and we often felt satisfied until early afternoon. So often we would have the Buffett, light lunch or snacks and then go to dinner (often a happy hour) in evening. So for breakfast (for 3) it cost us $3 plus a tip. We would use the $10 dining voucher/credit that is included in resort fee.One thing to know is the area for the Buffett is very small and can only accommodate 3 groups comfortably at a time. There are options to eat outside or bring the food to the Fishhook. Weboth... they will service you (for drinks, plates, etc) at all 3 locations. Service was great!Other than a sandwich we never really ate at the Fishhook, but the food looked good!You are close walking distance to cafes, ABC store and plenty of restaurants.Resort Fee: I think this is standard for hotels in the area and varies. It was not included in our package. With the $10 credit, it is like paying only $15 resort fee. We have stayed in 4 hotels in Oahu and this one actually provides a lot of things/services that you can actually use!We took advantage of using beach chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards when hitting the beach. We used their shuttle service to go to Ala Moana shopping mall. Rented a few movies and attended one of their managers receptions.Manager Reception: this free event is 5-6 on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. There’s live entertainment, wine, local craft beer and some cheeses, cracker, pretzels). We enjoyed the hour one evening had a couple drinks on our way out to dinner! Car Rental: we rented a car 4 times from the dollar location directly across the street. This was our third time to Waikiki, so we didn’t want a car the full time. In the past, we would rent for the full duration of trip and pay parking fees of $40/night. We saved quite a bit of money by pre booking the car from Dollar for individual days and returning by 8:00pm that evening. Gas station is adjacent to hotel too... so super easy!Location: you are a small 15min stroll to beach through a nice walking trail and park. You are pretty close to all the restaurants and happenings of Waikiki... just depends on where you are going. For example, in 15-20 minutes you can be at the Duke statue. We have stayed at Sheraton and Hilton Hawaiian Village so we were a little concerned about location off of beach... but it was fine as we knew it all in advance.Room: I’d get a high level room with a partial ocean view. Our room was average and had 2 queen beds and a nicer than expected view! Lots of cabinetry to store food and there is a kitchen sink and small fridge. We don’t cook much on vacations, so we picked this room instead of one with kitchen facility.Used the small gym a couple times, but not the pool. The pool and pool deck area are small and don’t get sun until later in afternoon.Plan on staying hear again!

Been here for couples days now and i must say i have found my go-to hotel. Check in went smooth and quick. But I do wanna give a shout out to Martha who is the hostest with the best customerservice she seems to have a great attitude and is aways very helpful thanks Martha for having such a great attitude and for being helpful everytime i needed help.sincerly Jason E, Thomasson

We absolutely loved our stay! The staff at this hotel were all excellent. I have to mention Martha, Malia, and James by name. They really took care of us. James knew that my father had physical limitations and actually chased us down with a taller beach chair so that he would have a more comfortable day at the beach. Malia always had great information for us on our day's adventures. We didn't do a lot of tours as we have a local friend who spent time with us, but she was always willing to make sure we knew exactly what to expect. Martha always greeted us with a smile and made sure that we were served quickly and efficiently every day. Thank you to everyone!

Seven of us stayed for a week over the Christmas holiday and we could not have asked for a more ideal location. The hotel is situation on the quieter end of Kalakaua Ave the main drag in Waikiki so it's slightly removed from the major hustle and bustle. We had a two room two bath suite with a huge lanai and washer/dryer on 7th floor. It was perfect for the 2 kids and allowed us to pack lighter. The lanai was so big that all seven of us ate pizza outside and enjoyed the Hawaiian breeze and view of stars. We also had a one bedroom one bath suite with and ocean view on the 9th floor over looking Kuroda Field. Both rooms were quiet with no noticeable street noise. What makes this an ideal location is that it borders Fort DeRussy so it's not surrounded by other large concrete high rises blocking out the view or the sun. The hotel provides free beach towels and beach chairs which we used almost everyday. We even rented a car and went to Bellows Beach on the windward side of the island and were able to take towels and chairs. Again the location is ideal and made for easy walking to every lunch and dinner meal and car rental office. Plus we walked to our outrigger ride and Fort DeRussy and Waikiki Beaches. Gas station next to hotel was our go to for a few things. Apples were available at the front desk each morning which made for a healthy snack for the kids. We have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki and this one was by far the most accommodating price, location and staff wise. We would rate it a 5 if the room furnishings were updated and the pool had more lounge chairs. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

We stayed for one night before leaving on a cruise. When we went to check in our reservation had been canceled by someone(not hotel) they were kind enough to help us get a similar suite to fit 5 and upgraded us to ocean view. This is a great location as it is near the beach and restaurants. As someone who likes to work out that would be my only real complaint as the fitness room needs some serious updating. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful from holding our luggage to calling us a mini van taxi cab to recommending restaurants. Would recommend as a no frills hotel but decent hotel to stay in.

Some friends and I stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 13 nights over Xmas. My room was 1104.The staff were fantastic, friendly and efficient. The location is great as you are not in the middle of the shopping precinct, but only 5 minutes walk away.On three nights, the Luana provided Drinks, Nibbllies and local Entertainment which is a great thing for Guests.The Rooms are reasonably spacious and very comfortable. The Bathroom has a large vanity for storage of all the necessary items. The only thing I found was the balcony door was very hard to open and close.Some very minor issues that i encountered and if fixed would make it a 5/5 Hotel were;The property was replacing the Room Doors and the electronic locking system so initially I could not gain access to the Pool, Gym and Mezzanine toilets. Reception provided an additional card for access which solved this problem.The Buffet Breakfast is not worth the US$19++. The vouchers provided are better used in the Fish Hook Cafe. Great food and service, however not many tables and on occasion had to wait.Housekeeping was a bit sloppy initially with no bath mat or tea towel provided.Staff use the guest lifts and not the Service lift which can be annoying at peak times.The lifts also do not park spread out when not in use. For instance all lifts can be on the top floor and you have to wait for one to get down which may also stop on the way down. For instance, in off-peak times the lifts should park say one at the Lobby, one on the top floor and the third in the middle. This would then reduce the wait time.The Lift annunciators on each level only sound and light up when the lift doors open. It would be good for this to occur a couple of seconds before the lift arrival, so when struggling with luggage you can be prepared to move towards the arriving lift.All in all this is a great Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

This is a very pleasant hotel, well placed for walking to restaurants and shopping. The staff were excellent and very easy to deal with. The room was clean and had all the facilities we required, including a fridge and microwave. We used the underground car park and it was completely hassle free.

Stayed one night here. It is close to shopping and beach. Room had nice view of city, small pool, extra $35 per night for parking. The bathroom sink had no counter space to put things on-it was just a sink and I didn’t see a blow dryer. There were a couple of fish bowls at the front desk that could be taken up to the room if you wanted to. Check in in hour easy no long lines. It is on a busy street but with the air conditioner on I didn’t notice the noise. Attractive open floor plan in lobby.

I love staying at the Luana Waikiki hotel... I have been visiting Hawaii for years, finally found my favorite hotel... Great Price, great location, clean, beautiful entrance with Hawaiian music playing, friendly and helpful staff.... I’ve stayed there 10 times and it’s about time I share the gem with others! You won’t be disappointed!

My mum and sister and I stayed in an apartment for 11 days at this hotel complexWe found it very central and a short walk to the great beach, and shops / restaurants / only a block to Hard Rock Cafe Our room had great views overlooking the park towards the ocean.Nice touch having managers happy hour each week with music, drinks and nibbles.ABC store handy as just over the road I would stay here again most definitely

Since the very first weekend me and my family "stay-cationed" here, its been nothing but amazing views and excellent staff, id like too thank Kim & Chastity for their Outstanding guest services. it feels like nothing but family and Aloha. Every time we walk through those doors my kids can't help but smile. Every friday that we checked in, we were pleasently greeted by the valet. The rooms are always clean & comfortable. They provide a wide range of New released movies that come in really handy when you want too kick back and enjoy some family time. During the day me and the kids go down too the first floor, my husband and I enjoy utilizing the fitness center with a great view of my kids swimming at the pool. we will definitely be back again!

You have an awesome staff! My son first trip to Hawaii. You made memorable! I want to especially thank Thomas, Melissa and Alexis for their great guest service. The room was perfect for us. We will definitely come back again.

This is a cute little boutique hotel which exceeded our expectations. Booked as a part of Costco package for 6 nights. Got a room in 14th floor with excellent city view. The hotel as such and room were very clean and comfortable. Very close to the beach and restaurants. We had free breakfast buffet as part of our package and the Fish hook cafe buffet was wholesome and top notch. We started our day with delicious desserts, fruits, eggs, bacon, potatoes, fried rice and much more. Overall, we loved our stay here. One star minus for expensive parking $35/day and the shower. Check out the public parking for $1/hour near Prince waikiki hotel. We saved a lot of bucks parking there every day evening and walking to the hotel along beautiful streets. Took an uber every morning to the parking spot to avoid walking in sun and saving time.

Okay so if you want the ideal location for beach access and downtown activities to down town this is your go to place. The price for the hotel is fair, and they are updating the rooms to a better standard. It's about a 5 minute walk to the beach and and 10 minute walk to most down town activities. A lot of the rooms have kitchens which can save on extra cost. Things to be prepared for is valet parking, which is an additional cost, but worth it. The breakfast is lacking because the room they have breakfast in seats 5 to 6 families and that is all, so most times we had did breakfast in our room or off sight. The only complaint is that the rooms are tile, and could use a good scrubbing while guest were present to help with sand control. Most times I only observed a swifter mop doing the job. But this is my only area that could use improvement. Overall we will always stay here in the future!

Very nice, attentive front desk staff! Some construction going on while we were there, but even the construction crew was courteous and attentive to our comfort. Smelled so nice in the lobby. Great amenities! Clean rooms. Melissa, Chastity, and Kim were the best! Thank you for making our one-night stay so memorable!!
とても良いホテルです！どこにいくにもアクセスが良いのに公園の前なので静かです。スタッフの皆さんも優しく、ヨガクラスやジムがあるのもありがたいです。次回もぜひこちらに泊まりたいと思います。Luanawaikiki is the vest hotel in Hawaii.Chastity&Kim are very kind for us!Thank you so much!(^o^)

Great location. Chose this hotel because it was near my niece’s apartment. Far and near enough (walking distance) from the crowded Waikiki downtown and beach areas. Hotel accommodations comfortable and clean. Great resort amenities. Delicious food at Fish and Hooks restaurant downstairs. Wonderful, friendly, kind, and helpful hotel and valet staff. Chas and Melissa were the checkout staff. Every staff I encountered were excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Over all the entire staff was excellent, very friendly as always. We had such an amazing experience here that we returned for 3 more weekends. A special thanks to the women at the front desk. Kim and Alexis because of your great service we will definitely be back soon.

Just back from five nites at the Luana Waikiki, our first time back to Hawaii in over 15 years.... delighted with the location away from the main hotel strip and the views over Fort DeRussy park. Atmosphere in the hotel was quiet( no large tour parties) and relaxed. We had use of the gym and pool each day, which are well maintained and not over crowded. Vouchers for the Fishhook Cafe are a great idea... their menu is very interesting and good value for breakfast and brunch.Rooms well serviced, towels changed each day, nice touch wth the orchids in the room. Concierge very helpful with booking taxis, shuttles.All in all a very enjoyable stay and we will certainly stay here again.. MAHALO !!

I must say the front desk staff by far surpassed my expectations. Knowledgeable and friendly. Thanks Martha and Alexis you guys rock!! I will be returning and recommending this hotel to all my friends!

My wife chose Luana because of the nice location. We loved the ocean view and clean facilities. Anything we needed, the front desk staff Ms Martha and Ms Alexis (ask for them and they will certainly take care of you) were always available to assist us with 5 star effort. Whether it was beach towels, dvd card, free apples or extra towels and help with directions and smooth check in and out. They made us feel so much aloha kindness.... thank you ladies!

We came out here with a group in February to play in a Pool Tournament and had a fantastic time! This hotel is a mile away from the center of town, it was a mile away from the Pool Hall we were playing at and was a short walk to the beach. We had rooms with kitchens which were great for breakfast. They had an area that you can use with BBQ's and tables so we went to the store, got steaks and potatoes and had a BBQ with our group one night. They had Happy Hour on Monday-Wednesday-Friday's with free wine and cheese and live entertainment. We met back at the mezzanine each day to catch up about our day and played cards together. The Restaurant was great for breakfast...Yummy waffles and everyone loved the Avocado Toast! The pool was refreshing and there was always cold water in the lobby so we filled up our cups each day on the way out. The beach was perfect and you could get chairs and floats from the hotel or for a small fee, they had comfy lounge chair/umbrella rentals at the beach. It was a short walk to a lot of restaurants or you could jump on the free shuttle (included with your stay) that stopped right in front of the hotel!
