Loved the liquor store/convenience store right across the street. No need to rent a car while you stay at this place! The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and comfortable.

I met some old friends for a high school reunion here in Hawaii and we could not have picked a better place to stay. First of all, the desk assistants Jessica and I believe Melissa were incredibly welcoming and helpful. Second of all, the location was great and the amenities were lovely. Thank you to everyone at Luana for making our reunion one to remember! I'll be back!

My girlfriend took me here as a surprise, one of the most incredible and fun experiences I have ever had. I LOVE HAWAII! The guest service at Luana was incredible and everyone was very compassionate and understanding of our needs. Jessica B helped us out at the front desk, she was very kind and professional. Location of the hotel is awesome, with a fantastic pool facility and service was never disappointing. Thank you to everyone here, we enjoyed ourselves to the fullest!

We have stayed many times at this Hotel. It continues to impress. The amazing staff with whom we interacted on our 17 day stay brought us great happiness. The front desk folks, Jessica, Melissa, Kim, Chastity, and Melanie were very kind and welcoming. The valet person Chet was especially cordial, and Jace and James were always efficient with getting our beach chairs and mats every day, and bikes when needed.Coming back to the hotel was like returning home to friends.The location of the hotel sets it aside from others in the area. Our partial ocean view room on the 16th. floor gave a sweeping view of the Waikiki area, some view of Diamond ahead, and much the Fort DeRussy Park and beach. The wine and cheese receptions on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at 5:00 p.m., were especially appreciated as they afforded us a wonderful opportunity to meet fellow guests as well as some of the people who own units in the hotel. These times were wonderfully enhanced by the entertainment in the Aloha fashion. Lovely dancing by Emma and music by Brad, as well as others, made the end of the day at the beach or from just sightseeing, so very relaxing.The amenities at the hotel are comfortable, especially the pool deck area.This time upon check-in, we were given vouchers for the Fish and Hook Cafe.We used them for breakfasts, and the convenience of food services was most welcomed.One could go on, but suffice to say, we have nothing but high praise for the Aloha spirit of all concerned, and the fine management people who run the day to day experiences at the hotel. One must not forget the housekeeping staff whose daily chores made our stay so comfortable. The location of the hotel, at the very start of the Waikiki “strip” is excellent. A couple of blocks from the busy sidewalks, yet far enough away so that the hustle and bustle gives way to a more relaxed and park-like setting.We can hardly wait to return again.

We've just come back from an amazing 5 day stay at Luana. The hotel is centrally situated but still away from the noise and crowds of Waikiki, provides filling breakfast and guest services are outstanding. When we complained about the noise from the neighbouring room (no sleep for 2 nights) we got immediately moved a better room (with a view and higher up). That's all thanks to Chastity and Kim. The Fish Hook cafe has amazing breakfast options! I will recommend the hotel to all our friends as it's good value and so convenient.

Hi, my name is Haley and I am from Colorado. I took my boyfriend here as a birthday gift - his first time to Hawaii!! Everything was amazing during our stay at Luana. Perfect location, great atmosphere, beautiful energy, and EXCELLENT guest service. This was a perfect place to take him in Hawaii, and he really got the greatest experience, I am so thankful. The guest services blew me away, we were helped by the employees Jessica and Melissa, and they were awesome! Made us laugh, helped us feel comfortable, and welcomed in like we were Ohana. Thanks for everything Jessica & Melissa and the entire Luana fam! We will definitely be returning & recommending !

First time stay at Luana Waikiki Hotel. My daughters and I had the pleasure of meeting Jessica at the Front desk when we checked in. She was very pleasant and exudes true Aloha spirit. Beautiful property, look forward to staying there again. Mahalo!

Where do I begin? Blissfully scented lobby, super helpful and friendly front desk staff, GIANT rooms with kitchenettes and a gorgeous pool! Can't beat the location either. Right across the street from the ABC Store and Whalers, plus Tony Roma's! It's about a ten minute walk to the beach. I want to give shout outs to Melissa, Kim, and Martha for being such fantastic front desk employees. I loved how quiet the hotel was. The other great amenities include: free movies to rent, free beach chairs and towels and free bikes to use! Will DEFINITELY be coming back next year! MAHALO

Firstly the front desk staff were really excellent. From early check in’s, room upgrades, great rates to extend our stay when we had an air bnb fail, to a great pool space & spacious and clean rooms. It’s perfectly located, central to everything Waikiki while still feeling your somewhere a bit quieter. We were travelling with a baby and felt very well looked after. The extra touches like DVD rental, fresh fruity water & free wine and cheese socials were added bonuses. We would happily rebook on our next trip.

Just want to shout out the front desk staff for their amazing work and awesome hospitality. Front desk workers Chastity,Kimberly,and Jessica. They truly go above and beyond. Amazing aloha spirit!!!! Mahalo Nui Loha Ohama!

I stayed at Luana Hotel for a couple day visit. I had an issue with the room but a supervisor named Jessica was able to rectify their problem quickly. The room she gave me was very nice, clean and had a partial ocean view which was perfect. I ate st the Fish Hook buffet and the food was very good with a huge variety of choices. The hotel is located on the Waikiki strip with easy walking to everywhere I wanted to go. Really nice stay!

A great place to stay.. staff was pleasant, starting from the reception. Meals are very good and delicious...Rooms are warm while outside is very cool. Well maintained hotel. I highly recommend the hotel for locals and foreigners. I will definitely choose The Luana hotel next time as I have experience warm welcomes of the staff, excellent service and pleasantness of hotel crew. A special thanks to Kim, Alexis and Chas for making our stay a memorable weekend.

Walking distance to shops, restaurants, tour and trolley pick ups. When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite with fridge, cooktop, microwave ,sink and even dishes provided. Even though it was a city view room you could still see the ocean from the lanai. The view of the city was beautiful you could see the mountains in the background. Ocean view, city view and mountain view from the same balcony you can’t ask for more! The room was clean and spacious. Housekeeping was above average. Staff was very friendly especially Martha. Martha always greeted us with a smile. She always asked what fun things we had done that day and what was planned for the next day. She made you feel at home. Our flight out was late at night so after we checked out the hotel stored our luggage and even gave access to the pool and a place to shower before our flight. All at no charge!!! I highly recommend the Luana. There my be newer places to stay but none could be better!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this friendly hotel with amazing stuff like Chastity at the front desk who listened to our needs and got us exactly what we wanted. The pool is very clean, building is surrounded by parks and Seaview , location is fantastic however the beds and the washrooms are a bit tired.

Had a wonderful stay at this hotel! Staff was really friendly and accommodating! This hotel is conveniently located towards the end of the Waikiki strip which is ideal- far enough from the hustle and bustle of the noisy strip but only a 10 minute walk if you need to go to a restaurant or the main attractions. The pool is small but we didn’t use it much, as we spent most of the time at the beach. The room was really spacious and it was ideal that it came with a mini kitchen which we used daily! This hotel is ideal for families as it is very clean and quiet. Shoutout to Chastity and Alexa at the front desk! I would come back!

It's a great little hotel in a perfect location to explore Waikiki. The rooms are large and have a nice little balcony. The furniture is dated but practical. The bathroom is a little small but functional. The shower heads need replacing. The bed is comfy and the aircon works well. There is a free shuttle bus to the shopping centre and also to the other end of Waikiki. The staff are lovely and very helpful. The pool is great and has nice comfy lounge chairs. Would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is in a great location and the staff above all is wonderful and accommodating. The rooms are very nice, spacious and clean! We were on island last minute for a family member who needed to have emergency surgery. The staff made everything easy for us during a difficult time. We were especially taken care of by the front desk staff: Kim, Chas, AJ, and Alexis. Thank you so very much for making us feel at home. Your care and genuine aloha made our stay. We will definitely be back and recommend your hotel to family and friends. Thank you one hundred times over!

Booked here based on a colleague's recommendation and proximity to where I had to go to. Well this place exceeded my expectations. Check-in was smooth and efficient. I booked a one bedroom suite with kitchen...got a room upgrade - ocean view! These one bedroom suites have two balconies - one off of the bedroom and the other off of the living room. The place is spotlessly clean! The toiletries are also very good (I'm fussy and always travel with my own, but didn't need to use them). The hotel is very quiet and centrally located in Waikiki. I walked everywhere - tonnes of great, affordable restaurants within minutes (read my reviews of those). There's a manager's reception from 6-8 every M-W-F. Wine, beer and finger foods are served there. The kitchens are fully kitted out, and there are several small convenience stores nearby where one can stock-up. There's also Food Pantry about 15mins walk away - a more fulsome grocery store. The pool was well used by families, but I chose to walk to the beach - 15 min stroll. The hotel also has beach chairs and towels that you can borrow. This place is fantastic and great value for what one gets. I highly recommend this place for families and business travellers alike. If I return, i will stay here.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for business. The check-in was the BEST I've had anywhere. Melissa and Alexis were on top of it. There were several of us checking in at the same time and it took less than 2 minutes each. These girls had everything orginized and all we had to do was sign the form. This hotel also has FREE Beach chairs, Towels for the beach and bicycles for guests to use. The breakfast buffett is a little expensive but the Fish Hook Cafe is great. They have Valet Parking 24hrs a day so getting your vehicle in and out is a breeze. I would definetley recommend this place to my family and friends and will consider this hotel for my personal stay next year.

Stayed for 3 nights - upprofessional and unkind staff, dirty room - cleaning lady didn’t even pretend to clean - big cockroach on the floor - absolutely disgusting. Can not recommend this place to anyone.

Melissa and Alexia were awesome with the check in. They were very professional, organized, and helpful. Just awesome! Would recommend this hotel. The location was great. Walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the beach.

Alexis and Melissa were great at getting us checked in and answering all of our questions. We were a large group suddenly deployed for a mission and service was quick and excellent.The rooms were spotless and very large. My room had a full kitchen compliment including dishes. Housekeeping staff were very thorough gracious and polite. The hotel provides beach chairs and bicycles as well as towels at no extra charge.Be prepared to eat out as the hotel breakfast is pricey. But the location is with in very short distance to a multitude of restaurants and the beach.

Alexis Melissa and Chastity always greet me with a smile when I walk through the lobby. They are very welcoming. Check in was quick and easy and I’m so happy to be staying here. I really like the happy hour 3x a week and that they provide beach amenities. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family

Here with a large group for work Fast and easy check-in by a very pleasant staff. Wine and cheese reception three times a week. Small buffet breakfast that was very good (extra charge). Small pool area. Several blocks from the beach. In room coffee, large TV and sofa bed in a nicely furnished room. Very good for the price. I would recommend to friends and family.

On check in we received a free upgraded room, which set the start of our great vacation. Well checking in Chastily over heard us talking about our recent engagement, and sent up a bottle of complimentary wine and chocolates. It's the small acts of kindness that'll keep me coming back to this great hotel.

I was a guest this week at the Luana Waikiki and would like to commend the staff for a outstanding job. Their work standards were totally outstanding. From the Valet, house keeper and also Front desk it truly made my trip to Hawaii the dream vacation I expected.I would also like to commend front desk staff Kim, Chastity and Alexis. They truly exude the aloha spirit. I will highly recommend this hotel to my colleagues, friends and familyJohn

Me and my family recently stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and found it to be good. It's an older hotel in need of a makeover. The rooms are a good size but the bed is not very comfortable, some drawers are difficult to open and close, and if you face the street, it's very noisy. Also noisy was our air conditioner, but it worked. Aside from that, the hotel staff is very friendly, accommodating, and professional. Another plus is the location - walking distance to the beach and many downtown restaurants and bars.

When I first arrived at the Luana Hotel, I was greeted with a warm smile by valet who informed me they would take care of my care! Great ✅ Once I walked inside the hotel smelled beautiful! Then I was greeted by two amazing women at the front desk Their names were Melissa & Alexis! They got my room squared away in a quick and professional manner. I hope next time I return to the Luana they will service me again. My room was lovely and bed soooo comfortable ♥️. 10/10 visit.

We had the most amazing stay with family and friends in Suite M100 ( 2br) and M200. The suite itself was huge with a fully equipped kitchen, 2 huge bedrooms, an enormous living area, laundry and the most amazingly large balcony. We booked through Captain Cook resorts and James the contact person was extremely helpful. The location was just at the start of the main drag, with parkland around and a 5 min walk to the beach. All great for us as we had a 21 month old with us, and didn’t want to be high up. No beach views but more than compensated with the space in the apartment. Our friends stayed in M200 just next door. Would definitely stay here again!

Stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 10 days. The staff, the hotel and fish hook cafe were fantastic. It was our first visit to Oahu and this boutique hotel was clean and in a good spot away from the noise of Waikiki. Our room had a kitchenette with all the required utensils, which we used daily. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to and from the Ala Moana shopping mall. We will certainly stay there again if ever in Oahu.

We stayed at the Luana several times, with Oct. 20-21 as the latest stay. First, we love the smell of the hotel as soon as we walk in. It smells like fresh mandarin oranges. Each time we stayed, we were given excellent customer service at the front desk, by either Kim, Chas, Melissa or Alexis. On our latest stay, we were offered a choice of bottled wine at no charge, which was delivered to our room. The wine came with some delicious chocolates. The room was clean and comfortable. Upon check out, Kim thanked us with some macadamia nut & coconut cookies. What an awesome departing treat! We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends & family because of the excellent experience we always have when we stay at the Luana. Thank you, Luana staff, for treating us soooo well!

This place is huge and absolutely beautiful! We stayed in the M400 Presidential Suite and I would for sure stay here again. It is spacious, convieniently located and almost the size of an apartment. The property manager was extremely helpful and ready to assist with whatever we needed. We have nothing but wonderful things to say about this condo unit and recommend it to everyone who needs space in the heart of Waikiki

I´m from Europe and I have to say that this hotel is a very low standard compare to European hotels standard for the price we have payed in every aspect. Be aware - it is located next to a very noisy Kalakaua Ave. My family had two rooms on the 6th floor with a view toward the ocean, but the noise from the street was not acceptable. The balcony doors were not at all soundproofed. Even at the night, there was some traffic noise from cars, motorbikes, police sirens etc. The bathroom was very outdated and in one room was like a joke - big empty useless space on one side and very small washbasin at the other side, where you cannot put anything. If you want - you must place your comb on the toilet (see a photo). Also you have to pay resort fee - it is really for nothing, even if the manager writes here in reply to my review the "great" things which are included... You don´t have an option to deny this "great" services. Once we want to use their "shuttle" service but after waiting for 35 - 40 minutes (we were there 5 minutes ahead of schedule) we decided to walk on foot to Ala Moana S.C. as no one shows. The breakfast have very limited selection - if we haven´t included one free breakfast for 4 nights of stay for 2 of us - I don´t recommend to take it for $20 per head. Parking is also overpriced - almost $40 for hotel guests. I will not stay at this property anymore.

Upon arrival, we were greeted and explained to in great detail, about the daily breakfast vouchers, $10 vouchers, shuttle etc. All of these were included with the package deal from Costco travel.The room was very nice, albeit the air conditioning was noisy, but at night it would drown out the sirens. Maid service was efficient, a recycle bin would have been nice and the safe was not working. However, the fridge and sink area with dishes were a great addition for when you had leftovers, a microwave perhaps could have been useful.The staff at breakfast, Tomas, Jawaiian were outstanding, pleasant, helpful with ideas for planning our trips and efficient at their job. The food from the restaurant/cafe was delicious, poke sampler, avocado toast, grilled fish sandwich were all excellent. Breakfast was lots of fruit, eggs, sausages, toasts, and sweets, plenty for us.The wine/cheese party from 5-6 MWF was delightful, to get a chance to talk with staff and gather ideas for what to see and what to avoid.They provided beach towels, chairs, bikes, and even umbrellas, along with a shuttle to go to the mall! The pool was great as it was shady for the morning, and lots of chairs. There was a gym and a barbeque area as well.I have recommended this place to many, and thoroughly enjoyed my 12 day stay.

Great hotel the staff were very welcoming. A shout out to Tyler, Jesse, James, Elsie, Chastity and Kim to name a few. Great service and extremely helpful,knowledgeable with suggestions and directions.

From the moment we arrived, early by the way, the level of customer service we have received has been excellent! Not only has the entire staff, including at the café at the Fish Bowl/Hook, been attentive and accommodating, everyone seems to enjoy what they are doing. Their attitudes are what set this place apart . We are staying in a one bedroom suite facing a park and the beach that has 2 balconies, a full kitchen and a washer/dryer. BOOM! Home away from home. There is an on site pool, barbeque area and laundry room (if you don’t get a suite with a washer/dryer). Housekeeping/Maintenance keep this joint spotless. Located close but not too close to everything – (this location is not surrounded by other tall building and although family friendly, pretty darn quite). A great place to see the Friday night Waikiki firework. And, even though we rented a car, a piggyback deal through the Luana and Alamo, we have only used it a few times. On site parking is $35 per day, but worth it for the convenience. The valets are super friendly , have (useful1) good advice and greet us every time like we are family.The food on site is great. That award winning bacon fat avocado toast was worth every penny as was my Loco Moco. The buffet was also delicious and both have great healthy options and include vegetarian and vegan options. Although we are checking into the Four Seasons tomorrow, the Luana is what I will be recommending to friends and family and are included in my plans for my next trip to Oahu. Mahalo Luana!

Jessica, Jesse and Jace, and all the works that I know your faces but not your names ROCK!!!! You make my trip awesome. The people bring you back with their aloha sprit....the hotel is clean and it's location is perfect. Great guest services and alway will to help...great people work at the Luana, that's what keeps us coming back for the 8th time and looking forward to the 9th time.

Great place to stay centrally located literally its between 5-10 minutes to everywhere you want to go. Super friendly staff. Best breakfast was in the cafe skip the buffet and get the breakfast croissant. Loved the DVD and games that they offered for free. You can borrow bicycles, beach chairs, beach umbrellas, and regular umbrellas to shield the sun. This place was over all a good place for families. Wish the room had a microwave included. They did offer us one for 50. Extra for a week but when we booked our package it showed one included. Not the hotels faulty that was Costco I guess. Overall I was very happy for our 11 day stay.

Happy I stayed at this hotel and would stay again. It was reasonably priced, clean, and well maintained. The pool area generally had some sun and shady areas. Was great for cooling down after a hot day out and about. Also the location near the park was nice. The beach at the base of the park was excellent for swimming and was quieter than the main Waikiki beach.Staff were friendly and accommodating. My flight out left late in the day and I was able to maintain access to the pool area after checking out. Also I enjoyed having breakfast and grabbing food from the Fish Hook Cafe. I didn't try the buffet. Overall happy that I booked here.

On arriving in Hawaii after night flight, We were sent here from the hotel we actually booked. Without any notice to us or our booking agent, they shipped us off to this hotel. Sub-standard! Room was old and smelly on 1st floor. No kettle. Some Staff were very unfriendly. Would never go back.

I travel to Oahu for work frequently and this is my new go-to place in the Waikiki area. Conveniently located near shopping, dining, and the beach, it takes little effort to get around. The staff is friendly and the rooms are well kept and clear. If you get an ocean view room, you will likely have a nice view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village fireworks from your balcony - if not, they can be viewed from the pool area.
user_name:
Boise_Jax
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Thank you so much they let us borrow their amazing blue fish for a day and had macaroons to take care of my girlfriends tummy ache.They also gave us refreshments and that was perfectly timed. The towels and environment are great.Thank you so much.The WiFi was included and food credit was great as well.Special thanks once more to the staff they work hard and are diligent thank you!!-SteveSteveyoo94@gmail.com

This hotel is in a central location, only an easy ten minute walk to Waikiki beach. We had good views right out to sea. A nice room and good friendly and helpful service. Received $10 voucher per day for the cafe. Hotel provides a regular free shuttle service to get around. a nice pool and gym.Told them it was my birthday on check in and was given a bottle of wine, very nice.Would be very happy to stay there again. Thanks to Chastity, AlJohn and Mel

Chastity and Kim greeted me at the front desk after making a last minute reservation on the phone. I was treated with courtesy and respect and the bell boy met me out at the car. Beautiful cozy updated tropical hotel of my dreams. They gave me a courtesy upgrade which included a Mini kitchenette. This place is a 10 + 2 and I will definitely stay here again. Beautiful swimming pool $10 off of your breakfast free bike rentals, free towel service, DVD's etc. TV's are flat screen and include musical channels like smooth jazz. Love it love it here. You can't beat the price for the location.

The rooms have all that you would expect. Ours also had a kitchenette. Whilst there is no restaurant on site there is a cafe and buffet that caters for breakfast and lunch. There is no full time bar but there is happy hour on Mon, Wed , Fri which was free. Very friedly staff, nice pool area and small well appointed gym. Only a 10min walk down to Waikiki beach etc. There are two close options to rent cars as well.

We stayed at the Luana for several days while moving our daughter to her freshman year at University of Hawaii at Manoa. The location was perfect! We had massive amounts of luggage and even needed to pull our car out of valet multiple times a day for trips to Target, Costco, etc to stock her dorm room. Valet and front desk people were really helpful! The room was perfectly clean and it was so convenient to have on site laundry. We also loved the Fish Hook cafe (I'd recommend the avocado toast)! We were even able to enjoy some evening swims while watching the sunset from the pool. My only complaint relates to the pool side yoga class...great idea (I love outdoor yoga, in hawaii by a pool) but it was perhaps the WORST yoga class I've ever attended and was a complete waste of my time.

I recently stayed in a city-view room on the 6th floor at this property while on business for over three weeks. I chose this property due to the budget, location, and room amenities (kitchenette). I have to say that everything was wonderful from the start. The room was exactly as described / photographed and kept very clean. All of the staff I encountered were very helpful and always pleasant and smiling. The reception was a great bonus and the gym was clean and very well-equipped. I also appreciated the laundry facility. As a woman traveling alone, this was the perfect location for me. It is just on the edge of the busy Waikiki area and was very convenient for shopping, dining, and exploring.

We stayed a week here and enjoyed our stay overall. The staff were all very nice. I loved that we were able to rent beach towels. The buffet was very small and the food is pretty much the same every day. You have to get there early if you want to get a seat. Our package included the breakfast buffet so we ate there but otherwise I would skip it. It was great to have a refrigerator in the room so we were able to buy milk for our daughter. I do wish the room had a microwave so we can microwave our leftovers.I wish they would have some sort of warning about the pool. It is an oddly shaped pool. The dangerous part was that where the stairs are, the pool splits into 2 parts: the right side of the stairs is the shallow end and the left side of the stairs goes from 4 feet to 6 feet in like one step. In normal pools, where the stairs are, that is the shallow end. As you walk further, the deeper end comes on. NOT in this pool!!. When I was there, I saw a Japanese lady carrying baby (less than a year old) into the pool. I was standing near the right side of the steps with my 3 year old daughter. She went to the left side of the pool with the baby. I watched her walk down and before I could say anything to her, she went down under the water. She was struggling to put the baby to the side of the pool. I shouted at my husband to get the baby from her because I couldn't leave my daughter. He swam over picked up the baby and swam with the baby to the stairs while mom swam back. It was a very scary situation. I can't imagine what would've happened if we weren't in the pool that day.

Our stay at the Luana was awesome!! But one employee really stood out to my family & i. Her name was Jessica she was so helpful, she went over & beyond to get us the perfect room for our large family & even gave us some tips on places to visits & eat. Jessica was a huge help during our family vacay. I’m huge on customer service & hospitality & Jessica definitely embodied all of that! Thank you so much for making our stay in Hawaii a memorable one.

I was treated so well by the reception desk staff.Kim, Chastity and Shannon really represent the Aloha spirit. They were very helpful with all my questions and gave me great suggestions on what to see and where to eat!! They also printed directions to my destinations!! I couldn’t have aske for a more friendly and welcoming staff! Mahalo Kim, Chastity and Shannon!! Great Job! I will be back and refer my friends! John Berry

The hotel met all our expectations. Great location, just minutes of a slow walk from nice and sandy De-Russy beach and from the all main attractions and shopping places in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel is either pretty new or recently remodeled, very neat and clean. The room size was big and comfortable enough for our family of 3, with a good working air conditioner and a kitchenette fully equipped and ready for any needs. A pretty small but nice swimming pool and fitness center on 1st floor. Several small grocery stores just a cross the street. The hotel provided free beach towels and light chairs to take on the beach. Very friendly and always ready to help personnel. Great daily housekeeping. We would like to offer a special thank you to our housekeeper Shella who was so friendly and kept our room in a great condition on daily basis. Another convenience that we would like to mention - the pick up for any tour is just across the street or a short block away. So, our stay in this hotel was a great fun and pleasure. Also, even though the hotel is located very close from the heart of a crowdy and noisy Waikiki it provides a very quite and relaxed stay. Will definitely stay there when going back to Hawaii.
user_name:
Marina S
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: The hotel staff are friendly! The free amenities are awesome! The free with room WiFi works really well throughout the property. The views are amazing. The location is perfect it's a walk away from everything. The rooms are reasonably priced! One of the downsides for me is the inconsistent shower water temperature. They need a bigger/better water heating system. I also found it odd that the room deposit was the cost of the entire room instead of like $500 and the rest at the end. It would also be convenient to have a microwave instead of empty cupboards.

We stayed at this hotel as part of a Costco vacation package. We enjoyed our stay here. It is centrally located in Waikiki with everything within walking distance . Highly recommend all to stay here. They have a wine and cheese reception on Monday. Wednesday and Friday fro. 5-6 pm. They have a pool, fitness center BBQ g rtc ills, laundry facility and complimentary bikes to use. Shuttle bus comes by the hotel every 30 minutes. Short walk to the beach.

Very surprised to find any positive points about this hotel on other reviews. My "highlights" were......1. Very old decor everywhere2. Rooms had a strange musty smell like they hadn't been properly cleaned for ages3. The air-conditioners were unbelievably noisy. I'm a pretty deep sleeper though the old style air-cons kept waking me up4. The balcony was useless as there was no privacy. From our balcony I could easily see partly onto at least onto 6 other balconies, with one literally ~ 3 m away with no screening at all5. The beds were poor. For some bizarre reason the under-sheets were too small for the beds and so kept riding high during the night. As for house-keeping, one day I found they had simply pulled up the top sheets, as the under-sheet was still pulled up high from the night before...lazy housekeeping effort there6. The "buffet breakfast" was a joke- easily the worst I have seen in 30 years of travelling. The "restaurant" was a tiny room with enough space for only 4 tables- for the whole hotel!. There was an extraordinarily small range of food offered and it was of very average quality. 7. The front desk staff seemed to not care about their customers. One was blatantly rude to us. On other days I saw two separate parties arguing with front-desk staff over some issue. One staff member did smile at us several times, though the others seemed happy to just stand around and ignore guests.8. The Hotel location is at the wrong end of Waikiki and right next to a very noisy petrol station. Street noise was very noticeable.9. The pool is tiny 10. Ridiculously expensive daily resort fee for the all the "services" offered (yes I know what they are- they're just really poor all-around). To call itself a "resort" is a joke. So if it was a youth hostel or was advertised as a 2 star hotel, then The Luana would be acceptable. However I found it to be extraordinarily over-priced for the very poor quality and services offered. Do yourself a favour- find somewhere else to stay; ANYWHERE else.

Great place. Close to everything, but quiet. Nice coffe shop and beautiful inside. Great views, nice swimming pool and a private BBQ area for guests. Close to all the hot spots, ocean front with extremely short walk through the lush park to the best Waikiki beach.

We booked this hotel literally the day we flew out from Australia, as our original flight to Bali was cancelled due to the volcanoe, so suddenly we found ourselves being flown to Honolulu instead. Would not stay here again. We arrived at 8.30am and were told there were rooms we could check into immediately, but not the type we needed (two twins - we had two teenage children with us and they could not provide interconnecting rooms, so we had to have one parent stay with each child ie two twin rooms). Alternatively if we waited to check in til 3pm, we would have the two twins, so we chose to do that. Walked around Waikiki for 7 hrs, with no opportunity to swim or change clothes (as we couldn't unpack) and then arrived back to be given two double rooms ie a queen bed in each, not even adjacent rooms. When we went to raise this with the staff, they had the attitude that "there's nothing we can do about it" and shrugged their shoulders. We asked for the Manager, and she was the same, and even got quite narky in the way she was speaking to us. We then were told we could speak to the General Manager, Clem, and while he was more empathetic, he would not believe our telling of the situation and took no responsibility for the clear error someone on his staff had made. We were then put into adjacent rooms with a queen bed and a pull-out sofa in each - better, but still not ideal as the sofa bed in both rooms had a dip in the middle and both my husband and my son had a sore back the next day from sleeping on these. We re finally moved to suitable rooms on Day two of our visit - only then could we actually unpack and access things to go to the beach etc, so properly start our holiday. The breakfast buffet room has barely enough seating for 10-12 people, and was a very minimal menu, so even if you could get a seat (which was difficult - we waited for 20 mins two days in a row, then decided to breakfast elsewhere in future), the food was poor. The resort fee is supposed to account for this - you get vouchers back to use for breakfast - but what is the point if you can't use them? A resort fee should be to pay for things the resort provides on top of the standard inclusions a hotel would normally give: I don't call towels or chairs for the beach "resort extra's" when you are staying at a beach hotel! So on check out we paid around US$600 resort fee for our 8 day stay for essentially nothing.

Hotel was ok. I was disappointed at first. Our flight got here at 8:30. Great welcome from rep at airport with flower lei and good ride to Hotel. Had called earlier and was told would honour waiving of resort fee for govt workers. At desk was told no because booked through Costco. Was given breakfast vouchers - no assistance with the bags at all and no additional information or recommendations from John. The room was small and just average. I thought with the comment from John I must have gotten an awesome deal with Costco. Apparently not. Nothing in the fridge. No microwave. Coffee burnt on the coffee maker. And tiny bathroom. Started off on the wrong foot but I have to say the rest of the staff are good. Breakfast was decent and it was convenient to have this available on site. Its not open all day so no lunch or dinner options on site. Open for Dinner only on Friday and Saturday. The parking fee is $35 per night. If Hawaii's primary industry is hospitality, this place falls short. We weren't even told the extra vouchers could be used to to get water for the fridge which would have been nice. I am disappointed with Costco and the Luana. They need to make better arrangements for late arrivers and some kind of info or orientation time regarding the amenities. Maybe I have just gotten used to A class service from Costco so expected similar from Costco travel and the Luana if they have partnered. Overall I did enjoy my time in Hawaii.

I have no idea why this place is not better rated on Trip Advisor. It has everything one can hope for. Classic Hawaiian style lobby and mezzanine. Rates are very competitive (probably some of the best you'll find in Waikiki). Location is very nice, right next to Fort Derussy and its beautiful beach (much wider than the central Waikiki beach). It's right at the edge of the Kalakaua strip, so not as busy as the other hotels right in the middle of it. Check-in was professionally handled by Chastity, who, at our request, arranged for a room with a better view for a nominal daily fee. We ended with a "partial ocean view" room on the 16th floor (the highest one). In reality, we had a very good view of the ocean along with a wonderful view of Waikiki and the Diamond head. Rooms are spacious and clean, with a balcony. Our room had a granite counter with a large sink and small fridge, but no microwave or hot plate (which are found only if you book a studio kitchenette). Granite counter also in the bathroom. Mattresses were firm and particularly comfortable. There is a safe in each room. AC worked well. The pool was only slightly heated and we found lots of hair in it (filtering issue?). Of note, there are two large, very nice natural gas Weber BBQs available; we used them on two occasions when we didn't feel like going out to restaurant. Laundry facilities were modern and functioning properly. Three times a week, there is a "manager's reception" on the mezzanine, where they offer wine, local beer, cheese and crackers at no cost. We found the wines to be actually quite decent. Bikes are also available for free (see the bell boy). Buses pass at the front door should you wish to go to places like the Diamond Head or Hanauma Bay (where parking is tricky). Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. All in all, I'm not sure what else someone could ask for. Having said this, I am knocking off one star in my overall rating because of the so-called "amenity fees" of $25 charged on daily basis. This is basically a surcharge for such things as pool towels and beach chairs which should be part of the basic accommodation charges. Nothing we saw justified that surcharge. Most Waikiki hotels charge it but that doesn't make it acceptable. It really comes across as a scam, a gimmick, a money-grab. Puts a damper on an otherwise very fine establishment.

We have just the most amazing stay at the Luana Waikiki Hotel & Suites in downtown Waikiki beach. Everything about our stay was never any trouble to all of there staff. They were always there to assist with any of our requests. The Hotel was always clean and nothing out of place. I want to particularly mention two front office staff that went above and beyond in helping us when we had a problem with our flight back to Australia. Chastity and Melanie you are both a huge asset to your employer and we cannot speak highly enough to the both of you. We will definitely all be back to your hotel next time we visit Hawaii.Craig,Annmaree and Brodie Stibbard Australia.

Great location, pool was nice, the breakfast buffet was a plus convenient, the staff was exceptional guest services front desk Kimberly was very helpful she made our stay pleasant. Will definitely be returning.

Is was a good place to stay , overall , very high price for breakfast , I mean you can go anywhere in the island and have an amazing breakfast for the same price that they had , and their breakfast wasn't anything special , one of the days their breakfast was really bad , the pineapple was really hard the rice was old , the breads were hard, it was like they didn't care what they were serving , so we just ate breakfast out every day , besides that , I guess it was ok .

Hazel was a gracious host and left detailed info on how to check in after our long flight and late night arrival. The suite was spotless and everything worked as expected. The view from both balconies - the Waikiki shore and downtown Honolulu/mountains were more than we could ask for. Mahalo Hazel!

Booked an ocean view apt for a few nights as a stopover to the mainland. Great staff & onsite cafe...fishhead your go to for breaky. Our apartment was in need of some maintenance though broken washing machine full of water...very noisy in bedroom due to rattly sliding doors to balcony. Just needs some updating & would be happy to stay again as close to everything.

We were joining a family group and went with the booking already chosen. This was clean and comfortable however a walk to the beach and when in Hawaii you need to be able to see the sea! The breakfast was included in our room rate so we did eat in a few times, however it was basic and better choices were available not too far away.

Good location, not right in the centre of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but only a 10 min walk away, and 10 min walk to the beach, so close to what you need. Also local tour companies pick up over the road at neighbouring hotels which is handy for those early morning pick ups! Apartment nice and functional, you don't get a "Wow" moment when you open the door, but kitchen was functional (no oven, but electric hob and microwave, along with toaster, kettle etc). Probably could do with some decorative updates/modernisation, but I would recommend and I would stay here again. Whilst some of the other bigger hotels in Waikiki look appealing from the outside, they are much larger, busier and more expensive, so the Luana I believe provides good value for money. Aloha!

Great location. Not right in the middle of it all but close enough. We walked everywhere, The staff were all super lovely. We got a one bed suite with a partial ocean view and it was great. It had 2 balconies, a little living area and separate bedroom. You can hear the road noise a little and some of the other guests but overall it was a quiet hotel. I would stay here again

The location is awesome very close to the main street with all the shops and restaurants, the experience is this hotel was very good, the suite was so big that it has a canoe hanging from the ceiling and much more, the lanai was really nice but to close to the gas station below.

Luana could be described as a "old fashion hawaiian" hotel. But it is this that attracted my wife and I to the place on our recent trip to Hawaii. The decor is hawaiian. With some great pieces of hawaiin furniture on the mezzanine floor and also in our room. Our room overlooked Fort DeRussy Park to Waikiki Beach through which was a short walk to the ocean.Another good factor of the Luana is that it is almost on the bus stop of the "Beach Bus" stop. This bus takes you to all the beach stops beyond Diamond Head. However I must add that the person on the desk did not know this. But it was all sorted.All of the staff were helpful and friendly and went out their way to help.We had $10 US vouchers for breakfast. That you could spend at the in-house breakfast area or at the 'Fish Hook" cafe at the foyer of the hotel. We chose the Cafe due the variety of breakfast on offer and friendly staff were excellent.I would recommend the Luana. But get a room with an ocean view. They are quieter.Finally for you Aussies looking for a good flat white, check out the 'Coffe Bean Tealeaf" just over the road..

A great hotel in the heart of Waikiki. It is within walking distance to the Ala Moana Mall (about 30 minutes), the U.S. Army Museum of Hawaii (free), lots of good restaurants, numerous shopping centers including the International Market Place, within walking distance of several beaches, and St. Augustines’ Catholic Church. The staff is very helpful, out room was spacious and included a queen bed, sofa, table and chairs, wardrobe, cabinets with cutlery and dishes, a sink and refrigerator, and a neat bathroom. The hotel includes a free happy hour on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 5-6pm which includes cheeses, crackers, wine and beer. They also have a dancer and singer at the happy hour. Reservations for various activities can be arranged through the front desk. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed one night in this place then cancelled the rest of our stay! Avoid the Luana!!! Everything about our room felt dirty. The floors, the bedding (which had huge stains). Rock-hard bed and pillows. Shower wouldn’t stay one temperature, so we couldn’t even shower after a full 24hr of traveling with a toddler. TINY room. We had nowhere to put our luggage - it ended up on the table. Literally 3-4 tiny tables available for ‘breakfast buffet’. Reception staff were rude and unhelpful. Weren’t interested in helping us with any of the above issues, but were quick to tell us to cancel our booking through Expedia. Deeply disappointed. Have never felt so unwelcome. So glad we switched hotels otherwise it would have ruined our holiday. The best thing about this place was the lovely bellhop/valet staff.

We were able to get 2 rooms at short notice after our original accommodation (at another "hotel") turned into a nightmare. Friendly happy service from the first encounter and this high level of service was maintained throughout our stay from every single staff member. Rooms were a decent size, cleaned and serviced regularly. As previously mentioned rooms looked a little tired in places but were very clean and comfortable and it didn't affect our stay at all.

We had a beautiful 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen on the top floor of the hotel. The view of Waikiki was amazing.Very clean, maid was wonderful, bellhop fantastic and the stay was great. They have a 3 night a week reception with beer, wine, cheese, crackers and pretzels. The only thing that kept me from a 5 star review was they had no regular restaurant that served dinner or a nice bar. We had to go out every evening as this gal was not cooking and neither was my hubby so that was a bummer.

Waikiki is expensive. Chose this accommodation based on price. Decor is tired, and we were on the first floor - avoid this as the balconies are like prison cells. Higher floors had usual railings unlike our cement block wall. Air conditioning was very loud - though this was quickly seen to when we mentioned it, and it was improved but still quite loud at night. The standard was what I expected based on the price, and so I was not disappointed - just have realistic expectations if you book here. Pool was small but pleasant, though very little shade, and bed was comfy. A ten minute walk to Waikiki Beach, and easy access to public transport.

Stayed for 5 night, the hotel is right on the main road in Waikiki, perfect! we stayed on the 11th floor with beautiful view of sunset and sunrise. The hotel is a bit old, as long it's clean, we don't mind. Room was been cleaned every day with new towels. The Concierge was helpful. There was a small pantry in the room perfect for breakfast as we were travelling on a budget, location is close to beach, shops and restaurants, the bus stop is close by, safe to walk around at night, perfect for a family. Will stay again, as the price is reasonable for Waikiki area.
user_name:
Mila R
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: This is the best deal in town! My 4th or 5th visit. Why do I keep coming back? 1- value for money. 2- location, 3 - staff, 4- the little things, 5 - did I mention value for money.Located walking distance to everything by Fort Derussey park. The staff are friendly and polite. There are bikes to use and a cute little pool. The fish hook restaurant is great for breakfast and they gave us $10 a day to eat there. We went 3 times in a week as no stupid rule about using the vouchers. Housekeeping EXCELLENT. Balcony for fresh air AND they kindly hold your bags and give you a key to the pool AND free WiFi if your flight is long after checkout.Fitness centre is dated but air conditioned and spotless and FREE. This time we had a basic room but if you have a few extra dollars go for a kitchenette ocean view. I will be back!

We ended up having to stay here after not being able to catch a flight home. The front office wasn’t much help they seemed more interested in chatting with each other than helping customers. the rooms were decent, there was a “kitchen area” but just a sink and fridge... There was a laundry area that came in handy, it was $1.50 for washing and drying. There are PS3 in the rooms and a rental area to rent movies or games in the lobby. The hotel is located close walking distance to the beach and shops and a ABC across the street.

We stayed at this hotel for two weeks. The overall impression of our stay was pretty good. Good location (10-15 min walk to a beach of your choice and to the centre of Waikiki), a pool and a gym, a social hour (5-6 pm) 3x/week with complimentary wine, local beer, cheese and crackers accompanied by live local Hawaiian music and dance, complimentary bicycles on first come first serve basis. Breakfast is not included, and a small buffet in the lobby cost $19!!! However, you get a $10 voucher to Fish Hook Cafe for every day of your stay at the hotel (great eats!) - at the front door to the hotel. The only problem we had with the hotel is cleanliness. There was no sign of vacuuming or dusting for the entire two week period. Or perhaps even before we arrived. If you ended up going for this hotel, just check around and behind the couch for dust. I had a chat with the manager so hopefully this deficiency will be addressed soon.

Our family used this hotel as a place to stay before we left the island. The staff was very accommodating as we needed to leave our bags there for two full days while we were out and about the island touring. They also let us come back to use showers by the pool before we departed for the airport at night. Our one bedroom suite was fantastic for our family of five. We would definitely recommend staying here. Great location and awesome rooms!!

We stayed here for a few nights after flying into Honolulu to do Pearl Harbor and Waikiki before heading to our main destination. The room was large, but had tile and loud. Nice outdoor patio with a good view of the ocean over the other buildings. Initially we were upgraded to a suite but they couldn't get the air conditioner working so we ended up not staying there. The location is the best part of this hotel due to walking proximity to shopping and restaurants, as well as the beach. Easily caught Ubers to hike Diamond Head and to do Pearl Harbor. This is not high end but very functional and nice.

This hotel received good reviews which is why we decided to stay there. However our room was quite noisy given it was located right next to a service station. Location was good and quite close to the beach and shops. Breakfast was okay but quite expensive given what we received. The hotel doesn’t have a bar, which is not all that important however it would have been nice to go for a drink before dinner. The hotel was clean though. The free yoga my wife attended was okay but the yoga teacher was quite unfriendly and didn’t even introduce herself or say hello when she was asked whether she was teaching yoga that morning. The reception staff were friendly however the staff located at the front of the hotel didn’t assist with bags up and down stairs even though they could see some people struggling to carry their bags. Wouldn’t stay at this hotel.

Great experience at Luana Waikiki!!! The staff inspecialy the manager Kanani was awesome!! We would definitely recommend this downtown location to everyone that is looking for a great hotel and very very close to all that Waikiki has to offer !!! Thx Chris and family!!

Hotel is in a great location, minutes from the beach and shops. The front entrance can get a bit busy especially if multiple guests arrive at the same time. The valet was friendly and assisted my group, although several of us were not using the valet but only dropping off luggage. I opted to use the Hale Koa parking lot behind Luana, as I am DoD and can get a pretty good rate. The parking lot is about a two minute walk around the hotel, nothing that isn’t manageable.Once my team started checking-in, Melanie (believe she was the manager on duty) questioned our group rate and was actually able to get us a better rate for our extended stay. I am so thankful she was there, paying attention and went the extra mile to get us a better rate. She definitely could have let us check-in and pay the higher rate, but she knew we qualified for the lower rate and made a phone call and got it authorized. That’s what I call customer service. The rest of the check-in was great and AlJohn was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean as was the rest of hotel. After the day we had at the last hotel (personal items covered in mold) this was a refreshing arrival. Room is quite roomy with a kitchenette. I am here for over 30 days on busy and the ability to make some in-rooms meals was needed. The bathroom is a bit on the smaller side, but it will work and I personally would rather have the kitchenette than a large bathroom, but that’s my personal preference. Also, I wasn’t paying attention when I checked-in and noticed when I got to my room that it was two queen beds vice a queen and a sofa. I called the front desk and they said they would move me with no problem but would call me back after she looked up the rooms. She did call back but they did not have any rooms available until 2 days later. Although she said originally that they would move me, she immediately called me back and gave me a thorough explanation and was extremely courteous and friendly. I was very pleased to know that she tried multiple times to accommodate my request and although I have to wait a couple days, I am able to change to the room wanted.So far, Day 1, this hotel gets a 5-Star rating for service, cleanliness, accommodations, and location.

We checked into the Luana March 3rd. Check in was quick and very smooth. We ended up with a room on the 10th floor and had a partial ocean view. The room was spacious and very clean, however a bit dated. Hotel staff for the most part were very friendly and helpful, unfortunately with the exception of a few. I am a smoker, this was a smoke free property, which I do not have a problem with. I would walk off the property for my cigarette. Our 4th day into our 7 day vacation, I had a guest staying at the hotel inform me that they did have a more private smoking area at the back of the resort. That would have been nice to know so I didn't feel like a bum standing out on the street.The pool at the resort is very small, and the sun does not reach it until late in the afternoon, which leaves the water quite cool and very cool once you get out. The bar, a bit of a joke, as it is only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, and only between 5pm and 6pm. Not really anyones idea of a bar.The restaurant, again kind of a joke. Breakfast buffet every morning from 7am to 11am. Very small buffet, had scrambled eggs, bacon, potato or rice and sausage. It did have a bit of fruit and some yogurt which is fine, but at $18.99 per person, so not worth it. That being said, the restaurant is only open daily from 7am until 2pm, so if you want an evening meal you need to once again leave the property. We checked out of the resort on March 10th, check out was at 12pm, our shuttle did not pick us up until 8pm. We had spoken to a girl at the front desk the day prior, she explained that we would get a key for the pool, washrooms and would be able to use all amenities that were with our original booking. However, the girl that checked us out did not offer us that and I had to go back and ask for it. Minor yes, but not consistent service. We did have an amazing vacation, and Hawaii is beautiful. The Luana as a resort that charges resort fees??? I do not think so. A hotel, yes, a resort not even close. Your vacation as I say is what you make it, and we did have an amazing time. Would I return to this "resort". No.

Great location in Wailiki Beach in Honolulu. Permitted us to have early check in and one hour late check out with no fee which was a huge convenience. Customer service was very good at check in. Our room was lovely with a king size bed and pull out couch. Full service kitchen suite offered excellent accommodations with the exception of the microwave which was difficult to work. The lighting was dim and remote did not function properly but these were minor issues. Room offered beautiful views of green space around the hotel and not too distant ocean. The only day we used pool, they ran out of towels so we did not have any. Cleaning staff was friendly and professional - towels in the room were always abundant and refreshed. Everything was spic and span clean! Bed was comfortable with clean linens and plenty of pillows. The Friday of their wine and cheese event, the bartender was quite rude and 2 minutes before it ended literally withdrew the cheese platter from under my hand to put it behind the bar. Allowed us to store luggage all day (after check out) since we had an evening flight which was also a huge convenience. Hotel has coffee shop/bakery which permitted us to have a quick breakfast each morning - prices were a little high but food was good and staff was courteous. Overall I would recommend this place.

We stayed at Luana for a week and our vacation was fantastic. Thanks to Kanani, one of the managers, our stay at the hotel felt like home. She did everything she could to accommodates our needs . We really enjoyed the Cheese and wine party at the hotel and our kids enjoyed the free movies and cookies :) Thanks for your help, kindness and smile every time we saw you ! For sure we will be back at Luana! Great price for great services and great people!

This hotel was a great find. Our room was very clean, comfortable and attractive, the location is excellent (close to park, beaches, Ala Moana Shopping Ctr, but just out of the downtown crowds), the amenities were nice, and the staff across-the-board were friendly and professional. While all staff deserve kudos, Chastity at the front desk in particular was excellent - very helpful, professional, and a great representative for the hotel. Room details -- our room had a nice long granite kitchenette counter, full size sink, 2 burner cooktop stove, and basic cook and eating ware (3 cooking pots, plates & bowls, coffee/tea mugs, drink glasses, cooking & eating utensils). It had lots of drawers and cabinets to put our things in. The sofa and sitting arrangement were very comfortable, and attractively decorated Hawaiian style. Our room also had 2 very comfortable robes, don't know if that's standard though. The room was also very quiet. We could hear the traffic through the sliding glass doors (where can you not hear the traffic in Waikiki?), but couldn't hear hotel guests in rooms next to us or above us. Very much appreciated after having stayed at hotels where you can hear conversations around you, or furniture moving and footsteps above you. This is an excellent, well-run hotel with character, and we will definitely recommend it to our friends.

We booked a suite at the Luana for part of our vacation trip to Australia and New Zealand. To break up the long flight, we stopped in Honolulu for a couple of days before flying to NZ. Unfortunately, our room reservation for a suite with 2 bedrooms/2 beds and kitchen was changed to a suite with a single bedroom (with a rollout sofa). Since this was a family vacation with 5 individuals (including grandpa and 2 older grandkids), we said the suite would not work and was unacceptable. The first option given of 2 separate rooms on different floors was also unacceptable. We asked to speak to a manager and Guest Services Supervisor Kanani Merseburgh listened to our issue. Rather than dismissing it, she was not only sympathetic but said she would work with us to find another solution. Since there wasn't another available suite large enough to accommodate us, she asked Melissa on her staff to find another option. With Melissa's tireless assistance (she worked with us for at least 30 minutes while suggesting alternatives), she was eventually able to find 2 individual rooms across from each other on the same floor (1 with a kitchen). We took this option and while not perfect for grandpa, it did end up working for us (give Melissa a raise).Kanani also assured us this type of mixup would not happen when we returned to the Luana 3 weeks later and she lived up to her word. She reserved one of their best suites for us and our return stay at the Luana was fantastic. Kanani impressed us with her customer service and she deserves a promotion/raise!!

This hotel is located in the perfect position. Less than 15 minutes away is the Ala Moana shopping complex, Fort De Russy around the corner and next door is a service station where drinks and snacks can be bought. ABC shop is across the road. Although our room was on the first floor (would have preferred a higher level) the noise level was not that bad as we faced onto the main street and it is busy. The room was a little dated (but I think a lot are in Honolulu) and it was reasonably clean. The balcony was covered in so you had to stand to see the view. Would have preferred to have sat and looked out at the view. Did have a few issues with the room - the coffee machine would not heat the water (was replaced with a jug) and the dvd player would not work, maintenance bought a new lead. I would have thought that these were standard things to be checked before next persons arrival? Bellhops were very friendly and helpful - no trouble in anything you asked them. Concierge staff were all fantastic (I think they were all from Expedia). If questions were asked of reception staff, they obliged but, it was not done with a smile? A voucher was given to the amount of $10 per day to be spent in either the tiny restaurant for breakfast (which was $18 per person) or out the front of the hotel in the Fish Hook Café. We ate here. The food and staff were amazing. As the Café is open 7-2 there is nowhere to eat after this time in the hotel itself. In the lobby and level 1 there were large containers filled with water and oranges/cucumber. Very refreshing. Bike hire is free (but then again you pay for it in your daily amenity fees which you pay for upon leaving). DVD rental machine in lobby was a bonus - reasonably good up to date movies there. Washing machines/driers on level 1. Our room was exactly as the photo portrayed it on Hotels.com. Overall our stay was very pleasant and would most likely stay here again.

The Luana is a hidden gem, boutique hotel in Waikiki. It is very Hawaiian and has an incredible staff. Every single employee was thoughtful, kind, and attentive. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed. The pool while really small is heated and relaxing. Yes it’s in the heart Of Waikiki and with the doors open, pretty noisy, but when closed it’s quiet and peaceful. We had a partial ocean view kitchenette and couldn’t have been happier. The room looks over the park to the ocean and is beautiful. Overall this is a great little hotel and the Fish Hook restaurant on property is fabulous but only open for breakfast and lunch 7-2. Increble food and staff there too. A 10 on the hotel and the food. No complaints. When we asked for something we got it. Very attentive.

Stayed in a suite with my wife and our 3 kids. Wife and I in one bed seperate room. 2 kids in hide away and 1 in a roll away. Kitchenette was great. Room views were spectacular. The hotel location is great. Walk thru Fort Derussy Park to get to beaches, 10 minute walk. Close to restraunts and shops. Hope to return soon.

It's rare I stay in the same hotel twice, I just like the variety, but I will reconsider that policy after my stay here. It's not a fancy hotel, but it got it where it counts, like the Millennium Falcon. Excellent staff, clean and comfortable room and a great location. We happened to book the suite this time, but would consider the less expensive rooms. All in all it was a great stay and I don't see any reason why it shouldn't be on anyone's top 10 list in that area.

We just returned from a 3 week stay at the Luana Waikiki. As in past experience this is truly our “home away from home”. This time we stayed in a one bedroom suite on 10th floor. The accomodations were fantastic and the views from our 2 balconies were spectacular. We enjoyed having a full kitchen and made good use of the BBQ facilities. The managers receptions were great, we met other guests and have made some new friends as a result. We had the pleasure of enjoying breakfast at the Fish Hook Cafe: can’t say enough about this place. Food is fabulous and the staff go out of their way to ensure you have everything you need. We can’t say enough good things about all the staff at the Luana Waikiki. Everyone we encountered was very polite and helpful. They made us feel very welcome and were most willing to help out with anything we needed. We are already planning a return trip next year, and very much looking forward to it!

Our room was located on the 14 floor. It was a very nice room with kitchenette, Queen bed and a small balcony overlooking the gardens and looking towards the ocean. The room was very nice and the staff cleaned it very well every day. The staff at the Luana where fantastic. Especially our Concierge, Rico Imperial , who put togeather a fantastic package of different tours of Oahu. Thanks Rico, well done and many thanks to the rest of the staff..

My wife and I just returned from a 9 night stay. The lobby is beautiful and the employees are very friendly. The other reviews are correct about it's location to the beach (two blocks away), shopping and restaurants just down the street. They serve a buffet breakfast in the morning and have bikes, beach chairs, beach towels for use. There is a DVDNow machine in the lobby that you can get (one-at-a-time). Using the PS2 to watch a movie can be a pain to use.Cons: on our way to check out we noticed a different room had more of a kitchen than ours. Our room had a mini kitchen (mini refrigerator, sink, and dishes & flatware for two). The other room had a microwave and a two burner stove that ours did not. When my wife inquired she was told that each "apartment" was individually owned and set up to the owners specifications. So if you're trying to save some money by cooking dinner most nights inquire what is included before booking. Also, if you do not need a car then don't get one ($35.00/day charge). If you are there for the beaches and/or shopping it's all within walking distance. Rent one for a day or two when you decide to do some sight seeing.

We just returned from a week's stay in a 1 BR unit on the first floor with full kitchen and huge lanai with lounges, chairs, 2 tables with umbrellas and a great view of Fort DeRussy, a green park with lush vegetation. The hotel has all the amentities - concierge services, pool, fitness center, guest laundry facilities and adjacent restaurant. A manager's wine and cheese reception is held on Monday, Wednesday and Friday evenings from 5 to 6 PM, accompanied by musical performers and a hula dancer. Shopping and restaurants are close by on Kalakaua Avenue and public transportation is nearby. The hotel staff was very helpful and cordial. Highly recommended!

The location is decent. Close to shops and restaurants and walking distance to Waikiki. Hotel room was average at best. It did have a nice stove and plates and pot and pans. Bed was a bit on the hard side. Floor tiles cracked. Drapes didn’t close all the way and were a bit raggedy. Would have been nice if restaurant stayed open for dinner. Didn’t try at all.

Located near the west end of Waikiki a few blocks off the beach we found this location very convenient. The Fort Derussy Beach Park was close by and a favorite for walks and swimming. Our room was very comfortable and included a mini fridge and coffee maker, but I wish it had a microwave oven since the room had kitchen style cabinets, dishes and utensils. The staff was very friendly and helpful which made for a great stay in Honolulu. I highly recommend the Luana Waikiki Hotel and Suites, a great value in this price range.

Room even the cheapest is great and spacious. The hotel amenities was very convenient can even do your own laundry without leaving the hotel, there was even a gym and a pool. However the weird part is they will put on hold the total amount of days you have booked with them in the beginning plus a deposit of $100.00. Even after they have released the hold it will take 5 days for it to clear. That's new for me as even existing 5 stars hotel such as Sheraton or even Hilton does not do that. Nevertheless the location and amenities was great for such hotel and the staffs were all very friendly and helpful.

Due to a medical emergency I ended up in hospital and needed to extend our stay in Hawai'i. The reception staff at Luana were fantastic in accomodating my partner and making things as easy as possible for her by keeping us in the same room for the extra nights. They also found a room on a nearby level for my parents to stay in aswell which I'm sure was not easy during such a busy time of year, and on such late notice. One very minor issue we noticed during our stay was that the air conditioning in the rooms (while very effective) are quite old machines, and as a result are quite noisy! During the night you can really notice the noise it makes starting up again, which if you are a light sleeper, can take some getting used to.. Apart from that, absolutely loved the hotel and its proximity to the main centre of Waikiki, but also half way towards Ala Moana shopping centre is a great plus when doing Christmas shopping in December!

Good location with easy access to beach. Has been remodeled - appears to have been built decades ago and you can see the wear in points. Valet service was great, front desk was fine (though the night check in for my in laws was horrible - the night staff was rude, couldn’t find their reservation correctly and left them locked out after the first night. Thankfully the day staff were friendly and efficient). Room was spacious and bed was decent, if soft to my liking. Be sure to check the window/balcony door - if not closed all the way, you will hear traffic all night.One weird thing - the kitchenette setting in the room. It has lots of counter space, dishes and even a knife block, but not even a microwave! The large fridge is great because you will want cold drinks!You will be charged an “amenity fee”, so you can use beach towels and stuff. It’s mandatory, whether you use the “amenities” or not. I know it’s industry standard, but it’s dumb. If I can’t opt out of it, add it to the room rate!

We had been staying at the Hale Koa and our time had run out as military visitors. It was recommended we go to the Luana.Not only was it clean and overlooking the Hale Koa park, it was also not as expensive and we had a room with cooking facilities. The luggage and counter attendants were so kind and helpful. Next time we plan to skip the Hale Koa and stay at the Luana.

The staff is friendly - the valet crew is tops for customer service! The property is nice, the pool and fitness area are small but nicely done. The location is very convenient within walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center, beaches, and everything else in Waikiki. The room was clean and having a sink and refrigerator in the room is nice.

We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon and I really enjoyed the stay. The standard rooms aren’t super modern or big but they do include a mini fridge, a stove and everything you need (cups, mugs, utensils and so on). They also provided a toaster, iron, ironing board, robes, among other things that may be useful during the stay.We arrived on a Thursday and they have a complementary cheese and wine event on Friday. The entertainment was nice and we made a few friends.The hotel lends beach towels, chairs and bikes. They also have movies that you can take to the room. The pool is nice, they have a fitness center and bbq grills.Overall I can say that we were very pleased with our stay.

My wife and I spent two nights at this property last November for a stop-over from Australia coming home. We were exceptionally pleased with our room - well ok, it was a 1 bedroom suite on almost the highest floor. We had view in two directions - it was fantastic!Waikiki is a busy, pretty densely populated area of Honolulu but in spite of that, it was easy getting around. We just let them part the vehicle and we walked.The beach, the Hilton Hawaiian Village, shopping, dining - all of it was an easy walk.It was just as easy to drive to the Valor in the Pacific / Pearl Harbor Memorial historic sites. Other Honolulu attractions such as the Royal Palace and Diamond Head were just as easily accessible.In addition, the Luana Waikiki had a pool - we didn't avail ourselves of the opportunity to use it but it looked quite nice.There are "tons" of hotel choices in Waikiki and I would recommend you try the Luana Waikiki the next time you are visiting Honolulu.

I have found that hotel rooms in Waikiki are smaller than most but this hotel was an exception. The rooms were very spacious and ours had a kitchenette with hotplates, sink, fridge and cooking equipment. Although they were looking a little tired they were quite serviceable and the bed was very comfortable. the air conditioner was a split system, not ducted and was rather noisey and we found it needed to running while we were in the room to keep the temperature comfortable. We had rooms on the 7th and 10 floor with a partial ocean view which also had a great view of the city. There is a small balcony with a table and chairs for two. The best feature of this hotel was the location. It is on Kalakaua Ave adjacent to the park on the western end which puts it within easy walking distance of the restaurants and shops and also is easy to get in and out of without going into the busy shopping strip. An easy 5 minute walk through the park takes you to the famous Waikiki beach. There is a small cafe in the foyer where they serve a basic buffet breakfast that was not included in our room rate however we did get a ten dollar voucher each day which we could use toward it. The staff were very pleasant and the desk staff were especially helpful with our check in and check out procedures as well as any other requests we had.

Luana Waikiki was the perfect all round option for us - a couple and 2 friends. This was our second time to Waikiki.Luana is pefectly located between Ala Moana Mall and Waikiki Beach and a 5 min walk through the park to the best beach in Waikiki - Fort DeRussy.Luana provides everything you need in a very friendly, welcoming, comfortable environment. The pool area is fabulous and relaxing and also provides a great view for the Friday night fireworks. Beach towels, chairs, bikes, water, apples etc are all included in the resort fee as well as complimentary wine/cheese on Mon/Weds/Fri evenings.The rooms (ours was a double w sofa and balcony with partial ocean view) were super comfortable and spacious with plenty of room for 2. No microwave or cooktop but a decent sized fridge and plenty of cupboard space. (BYO champagne glasses though as they don't supply them). The bathroom, whilst compact, was totally adequate with shower over bath. One basin, plenty of counter space. Shower pressure not amazing but ok. Good wardrobe space with in-room safe. Black out curtains were great but my only negative would be the light coming in at night around the door frame from the hallway lights. This lit up the room like a lighthouse beacon! Sofa cushions across the door helped to alleviate this.Luana is a 10 min walk (past some great shopping) to Waikiki Beach and a 20 min walk to Ala Moana Mall (or an 8 min bike ride). There are plenty of good food options within a 2-8 min walk. The gas station right next door offers convertible rental car options as well as the best fried chicken in HNL apparently (tried and tested by one of our group)! Breakfast options are a buffet (not included in room rate) or the Fish Hook Cafe which is at the hotel entrance. Really friendly, welcoming, licensed and a nice selection, even if seafood isn't your thing. The hotel provides $10 a day cafe credit vouchers for the duration of your stay. We ate at the Fish Hook most mornings.We would absolutely stay here again - superb location; friendly, relaxed, helpful staff; welcoming, spacious, clean rooms; fantastic pool area. Great value for money :)

Loved, loved, loved Martha at check in. She is professional, helpful and friendly. I can't say enough about her. She is the best! We had 3 rooms booked here and she handled all our needs. The free social on Mon, Wed and Fri is very nice; wine, beer, cheese, crackers, pretzels, walnuts and grapes. The location is great; within walking distance of the shopping malls and the beach. Large, clean room with great amenities. Free shuttle to the mall.

Cheap hotel within reasonable walking distance of the beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room cleanliness left a lot to be desired. Basic accommodation with free shuttle to the Ala Moana shopping mall.
