This hotel is on the main strip and is within walking distance of the shopping malls and the beach. Our room was nice and the staff were really friendly. This are is definitely a busy place and fast paced - we certainly noticed the difference between here and Maui.

We stayed here for 5 nights and were thrilled with the location. Right next to Fort DeRussy and a short stroll to the beach. Also not right in the midst of the heavily trafficked shopping (although it is very close, just right before it) . The Biki (bike)rental, coffee, scooter rentals, parks, food, bus service...all within just steps. We loved it! The place is nice and staff are ALL helpful, courteous and very awesome! We had trouble with our door lock and couldn't get in our room. They were lightning fast in fixing it We utilized all amenities and really enjoyed it here. Would come back again because of the staff and our experience. From the bellhop to the housekeepers to desk staff, everyone there was friendly and helpful..The Fish Hook restaurant there was fantastic too. MAHALO !!

so last minute mission into town. needed a place to stay, and I found myself at the luana hotel. mellisaa was the one to help me, and she has the greatest customer service anyone could have, she made me feel like I was part of the ohana. she was outstanding, she should be promoted to head chief asap

Pleasant and helpful staff and the rooms are very nicely furnished. Central location close to bus stops and stores. Only negative is the extra fees you have to pay after booking - a negative of every hotel in this location however I do wish that some would just include it in the price. Afternoon cheese platter and drinks hosted by management is a fantastic idea and was a fun way to interact with other travellers.

Luana Waikiki is located on the edge of Waikiki at the beginning of the famous Kalakaua ave. This is within walking distance to the beach, mall and tons of restaurants. As a local I think this is a great hotel for both Kamaaina and Tourists depending on what you are looking for. There are a few Pro's and Con's I'll list below-Pro's-Location is walking distance to shopping, restaurants and the beach.$25 resort fee however there are free DVD's to choose from, 10$ dining credit per day at Fish Hook restaurant (which is really good), free beach towels, free beach cruiser bicycle, free social hours with complimentary wine/cheese on certain nights, gym, pool, yoga classes on certain mornings, newspaper, coffee in rooms. -Rooms are clean and pretty large, complimentary bath products were good-Fish Hook restaurant in the lobby is really good highly recommend and they serve fresh Poke there. THey also serve a buffet breakfast which is convenient.-They have a complimentary shuttle to Ala Moana shopping center if you dont want to walk-Con's-Valet parking only which is pricey at $35 (going rate for waikiki)$25 resort fee (some may not like this but I think its worth it)-This can be pro/con depending on your preference but the floors in the rooms are tiled and NOT carpeted, so if you prefer carpeted floors you may want to stay elsewhere.-the room I was in the water pressure was not that good but I understand trying to be "green" and save water-If you are going as a Couple these rooms are NOT King Size beds they are either Queen or 2 Queens, so if you are larger set you may want to get a hotel with larger beds. Overall it was a great stay for me front desk was very friendly and valet guys were great! the employees at Fish Hook are very friendly and their food is awesome!

We stayed there for 2 nights w our 2 kids. A few things... we got our hotel on hotel.com and we reserved a double queen but when we got there they only had 1 queen and a sofa bed. Not terrible but annoying. Read the fine print on hotel.com. Room was smaller... but we hear all hotels in Honolulu are small. Room was clean. Had a fridge and sink and some basic kitchen stuff. You can borrow beach towels which is nice. We rented a car and had to pay $35 a day.... insane. We ate at the little breakfast place and it was $19 per adult and $13 per kid. It was buffet style... was good, but not worth $19. The staff was very nice and helpful. Loved walking in and they say ‘welcome back!’ Like we are family... or ohana! :). Thanks Luana!

Rooms are clean, and well maintained. Service could not be better. I stayed on the 8th floor with a partial ocean view suite. Frig, micro-wave, stove top, King bed and couch converts to a second bed (not bad)! Special thanks to the to four people who made feel right at home and special during my stay. Receptionist supervisor: Kanani, (receptionist) Melissa, and Makhia, Also bell hop: Mr. James was great.. They asked me where I was dinning and believe it or not they had special coupons to receive things like free appetizers. They cater to your needs. Great all around service. I will visit again!

Perfect first visit to Hawaii :) gorgeous views of the park and ocean from our balcony, we walked to diamond head entrance most days and stopped to swim and snack along the way... close enough to town if you want music and city life, but far away for peace and harmony if thats your thing too - nice little irish pub plays music most nights if youre up for a 10 minute walk...nice pool for a quick dip , but get there early as its small and chairs go fast and it closes at sundown - id stay again and again..and again :)

We were here just before Christmas for 4 nights. We were pleasantly surprised as it is an older building now. Our room overlooked the nearby green space and park with a view of the ocean. The kitchenette in our room was very adequate and with some deli food from ABC stores, we had more than one meal on our pleasant balcony. From this location it is an easy walk to the beach, the Waikiki stroll and even the other direction to the Ala Moana mall. The staff were all courteous and friendly and our room was clean. Would stay here again!

I stayed here with my husband and 13 year old son, we stayed for a week and paid $210US per night. At this price at peak season, I thought it was excellent value for money.I was initially disappointed at check-in to discover that we were on the 1st floor as I was hoping for a room with a view. On getting to the room though I was pleasantly surprised to discover that the rooms on that floor had huge balconies (16sqm+) - enough space for a couple of deck loungers, table and chairs etc. There was a significant amount of road noise, but this was largely drowned out by the air conditioner.The room was dated, but clean and comfortable. The kitchenette had plates, cutlery, a toaster, coffee machine. The $10 per day vouchers were an awesome bonus, allowing us to eat breakfast on site twice. We happily paid on another day to eat here too as discovered it good value for money ($14.95 for adults, $8.95 kids) Breakfast consisted of:fresh fruit (blueberries/strawberries/pineapple), yoghurt, granola. 4 hot dishes (fried rice, pancakes, bacon/sausages, eggs) and bagels/bread/muffins & spreads. There was also plentiful tea, decent coffee and juice. The male staff here were exceptionally efficient, friendly and happy despite being rushed off their feet. The wine and cheese nights were fun. Decent beer, wine, pretzels, cheese, crackers, nuts and grapes on offer and replenished frequently. Live entertainment was provided. Was really relaxing. The pool area was immaculately clean, although the bulk on the pool area is in the shade until afternoon. The gym was clean and well-equipped. There is a DVD machine in the lobby to rent DVDs for the in-room play-station. One per day is covered in the resort fee. Location-wise it was excellent. Plenty of places to eat nearby (Subway 5mins walk) ABC Store & coffee/bagel cafe across street + more. Overall a decent stay for the price we paid - all of the staff seemed happy, were polite, friendly and helpful whenever needed.

This hotel is listed as a "boutique" hotel. I think that means you will pay too much. The lobby is beautiful and modern looking. The young lady who checked us in was unfriendly and did not acknowledge my presence until I asked her if I should see someone else to check in. For a daily $20 fee, she gave me a list of amenities. I thought amenities were included?? Maybe not. Overall, the hotel is very clean.Upstairs, the carpet is from the early 1980's as was the room decor. The kitchenette had nice dishes and silverware. Kitchenettes are most useful with pots and pans to cook in. We had a small skillet and a 5 quart Dutch oven as cookware. No additional cookware was available. First time I ever cooked a can of green beans in a small skillet. I guess yp u learn to improvise.The pool area is small, but nice. The barbecue grills came in handy, but you have to use the Dutch oven to bring your meat down and back up and then to cook anything to go with the meat. T.V. is clear across the room (also outdated) above the air conditioner. We had to raise the volume to hear it over the air conditioner. $35 per day for valet parking was a surprise, too. No self parking. So on top of the daily room rate, add $55 for resort fee and valet parking PER DAY! We did take advantage of the "free" bicycles since parking in that area as you visit the beach and/or the zoo is quite hard to find.Our trip was great, but the hotel room was disappointing considering how much it costs.

I was placed at this hotel on a week long business trip. It was clean and comfortable. I think good value for the location. The hotel is situated at the end of the Waikiki strip, walking distance to restaurants and shopping. There is also a free shuttle to Ala Moana that was very convenient. I would have liked to take part in their free Yoga classes, but they are only offered in the late morning. On booking this hotel, I assumed the kitchen in the room would have a water heater or a microwave. When I found out it did not, and asked front desk for any resources I could use, the guy was not very friendly and did not offer anything to help me. Every night, the front desk does not even acknowledge you when you go down from the elevator. It seems like a bunch of kids with no supervisor on duty. I liked the hotel, but I am put off by the service, and wouldn't choose this hotel if I was going back to this area.

I picked Luana Waikiki Hotel because of the reviews from trip advisor. And of course it was spot on. Very friendly staff and the room was spotless. The balcony was very relaxing to sit out on in the morning and at night and enjoy the city scape of lights. Plenty of shops and a wide variety of restaurants within walking distance. Free DVD and game rental during your stay. Breakfast buffet was good for the price a lot of fresh fruit. A $10.00 coupon per day. Well worth the stay and would stay here again.

I was in need of a room on short notice. This hotel has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. The room itself was very clean. We were helped by Melissa who was awesome! Thank you for the easy and convienent experience with the check in and the process of getting me a great room. The valet staff was always very courteous even though I was in and out all day long. The hotel is in the perfect location as well. We really enjoyed our stay and you can count on us to be back again when we need a room! Awesome job Melissa and the valet crew, and thank you for making my stay so effortless!

First to be fair, the positives of the hotel. I stayed there 15 nights with my friend and staff were pleasant. The doormen especially, always friendly and wanting a chat or making us laugh with their jokes. 5 star service. However If you want to go to the beach this hotel is not recommended since it's 15 minutes away on foot. The hotel is a little on the tired side...very 1980's decor so was a bit depressing....Upon checkin I gave my Japanese credit card which was charged and we went about enjoying our Hawaii trip which we had planned for 7 years. Upon checkout I was the Only one left, as my friend had left on a different flight. I went to checkout and pay the car parking and was told my card hadn't charged and I needed to pay around $2600. As I'd been in Hawaii 16 days, neither of my cards would charge and I was lectured by staff about how I should have had money on the card (I had for the car parking, and had paid the room stay upon checkin so WTF?) I was at the counter for almost an hour. Staff charged my card another $1500. I was actually confused as to why there was apparently no money on the card since there is a $7000 limit and I'd hardly used the card.... I continually told staff I was running late for my flight but they said I couldn't leave without paying. In the meantime other guests were coming and going and listening to the staff lecture me which was quite humiliating.,. I couldn't believe I was in that position..... Finally after speaking and explaining the situation with the manager I was allowed to leave and rushed to the airport. I made the checkin within two minutes of the counter closing! Upon returning to Japan I got my card statement and to my shock, I'd been charged not only the $2600 for the room stay but also the $1500! So I was overcharged $1500! I immediately called the hotel but they claim to have not received the money.  I then called booking.com where I booked and told them what happened. They sent me an email saying I'd run away from the hotel without paying! WTF!! After sending emails to at least 4 different people at booking.com, plus speaking with several useless staff at Luana the money was still not returned.  I contacted my credit card company who are now looking into this issue. It's been 3 months since I checked out, Luana are still sending me emails claiming I owe them (they claim to have received the $1500 but not the$2600, despite me sending photocopies of my bank statement)  I even received an email from booking.com a couple of days ago saying not to worry about paying the balance of the hotel charge...WTF? I'm owed $1500! All the meantime this money is accruing interest and Luana or booking.com couldn't give a damn!  I travel 5 times a year overseas and this is honestly the worst experience I've ever had,,.,it's not something I'd expect in a place like Hawaii... The management of this hotel should be fired....I'm looking into getting the hotel owners name and sending them this message too. This problem should not happen in a big hotel like this. If you're planning on staying there, DO NOT use your credit card....you could end up like me over 3 months later and not getting your overcharged money back...

This was our first visit to Honolulu and we weren't sure what to expect, but this hotel was quite the find. It's close to the beach, Waikiki and Downtown. If you can get an ocean view room do, because it's situated next to a park, so the view is worth it. When you check in you are given a voucher to use either for the breakfast buffet or for lunch-though it doesn't pay for the whole meal, so bring cash or card.. It's also per room-not per person. We didn't do the lunch, but the breakfast buffet was good. There are several breakfast places near by that are cheaper and just as good. I liked the fact that we were given a free towel to take to the beach along with a beach chair-nice perk! The staff was very accommodating. it's valet parking-which you pay per day. The valet staff was super friendly and very knowledgable about the island. The room was basic but clean, but as I said the view is what made it. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel to Honolulu.

Knew going into this trip the hotel was not high end and therefore didn't have high expectations. That being said, the hotel was amazing. This was mostly due to the people who work there. Their hard work to keep the hotel clean and welcoming was top notch. I usually travel on a budget, but they made me feel like I paid a fortune for the attention they gave me... Always acknowledging me as I come and go, and quick to help if I needed anything at all. The pool was a nice option to relax if you didn't want to walk the 5 mins to the beach. The buffet and Fish Hook cafe are both amazing and the staff there are just as amazing as the others.The only downside of this hotel experience is the AC unit. It seems confused. Lol. It will turn on and off multiple times without actual cooling anything, and a rush of water. We spent most of the time sleeping with the patio door open, which was nice, but could be noisy at night.Overall it was a great experience, and if I ever go back to Waikiki I'll definitely stay here again. The value was exceptional, the people were terrific, and located was perfect. Thank you to all who worked at the hotel to make the experience a great one.

Had a great stay at the Luana. We arrived at 7am in the morning and had previously requested an early check in. They said they would try but could not guarantee it. When we did arrive they said the room is all ready which was much appreciated after a long flight and we had a good rest before heading out.We had a one bedroom apartment which was not huge but was big enough. Upon arrival everything was pretty clean and tidy. There were a few little things we needed to call guest services about and each time they dealt with things promptly and were accommodating.Like others have said the air con units are a bit noisy. The balcony is small but big enough to take in the view which is great looking at the park and beach beyond. Do take note that if you have small children like us you need to be extremely careful with them on the balcony as the bars on the railing are wide enough for kids to fall through.The hotel is in a handy location - easy stroll to the main part of Waikiki and short walk through the park to the beach. This beach is more family orientated and it is nice to have a park adjacent to the beach. If you want it busier with more action I would head to that part of the beach near the main shopping part of Waikiki.The shuttle to Ala Moana is good although big tip - the shuttle does a loop and the hotel is at the start so you will be on a 45 minute trip before getting to Ala Moana. This may be ok to do once to take in the scenery. However you can bypass the big loop by walking over the street to the Holiday Inn as the shuttle loops around to that hotel and from there it is only 10 minutes or so to Ala Moana.Pool was clean and big enough. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. So all in all we had a great stay and would recommend.

We have stayed at this hotel 3 times - the value for the price is very good, especially with a kitchenette. Location is convenient next to Fort DeRussy. More like a boutique hotel than a big chain but with a lot of nice perks such as: fruit water and morning coffee in the lobby, free bikes to borrow, small fitness room, free wine & cheese happy hour and very friendly staff. Comfy beds and quiet if you are up higher or not facing the front of the hotel which is on a busy street. The pool is very small but there are nice lounge chairs and a BBQ area.

Okay ... this is the second time I have stayed in this hotel, and they exceeded what my expectations were from my first stay with was outstanding !!!They hotel staff are without exception the the most courteous , pleasant and sincere persons that you could ask for in this industry. From the front desk , to the concierge , to the front entrance staff whom wish you a great day on your departure to welcoming you back from you days adventures . Problems with your room are taken care of immediately .When you check in you receive vouchers for the in Hotel breakfast cafe with equate to 75% and the food is excellent .... make sure you try the homemade mixed berry jam...there is NO EQUAL !Pool deck is wonderful with padded loungers , umbrellas and complimented with a BBQ deck where if you wish you can grill up some fantastic steaks and dine on the deck .The fitness centre is well equipped, treadmills , ellipticals , free weights and many different Nautilus type machines.Meet new friends at the complimentary wine & cheese nights on the Mezzanine .I could go on and on about Luana but if you want an excellent well located Waikiki hotel , don't hesitate to stay here.

This was our second visit to Waikiki and this time we were travelling without our kids. I chose this Hotel for price and location. We checked in just after 7am and without evening asking got upgraded and given our keys 8 hours before check in! The Lanai is tiny and sadly looked over the petrol station next door but the room was clean and very quiet. The pool was nice but very deep so maybe not great for small children. It's a great location and after several goes we finally found the best way to the beach which lands you outside the Hale Koa where you can get a fabulous cocktail on the beach for $8. You get a voucher for $10 per room per day to use in one of the restaurants downstairs. We ate in the buffet and Poke type Café and both were very good. Staff were very friendly and we would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Allena D
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: What started this stay off poorly was that I called the day prior to confirm my two double bed rooms would be on the same floor and told them we would be arriving late. Sure enough we arrived late and walked into single bed reservations. At least they were on the same floor. The rooms were ok. Not high end but definitely not lowest end of the spectrum. My remote was soooo dirty I didn't want to touch it. I had to plug in my phone charger and was afraid I could set off a fire plugging it in. It was a noisy area and we were on a low floor so we could hear noise all night. I did like the location for the price. They gave food vouchers but their cafe had short hours and ran out of what we liked. This was not the worst place but the mix up makes it hard for me to rate much better. There are better places about the same distance from everything that are nicer options. There are worse options tho, so choose wisely.

Terrific place with great service, friendly and helpful staff. Close to all terrific shopping. Loved the VIP bus, saved time and $$. Either way you go you are close to the beach, shopping and site seeing

A hotel without a bar or restaurant? Yep, but we loved it. This hotel is situated at the western end of Waikiki on the main drag and it's an easy stroll into the heart of Waikiki and to the beaches. Fort De Russy Park is right next door providing a lovely break from the tourist bustle. High on our plus side was the fact it was located just a 5 minute walk from our favourite beach-side bar!! Our 5th floor room was excellent, comfortable twin double beds, lots of storage space, air conditioned (perhaps a tad noisy) and a great bathroom. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Breakfast was not included but the hotel provides $10 vouchers daily against the cost of the buffet breakfast at the small Fish Bowl in the lobby or a limited ala cart breakfast at the Fish Hook near the hotel entrance. Other food options are close by and there are two convenience stores just across the road. The hotel has a nice pool area, and other amenities such as ice dispenser, vending machine and self-serve laundry service. The hotel charges an $18 a day resort fee, the value of which I'm unsure! The room has a non-stocked bar fridge and coffee and tea making facilities but only supplies a percolator. An electric jug or kettle would have served us better! An extra convenience is that most tours do pick-ups from the Ambassador Hotel which again is right across the road. Overall, we had a very relaxed and enjoyable stay at Luana Waikiki Hotel & Suites and would definitely consider staying here again on our next visit to Waikiki.

I really appreciate the customer service and all the extras I receive when checking in the Luana Waikiki Hotel. I never have a hassle - even if it's an early check in. It is centrally located, so walking to dinner, the beach, and shops is super easy.

Value for money - rooms are on the dated side but were comfortable and clean.. The staff were always courteous except for one of the breakfast staff who I found her to be a bit on the rude side.. the shuttle bus is great as it goes to around Waikiki and Ala Moana SC.I booked on Wotif.com, the amount per night I paid was discounted - based on that it was great value of money - it’s approximately two blocks back from the beach and it is down the quieter side of the beach which is great ! I do think they need to find another option for the breakfast buffet where more seating is available for guests.

we booked this hotel mainly as it was one of the cheapest we looked at and as it seemed (which turned out to be true) that the resort fee might actually be good value. the hotel was nice, staff were friendly, rooms good if a bit aged. only the A/C wasn't great as it was so noisy. location great for us, about 10 mins to the beach, plenty restaurants walking distance, 2 shops across the road where you could buy food, wine & beer, bus stop outside. and it was quieter as its away from the very hub of waikiki (but not far, walking distance or short bus ride). the resort fee included free bike hire, free dvd rentals, $10 per night to use in the breakfast room or cafe (you get all the vouchers up front - $40 for our 4 night stay - and can use separately or all at once. you could use this for coffee & a muffin from the cafe at the front of the hotel and that would get you a breakfast every day). the best thing though was the manager's reception between 5 & 6pm on Mon/Wed/Fri - we were there for 2 of them and it was great, you met other guests and got free wine & beer & nibbles for the hour. we were very happy overall that we chose this hotel.

This hotel is peaceful with superb rooms with wonderful views. The staff are friendly and so helpful. The pool is great and the breakfast in the fish hook is great value. It is so handy to everything in Waikiki and a shuttle to the local Alamoana shopping mall. We could not of asked for more

ProsThe price was greatWe were in walking distance to the best shopping, a beach, and great restaurantsThe room was comfy and cleanThere was a small, but full kitchen in the roomThere was a free happy our with live musicConsThe elevator did not work for at least half of our stay and we were on the 5th floor, which is a lot of stairs after you've been out having a great time!

My husband and I were here for an overdue vacation. We just loved our room and accommodations. Alexis at the front desk was extremely accommodating and helped us navigate our stay. We especially liked our kitchenette with the ocean view. I like to cook a meal or two, even on vacation. The wine reception is nice and lowkey. Everyone can come nightly and unwind. The valet crew and concierge were awesome too!Our only complaint was the Fish Hook Cafe, breakfast. It wasn't really a "Hawaiian" breakfast at all. The eggs were like yellow unflavored powder.

The remodeled elevators (since our last visit) are wonderful. Also added is a restaurant. The staff remains excellent and they made our stay enjoyable...The Luana also offers Yoga classes every Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday at 8am on the pool deck. Excellent instructors who adapts to your level of Yoga.The M-W-F HOSTED wine, beer, cheese,fruit, crackers social provided a great gathering place to meet fellow travelers. If you are bike enthusiast, the Luana offers free use of bicycles...

This hotel is 4 mi from airport. Great views! Lobby area is nice. Pool area has sunbeds! The staff is awesome in every way! So helpful and efficient! The room was dirty. Floors needed cleaning. The bath was small and the sink was cracked. The whole room needed dusting.

What a great experience staying at this hotel. Stayed here for 50 days and it's been great every since day one. I have no complaints. I have two people at the front desk who I would like to give great thanks to. They are Martha and Alexis. They were always there for the customers with a friendly smile. They have great service and care. I also would like to give thanks to all the guys in the front who valet park our car and who help with the luggage. I would stay here again.

What a great experience! From the prompt friendly replies to our pre-arrival emails, to the excellent service at the Hotel, it could not have been a better experience. The hotel is surrounded on three sides by parkland, quite different from any if the other hotels we saw in Waikiki. The stroll down to the beach was lovely. Shops and cafes were super close but we thoroughly enjoyed the cafe on site - good food and again excellent staff. Our room was delightful - clean, comfortable, light and airy. The only mild negative was that the air conditioner was a bit noisy for a light sleeper. The pool area was excellent. We enjoyed this hotel so much that we will return again without hesitation. A really satisfying experience

I booked this hotel a full year in advance to get a great price on two suites for a family vacation. The suites had either a king size bed or two queen beds in addition to a sleeper sofa, so our family of seven had plenty of space. Each suite also had a sitting area and kitchenette which were very convenient. Just a short walk to the beach, the hotel is located on the main drag through Waikiki, close to restaurants and shopping. Serendipitously, we were staying during the weekend Hawaii was celebrating King Kamehameha Day so we witnessed a street fair in progress right in front of the hotel. The staff were very helpful, supplying towels for the beach or pool and arranging taxis. They also provided a wine and cheese buffet Friday evening. We definitely would return here in the future.

Great hotel great location walking distance to everything and staff was amazing and will stay there again. Love the pool, They also have breakfast in the morning when you get a free DVD rental one a day to watch a movie in your room they also have a PlayStation if that’s your thing

We loved this place, excellent location 5-10 min walk to the heart of Waikiki and the beach. The staff were soooo friendly, especially Martha and Kim on check in and check out. We originally booked a studio with a kitchenette which would have been fine, however we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite, gorgeous!!! Room was so comfortable and clean! Loved the laundry facilities on level 1. We will stay again!

in standard room no microvaile; recepcion was a weakness; on the midfloor - nice place for meetings; on Fri and Wed there are cheeese and wine degustation - you may meet there many people from different places and spend your time (I recommend good light bear) Location - - not too many schops or bars around, 15-20min walk to the beach. free bikes - I recommend to take to go on Ala Moana Beach near Hilton Hotel. The strong point of the hotel is the fact that even cfter check out you may still use swimmingpool or bikes and towels, restrooms. There is luggage store for free. Drinking water available all day.

Well we booked over 6 months and was due to arrive next week we found out yesterday the pool will be closed for maintenance, surely they would have known this more than six days priorTo this work being done. On hearing this news we enquired if we could expect somereduction in price or some kind of compensation even a pool nearby we could use. The reply was not interested - cancel if you want to so we and have booked elsewhere. Great customer service I don't think so. Still no mention of pool closure anywhere on there social media.

Stayed here for a week and loved it. It's not the most glamorous of Waikiki hotels but it has everything you really need. Free use of beach towels, free DVD rentals. A perfectly ok pool and decent little hotel bar. For the price it's certainly worth it and a short walk to all the shopping and beaches of Waikiki. We thought it was great. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

This is a SMALLER BOUTIQUE HOTEL on the northern end of Waikiki which is a huge benefit because it is not as crowded as the southern end. They seem to be an older hotel trying to modernize itself. ROOMS are comfortable BUT lacks in good air conditioning. There's a rather loud AC unit under the window, no AC in the hallways, elevators or fitness room. FITNESS ROOM is well equipped but has 3 walls of all windows without AC, a fan or shading. It's like workout out in a sauna. ELEVATORS are being worked on and are REALLY SLOW in transporting people up and down 16 floors. DINING includes one small restaurant (4 tables) for a buffet breakfast and 1 small cafe (1 table + window bar seating) for breakfast and lunch. Reasonable cost wise. They provide a $10 per person voucher for the restaurants.A FREE SHUTTLE is provided which makes a full circle along Waikiki to their sister hotels between Diamond Head to Ala Moana shopping center. They also provide on a first come first serve basis beach chairs, boogie boards and umbrellas at no cost (nice). THE BEACH is 1038 steps from the hotel (we counted them). It's a small but not over crowded beach.We rented a room with a KITCHENETTE and was able to walk to the Food Pantry that's only 10 minutes away for our food. The kitchen was adequately stocked although the knives were not very sharp. In addition, there's a barbecue available by the TINY POOL area. The CUSTOMER SERVICE was excellent. They were always very responsive to anything we asked for. The front desk and valet parking offered great tips. They charge a daily resort fee and valet parking fee but that's par for Waikiki. There's always dispensers of fruit infused water in the lobby that was very refreshing.For the price I think it's a pretty value in the Waikiki area and would consider staying here again, especially if they offer more and better AC.

We stayed here Airbnb styles. It has a pool, fitness centre and a BBQ area on the first floor. The apartment was spacious and the air-conditioning was a life saver. This accommodation is really central to lots of great shopping but if you are wanting the beach you probably need to catch a bus ($2- 2.50 the buses don't give change, you need the exact amount) to the other end of Waikiki- that's just my opinion- you can swim at this end it is just better at the other end.

Between Ala Moana and Duke's statue, Waikiki this is the perfect little motel. Surrounded by a park its location is a perfect buffer from the hurley burly of Waikiki. It only takes 5 minutes to hit the strip. They have a courtesy shuttle to Ala Moana, staff are lovely and helpful and although its not the flashest place in Waikiki I loved it. Highly recommend.

This is a great hotel in a nice location. Overlooking beautiful parklands and out to the ocean. It did help that we had a room on the top floor. Staff are very friendly and efficient. They helped us out with an extension of our stay when our flight was cancelled for 2 days. We had a small kitchenette which was handy. The "happy hours" were fun and able to meet other travellers. We had no problem with the lifts as other reviewers have had. The only downfall was the noisy air conditioning but it drowned out the outside traffic noise. Would definitely stay here again!!

We really liked this hotel! We had a large one bedroom apartment with two balconies, a full kitchen, two twin beds and a huge bathroom. It is a great location and an easy walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants. We would totally stay here again! The staff was super friendly and helpful and it was nice there was beach chairs, towels and bikes to use for free.

I was a little hesitant to book this hotel after reading mixed reviews. I am sure glad that I didn't! This place was beautiful! It is in a great location at the end of Waikiki Beach. The staff was wonderful and helpful! We had a corner room on the 4th floor. It was spacious and had a wonderful kitchenette that allowed us to cook and eat many meals in in room. We had 2 balconies, a bedroom and living room. The pool was very nice and clean. We got some vouchers to use at their own Fish Hooks cafe. It had great crossants and coffee for breakfast. It made our stay in Waikiki great! It was a short walk to the beach throught Fort De Russy Park. This beach was much nicer and cleaner than farther down the strip. Great place to stay!

We booked two rooms from a online travel agency and they totally messed up, but Melisa from Luana Waikiki Hotel listened carefully and she corrected the mistake, she spent quiet a lot of time but she made us happy. Thank you Melissa you are "awesome". The management must be very picky otherwise you can not have so many professional people working at this resort.The rooms are very clean and service is top quality. The kitchenette and some rooms are awesome. It is in the center of Waikiki and it is close to the Beach and shops. We choose a great hotel

We had a top floor ocean view that was great. The hotel is not right on the water, but a short walk from it. There is a free shuttle that runs in a loop around Waikiki and makes a stop at the mall. Even though the hotel is older, the room was spacious with a full kitchen, dishes, utensils and a living room. Overall, a nice one night stay.

Great place to stay in Honolulu, just in the beginning of the main streets. It's a short walk to Waikiki beach, the hotel is located in a quiet area. There is a nice beach and not so crowded nearby the hotel, just cross the park behind the hotel,

We had a great time staying here. We could walk the Waikiki area as well as the Ala Moana area. The housekeeping staff was the best ever! We were on the 9th floor and had a great view as well as the best housekeeper! She did an excellent job and took pride in her work! The evening reception was an added plus. There was entertainment during the hour along with wine, beer, and snacks. We were able to catch the bus to travel to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor. We had a kitchenette which came in handy. Just can't say enough positive remarks.

This was our third stay at this hotel, and we got the same room as on previous visits. It was a little disappointing to see a big change in staff, not many of the original staff there but those that were there were fantastic. Several of the original staff remembered us from our previous visits which was really good considering the number of people they must see. Arrived early morning so not able to check in straight away (check in is at 3pm which we knew), so stored our luggage and went for breakfast. Returned later and completed check in with no issues, new staff friendly and helpful. They still offer free tea, coffee and water in the lobby which is a great touch. The cheese and wine which is offered three times a week is a great way to meet other guests. The location of the hotel is ideal - turn right and luxury row, turn left and head to Ala Moana shopping center. Lots of bars / restaurants nearby and as it is at the start of Kalakaua Ave it is quieter in my opinion. Others have complained about noise, I would imagine it would be worse down in the middle of Kalakaua....we don't even notice the road noise.The elevators are still being upgraded and there was a slight delay sometimes, but nothing like the waits others have complained about....it really isn't a big issue.Mahalo to bell boys, Ryan and Jayce, and concierge Tyler - your friendliness and help was greatly appreciated. To the ladies on the front desk - keep up the good workI am sure there are better hotels in Waikiki but we will never find out as we will always stay at Luana due to the staff, I hope management appreciate how lucky they are to have these people.Some complain about the resort fee which is added to the room rate - this appears to be standard at nearly every hotel now and in a lot of instances it is a lot higher. Personally I would prefer it was just added onto the room rates rather than being a separate item, but hey it's the norm.We took Tim Tams from Australia which seemed to go down well with the staff (will bring more next time).Thank-you once again Luana for a wonderful 16 night stay. See you next year.

This is without a doubt the worst hotel in Hawaii. We stayed for 11 days and there was only one of 3 elevators working which meant waiting for 39 minutes for one to show up and then stopping at every floor. The front desk help were not interested in the guests in the least. There is an $18 a day resort fee and a $35 a day parking fee which we had to pay as there is no on street parking. The worth was the 3" cockroach that came out of the owners closet. I told the front desk about the cockroaches and their response was if I have too many they will change my room. The walk to the beach is about 20 minutes hauling all your beach chairs etc. if you are in Waikiki during one of their 92 parades plan ahead because the street will close down. There was a great view from the 15th floor of the fireworks though. The hotel sits on the main drag so it is loud with screaming people and loud screeching cars

A friend and I stayed here for 8 day/nights and we loved it! Grate location and friendly staff, I only gave them 4 stars as I would say it's ready for a revamp! But a part from that it was lovely! Defo recommend

We arrived at Launa Waikiki Hotel very early in the morning having only just arrived on a cruise ship. The staff were very friendly and helpful and despite it being only 10.00am they found an available room and checked us in quickly. We were due to fly out at 11.00pm that night with many hours of flying so we needed a base to sleep and rest before the long haul. We had a room on the 14th floor with views of the city. The room was fresh, clean and comfortable. The decor was pleasant. The free wifi a plus to catch up on family and friends was a bonus after 18 days on a ship with VERY expensive wifi. One highlight was a wine and cheese Happy hour in the mezanine which we enjoyed complete with Hawaiian music and dancing.

A bit old and in need of minor fixes/updates but clean. Free wine, beer, snacks 3 nights per week is more popular than seating and snack availability. A very short walk to beach and other stuff. If your military, just stay at Hale Koa who h is very nice. Idnstay here again if no rooms at Hale Koa

We booked two rooms for two couples, for 2 nights. Our rooms were three floors apart, even though we booked them months ago, together. The hotel staff did let us check in early but that is about where the good part ended. Of their three elevators, at any given time, only 1 worked and in fact at one point, none were working. No evidence of repairs or concern was expressed. Not a great idea when staying on the 5th floor with a bum knee. We tried to use the pool at 6;15 in the evening. All the pool towels were gone, left wet on the pool chaises. We were told we could not get towels because the pool closes at "sunset". This time was fluid as we were told previously that the pool closed at 7:30. So while the pool had people in it, we were told it was closed and could not have towels. The rooms are in sad shape, do not cool well and very dark due to poor lighting. They have "kitchenettes" that consist of a refrigerator, coffee pot and sink. We were charged a daily amenities fee when we did not use any of these said "amenities". Pay some more for a better hotel, it is worth it. The Luana appears very understaffed.

Great location! Short walk to beach which is lovely walk with our family through park.Rooms are good size. We had city view which was great - a/c took care of any city noise. Room furnished great but it very much needs a microwave. Wonderful staff, very helpful. Beautiful lobby & mezzanine. Thank you!

Im just back from a stay at this hotel for 6 days with my friend, what a great hotel, we had a twin room with 2 double beds, ensuite and side sea view.The staff were very friendly, courteous and the concierge was very helpful in helping us arrange a trip to pearl harbour.The pool is quite small but is very relaxingAnd is set in a beautiful setting. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hawaii.

If you are looking for a great location, clean, comfortable, no frills affordable hotel, this is your place. Lots of restaurants a couple of minutes walk away. David, the concierge, was fantastic - very helpful in booking tours and fixing computer problems!!!!

I spent 3 days in Waikiki prior boarding a cruise. I stayed at the Luana Waikiki right on Kalakaua Ave. I wasn’t looking for anything upscale or super fancy. Just a clean place and easy location. Luana was perfect, great little hotel with a classic Hawaiian charm. The decor was dated and cheesy but that only added to the charm of this hotel which made me love it. The Hawaiian lamps and the nice view of Honolulu was my favorite thing about this hotel. Will stay here again.

We were on the fifth floor of the hotel. The view was lovely from the lanai. The suite had a full kitchen. Our bedroom was spacious with two closets. The living room couch was a sleeper sofa. Two air conditioners made it comfortable. We enjoyed the managers reception which included Hawaiian Music and a lovely young hula girl. It was delightful. The young girl talked to us and she told us she had gone to Hula School. She was very good. The cheese, crackers, pretzels, fruit and nuts were generous. There was beer, wine and cold water. We got to meet some of the hotel guests. It was very relaxing we will do it again on Wednesday night. It's all part of our perks while staying at this lovely hotel.

My husband and I are 60 days into a 74+ day stay at the Luana while we wait on our house to be available after our move to Oahu. Overall our stay has been very pleasant, with only a few negatives that have also been mentioned by other reviewers. I would definitely recommend this hotel for short or long stays. Pros: The Luana offers excellent TLA rates, benefits, and support to military members. -We were very happy with our room on the 16th floor, which included a kitchenette and amazing views of Diamond Head and the ocean. The kitchenette had everything we needed to make simple meals in our room. -The service was very, very good. Everyone from the front desk to the maintenance folks were always extremely nice and helpful (we haven't yet taken advantage of the concierge, but other guests seemed pleased). -The services offered (included in the resort fee) were a nice addition: manager's reception with free beer/wine/cheese three times a week; morning yoga four times a week; folding bikes; new movie/DVDs; beach chairs and umbrellas; gym; pool; BBQ area; laundry. -The hotel is a very short, easy walk to the beach and Waikiki restaurants. Cons: The room was dated and the interior was showing wear. The chairs in our room were stained, the coffee pot was corroeded, and the shower head was old and had calcification. The room was still nice, but could use some serious updates.-The restaurant was closed, although they did offer free coffee every morning in the lobby. -As others have mentioned, the elevators are being updated. Two are complete, and the third should be complete soon. There is some noise associated with the updates to the elevator, but will be resolved when the construction is complete. -A/C is a window unit that can be a bit loud. *Update: we moved rooms toward the end of our stay and the A/C was much nicer in the second room. Depends on the room. -The biggest issue that we've had is with our vehicle. We parked with the valet for our entire stay and by the third week we had a roach problem in our car. We bought roach bait, but each time we took the car our we saw additional bugs. I have brought this up with management, and hope that they will address this issue. **for clarification: we have seen no bugs inside the hotel; our car has been parked in the parking garage. Overall the pros outweigh the few cons. It seems like the Luana is being updated slowly. It is in a great location, and with the additional services, is a great place to stay for the price. It is an excellent hotel for military on TLA. I would recommend purely based on the service, the location, and the view!

We have stayed at Luana Waikiki on two occasions (latest April 2017). It is in a great location, rooms are neat and comfortable with everything you need. The staff are friendly. Has a complimentary beer and wine reception three nights per week which is a great opportunity to meet people from all over the world. We will definitely be staying here again.

Quick stay on our way to another Island. Very good for the price. Good location and within walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Staff was very nice and helpful, room was comfortable with small balcony and kitchenette. Cleaning staff wasn't the best and the elevator was slow. All and all a good stay.

We have stayed here before and it is a good hotel with comfortable beds, a small balcony and kitchenette. It is in a convenient location and quiet with the windows closed. The shower is over the bath but OK with good pressure and hot water. Towels were good and there is room in the bathroom for all your things. Could just see the Ocean and fireworks from the balcony. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

We have vacationed in Waikiki several times but this was our first stay at the Luana and we loved it! Our partial ocean view room was on the 14th floor and had a lovely view overlooking Fort DeRussy Beach Park, the ocean and a city view of Waikiki. We had a kitchenette, which was very convenient as there is no restaurant in the hotel. There is a grocery store nearby and an ABC store across the street, as well as many restaurants close by. It is a short walk to the beach and the hotel provided beach chairs, mats and towels. We did have a couple of rainy days and they seemed to have plenty umbrellas on hand. There is infused water in the lobby and near the pool /fitness centre and daily newspapers available. We also made use of the shuttle service, which went through Waikiki and to Ala Moana Mall. One of our favourite things was the wine and cheese nights. It was a great way to meet other guests and we appreciated the free wine, beer, snacks and entertainment. We also barbequed our dinner one night on the outdoor grill on the sundeck. It was fun and again a great way to meet some of the other guests. The pool is small, but had comfortable loungers and it wasn't overly crowded. They also offer yoga classes, free DVD's and have bicycles available, but we didn't make use of these. We knew about the elevators from reading previous reviews so we were prepared for that and most people made light of it. One of the quirky things in our room is that it only had sheers and not a full drape. It wasn't a problem for us, but it could be if you need total darkness to sleep. I only have one minor complaint and that is that I didn't think the housekeeping was as thorough as it could have been The bed was always made, but on some days the floor wasn't swept and not all the surfaces were wiped down. It was especially noticeable because we were cooking and eating some meals in our room. We did the best we could, but there was no broom or cleaning supplies provided. Since we booked through the hotel, and not as a vacation rental, we expected a bit more. The cleanliness of the common areas was very good. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We stayed for fourteen nights and enjoyed it very much! It's not a luxury hotel, but it was comfortable and friendly.

We had an ocean view room on the 15 floor. We had a clear view of the ocean and could see the waves, sailboats and surfers as we sipped mai tais on our balcony. It had a bedroom, living room, and full kitchen, yet was paid 1500 less than actually staying at one of the other hotels on the beach. That is great value and you pay half the resort fee because you are not on the beach. The full kitchen allows you to make meals and save on restaurant costs. We saw numerous families with young children. The only minor inconvenience was that one of the elevators was recently installed and required an inspection before it was put in service. The staff are super friendly (although everyone one is in Hawaii) and helped us many times. It has a great location, close to the beach. You just need to walk across the road to access any of the tours or trolleys available. This is important because there are so many one way streets that you have to walk a ways to get on a public vehicle from some hotels. They have a regular wine an cheese that was great. The pool is small, but the whole time we were there, it was only used by a few people as most were at the beach. Next time we go that is where we are staying guaranteed!

We had a short stay at the Luana Waikiki Hotel & Suites for a stop over on our way to Maui. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. When we checked in the person at the front desk recognized right away that we had been put in rooms with sofa beds and that we were all adults. She very gracious moved our rooms and ensured we had two queen beds. The hotel was very quite, never heard a voice in the hallway for the two nights we were there. It was in close walking distance to restaurants and shops along Waikiki Beach. Beds and pillows were comfortable.

Great motel...Clean, very friendly & reasonably priced. They had beer, wine & cheese nights, which was very nice. The motel is in a great location, in walking distances to everything, including Waikiki beach.

My boyfriend and I spent few night there and we were really happy. We got the suite with the sea view and a balcony with chairs and table. We got a kitchen space, a living room, a bedroom, dressing and bathroom.The staff was friendely and the hotel is close to the city center of Waikiki.We would definetely go back there if we go back to Hawaii.

My husband and I stayed at the Luana Waikiki from 4/29-5/2. The location was excellent, make no mistake about it. The Waikiki beach is within walking distance and when we were in town so was the Spam Jam! The view from our room was also beautiful and we did not find it to be noisy, as other reviewers have mentioned, even though we were on the 7th floor. Additionally, they offered some amenities like umbrellas you could borrow, which was a plus in our book especially since it was a bit rainy during our stay. However, that's about where the positives end. As someone else mentioned, there are only 2 functioning elevators as the 3rd is undergoing renovations...and boy are they slow! If you ever had to make it up to your room you should easily plan for 10-20 minutes waiting for the elevator depending on the time of day. Also, with my husband being in a wheelchair taking the stairs was never an option. The bed and pillows in the room were AWFUL - so much so, in fact, that after getting no sleep the first night I ended up making a cot out of blankets we brought for the flights and slept on that instead. I also used a travel pillow instead of theirs and finally got a better night's sleep. Finally, and what bothered us the most, is that the Luana Waikiki offered us a wheelchair accessible room which was NOT accessible at all. Sure, my husband could get in and onto the bed/balcony but the most important part, which is the restroom was a true nightmare and, frankly, quite dangerous. It took multiple transfers for my husband to get from his chair to the toilet and then to his shower chair and he needed assistance every step of the way. You might think that's normal if you've never been around someone with paralysis but let me assure you: it isn't. My husband is a young, independent wheelchair athlete so this was anything but the norm. Overall, while the view and location were excellent the amenities did not warrant the nightly fees and the uncomfortable bed and inaccessible bathroom all but sealed the deal. We will not be back nor can we, in good conscience, recommend this place to anyone else.

Located on the edge of downtown Waikiki was great.Hotel offered own shuttle service to Ala Moana shopping centre.Friendly staff but no offer of assistance. Just look at you while you struggle with your cases.Concierge didn't know where to catch what bus to Aloha Stadium, sent us to the wrong location, then missed bus and had to wait longer time in the correct location.Good thing we were updated, I would hate to see what the regular room was as for upgrade, grubby and smashed tiles, utensils and cooking items. Lights didn't work, so when evening came hard to see in room.Elevator was soooooo slow, and there were two! Maintenance works being done on third one.Pool couldn't be used by children as it's too deep.Won't recommend this hotel.

Our travel agent booked this motel. It was nice, beds were good and it was easy access to shopping and public transportation. Not a lot of eating options in the area. Motel did not have a restaurant. Had ocean view from balcony. And Waikiki was not far. There was a Hard Rock Cafe within walking distance that was really good after being on our feet all day. For breakfast there was a restaurant named Eggs N Things it far from motel that was good. Was busy and had to wait about 20 minutes. Food was good. Lots of it.

Good location - Right at the entrance to the main shopping district and only a 10 minute walk to the beach. Room was ok, but felt somewhat dated and the air conditioning unit was horrifically noisy! Balcony overlooking the pool area was good. No restaurant or bar on site, so had to go out for any meals or to have a drink. We had 4 suitcases but got no offer of help to take them up to our room which was disappointing after a 6 hour flight.

Great location. Beach, shopping ,restaurants all within walking distance. Bed and sofa bed comfortable. Yoga classes for those so inclined. Designated smoking area towards back of building. Free beach chairs for your use. Water and coffee in lobby. There is a pool but we were too busy to use. Trouble with one of the computers which caused a delay in printing our boarding passes. Derossey park right next door, beautiful beach. Staff were very friendly.

We stayed at the Luana last year and we had no complaints with the regular room with a Queen bed. This year we stayed in a suite with a king bed (room 907) and enjoyed it even more than last year. This room is on the corner and has an ocean view. The hotel has a great location with an easy five minute walk to the beach. The complementary wine and cheese nights are fun and a great way to meet others. The morning yoga on the pool deck was wonderful! All staff were friendly and helpful but both Shella and Mulato went out of their way to be helpful. I'd most definitely stay at Luana again.

We stayed here for one night before heading to airport. Positives first, the room was big with kitchen and sofa and so one. But it was very noicy. Even though our room was at 8th floor, the traffic is keeping you awake. And if that doesn't the AC is so loud you need ear plugs. So we came here to sleep and did not sleep. One other reason for that was that our bed was supprisingly small. Also the hotel is not really ideally situated. We stayed a few nights in Ramada Plaza and it was cheaper and better in all ways. Sorry to say, from us no recommandations here.

We enjoyed a two-night stay at Luana Waikiki and were graciously provided with a very early check in. The staff were helpful, friendly and welcoming. Everything was very clean and carpet on 6th floor was being replaced during our stay. The lifts are being replaced and apparently this is a slow process in Waikiki as a frequent guest told us the completed lift took around nine months to replace. We were on holiday so didn't mind the wait for lifts but some guests were cranky when we travelled with them. We would have liked a curtain to block the early sunrise but it wasn't a deal breaker. Given the price, location and shuttle service, we'd definitely stay at Luana Waikiki again.

Stayed for one night after a cruise, check in staff was very welcoming when we arrived and got us checked in quickly. There was an issue at check where the hotel would not accept my travel credit card as the security hold, and had to withdraw $200 + resort fee cash to pay as a deposit (ATM on site). Room was larger than expected and fairly clean, but requested two beds at time of booking and just had the one. Nice touches in the room with the nature sounds. When making the booking in 2016 I was aware of the elevator upgrade and thought it would be near completation for my stay in April 2017 but unfortunately that was not the case and the wait time for lifts was ridiculous and it would stop on almost every floor making it a long journey. Another issue we had on our visit was the noise - we had spent two weeks in Waikiki and the other islands and this was our last hotel stay where we was hoping for a good night sleep as we had to catch an early international flight, but we had a very restless night with street noise, sirens, car radios and all this was heard from the 9th floor room was not very sound proof. Also in the room the fridge kept defrosting every 30mins and the air con very noisy, which we had to turn both off.

We are regulars in Hawaii and thought we would try the Luana and glad we did. I have read some reviews and was totally surprised. I think some people need to go and pay top dollar as The Luana offers value for money with style. The Luana offers, free coffee, tea and infused iced water in the lobby every day and a wine and cheese night which is wonderful three times a week. This night offers great wine, local beers great snacks and live Hawaiian entertainment. Towels, beach -chairs and bikes are offered to hotel guests as well. The pool area is done lovely, with towels, cabanas, deck chairs, infused iced water and piped Hawaiian music. The location is great, looking over Fort DeRussy to Waikiki Beach. We walked everywhere, close to ABC stores, restaurants, transport and the hotel offers a Shuttle Bus as well. The room was great, we had a one bedroom which offered a huge bedroom with a with a living area and kitchen. Although the TV in the loungeroom was positioned in a strange place, should have been on a retractable tv arm. Abundance of towels are offered and complimentary toiletries are topped up daily. This hotel offers value for money, friendly staff, amazing authentic Hawaiian furniture filled the hotel, free dvd's and a very competent and knowledgeable concierge. We had an enjoyable stay, it's a holiday so waiting for an elevator didn't stress us, not that we noticed the wait. We will be returning again and would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants style and comfort on a budget.

Valet didn't come to our car when we arrived. My husband had to bring the keys to them. Check in staff were awesome. One of the 3 elevators was broken, which made wait times excessive. If you try to save time using the stair well, don't because it's a circuitous route around the building. Our room was larger than expected and clean. We asked for more pillows. They said we could only have 2 pillows. This was the first time Any hotel refused. Just call the manager and the problem was solved. Stay was alright being close to the convention center if you don't mind walking a little. On Saturday, please check your sheets, because the housekeeper doesn't change sheets. Because I came back at 7pm, they told me housekeeping was gone and brought me sheets, and told me I could change my own sheets. My sheets were changed thur and fri. For the most part, the location is excellent. The room is large. The water pressure awesome. If you face the street, there's noise at night. Overall, a good value if you're patient enough to wait for the elevator, don't need any extra pillows, and willing to change your sheets for part of the stay.

We stayed a t the Luana Waikiki for one week the last week of March 2017. It was terrible. We booked a two bed condo with an ocean view. We got a room on the third floor with a view of the street and the smoking area in the alley next door. We could see the ocean if we stood in the corner of the balcony and looked thru some trees a sliver of blue. The air conditioning unit on the balcony was coated in thick old grease ( like from frying food). Consequently the room smelled like old French fries and Asian cooking. The smell was so strong on the balcony it got in your clothes if you sat by it when it was on! The room had a sofa bed in the living area and a bedroom with a kingsize bed. The sofa bed took up the entire living area when it was pulled out. It also had a metal bar thru the centre of the mattress. The kingsize bed was comfortable but the cleanliness of the room was a problem. There were Plum pits all over the floor by the headboard in the bedroom. There was only one working lamp and the overhead light was burned out. The maid service was poor. Two days they missed cleaning and just piled towels on the bed. The garbage wasn't emptied until the last day. The furnishing and decorations were probably new in 1970 but have not been updated since! The room was dark and not very appealing.Of three elevators only one was operational! All of the BBQ grills are poolside so if you planned on cooking and bring food to your room, you better plan to eat it COLD!The restaurant on the property is closed so don't plan to eat there for breakfast!The pool is small, two arm lengths of front crawl and you have crossed it in both length and width. There is a full size fridge, freezer, microwave, cooking utensils, rice cooker. They offer coffee in the lobby in the morning and you can borrow beach chairs towels. It is about 10 minutes from the beach. The rooms are very noisy. There are sirens day and night. We will NEVER stay here again!The front staff was not interested in helping with any of our concerns.

Beds are comfortable and clean, and the service is great. Overall, I'd recommend staying here if you're looking a more economical place to stay.The value-for-money is good by Waikiki standards. I would love to come back....aloha...

My daughter booked an Airbnb at this hotel...not sure if certain people own suites w/in the hotel...must be. Anyway, it is a super location, nice pool, and we got the room for $99 a night during spring break. LOVED IT!

We stayed at the Luana for 5 nights in March 2017. The hotel is right next to Derussy Park which extends all the way to the beach and just a short walk away from all of the shopping and dining establishments. The hotel is clean and all of the folks were very nice. I have only two complaints: the elevators are slow (one was out of service due to it being upgraded) and the sliding balcony doors are single pane glass with let some of the street noise in. We were in a low level (floor 3) city view room, higher level rooms would probably be better with respect to the street noise.

The Luana's rooms need help. There was mold in the bathrooms, and the door didn't shut without a lot of effort. 1 of the 3 elevators was down, and the 2nd was being closed the next day for "emergency repairs." I don't think the pool heaters were working, because it was freezing (and that says a lot from a family from MN in the winter). However....the staff is great. The valet team was super fast. The manager had a wine and cheese reception for the guests. What the hotel lacks, the team makes up for hands down.

The review published is from 2016 not 2017. We were disappointed this time and although we liked it a year ago. ....this was not the case is 2017.The lifts are still are big problem, and the room that I had booked was not what we walked into....I ordered 2 doubles. To the Manager's credit she fixed the problem in 2 days/

My room overlooked the Fort DeRussy Park with a partial ocean view. The hotel is a short walk from the beach, along a bus route, and had plenty of stores and shops, from ABC to high end, within walking distance. The room was clean and quiet. The front desk provided beach towels and beach chairs. On the one day we asked for a beach umbrella, there were none available. The wine and cheese get togethers are a nice touch with Hawaiian music and dancer. We watched the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village from the viewing area balcony. I would definitely stay here again.

This was our second stay at the Luana. Had a fabulous room with great views of the ocean & Fort Derussey. The staff are extremely helpful & friendly. Our only suggestion would be to have a clothes airer in the room for drying clothing that cannot be put in dryers. Location is great... far enough away from the fastness of Waikiki but close enough & a perfect stroll through the park to the beach. We will be back!!!

We stayed here for 6 nights in February and it was our first time in Hawaii and Wakiki. ( what a beautiful Island)All in all a nice hotel, although I couldn't use the Air con as it was just a bit too noisy to sleep with it on. We had a corner room on the 9th floor with a lovely view overlooking the park.The staff were exceptionally friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them, they even gave us a goldfish to look after whilst we were there, luckily we managed to keep it alive :-) Our room had a huge well equipped kitchen and very comfortable beds. The only negative really was a $35 a day parking fee ...... but I guess that's Waikiki.

On the plus side, most of the staff were incredibly nice and warm. Sadly though, on the negative: broken elevator, broken vending machine, broken sofa bed. Noise from repair work being down. Restaurant permanently closed. Snack shop under construction. Pool not heated. Air conditioners loud. Everything about hotel was very dated and sadly depressing. Wish we'd moved to another hotel.

Coming from Hilo we found this hotel to be noisy in comparison. We had traffic noise and a very loud air conditioner. Having said that the room was very nice, we were on the 11th floor with partial views of the ocean, great view from the balcony.The staff were excellent and very friendly.Love the free drinks and cheese happy hour.

We are a family of 4 with 2 adults and 2 children. We stayed for 3 weeks in November, and were beyond comfortable in this unit. Everything we could possibly need was found in the unit; pots, pans, utensils, cups, beach towels and chairs, and more. We absolutely loved the location of the hotel, and were only a 10 minute walk to the beach and an extra 5 minutes to the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon. The ocean view from the lanai was exceptional and we enjoyed having our complimentary coffees overlooking the park and ocean. We loved taking evening strolls along the board walk by the beach and along Kalakaua Ave., shopping for souvenirs and trinkets, at the many shops. The owner provided great service and responded quickly to emails and was easily reached by phone. She was extremely accommodating regarding requests that were made. The staff at the hotel were also very pleasant and the concierge was very knowledgeable. We were very pleased with the Luana and will be staying there again on our next visit. I strongly recommend this unit.

Just returned from our yearly visit to this wonderful hotel. Being smaller and located in a very convenient location, this property has everything you need. Waikiki is just down the street and the bus stops are very close. Staff including Ashley, Dee, and everyone else couldn't be more helpful. Their wine and cheese receptions are a big hit and a nice way to meet your fellow travelers and staff.For a great location with a decent price the Luana is not to be missed!

We recently stayed here at the Luana Waikiki Hotel & Suites on the way back from our cruise, the first day we arrived there about 10am tried to get in early, but were told no wait until maybe 2pm we waited and the room wasn't ready even after 3pm we complained and got another room, which wasn't very clean the sheets had stains on them. The day we arrived 2 out of 3 lifts were working but took up to 20mins to come. The second day we went to go out and waited 30mins for the lifts only to be told use the stairs ( we were on the 12th floor ) and I have bad knees & legs after scaling 12 flights of stairs, we were to tired and sore to go anywhere & the staff seemed like they didn't even care when we complained. DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU NEED ELEVATORS AS THEY DON'T WORK!!!! I have since read other reviews on this hotel going back to March 2016 with people complaining about the elevators not working and one person even got scabies, as it's not very clean. Luana get your act together it shouldn't take more than a year to get your elevator's working seriously!!!! Very unhappy as we lost two days of our holiday's due to not having rooms ready earlier & the poor state of the elevators!!!!!!!! Definitely not worth the money you pay.....

Stayed here for 10 nights as a family (myself, husband a 2yo in one room and in laws in another). My in laws had booked a kitchenette room but we had only booked a family room. Upon check in we were informed they had given us a comp upgrade to a kitchenette as well which was a great touch as we really made use of it.The hotel was always clean, housekeeping came every day, the pool was warm when we used it however, not toddler friendly and all staff we came across were friendly and helpful. I agree with the comments about the lifts being very slow but they are working on that and just leave the apartment 5 minutes earlier if you have a schedule to stick too just in case! All in all a great hotel to stay in with great access to shops and beach.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Luana Waikiki Hotel. We found it to be very nice for a moderately priced property in Honolulu. We had a city view unit on the third floor. There was a nice view of the park next to the hotel from our lanai. Our room was large and clean, and importantly, quiet. The hotel staff we encountered were all very nice and accommodating. It is a short walk through the park to the beach and the hotel is close to major bus routes. Overall, a very good place to stay.

This hotel is a little older but it's nice. They are working on upgrading the elevators. The staff is so friendly and nice and very helpful, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay

My husband and I and our 1 year old really enjoyed staying at this hotel, it was clean, great location between two beaches and in the main area of Waikiki. The best part where the friendly staff, they always said hi and did their best to accommodate everyones needs.(They have chairs umbrellas etc.) There was free yoga, wine and snack evenings, free rental of D.V.D'S and daily coffee and flavour water. We enjoyed the salt water pool and the outside BBQ's. The hotel is also beside a park which is perfect for daily walks...Our stay was perfect!

I don't really have any complaints, except that it was not great value for money. We stayed at 2 different hotels in Waikiki, before and after a stay on the Big Island. At the first one we got a one-bedroom suite for less than the cost of the studio at Luana. I guess the difference is that the Luana was located at the posher upper end of Waikiki, where there is an up-scale shopping district. On the positive side, we did find it fun to browse through the shops and shopping centers. The beach at that upper part of Waikiki is also nicer. My son enjoyed taking out the complementary DVDs and video games. Be warned if taking the free shuttle to Ala Moana because it heads first in completely the wrong direction, making a long circuit to pick up other passenger from other hotels before it backtracks back up towards Ala Moana. Between that detour and the wait, it's more worth it to just take the local bus, taxi or Uber.

From the valet to the check in staff, the housekeeping or anyone associated with the Luana, everyone was pleasant and knew their stuff! elevators felt like it was the 12th of never before it got to your floor (The Luana is undergoing replacing the elevators), perfect views for fireworks from neighboring hotels, and able to walk to the Zoo end of Kalakaua Ave within 30 mins!

Room was very clean, nice and big, a mini kitchen, great pool.Enjoyed our one night stay. Appreciate the min fridge, microwave oven, and dishes. We checked in tired from a long flight and had a nice rest. Rooms are very noisy as they are downtown. Couldn't sleep with the window open.My daughter really liked the pool. Beach is about a ten minute walk.

Great location to gas station, stores, and some restaurants. This hotel is within Wakini where you can walk to explore Wakiki. Rooms are clean and spacious. Comes with TV, PS3 for games and DVD, AC, kitchen with all the utensils and plates and mini fridge. Place is not noisy at all. Also comes with iHome docker to use as alarm clock or turn on the ambiance white noise to cancel the snoring of your family members. Friendly and helpful staff. Great amenities with swimming pool, gym, valet parking, beach towels, free DVD/games rentals, free water, tea, coffee. Wifi is super fast, not laggy at all. This hotel is doing renovations so place will look new and fancy after completed. Very nice.

We stayed on the 8th floor facing south east (Partial Ocean view Upgrade) which offered us a view of the beach, the park and the street as well as a fairly central location. The wine tasting that is held three times per week is great. The room was clean, bright, airy and comfortable with a decent sized kitchenette. The staff were always helpful and accommodating not to mention very pleasant. The biggest complaint that we have is the elevators, they are very slow, however, they are clearly marked as being in the modernization process. One of the elevators was down for maintenance and another was put out of service for a couple of days leaving just one elevator to use. Quite often it was much faster taking the stairs. But that is our only complaint and this can be expected with an older building. We can honestly say that we would have no problem staying here again.
user_name:
Steve and Trine W
Vancouver, Canada

review_body: We booked this hotel via Costco travel and stayed in room 1409. This hotel is a condominium hotel and each room owned by different owners. The staff maintaining the facility is friendly and helpful. Parking is $35.- per day. Parking is only valet parking to avoid accidents the staff explained. There are 3 elevators, only 2 are working and they are linked, it takes forever to get to your level and down. Room had ocean view with a small balcony. Mattress was good and sheets and towels were clean. Overall cleanliness 3.5 stars. Missing dishes and pots and pans very dated. The air conditioner rattled all night and with the noise from outside we had never a good night sleep. Breakfast buffet was included and served across the street. I would give it a 2.5stars. Overall I would not stay in Waikiki again. The beach is overrated and the noise there is unbearable. Thankfully we had a rental car and spend most of the days exploring the island.

Lots of things to like about the hotel: friendly staff, free happy hour twice a week, beach towel service, nice pool deck, free movie rentals, great location with easy access to beach and bus lines. Physically, however, this hotel is a bit run down. Our bathroom shower was very difficult to adjust, our balcony was a bit dirty with strange puddles (no rain), and the elevator literally took 5 minutes to take us at times. If you don't plan on spending a ton of time at your place of lodging, this is a great find. Maybe look elsewhere for a romantic spot though.
