I have never been to Oahu before, so when we planned this trip, I bought a package through Costco. I did this when I traveled to Florida several years ago, and the property was beautiful. I expected the same here, but my expectations were not met. After staying here, I can honestly say that I am disappointed that Costco even offered this hotel as an option for several reasons. First, all that noise, noise, noise (Yes, I sound like the Grinch!) Seriously, it was like sleeping under a freeway overpass. I had asked for a quiet room, but my room was very close to a five lane intersection with a busy gas station right below my window. I heard sirens, honking, and trucks backing up (beep, beep, beep). There was even a wreck right below my window. (It looked like a moped hit a telephone pole.) All this was very audible from the 12th floor. I simply couldn't tolerate it, and I complained to the front desk. They said that they would move me to the other side the next day. Well, that room (1014) was indeed better, but still very loud, since the other side faces a three lane busy road. I still heard sirens, car alarms, traffic, etc. On top of that, the rooms are not well sound-proofed, so I heard talking, coughing, scratching noises, water running, etc, so I had to wear ear plugs every night. Second, the elevator situation is an abomination. Seriously, sometimes, it would take 10 minutes or more just for the elevator to come. Then, it would stop on almost every floor, and about half the floors didn't even have people entering. Now, this would have been tolerable for me if the stair situation was acceptable, but there was no easy way to go from my hotel room to the lobby or mezzanine using the stairs. The third thing I didn't like was the fact it was not at all a resort. This hotel charges an additional $18.00 a day called a resort fee. I had to pay this separate from the Costco booking, and it made me think that the property was resort-like since I have only encountered such fees at nicer properties. Well, this place is no resort. There is no spa, no hot tub, no onsite restaurant that was open - not even anywhere to buy food. The only way you could get a snack is by crossing 5 lanes of traffic. Fourth, the overall room situation was less than idea. The bedding was extremely uncomfortable. The mattress looked like it was about 20 years ago, and the pillows were like cardboard. On top of that, on my paperwork, it said I was getting 2 beds, but we didn't. We got one queen bed and one hide-a-bed. When I complained about this along with the fact that I also asked for a quiet room - both of which were noted in the paperwork - I was told that there was no guarantee that "special" requests such as two actual beds could be accommodated. Furthermore, the housekeeping staff wasn't great. My coffeemaker wasn't washed for days, and no one even took the time to wash the couple cups in the sink, even after I complained to the front desk. Now, there are two reasons that I am not giving this property one star. One highlight was the concierge, Tyler. He was excellent, He was friendly, knowledgeable, and patient, and he worked with us to book some fun adventures during our time there. Second, the front desk claimed that they gave me a 'free' upgrade when they moved my room to the ocean-side, which I did appreciate. While the partial ocean view is somewhat of a joke since as I noted, this room is much closer to a three lane road than the ocean, it was less noisy than the first room I had. However, I wish the hotel would have noted, when booking, the side you choose makes a difference in terms of the noise. I didn't know that. I don't spend much time in hotel rooms when on vacation, and didn't initially book the upgrade because I thought it was just a matter of the view. Lastly, if you do stay here, be prepared for some inconveniences and if you don't want extreme noise, book a room with a partial ocean view. Better yet, spent a little more and stay at the hotel right behind this one called Hale Koa, which is absolutely beautiful. To be honest, I would have left this hotel the first night if it had just been me, but we had other family members staying at the hotel as well, so I tried to make the best of it.

We stayed in a condo at Luana Waikiki that we rented through Homeaway/VRBO. All the staff were friendly and eager to please. The layout of our 1 bedroom condo worked great for the two of us and it was nice having a lanai to drink our coffee on each morning. Luana Waikiki is in a great location to explore the beaches, shopping, and dining of Waikiki. It's a nice walk down the main shopping street and away from the crowds. The only complaints we had while there were that the elevators took a very long time at certain times and that our key cards were very sensitive in that we couldn't put them near a phone or other credit cards or they'd deactivate.

We booked this hotel through a package with Costco. We had spent 10 days in Maui, and wanted to visit Pearl Harbor and spend a couple of days in Oahu. We didn't know anything about Waikiki, and booked the Luana based upon the Costco recommendation. Aside from being overwhelmed about how crowded Waikiki is, this hotel was very nice. We did not utilize all of the amenities, although the pool looked really inviting with nice chairs and a spacious deck area. The hotel will provide towels and beach chairs, but we were not in Waikiki long enough to spend a day at the beach. The hotel also offers a yoga class one morning and a wine and cheese hour one evening. We didn't do either, but there were several people that did. The hotel is walking distance to several shops and restaurants, and we took advantage of that. They charge $35/night for valet parking (you really have no choice) and the valet guys were very friendly and helpful. The hotel also charges an $18/night hospitality fee. I suppose if you use all of the amenities, it is worth it. We had an ocean view suite, and it was well equipped with comfy beds and plenty of space. The concierge was very helpful giving us ideas of where to stop along the North Shore and had good suggestions for eating out. The gals at the front desk were also very nice and helpful. Waikiki isn't our idea of a vacation...we like the slower pace and less crowds in Maui. I don't have anything to compare it to, since this was our first trip to Oahu, but I would for sure suggest this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki.

The right place to stay in Honolulu/Waikiki:- Perfect localization. 1 block from the touristic area of restaurants and shops, still without the noise if you want to rest;- Very good quality vs. price;- 1 block from a car rental company if you want to rent a car for a day on the other side of the island;- Very good support from Concierge if you want to go to tours, rent a car, Luaus, etc.- Super clean common areas and room;- Close to convenience stores;- Walk distance from the beach,- Friendly staff.Highly recommended.

We stayed at the Luana for 9 nights and were very happy there. Our 6th floor kitchenette room with partial ocean view had everything we needed. We felt like we got some good services for our daily resort fee. We especially enjoyed the barbecue area, heated pool, wine & cheese receptions and the yoga classes. Having access to beach towels and beach chairs was also great. The wifi worked well in all areas of the hotel. The Luana is in a good location, right next to Fort DeRussy Park and a short walk to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, shopping and grocery/convenience stores.

My husband and two teenage boys and I stayed in a one bedroom with kitchen and ocean view room. The room is dated, the ac didn't work in the bedroom but worked very well in the living room. It had two sliding glass doors onto a lanai that was furnished with four chairs and two small tables with a great view of the park and ocean. There has been complaints about their elevators but I personally had no problems with them. The wine and cheese is wonderful!! We used their beach towels and small beach chairs almost everyday. We had a very late flight on our checkout day but the staff stored our luggage and we stayed at the pool all day, they had a bathroom with shower to use. There are a few minor things that I forgot to tell the front desk to address so hopefully they'll read it here. Room 607 needed to be cleaned a little better, you need a frying pan and flipper. The bedroom door needs to be oiled as well as the bedroom sliding glass door (very hard to open) the ac in the bedroom barely works (ok for me, I don't like ac) All in all this Hotel was a great place to stay!

Is a very nice clean hotel and you can get a decent view for the price. Close to everything in Waikiki. Nice to have a lanai with chairs to sit on. Nice sized room as well. No complaints. USB port in the room is on the PlayStation.

Waikiki beach is a very expensive place to get accommodation for a family and so I will say in terms of price this hotel is very reasonable and it is in a great central location. Unfortunately beyond that you shouldn't expect too much- the staff are friendly and helpful but much of the time can't answer your questions as there are several different teams of people operating in the hotel. There is no food available and you have to take a short walk anytime you want anything to eat or drink. The elevators as you will read in many reviews are ridiculous and cause many headaches. The room configuration we asked for we didn't exactly get and we were simply told that it's not a guarantee that you get particular configurations when you book- just a possibility. We did enjoy the wine and cheese evenings! Just OK overall I would say.

The Luana Waikiki is a well-situated hotel that is reasonably priced with friendly staff. It is an older hotel that shows in some respects. The elevators are very slow, there is no food offered, and the computers for guests are ancient. We particularly liked the wine and cheese reception offered three times a week. Compared to most Waikiki hotels, this place is a bargain, especially the kitchenette rooms. If you're willing to forego some modern amenities, I would recommend this hotel for you.

Thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this hotel; from the warm reception by the front desk and valet, and the cleanliness of the room. We especially enjoyed the complimentary wine, beer and cheese hour. This hotel has plenty of amenities: complimentary wifi, shopping shuttle, etc. We borrowed the bikes to go to the beach (for free!), and actually managed to wake up to join their yoga class. There is also a DVD/ps3 game rental machine in the lobby. Didn't really get a chance to use it, but I think those are complimentary too. We had an awesome "3d TV" from our balcony! The pool area has a large, open deck for tanning, BBQ grills, and large gazebos to relax under while listening to Hawaiian music playing in the background. One of the elevators had been fully renovated, (the front desk person was really excited about it) it was fast and a very smooth ride. Definitely a good addition! They also have an interesting piece of art, an intricate art wall made of old printing plates (for fabric?) - very unique. Overall, I would recommend this hidden gem of a hotel.

We stayed for 2 nights as we had a layover. Found good deal on Expedia. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Excellent location and very friendly staff. I used weight room which was clean and machines were in good working order. Smaller room but functional. Also tried free outside yoga and enjoyed it. Our room was basic but clean. No view but quiet except for occasional police siren. Also had a kitchenette. Only complaint was poor pillows. We enjoyed small touches such as free coffee and infused water in lobbies and free DVD's. 12 min walk to beach and even closer to shopping/restaurants. Would definitely stay again.

I stayed at the Luana for one night as a stopover from Maui, flying out the next day. I didn't get much of a chance to utilise the hotel.The check-in process was very easy and the staff were extremely friendly.The room was adequate, but nothing fancy. My air conditioner was very loud and kept me awake all night. If I was there another night, I would have alerted the staff to this.The elevators were all quick and the hotel itself looks neat and tidy.I would probably stay somewhere else next time, not because there was anything wrong, just to try something different.

I stayed there on my first night in Honolulu.The personnel is very nice and friendly. I had a good time at the Luana.The room is spacious and clean, everything works perfectly.No excessive noise, comfy bed and good amenities (pool, laundry, free luggage storage).Thank you guys!

We had a great stay. Wonderful staff and hotel. We had a 10th floor city view. I'd give it a 5 but there were a couple things the cleaning staff missed or didn't do. A couple of times they forgot to leave us coffee and I don't think the floor was swept once.

There suites are beautiful we had a full kitchen with one king size bed and a wrap around lanai it was beautiful but being that there were 4 of us an our daughter we got the pull out couch but it was just as comfortable an fun. I loved my time there.

The hotel was clean, staff friendly, generally tidy hotel but the rooms were smaller than expected and you couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom! The elevators were so slow I ended up taking the stairs! On check out, I found out they bill you about US$18 per day for a "hospitality fee". This pays for the use of the pool, free video, WIFI, etc - excuse me, I didn't use the pool nor hired any videos although I did use the WIFI to check my emails. Definitely not 4 star, maybe 3 star.
user_name:
Chrissy B
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: I booked this hotel with Priceline for $143/night. I thought that was on the nicer end of budget hotel spending and with a 3.8 out of 5 rating I thought, how bad could it be?It was pretty terrible. There was only one working elevator, $35/night parking, and thin walls. Our room over looked a gas station and you could hear EVERY noise from outside- garbage truck, skateboarder, you name it.The staff was very nice and the hotel was relatively clean but I would never stay here again.

Nice and clean hotel. Rooms are bigger than we expected. Nice location, close to shopping area, though it takes about 10 minutes to walk to Waikiki. Elevators are slow though.Parking is expensive at $35 overnight.

As a '4 star' stay I would have to say that the Luana hotel and suites Waikiki is defiantly 'self rated'........ The hotel is clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the little added extras (free bike hire, video hire and yoga) are a really nice bonus - what you would expect from a four star stay - however that's about where it ends for the rating. Now don't get me wrong, the rooms are clean; reasonably well maintained and the WIFI is adequate but the hotel it self is very dated - very. There is no restaurant nor room service (apart from other venues delivering) and no bar for a quiet get togeather. But probably my biggesy complaint would be the work being done on the elevators; only two work (one of those stops only at random floors I think it decides on impulse); of those two one also 'on apparent impulse' decides to not open the doors; or close them........ I understand they are "working" on them for upgrade but I feel a decent thing would have been to let prospective clients know of the problems BEFORE they made a booking. It was that bad that people were waiting up to 10 min for one to arrive and then getting in, even if it is going in the wrong direction, just so they don't have to wait anymore! To add insult to injury on TWO separate occasions when the lift did stop we were advised by the room cleaners we couldn't get in because it was full with them and their trollies!! Overall PRO's, clean, well maintained and friendly. CON's, lifts, nil food/bar, poor sleep due main road frontage and price for what you get. If honestly rated I would say a solid three star but four is just a bridge to far...

We very much enjoyed our stay at the Luana. The rooms are clean, the staff are friendly / helpful and the location is superb.Main notes to share:* Elevators - have been going through upgrades / modernization. We were reading reviews of some folks saying it took a long time and they were very slow. Over our 10 day stay, there were 3 instances that the elevators did take a long time to arrive (more than 5 minutes), but for the most part, they showed up in under 2 minutes. This may be unacceptable for some people, but if you know and are prepared for them to be slow, it's not so bad. On the day of our departure, a couple families were complaining loudly about how ridiculous it was and how unhappy they were about it. I suspect they didn't know about the situation beforehand, and if you're used to very fast elevators...yes, it can be frustrating. It didn't ruin our experience. Random: For the impatient, we were on the 14th floor and I took the stairs to see how long that would take. Approximately 3 1/2 minutes, but the faster you go, the dizzier you get.* AC / sound from the street - we don't have an AC unit at home, where we come from, so I don't know how loud or quiet these things are supposed to be. Some reviews complain of them being too loud or rattling, and at times, I suppose it can be annoying (I was just happy to be cooled off!). We opted to keep our balcony door open for the breeze at times, although at night, if the noise from the street is too much, then the AC unit works in a pinch. Earplugs, for light sleepers, perhaps.* Happy Hour - so fun! Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 5- 6pm. Very generous pours and so great to mingle with others staying at the hotel and sharing their experiences. We made a couple new Kiwi friends that we ended up going out for beers and dinner with, another night. They had entertainment (singer, uke and dancer) to keep the energy up. My favourite part, haha! They served the Kona brewery blonde and amber ale, 2 whites (pino and chardonnay), 2 reds (merlot and cab) and crackers + cheese.* Movie rentals - just for fun, free DVD rentals with pretty updated options. Great for the kids. I think they had some video games available as well. The room console only had one controller for the PS3, so no multiplayer. You might have to ask the desk if they would loan out another one.* Outdoor Yoga - Tues, Thurs, Sat and Sunday at 8am (it says to meet in the lobby at 7:45am). They provide the mats and the yoga teacher might saunter in at 8, 8:01...it's Island Time. I experienced two instructors and two different group sizes (3 people and 12 people). It's pretty random but a good experience and really nice to have this service.* Gym - small, clean and decently equipped for a total body workout. They have two treadmills, one elliptical, one bike. Rack of free weight / dumbbells (up to 50lbs) and a bench. A few machines (Leg press, leg extension, prone leg curl, row, lat pulldown, pec dec, seated bench press,roman chair, back extension). AC was on - thank god haha.* Parking - $35 per night

My husband and I along with my sister and husband just spent 4 day at The Luana Waikiki. We are actually still at the lobby checking out soon. Couldn't wait to thank the staff for the amazing service and welcoming spirit. James the concierge, Jessica, Ashley and Chastety....all amazing. Always willing to help and accommodate.The hotel is very clean, excellent location, however some rooms need to be updated...A perfect example of the welcoming atmosphere is the 'happy hours' given every week. Very generous with wine, beer, cheese, etc... And music. Will definitely go back. We stayed in room 914. Beautiful

Our stay in Hawaii was great. Tyler Hurrle from Expedia hooked us up with nothing but great activities and shows. He was so kind and helpful with everything. The hotel was beautiful and when I go back to Hawaii I will be staying in the same place.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki on a recent trip to Hawaii after reserving the hotel through a package from Costco (worth the membership even for this travel alone as I looked and looked at other configurations and this was the best by $100s). The hotel is one the main road in Waikiki and about a 5 minute walk from the beach at Ft Debussy park. The rooms were clean and the lotion great ( I'm a sucker for good smelling hotel lotion) and cleaned well each day. The pool was small but lovely with soft padded chairs. Take advantage of the available cruiser bikes and beach chairs to explore the beach and surrounding area as well as the DVD now ( like Redbox but included in hotel stay) for free movies and games so you can brush up on your Jurassic World or Aloha before seeing the sites. The rooms have two queen beds which is good for our family of two adults and two teens. Definitely get a room with a kitchenette as you don't want to each out all the time. There is a small convenience store with great sushi and good sandwiches right across the street (Whalers) and a reasonable grocery store for more items and better prices about .6 miles down Kuhio called Food Palace which is worth a walk to. Overall a wonderful stay and Luana Waikiki was part of that.

We stayed in a private apartment within this wonderful hotel. Hotel staff were wonderful to us, especially since we arrived at 5.30am! Lovely rooms, pool, refreshing water available in lobby & poolside. Even though we weren't technically hotel guests, the staff treated us like we were. Travelling with kids can be tough but they were always very accomodating.Great location, easy walk to Waikiki's centre. Free Aqua shuttle to Ala Moana centre. Very convenient pick up point for tours and sight seeing. Walking distance to Waikiki beaches, Hilton Villages. You can see the Hilton fireworks from the 1st level pool deck. Very clean, no bad smells whatsoever, our apartment was small but more than adequate. Fridge, microwave, portable cooktop, laundromat, ice machine, bbq facilities. Kids loved the pool. It wasn't big, but more than adequate and we usually had it all to ourselves. Overall, great location, amenities and price. Obviously there are more luxurious properties in Waikiki but for a lovely stay & staying within a budget, this place is fabulous.

We had a partial ocean view hotel room with a small kitchenette on the 12th floor. This provided excellent value as you could eat some of your meals in the room and save significant money. Although not directly on the beach, access was through a very nice park. Very central location. Gym and pool were small but more than adequate and the staff were very informative and friendly. The only thing that was a negative were the very slow elevators which are in the midst of a much needed upgrade.

Too expensive for what you get. Rooms are old and outdated. Host keeping staff are very friendly. So is the valet. The front desk staff is not. Bust area if that is what you like. You can slam to a number of things.

When I stay at a 3.5 hotel, I expect a Hilton/Hyatt/Marriott. This wasn't that level of a hotel. The elevators are falling apart and it seems like they have done a kind of face lift. The front desk people are great and the lobby is beautiful. I got this on Hotwire, but I normally wouldn't stay at a place like this. For the price, it was excellent, so overall it was average.

Stayed one night and was impressed. The hotel is located at the start of Kalakaua but it's perfect for those who love the peace and quiet. Conveniently located next door to a gas station and store. Walking distance to the beach and great restraunts. The front desk and valet were great! I appreciate great customer service especially when they show the "aloha" spirit! The room we had was great #301. Not a fan of the tile floor but it was very clean, modern and tastefully decorated and most importantly the bed was comfortable! We will be back Luana Waikiki

Front desk service was excellent and prompt. The Concierge was very helpful in restaurant recommendations, tours, and giving directions. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are large and very well decorated, with city views. You can walk all over the Waikiki area, shopping, beaches, and access to tours at a moderately priced hotel. All three rooms our group had included a kitchenette, patio deck, and sitting area. There is a small swimming pool, and an exercise room, but we never used it, as we were at the beach or touring the city sights.

Our room was clean views are good information desk was very helpful and the people are so friendly, shops are so close to the hotel. The only thing wrong with this hotel was the lifts but they are trying to repair or replace them

Stayed the week of 18 October and experienced a clean well appointed full ocean view room experience. Without a doubt The Luana Waikiki is the best value for an off beach hotel in regards to pleasant accommodating staff, excellent Wine & Cheese experience on Monday, Wednesday and Friday's from 5-6 PM! Pool deck is fantastic and the first floor BBQ area is awesome!On the down side, elevator modernization is in progress and parking fees reflect the going Waikiki rate of $35 a night. However an excellent valet service is in place!

My husband and I visited this hotel and we loved it. It was so close to the beach just a block or so walking distance. Also, near the hotel were many stores that we could just go and buy breakfast or be near an ABC store it was really convenient to stay there. We stayed for three nights and those three nights we had such a blast. The room was nice and beautiful with cute hawaiian decorations. The service lady would come every day to make sure that the room was clean. They would provide with towels for you to take to the beach and it was really nice and convenient.

This was just about the most positive hotel experience I can remember, anywhere. The hotel felt classier than the price would indicate, and yet it didn't feel stuffy. The hotel staff, especially the bellmen out front, were extremely helpful and friendly.The hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable. There were nice views from the upper floors. The balcony was lovely (except during the heat of the day). The kitchenette was well-equipped and saved us a lot of money on meals out. It was a short walk to the convention center and the beach. The hotel offers guests beach towels, chairs, and bikes free of charge. There is a wine-and-cheese music performance 4 times a week. The music was nice, although the snacks were skimpy.The only real downsides: the elevators were being repaired, so waits were quite long. The daily charge for our rental car was steep at $35 a day.Still, overall we were quite pleased and would highly recommend the hotel.

We booked a one bedroom suite with a beach view for what appeared to be a reasonable price. The suite did have a beach view but was marred by the Hilton and other hotels, leaving just a narrow view available.The hotel does not have a coffee shop or restaurant although coffee is provided in the lobby in the morning. While we there two of the three elevators were working and occasionally only one was available. The hotel does not have a shuttle service although one is mentioned on the web site.The hotel lobby was spacious and bright, less so the suite, with furniture and carpets that were well past their sell by dates. As we had an evening flight we left our bags and called back for them. We had asked if we could rent a room for a few hours to freshen up before we left, which was refused.

Stayed here for a couple of nights upon arrival in Hawaii before heading to the north shore where I had a beach house booked for the rest of my stay. There isn't really anything "wrong" with the Luana and if you're after a decent place in a handy location for exploring Waikiki at a good price then this will definitely fit the bill. I was just surprised at how dated and tired looking the building was inside and out - the finishing touches just weren't there. The hotel does have all the expected facilities including a small pool and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. The room I had was a good size, on the park side, and I could even see the sea from the balcony. It's the small things - the sliding door to the balcony didn't slide smoothly, the paint was chipped and marked in places, two of the three lifts were out of order, the aircon was loud and clunky. Sounds like small potatoes right? Yes, any one or two of these on its own is hardly worth mentioning ... What gave the sense of being dated was the combination of many small things with some issue or another. Having said that, the hotel was clean and had the best water pressure in the shower of any I can remember! I wouldn't not recommend it, I'd just say don't expect the finishing touches.

Very pleased with the Luana Waikiki ... chose the hotel for its proximity to the park , a short stroll to the beach, partialOcean view was fabulous from our 12 th floor, staff great, James the bellman, our sweet Gloria in housekeeping... I recommend it highly... would stay again... Mahalo!

This hotel was about what I expected for a 3 star hotel. It was clean with comfortable beds & close to shops and restaurants. The pillows could be better. We had a room on 1st floor with no view which I wouldn't recommend. We did not want to spend too much time in the hotel so we could be out and about in Hawaii. I was very impressed with the staff. They were very professional & helpful, especially Ashley & Isaiah. Thanks again for your help with transportation! I would stay here again being on a budget.

Luana Waikiki Hotels , is @ very beginning of Waikiki Location in Honolulu. It is Near the Shopping malls .You are the 1st on to be Picked up on Booked Tour.The rooms are like a Time Share rooms , ( Someone owns the Rooms . So if the Owner shows up , you will need to get a different Room ) .All the Staff are very Helpful , Especially Valets with your Car.The Hotel Needs some Up dates. Kind a Older Hotel.

We stayed here at the end of our cruise for two nights. We got told when booking in we had arrived to early. Our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm but we could leave our luggage and use the facilities. We had also been upgraded.( I dread to think what our room was like if we had been upgraded). I didn't take a note of the young girl who was booking us in but she was very unfriendly, didn't smile or even look at us the whole time. Some reception staff mainly the male ones were fine and friendly. Concierge Was great as was porters.Lifts terrible two were out if use one day and I waited 20 min for a lift before a member of staff shoeing me the fire exit stairs.Room was clean but floor aircon extremely noisy especially at night. Kept getting woke up with people going back to rooms.15 dollar a day hospitality was a bit unexpected when we checked out as we didn't know about it. Didn't use the carpark.No hotel restraunt or room service either.The only pros to this hotel is near the shops and restraunts. The beach is also close by.

Been to this hotel numerous amount of time very handy for shops and food places within walking the lifts have always been slow and been having a upgrade the amount of time I have stayed at this hotel each year staff can be nice one day depending who is on any other time do not want to knowNoticed the change each time hence why I booked somewhere different

I booked this hotel through a time share because I needed somewhere to stay while helping a family member relocate to Oahu...this was not a vacation. Upon checking in Allan advised me that because of how I booked my reservation I was not allowed to use the facilities (fitness center, pool, bbq area, and possibly others). Our room was just above the lobby entrance (busy street), the AC unit's (an antiquated window unit that was mounted on the floor...no central air???) front plate was falling off and rattled but had to be used to drown out the street noise, hair dryer smelled like electrical burning, coffee maker tripped the GFI, exterior security door was left open, hallway carpeting was filthy, bathroom door knob falling apart, lanai (glorified balcony) door was left unlocked and curtains opened when we returned...who the heck would have been accessing our room when we only we "allowed" maid service one day??? Only two working elevators for 18 (I think) floors so the first floor wouldn't have been a bad deal in an emergency. The valet and concierge services were great but it didn't surprise me to find they were contracted out. (Kudos to Mahlia-concierge and Ryan-valet...they were incredible, kind, and so very helpful to a couple of newbies who didn't know a thing about the island.). There was another nice woman behind the front desk, too, but I failed to get her name. I had called down about the electrical burning smell and a maintenance man was sent up. He really didn't do much and made me feel very stupid. We checked out early and ran into Allan again. I thought the first time he was having a bad day and ignored it but sadly that proved not to be the case. His condescending demeanor left me happy to be leaving. Anyone who says, "for the record" when addressing a customer complaint (to the customer's face) needs retraining...or a new vocation. I wouldn't have written anything about this hotel had we not had two run-ins with the "lovely" Allan.

We stayed for two nights at the end of our 11 days in Hawaii. It really was a bit of a downer as it is very average in many ways. Staff on arrival were helpful but our room wasn't ready, so we had to leave our bags and find a place to eat lunch. The room was large enough but tired and a bit scruffy. It overlooked the service station next door. The Lanai was small - we never used it. The aircon was hideously loud especially in the middle of the night. The buidling is showing it's age and is definately not insulated for noise. It's right next door to a service station and at one stage in the night a group of motorbikes arrived - I thought they were in the room!The room wasn't the quiet, cool, haven you need when you stay in Waikiki. The bed was comfortable enough. Housekeeping didn't arrive until after 3pm and by then we'd made our own beds and just wanted clean towels which was fine.The lifts are a joke. Two of the three were closed off for renovation some of the time. When they were working they were slow and crowded often with staff who we witnessed using them for one floor!The pool was small, extremely exposed and there was very little shade. Not the sort of place you'd want spend much time.The beach is a good 10 mins walk away.We visit Waikiki often and you could do better for the same money.Free apples and tea/coffee in the morning, friendly staff don't make up for some other basic aspects for a comfortable stay.

I Spent 9 days at this hotel. It has free shuttle service to the Ala Moana centre, a gym as well as a heated pool that operates until 9pm. There is a laundry where you can do your own washing unless you want them to do it at a price. Its roughly about 70 metres from the Waikiki beach line. The main shopping area is pretty much outside the hotel where you will find stores like Armani, Fendi and Gucci. There are smaller stores to browse & shop but to be honest try the ones in & around the Ala Moana centre. Ask at the front of house team for tours you want to do they will happily organise something for you if you haven't done so. Depending on the room you select, it will be cleaned everyday your there, coffee & tea provided as well as bathroom toiletries provided. I enjoyed my time there & recommend it friends &a family on a budget.
user_name:
Johnboy W
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: This hotel is totally deceptive. As you approach you see this beautiful facade and entryway, the foyer is fantastic but then as you get further and further into the hotel you discover that the front is a facade and the interior rooms and service experience are just not up to par in many ways.Pros- Location- concierge is super helpful and has great recommendationsCons- Guest service experience when checking in (rude, agressive, super snotty)- Lifts are very slow and usually full of staff- Air conditioner is antique and VERY loud, you can't sleep with it on so you just sweat it out all night- Air conditioner hole in the wall lets in ALL sounds, all the time, lots of sirens constantly- no soundproofing at entry door so you hear everyone in the hallway, woke up every night around 2am to drunken louts returning to their rooms- $35/day parking, enough said- no restaurant, no coffee shop, no room service, no mini barThe venue is overpriced value wise but considering the others in the area I guess it's a cheaper option and you get what you pay for. It is safe and clean and so long as you go in not expecting a typical experience for a $200/night room then you shouldn't be disappointed. For me it ruined the end of my vacation.

Only stayed one night at the end of our trip to Hawaii. Did not use any of the hotel amenities. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I thought it was unusual to have a kitchen sink, refrigerator, and sparsely stocked cabinets ( dishes, glasses, silverware, cups) but no microwave or stove. The concierge was helpful in giving information about a tour to the Polynesian Culture Center.

Based on the rating, I was expecting a better hotel. This is definitely far from a Hyatt or Marriot. Pros:1) Good price2) Decent location - 5 min away from the shopping center and 10 min walk to the beach3) Friendly staff at the front desk4) A/C worked wellCons:The lift was horribly slowAsked front desk to order a cab for me, an hour in advance. When i came down not only the cab wasn't there, nobody even called the cab. Same thing happened twice. Very disappointing8 ft deep tiny pool No restaurant or mini bar. had to walk several blocks to get breakfast.
user_name:
Felix G
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: One of the lifts was not working. I believe they are slowly updating them however it's quite an inconvenience.Wait times on them can be long. Luckily we were on the 3rd floor so not so bad for us. Although most times it arrived it was packed full of people and we all had to squeeze in. The room I felt was a bit dated. The hotel is in a good location close to shops. Parking was $35 a night a bit steep I felt. The hotel on Monday, Wednesday, Friday had a evening with free wine and beer and nibbles which was nice.
user_name:
Derek W
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: aircon not ducted kept turning on contrinually every half hour even when turned off.Myself and partner got very ill i believe from unclean aircon.When complained they agreed repalcaed 2 days later old aircon returned .Not 1 night out of 14 did we get a nights full sleep awefull.on arrival dispute on whether account had been paid i was about to walk out but alas they found it had been paid .They tried to tell us that we only would have paid 100 deposit .Staff at counter yiu feel sorry to interrupt they never smile or appear happy to serveno coffee shop availablemy wifes 22 visit to arae my 6th worse experience

We stopped at this hotel before flying home - the room was fine although a little odd to have kitchen area with no oven, hob, microwave or kettle. No breakfast served at the hotel at all. No mini bar. There are three lifts but only one working and it seemed very odd - going up it would stop on every floor no matter what and going down similar - us and others often waited 15 - 20 mins for the lift only to then spend another 5 squashed inside as it stopped on every floor - it may sound like a small thing but there were people running late for flights and trips because they had had to wait so long for the lift to arrive and then had to wait again because when it did arrive it was already full. There is only valet parking available at $35 a night - I really think the hotel should offer a cheaper self-park option because I know other hotels in Hawaii do. To get here from the airport will be expensive by taxi so consider using uber or I think the 19 bus from the airport stops reasonably close by. Friendly and helpful staff and good size room and the pool looked good (didn't get a chance to try it)

Stayed here for 8 nights while on holidays in hawaii.This hotel has alot of potential but is lacking facilities. The location is perfect, quick walk to Centre.The lifts where dreadful, i understand theyre renovating them but wow. Waiting 15min for lift is not cool.The pool was good but not open long enough currently 9am until sundown. 6am to 10pm is idle.Rooms where a good size, beds where very comfortable.Guest facilities and concierge where poor. Was annoying to organise anything through them. Good reception team and bell boys.

Right from the moment we arrived a the hotel the less than average service began. We walked past the staff member at the driveway lugging our suitcases up the steps only to find out later there is a ramp to the side of the hotel. There was a lengthy rushed intro to the hotel and then off to our city view room. The room itself whilst a little tired and old was spacious and clean. The air conditioner which was fitted into the window was so incredibly noisy we couldn't hear the TV over top of it. We checked with the front desk maintenance and they told us all of the rooms are like that. We were on the 15th floor but the incessant noise of sirens day and night kept both of us in and out of sleep. The hotel is a bit of a walk from the main strip and beach but nothing too onerous. I found that many tours didn't pick up from the Luana so we had to walk to the Waikiki Gateway - about 200m away around the corner. We tried to book some tours but after checking online with the same companies were able to find the same thing and significantly less costs. Generally the service was mediocre and staff didn't seem too concerned to assist or go the extra mile. The hotel is across the road from a deli where you can buy milk and water and close to the pink line trolley. If price is your decider then this hotel is OK but next time I'll shell out a little more - the sleep will be worth it.

We were in Honolulu for a conference, and chose this hotel for its location near the Hawaii Convention Center and reasonable price. The room was good, though a big aged. Had excellent small kitchen and it would be possible to eat all meals in the room (though this would mean missing some very nice restaurants). Our double bed was comfortable, but having only one lamp was a source of some discussion. WiFI was free, of course, and bathroom amenities were good. Staff were very good, helped us find good restaurants, served wine and cheese 3 times a week, and cheerfully extended our reservation. No restaurant in the hotel, but plenty within easy walking distance.

Our group of nine had four rooms which we booked directly with the hotel 7 months ahead for the night before and night after our NCL POA cruise. The rooms were reasonably priced and we honestly stayed in them both nights for less than 12 hours due to flights and excursions. With it being short overnight stays, the location and view of the ocean wasn't a big issue. Both nights we had trouble getting rooms with two queen beds we requested which made some sleeping arrangements a little uncomfortable (had to sleep in same bed with people they don't live with). For the most part the staff tried there best though some were more interested in problem solving than others. Jessica was great. They accommodated our need to store our luggage post cruise (10 am) and took it to one of the rooms when it was ready. We didn't get back to the rooms until 10:45 pm later that day so it was very helpful. Valet parking was $35 - a little high but the valets were fast, efficient and friendly. If you were staying more than two nights it could get costly. Uber from airport at 3:30 pm was $45. Cab from airport at 8 pm was $40 plus tip. Rooms were adequate for our short stay. Beds comfortable. Has some small maintenance issues with blinds. Rooms have a kitchenette but all were equipped differently and sparsely. Refrigerator was nice. Within walking distance to Waikiki beach, high end shopping and tons of restaurants. Thrifty car rental location within one block. Beach towels and chairs are available free of charge. ABC store right across the street. Gas station next door for soda, beer, snacks etc. hotel has no restaurant or breakfast. Elevators were a problem as there were long waits due to maintenance. Sometimes only one was working. Another issue was there was no lobby or mezzanine bathroom for use.You had to go through a convuluted path to get to a bathroom near the outdoor pool. We didn't use it but it was small! All in all, we'd book here again if we were using it for the same purpose. If you want a hotel with a great view of the ocean, there would be better choices.

My husband and I were so excited to be celebrating our honeymoon in Hawaii! We bundled our packages to get a cheaper flight and better hotel. I did research on the hotel beforehand and it looked to be pretty neat looking. We got a kitchenette with partial ocean view. From the pictures that we saw online it showed the partial ocean view to be more open and not dead center in city view. We were able to see a small little area of the ocean, very tiny part while having to go out on balcony. From the pictures it looks like we should be able to see the ocean from just opening up our blinds but that was not the case. The room was much much smaller than we had thought, and the kitchenette was equipped with very few items and mismatched sets, older looking. The toilet was extremely screeching when you flush it, and when the housekeeping was cleaning out tub next room over all the grime and nasty stuff came up through our tub! It was gross! But with us being on our honeymoon we just wanted to enjoy the excursions and tours and spend little time in room anyways. However that became a problem when a hotel with 3 elevators was only able to service one elevator per 14 floors!!! We had to wait there sometimes 20 minutes, which then made us almost running late for excursions! Not happy, but being on the 7th floor we just did the stairs up and down many many times because it seemed to be faster! They in no way offered us any compensation, and when we asked to check out later on the day we leaving, they said we couldn't do it, but then gave us an hour, which barely worked out due to our excursion. The service was not that friendly and the cleaning was not thorough at all! The great thing that we did love about this place was our Expedia guy Tyler! He helped us out the whole entire time and set up all our excursions, and took the time to show us where to go!! Thanks Tyler!

We stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and had a fantastic stay so we thought we would return and stay here again, Last time we rated this hotel 5 star. Sadly this time only 2, only because of the elevators, be prepared to wait 10-15 mins just to get into the lift. Such a pain when you are on the 16th floor. Could not fault the staff though, very friendly and apologetic about the elevator problems. Only 1 or 3 lifts were working during our stay

This hotel will definitely get 5 when renovations have finished. Was a nice stay for the night. Room was clean and spacious and location great. Parking valet only. We didn't have chance to try the facilities but they sounded great. Lovely check in staff - thank you!

An amazing stay, with an amazing room. 2 people very comfortably fit in this room. Great facilities, clean, wonderful staff, beautiful pool area. We had absolutely NO complaints about our accommodation. The staff were only to happy to help and the amenities were superb. Will go back again.

The employees were all very helpful and accommodating. Elevators were slow and one was down for maintenance. It's $35/day for "in and out privileges" parking. There's a lot about 2 minutes down the street that is $24 per 24/hours with no in and out privileges. Street parking is next to impossible. I say it was a little worn around the edges because there were little things that weren't quite right - some light fixtures in the common areas were broken. There was mold growing on the upper part of the bathroom sink - but it was only observable when sitting on the toilet - but that's something that housekeeping should have caught. It was about a 10 minute walk to the beach and we had a partial beach view from our room. It was decent hotel - I'm not sure we would pick it again - it would depend on price. The location is fine - just a few blocks from the main area of shopping in Waikiki.

While we are still here at the hotel we would like to give POSITIVE feedback on how AWESOME and FRIENDLY a few of your staff members have been since we have arrived. First of all to the valet : Jace, Jesse, Andrew and Kenzil. Second to the bellman: Ryan,also the 2 ladies at front desk tonight.Thank you all for making our stay here AWESOME. Again mahalo nui loa !!!!

Concierge Matt was absolutely amazing! All the front desk help has been great. The restaurant is being renovated. So no close breakfast. Rooms are very hot. It only has a small ac unit. The atmosphere is great. It's very clean. The pool is great!

This hotel is within walking distance of anything you could need for your trip: Waikiki beach, restaurants, food trucks, bank, CVS, convenience stores, touristy shops, car rental, and other hotels. Airport transportation takes you straight to the hotel and back. However, a lot of the big tours like the Polynesian Cultural Center do not do pick ups there. They do them at a hotel that is across the street from this one (within a 3 minute walk).The hotel itself has a laundromat (only works with quarters - they have a quarter exchange machine there that takes your dollar bills), bbqs, pool, movie rental, and agym. They also lend you beach towels for free.There's room service every morning. They replenish your coffee, soap, shampoo, and conditioner if needed. The room we booked had a waikiki beach view, which was nice to have, but being in the narrow balcony felt a bit weird. It also has a TV, Playstation (that you can use to play movies), a safe lock, fridge, coffee makers, and various utensils like plates, forks, spoons, mugs, etc.The only thing we didn't really like was that the room we booked did not have carpet. But that could be a personal preference. I do not know if their other rooms do have carpet or not.I would recommend this hotel as it is inexpensive than the other big named chains, but still has everything you need inside or nearby, and in a perfect touristy spot!

It is a good hotel. Located just 5 minutes from the beach. Kalukawa ave is where most of the shopping is done so you are right there. There's a gas station next door with wine, beer, soda and fried chicken around the clock. So, you won't starve. The only thing I found annoying are the elevators. There was a consistent issue with them. They have only 2 as they are upgrading their elevators and one is down for the upgrade. This hotel has 16 floors so it gets crowded especially during the tourist season. The people who work here are more than nice. Never a problem. The cleaning personnel are all good. Some will even wash your dishes. I thought that was awesome. There may be better hotels, but this one would suit me anytime. I was here from the middle of May to the middle of August so I got to see it a lot. The rooms are nice. They are fairly small. If you get a room, check the A/C. Some are very noisy but they are upgrading those too. My first room sounded like a train coming through all night. When I moved due to upgrading, my next room was extremely quiet. They aren't letting things go, they are upgrading. If it weren't for the elevators, I'd of given it a 5. That because one night I had to trudge up 15 floors on the fire escape to get to my room. This after working all day. Overall, I recommend it. The valets are first rate. Very nice and prompt. So, there you have it.

This is the 2nd time I have stayed here in the past few years. I spent a week on business in Honolulu last week. The price was very good when compared to other similar hotels in the same area. I booked directly with Aqua hotels website. I think this was or still is a vacation time share-partial ownership resort. The rooms are large and comfortable. I had a partial ocean view of Waikiki beach. It's a 10 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki shopping and restaurants. That's perfect for me as it's on the edge of the madness and traffic. Valet parking only at $35 per day and a $15 hospitality fee are added on to the daily rate. The staff was very friendly and helpful from check-in to check out. the A-C unit in my room was a bit loud and there was a high pitched whistling noise that I think was from hot water pipes vibrating in the wall of my bathroom. The elevators need upgrading and hopefully will be working well upon my next visit. Was it perfect? No. But for the price and location, I believe it is a very good place.

Since the hotel; is surrounded by the Fort DeRussy Park it offers a much better view of the area and feels a little less crowded than the other properties. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The had a happy hour for guests on M-W-F for guests with free beer, wine, snacks and entertainment (great ukulele and beautiful hula). They are in the process of upgrading the three elevators which caused some delays. Other general facilities are nice and well maintained.

We flew into Oahu for the night as a side trip from an adjacent island. We checked into this hotel and were very impressed! The decor is beautiful. Each room has a Duke Kahanamoku lamp and other Hawaiian decor which adds to the ambiance of your stay. I always like a room with a couch to sit on, too. Our room overlooked a large green park & ocean views in distance. They also served a complimentary happy hour with hula dancers and music, wine and cheese and beer, and nuts which was great! The hotel was also within close walking distance to the hub of downtown Waikiki. Tip: no complimentary breakfast served but Eggs n'Things is a short 1-2 block walk away.

Stayed at Luana many times and it is my home away from home. Staff is great and services are excellent. Staff definitely have the Aloha Spirit \m/. Close to the beach and all the wonderful shopping. One suggestion is sit on your balcony in the morning and listen to the wonderful sounds of birds singing. Just great.

We stayed on a budget and the Luana was perfect. While not on the beach, it was a doable walk to the beach each day. The hotel is very clean, the staff very helpful, the rooms with kitchenettes great, and shopping is close by. Pool is tiny but nice. Good choice on a budget.

We just moved from main land and stayed this hotel almost 2 months while we were finding our new home. Nice and clean room, free beer wine etc with entertainment 3 times a week, you would meet people from all over the world, good location, not on a very busy street but easy to get around. All staff are VERY VERY nice. Bellboys, house keeping ladies and front desk. Special thanks to Elton, Jessica, Ashley for making our stay fabulous. When we checked out and loaded car up, I even got a big hug from one of the bellboys, didn't get his name but felt so welcomed. Thank you everyone for making this hotel as our first home in Hawaii

We looked at this hotel from home thinking... This' gonna be great. You get the idea, that the rooms have space, and its a quiet place. Far from! There constant noice here. Hotel just beside a huge road. Playing music by the pool aaaaaall night. Plus... You have to pay 35 dollars pr day for parking. Just arrived from Maui yesterday. This is a nightmare. NEVER coming back!!!!!

This hotel is not in the centre of Waikiki but is an easy walk to either the beach or central Waikiki. The room itself was fine although the bathroom was a little on the small side. The disappointment was the service, when we reached our room we found that the sofa bed had not been made up, we called housekeeping and they arrived promptly but did not leave any pillows, we then had to call back as there were not enough towels in the room. We called housekeeping twice and left a message about no pillows and in the end we had to ring guest services and then someone turned up and almost threw them at us. The next day when the room was serviced they once again did not leave enough towels. The day before we left I asked the concierge to book us a flat rate taxi to the airport and he asked me what company should he use, I mentioned Charleys and he asked me if I knew their number, I told him not to worry and booked myself. On one of the days there was only one lift working and it took forever to get up and down. However, for the price and the position it was OK.

Good Beds, plenty of storage, kitchenette with sink and micro. Close to Hale Koa.Good Happy Hour a few days a week.Free dvd rental.Small pool and gym.Loud Air Conditioner.Not enough air conditioning in lobby area.Slow elevator.No restaurant, as advertised.

This is a great hotel. After a long trip from Australia I wasn't looking forward to the 3pm check in but after arriving at 8am the front desk staff made an early checkin available and we were resting in our room within 15 minutes of arrival. This hotel has a lovely feel to it and I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to both couples and families. Make sure you take advantage of the free coffee in the foyer and the wine and cheese reception that offers complimentary wine, beer and nibbles.

Luana waikiki was an excellent hotel within walking distance-about 2 blocks to Waikiki beach and the up scale shopping district. The staff, Eric and Elton, at the front desk very very courteous and efficient in answering our questions and making sure our stay was a pleasant experience. The room was well appointed and clean. We selected an upper floor room with partial ocean view, which was very quiet and with a nice view. The concierge was very helpful with directions.( estimate of distances tended to be a little off!) There is no restaurant on the premises- though there is a sign at the entrance about a breakfast place. Go across the street to the coffee kiosk for fruits, muffins, boiled eggs and coffee!

The hotel is very well located. To the beach 7 minutes. Moreover, the road passes through two beautiful Parks. And You will immediately find yourself on the widest part of Waikiki beach where no crowding.It's very important!!! Otherwise, you will swim together with five people on one square metre of the ocean. Even entering the beach from a five star hotel.I lived on the 9th floor in a Studio room with a kitchenette and partial ocean views. The room is very clean. The view is gorgeous. The kitchen has everything you need. The bed is very comfortable. The view not only from the balcony but even from the dinner table!The hotel has an excellent atmosphere. The staff is Very friendly and helpful. They are ready to help you day and night time on all issues. Especially Elton and Ashley. I thank them very much!!! The hotel has entertainment nights with local music, wine and snacks.I was very happy to spend time in this hotel. I can safely recommend it to all travelers, alone, family, group of friends, rich and not so rich tourists.

Stayed in this hotel for just over a week for business and a bit of leisure. Wonderful service and the rooms are clean and well kept. The hotel provides kettles and even a microwave if you ask nicely for it. The location of the hotel is just in front of the Fort DeRussy Park and its just a short walk down to the beach and the shopping belt of Wakiki - everything you need or want is within walking distance.The staff are nice and helpful, and the coffee is good. What else can you ask for? :)Loved my stay at the hotel and would defintely come back again. One thing though - the lifts are a little slow at times, but otherwise its a wonderful hotel for both business or leisure.

Hotel was very comfortable, staff were very friendly, especially the bellboys! Free wine and cheese some days, free bike hire, good location. I borrowed the free bicycle to cycle to Diamond Head for a hike, one of the best things I did that week! The aircon was quite old in my room but it worked so no complaints there. Overall, I had a good stay for one week.

We chose a Studio Kitchenette with a partial ocean view and we were very happy with our choice. The unit had everything we needed and we loved the view over the park to the sea from either inside the room or from the small balcony. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Even though we arrived before our check-in time, they very kindly let us into our room and, as we had just arrived after a long flight this was very much appreciated. The staff were very helpful at all times. We enjoyed the wine and cheese night but unfortunately we could only attend one of them. The free shuttle to the Ala Moana Mall is not quick as it picks up from other Resorts. One driver mentioned this but another one didn't. It would be helpful to know this beforehand as some may prefer to walk as it's not that far. Our Air conditioning unit was very noisy so we switched it off at night. There are lots of Restaurants nearby and a good General store (Whalers) just across the road.

The hotel is a bit dated. The bathroom felt cramped and old was our biggest gripe. The room was very clean but dated and patio furniture was falling apart. The beds we had however, were fabulous. Plus it was in walking distance to Waikki and all that so convienece was nice. Staff was very friendly. Vallet parking at 35 a night fyi

I really enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are probably a bit dated but I enjoyed their quirkiness & they were very clean & tidy. I had a studio which was well stocked & which would have allowed me to be completely self sufficient with cooking etc should I have chosen to do so.The balcony did have a view of the beach albeit a distant one.The best part was the exceptionally friendly staff- couldn't fault one of them

Attentive staff, very polite house keeping where nothing was a problem. Would stay again, only negative comment is the noisy air conditioning unit. Close to all shops. About a 20 minute walk to the popular Ala Moana centre.

Arriving the day before our cruise and staying two nights after the cruise we enjoyed our stay at Luana Waikiki. Our party consisted of 7 adults and 6 children (5 rooms). Our request to be on the same floor worked out great. The hotel is centrally located to everything, even a rental car company which we took advantage of to travel one day to Humanunma Bay. Everyone from the moment we checked in until we checked out were so helpful and happy. The hotel is in the process of renovating, but this did not really affect us. One of the three elevators was being repaired but again, the other two were working and really didn't bother us. There is coffee/tea available in the lobby as well as ice water with limes and another with oranges constantly being replenished throughout the day. We asked the concierge for a recommendation for breakfast. He gave us several choices, one being "Eggs N' Things". Needless to say we ate breakfast there every morning. Also, we had heard about the luau at Paradise Cove and asked the concierge where we could get tickets....they have them right there. A motor coach bus picks you up around the corner from the hotel....how great that was !!! We walked to dinner every night. There are your restaurant chains and local eateries. The beach was two blocks away with surfing/snorkeling if you wanted. This was a great hotel with great people and price was right.

We had a very pleasant room, clean, comfortable, with a nice view of downtown. We could walk from it to a shopping area with a fantastic combination of shops, restaurants and it was even fun to see all the tourists walking along the avenue. There was some renovation going on at the hotel, so sometimes we had to wait a bit for an elevator, but that's a minor complaint. The staff was pleasant, helpful, and they had an early evening reception for guests with music and hors d'oeuvres. We used it as our base to do things like to climb Diamond Head - caught a taxi went~!

There’s a lot to love about Luana. It’s very reasonably priced for Waikiki, has some fantastic amenities including a decent pool and gym, and offers numerous free extras including yoga classes, speedy free wifi, beach towels and chairs, coffee & tea reception, wine & cheese evenings, and more.Our studio room was lovely, with a well-equipped kitchenette and a lanai with amazing partial views of the Pacific and Diamond Head. It’s a little rough around the edges; the shower was fairly ineffective, housekeeping was inconsistent (one day removing every single towel from the room), and the door to our lanai didn’t close all that well, allowing in a surprising amount of noise even on the 15th floor. The parking situation is annoying but pretty standard for Waikiki; it’s valet only at the hotel at $35 a day (plus tips), but we did find a large parking lot a 15-minute walk away at the marina on Holomoana St for only $1 per hour. Overall for this price and within walking distance from Waikiki Beach, we were very, very happy with Luana.So far, so 4*, and it would have remained as such were it not for the customer service we received one evening. Having picked up an injury during a half marathon earlier in the day which left me largely unable to walk, I had to cancel our dinner plans for the evening, so we tried to rescue the evening and have a nice night in instead with some takeout, alcohol, and a movie from the lobby’s DVD rental machine for our in-room PS3. The first problem came when we tried to turn the PS3 on, only to find that the HDMI cable was completely and very obviously chewed up. My wife took the console down to the lobby to try and get a new one, and we were told that someone would be right up. Having heard nothing in 45 minutes, she then phoned the lobby and was told that someone was on their way right now. Another 40 long, infuriating minutes later the maintenance guy actually turned up, and he had absolutely no idea what he was there for. To be fair to him he brought a new cable within 5 minutes, and we finally settled down and popped the disc in. Only to see a message on-screen stating that the disc couldn’t be viewed because the console’s encryption key was out of date and needed updating – which we couldn’t do, because the hotel have prevented the consoles going online – leaving the movie literally unwatchable and the entire evening completely wasted. This incident completely ruined an already bad day and really shouldn’t have happened – why bother having this technology in the rooms if no-one’s ever going to check that they work, and why say that someone’s on their way up to the room when they’re obviously not?Honestly I still feel uncomfortable about giving Luana just 3*; there was a lot about it I absolutely loved. But the reality is that this is one of the only times I’ve ever received bad service from an American hotel, and even as a fairly easy going traveller who will happily put up with a lot without ever complaining, that whole evening of poor service and outright lying is enough to ensure that I would never stay there again. However if all you’re looking for is a relatively cheap base hotel then you could do a lot worse than Luana.

The Luana Waikiki is fine, but it's not really up to its 4 star rating. It's just a bit tired. While we were staying one of the lifts was being renovated. Despite only staying on the third floor (which is actually the 5th because of the lobby and mezzanine) the lifts took at least ten minutes to arrive every time. Our room (a suite with kitchen) was a very good size. The fold out sofa bed worked well for our six year old and it was great having our own kitchen facilitates including giant fridge. The balcony is small but the view from it over the park is lovely. The aircon is old and very loud. Decor is also a tad dated. But everything is nice and clean and the cleaners are excellent. Towels are restocked regularly as are shower products (and coffee and sugar) despite is buying our own. The staff are friendly and helpful (although their tour advice regarding pearl harbour was woefully inaccurate and I couldn't help feeling that the yarn about a two hour wait for tickets was a sales pitch for their own tours - we had no queue at all when we went.).The fitness room is a good size, the pool is on the small size and when we arrived one of the wall lights was floating precariously in the pool. This didn't invite us to try the pool, to be honest you don't need it with the beach just a short stroll across the park. The hotel may not be shiny and new, but it's clean, reasonably priced and super close to the beach.

We stayed for 13 nights. Great location , we were able to walk everywhere. Hotel supplies beach chairs to take to the beach. Wine and Cheese nights three times a week. There was free tea and coffee in lobby every morning and iced water provided all day. Complimentary apples were available every day. We had excellent wi fi in our rooms. All together a very nice place to stay.

This was a return visit for us, last visit being October 2014. I do not understand how this hotel gets ranked at number 13....it should be much higher. Yes it does have minor faults and I am sure I could find faults in any other hotel, however that will not happen as we would not stay anywhere else when visiting Waikiki. Why wouldn't we stay anywhere else? - because of the staff. Front desk staff, Elton, Eric, Ebony, Jessica to name a few are so polite, obliging and helpful. Overnight on reception was Hui - a lady who is so nice and the first face I saw every morning with a welcome.The "bell boys" are very hard working and very helpful, especially Ryan who remembered us from our last visit. He is the epitome of great customer service, always welcoming with a smile and eager to please.This hotel is clean, comfortable and homely and very well placed on Kalakaua Avenue - easy walk to beach, shopping and dining. It is not a resort so don't book here if that is what you want to waste your money on. If you want a hotel that is clean, comfortable, welcoming and has the best customer service, then book here. This hotel does not have all the bling of resorts but it does have a Hui and especially it has a Ryan. 5 star in my book.Thanks for a wonderful stay once again and we will return.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 5 nights. The hotel is conveniently located on the Main Street in Waikiki within walking distance of the beach, shops and restaurants. Our room had a mini fridge & lots of counter space to prepare meals. The room was spacious with ample drawers and comfortable beds. The front desk staff were extremely helpful with directions & local activities.

We were looking for reasonable rooms for ouselves and my parents. At first, we only booked 1 room with 2 double beds for all 4 of us. As the stay got closer, we realized we would want more room. The second room we got was even better than the first. It had a king size bed, sitting area, and full kitchen.The location of the hotel was good for us. We walked to a variety of restaurants for various meals, but weren't in the large crowds closer to Waikiki Beach. When we wanted to drive, the mandatory valet service was quick to retrieve our car (an added expense to the room).

I stayed here over the weekend with a few friends from out of town. I am extremely pleased with the decision. Staff was superb and very friendly and accomodating. Sunny the Manager was very pleasant to work with prior to my arrival. He ensured all was taken care of and had a smooth arrival and experience. Elton, Ebony and Jessica at then Front Desk was also superb - talk about 5 star service WOW. I was even more impressed during the Wine Tasting. Ebony and Jessica hosted that too. What a treat.Room was spacious, clean and always restoked upon service. Pool area was very relaxing as well.Walking distance to reastauarnts and a 24hr convenience store next door.The only negative was the elevator wait times. However, they are u dergoing a modernization project which should resolve this soon.Both Valet Gentleman were also great. Quick, efficient and friendly.Special mahalo to the bellman James and Kenzo who helped as we checked in and out with cart loads of luggage and fragile cargo.We are already planning our return stay. Thank You Luana Waikiki Team.

I am a very frequent traveller to Hawaii both with work and leisure. It seems every time I go to Honolulu I stay at a different location, not having found a place for me that I felt at home whilst on holidays. Luana is my place in Hawaii now.Location was perfect. It is not in the busy hustle and bustle of Waikiki, however it is still incredibly close, situated right beside Fort Derussy Park. It takes just 5 minutes to walk to the beach, or 15 minutes to be on the famous Waikiki Beach. The hotel lobby is beautiful, and staff give a friendly holiday atmosphere. The managers offer free drinks and canapes to guests 3 times a week, a nice touch to show they are passionate hosts. I have stayed in 2 rooms now, both had full kitchen facilities, which was great to be able to prepare food and not have to eat every meal out. Beds were comfortable, and the sofa bed was tested for a few nights and gave a great nights sleep. Balconies are quite small though, however I didn't spend much time out here other than having a look at the weather.Pool area was immaculate, fresh towels and lounge chairs always on offer. Gym was kept very clean, and we used the BBQ area 3 times during our week stay. BBQ area was clean, and gave a great view over the park for enjoying your meal.

We had a comfy stay in this very clean and pleasant hotel, with two queen beds, and great linen. We are local and often looking for a place on our way in or out of town or when are yacht is indisposed. This was our first time here, but earned a place as our new go to spot. Thanks for the reasonable prices, boutique vibe, friendly staff and Aloha! Kama'aina friendly, too!

This hotel met our needs very well. It is not 5 star, elaborate or grand but we were very content there. The location was great for us also. It was a nice walk over to Hilton Hawaiian Village for Lapperts ice cream. Also it was close enough to do the nice long walk along the Waikiki beach sidewalk. It was certainly walking distance to the Army Museum and restaurants. I went alone in the dark by myself and felt very safe in the main touristy area.The tiled floors were clean. We did not need the kitchenette but it was complete with  utensils. The 2 beds were queen, not double like Hilton Hawaiian village. The city view was fine. I was surprised to hear birds in the big city. The air-conditioner was Noisy & cycled on & off throughout the night but it worked. The next night, I took it of the energy saver mode & there wasn't a noise problem. The business center was not working correctly so the front desk Clerk cheerfully printed our boarding passes for us. There were three bikes available and they were already checked out when I wanted to get one. They are in the process of getting more bikes licensed.Yes, I should have stayed longer! I would return again in a heartbeat!

waikiki is not my cuppa tea, too expensive, too many tourists, however, the staff was super friendly and helpful and worked hard to make our visit great. the room has kind of a kitchen but ultimately on a small bar fridge, seems like they would have a microwave. got a lot of traffic noise but not sure you can escape that. pool was nice, nice pool chairs.

After a long flight and finally getting to the hotel after riding a shuttle from the airport we were greeted at the hotel by a great front desk person who helped us. He uprated us to a sweet which was really nice and made our stay a lot nicer. He helped us in every way possible and even things I didn't think of. Great staff and nice place to stay. Ten minute walk to the beach. I like the place and I can see Diamond Head and the beach from my room.

Well the hotel was fine, the staff is friendly, food is average, rooms are a little outdated and the prices are not too high. If you're looking for an average hotel with an average price that's where you should go. It's a 10 minute walk to the beach so that's convenient too. I didn't have the best experience with the activity desk there though. I wanted to find something to do in Hawaii so I went to the Local Expert desk to get a tour and the concierge seemed like he doesn't care about me and wasn't very competent about the tours.He didn't give me any information about the pick up so I had to go to another concierge and find out when and where is the pickup.I didn't like the tour but I'm sure that if I had a better and more competent concierge then I wouldn't have wasted my time taking that tour and went some place better.

The rooms were nice, the view was upgraded to partial ocean, the service was impeccable and the price was comparatively low. My wife slipped on the tile floor and was given immediate care by the manager who offered to call paramedics and filed a report of the accident (thankfully nothing serious). This place is well worth it!

We had the only two bedroom, two bath unit in the building. While it was extremely spacious, it needs significant updating, a good cleaning, and kitchen supplies. Most of the furniture was tired and old, with some unappealing stains of dubious origin. The microwave was full of crumbs (not ours) and the master bathroom was not well cleaned before our arrival. The unit has a stunningly large lanai, which unfortunately was littered with beer bottle caps and cigarette butts, again, not ours. It clearly was not swept in a very long time. The kitchen was very poorly stocked, without a single knife other than a butter knife and a random assortment of other utensils As mentioned by others, the air conditioners are loud . The AC in the second bedroom sounding like a jet engine every time it went on. Lastly, I found the front desk attendants less charming than other reviewers. There was one gentleman there with whom we had the most contact, who was indifferent at best. Frequently, he acted like he was doing us a favor, when doing things he was supposed to do, like giving us towels. While the Luana is a good value, I am not sure I would stay here again.

Thank you Jessica and the front desk staff for making our stay more than expected! We were welcomed at Launa prior to taking a Hawaiian cruise.Launa, situated in Waikiki is the perfect spot - close to shopping, the beach and a short ride to the pier. The staff were amazing, the room, bathroom (and most important the linens) were very clean. The kitchen cabinets could use a refresh but otherwise very satisfactory. We would definitely stay again and recommend to those needing a convenient, clean place to call "home away from home".Thank you Launa!

Firstly, we want to thank Alton and compliment Luana for checking us early into our room after we arrived off the red-eye from Auckland. It was such a relief, after a short sleep on a long flight. We had a studio apartment on a city-view, high floor for two nights before joining a cruise.
