It was very good in all respects, apart from one aspect - the old-fashioned air-conditioner was far too noisy for modern days. (it was one of those units inside the room). We went to the tManager's reception 5-6pm for ordinary wine and local entertainment - one ukelele and a hula dancer.The kitchenette set up was not put to any real test as we ate salads, cooked meats, fruit and breakfast foods from the ABC store right across the street (slimming down for a week of cruise-ship food!) It worked well for what we demanded of it.Luana has a novel and easy-to-use DVD loan system. There's a self-serve cabinet on the mezzanine floor which dispenses disks using the guest card. Unusually for us, we watched and enjoyed two recent-release movies (Trump was hogging the TV news).Easy walk along the main drag to the hot-spots of Waikiki. Free shuttle to Ala Moana (avoid the mall unless you're desperate).Overall, quite comfortable and extremely good value for its location.

We stayed with another couple for 3 nights. Very clean , quiet and spotless. Our city view room was on 7th floor and even though we were first room next to the lift, still very quiet. We actually had view of mountains. There is a gas station next door, which is handy if you had a car . Each time you came down to the lobby, staff were cleaning. We had a room with City View .They had a "business centre..basically a desk with 2 computers" if you wanted to check your emails or print anything. Plus they didn't charge extra for printing. Friendly staff and free wine & cheese night are a plus. Only a short walk 10-15 mins to Waikiki and there was an ABC Shop across the road from the hotel. Ala Moana Centre short cab ride away, although you could have walked if you wanted . Hotel has 3 lifts, but only 2 were working as they are currently upgrading the lifts. Allow yourself extra time if you are going to the cheese & wine nights as lifts are slow and arrive early as not much seating. An issue we had was that we got charged the hospitality fee twice, hotel did apologise and refunded it promptly after we following up .

Luana is a very short walk away from the shopping district and Waikiki beach, granting easy access to all those amenities without being affected by the noise or crowds during your stay. Upon entrance, we were greeted by extremely friendly staff. In our luck, the concierge upgraded our suite to an ocean-view room free of charge! Throughout the stay, the staff were very resourceful with any questions or concerns we had with the hotel or with our vacation in Oahu. Although their restaurant is currently under renovation, they provided coffee and tea every morning and had snacks at the front desk. Included in the $15 service fee were a wide variety of amenities, such as wine and cheese reception, morning yoga, offers, and more. There are also many services available at the hotel, such as ice, BBQ, pool, gym, beach towels, and bikes, just to name a few. During our stay, we rented a car which was valeted by Luana every night for a charge of $35 per night. Kindly enough, they allowed us to park our car in their lot free of charge for the day even after we had checked out!

Overall an amazing hotel to stay at. From the wine and cheese nights, to free movie rentals, to being 5 minutes away from the beach. The reason it lost a star though is because how much parking there is. They charge a $35 overnight fee, as well as daily fees depending how long your car is parked there. In 4 days I spent an extra $200 on parking which is a bit ridiculous. If you don't have a car a perfect 5 out of 5.

Luana hotel is nice and clean. It's located in a very convience area. It's about 3-5 minutes walk to the beach front. Besides that, it's close by major hotel chain, shopping strip, restaurants etc. On top of these, the staff is very friendly, accommodating and helpful. Allan and Alton, they both super nice. I remembered I forgot my hat at the table in the front lobby. After we came back, I made a call and got Allan. He said they found it but I failed to come down to pick it up. The next morning, I came to the front desk to return the fish that we babysat the night before, Alton asked if I got my hat yet. Just little thing like this made me think they care of their own customers. Superb. In addition, my sister, coincidently will stay here for her honeymoon this June. I mentioned that to Allan and he made a note of it. Although, I don't know what the hotel management can do in the busiest season but his hospitality counted. We also switched room and everything was done in the excellent manner (the staff brought our luggages down, moved them to new room and called us to inform it was done and our new room number) while we were out and about. we were very happy while we stayed at Luana. I have been telling my family members about this place. If God will, we will return and would stay at Luana again.

The Luana is in just the right location-short walk to the beach & shopping strip-excellent pool-love all the special touches-free newspaper & especially the "happy hour" three days a week. At these, free drinks & snacks meant guests met & freely mingled, adding to the friendly atmosphere & wonderful memories of Hawaii. As Australians we tend to drink tea -so I asked for a kettle & promptly received one. The only thing that could make it even better, is for a toaster & bowls to be provided, as Australians, culturally love to have a light breakfast before leaving to go touring.A microwave in the kitchenette would make it exceptional.Loved the Luana & would be ecstatic to be able to return

Came to Honolulu to celebrate a family member's birthday. Upgraded to a beautiful suite with views of the beautiful beach. Staff were so helpful at the desk and the lovely Brian on the bags. Could not ask for a better place to stay after a week of cruising. Spot less, lovely decor - very Polynesian, feels like a family run place.Highly recommended!

I read reviews for like 10 hotels before I chose the Luana, I'm so glad I picked this one. The room was nice and clean, the bed was very comfy. I wasn't sure about a room with a "city view", I was on the fourth floor and the view was actually pretty nice, you could see the mountains, there was an amazing breeze and people watching from my perch was very entertaining. This hotel is on a quieter end of Waikiki which I liked a lot, but a 5 minute walk and you were in the middle of everything. I saw a few of the hotels I had looked at prior to booking at the Lauana and I as again very happy with my choice.The staff at the Lauana were all pleasant and helpful but I really have to give it to Allen. I had a bit of a hiccup on my trip and in talking to him he showed a level of concern that to me was very thoughtful, I felt he did actually care that I was alright. He also understood my fear of not waking up in the morning to catch my flight, not only did he provide a wake up call for me, he also made sure someone called my cell to be sure I was up. Allen-thanks so much, I appreciate what you did (=The only negative I have is I wish you had a bar!! Or offer some type of wine or cocktail after hours. My first night there I was jetlagged and was up from midnight till about 430am, a glass of wine would have put me right to sleep. I'll remember to come prepared next time I stay there. For all those folks that complain about the elevator-take a deep breath, look out the window, give a hug or a smooch to whoever you came with and relax into island time!

Very friendly and helpful staff and nice rooms. We booked the first two nights and then extended our stay by four. Very happy with the accommodation and I recommend it highly. Also very good location in Honolulu.

Can't give a 5 star review due to the lifts being so so so slow. At one stage they only had one working. Everytime we went in them we felt funny afterwards like a bit sea sick, I thought it was just me as I get motion sick but my husband, sister in law and her family all got the same feeling (they normally dont). I thought maybe it was the lifts in Hawaii but no other ones gave us that feeling. Might be the slow speed and the sudden stops they do. The wine and cheese night was very good, we all enjoyed that. The room was alright. The lamps and little pineapple details are good. Good distance away from the busy part of Waikiki so location was fantastic. Most staff where really friendly and helpful, just had one grumpy man who we dealt with getting our car for a few days. The car parking is super expensive. Nice cookies when we left which was a great touch. Overall pretty good experience apart from the lifts.

First and foremost this hotel is in a great location of you want to be in the center of Waikiki. The rooms were very nice for the price however I thought the service was hit and miss. The valet service was excellent! Be prepared to pay $35 a night for your car. The front desk wasn't the most helpful or friendly. Because of my review of reviews on this hotel I asked for a room with a view but in a quiet location. They put me in a very noisy room. Just remember that there are 3 sides of this hotel that all face a very very very noisy street. We were on the 8th floor and it was still very noisy. The elevators however were quite the issue. Sometimes we would have to wait 10 min or more for an elevator. Of the 3 elevators, only 2 worked and those two are heavily used by their staff. Their pricing was very good and if noise doesn't bother you this could be the right place.

Hotel well located for pubic transport, short distance to shopping and eating in both directions, spacious one bedroom apartment with adequate appliances and utensils.Staff was very helpful when called upon.View of the park and sea from the balcony was exceptional, with no adjacent high rise buildings blocking the views, compared with previous accommodations from earlier trips to Waikiki. Lovely night view of Saratoga Rd and Kalalaua Ave from the balcony

If you are looking for quality, cleanliness, location, and value in Waikiki, then this is a great place.Short walk to beach, Waikiki shopping, restaurants.Very nice pool and deck.Rooms are modern, clean and cheery.Best to upgrade to ocean view as it is a good scene across Fort deRussey park.Very pleased with all aspects of stay. AAA rate was very good. Kitchenette serves well. Markets across street.

We had 10 nights here. Although our apartment was a bit dated, compared to some of the newer modern larger chains this hotel had atmosphere. it was well equipped.we had two queen size beds which where very comfortable, China, cutlery and a microwave which also had an oven. We were mostly able to prepare our meals and eat in our room There is a small balcony ours overlooked the road, but we did have views through a few high rises to the sea, we also had the sunset which was nice. And we had views across to the mountains, so really the best of both worlds.We found the air conditioning to be noisy, and left it off for a few nights but faced with the heat and noise from traffic especially sirens. We put it turned back on and had better nights sleep.The staff were lovely, thankyou Jessica for being so helpful and lovely all at the same time.The position was excellent we were able to walk no problem but also used the trolley buses.

As other reviewers have said, this hotel is located in a great spot, the quiet end of Waikiki a few minutes away from some of the best beaches. From the moment you drive up, the service is great, especially considering that this is a budget hotel. Cars are parked by valet, there's fruited water in the lobby, free newspapers, free DVDs, very helpful desk agents. There's a rather amazing free guest reception Friday nights, with wine and an assortment of pupus. When you check out, they give you free cookies. The rooms are squeaky clean, large enough, have balconies and nice amenities. The decor was a little on the cold, clinical side for me with the tile floors and spare approach, but most would probably not mind it. Why only three starts, then? Because the bottom line in any hotel experience is how well did you sleep, and in our case, the answer at the Luana was hardly at all. First of all, the pillows were hard as rocks. I was shocked, actually, that they weren't even medium firmness. No, they were more like what the ancient Egyptians must have used on their stone beds. Then there was the fact that the door to the room didn't fit the frame well, so that huge amounts of light streamed in from the hallway all night. I tried stuffing rolled towels in the gap between the floor and the door, but there were gaps on top and the sides so it didn't work. The poor doorframe fit also meant we could hear guests in the hallway as if they were in our room. Also, an alarm went off at 4:45 and we thought it was in our room, but it wasn't, meaning we could hear through the walls.I wouldn't stay here again, and that's sad because so much was so right here, but again, if it doesn't work for sleeping, it's not a good bet.

After a harrowing experience at a neighboring hotel we had originally booked, the Luana Waikiki came to our rescue! I frantically searched the internet for another hotel to book last minute in Waikiki and stumbled upon the Luana Waikiki. I called the Luana and spoke to Allan at the front desk and explained our situation, He was able to secure us a room with a kitchenette for a great rate for the six nights we were to be in Honolulu. Upon arriving at the hotel, Allan re-checked the rates and was able to get us an even better rate than he originally quoted. Allan must have felt sorry for us for the rotten experience we had just been through, because he made sure our room was located on the 15th floor with a fantastic view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Our room also overlooked a beautiful park. Thanks Allan - you really saved the day for us!The location of this hotel was great as it was close to everything - beach, shopping, food. All areas were clean and inviting. The staff was friendly and accommodating - from the concierge, who booked our tickets at the Polynesian Cultural Centre, to the valet's who parked our car. Another perk is that this hotel is very close to where you can view the firework show offered every Friday over Waikiki Beach. It was a 10 minute walk to the beach from the Luana for optimal viewing. However, if you have a room on the west side of the Luana you could probably witness the fireworks from your balcony.There is a $35/day parking fee which is a little on the high end but well worth it. Most reputable hotels here charge a fee for parking - it is just something you have to expect in Waikiki. If you cheap out to avoid this, you will end up with an experience like we initially did. My advice if travelling to Honolulu is to do your research or, better yet, just book at the Luana Waikiki for a guaranteed great vacation!

We visited Waikiki for our 4th time and always stay at a different hotel...however, after staying at Luana, I'm sure we will return to the same hotel next time! This hotel is at the quieter end of Waikiki and perfectly placed for easy access to the Fort DeRussey beach which is much less crowded than the main section of Waikiki beach (a mere 7 minute walk). There is an ABC store just across the road and Hard Rock Cafe about 5 minutes away, with the main hub of the shops/restaurants of Lewers St just a couple of minutes further. A great location for a very nice hotel. The check-in staff were prompt and friendly. Whenever we had a question or required anything, they were very quick to respond and happy to help. The decor is traditional Hawaiian and in good condition. Coffee and bathroom amenities were well provided and replenished. The Manager's wine and cheese reception is a lovely idea and a good way to mingle with other guests. I had every intention to make it to a free yoga class, but at 7.45am, it just didn't happen! Our bed was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in while on holiday, which was a bonus. The amenity fee is well worth it and we watched quite a few DVDs during our stay. Waikiki is an amazing place to visit and I would highly recommend this hotel. Quite impressed all round!

We stayed here for 2 nights pre cruise. The location is good. Close to restaurants and all shopping and not far from the beach.The staff are fabulous and helpful. The rooms are great for the price. Bathrooms are looking a little tired but functionable if on the small side. The air conditioning however is where this falls down. Although it works and does the job it is really noisy and makes it hard to sleep. Constantly thought we were having a down pour of rain....... Wrong it was the air con.Little cafe was also closed for renovation tea and coffee was available early in the morning in reception to compensate.

Excellent stay at the Luana, the staff were very professional. Will return again in the future. After reading all the reviews, this was a great choice forme and my husband. Location was perfect, close the everything.

Our first stay at Luana Waikiki Hotel was in 2014, after that we've never booked at another hotel in Waikiki, been there four times since and always recommend them first to our family and friends. The location is perfect, close to beach, restaurants, convenience stores, and so many shops. They valet your car so you don't need to worry about finding parking, the valets are super friendly; much "Aloha"; everyone along the way to the front desk are super friendly, greets you with a smile and Aloha. The front desk are very friendly and prompt. The rooms are BEAUTIFUL and so comfy, every view is beautiful and relaxing. The pool and gym are clean, good gym equipment, pool big even with several families there. Housekeeping is great! They're prompt and always smiling. Always came back to the room as if we just arrived. Nothing bad to say because everything was PERFECT! Especially for the price

After reading some of the reviews, one in particular, written by a very unsatisfied man, we were regretting our 4 day reservation. We were so happy we followed through and stayed after all. The location was great for us. We began and ended each day by sitting on the balcony enjoying the ocean view and watching the hustle and bustle of the city. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the work out facility was too. Our room was clean, comfortable and our pleasant cleaning lady did a very nice job everyday of tidying our room. All of the staff from check in to check out were always very pleasant and very helpful. I would definitely recommend and will again stay myself on future visits.

2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed comfortably in 1 room with hair dryer, small fridge and dishes and utensils, access to BBQ , outside pool, Complimentary movie access. Beach chairs and towels available at desk. Very helpful concierge. Complimentary cheese and wine twice during the week- in mezzanine open area to meet and visit. Private cards room. I understand we could have asked for a microwave but we didn't. 10 minutes from ocean beach through quiet park. Close to restaurants , shopping convenience store. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

This hotel was beautiful! We loved out room and balcony and it had A/C! Our room overlooked a small park across the street and even though it was not one of the more pricey rooms it was still fabulous. The lobby and amenities (pool etc.) were kept very clean and the staff are friendly and can recommend breakfast and food places in the area, as well as help you with the location of bus stops if needed. It was always nice to come back to the hotel after a long day of exploring!

This was our 1st stay on the Hawaiian islands so we were thrilled at the convenient location of this O'ahu hotel. The reception staff couldn't have been nicer. Our friends booked this hotel in January through Costco, requesting adjoining rooms. But, when we checked in, the reception staffer, Mike, told us they never look at these written requests, so we couldn't be accommodated and was placing us on separate floors. But, Mike finally gave us 2 rooms on the 3rd floor, with a wall separating us! We overlooked the air conditioning units below but could see the ocean from our balcony. However, I was very surprised that the following basic features were missing: no in hotel restaurant or bar, no staff to help with luggage, no microwave oven, no hooks on the back of the bathroom door to hang wet towels, no safety grab bars in the shower, housekeeping didn't replace the plastic cups in the bathroom, nor wash the barware or tabletops, and no plastic liner in the ice bucket. The room did provide cutlery/plates, a refrigerator and safe for valuables. The pluses were a wine and cheese reception on Mon/Wed/Fri. Between 5-6p, which was part of the mandatory $15/day/room amenities fee, which also covered free trolley service around Waikiki. One major convenience was meeting Elton, a reception desk staffer, who showed us how to access our boarding passes for the next day, and ended up printing them for us. Elton, and Mike, should both be recognized for their professionalism and friendly manner. After partaking of the island meals, we did enjoy dipping in the outdoor pool and using the scale in the gym! If the aforementioned items are added for future guests convenience, then I would recommend this hotel, for its ideal location and how helpful the staff were!

Luana Waikiki delivered quality and peace of mind. Excellent location, with a short walk to the beach, shopping, delicious food and morning yoga. The staff were polite, helpful and excited to have us as guests. The hotel was clean with decent decor, comfortable bedding and in a safe location. We rented a car, but only used it one day for Pearl Harbor. Luana Waikiki's nightly parking fee wasn't worth the rental - I recommend doing a short rental, if possible. We're going back with our children this summer and will be sure to book with Luana Waikiki!

We had a one bedroom apartment which was great, fully equipped kitchen if you want to cook. View of the ocean with great view of Friday night fireworks. 10 min walk either way to Ala Moana shops & Waikiki beach. Great park at back of hotel. Staff great.

The Luana Hotel has been our favorite hotel for the past 3 yrs. It's located right on kalakaua, and all the stuff you need is just across the street or a block away. They have a 24hr Longs Drugs nearby which was a lifesaver! The hotel has all the stuff you ever want in a room, such as free wifi, kitchenette, hide-a-bed etc.You can check out beach chairs, towels, and even boogy boards at the front desk. If you have a car, you can go anywhere on the island. Just make sure you get it back by 10pm. The rooms are nice and are kept very well. Some rooms have a kitchenette with refrigerators and microwaves. So it's nice if you're on an extended stay, you can cook or heat stuff. They have cups and plates and cups in the cupboards.Kids can check out Moo moo and Lu Lu, the resident guppies and take them to you room. They have toys you can borrow and of course a nice warm outdoor pool with outdoor Bbq grill. I haven't tried it yet, but available. They have a gym also.The hotel has daily activities you can participate such as morning yoga or wine tasting on the mezzanine floor. This hotel has something for everyone. Highly recommended!

We enjoyed our stay at the Luana Waikiki. First of all, the staff are all super friendly. EVERY STAFF MEMBER greeted us whith a smile and every worker spoke to us either in hallway, elevator or anywhere on campus. I can not say enough about JESSICA, she was super helpful with many recommendations to make our stay the best it could be. She is a super star! We had a partial ocen view room with kitchenette and 2 queens. Comfortable room, loved the decor. MICHAEL and JACE also did a great job with check in and helpful with questions about the area attractions and transportation options. Location is good, short walk to the beach, shopping and don't miss the Friday night fireworks..a short walk to the beach. The reception on Monday, Wednesday and Friday nights are nice with music and a hula dancer.THINGS that could be better: Right now they are down one elevator so there is a short wait at the busy times, ice machine is only on the 1st floor. No vent fans in the bathroom so fogs up quick. Otherwise great stay and a memorable vacation made better by the great experience at the Luana!

Staff were friendly. Room and hotel were top notch. Excellent location highly recommend this hotel. Walk across the park to the beach in minutes or walk down to walkiki beach if you like a busier beach. Beach across the park is perfect. From the moment I arrived til the moment I left everyone at the hotel is friendly and go out of their way to make sure you feel right at home.

Recently stayed at the Luana for seven nights with our granddaughter and had a great time. The staff is friendly and very efficient. The hotel was very nice. Not a luxury suite but for the price we felt it was a real bargain. Location is fantastic for walking, swimming and shopping. I would definitely stay again!

The elevators were a little slow and you had yo wait for them. But it was made up by the service that we had. Everyone that worked there was great they were very helpful and willing to please with our entire stay. Our room was on the 16th floor and we could see the ocean from the living room. We could not get the toaster to work and they had a new one to us within an hour of our call. It is not a new hotel but very well kept.

We had a partial Ocean View Room ...this room had a very good view of the Ocean.The Luana Waikiki Hotel & Suites is a very friendly place to stay and amenities are very good. The Manager's Wine & Cheese Night is a great way to mix with other people from different Countries. Also provided are beach chairs, umbrellas and kids sand toys.We were very happy with our stay and would go back again.

Not too far from Waikiki and a pleasant walk to the beach.Manager's reception with complimentary beer,wine and entertainment was a nice way to start the evening.Staff were very attentive and helpful. They also have a regular shuttle to downtown Waikiki if you don't want to walk.

The room was spacious and always cleaned by the hotel staff. The cleaning lady "Chita" was very professional and courteous. The hotel is in great proximity to the food and nightlife. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends that visit Hawaii!

This hotel have diffrent roomsettings. Our had a small kitchen so we could cook food. Pool heated byt you also have a short walk to the beach. Its easy to find a bus for diffrent locations like Hanamuna bay, Pearl Harbour etc. Also located close to wakiki shopping Street. Hotel staff most helpfull.

Great place to stay. Only complaint is there wasn't an exhaust fan in the bathroom. Otherwise great place. Lots to see within walking distance. We went to Pearl Harbor and was picked up at the hotel. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Even allowed us to stow our things while we went on our tour.

It's the first time we stayed at Luana and I thought I booked 2 queen beds room. Turned out that this is only by request and they might not have 2 queen beds room. First night they put us in a one queen and one sofa bed room. I went down and spoke to the reception and the lady was very helpful and told me she could not move us but would have something available tomorrow in which she is happy to block the room for us. We didn't sleep well the first night because it was very cramp but we moved to another room the next night.I am not sure if all the bedding are by request so if you aren't flexible with your sleeping arrangements, maybe send them an email closer to date to ensure they can put you in room with your requested bedding. The hotel is located at the beginning of the strip so it will be a good walk to Waikiki (maybe around 15 mins?). It's still very convenient though and we even walked to Ala moana centre (around 15 mins walk) so everything is pretty much walking distance. If you don't want to walk to Ala Moana, the hotel provides free shuttle that leaves every 30 mins or so. It might be worth mentioning that the hotel doesn't provide pick up from the airport so you need to book shuttle from Speedy shuttle. We used A8 Shuttle because it charge a flat $35 for taxi shuttle from the airport to the hotel so it works out better if there are more than 2 of you travelling. It's also worth mentioning that A8 doesn't charge extra even if you need to leave for airport at the crack of dawn. Back to the Luana - there is valet parking available for $35/night and I believe the hotel doesn't have a restaurant but as mentioned above, you are very close to restaurants so no worries there.

Wasn't sure what to expect but I liked it. Just a short walk through the park to the beach. Walking distance to shopping and dining and it's away from the hustle of Waikiki. Plus there are stores across the street to buy groceries for your room

My fiancee and I stayed at the Luana for 4 nights. I was truly impressed with the hospitality of the staff and found the hotel to have great value compared to other hotels in the area. We stayed in a king room that had small balcony, sofa and kitchenette. The location was great, with easy access to waikiki beach and places to eat. I highly recommend.

You definitely don't want a street view/front room. One night alone we counted 6-8 cop/fire sirens and it was after 10pm so the sirens were not so necessary. The staff if wonderful. Very accommodating. It would help if they had that front coffee shop open but we didn't know if they had closed it or it was waiting to be opened. They do have coffee/tea in the Lobby but no food. Suggestions are to mop the tile floor at least every other day. They vacuum but no wet mopping. They also have a habit, and they weren't the only ones, of putting the top sheet cross wise so the bottom was about 8 inches too short so if you're taller than 5', you will feel the mattress and mattress pad. We asked for a microwave and they were accommodating. They have silverware and china. We could have used paper plates for our leftovers.

Stayed for 4 nights on a 15th floor room with a partial ocean view. Welcomed at reception by Allan who was friendly and jovial (though most people are friendly in Hawaii it seems). Room amenities were good; clean bathroom with shower over the bath and room was reasonably spacious but there was only storage room to store one large suitcase (we had three). Could not hear any traffic noise, the elevators made a bot of noise that could be heard from the room as others have stated, but hotel elevators get a lot of work don't they? It didn't worry us. Walked to Waikiki Beach; 10 mins or so. Plenty of shops to buy groceries etc. The Wi-Fi was free which was a great bonus since we had been paying up big for data in LA and NYC prior. On departure, Justin gave us some cookies for the plane trip home. Most satisfied with the service, although did not use amenities such as hotel pool as had other trips arranged.

Room was clean, we got a free upgrade, staff was very friendly, beautiful view of the city and the Friday night fireworks. Would definitely come back. Only downside is valet only parking. So keep cash in hand to tip

This is the second time I've stayed at Luana, first time since the management change. The rooms were just fine with no issues. There was a slight problem when I arrived at 11pm and was given a room that hadn't been made up. The young man at the front desk was very apologetic and upgraded me to a nicer room on a higher floor. I received a phone call from housekeeping the next day, apologizing for the problem as well. If you travel much, you know that "stuff" happens even in the best hotels. How they handle it is what makes a good hotel. In my opinion, it was handled perfectly. Can't say enough about how friendly and helpful all the staff were. I really like the location of the hotel. It's surrounded by park areas, easy walk to the beach, and one bonus I discovered on this trip, it's one of the first stops for the tour bus pickups, which gives you a choice of seats.

The only good thing about our stay, was that we got an early check-in!The room was nice enough, but our lanai was filthy. There were cig butts, drug paraphernalia, bird poop on the chairs etc. Our bathroom sink was clogged also. It felt like the room had not been rented in a long time. It was a 1st floor room, facing an alley. The best part is that I emailed the hotel 1 day later and never got a call until I completed a generic guest survey that was sent a few days later. I got a call from Destiny, who only kept apologizing, as though it was her first day on the job. She offered a future room at the same AAA discount we got! How very generous. The hotel has potential, but service is lacking.

I have stayed here twice in the last 3 years. I freaking love this place! Rooms are clean and facilities good - we had a fridge and kitchenette for our food. There is a great pool area and we cooked BBQs on the deck and had beers and G&Ts while watching the sunset. There is a gym ( I forgot to use it! ) and an ice machine. Wine and cheese tasting every week with entertainment was a highlight. You can walk to the main shopping and eating areas, the beach and Ala Moana shopping centre. I will be coming back again soon!!

Our experience here was truly enhanced by the awesome staff. Mr. Chan, Elton, Alan, and everyone else were just a pleasure, and made our stay very enjoyable. Sometimes overlooked but just as important was the housekeeping staff. They kept or 7th floor room immaculate and even added a local flower to the room. Make sure you attend the happy hours on the mezzanine floor. A very nice touch by the hotel. All in all we would recommend this smaller, quieter hotel that sits in an ideal location. Thanks again to all- a hui hou!

Fabulous location. It does not get any better for a budget hotel. The rates are very reasonable for the area. The hotel is located on the main drag in Waikiki so it is perfect for walking to shopping or dining. Directly beside and behind the hotel is Ft. Derussy park so the short walk to the beach is thru the park and not along busy streets. The hotel staff and concierge were very helpful and friendly. Our room (512) was typical hotel size, and included a small kitchenette (small refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes etc.). Coffee and tea in the lobby in the mornings. Managers reception Monday, Wednesday, and Fridays with free wine, beer, cheese and live music. They supply beach towels and offer a free movie rental each day. Our room even had a live orchid. Cons: The street below can get a bit noisy at times but nothing unbearable. The walls are thin so you can hear people walking by the room and next door. Also, some parts of the hotel and rooms could use a bit of updating and renovating. But how much time do you spend in the room? You are in Hawaii!

First and foremost the hotel was very nice for the price, we loved it. Although, we were a little lost and a bit overwhelmed the bellman, Jace, was AMAZING and so much help! Showed so much Aloha and Thanks to him we found exactly what we were looking for and enjoyed the rest of our stay!! Thanks Jace, hope to see you when we return!

Staff are fabulous. James, out the front, in particular was always helpful with advice, booking taxis, how to catch buses etc. Wherever we went in the hotel staff were friendly, smiling and helpful. They were the true highlight of our stay. The Luana is in a great location. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach ( Fort DeRussy Beach) or the center of Waikiki. 7/11 type shops, restaurants, coffee shops are all within a few minutes walk. A Food Pantry supermarket is 10 minutes away if you need to stock up on groceries ( a bit cheaper than 7/11 stores and a lot more variety).Tea and coffee are provided in the lobby every morning and there is a cheese and wine hour 3 times a week, all enjoyable. Dancing and music was a bit cheesy but its a nice way to meet other guests.The pool area is small but very pleasant. Free DVD's handy. Tour desk for advice. The gym looked modern with lots of equipment. ATM in lobby ( fee for usage is higher than other places we tried though) We had a 1 bedroom ocean view suite, which whilst clean and quite comfortable was in desperate need of updating. The furniture is very dated,old TV but the worst is the A/C units, old fashioned,not particularly efficient and very noisy,especially when one is 3 feet from where you are trying to sleep. We opted to turn them off and leave the door open instead, though this let in traffic noise.There was a lovely large kitchen with good appliances, handy if you were staying with children or wanted to save a few $$ by not buying every meal but some better utensils would have made this more useful. A microwave with no microwavable dishes? an oven with nothing you can cook with in it? a set of saucepans and a couple of metal bowls are all that is provided for actual cooking. A good range of cutlery and crockery, coffee maker and a rice maker are provided.We wanted to do laundry but the machines were in constant use ( there were quite a number but its a large hotel) then finally the laundry was closed for renovations and we had to lug washing down the street to a launderette and pay a lot more than the hotel charged for machine usage. It was advertised by signage in the lifts but it was still annoying as part of the reason for booking this hotel was the kitchen and laundry facilities.We enjoyed our stay but feel this hotel could be so much better. The A/C is something that really needs urgent attention.

I have stayed at several Waikiki hotels and really liked this one for its location. It is a block from the beach and on Fort Derussy Park. It is so easy to walk to all the shopping a from the hotel! One of the things I liked best was how quiet the hotel was - last hotel I stayed in in Waikiki I was awakened every morning by delivery trucks at 5 am - nothing like that at the Luana - could sleep as late as I wanted without being disturbed. Although I didn't use them, the pool and exercise facilities looked really nice. Also, every Wednesday and Friday evening they have a wine tasting. The staff was really friendly, and we were really pleased with our stay.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and the service at the luana was great. Jace was extremely helpful he gave me some good ideas on what to do on the island, Mahalo for all the great tips jace appreciate it very much.staff a very very awsome. I would definitely stay here again.

Located within walking distance to Wikiki Beach ,shopping ,restaurants and other hotels. ABC store opposite hotel.Paid parking under hotel. Most rooms have a lanai or balcony .Front office staff very friendly and helpful. Computer available in lobby and free WIFi .Complimentary wine and cheese on 2 days of the week. Room to leave luggage in lobby. Good exercise room and outdoor pool.

This is my first review where I have to say I am disappointed with the comments from my fellow Trip Advisor reviewers. We stayed at this hotel based on the overall high rating for five nights and our first night was in a suite with ocean view and unfortunately we have to say our room was a disaster, the two window mounted air conditioners were extremely noisy and our bed was as hard as a rock. This was the first bed we have ever slept on where we were both stiff and sore the next morning. The positive was the staff are exceptional and we were moved to another room the next day which was equipped without window mounted air conditioners, had a ceiling fan in living room and a comfortable bed. The downside was the patio doors in the bedroom are not soundproof and you can hear road noise and sirens all night long. I can only rate the two rooms we stayed in and our expectation for what we paid for the room and what we received unfortunately did not match. Another positive is the location is fantastic and close to restaurants and the beach.

Excessively long wait to check in after a 9 1/2 hours flight. Perhaps look at changing check out time to allow for rooms to be cleaned so that guests can check in earlier.No scheduled time for room to be cleaned. Cleaners arrive in the morning or sometimes not till late afternoon. Very generous with supply of essential shower gels. Love the meet and greet cheese and wine evenings.Excellent location for walking to the convention centre.

The Luana Waikiki has a great deal of investments to do, in order to improve their hotel facilities. Its a condo/hotel so the owners/management should strongly consider upgrading.The positive thing about this hotel was the friendly service we received from all staff. They were all very efficient and helpful. Reception staff and bellmen were all great. We had the 2 bedroom suite booked, along with a few other regular rooms, as we were a group of 9. This hotel is useful to help manage costs, as its affordable for Waikiki. Location is good for walking to the beach through a nice park (10 min) and its at one end of Kalakaua, so easy to walk to the shops. If you are booking, be aware of a few things:- City view rooms are very noisy from being on the main street and lack of proper sound proof windows. Pay a bit more for the partial ocean view room and you'll sleep better- Air conditioning units are very noisy, no central air, so these clunky units are in each room- the 2BR has a large lanai, but we couldn't use it, as the noise from the HVAC and lack of comfortable furniture made it impossible to use- A complete overhaul is needed to upgrade the bathroom fixtures, furniture, floor tiles, etc, as the rooms all had cracks in the floor, sinks with drainage problems and taps that are difficult - There is a $15 resort fee added to your bill at the end of the stay. Many hotels are now using this scheme, which is bothersome. This hotel is not a resort, so it bothered me that I had to pay a resort fee.- There is no bar or restaurant, so be aware of this if you are looking for the services you would get in most hotels from food and beverages. I would like to end on a positive. - The rooms are well equipped with kitchen facilities, which is great for families and fills the need if you aren't looking to eat or drink at your resort. The 2BR has a washer/dryer, which came in handy- Free coffee in the reception area in the morning was appreciated- The manager hosts a free wine and cheese event 3x per week. We attended one night, but couldn't tell who the manager was, didn't see anyone from their staff roaming around meeting guests. Not sure this is needed. Overall, this hotel is fine for families and people on a budget. If you are more particular with the quality of the hotel facilities you like to stay at, then this hotel is not for you. Unfortunately, due to the overall conditions, I would not stay there again.

Second time staying at the Luana Waikiki for me and my wife--this time we had our 4 mo. old with us. At check in we asked for a fridge for baby's milk, and the concierge upgraded us to a suite with a full kitchen. Parking is about $30/day, but worth the cost for the fast and friendly valet service.We did hear a little construction noise after checking in on the first day, but it stopped at a reasonable hour.Definitely staying here again!

I was in Honolulu for a conference and Luana was very close youths convention center. It's a small but convenient place with many basic amenities. Location is nice as it is away from Waikiki craziness. It's not beachfront but the 5 min walk to the beach through the beautiful park was heavenly. They provide beach towels, chairs etc. the staff was very friendly and helpful. My only suggestion would be to get some pluming work done. Otherwise everything was excellent quality.

We had a room on the 2nd floor, and apart from the occasional ambulance/fire truck, was quite nice.On the 1st floor is a pool and barbeque facilities, with washing machines tucked around the corner.The hotel offered free DVDs and towels for use on the beach or pool. Bikes can also be borrowed but my wife refused to try it!The hotel is next to Fort DeRussy State Park, which is a very pleasant place to while away the hours. It is also very close to just about everything.There is a shuttle bus that runs between all the Aqua hotels and the AlaMoana centre, but the timing is very much a Hawaiian thing (we waited 45 minutes past the advised time for one). Be warned!The staff were extremely friendly and willing to help at any time. We enjoyed the free coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning, and the cocktail party they had (3 times a week).Friday nights the Hilton have a fireworks display, and the pool deck is a nice place to watch them.The only drawback was not having a microwave and kettle in the room. The room could have done with a fry pan (for use on the barbeque) and a toaster as well.There are many smaller cafes and restaurants within a 5 minute walk, and a really good coffee stand just across the street.We would stay there again.CAUTION: Parking is NOT AN OPTION! Will cost over $35.00 PER NIGHT plus tips. Use the bus or the shuttles.

We have stayed at this hotel twice now. The most recent was 2/2 to 9/2/16. We went back to this hotel as the people there are just lovely. Our room on the 16th floor was lovely. Had a little trouble locking the safe but was rectified with 60 mins!Housekeeping great, changed sheets when we asked and was cleaned well each day by the most gorgeous, lovely ladies. We have stayed here before in October 2014 and returned because we were so pleased with the hotel.The "bell Boys" are great. Ryan especially was extremely helpful. weighing my cases for me to make sure I was ok with the weight of my cases. They arranged for a taxi for us on a few occasions and it was never any trouble for them.We booked our activities with Matt on the desk downstairs and he was really helpful, more so than our last trip! He advised us on trips that suited our "age" and was spot on with his suggestions!We also always found Eric to be a lovely person, on the front desk, pleasant and funny!The only thing I would point out and it is no way a criticism, is that when we attended the wine and cheese evening, my husband (who is not allowed to drink alcohol due to a medical condition) was only offered water to drink. Maybe a suggestion of soft drinks or a juice may be worth thinking about. This is a wonderful way of meeting with other persons in the hotel, a great time had by all!This hotel is located at the quiet end of the avenue which is a bonus. The park next door very nice. Lovely pool area too.Will certainly be returning here in the future.

Had a good experience from check in to check out. Rooms were clean and housekeeping was very thorough. We had great access to beaches and restaurants. We were only here for 4 days but really enjoyed our stay. The concierge was very helpful.

Absolutely a hidden gem - no better place to stay if you want to be close (walking) distance to everything but far enough away for quiet. Spent two weeks exploring the island and loved coming back to my room with its kitchenette and then relaxing by the pool.

Stayed in a one bedroom apartment with my family of 4. We had the 1114 apartment with the massive balcony that hangs off the side. I think there are only a couple of apartments that have this. The kitchen was very good. Had everything we needed. The closet was huge and great to store our suitcases. The wine and cheese reception was good. The pool and movie rentals were also very good. The wifi was a bit patchy at times. Our safe did not work. Reception was always friendly and happy to help with any inquiries. Did not use the free shuttle as it was faster to catch the Waikiki Shuttle Pink Line and pay $2 each. It is less than a 5 minute walk away and comes every 10 minutes and doesn't take the 40 minutes the shuttle does. I would recommend if you are going to Ala Moana to use this shuttle but when you get off, get off at the Trump International Hotel stop otherwise you will have to do a big loop to get back to your original get on spot. Recommend you to get a City view room. You will most likely have the A/C on which cancels any potential city noise. The ocean view is more expensive and isn't that great of a view anyways. Very good location for shopping and a really quick walk to the beach. But otherwise as I have said, the hotel was great and didn't have a single problem with them.

Before arrival I know Luana is a great hotel from their prompt, respected, and detailed email reply. I have 5 nights stayed at Luana. I feel it is safe, clean, friendly hotel. The bed is very comfortable, and staffs are very friendly. I can feel real relax at Luana.

Initially booked into this hotel months in advance. 4 months to be exact. I called this property every month, approx every 4 weeks from initial booking until arrival to ensure that nothing happened to our room as we have several A.D.A. people in our party. We are all seasoned travellers and have stayed all over the world in a variety of different lodging to Cruise Ship state rooms etc. Nothing prepared us for initial check in. Upon receipt of our keys and room (1604) we arrived to a top floor corner with a lovely view of Fort Derussy Park and the Beach beyond. This would normally have placated just about anyone, but as I mentioned there were 3 of us in our party. Two of us are large strapping men, who most certainly did not want to share a single King Bed. Yes, that's right, we were given a suite with a single king bed. I called down to the front desk immediately, and was told 'didn't I know there was a sofa bed?'... yes of course there is, for a toddler! Not for either one of us over 6 feet and 200 plus pounds! Never mind I specified a room type of 2 Queen beds and felt the one in our party under 6 feet wasn't worried about the size of the sofa bed, but it was a single person bed. At this point the front desk clerk informs us 'we don't guarantee room types', then why on earth would anyone book a king size or a double queen set of beds when they book? How crazy is this? Obviously I call back and try to get a hold of the manager. I am informed 'there is no manager, they might be in tomorrow'... CLICK, and get hung up on. As if this isn't bad enough, our door doesn't close right and barely latches, it appeared to have been kicked open. The front desk is now refusing to answer the phone repeatedly for over 20 minutes; obviously I return to the lobby. At this point there is no one that will help me and the clerk at the front desk sneers in our faces that that's the way it is! $3000 plus dollars and frequent month calls plus initial booking... and that's the way it is? BE WARNED!After negotiating again for 10-15 minutes we finally secure a promise of the maintenance man coming to fix our door so that it will at least close and lock; which Luana's maintenance team happily does. The friendly joking service guy apologised while fixing our door. It is now well after 5 and we are still waiting for the last of our party to arrive, the final 6 foot plus guy. In this time I return to the lobby and speak to another front desk clerk who graciously offers a child size hide away cot for our under 6 foot to use while the other 6 foot plus we are waiting for arrives. Did I mention all of the over 6 feet are ADA and need 'real' beds? We weren't asking for special treatment, just what we had booked and paid over $3000 for! Again, with a promise the manager would 'call us first thing in the morning' we retreated to our very unsatisfactory room. We now had the short term bedding situation sorted, but the air conditioner kept rattling in the main living room, so we pressed on the control panel, sure enough the front of the a/c housing and unit fell off... as if that wasn't enough we tried to close the patio door and it appeared the moth mafia had taken a hit out on the living room draperies as they were covered in 1920's style machine gun bullet hole holes... bizarre. Once our final party arrived we agreed to speak to the manager the following day, and just rest from the lengthy travelling we had all done. This was Tuesday the 19th of January, 2016. Wednesday the 20th arrived, no manager calls, no manager on site, nothing but front desk staff that could care less, but the good news is we were in Waikiki and it was warm, we left our hotel by taxi for brunch. After a short hop around the avenue malls and shops we returned before 3pm to enquire, yet again as we had on the way out, if there were any new rooms with double queens available as sleeping was extremely uncomfortable and we didn't pay over $3000 to sleep on cots. Again, 'the manager isn't in we'll look into it for you'... another fake platitude.At this point we arranged for a rental car the following day on the 21st, Thursday. In the mean time we headed to the swimming pool, I'd say it was down several gallons of Chlorox,as everyone exiting complained about burning sinuses, throat from inhaling the air, and red eyes.We returned to the front desk where a senior staff member, I can only guess this because he took the time to actually look in the computer for a room, and found guests checking out on the 22nd of January. Great, one more sleepless night for our party. We all agreed to try and pack up early so we could take our stuff into the rental car early the following morning and head out for our circle island drive. Pretty safe to do when you haven't slept because there were springs in your back from the sofa bed all night... It really feels like a $30 sleep not three thousand!The next morning we checkout of 1604 and get into our rental car, heading out to Hanauma Bay for a day at the beach relaxing. I highly recommend you see this natural bay, we arrived around noon after the morning rush had died down and found parking near the entrance to the pavilion. After a day at the beach we returned in the rental car and checked it in to the Luana Waikiki valet, you can not self park and they are entrusted with your vehicle. As I handed over the keys to our new 2015 Nissan Altima, I had no idea what was to happen the next day.Upon check-in to the front desk at 3:30pm in the afternoon on January 21st (2 days after initial arrival) we received the keys to room 606, a bright airy room overlooking the swimming pool and the park. This room is slightly noisier than 1604 as the avenue branches off below into the main part here (Kalakaua Ave) and the side avenue Kuhio Ave. This creates a lot of traffic noise on this side of the building, and the 24 hour gas bar below.We finally feel that we are in the right room that we paid for, requested, and deserved after so much negotiating and unnecessary awkwardness; then the shoe drops. We open the door to the TV set and it's an old style tube TV, with VHS player... I know we are in Hawaii, but for these prices, this was hysterically funny. Worse than that, we discover this is a 3 person 1 bug arrangement. We end up sharing our bathroom with a giant cockroach. Every time one of us 3 turns on the bathroom light, we get a visit from our little friend scurrying around. We can only ascertain he has more personality than Luana management.On the morning of January 22nd, we arrive to the Luana Waikiki Valet and attempt to pick up our rental Nissan. It is at this time that we notice an extreme amount of damage to the vehicle. The drivers side mirror has been impacted and nearly taken off, I am left to try and push it back on so it doesn't finish falling off. There are dents and scratches all over the entire vehcile including the hood and roof and it appears that it was backed into something as well as rammed forward. The valet immediately, with hands at his side, states 'oh it was like that when I got it'... VERY much not at all! I immediately demand to have Honolulu police contacted who arrive on scene and make a record and case note about the damage. After almost 2 hours of documentation and the Valet 'ADAM' swearing up and down that he did nothing wrong, the police give me my card with file number and send us on our way. We narrowly averted disaster on our arrival time for the Polynesian Cultural Centre because we were detained by Luana's damage to our vehicle. At least the entire day wasn't ruined. I recommend this point of interest as well, the Polynesian Cultural Centre is a wonderful group of experiences and a fun drive to the North Side of Oahu.Upon returning to the hotel, and with assurances by the NEW 'not Adam' valet person we agreed to park our rental in their care. Which as you will note was a continuing disaster from the get go.Saturday we continued to explore more of Waikiki, and the Hawaiian Prince dinner buffet etc. Recommend the Sushi highly in Hakone!Sunday Morning we again pickup our rental car and note that not only the previous damage that was done to it, but the right rear passenger side has been scraped up against something and FURTHER damage was done. At this time I demand to speak to the police, and ADAM is now the valet on site, smiling and grinning while laughing hysterically. This is obviously a joke and fun for Luana's VIP staff, destroying rental cars is no big deal because well it's fun and a victimless crime right? How Narcissistic and Sociopathic do you have to be to enjoy damaging property in this way? Apparently Adam is without explanation as three Honolulu Police Officers respond to the scene! Suddenly Adam isn't smiling any more, in fact he's white and shaking nervously as the police ask him to fill out a statement for them and insist on contacting his managers because there ARE camera's in their parking garage. Funny how their demeanor changes when authority arrives? At this point I complete a second police statement, receive a second police file number, and pack up my party and head off this disgusting property. By the way, the manager at this time of both the hotel and the valet show up. The hotel manager immediately jumps to luggage must have damaged my rental car. Yes ladies and gentleman luggage took the side mirror off my rental car and dented the fenders, pushed in the front bumper, and and luggage again scraped up the side of the car. The Valet manager refused to comment or make any statement, but was handily taking pictures of our car while dodging questions.Our day was spent driving to Turtle Bay and the rest of the North Shore. I highly recommend staying out here, it's not a pretty hotel, but the views are stunning and as I've been here on previous occasions; they won't demolish your rental car.After returning to Honolulu in the evening and contacting the rental car assistance centre AGAIN, I make the decision to cut our rental short and return the car, Sunday evening as we can simply not trust Luana Waikiki at all. This trust has been broken in so many levels it's appalling that anyone could run a hotel this way.After we drop the rental car off at Honolulu airport, pay for our own taxi van back to this dreadful property we find that the maid service has simply pulled the blankets over the pillows left in our bed and refused to clean our room. There are dishes in the sink I do myself and garbage I empty into a bag and leave in the hallway as I don't want it in our room. Obviously the maid staff have been given orders by their hotel manager not to serve us at all. After cleaning our room, we all collapse into our beds and try to forget this nightmare. Ahh Monday, the 25th of January, I proceed to do laundry in the morning. The one amenity of this hotel that is lovely; self serve laundry. I shudder to imagine if Luana had a laundry service, you're clothes might come out like our rental car.We walk over to our now favorite Oasis in Waikiki Eggs N Things... they recognise us instantly. My favorite meal is the grilled Ahi Tuna steak and eggs with Wasabi sauce. This is highly recommended as well. We head back to the hotel for an afternoon nap and rest. It is this point where I decide to catch our little cockroach friend. I sneak into the bathroom and have one of my friends turn the bathroom light on. Success, I catch it in an old pill bottle. Ugh! Well that's almost as exciting as the Monday Wednesday Friday wine and cheese party on the Mezzanine Level bar. Ahh, Tuesday, thank goodness, time to check out and get out of this dump. Which by the way has advertisements all over for it's annual condominium HOA board meetings. You see, this isn't a hotel, NO no... Luana is a Condominium that uses it's slum hotel to subsidise the tenants living there. Be warned!At 11:50am we check out, I request a zero balance print out and am told they don't do that. What hotel doesn't do this? I demand that a screen capture or some other receipt be issued to show that we have in fact paid our balance. Grudgingly the clerk agrees and prints off the screen capture I ask for. I am then asking what about my $100 deposit on my credit card, and assured it will be removed in a few days time. As of this writing on February 9th 2016, Luana has chosen to NOT credit back my hotel deposit. I have made several calls to the management, and as you guessed - haven't been returned.The best part of Tuesday the 26th of January 2016 was leaving. I have never felt this disappointed, drained, and frankly appalled by a hotel in a VERY long time. I urge anyone thinking of staying here to remember that because the pictures look good - it doesn't have to be! If anyone gives a good review, they are either paid by Luana or blind... and if you're blind, I'm sorry you had to endure this property.Further the restaurant in this hotel is nonexistent and under reno's - permanently - a fancy way of saying run down beyond belief and closed by the health board. Like everything Luana, it was a complete hell hole.By the way, at no time did the Luana Hotel manager or Valet manager ever offer to compensate us, nor did they offer to pay for my renters insurance they most certainly made us of. No one did anything other than deny any responsibility and continue to ensure our stay was even worse than before.I urge you to look at my pictures, and ask yourself if this is how you want to spend your hard earned money and be treated.

We stayed for 18 nights in a one bedroom apartment as a family of four. Staff were super friendly and helpful, including our amazing housekeeper, Elsie. Our apartment was spacious with great views of Friday night fireworks. A quiet mezzanine level enabled me to work and we appreciated the thrice weekly wine and cheese receptions which helped us make some lovely new friends. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again ourselves!

The best part is the location (adjacent to a very nice park and close to the sea (5 min walk); however, rooms facing Kalakaua Av are NOT GOOD, terribly noisy, if you keep the lanai door open you cannot have a conversation nor sleep!!!We booked 2 rooms (1 with a kitchenette) and stayed from Dec 22-Jan 12 (needless to say the prices were ridiculously higher than earlier/later weeks, but due to kids' schools we had no choice).Number one issue is the cleanliness of rooms, in one word - POOR (regardless of what other reviews say, this is NOT a clean place)! Please wash the floors (scrubbing with soap), it is essential that the accumulation of dirt over decades be gone!!!I chose a hotel without carpets because I expected it to be cleaner, but I was very disappointed…. The common areas were better kept, specially the lobby and pool areas.Second: OLD, nothing has been renovated in decades! Furniture is poor because it takes a lot of space and offers little storage space. Everything is too dark, counters and floors, furniture, please make it lighter, it looks like a cave!AC is too noisy, we turned it off (was not necessary) and never turned it on again!Cooking is possible but keep in mind that there is the bare minimum! Internet??? A great joke, works one min and not the next, intermittent should I say?Nonetheless, most staff was professional and helpful, the "manager reception" (3 days per week) and yoga classes (4 days per week) were a reasonable highlight.Over the last 25 years I've stayed in various hotels in Honolulu during Xmas peak season, so I believe that relative to more highly priced hotels (Sheraton Waikiki, Hilton Hawaiian village, Hyatt Waikiki, etc) this is an economic choice for families.Finally, I confess that I was greatly dissatisfied with reviews I read in "tripadvisor" that evaluated this hotel much higher than it deserves! Overall is bearable, specially if you are staying for 3 weeks, but I'll not go back to the same place!

After a mixup with our hotel (we arrived a day early! My bad!) the Luani Waikiki took us in last minute & even gave us a military discount! The staff was friendly and the room was clean & comfy. It's a bit of a hike to the beach but other than that it's a great location. Happy hour 5-6pm with cheese, fruit and the like. Nice bar. No restaurant even though the sign at the front door posts hours! Nice pool. After traveling this far, we want to be on the beach, and you can be for the same price.

Booked direct, friendly efficient staff on front desk but nor really interested beyond their own responsibility. Concierge was a fail, we got better advice from adjacent shop keepers. Porter / Doorman has the cruisiest job ever. During our 4 day stay never saw him assist anyone with a bag and his directions suggest he had never ventured off his stand. Room was fine, clean but well worn. Air Con was very noisy, an old in wall unit with daylight visible around the edges.Location is a positive, food stores across the road and at a quiet end of the strip yet only a 5min walk through the park to the beach. Underlies the maxim-- you get what you pay for.

I realize it's near (not on) Waikiki Beach, but for over $200/night (and up) I expect, at a minimum, a clean room in which everything works. The lanai outside our room was so dirty I didn't even want to go out there, not to mention condensate from the a/c units in the rooms above dripping onto it. Both times I tried to use the DVD player to watch a movie (there's a free Redbox-type rental station in the lobby) I had to have someone from maintenance come in to make the AV equipment work. At least two of the three elevators had service outages during the four days I was there, too. The tile floors in the rooms get swept every other day, which is a problem if you track sand in from the beach, which anyone staying here is bound to do. The window a/c unit was old and very noisy.The whole property has an air of neglect, as if the owner is preoccupied with his other enterprises, and with his large collection of very expensive classic cars, one of which is parked in a prominent place near the front door every day. I don't really want to see his Bentley or his XK6 or his immaculately restored early-model T-bird sitting there when I feel like I'm paying a lot for very little. There is no food or beverages of any kind available in this hotel (the restaurant was closed up, with a sign saying they were remodeling, although there was no evidence of any work being done on it.) What used to be a gift shop also sits vacant, and so does the bar. So also does the large building next door (same owner), which used to be a restaurant. Frankly, it's a little depressing.The staff is very friendly and willing to be helpful, which is the best thing about the place.I recently stayed at the Venetian in Las Vegas, paid less, and got vastly more.

This resort is fantastic. It's clean and well maintained and the staff are extremely friendly and anxious to see you have a pleasant stay. Restaurants are close by and the beach is a short walk away. A problem with my room wifi was fixed within minutes by a cheerful and helpful repairman...I can't say enough good things about the Luana. I've travelled quite a bit and these folks do it right! The Expedia rep was very helpful with tours and I'd recommend you speak with them for any of the numerous excursions they offer. First class service.

Stayed at this hotel from Dec. 29, 2015 thru to January 10, 2016. There was 3 of us all adults (myself with 2 adult children), we stayed on the 14th floor, had 2 queen beds with kitchen and balcony. Lots of space for our luggage and clothes. Good TV, free wi-fi. Hotel had 3xweek a wine/cheese welcome from 5-6 p.m. with hula dancer, wonderful. Hotel also had a variety of beach items we could sign out for the day such a beach chair, umbrellas, floating devices, etc. Public transportation was just across the street, we used the city bus for everything, found the city bus to be safe with great air conditioning and the bus went everywhere. This hotel was the best for our family, they had a great little pool that was perfect for a quick swim and for sun bathing. We are definitely coming back to stay again. Staff were super and always accommodating. Perfect location in Waikiki, loved this place !!! Thank you Luana Hotel and Suites for an awesome stay!!!

This hotel was amazing and had everything you could imagine to make our vacation a dream. They had at no charge bike rentals, beach mats, towels, video movies and games with a playstation 3 in your room. One of the nicest amenties was the wine and cheese gathering every M- W -F from 5-6. Everyone from the bell hop to the housekeeper, front desk and beyond was so nice and helpful. The price we paid was a good rate as well for all the special amenties we got. I will defintely return and spend it at this hotel, trust me it is so worth every penny. Oh and by the way it is right in the heart of the city where you could walk to everything or they shuttled to the Ala Moana Center if you didn't want to walk for free. The only thing they don't do is shuttle to and from the airport but a taxi 29.00 flat fee or the bus 2.50 one way.

Nowhere on my scale does it completely disappoint or amaze, everything is quite average. Its a bit dated and hence the shower should probably come with instructions (complicated to turn on) the location is good.

Stayed here over the Thanksgiving holidays, and we really loved the location of the hotel. It is a nice short walk to the main shopping area 'luxury row' and not too far a walk to the Ala Moana. The hotel and rooms were nice and clean, and the amenities provided were good. The staff were lovely, Chita our housekeeper was so friendly and gave us some wonderful tips on getting around on public transport. Justin who works front of house was also incredibly friendly which definitely made us feel very welcomed! Overall we had a wonderful stay, and we thought the hotel was well situated for all our needs.

I had the pleasure of staying here for one week, and I have to say that I enjoyed it overall. The hotel itself is fairly modern, but most importantly, it was clean! The staff is courteous and attentive. There's a decent gym, laundry facilities, and outdoor pool available. The rooms are decent in size with a kitchenette, fridge, and microwave. The hotel is far enough away from the riff raff and rather quiet. There's easy access to public transportation and parking is available for a nominal cost.The only issue that I had had with the hotel was how SLOW the elevators are!All in all, I'd definitely return here, as I had heard some horror stories about other hotels in the area not being clean or tidy

We booked in advance for a New Year's Eve stay and requested 2 queen beds, even confirmed this, twice, as there were 4 of us. At check in we checked again...got to our room and found 1 queen and a pullout. When we called the front desk we were told that's all that was available. We asked for a cot and extra towels to be brought up. At which time the desk clerk literally told me off for having 4 people in our room, we were only supposed to have 3! (All 4 of our names were listed on the room at check in and we were given 4 keys so...? ) we made due, the housekeeping staff was lovely, as were the valet staff. There won't be a next time.

The four and five dot reviews are hard to understand. Sure, the hotel is clean. Service was good. However, it's simply dated. Personally. my biggest issue was the a/c unit. It's not central air -- it's basically a unit (an old noisy unit) in the wall. I'm generally a very sound sleeper but it kept me up. The elevators are also dated and relatively slow. Not smooth. The pool area is small. Finally, the bathrooms (while retiled and clean) are small and have an old bathtub. Simply put, it's serviceable but not worth top dollar.

I have been to oahu about 14 times. I booked into the luana hotel. The amenities are great the rooms are excellent. But above all the staff really made the vacation above and beyond. From the valet " jace and company" the always pleasant front desk "Elton and company" to house keeping who every day did an unreal job "special thanks to surly, thanks for your great job and your great smile". Super job by all the luana staff who showed me the true aloha way. A must stay in paradise. MAHALO- K.P McCarthy

In essence, this is a decent hotel for its price, and we found it to be clean, and the staff pleasant. Ready acces to beach towels was good, and th wine and cheese nights were great. However, there were a few issues. Firstly, whilst we had booked two beds, the room came with one. Upon raising this with the staff, we were told that the hotel does not have rooms with two beds (hard to believe), and also that any room reservations are not guaranteed (which hints at the first point being a lie). I also walked past an open room on our floor later in the trip and spotted two double beds! We were given a trundle bed for the stay at no extra charge, but I was disappointed to have to spend 9 nights on it, for the same price. The air conditioner also leaked twice, but was finally repaired, and we were given a reduction of taxes at the end of our stay as my shoes got wet overnight from it. Also, it is very, very noisy, although I guess that is to be expected for a room facing he very busy Kalakaua Ave. In short, whilst there was nothing that you could say ruined the holiday, these were some very disappointing things, and I must say I would not stay there again. This is unfortunate, as it looked very promising and I am sure could have a lot to offer guests.

We stayed at the Hilton Waikiki Beach for 3 nights in early December, then went to Kauai for 6 nights. Afterward, we stayed at the Luana for one night prior to flying out of HNL. Honestly, I can't figure out why the Luana is rated higher than the Hilton. We loved our stay at the Hilton and the Luana fell far short of expectations. First, it took 30 minutes to check in with only one representative at the desk. The first room we were given was DIRTY, with a bad accumulation of dust, hair balls on the floor and dried urine on the toilet rim. Room number two had only one double bed, when we asked for two. Room number three was okay, but the bathroom/shower had been used and not cleaned by housekeeping. They sent a man up to clean it and replace the used towels. The only compensation for this mess was a refund of the $15 resort fee; a fee we had no idea about until we checked in. There is no resort fee at the Hilton. Overall, very disappointing!

Bed was quite comfortable and city view was lovely. Nice to see a hotel with tile floors. While there is a fridge in the room and the room comes stock with dishes, knifes, and stuff to clean the dishes, there is no microwave in the room; if you plan to cook it will be with the barbeque grills provided. BEWARE, parking is only valet and cost $35 a day.

We stayed there on two occasions the first for 6 nights and the second just overnight. The hotel is in an excellent location at one end of wakiki beach. Provides free beach towels and has several ice breaker wine and cheese parties each week. The hotel has a small pool if you do not want to go to the beach. The beach is a 5 minute walk away. Tours can be arrange by the concierge and taxis by the front desk transport guy. There is a complementary shuttle service to the local Mall or you can just walk along the Wakiki shopping strip.

The staff are the nicest people you'll ever meet (especially Tyler the concierge), and this location is equidistant from shopping centers, food, and the beach. Wonderful hotel that is absolutely deserving of 5 stars. Would definitely come again and recommend to friends, family, and tripadvisor users!

I can't comment on the room price as we stayed two nights free as part of a Hawaiian Airlines promotion. We liked the location on the less hectic west end of the main tourist street and next to a large park. The walk to the beach through the park is about two blocks. The staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the evening wine and cheese event and used the hotel pool and free cruiser bikes. The room was adequate. The sliding door to the room's deck was very hard to open and close. Our only real complaint is about the incredibly slow elevator service. We were on the second floor but the hotel didn't give us the option of taking the stairs. We had long waits each time we wanted to take the elevator, even though there are three and the building doesn't have that many floors.

This hotel is not in the 'beach resort strip' but for us that was a plus. It is only a 10 minute stroll through the park to the beach or a 5 minute stroll to beach walk. The hotel is a little tired in its decor but I'm sure there are plans to update soon. It is very clean and comfortable and the staff are unfailingly happy and helpful. We had a one bedroom ocean view apartment which proved to be well worth the extra cost. The views were spectacular, especially or the fireworks on Friday evening. I would suggest if you are a light sleeper you ensure you have a room away from the lifts as they run all night. Wasn't a problem for us though. An added bonus was the proximity to local bus stops which we loved riding to get to places such as the palace and bishop museum, and even diamond head.

We recently stayed at Luana Waikiki for the first time and are very glad we did! Great location. It was very clean and well maintained. All of the staff were extremely friendly, kind, professional, and courteous. (Only had a problem with one employee and that was definitely the exception to the rule.) If we had any problems at all, which were very few, it was taken care of immediately. I asked for a room on one of the higher floors and a room that would be quiet since I suffer from migraines, and we were given just that. We had a Studio Kitchenette with a Partial Ocean View on the 14th floor and it was amazing!! We absolutely loved the DVD Now Rental!! We will definitely be staying here whenever we visit Waikiki in the future.

We were pleased with our five-night stay at the Luana. The location was just right for us, as it was just close enough to the beach, shops, restaurants, and bars, but not necessarily in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. All the staff that we interacted with were very helpful and amicable. I resorted to the concierge several times to get some tips on visiting other parts of the island and again, they were very attentive. The room and amenities were adequate for us- fitness room, a small pool, a kitchenette area in the room. A few small downsides for us were the shower which didn't seem to work properly all the time and the fact that there is no restaurant or breakfast offered. But all in all, we were very pleased with our stay and would consider the Luana in the future.
