Good location, walking distance to shops and restaurants. Family friendly hotel with spacious rooms and comfortable bed. Friendly staff. Parking was around $25/day but that pretty much goes for any hotel in Hawaii. Would stay here again.

We have had the pleasure of staying at the Luana Waikiki many times in the past few years, three times this present year. The reasons ... Location, Outstanding Hospitality, and, above all, Staff Conviviality.Situated at the edge of Fort DeRusssy Park, the quieter end of Waikiki, it affords one a very short walk through the Park to the beach. To savour the hustle and bustle of the shops, restaurants, bars and night life of Waikiki, these are a mere two blocks along Kalakauha Avenue towards Diamond Head. In the opposite direction, the ever-evolving and increasingly "upscale" Ala Moana Shopping Centre awaits!We have always arranged for a room with kitchenette on the highest floor possible on the Diamond Head side. It faces the Park and has a fine partial ocean view. The vistas are excellent as no high-rises are immediately in front. The same can be said for the opposite side towards the lush mountains.Daily room house-keeping is thorough and the staff are efficient and very friendly. Public spaces are immaculate, the pool deck is extremely comfortable, the two barbecues are great for those wishing whip-up "your inner-chef" dinner bills of fare, and should you be at the hotel on a Monday, Wednesday, or Friday between 5:00 p.m. and 6:00 p.m., the Manager's wine and cheese reception is excellent. Music with a graceful Hula dancer bring a lovely ambience whilst you chat with guests from far and wide.The daily Resort Fee lists many items to make you stay memorable. This past visit we took advantage of the touring bicycles and did a very early Sunday morning cycle out past the Diamond Head Lighthouse and beyond to the Waialae Golf and Country Club in the Kalaha District of the Island. Also available are beach chairs, floats, tubes, and other sun-worshipping paraphernalia. Current DVDs are free from the kiosk on the mezzanine floor.Kudos go to the very affable manager Rudy Fao and all the staff with whom we dealt. Jacqueline and Sunny at guest services, Elton and Jess at the front desk, Trace who manned the luggage and signed out the beach items, Destiny who manages and oversees Housekeeping, and Mark and all the greeters and servers who make the Manager's Wine and Cheese so enjoyable. The valet staff stationed outside at the driveway's edge always offer welcoming pleasantries as you enter or leave the hotel.

The manager's reception was good even though it was crowded and not enough chairs. The service was outstanding. Everyone was helpful and take pride in their work. I reserved a studio with partial ocean view but I got one bed room with view of ocean and Diamond Head. Even though glasses were filthy and yucky, the service made up for that. I left my IPad when I left. As soon as I noticed, I contacted and it was reported to lost and found. They made all the necessary arrangement, and shipped it to me in Japan. Thank you so much.

Enjoyed our stay at the luana Waikiki. The staff was great, especially Diana. She was very courteous and friendly and did a great job cleaning the room and a great asset to your company. Enjoyed seeing and talking to her every day and hated to leave her behind, we wanted to bring her to Tennessee. Very sweet. William Carmichael

Fantastic hotel in Waikiki....I searched for a long time before booking a hotel in Waikiki due to the expense of the hotels, I chose this one for the location, free wifi, free bike hire, pool and great value price...it did not disappoint spotlessly clean and bright with friendly staff. We booked the last 4 days of our holiday at the Disney hotel and I really missed my lovely balcony overlooking the park and the hustle & bustle of Waikiki ....shopping, restaurants and beach all on your doorstep. I would definitely stay here again if I'm ever lucky enough to return to Oahu :) only downside was the expensive car parking but it was nice having valet parking after a long day sightseeing

Hotel location is pretty good. Not far to walk to Royal Hawaiian, Lewers Street etc. Rooms are comfortable, clean, nicely furnished and decent for the price. Pros - price, location, comfortable room. Cons - staff slack maintaining drink station in lobby - tea and coffee offered in the mornings included in resort fees was always out of stock and had to wait a long time when asking staff to restock, gym is open only limited hours, outlook from hotel balcony is horrible - best stay inside. Would stay again.

The reason for my visit was to surprise and celebrate an early Christmas with my kids, whom I haven't been with in over 4 years.I really want to thank, Julie, our room keeper, for providing us with clean towels, sheets, and fresh supplies daily. I personally met her in the hallways once, and had a very pleasant conversation. I told her my 8 year old says, "Dad, they treat us like Kings here!" And, my 13 year old takes 2 to 3 showers a day, cause he said, "It feels so good, Dad."Julie left a very sweet and sincere note, wishing me a safe trip home. This was the first time in all my travels. So, I posted it on Facebook as a keepsake, and proof that real genuine kind people still exists. Thank you so much for a most memorable experience.Sincerely,Frederick Paulino

Diana comes to my room to restock my coffee, bathroom supplies and excellent cleaning. She also brings with her a positive attitude that makes my day! She's funny and pleasant to talk to and able to provide information on the local area (she is very helpful). The staff is VERY FRIENDLY and Helpful. The room is very clean, the appliance & utility (stove, refrig, AC, and bathroom) all working in good condition. Last January, I stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel in Waikiki, and in comparison I like Luana Waikiki Hotel & Suites. But in all my stays in hotels in the world, I felt more relax here. When I come to Waikiki again, I will come to Luana!!!. Thank you Diana!!

We have stayed here a few years ago and thought it was a very nice hotel. Very little has changed. The rooms are perfect in size with small balconies. My roomed faced East with a nice ocean view. Our stays here are usually 2 to 3 days in length, so have an oven, microwave, refrigerator and cooktop made it possible to save a ton of money on food. Staff is always friendly and accommodating. Pool is beautiful and the gym is really nice.

On my second day at Launa, Diana come to our room to clean. She was so sweet and pleasant. She has such an outgoing personality. This is something that bring guest back to visit Launa again. (Friendly staff) She was very good at her job, going the extra mile to please the guest. After talking to her, her goal is to make the guest feel special so they enjoy their stay! We just fell in love with her, which made saying goodbye hard to do! Great Job Diana!!

We just returned from a 15 night stay at the Luana Waikiki. This was our third time staying at the Luana, and we weren't disappointed. We had a fabulous room on the 16th floor with a spectacular park and ocean view. We were celebrating a couple of special occasions and the hotel provided us with a lovely bottle of wine shortly after arrival. The Luana has everything we need for a comfortable stay; the kitchenette units are sufficient, we loved the BBQ patio, and the on site laundry facilities are very convenient. We very much enjoyed the "Happy Hour" festivities which take place 3 times per week, a very nice touch! We find the location ideal, just far enough away from the "craziness" of Waikiki but still close enough to walk everywhere. The thing that we are most impressed with at the Luana is the excellent customer service. Every member of the staff (from housekeeping to maintenance, to front desk to valet, bellman, etc) is polite, friendly and they just can't do enough to make your stay perfect. A big shout out to Tyler who helped us plan a few excursions which made our strip definitely more enjoyable. Rudy, you have an outstanding team at the Luana and we can hardly wait to return!

We're really happy we made the choice of Luana hotel. Our view was lush garden and wonderful scenery. Our room was clean and comfortable and thanks to our house keeper Julie she's making sure we have everything we need.

We arrived, to be politely and kindly, that check in was not available as the room wasn't ready yet, although luggage could be securely and safely stored. We knew room wouldn't be ready but they were so polite in helping us out.Came back, and received a warm welcome from Jordan - a great start. Room still wasn't quite ready, although he kindly 'hinted' that if we just allow 5 or 10 mins, it would be worth our while. We got our room keys, headed up there, entered the room, gasped, went to the balcony and just about cried lol. - Absolutely amazing !!!!!!!!! My only concern is everyone now using here to stay due to all the accurate reviews which means increased prices etc lol !Only major con that got resolved and I recommend this is recommended - insanely loud elevator noise, you need to choose the desired air-con temperature beside the bed, then stick it on full blast all night and you won't hear a thing except the air-con working which fortunatley mimics the sound of being in an aircraft on a night flight, except you're travelling First Class ! That's how to get around it. The only way.It felt special, like a large family home, where everyone gets along. Very professional staff and great attitudes all round. The staff all work like teamwork and treat each other and their guests very well. Good to observe. Real Aloha spirit.We were sad to leave but will return one day from Scotland.....

Stayed for three nights. Room was comfortable and clean. Housekeeping did an excellent job. Bed comfortable. Had a nice view over park. Did not hear traffic noise at night but you would if sitting on balcony (but you are in Honolulu which has terrible traffic all the time). Aircon quite noisy but it didnot stop me sleeping. All staff very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the wine and cheese with music and dancing. Very nice. Beach hire equipment is great, we had ours all day down at the beach. It is only ten minute max to walk to centre of Waikiki for the beach and shops so great location. Allow time when catching the lift as a little slow! Overall an excellent stay and we will recommend. Thank you.

The location is okay. It is a 5-8 minute walk to the beach and 8-10 minute walk to the epicenter of Waikiki. We often rented the free cruiser bikes from the hotel to make commuting to the beach easier. We also took full use of free beach chairs and boogie boards. This along with complimentary coffee/tea in the morning and wine and cheese receptions on certain nights were nice touches. The elevators will annoy you, as they are terribly slow. The staff were friendly except for James who is a bellman who is a bit abrasive. He felt the need to lecture us every time we rented bikes about how we need to take care of them and that they are new, etc. You would think after the 3rd time we rented and returned them in perfect condition, he would let up. It's more that his unfriendly approach was off putting. The rest of the staff was great and friendly. In fact, one bellman gave me a cold towel when I returned from a run! Very nice.The room we stayed in was a privately owned condo, and was well maintained and fully stocked.The bottom line is I would recommend to others as a good value option.

This is part of the chain of "Aqua" hotels you will find in the Waikiki area. It is about a 10 minute walk from the beach and surrounded by Waikiki. I just spent a one night layover here so I did not take advantage of the many amenities that they offer. Staff was friendly and checkin was easy. Room was clean and comfortable for the price. If you are looking for the most convenient Waikiki Beach Experience I recommend the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but this was booked at the last minute and I was only going to be in the hotel for ten hours. For the $138 dollars all taxes included booked on Hotels.com this is a GREAT VALUE. One word about the Wi-Fi - each room has its own SSID - I was in room 104 which did not seem to have one - so i connected to the lobby and to the room upstairs but it was very spotty. If you are going to be there and rely on wi-fi make sure you can connect and move to a different room if you can not.

This is a solid choice for a visit to Honolulu / Waikiki. It's got a great location, just a few minutes' walk from lots of restaurants and shops, and the famous Waikiki Beach. It's a good choice for families or couples. The rooms are comfy and quiet, though a bit dated. But don't let that discourage you. The place is spotless and the hotel staff is super-helpful and kind. If you want a spiffy, hip, resort complex with oodles of amenities, look over at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. (And hold onto your wallet.) The Luana is moderately priced and a great choice for a visit to Waikiki. We'll be back.

I booked here for my first trip, having no idea where this was located. I was thrill to see if was in a great location, within several blocks from walking around "luxury row". The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the kitchen was a nice bonus. Thanks!

Nice rooms with minimal kitchen facilities. This is a good hotel for the more budget price range, probably because its not quite on the Waikiki strip, but still within walking range. Some things could do with updating, in particular the aircon which was very noisy and old, too loud to run over night. WiFi was a highlight with access from all areas of the hotel, as well as the welcome function which included good quality wine and nibbles 3 nights per week.

Just had a wonderful staycation at the Luana. This is a quality "well maintained" hotel with a friendly family like staff. Not the lap of luxury but clean great smelling rooms with very comfortable beds. We had tile floors, stone counters, black out curtains, fast free internet, great kitchenette and very well appointed decor in the common areas. We would definitely come back again.

If you are looking for a romantic hotel/resort type of stay then this is not it. This is why I was disappointed in the hotel. It is a good 10-15 min walk to the beach, which is a lot if you have to do it 3-4 times a day for 10 days.If you are looking for a place just to stay in Hawaii, don't mind the walk and not looking for the Hawaii resort type of experience then this hotel will be more than sufficient. The hotel services are great. It is clean. The only tip I have is not to stay on the lower floors as it is very loud with the road noise. stay above 10th floor.

The staff was discourteous, even borderline smug. Zero interest in true customer service.The room felt spacious and the kitheonette was a nice addition, though no microwave or stove to heat up leftovers.

Booked this hotel on Hotwire and I was pleasantly surprised. The location is great, walking distance to everything (beach, shopping center, restaurants, etc). I saw the fireworks from the balcony. Room is well equipped, with even free DVD rental (though I wonder if anyone actually takes advantage of it). The staff is very friendly and helpful. I accidentally left a jacket in my room and they actually sent it back to me free of charge. Overall, great value for its price!

The Luana is so nice and the staff are great! We go to Waikiki every Jan for 7 days, we always stay at the Luana. The area is great, the staff is great and the rooms are great. The Luana is in the perfect location for every where.

Stayed for just 2 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship back to Australia. Having been to Honolulu previously we just wanted an establishment away from the hustle & bustle of downtown Waikiki, but still close enough to be within walking distance. The complementary shuttle to the shopping centre was excellent with the added advantage of good tour of downtown Waikiki.The rooms were well equiped with a view over the adjacent park and beach in the distance.

I recently visited Waikiki for a learning summit and award ceremony. The Hilton was fully booked for the event. I had to find an alternative location. I found this little boutique hotel a couple of blocks away. It was a great find, they had so many added benefits that you don't normally get in places like Hilton. We enjoyed their manager's reception with wine and cheese and some lovely hula dancer and music. They also had a great little pool that wasn't crowded at all. Also, they provides some great extras like bikes, buggies boards, beach towels and chairs at no extra charge. I did book the room with a kitchen, I only wish it had more space, since we had to use the sofa bed for one of my kids, was really crowed. But other than that, we really enjoyed our stay.

We had a 1 bedroom apartment and we could not fault it at all. A great place to stay on the edge of waikiki away from the main hustle and bustle but only a few mins walk away. We will return in the future and I recommend it to anyone

My first trip to Hawaii and we chose the Luana. First and foremost the staff here are just wonderful. Nothing was ever a problem and they often went above and beyond to make sure my family was comfortable. Accommodation was very comfortable and it's a very easy walk to the Main Street, restaurants and beaches. We fell in love and will be back for sure.

I can't express how impressed we are with the Luana Waikiki. We originally had reservations at the Aqua Palms Waikiki and the day before arriving I get an email confirming my reservations and a little note regarding their a/c system was currently 50% but there are fans in the rooms. A relocation wad also offered as guest request. I took the opportunity yo call and relocate. I was hesitant at first because the previous hotel was an ideal area close to shops and restaurants. The Luana is not that far away from the Aqua Palms and it worked out great!The lobby is always clean with daily water infused with fruit. There's a managers reception every week. Valet parking is available for $35 a day and the resort charge is $15. Awesome price for both and we got a good deal on the room as well. Front desk staff were helpful and the valet were quick. Families as well as couples would love the Luana. Thank you for your hospitality. We will be back!

This trip was my third stay at the Luana Waikiki. The hotel has two great things going for it: 1) great location and 2) a fantastic staff. Being located at the west end of Kalakaua Avenue and right off Ft Derussy on Waikiki means that you get away from much of the crowd associated with the place, while enjoying some relaxation that you come for in the first place. The staff are all excellent, I never met an exception to that statement. They are not only friendly and responsive to the customer, but will always take the time to just shoot the breeze with the guests - making my long stay feel more like a home away from home.

Me and my husband stayd at Luana for over two weeks in last February. This was our second stay in Luana and 4th trip to Honolulu. We simply loved it. Everything was so easy; staff was so friendly and we really felt the aloha! Location is best in Waikiki, it is so peacefull and still it is close to everything. Can´t wait until next March...we will return:)

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki from 22- 29 Sept . The hotel is really well located about a 10 minute easy stroll along a main street (with many shops and restaurants) to Waikiki beach. It is away from the hustle and bustle (and noise) of central Waikiki but within easy reach. Our 1 bedroom apartment had an extremely spacious bedroom with a king bed and a compact living room with a sofa bed and en-suite sized bathroom. Everything was immaculately clean and cleaned and serviced every day. The staff on reception and housekeeping were very helpful and courteous. The concierge was really knowledgeable ,friendly and helpful too. The only downsides were that the air conditioning units were extremely noisy ( too noisy to leave on at night ) and there are no insect screens so it was quite hot at times. There was a noisy party above us on the final night but after a complaint to reception it was shut down quite quickly. This apartment hotel is very good value for money - much cheaper than other apartment/hotels closer to Waikiki and very nice.

This hotel is only about a 10 minute walk down to the beach at Fort Derussy in one direction or 10-15 minutes down Kalakaua Ave to shopping and restaurants. You can see the Friday night fireworks on the beach from the Luana pool area too. The room was spacious and comfortable; the wine and cheese tasting the evening we arrived was a real treat. It's next to a beautiful park and we enjoyed walking there every day. It was easy walk to get to all the pick up places for the tours we took. I wouldn't hesitate staying here again!

My family and I stayed here for 7 nights and we loved every second of it.We loved:1- the very polite and cool staff (hi to Ebony and Erik)2- the very clean room - housekeeping Elsie was awesome!3- valet people were very nice and careful with our vehicle4- guest laundry, loved it and reasonable price too5- free use of their computer and free document printing. This helped a lot when we needed to print our boarding passes ahead of time.6- awesome unlimited blu ray dvd rentals!7- loved our one bedroom suite, full kitchen complete with everything!!!!!We regret that we did not have time to use the pool, yoga classes, wine and cheese, and beach stuff rentals.We will definitely stay at this hotel again! My toddler actually called this hotel her home because that's how comfortable she felt staying in it.

With so much to see and do we used the Concierge , Tyler, to help us decide what to do and with Helicopter tour--Pearl Harbor--A Luau--North Shore Excursion--Tour around the Island --Swap Meet (Flea Market)-- Waikiki Beach -- Turtle Bay-- Shrimp Truck- Snorkeling and lots of WALKING we had our vacation of a lifetime. Thanks Tyler !!!!!! The Hotel surpassed itself with beach chairs-umbrellas-Towels-Wake Boards --We even had one of the employees do a rain dance to stop the rain on our last day and it worked..

We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Luana in a spacious and comfortable 1 bedroom suite. The location was great - close to the beach and shops but just enough away from them to be a little more peaceful. The roomy kitchenette contained everything we needed, the bed was comfortable and the lovely view from the balcony over the park to the ocean gave us a great view of the Friday night fireworks. Touches like the wine and cheese receptions and yoga made our stay very special. My whole family enjoyed the yoga sessions with Chenoa who made us all feel welcome and whose yoga left us feeling relaxed. Even the rocking chairs out the front of the hotel to wait for a cab or shuttle show the small details which give this hotel a real personal touch.

We just stayed at Luana Waikiki for 3 nights and booked based on the good reviews. On driving to the hotel, we passed a building site next door and Gas station, right next to the hotel so first impressions weren't great. I asked when checking in that we didn't have a view of either of these but we did and couldn't change rooms. However, we had a room on the 9th floor and my initial worries disappeared. The view of Waikiki was great with the ocean peaking though. The balcony is very small and not good if you don't like heights. The room was good, not plush and a little dated maybe in the bathroom but it suited us fine for a base in Waikiki. The location is perfect, 8-10 minutes walk (depending on how slow you are) to Waikiki beach. All the top shops are within spitting distance from the hotel, Tiffanys, Chanel, Gucci etc and out favourite bar, Arnold's was 2 minutes walk. We never had a problem with the elevators. My only complaint would be the buffet breakfast we had included at Waikiki Gateway. We went on our first morning and didn't bother again. Most of the food is inedible and doesn't look very appealing. It was good for coffee/tea and toast and the staff were nice but I wouldn't bother with this option again. It would be nicer if the hotel could offer something instead.

Stayed here for five nights 9.18.15 great location easy walk to beach, restaurants and if you must shopping. There is no in house restaurant/ breakfast, but plenty of outlets nearby. Our room a/c was noisy which made for uncomfortable sleeping, this was our only negative. Staff are exceptionally helpful. You must go to the wine and cheese events for easy conversations and relax.

My husband booked this hotel for our anniversary. He ended up accidentally booking a regular room instead of a suite since our friend would be staying with us. So when we got there we asked about upgrading to to find us something bigger and he found us a great suite with a full kitchen! And you can rent movies, borrow bikes and boogie boards which was great! I'd definitely come back. And to Jordan, thank you so much for making my stay so great.

This is a sacred place to be in the midst of commotion and the never ending tourist noise of Waikiki, you won't hear the hustle bustle of shopping and clanging of new building going up -- I hope it remains so! (But with my review, I guess it'll be out there along with everyone else who has found this secret little inn.) Starting with the location -- it's perfect. It's away from the crowd and all the noise going on around town in Waikiki. The people who work here -- every single one -- is professional and courteous. You want something: they jump to help. It's a very interenational clientele as well. The slow moving & quiet vibe of this hotel helps keep everyone in a sort of Zen zone. (In fact, it's a riot but there is this little bird chirping noise with a waterfall background in my room to help me sleep. Is that cool or what!) The pool is clean and quiet. BBQ stations and fitness center are up to date and well maintained. Rooms are superbly kept. There is a small kitchen in the suite with plenty of room. Every monrning there is coffee and tea and certain receptions are held for guests during the week. Yoga once a week on the terrace in the early morning brings sun worshippers together for an hour of meditation. I'm here now and wish I could stay for a few more nights. It's perfect. Thanks to everyone here who keeps this lovely hotel so well maintained and makes it a special little gem in the crazy-busy city of Waikiki in Oahu, Hawaii

We stayed in a partial ocean view studio after getting an upgrade. Loved the room and the ocean view was much more than partial! Room was spacious with a decent size fridge and all kitchen items you could need. There was a lovely fragrance in the room from freshly laundered curtains. Loved the Hawaiian themed rooms. Housekeeping team friendly and efficient. Enjoyed the wine/cheese reception Mon-Wed-Fri at 5pmand we met lots of other guests at these. Free movies from dispensing machine, Playstation in our room, beach towels, seats and umbrellas also free to use. Complimentary coffee/tea available till mid morning in the foyer plus cool drinks available later. Free shuttle to Ala Moana centre each hour. Pool was lovely with plenty of sun lounges and seating plus several cabanas If you want some shade. This hotel is in a great location within a short walk of many restaurants and it is easy to join various tours at nearby hotels. We stayed for 11 nights and would love to stay at Luana next time we are in Hawaii.

My 1st time to Hawaii....I found the Luana while trolling the internet for possible hotels to stay in in Waikiki. The Luana appealed to us as the price was right. I didn't exactly know how a boutique hotel worked, but I am so glad I picked this place. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful as I had many questions about my little piece of home for the next week. Our room was spacious, very clean and had a beautiful view. We were close to shopping, Waikiki Beach and various places to eat. Heck, even the car rental place we used was just about right across the street. We are planning another trip later this fall and will be returning to the Luana for their fabulous service!

Let me start off by saying that I am pretty easy to please and I don't consider a fancy hotel a necessity. I want a room that is nice and clean and comfortable. I booked this room based on all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. I wanted to love it.I am sitting in my room as I write this.Pros: love the location. Quick walk to anything you need as well as the beaches. Our room (909) has a beautiful view of the Ocean and its comfortable and spacious. We have a kitchenette and its great. The people who work here are super friendly and helpful. Gym is good. Wine and cheese nice. Cons: Our room has not been made up until at least 2 pm every day. Today we came in from the rain after being out from 7 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. and our room was not done. We didn't have fresh towels and we wanted to shower again due to being soaked from the rain. When they finally came (she knocked once and walked in - I was in my bra and underwear!) we asked for a few minutes (to dress) and then vacated the room. But the housekeeper was gone but her cart was there. So we went back in the room, cleaned it up, tossed our towels in a heap, emptied our pails (which didn't get emptied every day by the way) and we took clean towels off the cart and trash can liners to put in the pails. When she got back (15 minutes later) we told her to forget it. We did it ourselves. She was very sweet and smiling and thanking us. But really?The tub is slippery....really dangerous. I can't believe they don't put a rubber mat down.The beach chairs, while "free", which is nice, are very uncomfortable. Get there early if you want beach umbrellas. One day my husband went down to get an beach umbrella at 7:00 in the morning and we were told there were none left...at 7:00 a.m.?? There is a Playstation (not a DVD player) in the room. Ours didn't work and they sent someone to fix it but who clearly didn't know what he was doing. They then tried replacing it with another one that didn't work. Eventually someone figured it out (thanks Michelle!) But not until we realized that the PS3 was actually ruining the DVDs (which we brought from home). They were nice about it though and very apologetic, offering to waive the daily $15 a day fee.The elevators are bizarre as well as slow as can be. You push the button and wait thinking that the elevator is on its way. When you look again, the button is no longer lit. They were working on one while we were here and I think the service elevator may be broken so sometimes you are riding the elevator with the housekeeping staff and dirty linens. Plus the hallways are not air conditioned, so you are waiting in the heat.Again, the people are very nice and courteous. But I really don't think I'd choose to stay here again.

Stayed for a couple days in Sept and it couldn't have been more pleasant. Rooms are large they have a REDBOX-like system stocked with the latest DVDs included at no additional cost. Same goes for bicycles and beach gear - a real money saver because the cost of rental chairs on Waikiki is crazy. The staff were pleasant, professional, and responsive. All of this at a very good price for the area. No doubt that this will be the hotel I use next time as well.

I wrote a previous review but it seemed it has been deleted without my consent. Instead of rewriting a length review I'll just do a quick short one in case this one is also deleted for who knows what reason. Customer Service: all staff were friendly and helpful except for a few at the front deskValet: why is it only valet only?! It cause major back up when checking out and checking in when there is one person grabbing the car and another standing there telling us to wait. I rather have access to the car whenever at whatever time I please EASILY and without having to WAIT.Major cons: house keeping starts at 8:00AM, the complimentary bikes are outdated and unsafe, the pool is small, there's no restroom in the gym room, there's no stairs in sight just in case you rather take the stairs then the elevator(which is extremely slow given they have 3!), the laundry room doesn't have a coin changer or vending machine to buy detergent/softener, the ice vending machine is ONLY on the 1st floor.

This is a nice hotel in the heart of Waikiki, and the staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. My room was clean and comfortable, and I could see the mountains and the ocean from my balcony. Ft. DeRussy beach is only an 8-minute walk from the hotel, and if you're up for a longer trek, you can walk to Waikiki beach. There are also a lot of shops and eateries within walking distance of the Luana. And if you like high-end shopping (think Tiffany's, Chanel, Gucci, Hermés, Harry Winston, etc.), Waikiki is the space to be. The Luana offers a shuttle, as well, and it makes stops/pickups at a number of the Aqua-brand hotels in Waikiki, so it's easy to get around the area.

The room was ready way later than we were told, screwing up other plans. Then it was the wrong kind of room..one bed instead of two. And on top of all that the agents were rude. Then we heard they were only half full from an employee in the elevator. Lots of places to stay in Honolulu. Do Not Stay Here !!!

We stayed for 3 days before our cruise. Everyone was welcoming, efficient, and our room very clean and away from the busier areas of Waikiiki. Sunny, the Guest Service Mgr, Rudy, the GM, Elton and Jacqueline were superb hosts and made us feel most welcome. We enjoyed 2 of their social hours with wine and beer and lovely enterainment. The fireworks on Friday were a nice treat.....easily viewed from pool deck. Tyler, our concierge, was most helpful in scheduling restaurants and excursions. We had a mini suite with partial ocean view, small kitchenette area, sofa and table, and was perfect for our stay. Easy walk to beach and restaurants. We would recommend this hotel if you prefer not to be in a big hotel with all the hustle and bustle. ` Aloha! K & G

We had an enjoyable stay at the Luana, the service was great, location pretty good and the pool lovely after hot days out. The happy hour was a nice touch. Hawaii in general isn’t the cheapest place so we found the Luana to be pretty good value. Nice and clean place.

We are currently staying for two weeks at Luana; from 5th to 19th Sept.Positives: Tyler is very friendly and helpful booking tours.Staff have also been friendly.Prime position away from congestion of Waikiki.Nice location near park, within walking distance of everything. Poolside is relaxing.Rooms are spacious and clean.Negatives:Poolside very hot without umbrellas supplied.Kettle and tea making facilities would be great.Microwave in rooms would be ideal.Non-smokers but have had cigarette butt left on patio since arrival.Beds squeak.First floor not ideal as there is no view.Would recommend a stay here possibly on a higher floor, having booked for two weeks it would have been nice to have been offered a higher floor even if only for a week...People have told us they have a nice view on their higher floors....Would love the opportunity to see what they mean...Thanks Michelle and Deb

The price was really good, had a kitchen with 2 burners and all the necessary items to cook. Walking distance to the heart of Waikiki, yet was quiet enough for really relaxing stay. Very happy with property. Parking is $35/day and concierge service, so they park your rental for you. Nice that you walk across the street, and the bus station is on Kuhio. The front desk was very nice and helpful to parents, and they really seemed to care about your stay. Nothing fancy, but all the necessary things you need. I would stay again at the property.

Great place to stay, only two blocks from beach. You can walk anywhere from this location. Lots of great places to eat. Room was very nice, had small refrigerator but would have liked a microwave. Used concierge - Tyler to help with tours. Tyler took care of everything and had great ideas. When Tyler was out, Johnny was at the desk and was able to help with ensure we knew where to be and when. Luana has beach towels upon request and you can get beach chairs, mats or even a bike if needed. On third floor so did not have an ocean view but was not in the room much with beach so close. Also Aqua shuttle took us lots of places as well on their standard path they helped get you close enough to walk lots of places.

My family and I stayed here this Labor Day weekend. It's definitely one for the books. We stayed in the two bedroom suite that includes full kitchen and living room, 2 full baths, washer & dryer, and not to mention the HUGE balcony that overlooked the city. This property is conveniently located near, dinning, shopping, and walking distance to the beach. It includes great amenities; DVDNow (unlimited movies & PS3 games), complimentary Waikiki shuttle service, daily newspaper, in room coffee, in room safe, water in lobby, fitness centers, pool, laundry, valet, and WIFI. Upon arrival my family and I were greeted with warm aloha from Adam (Valet attendant). We arrived earlier than expected; since our suite was ready the front desk complimented an early check in. On our way to our suite, the ever so sweet housekeeper in the 7th floor before even entering our suite welcomed us and asked if we needed anything. The next morning, as we proceeded with our day, there is water, tea, fresh coffee in the lobby. Our second night we utilized the grill to bbq right next to the pool. For our last day we had a later flight, the front desk again complimented a late check out, based on availability. To Sunny, Jace, Elton, and Ebony, thank you for your exceptional hospitality and customer service. Thank you for making us feel at home, and exceeding our expectations. Our family cannot wait to plan another vacation and stay at Luana Waikiki.

I wanted to be perfectly satisfied with my stay at the Luana, really I did. The reviews sounded perfect, and I was congratulating myself on another TripAdvisor win when we pulled up late at night last week. The lobby is in good shape, and the initial greeting and setup were quick and professional. However, our room (420, in case anyone cares) was in very shabby condition. The draft excluder at the front door of the room was cracked and broken, making a loud dragging sound. The dresser was worn, the wardrobe was missing a knob, and was covered in plastic shreds and dust. The shower was funky, with a rusty head and tricky controls, making a cool shower a near-impossibility. The door to the lanai was a fire door, not sliding and had dirty broken stucco. My four year old easily stuck his head between the rails on the lanai, which seems like a lawsuit waiting to happen, and meant the door stayed shut most of the time (but not locked, as the lock opened from the inside automatically). The AC was hugely loud, as previously mentioned in other reviews.You got a sense they focused their efforts on the common areas in terms of updating and cleaning, but I also noticed the employee door right by the concierge desk was very dirty and needed a paint job. The staff were friendly and efficient, although the concierge looked like he wished he was anywhere else but there most of the time. The wine and cheese reception was awesome, the beach towels, the pool, all other amenities were in good shape.My only other sour note was that the beaches were closed in Waikiki due to sewage the morning of our first day. Not the hotel's fault AT ALL, obviously, but the only reason I knew about it was because I happened to look at the front page of a newspaper in the lobby. The staff checked me out the towels without a word, and it was only when I went back and asked them that they acknowledged the situation. Eventually, someone in charge put up a notice, but it took a full day after the incident.Maybe there are other rooms that are better, and we got the crappiest room (which we paid full advertised price, so it wasn't a cheapo deal or anything). Maybe Aqua taking over meant the budget for maintenance was cut, I don't know...but overall I was disappointed.

The stay here was pleasant. The staff was great from concierge, front desk, house keeping, maintenance etc. Everyone was great! I was on the 5th floor and had the side facing the gas station. Not the prettiest few if you looked down, but it was a great view of you looked out to the horizon. There's a hotel fee of $15 per night that includes WiFi access, pool towels etc. The hotel has a complimentary wine and cheese social a few nights each week. The rooms aren't fancy, but they are clean and the amenities include the basics. The ac can be loud if you're not accustomed to noise, but for us it wasn't an issue. Overall at had a very pleasant stay. The pictures below are the views from my room. Enjoy!

This hotel really tries, but for what we paid, it's seriously overrated. The staff are definitely friendly and mostly helpful, but this is a very basic hotel at a busy intersection, with a few minor frills. The rooms are small, and the beautiful vintage furniture is somehow lost next to the more recent upgrades in the kitchenette and bathroom areas, incongruous with the gorgeous lobby areas. Even though we supposedly had a special rate, we had friends who stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki for only $25 more per night (also a special rate), with full blown resort amenities.There were no bellhops, no restaurant, and the elevators were slow. We couldn't get on the internet at first. The receptionist said it was my browser, which I knew wasn't true. When the "technical support" came, she was just a regular maintenance worker who didn't know anything more than the front desk. I finally called Time-Warner Cable, and they found that our internet access point was saturated with too many users, probably long gone. Since it isn't password protected, it might have been freeloaders outside the hotel. After it was working, the internet was still slow at times.When we asked for a cab reservation for the next morning, the receptionist said the cab could be called on the spot. We asked for a reservation anyway. The next morning, we found that no reservation had been made. Also, the cab company they use has cabbies who barely speak English. They don't understand what you need and end up wasting your time and charging you more.We stayed for 2 weeks, and our first room overlooked a gas station and the lanai door let in all the busy street and construction noise. When we asked for another room, they were able to change it, but only a few days later. The new room was much better, but we had to do a ridiculous rigamarole of getting ALL our stuff out of the first room, checking out, and only then putting stuff into the new room -- even though the new room was already made up! An incredible hassle, esp without any bellhops and one person moving two people's stuff. No other hotel ever made me do that. On the positive side, the reception did manage our complicated billing arrangements efficiently and cheerfully.The kitchenette area was a nice surprise, and when we asked about a microwave, to our shock, they sent one up. So that does add value. The maids are really friendly, and the hula at the wine reception was lovely.Overall though, this place is seriously overrated and shouldn't have a Tripadvisor Certificate of Excellence, unless you're really paying a discount rate. But to their credit, when I said so in my customer survey, I was pleasantly surprised by a quick response refunding our hospitality fees, so they really do try to make you happy. Luana has a lot of potential, but it just wasn't the relaxing time I'd expected.
user_name:
Andri07
New York City, New York

review_body: Our first stay in Waikiki. Stayed for 6 nights. The hotel is not located in the waterfront, but only 5-10 min. walk from the the more nice and quiet end of Waikiki beach. The rooms are nice with kitchen, microwave and refrigurator. A/C is unfortunately a little noisy. The hotel offers complimentary lend of DVD's, boady-boards, beach chairs, folding bikes etc. which is great! Furthermore they offer complimentary vine and cheese every Mo/We/Fri 5-6pm. The concerierge Tyler was a great help in planning our stay on Oahu with a loy of good reccommentations on beaches and places to visit and especially that he made us aware of the fact, that we should book our Pearl Harbour visit in advance.

This hotel is on Kalakaua Ave just as you enter Waikiki, on the right. Very centrally located, only two blocks to BeachWalk. Very nicely appointed and very hospitable with wine tasting, Hawaiian music, yoga classes, etc. When we reserved, we asked for a 1 BR with Kitchen, and were delighted to get Suite M500, the private residence suite on the Mezzanine floor, at the front of the hotel. It is probably close to 900 sq ft, finished with terra cotta floor tiles and what looked like real Koa wood doors, trim, and cabinets. The kitchen had everything except an oven.Huge fridge, dishwasher, two commercial hot plates, and all the utensils and plates,etc, you would need for 4. The one bedroom had a queen bed that actually was comfortable for my back. The living room had a queen size Murphy fold down, plus a long sofa that dropped into sleeping bed as well. The bathroom is huge, with walk in shower and ample room for storage for long term stays. This must have been the manager's private residence at one time. You can hear some sidewalk and street noise in the early morning and evening, but Waikiki is pretty quiet all night long and it was not a problem at all. The Pool and BBQ area are 1 floor up and in the back of the hotel, overlooking Ft. DeRussey park and the ocean in the back ground. No other hotels or buildings in between. The sun deck is nice for afternoon sunning.

We arrived a day early for our vacation to Oahu and were supposed to be staying in the Hale Koa military resort. They didn't have room for us, so they placed us in the Luana. And boy oh boy was I ever glad. We arrived on a Thursday and were told there would be a wine and cheese tasting at 6pm down in the lobby. What a wonderful surprise after a long flight over from the states. The kids found the pool, which although small, was fine. The rooms were tiles which was nice. But, the best feature for us, was the kitchenette. If I had known the Hale Koa didn't have a microwave or sink, I would've asked to remain at the Luana. We were able to cook breakfast there and reheat things. Also, in the morning there was complimentary coffee and tea downstairs set out nicely. The staff were so kind, and very helpful. And I loved the sheet of restaurants we should try in the area that were not tourist traps. Close to the beach, shopping to the right, and all the strip restaurants. Would definitely come here again.

Stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. The front desk staff were great and very helpful. It was a short walk through the park to Waikiki Beach or Hilton Hawaiian Village. There is a $15 a day resort fee but that includes a lot (beach chairs, beach towels, yoga classes, bikes, wine and cheese reception, etc). We had a one bedroom suite (room 507). It was very nice and had a full kitchen. There is a rental car lot and an ABC store across the street. The hotel lobby, pool area and all common areas are beautiful. I will say that our room looked a little dated. It could use some new cabinets and furniture. Overall it was a great experience and we would stay here again.

This was our first stay at Luana and absolutely love this hotel, had the most wonderful staff very friendly and helpful. I wish I could remember everyone's names starting with the valets, bell service, guest service, housekeeping (for lack of a better word). We enjoyed the Friday night wine and cheese happy hour and Lyzz was the hula dancer and I'm sorry I don't remember the musician's name absolutely beautiful music and dance. I'm now looking forward to another stay cation at your wonderful hotel for the 63 annual Wiakiki hoolaulei.Thank you

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights last week. We are celebrating our 40th anniversary. We had a one bedroom suite.The room was very nice. The front desk staff was very friendly and attentive. Very nice fitness center and free yoga by the pool. We also attended the welcome wine and cheese reception. It was amazing, the wine and cheese were endless and the hula dancer and guitarist were a nice touch.We really enjoyed the proximity to so many places. We could walk to Waikiki Beach, the park at Ft DeRussy and the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The rental car (Dollar/Thrifty) and the ABC convenience store are right across the street. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We booked our 4 night stay through Costco Travel and it was a good value. Included a lei greeting from a representative at your gate, shuttle from and to the airport, buffet breakfast daily at the Waikiki Gateway Hotel across the street (normally $12.95 pp per day) and taxes. The only exclusion is the $15 per day resort fee which covers wifi (each room had their own wifi account), yoga classes at 7:45 am on certain mornings, wine/cheese gatherings on the Mezzanine level 3 times a week, dvd/PS game rentals, shuttle down Kalakaua Ave and to Ala Moana Center, beach chairs and bikes. Tried twice to borrow the bikes but a big family beat us to it. Attended the wine and cheese gathering twice - the musician/ukulele player/singer and the hula dancer were very good. The shuttle to Ala Moana takes 45 minutes so we took the bus instead which takes 5 minutes plus a 5 minute walk ($2.50 per person, exact change only, buses do not give out change). Got checked in early by Alan and Elton who were very friendly and gave us recommendations of places to eat since our room was not yet ready. Returned at 2:30 pm, room still not ready and we waited in the lobby until 3:30 pm for the room. It was peak check-in time so the staff was much less relaxed during this period.There is a rental car agency at the 24-hr gas station to the right of the hotel and a Dollar rental car across the street.The room was a nice size, strong air conditioner blocked out the street noise even from the 10th floor, lots of storage, plenty of lighting. We did not get bath towels one day, called reception, housekeeping brought up freshly laundered, still warm towels in 10 minutes.There is an ABC store nearby (they are on every other block it seems) and a Whaler's grocery store across the street. The gas station has a small shop and some hot food as well (fried chicken and a few other fast food items aside from spam musubi).There was a small white pigeon that walked into our unit from the lanai one morning when we left the door open to bring our wet sandals outside. We gently chased it back out the door. The next few mornings, we would see it peeking at us from the balcony. Luckily, we are not afraid of birds :-)Overall, a very nice stay.The hotel

This hotel is a secret gem at Waikiki. Great location away from the main shopping/traffic area, just inland (mauka) from the best park in the area, and at the edge of Waikiki. Easy walk to the beach. Very clean and organized. Nice little pool with view of the Friday night fireworks, and even a decent weight room. Kitchen sink, fridge, and some dishware in the room. Lots of benefits, including free use of beach towels and chairs, wine and cheese night a couple of times a week, free wi-fi, shuttle service, and more. The staff was always friendly and helpful with directions, and even the tourist activity booking agent was great. I used him to book activities for my older teenagers even though I hadn't planned on it. I love the location, midway between central Waikiki and Ala Moana. The price was also very competitive. I have stayed here twice now for week long stays, and I will do so again. Credit to the maintenance staff too, as the A/C leaked a little on the floor one night, I mentioned it to the front desk, it was fixed, and worked perfectly after that.

Luana Waikiki is such a great place to stay! Elton at the front desk was most helpful when we checked in and all other staff that we had dealt with were equally as professional. The rooms are generously sized, clean, comfortable and quiet. The resort offers a lot that other places don't, such as coffee and tea every morning then iced water infused with cucumber and mint thereafter in the lobby for guests - which is a nice touch after your flight and the Waikiki heat! The resort also offers bike hire and on site Volvo car rentals, a wine and cheese reception, yoga classes, shuttles to Ala Moana, DVD/PS3 rentals...all available to guests at no extra cost! I don't know any other resort that can offer all that. The resort is conveniently located close to Waikiki beach, away from all the noisy high rise hotels. I highly recommended staying at Luana Waikiki!

Jessica and Ebony at the front desk were phenomenal! The hospitality was exceptional. It really me feel like I was home! I was there for work for a rather lengthy stay so it was a relief to know that I had a home away from home.

Here for 2 month at the hotel it is clean and comfortable and convienent , most importantly the hotel people are wonderful.. Ebony and Jessica have been great at the Front desk, Thank you for all the great local advice.

LOCATIONYou aren't on the beach at Luana, but you are a 3 minute walk from it. I appreciate this location, as you can easily walk to the beach, shopping or many restaurants. There is an ABC Store (convenience store) across the street, and a gas station right next door. I drive a lot when I'm in Hawaii, and Waikiki is notorious for its traffic. This is at the end of the strip, making getting in and out of the hotel and back on the H-1 pretty easy. Valet is $35/night. This is standard for Waikiki, so no complaints. If you are DoD/military and need to save money, you can look into parking at Fort Derussy behind the hotel, which should be about half the cost and a reasonable walking distance. ROOMThe rooms at Luana Waikiki are a bit dated, but very clean. They have Hawaiian decor. This didn't bother me, even though I am used to staying in more modern business hotels. Wifi functioned great, except on my Kindle (Amazon problem, not Luana), which ended up being fine as Starbucks was a hop skip jump away. No problems with A/C. Great housekeeping. They don't wash your dishes for you in the kitchenette as others have mentioned, but I would agree with this. It is time consuming for housekeeping staff, and as adults.. we can wash our own dishes we dirty. Comfy bed. Good water pressure. Can you really ask for more?AMENITIESYoga, pool, fitness center, wine reception, yada yada. I didn't use any of these, as I was there on business, but the activities seemed nice. Activities desk staff seemed helpful to guests that were looking to get off property. STAFFAs others have said.. Adam from valet was phenomenal! He remembered my name and vehicle every day, and we enjoyed a lot of good conversation. He brightened up my days, which I needed as a single business traveler. Ebony was sweet, and went above and beyond to help me get a letter drafted to my employer explaining that valet is the only parking option (so that it wouldn't be viewed as excessive). The friendly staff make this good hotel great.Next time I'm in Hawaii I won't hesitate to return. I spent 20 nights here, so I have a good feeling for the hotel. Good for long term stays (request kitchenette), and families. You could make breakfast and lunch every morning, and would be a good budget option if you've got a lot of mouths to feed. Thanks Luana for the fantastic experience! Can't wait to return!

We are here on military orders. So we have been staying here over a month and we always look forward to how Adam treats us when he pulls out our car. Everyone at the Luana hotel is friendly but Adam is at the top of our list.

The location is the best part of this hotel. We checked in early, so our room wasn't ready, which was expected since check in is at 3pm. We had requested for two beds way back in April when we booked the trip, but they didn't have any available, so they gave us a roll-away bed for free, which was nice. However, our studio was small, so with the queen bed, the pull-out sofa bed, and the roll-away, it was very tight. We had to make sure to stand the roll-away bed up so that we could maneuver around the room. Breakfast was served across the street at another hotel. We had buffet vouchers from Costco, so that was nice. The $15/night resort fee was fine since it covered Wi-Fi, the manager's reception, which included wine, cheese, and crackers, and DVD rentals. On our second to the last night, the water went out on the whole property. They got someone there right away, but apparently they also needed to get an electrician. My friends and I went out to dinner hoping that the water would be back on by the time we came back. It wasn't. Anyway, the water didn't come back on until either the middle of the night or very early in the morning. We know because we kept checking up until 11 pm, and then one of us went to the bathroom past midnight, and the water still wasn't working. Although this situation was beyond the hotel's control, I feel that they should have removed at least one night's resort fee. They did not do anything to compensate for the lack of water. No one could shower or anything from at least 7 pm on that evening. The way a few people at the front desk handled it was quite blasé, like it was no big deal. It was.Another thing, the elevators here are the slowest I've ever experienced. It was always hot in the hallways (maybe to save electricity), but sometimes it was uncomfortable. Enough people probably complained for them to get maintenance to take a look at the elevators. After that, they were much more efficient, though still slow (especially compared to the next hotel we stayed in). I did like the fact that there was a laundry facility in the premises. I hated that the pool closed so early.

Clean, quiet, comfortable, close to everything and lovely staff. We spent only 3 nights in this hotel, but we really enjoyed it! We had time to go to the yoga by the pool and it was wonderful! The size of the room and the amenities were perfect! Very good hotel for the price! I highly recommended!

Our family of 10 adults are just back from 6 nights at the Luana. We had a 1 bedroom oceanview on level 6 and a two bedroom on level 7! This offered good value for money. It was perfect for our base... Rooms spacious and even the sofa beds in these rooms were comfortable for adults! Jessica and Elton very helpful at reception. Two not such good features are that the lifts are very slow though one out of action for the first few days didn't help! Also no air con in halls and so waiting for lifts and in lifts very hot! Air con in rooms very noisy but we still slept with it on! All in all very good value for money!

The hotel is few blocks away from Waikiki beach. There are lot of stores for shopping on Waikiki and everything is walkable from the hotel. The hotel is clean and has good pool. We were there for 3 nights and didn;t have any problem.Hotel elevators are really slow. You will be made to wait for few mins before the elevator arrives. Concierge at the hotel provides useful information about things we can do around all Islands.
user_name:
Sivankar M
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Reserved an Ocean view Suite. Unfortunately 5th floor is not high enough to see the Ocean. Asked if a higher room or a room with two beds would be available later and was told NO. I find it unfair that I had to pay for a Ocean view suites and didn't get it.

This is a nice hotel, but I think for the cost, I would prefer to be closer to the beach. It is in an odd location between a small park and busy street. The rooms were clean, large and nice. There was a pool on the second or third floor deck area, a nice bar/restaurant and a big lobby. I enjoyed my stay here with my family renting rooms in the same hotel. However, if they had not already booked rooms here I would have rather paid for a room on the beach for the same amount. This hotel was family friendly and good for tour groups. I would recommend it if you want quality over location.

We spent a week at this condo hotel before our cruise. It was a short walk from the beach and close to the main shopping area. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool and took part in a Meet and Greet with wine tasting. It exceeded our expectations and we would certainly return.

This hotel was a very nice place to stay. Family values. The housekeeping was outstanding. The staff was friendly and had knowledge of their jobs and they helped when you needed help on certain things. It was a really nice, clean, place to stay

We stayed at a one bedroom suite. Everything was great, the location, the view from our bedroom. Excellent amenities, like sunscreen at pool, yoga classes, wine tasting, wow all was great. Would stay there again. The only con is that the elevators could take long. Would stay there again, loved staying at Luana.

During the last week of July 2015, I had the opportunity to stay at the Luana Wakiki Hotel. I found the staff very accommodating, friendly, informative and efficient. The room was on the first floor facing the main street, therefore the noise was a little louder than I would like, especially when trying to sleep. The air conditioning was a little dated and loud, therefore I only used it to cool the room down and turned it off at night. Furthermore the furniture was also a little dated but functional. All in all if it wasn't for the room, the staff made up for the deficiencies.

We had planned a trip to Honolulu for a children's hula competition for 4 days and 3 nights. There was a total of 67 people in our immediate group not counting the many parents who also stayed at the Luana. The management team as well as the staff on duty was beyond amazing! We felt so welcomed and their attention to our care went above and beyond. Each day they asked our kids how they did and gave them encouraging words. The staff was so happy for them when they walked in the lobby holding trophies. We had a great time and will be back again next year!!

Enjoyed our 8 day stay at the Luana Waikiki. Had a nice feel to the whole hotel from the lobby to the room. Nice pool, gym and room was clean. Friendly helpful staff. Shuttle was great to use to get to Ala Moana. Loved the wine and cheese evenings. Easy walk to beach.Would definitely stay again.

Our family of three stayed here for 11 days. Friendly staff, prime location, great amenities for the value. The pool was nice, the walk is short and gorgeous to the beach, the fitness room is sufficient, but the manager's wine and cheese social three nights a week was the icing on the cake. We met great people there and the conversation would last well after the drinks did. The kitchenette gives you the opportunity to cook for yourself, the lanai had a great view, and again, a professional and courteous staff that made it a pleasure to stay. The decor of the lobby was a plus and the rooms and beds were comfortable. I wish we could take the lamps and dishes with us!

Stayed here for our anniversary. Booked the ocean view room with kitchenette. Excellent location, friendly staff, relaxing vibe. The gym and pool had great views. Yes, the a/c unit was loud but I wedged a small piece of paper between the rattling top and problem solved. This will be our hotel of choice when we return to the island.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki from Dec 16 to Dec 31, 2014. Coming in on an early flight from Tokyo, we sincerely appreciated the hotel allowing us a very early check-in. Initially, we had reserved a "kitchenette studio" but it was too small for our party of three, which included a very active two year old who needed space to play in the room.We immediately asked to be upgraded to a one bedroom for the remainder of the stay, and Sunny Chen and the front desk staff were able to move us to a one-bedroom for an extra fee. The one-bedroom was definitely worth the extra cost, particularly since it was nice to have carpeting in the bedroom, but I will say that depending on the room, the quality of the sofa bed varied considerably. The big beds were fine in all of the rooms. Due to the season, the staff had to move us around a bit, staying in the studio for two or three nights, then a one-bedroom on the 2nd (?) floor for a week, then back to the 9th floor studio for two days, and finally to an *amazing* one-bedroom with an enormous and luxurious balcony on the 14th floor for the last few nights. It was so nice that we wanted to stay in the room and not go out.Moving from room to room during the stay was inconvenient since we had to check out and in each time-- and wait for the next room to become available-- but the front desk staff were accommodating and unfailingly polite each time we requested an item that we had used in the previous room but was not available in the next room, such as dishwashing soap, a colander, a small broom, etc. Traveling with a toddler, I appreciated the little touches that made the hotel more family friendly, such as toys for guests to borrow from the front desk, small fish that guests could "adopt" for a night, and especially the coffee service in the mornings. Though the hotel was friendly to families, most of the families we saw had older children, and we did not see all that many babies or toddlers. Excepting a loud party in a nearby room one night, which the staff addressed, the hotel was pretty quiet, and neither the street noise nor the air conditioner noise was as loud as other reviewers had mentioned.The location next to Fort DeRussy park was also fantastic, since we could go to the beach in the mornings and play in the park in the early evenings. We frequented the cafe outside the lobby, but it sounds like the cafe is no longer there as of this writing. That is a shame, since it was a nice little cafe and great for breakfast before heading out to the beach!All in all, despite housekeeping issues that were quickly resolved by the front desk staff, we had a great stay. Many thanks to Elton, Ona, and Ebony, especially.

Took a trip to Honolulu in early July for a week. The Luana is a great boutique hotel in a safe location right next to Fort Drussey Park and all kinds of restaurants and shopping with in walking distance. It fit our needs perfectly.Loved the wine reception and all the extras. The hotel offers beach bikes, floats, noodles, beach towels, etc. We upgraded to the room with a kitchen which was very convenient, stores across street and next door to purchase snacks, drinks, etc.

this hotel made our trip even better, the rooms were very nice and clean. the staff was very helpful and kind. they are also in a great location, in walking distance from the beach and at the beginning of the strip so that you can do your shopping. wonderful hotel with wonderful people.

Great friendly hotel on the main road of Waikiki. An easy walk to main strip with restaurants aplenty. Beach not far away. Our 1 Br suite was spacious for our family of 4 and well located on the corner with 2 balconies looking out to the beach and surrounding parkland. Nice deep pool with plenty of lounges. Staff very helpful especially the concierge who recommended a Waikiki trolley tour which was awesome. Our room wasn't quite ready for us at check in so had to wait 30 minutes or so but the hotel clerk offered us free breakfast and waived the resort fee so that was appreciated. For the price paid this is an exceptional place to stay.

Friendly staff, clean room and good size swimming pool. Good location for beach,shopping and restaurants,would use this hotel again.This hotel being smaller than many others allows staff more time to advise and assist their customers which they do with ease.

So this place had some good and bad things about it. Mostly bad. Stayed here for 4 nights it was packaged into our trip from the Costco Trip package. We stayed in room 914.So let's get the good out of the way:+ Decent location. The beach is nearby and maybe a 5 minute walk. It's also close to the shops near the Royal Hawaiian.+ Free shuttle. The shuttle is trackable online and can be a way to travel around the city for free. E.g. from one Aqua hotel to the next aqua hotel.+ Happy hour on Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 5-6pm. This means free wine and cheese on those days on the Mezzonine.+ They offer free DVD rentals. The DVD collection is pretty good. They had recent titles like focus. They had a playstation that would let you play DVD's+ They offer two Weber grills to grill from on the patio on the first floor.+ Full Kitchen and kitchen appliances: Small fridge, toaster, + Partial Ocean view is as advertised. Had a decent view of the city and the ocean.+ Bed / Pillow was comfortable and cleanSo the bad parts:- This place is dirty. They rarely ever cleaned the floors when i was there. I was a slob and ate coconut chips and accidentally dropped them on the floor the first night. They were there the whole time. If they're going to have tile floors they should sweep them. As if they had carpet, normally they should vacuum it. A/C units should be cleaned. I didn't want to check out the filter. It already had dust on the outside of the vents of the AC unit. The green sofa had a stain on it. It was brown.- The curtains were rusty as well and dusty. I didn't want to touch them. There's rust near the top of it.- The complimentary breakfast package includes breakfast across the street at the gateway hotel. The breakfast buffet at the gateway hotel was at a dive karaoke bar. They served the same food everyday. It was rather dingy and should have just remained a karaoke bar and not a breakfast buffet. Read the reviews for the gateway hotel. It's pretty nasty there.- The elevators were always usually dirty as well. I've seen sand and trash on the floor most of the day.- The AC is nice and didn't bother me. It's just annoying because the hallways, fitness and main areas were never cooled with AC. The fitness center did have two AC units; but they would cool it certain times of the day. - The microwave is rather difficult to use. It's the worst microwave i've ever used- The most frustrating part is they offer beach towel rental. They gave us two key cards seperate from the room cards. So what happens is you give them two cards like monopoly money and they give you two towels. This should mean one should know how many towels to keep on hand. However, this isn't the case. Frequently at times, they would run out of towels. When we did get said towels 30-40 minutes later they were the short bath towels you get in the room. What's the point of waiting for that? Beach towels should be longer than three feet. I have a large bottom. I need the towel so that sand doesn't go everywhere where the sun doesn't shine. You're a hotel by the Beach. You should make it a priority to get beach towels. - They offer yoga classes. We woke up early for them and the instructor didn't show up.- The shower head sprayed everywhere. It need to be cleaned and properly maintained. - Pool was really small and was hot.- Wifi was spotty- $15 resort fee per day was not worth it for free wine and cheese, missing towels, and movies.Some ok observations+/- The travel guy at the desk was busy watching youtube videos of videogames. +/- Front desk would disappear behind the office. Regardless, sometimes helpful and sometimes not. Sometimes wouldn't answer the phone after the 6th or 7th ring.+/- Lack of dining choices nearby. +/- Offer gym; gym lacked space, was hotOverall, it's ok but not some place i'd want to stay again. I'd rather save up money and stay at it's nearby competitors. The other reviewers are encouraged to write reviews by the hotel staff. Wouldn't trust them because they lack concrete details.

Wow this hotel is lovely and so well priced with very friendly and helpful staff. They offer free yoga classes through out the week and three days a week have a relaxing wine and cheese get together for guests. I loved the private pool area complete with bar-b-q and the gym is so well equiped. They even offer a free bus to the large shopping centre that runs every 30 mins. Will be back and would recommend to everyone

We stayed here for our daughter's wedding. We had three rooms and were satisfied with all of them. The one bedroom suites were well-appointed and the kitchens were nice. The single hotel room was comfortable and has a coffee maker and small refrigerator. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The only disadvantage is that there is no restaurant for breakfast. However Eggs n' Things is around the corner for a fabulous breakfast or brunch.

This hotel was a 15 minute walk to the beach. It was also 15 minutes from restaurants like the cheesecake factory. Great location. the staff were friendly and helpful. The hallways in between the rooms were stifling hot, but the ac in the rooms themselves allowed you to get the temperature very very cold though. The room was clean, I really have to complaints regarding that. My one and only complaint was the fact that the music from the morning yoga class was so insanely loud, that it woke my 19 month old daughter, who was actually giving us a chance to sleep past 6am, at 730. So in turn, my husband and I were awake at that time too. It was very aggravating. Overall though, the hotel was wonderful aside from that, and we would definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Luana Hotel on our first trip to Honolulu. The hotel is in a great location, only a couple blocks from the beach. Check in was really efficient and quick, rooms and hotel are very clean and we were even given a microwave on request. Maid Service was a little disappointing, one day we left all day and our room was missed and a couple of the other days, maid service was done after we had been gone all morning and midafternoon and room was being cleaned while we were in the room. Wish the hotel had a restaurant. Pool, weight room and movie and game rentals were great to have on sight.

We have stayed at this property, now, three times. As returning guests, it is always a pleasure to feel so welcomed. Located adjacent to Fort DeRussy Park at the quiet end of the busy Waikiki strip, this boutique hotel offers excellent amenities, such as morning coffee and tea service in the lobby, Wine and Cheese receptions for guests on set days through the week, excellent pool, fitness centre and BBQ grills, and beach chairs and towels for the lazy hours of beach time. There is even a shuttle bus that can transport you to the famed Al Moana Shopping Centre. If you want just a quiet evening in one's room, DVDs and Video Game Rentals are available free of charge at a Mezzanine kiosk with a provided rental card from the front desk. These are the amenities that we enjoyed as part of the resort fee and during our one week's stay.Our studio kitchenette room was on a higher floor with park and partial ocean view.It was meticulously cleaned daily by a very efficient housekeeping staff. The front desk and bell staff staff are very accommodating, indeed. Truly, we can but only compliment the excellent management of this hotel.

I would agree with all the reviews before us. What I really miss in the room is a broom to wipe the floor so now and then, since going to the beach will bring some sand in the room. Since there is no daily cleaning that would be nice. Other thing to note: our room looks like it has a kitchen in it, but without the cooking part. Why not complete it? Other thing to note: the restaurant connected to the hotel is closed. So no breakfest here.. other then that really nice hotel. Perfectly situated. Nice staff, nice amenities. Towels and chairs for the beach.

Good value and good location. Wish it had a restaurant though. It has a decent free gym and a pool. The staff was helpful and the kitchens were equipped quite well. Like the wine and cheese Mon, Wed and Fri.

Upon arriving, my elderly parents and I were a bit weary and hoped for a speedy check-in. Not happening!!! There was a backup at the front desk and there seemed to be a common themes...guests were being told that the type of room they had reserved and PAID for was not available. We showed them the documentation that the hotel had sent us upon making our reservations and that made no difference. They continued to tell us, as well as others, that they can NOT guarantee the room type you reserve and pay for. They suggested my 80 year old parents sleep on a sofa bed!After a few very upsetting and tense moments we received the rooms we had reserved. So, then WHY all the drama??? The rooms are very dated. The tile floors turned our feet black within an hour of walking on them. The air conditioners are LOUD! But the worst was the fact that in the morning I woke up with multiple bug bites from the bed!!! I was so grossed out we couldn't wait to leave!Told our travel agent as soon as we returned home! NEVER stay here or beware!

This place is great. It's a good place for couples or families. It has a beautiful view and its only a few blocks from the Waikiki beach. Its has a great location but doesn't have a regular maid service. You have a pay extra for maid service. It has a shop on the property with low cost jewelry. It has a washer and dryer. My room had a small kitchen with everything already in it. I would stay here again.

We stayed at the Luana Hotel on our recent work trip to Honolulu. I have stayed at the Aqua hotels before. The hotel is in a great location, but it is very quiet, the rooms are very clean, the gym and pool are very nice. I would go back to this hotel again. The staff is excellent

We stayed here for one night prior to moving to the Aulani. Four of us shared a two queen bed room. It was tight, but did the job! It was very nice to have a small fridge and coffee maker. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was quite nice. I spent an hour in the fitness room and thought they had what most people would want. It's a nice downtown location. Staff was very nice. My husband left a favorite shirt in the closet. When we called they said that they had it and we could come get it. (Not sure why they didn't try to contact us about since they had our contact info.) When we went to get it they took FOREVER!! Some security issue with lost & found I guess.

At first we were disappointed at our room being on the 2nd floor but it still had great views and possibly the best balcony in the whole hotel. The one bedroom apartment we stayed in was lovely and had all the equipment you could ever want.The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in.All the staff were friendly and helpful especially Tyler Thurle on the concierge desk who was extremely knowledgeable in all the available tours and went out of his way organise a full and varied schedule.We felt very at home during our stay at the Luana and would return tomorrow if we could afford the flights!

After a very long flight from NYC to Honolulu, we were greet with champagne, fruits, crackers and cheese! The workers were so eager to accommodate all eight of us and were willing to offer us some great information about the area. The view from our hotel rooms were beautiful!
