It is walking distance from the shopping area and the beach. Only 15 minutes from the pier. I would like to thank Jose (the hotel's chef) for working so hard by putting together an awesome breakfast for us! I highly recommend this place!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights during our two day stay in Oahu during our three island visit of Hawaii for our anniversary. We found this hotel to be everything that TripAdvisor reviews had said it to be. ( I am now "paying it forward" because I appreciate the earlier reviews that helped us so much in planning our trip.)This hotel is well kept and is very reasonably priced. We found our upper level ocean view room to be well furnished and very clean. The hotel is set somewhat inland, so there is not a close ocean view, and the ocean can only be seen since than is an open (?park) area between the property and the beach. It is located in the downtown section of Honolulu. The rooms, in our opinion, need to be remodeled and newly refurnished as it appears that this has not been done in quite some time. However, for the price, we found this hotel to be a positive experience for what we wanted, which was mainly reasonably priced accommodations for our short stay to mainly see Pearl Harbor.Note: There seem to be an abundance of "young" people who stay at this hotel.

We loved the Luana! It was a very clean, comfortable and spacious hotel a block away from the beach. It was nice not having the hustle and bustle of beach goers being close enough to enjoy the views. The hotel has a great pool and fitness center as well as complimentary wine and cheese a few nights a week and other unique amenities. The rooms were very nice and very large. Great spot for couples or families.

Hotel was just what we wanted which was a base to sleep of a busy holiday schedule. The pool is quite small but this was perfect for us to go to relax before going out at night. The hotels shuttle bus was a brilliant way to get round and the hotel is on the trolley route so transport is no problem. A short walk through Fort De Russy and you are on the beach. Hotel supplies towels and beach chairs. The concierge was great took time to go over all available trips and then did all the booking. This hotel is great for those who do not want to be in a large hotel complex but want to get out and do their own thing. If you stay here and want a good meal at a reasonable price try Vits Hawaiian steak house just across the road really friendly place and pleasant place to relax after touring the island for a day.

We booked Luana through Costco Travel as a place to stay before and after our 7 day Norwegian cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small boutique hotel in the "Aqua" chain. The location is perfect in Waikiki and the staff are very competent and helpful. The rooms are spacious, clean and have excellent views. As a Costco traveler, we were upgraded both times without asking. I would highly recommend the Luana and would make it our destination on our next trip to Hawaii.

I am writing this review while I am at the hotel. So...fresh from the oven. Hotel location is excellent. Walking distance to the beach and prime shopping on Kalakaua Ave; and right across from an ABC store!! Check-in staff was courteous and helpful. The Expedia concierge at the lobby is helpful as well. You get to borrow beach towels, beach chairs and boards for free. Nice!!Now for the bad part : I am in a room with a kitchen. The house keeping does Not clean the kitchen!! Forget about the dishes, they don't even clean the kitchen counter or clear trash. Makes no sense. And their maintenance staff lack basic training in terms of courtesy. They walk in into an elevator with trash and cleaning carts when there are guests in the elevator. Has happened three times during my stay. These carts and trash stink and they don't understand that it is not a good practice to do that. And pls avoid the Pool and BBQ area at all costs. It's DIRTY like hell. And now for the Microwave. Pls enroll yourself into a PhD program at Berkeley or Stanford. You will need that to figure out how to work the microwave.

It was a 4th of July weekend. Yes we only stayed one night and yes I understand it was high occupancy since it is holiday weekend but a staff should not be promising what they can not deliver. First we reserved for two queens and did not get that is why is the roll away was to compensate the inconvenience but then when we got to the room after walking around for 6 hours the roll away was not delivered. There was no courtesy call saying they ran out of roll away due to high occupancy. We had to call the Front Desk and they informed us that they ran out and there was nothing they could do. In the end they offered to waive the resort fee after asking for who can I contact for complaints. Great room but not the best view. .... Social hour was a bonus! Just don't count on what is expected during high occupancy.

Jess at the front desk is AWESOME! She was so helpful, kind, and genuine. She always recognized us and did everything she could to make our stay comfortable and pleasant. Ryan made us feel right at home and put a smile on our faces with his hospitality and humor. The room was very clean, and we really enjoyed the small kitchenette. Our only suggestion would be to add a toaster. Our partial ocean view was beautiful. As we were on the 15th floor, we had a great view of the city, as well. The town is extremely congested and the traffic, at times, overwhelming; so the bikes (provided by the hotel) were extremely appreciated. My husband and I enjoyed many days and evenings riding the bikes around town and the beaches. Here's the catch and the only real disappointment we had were the high cost of parking and amenities fees. You'll pay an extra $50 each day of your stay to park and be able to use the Wi-Fi and bikes. There are also Yoga classes and a wine and cheese reception offered on certain days, free DVDs and Video Game Rentals, Ala Moana Shuttle, and a 10% discount at the Cafe Italia which serves breakfast in the hotel. There is access to the pool, fitness center, and BBQ grills on the 1st floor where you can also view the fireworks on Friday nights, which we weren't able to take advantage of, unfortunately. Breakdown: $35 parking and $15 amenities per day.I left a note for room service to leave extra coffee, creamer, and wash clothes each day, however, that never happened. Overall, we had a wonderful stay. It is my hope that this review can help others to get a more detailed "lay of the land" before they take refuge. Aloha and God Bless!

This hotel sits across a park area from the beach and is an easy walk--one street to cross. We stayed in a partial ocean view room on the 16th floor and looked across the park to the ocean in one direction, and in the other direction we had a city view--nice at night. The kitchen was adequate for preparing meals, but the pans were well worn. We did find a dirty fork in the drawer upon arrival, but the rest looked very clean (I prewashed everything we used--no policy posted about hotel cleaning of dishes). Dish soap and new sponge provided along with dish rack, towels and potholder. I did have to request that the floor be swept and it was done the same day. The bed was very comfortable!! Shower head needed replacing but worked well enough to get by. Breakfast was good in the cafe next to the lobby. Just a little slow taking our order. Beach towels and chairs were provided at front desk. Nice pool area. Shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance. Parking is expensive. Consider using local transportation and shuttles for getting around. Concierge was very helpful scheduling tours. Construction is being done on one side close to hotel which may cause a slightly longer walk depending on where you are going. Seems like Waikiki is always under construction!! Overall, a nice hotel in a good location with helpful staff.

I absolutely loved this hotel. The room has a very nice view and is very clean. You will not be disappointed. The kitchenette was nice. I was traveling with my 6 year old daughter and the hotel staff was so accommodating, professional and so friendly to us . A front desk representative by the name of Jessica was so helpful. Met some nice fellow patrons at the wine and cheese social that they provided for us. Although the hotel is not a beachfront property, it's only about a 15 minute walk to Waikiki beach. My daughter walked to the beach with no complaints. It's about a 20 minute walk to the Mall. You can take the hotel's Aqua shuttle bus to the mall which which goes there every hour. I highly recommend this hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel despite the fact that it's a couple of blocks from the beach. First, the ocean view rooms have a lovely unobstructed view of the ocean past the park. We actually liked the 5 minute stroll through the park to get to the beach. The room was generous for Waikiki with two queens and a kitchenette. The kids liked the small pool and free play station rentals. We went to eggs n' things for breakfast both mornings since it was was right around the corner. Great affordable stay in a clean hotel!

The hotel isn't the biggest, most luxurious on the island but it gets things done! The rooms are good and comfy. A bit noisy on the city view side but you are on one of the main streets in the city so it is understood. It is close to all the shops and a 5 minute walk to the trolly hub to get you to the best tours of the island.The staff were all helpful and available anytime we wanted them.Would definitely consider this place again when we return.

Got a one bedroom ocean view apartment which had great views of Honolulu as well. Comfy bed , great kitchen and Hawaiian decor. In a great location close to Waikiki shopping and just walk through the nearby park to Fort Derussy beach. Fantastic place, hope to stay again !

There are lots of fancier hotels in Waikiki, and you'll pay accordingly but this is a nice, quiet place with all the amenities you'll need located just a couple of blocks from the beach, close to shopping and just across the street from the pink and green line trolley lines. We had a third floor room overlooking the King Kalakaua Plaza. The two queen size beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows and the room was well equiped and well maintained. Kalakaua Avenue is a busy street, so there was some street noise, particularly early in the morning when the garbage bins were emptied. If you're noise sensitive you might want to ask for a higher floor or a room on the ocean side but the noise was really not a major problem for us. We stayed a week so the laundry room on the main floor was handy to have, as was the ABC store just across the street and the convenience store in the gas station next door.The pool is small but with Waikiki beach so close it also doesn't seem to get used a lot. The sun deck is quiet and kept immaculate as is the lobby and lounge area on the mezzanine where the manager hosts a wine and cheese reception on Monday, Wednesday and Friday evenings (both the Merlot and the Chardonnay were very nice).Ours was not one of the kitchenette units but it did have a sizable counter space, kitchen sink, mini fridge and coffee maker. All that would have been needed to make it perfect for the stay would have been a microwave.I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again on a future trip.

We stayed there for three nights and we would definitely stay there again. It isn't on the beach but easy walking distance to everything. The service is excellent and little attentions make it stand out. The wine and cheese is a great example where we were invited on our arrival; offered three times a week, it is an extra service offered to guests at no extra cost along with the wireless internet in the rooms. The rooms are kept clean, there is a pool, gym, etc. In a nutshell, great place to stay!

This hotel is a great hotel for a great price. The rooms are clean, staff very friendly and helpful, great location in Honolulu, and the price was perfect (plus the cheapest resort fee in Waikiki). The only problem is there is a gas station right next to the hotel with a bus stop and where lots of motorcycles fill up and rev their engines. Plus, the hotel is right on Kalakaua ave, which is a main thoroughfare for emergency vehicles. I highly recommend getting a room that is NOT on the city or mountain sides or on a lower floor. All that said, there is nothing the hotel can do about it. This is a great hotel, but like any hotel on Kalakaua, there is a noise problem making it feel like a big city hotel.

When you go on vacation, sleeping in a comfy place if a must after a long day of site seeing. The Luana is that type of place. It is situated perfectly in Waikiki. We stayed there for six nights and five days and really have no complaints about the place. It was quiet, clean and quiet. The beds were comfortable. Now the Hotel itself did seem a little dated and yes maybe the rooms were too, but again when you are on vacation, all you want from your hotel is a nice, quiet, centrally located, place to rest. The Luana more than fits that bill. My wife and I decided when we go to Hawaii again the Luana will definitely be our base of operations. Totally recommend.

We had previously stayed in a much larger hotel right close to Waikiki beach. It was VERY busy , both inside the hotel and on the street.This hotel is at the other end of Waikiki - and hence is away from the crowds. We found it to be a pleasure to stay here and to get away from the crowds.It is an admittedly older style of hotel - but is kept clean with a pleasant foyer. Staff were all excellent. I don't like the type of airconditioners used however as they tend to be noisy.

The lobby and room were exceptionally well appointed. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Even though we booked a "street side" room, we had beautiful views of the city and the ocean and it was very quiet. It's a great location to walk anywhere in Waikiki or to bus stops to get anywhere you want to go. I would definitely stay here again.

Our hotel was comfortable and the employees are friendly and helpful. Just keep in mind that in the modern day Waikiki, where hotels are near upscale shopping, one can expect to pay some dough. The resort fee does include some nice features like discounts at the restaurant and free access to the DVD rental kiosk.There's an excellent museum nearby, the Army Museum, that is free and full of interesting models and artifacts. It is only about a 5 min walk away.We had a car and the parking is valet only. Parking is at a premium in this part of town so be prepared to for additional charges if driving.

We picked this hotel after reading the TripAdvisor reviews. Firstly, we agree that the front desk staff were friendly upon check in and it stops here. The 'concierge' had given us incorrect information when we asked what is the best way to visit Diamond Head. He advised us we could catch bus 2 or 13 across the road and we lost 1.5 hours on our holiday when we caught bus 13. We just made it in time before the gates closed at 430pm. Secondly, the room was tidy and we were right next to the petrol station and facing the main road. Part of the park was cordoned off due to construction. Our mornings were very unpleasant with the level of noise coming from outside. The furniture is very worn and outdated just like the room itself. We noticed a few cockroaches in the room. The hotel is in need of a refurbishment with double glazed windows for rooms facing the main road.

This was my first time in Hawaii and I stayed at the Luana for 7 nights in a standard room on the second floor, facing Kalakaua Avenue, with really pretty views and it was nice to have breakfast on the lanai (two chairs and a table).The location is excellent. It's a short walk to the beaches, Ala Moana Shopping Centre (or you could take the courtesy shuttle) and other cafes and restaurants on South King Street.Walk 5 minutes through the park to get to Fort DeRussy Boardwalk, a great place start following the shoreline of Waikiki's beaches. The beaches closer to Fort DeRussy are quieter, for a change of pace.The yoga on the pool deck was great and sitting under one of the shady gazebos by the pool was a great way to unwind after a sunny stint on the beach. The Room was spacious and the mini fridge was quite large, although I would have liked a kettle in the room as I drink a fair bit of tea (tea & coffee is available in the lobby, but only in the mornings).The room was really clean; Housekeeping did a great job.I would definitely stay here again, next time in a room with a kitchen.

I was stationed in Hawaii on military duty and had an opportunity to stay at the Luana Waikiki for an extended stay. I couldn't imagine a better combination of location, amenities, and friendly staff. My room was extremely comfortable, with an incredible view of the nighttime city lights. Housekeeping was great with providing extra towels, changing sheets and pillow cases, etc. The front desk staff was always friendly and addressed any concerns immediately, and the bell service and valets always greeted me with an "Aloha." The main people I interacted with (and were awesome everyday) were: Rudy, Sunny, Jordan, Elton, Ebony, Kevin, James, Ryan, Ryan, Jace, and Adam. Rudy is the GM, Sunny is the Guest Services Manager, and I don't think they ever had a situation/reasonable request they couldn't accommodate. The Luana also has complimentary beach cruisers, a nice fitness center, a beautiful pool, bbq's, a business work center with two computers and printer, and a wine/cheese happy hour three days a week. This hotel was my home away from home, and it felt like family. Without hesitation, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone (families, singles, military, etc) who is visiting Hawaii ... you won't be disappointed!

Great place to stay.Reasonably close to everything.Hotel shuttle service to Ala Moana shopping Centre. Good amenities.Staff very friendly and eager to please.Our room-maid, Diana, did a great job in servicing our rooms.Would definitely stay again.

My husband and I recently spent 8 nights at the Luana and were very pleased with our stay there. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had a one-bedroom suite with a kitchenette. Our balcony overlooked the nearby park and the beach just beyond. Although the hotel is located on a busy thoroughfare and this could make it a little noisy on the balcony, it's located far enough away from other tall buildings so you can get nice views of the surrounding area instead of just views of buildings next door. We were just a few minutes' walk from Fort DeRussy beach which we found to be wider and less crowded than other beaches in the area. The hotel offers a shuttle that can take you to other parts of Waikiki. We availed of that service on a couple of occasions. It's a great way to become more familiar with the area and the drivers, like the hotel staff, were helpful and friendly. Our room was very comfortable. We had loads of closet space and the kitchenette was well equipped and allowed us to cook several of our own meals instead of having to rely too much on restaurant food.We enjoyed the pool deck and availed of the BBQs, which were always very clean. They offer yoga on the pool deck a few mornings a week so I took advantage of that on one occasion and enjoyed that as well.The only issues we had during our stay was that some items were not always replenished every day. We used our coffee maker daily but had to go down to the lobby in search for sugar a couple of times because the housekeeping staff had not left any. We also came very close to running short of toilet paper and tissues one day. It was just a matter of going out to the hall and asking the obliging housekeeping staff to provide some, but we shouldn't have to track down essentials like that. As mentioned above, the noise from the street was a bit much at times, but it wouldn't keep me from going back to the hotel because the location is great. There was supposed to be WiFi in the room. I couldn't get it to work (may have been a problem with me and not the WiFi) but that was not a big deal either because there was internet access in the lobby and I availed of that from time to time. I would definitely go back to this hotel. Great amenities, great staff, clean, comfortable and a short walk to a lovely beach.

The Luana is located in a very quiet part of Waikiki but close to all the action. The hotel overlooks Fort DeRussy park with beautiful ocean views. The room was set up with a small refrigerator and microwave plus a balcony with 2 chairs. The Luana has a really nice wine and cheese reception a couple times a week. We definitely will stay here next time we're in Waikiki.

My 23year old son and I have just returned from 5 nights at the Luana. I was wonderfully surprised at the size, cleanliness and facilities available in our room (after reading various comments on trip advisor)Firstly, I requested a double room with 2 beds as my son is quite tall and a sofa would have been inadequate. Not only did we get two queen size beds, but were upgraded from a city view room to a "partial" ocean view room on the 16th floor. The view from our balcony (which contained a table and two chairs) was nothing short of amazing. Full ocean view as well as great city and park views.Our room was much larger than expected and contained a fully equipped kitchen with microwave, coffee maker, big fridge along with a large screen TV, safe and good sized bathroom.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the coffee and cold drinks available at reception were an added bonus. We attended two wine and cheese receptions and my son used the gym, swimming pool and beach towel services.The locality is perfect for beaching and shopping and we used public transport to get around everywhere which was great as being from Australia we were reluctant to hire a car.....definitely didn't need to.It was unanimously agreed that we would definitely stay here again and recommend the Luana to friend.A big THANK YOU for making our holiday comfortable and memorable.

Clean, quiet, comfortable, close to everything and lovely staff. I spent only 3 nights in this hotel, but I really enjoyed! I had time to go to the yoga by the pool and it was wonderful! The size of the room and the amenities were perfect! Very good hotel for the price! I highly recommend it!

We spent 5 days at the Luana last week (May, 2015). Our trip was for pleasure but I needed to conduct business while there. I had computer/printer issues and needed help! Sunny Chan, Guest Relations Manager, came to my rescue! He spent 30 minutes or more working with me to get the problem solved. He was kind, patient, and knowledgeable. Great customer service!

Every person was super friendly and treated you as if you were a king and queen! The amenities to the hotel were fabulous, however, we were not able to take advantage of many because we were out and abouts! It's not that far to walk to beach and the best restraunts are walking distance, as well as every store you could imagine!!!! Wow! There is a superb park next door to enjoy a stroll or bikes! I enjoyed the fact that it was the normal size hotel but with a kitchenette and a safe! My family stayed on the 10th floor, but there were 3 elevators so, we were able to commute easily up and down with out stopping on every single floor! The pictures are the view from our room, swimming pool, park, and entrance.

Unlike another recent reviewer, I found the bed to be very comfortable. The hotel is a walk from the beach, but has a shuttle between the related hotels that is very useful. We stayed for a week and were satisfied with the hotel.

Best boutique hotel I have ever stayed in. I would say its also a bit larger then boutique, but not too big which I liked. Best feature is the balcony, with that always ask for an ocean view, even a partial ocean view like my husband and I had. I would take my coffee out there early every am and sit for an hour and look at facebook, take pic's and post. Made me want to come home and build a balcony off my bedroom, LOL. Also, next time I am there going to request a kitchen, smelling bacon at 2am really made me want one! Great Concierge service,(front desk too) booked us a wonderful tour of the entire island. I really enjoyed that I was really glad we did, because the next day I was sick with my usual ailment. Bed was comfortable, very close to everything, and if not, a bus for 2 bucks steps away. Park below the hotel. I will definitely return to this location. Loved this vaca.

Bed was so uncomfortable, the mattress is clearly very old. They put my husband and I in a double bed, didn't offer a king at all. You can get this room for a "deal" around $130 a night, just remember plus parking plus amenity fees...

nice location, easy walking to everything. Over all Great trip I truly enjoyed the Hotel, Staff, the concierge service from Tyler and Matthew. On our future visits we will return to this location, easy and comfortable.

My wife and I found the hotel to be very handy to central Waikiki and only ten min walk to the main beach at Waikiki. What was off putting though was our room, even though was on the eight floor, one of the main routes in to Waikiki (three lanes) provided noisy traffic and the regularity of piercing sirens was quite annoying. Also the pool on the 1st floor of the hotel approx. 300 metres away was noisy when revellers were in the pool. Quite amazing how the noise carried really and while the pool was only in the day, the road was into the night and early morning. The restaurant on the ground floor seems to only be open in the morning and that was a bit inconvenient but their morning food was good.

After being moved from another hotel to this one, Luana. Luana gave us very good customer service and a great room! It is right in Waikiki too. Walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants, bars, etc. Can't go wrong with staying here.

This hotel exceeded my expectations as excellent! Kudos to the front desk service of Saori. She is awesome. My accommodations were absolutely inviting! This a a professional and fun Hawaiian atmosphere. The environment is CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN AND VERY MODERN!!!! Matthew as concierge is absolutely great! Adam and Jace (Front Desk) are so helpful as Bell Person as well. What a smiling, kind professional group of employees! Thank you so much for a fantastic stay! I'm definitely coming back as a extended guest for a month or so. Mahalo with a smile, Darryl Willis

My father and I met our Japanese relatives in Waikiki for 2 of their weddings. Since my Dad and I were on a budget and needed a hotel room with a bedroom and sofa sleeper (so we wouldn't wake each other up snoring :) . Our 2nd room suite was great! It had a kitchen and I slept on the fold out couch that didn't look comfortable, but was. We had a view out toward Derussy Park. It was a 10 min walk to Waikiki and just far away from the maddening crowds of Waikiki beach. We fed birds on the lanai and enjoyed our coffee in the mornings. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The only bummer was the elevator which took quite a while, so if you stay here, be sure to leave early as you may have to wait up to 10 min for the elevator.

I have mixed feelings about this place. It definitely wasn't bad, but there are areas for improvement. It was purchased as a Hotwire Secret Hotel deal, so I didn't know what it was before I booked it. The not so good things... the balcony in my room was filthy. Clearly it doesn't get cleaned very often, it was covered in cigarette butts and bird poo. The sunshade didn't secure properly either. The room itself was clean enough, but the rooms look a bit dated and the furnishings a bit tacky. There is a resort fee of $15 a day... I suspect they charge this because everyone else does in Waikiki. Albeit, it does come with some benefits but they are negligible. For example, the "managers reception" (with cheese and wine), the yoga and DVD rental.. I'd rather just pay for that if I wanted it, and have a reduced "resort fee". The wifi is also included in the resort fee... it was rather patchy at times and didn't always work. If you're going to charge for it, at least make sure it's reliable. Also included in the fee is the "in room coffee" and access to the gym... come on, most hotels have that for free!The staff were all friendly and polite, so that was a good thing. Would I return? Probably not, no.

Not cheap but nothing is on Waikiki we booked a room with a kitchenette. Our partial ocean view was nearly a full ocean view. Housekeeping not to Australian standards. Resort fee payable even if you don't want those services. Coin operated laundry. Nice pool. Gym. Next to park and near a beach. About two blocks from restaurants. ABC shop across the road. 20 minute walk to food pantry. Hotel cafe only open for breakfast. No room service.

We stayed April/May 2015. The room was comfortable, clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The only negative was that the sofa bed mattress was quite thin and the metal frame made it uncomfortable (it was used by a 25yr old male - may be OK for children to use). It is in a convenient place and their shuttle bus was very useful. We enjoyed our stay.

We recently stayed at the Luana after a recommendation from a few friends. I must say I was impressed with the cleanliness of the entire hotel and our room. The pool is a nice area to relax after the beach and toss a steak in the BBQ. Unfortunately we had to cut our stay short due to a family emergency but look forward to returning.

My wife and I stayed here for two nights. Location was great - just a 2 block walk through a park to the beach - great snorkeling. Borrowed the free bikes for a ride/walk up to Manoa Falls and around Waikiki. The staff was great - great advice about local restaurants and help with the bikes. Within walking distance of a the shopping/restaurant district.

I stayed at Luana Waikiki for 7 nights (5 business, 2 personal days before starting). I wanted an ocean-view room, but my agent accidentally booked a mountain-view for me. The front desk staff was able to get me upgraded to a partial ocean-view studio with kitchenette right away. It had a lovely view of the beach and park, and I could see the Waikiki Friday night fireworks from my balcony! The balcony had a table and two chairs, perfect for breakfast outside!I liked that the hotel was set back from the beach a little bit with the park in between. The rooms were nicely decorated, and the kitchenette came in handy.I didn't take advantage of many resort items except for the wine receptions (friendly service!), water in the lobby, beach towels, and the fitness room. The fitness room had an elliptical machine, two treadmills, an exercise bike, and a bunch of weight machines. The wireless internet took a little bit of fiddling to get working on my phone, but it was functional enough once that was fixed.The front desk was always helpful with everything I asked, and the valet was prompt and courteous. There is an ABC Store across the street with any minor groceries you need. The main shopping areas are a few blocks away, but it's a nice walk if you can do it.The only complaint I would have was that the elevators were unusually slow and seemed to be following a very strange algorithm. That's it, and definitely not annoying enough to decrease my rating!Bottom line is I would definitely stay here on vacation when I come back to Hawaii with my husband.

I chose this hotel due to its location and value for money. I enjoyed my time here and it was the staff that helped make it so.Things to watch out for:I booked a "city view" room was allocated room 320. Should be renamed "noise, construction and traffic view" room. I did not get a wink of sleep, traffic noise was unbearableLifts are very slow, I think one lift was out but there was no sign so not even sure if the lift ever operatesRooms are nothing to write home about, a bit dated but comfortable and clean with the added benefit of a kitchenette.There are no facilities in this hotel no bar, no spa, a cafe that I didnt try but that is only open until early afternoon.There is no toilet in the pool area where the fitness centre is and with the lifts taking ages its quite a mission if you have to go.Great things:I raised my issue of noise with reception the next morning and was provided a complimentary upgrade to a partial ocean view on the 14th floor straight away. It is this kind of service that makes an impression and I was very gratefulGreat location, next door to the park, 5 mins to the quieter end of Waikiki Beach, ABC store and bus stop across the road and Waikiki shops and restaurants 2 mins walk away. Oh and Bills Sydney which make the only decent coffee in town 5 mins walk awayStaff are great especially Matthew on conciergeHad Yoga in the pool area in the morning which I enjoyedWifi is password free and had no issuesAll in all a solid 3 star hotel in a great location with great service.

Next to a park, it is walking distance to the beach, so great location. The view from our room was beautiful. The staff was nice and the room was bif enough for us (2 adults 2 babies). The room was ok BUT we found an old banana rotting in the kitchen drawer which was disgusting.Don t forget to go to the three times a week social events with wine and cheese. I would recommend the hotel either for vacations or for, like us, a military family moving on the island.

We had the two room suite with the 1,000 sq ft lanai. The views were great! The suite was large, with a full kitchen and a laundry. The smaller bedroom was roomy and the master suite was huge! Lots of closet and storage space too! As we were on the street side of the hotel, there was some traffic noise, but not enough to consider it an issue. Our girl Diana from housekeeping was absolutely great and took excellent care of us!The front desk staff was very friendly & very accommodating. The hotel does a wine & cheese reception three nights a week on the mezzanine level. Awesome!As the hotel is right in the middle of Waikiki, parking is an issue. The parking garage across the street was full most of the time, there was almost no street parking, and the hotel charges $30/day for parking. We were able to rent a new Volvo from the hotel for $127/day. This price covered everything, including insurance and parking. The front desk staff handles the rentals so it is charged to your room. This is a good deal when compared to the prices at other car rental agencies in Waikiki.Café Italia is a new restaurant at the hotel and is located right outside of the lobby. The staff is extremely friendly and focused on your having an enjoyable dining experience. The best way to describe the food is “fresco e delizioso” (fresh and delicious). The homemade bread was awesome and the Italian waffles were the best I have ever had! I enjoyed multiple breakfasts and dinners during our stay and enjoyed every one.

This hotel is at the entrance to the Waikiki hotel and shopping district. Short walk to beach and 10 minutes to Royal Hawaiian mall. Located on main road so it's noisy during the day. Don't expect to sleep late because traffic and nearby construction noise begins by 7 am but room is large with up to date furnishings. Small restaurant on site which we didn't visit becsuse there are so many others within walking distance. Bus service is very close - if seniors show a Medicare card the fare is only $1, otherwise $2.50

We had two days on Oahu before cruising the Islands. The Luana was a very good choice for our short stay. We used the bikes they provided to see some local sites. The short walk to conveneince stores, restaurants and the beach was also helpful. The staff was courteous and attentive to our needs and questions. We would stay there again!

I only stayed two nights and chose one of their newer renovated rooms. The room was clean and it was nice to have cable, big flat panel TV and a Bose Bluetooth speakerHaving some music playing makes it much more relaxing. What made the stay great was Jay. He was friendly, helpful and truly aimed to please. We had a few requests and he was able to accommodate. He always had a smile and postive attitude. We used their complimentary bikes to get around Waikiki. The cruiser bikes, while a little older, were comfortable and did the job. Included were bike locks which we used when shopping at the Ala Moana mall. We had a late red eye flight out and we were able to get a later checkout and storage of our luggage. We were offered use of their showers in the gym facility even after we checked out which is nice to get cleaned up before heading to the airport. If I had one issue, it would be the elevators would take some time to get to our floor. Only two of the three elevators were being used for guests.

For my third visit to the Waikiki area, I decided to stay at the other end of the strip than I normally do. As I have stayed in Aqua properties previously, I had no hesitation in booking at the Luana.Front counter staff were courteous and professional upon arrival, and throughout the entirety of our stay. We were easily able to leave our bags securely until our room was ready.There was a small hiccup with our room as when we opened the door there was only one queen bed (as two females, we had booked a twin room). A quick call to reception and this matter was resolved within five minutes.We LOVED the wine and cheese nights and also the free dvd rentals. The pool area was spotless and was easy to get a sunlounge.There was only one small thing which I would recommend to the Luana, and that is creating some sort of hospitality room for early arrivals to freshen up. We were happy to use the shower near the pool though.I would definitely recommend the Luana to others who like myself, prefer to stay away from giant resorts. Also a big thankyou to staff member Brian (99% sure that is his name!) - such a polite and welcoming man! So important in this industry!Thankyou Luana Resort!

My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in Waikiki. We stayed at the Luana. It is a lovely hotel. Had a very nice partial ocean view on the 6th floor. Loved sitting out on the patio and enjoying coffee every morning. Nice view of the park next door and the ocean. Price was very good for Waikiki and they only charged a $15.00 resort fee a day. That covered towels, safe, movies, yoga, shuttle to Ala moana ,and a wine and cheese get together. Next door to Fort Derussy. About a 7-10 minute walk to the beach. The staff was very friendly. Plan on staying here again. It is a older hotel with some nice updates. Had a fridge and micro wave that both worked well. Internet was good. Beds were ok and the elevators were slow.

Luana is good value for money, but rather tired. In her day, Luana would've been amazing... Front reception, lobby area is large & spacious. Our 1x BR apartment had positives & negatives. Very large BR, extremely weary tired bathroom, fabulous new kitchen, & creaking sofa bed in living area. Balcony was not clean & very narrow..& complimentary game console for our teenager ( )..A dodgy card to open front door.Luana offers complimentary shuttle bus to Ala Moana-City Centre-Diamond Head.. Also ice in lobby, towels, bikes & video movies & games..Many thanx to Destiny( manager ) & Francis for hosting the cheese & wine event.. Complimentary to all guests 2-3 times weekly...Really enjoyed that !!

First impressions were that the room was very dated. Aside from that, the room is large and has a great kitchen area. Air-con is noisy but we personally love that - cannot hear any traffic noises. Comfortable bed, good black out curtains. Bathroom is adequate, shower head is not so great, have to run around to get wet and it sprays outs every which way. Location is terrific, not far to walk to the trolley pick ups. A big tick to the front desk who could see that we were quite exhausted after long flight and got our room ready early so we could shower and revive. Another great bonus was the breakfast vouchers we received to use at the attached cafe. Yum! We stayed on the 4th floor.

We are enjoying our 3rd night here tonight. The staff are very friendly, and there are several amenities like free yoga, dvd rentals, xbox in room, and wine&cheese reception. We booked a deluze ocean view room - don't be fooled, the ocean view is through one large horizontal window - not through french doors as it might seem in ads and descriptions. The room is spacious, with a comfy king bed, and sleeper sofa out in the living room plus a very usable kitchen with appliances and cookware. I highly recommmend this place to stay in for small families who don't want to spend their retirement money on a vacation. The htoel is located about 10 min walk to the beach, through a very nice, safe and picturesque park. Sure, it's not exactly beachfront, but still very value worthy. My only negative feedback is that the fixtures are a bit dated - faucets, furniture, but otherwise fully functional.

We had a fantastic stay at the Luana. The hotel has green spaces on 3 sides. Our room was on 5th floor facing street with a peek-a-boo view of the ocean from balcony. Traffic noise not a problem at all. Met new friends who recommend 15th floor ocean view rooms (their 7th stay at the Luana!). Staff was attentive and quicky responsive with requests. Great dining recommendations from concierge desk. Rocking chairs out front,were a great place to relax. Kitchenette was very useful in the mornings. The Luana is located 2 blocks from the shopping madness at Waikiki, but only 5 minutes away with leisurely walk. The Luana backs up to the Fort DeRussey Rec area. It was very handy for us to use the military facilities at the Hale Koa. Wine and cheese Happy Hour M-W-F afternoon was great for meeting new friends.

great location very helpful and friendly staff this was our second stay and was every bit as good as our first handy to all attractions walking distance to major shops supermarket's and shopping centres 10 mins to beach hotel give you beach chairs and towels boogie boards etc great service excellent pool and BBQ area theres a gym also if your into the fitness regime ,We recommended this to our family who stayed as well and had a wonderful time we also hired the resident Volvo station wagon to tour the island was awesome thanks to all the staff well done .Jane & Neil NZ

We stayed in a Studio kitchenette room. The room was nice and the staff were very helpful. It was walking distance from stores and great restaurants. There is a complimentary shuttle to a near by mall. Rooms to do not have an ocean view, but you are only a short walk from the beach.There is a mandatory $15 per day hospitality fee.

Had a pretty great location, everything was a short walk. Facilities were clean and presentable. Room, room service, and house keeping all were satisfactory. Jace, one of the gentleman normally at the front desk was super helpful, really awesome gentlemen, had insight, and tips. Also on a return walk he had some of his own private bakery food at the counter that he let me and my best friend sample. Super amazing gentlemen, made the stay 40% better by himself.

I stayed at the Luana in April 2015. I was in town primarily because of the Hapalua Half Marathon and I wanted a hotel that was relatively affordable and reasonably close to the start line of the race on Waikiki Beach. I also was looking for a hotel with a kitchenette as I wanted the option of making some of my meals. The Luana met those needs. I would give it a 3.5 stars if Trip Advisor had the option.Pros:--Rooms with kitchenette and a separate dining/seating area--Eight to 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach--Reasonable value for money in what is an expensive cityCons:--Air conditioner unit in the room is noisy (we had to switch rooms to another room to get a newer, quieter unit(--Mandatory resort fee of $15/day--Hotel is not directly on the beach so if you are planning to go to the beach frequently, keep this in mindThe staff were helpful when we needed anything though I would not say they were overly hospitable (i.e. nobody asked us how our stay was at check out etc).The biggest warning I have is that if you were expecting an ocean front location then this is not the place to consider as you do have to walk about 10 minutes to access the beach. If you have small kids or have mobility issues, keep this in mind.

This was our first trip to Honolulu and we picked the Luana Waikiki based on their reviews. This hotel is nice. We had a partial ocean view, which was great - across Fort DeRussy Park to the beach. We also had a view onto Kalakaua Avenue, which was nice at night. The room itself was a decent size. We asked for two queen beds and received those. The room also had a mini-fridge and a microwave, plus plates, silverware and glasses, all of which we used during our stay.The Luana is in a decent location. The walk to the beach takes only a few minutes, and a short walk down Kalakaua will get you to any number of shopping and dining locations. It's also a pretty short drive to the Ala Moana mall, and fairly easy to get onto the H1. Service was great - everyone was really friendly, helpful and attentive. There is a resort fee per night, but we used the amenities (towels and chairs for the beach, DVD and game rentals) and I found it reasonable.My only real complaints are minor. First, if you park here, the only option is valet, even though the parking garage is located on property. I resented not being able to park my own car and being charged one of the highest nightly rates in the city for the privilege of having someone else do it. Second, there isn't a restaurant at this hotel. As I mentioned, there are a number of restaurants within walking distance, but sometimes you just want to order room service for convenience and that wasn't possible. Third, the air conditioning was really loud. We ended up opening the lanai doors in the mornings and evenings as much as possible and used it only in the afternoons or at night if the room got hot. It was annoyingly loud while trying to get to sleep, but we did sleep soundly once we managed to fall asleep.Overall, though, my family enjoyed its stay at the Luana Waikiki and we would consider staying here again.

Very nice place to stay. Prices are about normal. Service is great. Very nice small pool, When we were there in January, there was a LOT of construction going on around the hotel, and streets, so very noisy during the day. Not their fault.

We have returned from 10 days stay at Luana Waikiki, we had an ocean view room which was fantastic. It is well located only 5 minutes walk across the park to the beach and the same to be in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. The rooms are fantastic, everything you need for a relaxing holiday. Great BBQ and pool area is quite spacious and able to accommodate a large number of people. The staff are great and very accommodating. We had a problem with noise from the lift and didn't sleep well the first couple of nights but after discussion with staff were moved to another room and had no further problems. Not sure we would stay here again but it suited our situation at the time.

We have been to Waikiki several times but this was out first stay at the Luana. The rooms were very spacious ( we had a studio room) and the beds very comfy.The pool area was very nice and all staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't really have any problems with the street noise ( hey your in a city ) so some noise is expected. Many thanks to Elton who assisted us greatly after we realised at the airport that we had left our keys in the safe!My only gripe is with the resort fee which a lot of hotels in Waikiki seem to be charging now. Firstly it's a hotel not a resort and there is a difference. Secondly many of the items " included" in the fee are standard inclusions in most hotels I've ever stayed in and the other items are things I would never use. It seems as though hotels advertise a cheaper rate and then sneak in a resort fee to make up the difference. Some hotels in Waikiki charge a resort fee, some don't so whilst I really liked the Luana next time I'd choose the hotel that doesn't.

We booked this hotel through Costco . We payed $1139 for the week in Wakiki that is a steal. The room was nice fridge microwave small kitchenette. We did not use most of it but we did some. We we're basically busy all day with so much to see and do we were not in our room much. Didn't like the resort fee since we didn't use it, but most hotels charge it. The staff was helpful and polite. Our view was of the city and we could see out of the side window the ocean. The money we saved let us do more things on the island. It was. About a 10 minute walk to the beach. This is a good hotel good price good stay aloha

If you want to be near the beach but a bit away from the frenzy, this hotel is an excellent choice. Kitchenette and balcony made having breakfast in the room easy and fun. Easy walk to nice restaurants, tiki bars on beach. Staff were very helpful.
user_name:
lgianessi
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Room was SO PERFECT! Room 718. City views from livingroom & both bedroom balconies. Extra large terrace off livingroom with small view of the ocean. (We could watch the friday night fireworks from ther terrace) Terrace had table, chairs & loungers for laying out. Full Kitchen. 2 bathrooms. Close proximity to every high end store & many options for low end shopping too. 10 min walk to Fort Derussy Beach, 20 min walk to Waikiki Beach. Lots of different food options are close too. Our favorite place was Cheeseburger Waikiki, 5 min walk. Great open air location with great food. $5.99 breakfast special was perfect! Front desk reception was great & concierge helped us plan out our 4 tour days. The only reason this location didn't get 5 stars was because the room could get pretty nosey due to being in the middle of the city & the cafe that was advertised was not open, due to renovations. This was a great place to stay. Definitely recommend.
user_name:
mistyforbes
Baton Rouge, Louisiana, United States

review_body: This smaller & quiet hotel met the needs of us 4 "sixty plus" female friends. We liked the location & felt safe walking in the area at night, great little restaurant (Vic's) nearby, decent pool, great wine & cheese on Wed & Fri. Staff accommodated all requests & Expedia concierge on-site was very helpful. Our ocean facing 14th floor suite wasn't luxurious but smelled good & we thought the price was great!

I was surprised by the high rating of this hotel. I was expecting a high luxury hotel, but it isn't the cleanest place and the furniture and decor is old. I know I'm a snob though so I'll say that I understand the practicality of this hotel. It is inexpensive and in a good location; close enough to the beach but far enough from the chaos. The staff is friendly and helpful. I was told that the building also has time shares in it. The floors are tiled as I'm sure carpet is hard to maintain in the moist Hawaii weather, but the floor never felt clean. There was also a lot of stomping from the room above me. I don't know what else Hawaii has to offer, but this hotel is definitely adequate for trips on a tight budget!

This was a single overnite stay. Overlooking lovely park on western end of Waikiki. Not as noisy as Diamond Head end. The staff was top notch helpful, especially James, the bellman, who hauled all of our luggage from across the street when hotel access was blocked off due to a parade. As in many of the 3-star level hotels there, the a/c units are individual in-window, so a bit noisy but not enough to keep us awake and worked well. Had a kitchenette in our unit, which gave more counter space for 3 ladies to spread out. Refrigerator but no microwave. A little worn around the edges overall, but suitable for our one night needs. Biggest dislike was very hard bed.

I had just moved out of my home at the Beach in Waialua and had a couple of days on Island before traveling to Las Vegas. I decided to be a "tourist" and stay in Waikiki. The Luana Waikiki was the right price and in the right location so I thought i'd give it a go. The hotel is located at the north end of Waikiki and is an easy walk (i'm 63) to pretty much everything this area has to offer. The hotel itself is a bit old but the room was clean and the décor was classic old school Hawai'i - perfect for a first time visitor. They have yoga 3 or 4 times a week and a wine and cheese reception on the other days. These are included in the ever present "resort fee" of $15 per night. At least they do offer these extras as a part of the fee along with a very strong wifi signal throughout the hotel and in room. I would like to add that the staff was AWESOME and know the meaning of Aloha!!! My only complaint is the price of parking at $35 a night!! a bit much i'd say. If you are the traveler that enjoys a good location at a reasonable price than this could be your hotel.

Was told I'd have a one bedroom suite "up high enough for view". They outdid themselves- my suite was amazing and on the top floor corner (16th floor)!! My son and I loved it! Walked everywhere !! Perfect, thank you Luana!

My wife and I recently stayed here for our one year anniversary. The hotel was in a great location (on the west side of Waikiki). They put us on the top floor so we had the best view of the ocean. The bed was huge and SO comfortable! All of the staff members went above and beyond to make sure our stay was nothing short of perfect. Our room was cleaned daily and the grounds of the hotel were well maintained. There is delicious coffee and fruit infused water in the lobby every day. We loved the beach chairs and the towels they lend you while visiting. On our last night there they also wrote us a happy anniversary note and left a bottle of champagne in our room! We would definitely stay here again!

Pros:What I liked about the Luana was that the Hotel was within walk-able distance from all the restaurants and shopping centers in Waikiki. They also had coffee and citrus water at the lobby in the morning and complimentary beach equipment rentals. The rooms were nice and clean but the fixtures were a bit outdated. Cons:I believe that the staff could work faster. My family and I had to wait quite a while for the front desk to get things carried out. Also, the air conditioners in the rooms are pretty loud.

Hotel is well located about a 5-10 minute walk from shopping and restaurants and the beach. Grocery stores are available right by the hotel which was helpful for grabbing some fruits and breakfast for the room. We enjoyed the bikes included in the resort fee. Service was also great and the staff extremely helpful! The only complain is that being in a busy street and in the middle of Waikiki, the room can be a bit noisy. We asked to stay at a high floor, and even on the 10th floor we could still hear some noise early morning. Overall a good value for staying in the middle of Waikiki!

This hotel took me by surprise, its location is right before Kalaukaua splits into Kuhio, so its right where Waikiki gets lively.Thankfully, they lend out bicycles to guests! So it was fun cycling to the beach, to shop, and to drink coffee. As much as I wanted to walk around Waikiki, my slippers were giving me blisters so I had to use the bike. Awesome choice.The rooms had a very Hawaiian culture feel to it, down to the decor, smell, and sound of the room which was a great experience. Everything was clean and tidy. Very lit up room which I loved. Management and staff were always welcoming and smiling! On top of that, even all the other guests that I had encounters with were very happy and friendly. I think that already says a lot. If the guests there are happy and sharing that happiness with others, then management is doing their jobs right.Check in and check out was easy and convenient. There is tea and coffee served every morning which helped get my days started.The valet guys were very friendly and helpful also. My overall experience here was excellent, I wish all my hotel experiences were like this one at Luana Waikiki. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki!

The reception staff were very friendly and informative compared to the Hilton. They explained all of the features available to us upon check in, and there was no wait for the room when we arrived at 14:00 on the dot.You get free movie rentals each night. They have a small pool is heated and not usually busy. We got free cheese and wine three days a week (we ended up getting this twice) and this was a real treat, the four Californian wines were well chosen and a fantastic start to a leisurely stroll to Waikiki a few minutes walk through the park.Some might find the room a bit on the small side, but for us it was perfect. It had a fridge, fully equipped kitchen. The water pressure in the shower was good.They have a free shuttle linking Aqua hotels to Ala Moana but it was too elusive to use, and takes a very long route through Honolulu to get to Ala Moana, but being free I didn’t hold it against our stay.The Bellman/Reception guy Jace was really positive and cheerful. He helped us to shift all our shopping up to the room on the first night, and gave us plenty of good suggestions during our stay.Much better value for money than Hilton. If you are a family staying in Honolulu, you want to be close to Waikiki and don’t need heaps and heaps of space in your room and like the idea of cooking occasionally- this place is ideal- oh and free wifi

I'll make this short and sweet. I'm fortunate enough to travel a lot and usually stay at pretty nice hotels. I was skeptical from looking at pictures before booking but with the good reviews I took a chance.The hotel is clean but needs some updating ( ok honestly , needs a lot), but I guess for the price I shouldn't expect too much. Kitchen is well stocked with most of the stuff you need. We had some issues the first night we checked in, left a message with the manager and Rudy quickly returned my call first thing in the morning and made sure I didn't leave his hotel unhappy. He did everything he could to to make my stay a pleasant one.The staff in the morning was friendly and very helpful.Wine tasting in the afternoon. Parking is a bit high at $35 plus another resort fee, but the rooms are quite inexpensive to offset that.Despite my issues the first night, the staff and manager did a wonderful job making sure I was happy, so yes I would recommend this hotel.

Just on the edge of the busier side of Waikiki giving you a breather from crowds. Also, clean for an older building and no bugs, staff friendly and helpful. Wine and cheese 3 times a week is a nice extra the hotel has for guests. If you are staying with a car rental for 7 days or more parking in the parkade in the park behind the hotel is cheaper $160 monthly pass.

I liked the shuttle to the mall and to the zoo end of Waikiki. The location is right next to a huge park, but it is still very noisey from the traffic. I like the free movie rental , availablebech towel, and the receptions a couple of night a week. Our room had a large kitchen sink outside the bathroom which worked well for the three of us adults. It is near bus stops and lots of eating places. Dont expect the maid to wash your coffee cups. Everyday we went after the third needed towel, and they dont vacuum. The maid scatters any sand around on the floor with her little broom.

The service was very good. The room was adequate. Bed was a little too soft for my preference. The room we got had a semi - kitchen in it including mini-fridge, sink, counter, dishes, coffee maker, etc. Even wine glasses. What it didn't have was a microwave (available on the 2nd floor) in order to reheat leftovers for a midnight snack. On one night the hotel hosted a wine and cheese party which was nice. We were on the same floor as the pool and workout room, but it wasn't too noisy. The location is right across from a car rental spot and with the charge for parking the next time I stay here, I'm going to rent from there only on days I plan on driving around the island. Location makes most of Waikiki walkable. Can view the Friday night fireworks from the pool deck. There is a park right behind and next door to the hotel. Nice for walks.

This hotel is clean and has everything you need, there is shopping near by, and the beach is about 10-15 minute walk. They have video games and movies, and they lend you beach towels. I would definitely stay there again.

I've stayed at this hotel 2x once 2013 and also 2014. The hotel is located at the beginning strip of Waikiki. We stayed in a partial ocean view, which had a great view. Great amenities on site, rooms equipped with a small kitchen. Every time I stayed here never had any problems always had a great time!

I wouldn't call myself a world class traveler but neither am I a homebody. Made reservations at Luana Waikiki for two nights along with a friend and we were treated very well by everyone on staff. The well-appointed room exceeded my expectations.The big question I have is how can the demand for hot water be met immediately, and why can't other hotels provide that level of service?

Honestly...I've never been to a hotel where the service was just beyond exceptional. My bf and I booked a suite here last minute for his birthday and unfortunately the room we booked wasn't available. In order to accommodate us, Sunny who is the manager, offered us another suite that was just a bit smaller and gave us a better deal on that. That was already generous offer that we were glad to take. But on top of that..he gave us a coupon to get free movie rentals, offered us complimentary beverages and basically just provided us with awesome customer service. We literally got hit with offers left and right from such a small mistake that wasn't even a big deal. They went over the top to make sure that our stay was awesome. I usually don't write reviews...heck Ive never even really used tripadvisor before...but their service was just that good that I had to voice my thoughts. Toot toot...we'll be staying here again soon for sure. Also Right after we got up to our room, chase who was helping us at the front desk, called to make sure that everything was okay. No hotel I've ever stayed at has ever called me to check in....mostly just for noise complaints or bad parking :P anyways...awesome hotel and awesome staff.

Stayed with kids in tow at Luana Waikiki for 4 nights in Feb 2015. This is the second hotel during our one week vacation there. We definitely saved the better for last:)I selected Luana after viewing other reviews. Without repeating or duplicating the accolades. It gets my thumb up for things like nice lobby, friendly and helpful staff, well appointed room with tile floor and no carpet, mini-kitchenette, comfortable bedding, organic soaps and shampoo, fast Wifi, free bike / DVD rental, and a great beach towel exchange system. The key thing that can be improved is the parking which is valet only. I would prefer self-park with a faster in and out. I also had a lower floor room fronting the busy Kalakaua street. There was no escape from the loud bike muffler noise lasting into late hours. We managed to counter it with white noise by turning up the AC fan. For light sleepers, get the ocean view rooms or at least requesting higher floors.The hotel is located on the north end of the Waikiki and a bit more farther away from the beach or the center of Waikiki frenzy. The quietness suited us just fine. After all, the bus or trolley stops are just around the corners that can get you to anywhere in Waikiki or Oahu. So if you like a boutique hotel that is slightly off the center and with a more "experienced" clientele. That place will not disappoint you.

You love this place as soon as you walk in ! Beautiful décor in lobby and the mezzanine is gorgeous ! Rooms are great ,with good views. New to us this year was the wine & cheese get together,from 4-5pm. A great idea to meet some of the other guests. A super staff, all in all, a lovely hotel-condo.

Another great staycation at the Luana Waikiki! Thanks again to Jordan who made the check in/check out process so pleasant and easy. Stayed in the one bedroom suite. Really enjoyed the full kitchen/refrigerator.

Whenever I'm looking for a staycation, the Luana is definitely my first choice! (And trust me, i've been to a lot of hotels in Waikiki). I've already stayed here 2 times in the last 6 months and both experiences were excellent. The rooms are clean, spacious, with a very homey feel, and the staff is just great. Both stays we had Jordan at the front desk to get us checked-in and he instantly remembered us the second time around - so personal and friendly! He did a great job in explaining everything and was one of the main reasons why we chose to return. If you're looking for a cute, convenient, clean, boutique hotel with amazing staff, look no further! The Luana has it all!

If you are looking for that old world charm where everyone greets you with a smile, you will find it at The Luana. It's secret is that it's not a huge impersonal hotel and the staff make you feel welcome. I liked like the ice cold water in the lobby with fresh fruit, the wine and cheese after a day at the beach. They even offered yoga and bike rentals. The staff was terrific, and went out of their way to make us feel so welcome and at home. Matthew, at the activity desk, he helped me bring 3 coffees to my room, I was not sure how to get all 3 cups up, and he found quick solution with a smile.The day we were going snorkelling at Hanama Bay, he offered us snorkel gear(helped save rental costs).The lovely lady( sorry did not get your name), who invited us to the wine and cheese party, we just came from the beach. She served us our wine , thank you. Then both Mathew and Tyler convinced me to try zip lining at Koaloa Ranch. Tyler arranged for my mom to come for the ride to the ranch, again with a smile. It was one of the best afternoons and most fun you can have while in Honolulu(try a burger afterwards at the restaurant). The hotel,was clean, our rooms spacious. Great location, easy walk to the beach and lovely park where you can start your day, with a complimentary coffee served daily in the lobby. You can catch local buses and tour buses right across the street, very convenient. I don't often write reviews, but really had to write how impressed I was with your hotel and great staff. Finally a big thank you to the gentleman that helped us get our taxi on 26th feb, back to the airport. Our last few moments were spent laughing with him, as he tried to convince us to stay, really wish we could have as I prepare for yet another snow storm in Canada!! Thanks again and highly recommend a stay here.

I really appreciated the personnal who work at the Luana Waikiki. I had a wonderful stay and really need to point out a young lady who will make your stay as pleasant as she possibly can. Her name is "Saori" and you can't miss her. She will have a big glowing smile and after she knows you will address you by name. Luana Waikiki is lucky to have Saori as an employee who truly cares about your stay and concerns as a guest. If you get bord and don't know what to do look up Rico he'll get you in touch with just about anything your want to do in Hawaii. The rooms for the price are a very good value. Ours had a small kitchenette. It's a short walk to the beach and you're in downtown and close to most everything. Also make sure and ask to use a beach chair, blanket a bicycle to ride for the day and all free of charge. I had a great time and if it wasn't for the people working there it would have just been another hotel. Thanks you guys. Hope to see you again. Kurt

We booked and paid in advance for a room with two queen beds, but were given a room with only one queen bed to accodate two adults and two teenagers. The hotel explained that bedding is not guaranteed. I wish I had known that when I paid extra for a room with two queens as I could have paid less for a room with just one queen. I was less than impressed by the hotel's offer to waive the usual fee for a rollaway bed.That said, it is a pleasant hotel a relatively short walk from the beach. However, when we returned to Waikiki a week later at the end of our trip, we had a much better experience with a spacious "family room" that slept six at the Marriott Waikiki Beach for about the same price.

First of all I would like to say that we are a local family that loves to stay in hotels both here and abroad. We took a one day Staycation (vacation spent at home) because it is Prom season and our son had their Prom at the nearby Hale Koa Hotel. Because of traffic and parking in Waikiki we did not want to have to fight either on the night of the big dance, so we decided to book a stay at the Luana. What an experience! I called the hotel the morning of our arrival and asked if we were able to check-in early. Jordan answered and stated that it was fine to come early as we could spend time in the pool and our bags could be held in the bellhop room until our bags were ready. It was a beautiful day and our daughters were eager to get into the pool, which is heated and perfectly sized for their swimming needs. Adam was the valet that took our car and insured us that we had in/out privileges any time of day and full access to our car throughout the day. The whole staff was very helpful and friendly no matter time of day. We were able to get into the pool while we were waiting for our room. Another plus was the fact that the fitness center is located next to the pool so that my wife and I were able to exercise and keep an eye on our kids at the same time as they frolicked in the pool.Time to check-in and I went to the front desk to request that our room had two queens rather than a single king in the category I booked... one bedroom suite with kitchen. I was informed that everything was taken care of and instead of the the one bedroom suite, we were upgraded to the two bedroom suite with two full baths and kitchen. What a surprise and impression that was made for my entire family. My son and his girlfriend were able to prep for their Prom in the spacious room, We were able to take amazing pictures of everyone on the private balcony. The beds were very clean and comfortable. The resort fee offered many extras that was an added value to our stay... unlimited free DVD and game rental, free daily paper, free shuttle, and others.Overall, an amazing staycation with perfect weather. Even though we only stayed one night, I can guarantee that we will be back! Thank you for an opportunity to make lasting memories with my Ohana....family.Mahalo! The Young Ohana

We booked the luana hotel for 3 nights including the night of our 5th anniversary the stay was very pleasant the hotel also provided free champagne to us for our special day.The staff was very courteous and friendly.The rooms were clean and quite big. We had taken a partial ocean view room which had a good view from the balcony.The rooms had a microwave also which had its benefits and the resort charge was not too high at 15 dollars though except for the beach towels I did not see any value to it, but the good thing was they were not trying to sell anything like others hotels offering "free" stuff as part of resort fee.Parking charges were high at $35 dollar per night but I guess the place is such where parking expensive. Also we were not driving so no issues.Great places to eat nearby and wakiki beach is also close.I would high recommend this hotel
user_name:
Rajat B
Phoenix, Arizona, United States

review_body: Great place to stay on hopping Kalakaua Avenue. The room was spacious, modern, and clean. I really enjoyed spending time on my private terrace. The property is just a short walk from Waikiki Beach and countless shopping and dining options. I really appreciated having a late check-out on my last day. I was, however, disappointed when I had to pay the resort fee + tax on it. I did know about this expense before coming to the hotel, but I still didn't like having to pay it. I find resort fees to be kind of sneaky. They did provide me with a list of services that were covered by this fee, but I didn't use any of them and I was still required to pay (no choice). This left a little bit of a bad taste in my mouth, but the hotel was really quite nice.
user_name:
chilopoda2
New York City, New York

review_body: Very clean & comfortable place... Had a partial ocean view on 14th floor. The bed was comfy (I'm Picky)..The location was centered, close to everything! The staff was Awesome (Kazmko?sp) was so helpful as well as the others! I Loved that it wasn't crowded!!!!  Would recommend to anyone! The only reason I mark "very good" on "Location" is because I Love being on the. Beach, but in Wakiki...it's a little to busy for me to be on the beach...I would rather be off.

This hotel sits in between the Ala Moana Centre and Waikiki beach- about a 15 minute walk to either. The rooms are nice and clean, and are one of the only options in Waikiki that offer kitchenette facilities. The staff were very welcoming and friendly.

The hotel upgraded us to the ocean and park view. The 15th floor kitchenette was spacious and we enjoyed the balcony. We could walk to the Hilton Hawaiian Village (live music, shops, fireworks, nice pools and waterfalls), to all the beaches, to downtown Waikiki, etc. We preferred the beaches near the HIlton to Waikiki Beach as there was a beautiful Fort de Russay Park to walk through on route and the beach was wider and nice atmosphere. One word of caution though. Do not agree to get a discount on any tour if it means attending the Wyndam Owner Sales Sessions. It was a stressful and painful 3 hours.

Spotless (as all the Aqua properties seem to be) - the staff is very friendly and helpful - Nora, my housekeeper, did a fantastic job and was VERY nice. The location cannot be beat - between Ala Moana and the Waikiki "strip.." Man good restaurants within a 5 - 10 min walk.

When I return to Honolulu, this is the first hotel I will check for reservations. The location is perfect: close to Waikiki without the hassle of crowds and noise. The views from some rooms is wonderful, and nearby is a lovely park to walk around. The best features, however, are inside: wonderful staff, very nice rooms, inviting lobby. The pool was just the right size and a great respite from busy days. My family stayed here for three nights and found a sympathetic and helpful staff when we ran into an unexpected emergency. We will never forget them. Even the parking crew was great. If possible, book a suite. They are excellent and worth the extra money.

We only stayed here for 1 night, but were very pleased with this welcoming hotel in Waikiki. The room was clean and comfortable with Hawaiian décor, and had a decent sized kitchen that would nicely accommodate a longer stay. Nice mezzanine level where a wine and cheese was served.The room overlooked a canopy of trees in a nearby park, which was a nice feature not common to hotels in Waikiki, many of which face neighbouring buildings. The property has a good location, near to the heart of Waikiki.Great hospitality - Would recommend this property for a short or longer term stay.

It was once probably a lovely hotel, but time has nice been kind to this old girl. The hotel is right on the main drag. This means that no matter the floor, bottom or top, you are going to deal with some serious road noise. If you're unlucky enough to be on the actual highway side, bring earplugs and gird yourself for the constant traffic noise. The rooms themselves are just fine. That's the best I can really offer. Think 1980s chic. Tile floors, older linens, older everything. While all of that is manageable, what was the deal sealer for us was the AC unit. It's one of those through-the-wall types that cuts on and off LOUDLY all night. The AC noise might cover the road noise but only until the clunk-clunk compressor goes off, then you're back to road noise (and being awake).We stayed just one night of our 14 night stay there and then transferred to the Aqua Iliki, a sister hotel just down the road. Same price, and much much much nicer. Things to know:1. Kitchenettes: Some rooms have them. 2. One King or two Queens: Unfortunately sometimes the second queen is a fold out and you can't get the preferred room types with a kitchenette.3. The hotel is also a condo, which means lots of little kids running up and down the halls.4. Loud doors: The old-fashioned kind that close/slam loudly. 5. Hotel lobby: Nicely furnished with nice folks, but it's loud too. Feels more like a Holiday Inn Express than a nicer hotel. Final Word: If you are going without kids or value silence, go elsewhere. We did.

We decided to stay at the Luana because of the great reviews on trip advisor and also because it was priced relatively well for being right on the Waikiki strip. Pros: Location-easy walk to the beach, catching a sunrise/sunset is only a 5 minute walk, walking to the heart of Waikiki is only but another 5 minutes as it's located right across from Tony Roma's near the beginning of the stripSize of rooms: very spacious, there's a sitting area, balcony, kitchenette, fridge, everything that you could need for a tropical vacayNice free amenities as part of their resort fee: bike rentals, boogie boards, beach chairs, beach towelsPool is cute, not too crowded, (but no music/ambiance/not trendy) If you want to get a tan, read a book, it's still nice though, seemed pretty mellow when I was there. I didn't test the water temp because it was quite windy the day I was sun bathing.Cons:Ambiance-this is not a romantic hotel by any means. Most of the people staying here are significantly older and/or international families, If you are looking for a sexy vibe for your hotel, this is not it Parking-valet only option at $35 is pretty steep especially given that this is not a luxury hotelTips:Ask for a higher floor so you don't hear the noise from the strip. Even on the 16th floor (their highest) my husband still heard some people fighting at 4am that woke him up!

Although not on the beach, this hotel is a short walk away from shopping, reataurants, pubs, and the beach.We really enjoyed our stay here and hightly recommend it. We would definitely stay here again.

Great value, lovely room and ammenities! Fantastic view and a kitchen is a great addition! You can walk to everything. The grill area by the pool has top of the line weber grills. Everything was absolutely perfect!

Dear Trip Advisor: Just finished umpteenth stay at The Luana Waikiki. Same old, same old i.e. another excellent stay. Great location, great room with all the comforts of home, and to top it all, a great staff. It's getting kind of routine. Maybe some time we visit the pool will be cold.Highly recommended, from a couple that has been to Honolulu a hundred times.. Best combination of location, beautiful large rooms, and price in all of Waikiki.Sincerely, Charmaine and Stew Leber, Foster City, California

A rare find in Waikiki, this property is a combo of quiet yet centrally located to everything. Under new management now and a pleasure to return.
