The hotel staff are guided by an excellent General Manager who understands the small details combine to make for an exceptional stay. There is a personal touch to almost everything..from the front desk staff greeting you by name to the GM willing to jump in and address concerns personally. Don't miss wine and cheese Friday!

For the price we paid, we were very pleasantly surprised what was provided. The hotel was close to the beach and shopping. A $15 daily hospitality fee provides 1) DVD/game rentals, 2) shuttle to Ala Moana shopping, 3) access to a fitness center and use of BBQ grills, 4) yoga classes (Wed, Sat, Sun), 5) WiFi, 6) coffee/tea (in-room), 7) beach chairs/towels, and 8) a manager's reception (Fri - free cheese/crackers/wine). The staff was very friendly (Ona, Saori) and accommodating. We were able to view a fireworks show from another hotel while laying on chairs next to the pool. The kitchenette (fridge, sink, microwave, utensils, no stove) was great and allowed us to buy groceries at a nearby store ("The Food Pantry"). We will book here again if/when we return to Waikiki.

The hotel is an ideal location for business and pleasure. It is close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. It is also easy to get to the Honolulu business district if you have meetings there. The kitchenette has complete appliances and utensils that allows for cooking. The balcony has an outdoor set for two that gives you the opportunity to enjoy the view and Hawaiian great weather. I love having coffee in the balcony. Since the building is a bit old, the sliding door that leads to the balcony is hard to open and needs to be repaired.

My Husband and I had a great stay. Nice location. Close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Take advantage of the $15.00 resort fee. For that you get a wine and cheese reception on Fridays,beach chairs and towels,bikes, boogie boards,DVDs, shuttle to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Tyler booked our tours for us, Thanks Tyler! We met the General Manager Rudy who was very nice. The bed was comfortable and was made everyday along with clean towels. I loved the pool. It was never crowded and the perfect temp. The BBQ area was nice as was the fitness area. The view was fantastic both day and night.I loved the rocking chairs out front while you were waiting for your ride. We will stay here next time we come to Oahu. Thanks Luana and all the staff!!

The Luana Waikiki is our new favorite place to stay while visiting family on Oahu. The hotel is staffed by very courteous employees, who greeted us warmly when we first got there and every time we returned, we felt very welcomed. We decided on the Luana because they offer a two bedroom two bath suite (#718) with a full kitchen and, as a bonus, a 1000 sq.ft. deck with a great city view and a partial glimpse of the ocean and Friday night fireworks.Having stayed at many Waikiki hotels before, I thought that there was a misprint that should have read 100 sq.ft., but this is not the case, it is the size of three budget hotel rooms, we loved it. Our room was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed for cooking our own meals, which is a big plus if you have a big family and want to save some bread. Comfortable beds all the way around, including the sleeper sofa, two full bathrooms and enough room for our family to unwind and not feel cramped. If I had to find a problem, it would be the temperature of the hot water in the master bedroom. It would not get as hot as the other shower would. No big deal, but it was noticeable. Also, the elevators will get you there, as long as you're not in a rush. Overall great experience and value. Highly recommended, and we look forward to staying again.

The staff were great - very pleasant and very helpful. Free coffee in the mornings in the lobby was a nice touch, although one can make it in the room too. The little eatery that was open early until 2pm was great too - very fresh and tasty breakfast fare and light lunches and the staff in there were very friendly too. We opted not to have our room serviced every day for the week that we were there and were given vouchers at the eatery in lieu of that. We were able to have clean towels and toiletries whenever we needed them..... We would stay here again for sure.....

Katia and BobOur stay at the Luana Waikiki Hotel was great with an ideal location close to Waikiki shopping and restaurants as well as Ala Moana shopping center. The very accomodating and excellent staff starting from the General Manager were genuinely interested in the wellness of the hotel guests. The pool and common area was well maintained and very clean with no building obstruction to the sun. We have already recommended he hotel to our friends.

We have stayed at this property for 2-3 weeks every year for years and sometimes twice a year.Sunny the Front Desk Manager was very professional and accommodating. The bellman and front desk staff were so friendly. Our one bedroom unit had a full kitchen overlooking Fort Duressy park and ocean.Mark from housekeeping was prompt to address a couple of small things. We went to the reception on our last Friday...nice social event. Some of the staff worked at it so it was nice to say good bye to our Hawaiian family and thank them for a great stay. Have not really met the General Manager with Aqua but he has an amazing group of people who work with him. They have yoga which my husband attended. The fireworks from our balcony on Fridays is a bonus! Great place...

I came to Honolulu for the first time with my family and gosh, this Hotel did not disappoint at all. Its location may not be the greatest, but it is located strategically in Kalakaua Avenue, taking 5-10 minutes (the most) walk to Waikiki Beach. The Hotel provides free wifi, free newspaper, and free water, coffee, and tea at the Lobby, free towels, and free shuttle services to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It also has a small park right by the hotel where you can go for a run or walk in the morning.My family took the room with partial ocean view. Man, the view was breathtaking. It has 2 comfy queen beds and spacious for the 4 of us. It also has kitchenette (microwave, all necessary amenities such as plates bowls glasses, coffeemaker) which makes it easy for us to do small cooking.We were also very pleased with the front desk staffs which are very friendly and assisting. Services is beyond excellent, especially the concierge. Thank you for making this trip of ours memorable, Luana Waikiki Hotel. My family looks forward to be staying there again when we return to Waikiki.

Location is great, just a few minutes to get to the main Waikiki Beach. We have a lovely room with 2 queen beds, very comfy with a Partial Water View which was great. Room was updated and well appointed. Liked the morning coffee and newspaper service. We also took advantage of the shuttle service to Ala Moana Center. The staff are very eager to assist as needed. We will definitely return, our new hotel of choice. Thank you Sunny and Team.

This year is almost past us. It is now time to start making arrangements for spring vacation. I stayed at the Luana Waikiki for a week earlier this year with my family, and I can't wait to return. Housekeeping & Valet attendants get five stars from me. Their service was superb! Any little thing I needed, and they were there - from shampoo, soaps, towels, keeping the floors, bathroom & kitchen shiny, and the beds were always made so perfect. The valets quickly got my car ready & carried my packages and bags when I returned from shopping - totally pampered.Thank you!Gloria Guerrero/Author Sterling's Howl

I've come to Waikiki every Christmas for the past 3 years and stayed at this hotel each time. Its not surrounded by tall buildings like some of the other hotels and its about a 7 minute walk from the beach. Plus it is right on the edge of where all the action is in Waikiki so you don't get a ton of noise. In addition to its great location, I have no complaints about the service what so ever. All of the staff are extremely friendly, especially the concierge. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again when I return to Waikiki in the future.

I recommended this hotel to my husband for our recent visit, based on a brief work-related stay I had in 2012. The hotel is now an Aqua property (on my previous visit it was an Outrigger).This hotel is in a fabulous and unique location - it is worth consulting a map before staying here. The address is on Kalakaua Ave, yet the hotel is surrounded by Fort Derussy Park, making for a peaceful and scenic stroll to the beach. An early morning walk is a vacation mainstay for us, so it was great to start our daily walks surrounded by greenery versus the concrete jungle of Waikiki.The hotel was built in 1971 but underwent a major facelift about 10 years ago. The design choices were classic, so the property doesn't seem dated. The lobby is cozy and inviting. We loved the fresh water station, which also includes coffee/tea in the morning. The hotel has a pleasant pool area a couple of floors above the street, facing the back of the property. There is a small gym in that area, as well as a couple of barbecues with tables overlooking the park. While I envisioned ourselves grilling some fresh fish and eating dinner there, with all of the great restaurant options in the area, that didn't materialize.We had a partial ocean view studio, facing East. From our lanai we had an expansive view of Waikiki, the park and the ocean. Based on disappointing past stays in hotels that face busy streets in Waikiki, I would personally only go for a partial or ocean view unit at this hotel. There was some noise when sitting on the lanai (to be expected in the heart of the city), but when the door was closed the room was whisper quiet and we always slept well. The little kitchenette was perfect for our needs, as the only meal we tend to eat in when in Waikiki is breakfast (yogurt, granola, tropical fruit). The staff at the hotel stood out. They were always polite and accommodating. The hotel hosts a weekly wine and cheese reception on Friday afternoons. Attending that event gave us the opportunity to meet the hotel manager and other staff members, who were friendly and professional.On a couple of occasions we signed out hotel bicycles, once to ride around Waikiki on beach cruiser bicycles, and a second time to ride in a quieter area of the island (on this day we took the folding bicycles in our rental car). Lots of fun. This hotel does not offer room service, which was fine by us. There is a small cafe just off the lobby, and plenty of other eating options within walking distance.Note that parking is expensive, and is only valet, as is typical for many Waikiki hotels. We opted to park at an off-site location.In summary, we loved our stay and wouldn't hesitate to come here again. It offers good value, a great location, and plenty of "aloha" spirit.

I was very pleased with my experience at the Luana Hotel. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful. The room was spacious & clean, & the kitchenette was an added bonus (although I did not need it for this trip.) The location is good, just at the entrance to Waikiki. My balcony looked out onto the street which was fine. I only wish the sliding door also had a screen door, but that's very minor. A bird walked in to do a bit of exploring when the door was open. The lobby is lovely & the staff very welcoming. This is a great place for a longer stay, especially if you want to make your own breakfast & lunch and be a tiny bit away from the center of Waikiki.

I recently spent 3 nice, relaxing nights at the Luana. The hotel was very comfortable and had unique features such as the kitchenette. I liked the balcony area, which had a view of the ocean and downtown Honolulu. The hotel is located on the west end of Waikiki so it is a little bit away from all of the action, but that isn't a problem since everything is within walking distance. There is a cute park right by the hotel where you can go for a run or walk through to go to the beach.Service was excellent and all of the staff were friendly. Jordan at the front desk was great and made sure that I enjoyed my stay. Valet service was also quick.
user_name:
Rebecca L
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We're from the windward side of the Big Island, and with over 35 years here, we've stayed in Waikiki more times than I can remember. At least a dozen, probably more.We both agree the Aqua Luana Waikiki is by far the best place we have ever stayed. And we've stayed everywhere from the old Queen Kapiolani to the Moana Surfrider. This resort is on the town end of Waikiki, and thus it is much quieter than most, yet an easy walk all the way to the Zoo, Kapiolani Park, and Queens Beach.The property is spotlessly maintained down to the slightest detail, and the beauty of this place is brightly matched by the Aloha and professionalism of the staff…. we felt like royalty!We had ourselves a time, the pool was great, there's an outdoor bbq, and a fitness room. Our finely appointed room had the best bed I have ever slept in, a kitchenette with a large fridge and a microwave. And an awesome 15th floor view of the surf, sunset, and city lights.While there we enjoyed day trips to the North Shore, Chinatown, and the Bishop Museum. walks and one dinner in Waikiki (there are better choices in Honolulu, but that night we were on the road most of the day, so we settled for an unnamed chain around the corner)Do yourselves a favor and stay here! Aloha!

Hotel is located in a very convenient location at the start of the strip (since its a one way road). The hotel facilities are basic (compared to the huge pools and gardens at hotels further down the strip) but is actually all you need if you intend to spend most of your time out and about.The concierge especially were very helpful in helping us recommend places to go and making bookings since we went there with very little planning. Will definitely be the hotel we will be staying at if we vacation there again.

This is a boutique style hotel away from the main hotel strip in Waikiki. Cannot fault the service of the young staff - they all appeared very keen. However, some of the fittings, particularly in the bathroom, need updating (indeed the door handle on our bathroom could be considered a hazard). Also, the air conditioner can be very noisy, but you need to use it because the traffic noise can get annoying.But, it is ideally located between Ala Moana shopping and the restaurants and nightlife of Waikiki.The view from our hotel over the park was also quite pleasant. And with a kitchenette included you didn't necessarily have to go out to eat. Excellent value as well.

The pictures did the location no justice. The partial ocean view and view of the park were phenomenal. We were on the 10th floor directly above the the pool with a party of two adults and 3 children. Accommodations were perfect for us as the kitchen was very clean, modern, and included all the necessities of home. We were able to save on food and eat exactly what we wanted. The rooms very clean and requests for towels were addressed immediately. The location is an easy 4 block walk to the beach and shops. Just close enough to everything without being right in the middle of congestion. You do NOT need a car for this location as the valet is pretty expensive ($30 a day), but convenient My family looks forward to returning soon to our home away from home.

My husband and I stayed here at the Luana with our 6 month old daughter in July 2014. It was a really great hotel, with very friendly staff, big spacious rooms and very clean. The floors in our room were marble and cool in the heat. The bed was so comfy and big! The staff were very helpful with my daughter and bought a cot tour room very quickly. Thank You

This hotel has customer service on lockdown, from the front desk to the housekeepers the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Big shout out to Ona who checked us in and gave us a great room with an ocean view! Clean and quiet with a well stocked kitchen our room was fabulous, just like the view. Elton, Jordon and all the front desk/bell desk were super helpful as well with everything we needed. The guest use bikes were a great way to see the town and stock up on groceries. Also it was so nice to not have to worry about beach towels and the guest use bbq's are a great amenity!Tyler at the concierge desk was full of great info and tips. His recommendations were spot on and he was really friendly and patient with all of our questions! Thanks for hooking up our Luau (we went to Chiefs and had a blast) and rental car!Basically I have never been so sad to leave a hotel because it essentially felt like our home away from home. I really hope we can make it back soon!

Mathew Frisbie is awesome. Mathew helped us plan our activities during our stay and it was great. Jet skiing...horse back riding...ATV riding...boat tour...the secret island and the convertible Camara Mathew helped us reserve for our trip to the north shore!!!! Mathew was just as excited about our activities as we were if not more...he is amazing and a real sweetheart! He even remembered us by name as if he new us forever. Mathew is awesome and I would refer him to all friends and family. Thanks Matthew!!!

Hard to imagine better location: park, beach, all amenities - everything is close by and are just nice. Special Thank You to our concierge Tyler - very kind, helpful and knowledgeable. Booked all our trips with him. His advises were priceless! Thank you Tyler!!! Another special Thank You for Matteo - You made our vacation very pleasant and comfortable. You were there and ready to answer all our questions about locations, 'how to' and so much more. Your commitment and personalities make a huge pleasant difference of Luana Waikiki from other places. Thanks! Will be back!

This is the perfect location for visiting the Waikiki area. Its on the main road, but away from the bustle of Waikiki. The park next door means it is nice and quiet. It's a short stroll into downtown Waikiki and an even shorter one to Fort Derussy Park beach - an excellent beach without the Waikiki crowds.The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. This is an older hotel which means larger rooms (some with balcony) and older style furniture and fittings. This is no issue, but if its five stars and contemporary styling you are after, this may not be the place for you.There is a pool and a terrace, as well as a small cafe at the lobby entrance. The local tour bus route has a stop across the road.My wife had stayed at one of the huge hotels on the beach and much preferred this hotel as it was quieter and more relaxed - and much much better value.Highly recommended.

Had the pleasure of staying in the hotel from November l5 through l8. We didn't arrive till late on the l5th and the room we booked was unavailable so we were given a ocean front suite on the l5th floor and it was lovely. The staff were wonderful and so friendly. We had problems connecting to the internet and Sunny Chan helped us old geezers out with the new technology.The hotel is within walking distance for anyone to Waikiki or if you want to browse through the Hawaiian Village, I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I return to Waikiki.

The hotel is on the main st of waikiki, but down a little from the hustle and bustle. Perfectly situated to walk to the beach and cafes/restaurants and shops. We had a 14th floor room and found it a little noisy with the balcony door open due to the traffic, but you got used to it quickly. Our room was meant to have a partial ocean view, but we could see the beaches is both directions. the rooms aren't large, but are comfortable and clean. the staff are amazing and couldn't be more helpful. Every Friday there was complimentary wines and cheese to enjoy for an hour. Complimentary bicycles were great to go out sightseeing on. They don't have a kettle in the room, as there was a coffee perculator, but I asked and was delivered a kettle within 5 mins. We had a kitchenette, but never used it as dining out was so inexpensive. We arrived at 1030am and checked in immediately at no extra cost even though check in is usually 3pm, we also came back to our room one night to find a bottle of champagne and a note hoping that we were enjoying our stay .Its these little touches that made our stay more enjoyable. We spent 21 nights and could easily have stayed longer!

We are kama'aina from Kauai and found the Luana in a great location for visiting Waikiki. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Loved the pool. The lobby is stunning. We'll be staying at the Luana again and recommending it to friends and family.

After a 10 night stay at Luana, we cannot stress enough how helpful the staff were. Being first time visitors to the island, we knew relatively little about the what there was to see, and the best way of getting around the island. The staff at the front desk answered all of our questions and provided helpful advice at every turn. The hotel also held our bags for a few days after our stay, while we explored the rest of the island. The room was tidy, the facilities were adequate, and the location was great. Would recommend this hotel for the service that was provided alone.
user_name:
Maddy S
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Great location, beautiful lobby, nice, clean room. Had a one bedroom suite, 2 balconies with ocean & city views. Front desk staff was awesome! S/o to Jordan & Elton! Super friendly and helpful, thank you!

i love the whole place, the room is great, everything is awesome, i feel like at home, and esp, i love the positive attitude of all the staff , front desk name saori thank you so much.i would recommend this hotel to all my friends and every one ,who ever travel in honolulu

great service , great location. Luana is at the start of the Waikiki strip , perfect location to experience everything in Waikiki . We arrived at 8am and to our surprise there was no problem checking us in early, Elton was the attendant at the desk and was FANTASTIC ! As were the rest of the staff at Luana. I will defiantly stay here on my return to Hawaii
Nice clean room, quiet, comfortably furnished. Good value. Staff Ona was very friendly and helpful. Thanks Ona and Luana hotel!

Loved the staff and their positive attitudes - front desk and Adam and James out front. Got a great room upgrade and appreciated being on the park side . . . Several cleaning problems, i.e. dirty mirrors and kitchen tile floor, but the corner room and large patio covered for it. Terrific location and no problem with noise. Enjoy!

Due to reservation errors, I suddenly needed a hotel for 2 nights in Waikiki. I got a suggestion for the Luana, an Aqua hotel. Turns out to be one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in in Honolulu, and the staff was wonderful. The "single" room was compact, but efficiently laid out, and there was enough room to maneuver. The bed was comfortable, the ambient noise box proved effective in blocking any exterior noise (except the fire engines).

I had an extended stay at the Luana while I was on a business trip. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with a full ocean view. The entire staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and clean. The amenities are pretty standard for a hotel; pool, fitness center, laundry room, business center, and cafe. Great for people who are going to explore the island or on business since this is not a resort. The location is great as it is situated at the beginning of the Waikiki strip which makes it a bit quieter and easier to get in and out of with your car. When you want excitement, a quick 5-10 min walk takes you into the heart of Waikiki. I would stay here again and recommend The Luana to others planning a trip to O'ahu.

We wanted a bed closish to the beaches without breaking the piggy bank and this place delivered! Luana is about 10 minutes walk north east of Kahanamoku Beach and bordering the pretty Fort DeRussy Beach Park. The facilities at the hotel were spacious and clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Protea cafe just off the lobby is well worth a stop or three for breakfast also.

We stayed here for one night after a two week long vacation. It's a nice hotel, but bathrooms are very small (I'm only 5'1 and 100lbs) and there was no fan. The beds were comfortable, there was a mini fridge, some cutlery, cups etc, but no microwave. You can bring down whatever you need to warm up at front desk though (a little inconvenient if you needed to warm up milk for the little ones) but not a big deal. Plenty of coffee shops around. Luana is located at the beginning of the strip, I prefer to be in the middle. I was travelling with my family, (kids 3&4) this hotel is great for couples, or if you're traveling alone. They offer valet parking only for $35/night or hourly for $6. There's also free cruiser bikes you can use downstairs as well as bbq's

This hotel, located on the main street of Waikiki but outside the most congested areas, is a real gem! The location makes it easy to walk to the beach and most of the attractions of downtown Waikiki. There is a shuttle to the Ala Moana Mall. With Fort De Russey park in the back, there is an excellent green space to make the location even more inviting. The main street is a very busy street but the noise level is not too annoying.Staff here are excellent and very customer service oriented. Almost all were very helpful and courteous. Jackie at the front desk went above and beyond in giving us a late checkout to our room. James in valet is also excellent. We do not rent a vehicle when we stay here but we do use the beach amenities provided by the hotel (beach chairs, bikes). James is excellent in providing those. House keeping is very good and those providing the services are extremely friendly and courteous.The rooms are nice, seem roomy and well appointed. We have always stayed in a studio which comes with a large granite topped counter, sink, full compliment of dishes/utensils, etc. A microwave oven can be obtained from the front desk at no additional charge. Bathroom has a combination tub/shower and is okay. The hotel has a laundry room with about 5 washers and 6 dryers. Very convenient. The pool area is not large, but is very well maintained and a wonderful place to go when wanting to relax. A BBQ area with 2 very nice grills and 3 high topped tables is adjacent to the pool and is great for an occasional home cooked steak dinner!We often stay here for an extended time, 3-4 weeks, and this hotel almost seems like home away from home. A GREAT place to stay! OH, they had a wine and cheese party for guests from 4-5 pm on each Friday on our recent stay. It was EXCELLENT! Great cheese, some good wine, and a chance to socialize and meet some of the hotel guests. It was a much better experience than expected! Thanks to Sunni, head of Guest Services, for being such a good host!

My husband and I arrived in Hawaii a little bit jostled from a long plane ride and unorganized transport from the airport on Roberts. We were excited to finally be in paradise and get settled in. The Luana is in a great location. Upon check in, we were surprised to learn that there was a mandatory $15 a day "Hospitality" charge. (Just keep this in mind when you are price checking hotels) This of course, was annoying. The room is nice, but the housekeepers do nothing except change sheets and towels. I was expecting at least a counter clean off and vacuum as well. Other negatives include annoying elevators, internet goes in and out, and smallish pool. Positives are the people are really nice here, and like I said, the hotel is in a good location. Overall, I would stay here again, but would not seek it out on our next visit to Oahu.

Arrived for a three night stay on Tuesday, got off the plane from Australia at 6am! Staff managed an early check in of 10.30am with no additional charge. We were even more pleasantly surprised to find they had upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite, with full kitchen, instead of a half kitchen studio. On a at the front desk arranged all this and he was just delightful to deal with. Friendly, helpful, fantastic. In fact all the staff are. They are not bored like so many can be! And a couple of the staff knocked back tips! The room is a great size for two adults with adult children, the bathroom is spotless, in fact the whole place is. The free products in the bathroom are really good quality (taking em home!). There is refreshing water with cucumber lemon and mint in the lobby, as well as tea, coffee, apples and lollies. The beds are queen sized, not double, and the sheets are spotless and comfortable. The beds are extremely comfortable. Plenty of pillows, plus extras in the cupboard. Our room overlooks the park between the hotel and the beach. It's just beautiful. Can't think of a thing to whinge about!! While the $15 a day amenity charge was not booked to our room, we paid it because you get a free shuttle service, and free rental movies. Haven't used the gym yet, but the machines are good quality. Pool is clean. Would definately recommend, and yes would definately stay here again. Just a block from the beach, and big shopping plaza a block to the right. Got a great deal online through booking I think it was. Cannot hear any traffic noise at all, or noise from rooms joining. All in all, a great experience.

We had booked a room with partial ocean views which sometimes is a worry as the view might be just a ocean glimpse. Upon opening the door to room 914 we were amazed to find we had a fantastic view of Fort DeRussey park and the ocean. The room was clean and well serviced.Saori, Elton and the rest of the crew at the reception desk were fantastic and of great help. Thankyou guys for helping us have a great holiday experience. We thoroughly recommend this Hotel.

Wanted 3 days on Oahu after a week on Maui. Picked the Luana Waikiki. Decent hotel about 2 blocks from the beach. Parking is valet only and is $35 a day. A queen bed and a fold out couch with a kitchenette. Just right for a long weekend. The hotel staff was very courteous, knowledgeable, and helpful. We had a few problems with the room: a roof safe that wouldn't lock, the deadbolt on the glass patio door was broken, and the AC didn't work the last night we were there. The hotel staff said they could send someone right up, but we were leaving for the day and they didn't want maintenance in our room if the safe was broken. They didn't provide dish soap or dish towels for the kitchen. They have a very small pool, but we didn't plan on using it anyway since we had plans that took up the whole weekend. Honolulu traffic is the worst so having a good GPS to get us to the Hotel and around town was a must. We hit all the top beaches on Oahu including world famous Pipeline and Wiamea Bay on the North Shore.

staff very friendly and rooms were great! Pity the pool area lacked service with food and drinks. No room service either for food although there are lots of places nearby. Central location good value.

This is a wonderful hotel especially as it's so well positioned. I much preferred looking out to the beautiful park instead of looking onto other hotel buildings. A block or two from all the main Waikiki shops makes it an easy stroll to shopping. Staff were just lovely particularly Tyler who helped us with travel arrangements to the factory outlets and our day tour of the island, and Ebony who was always extremely professional and very helpful. Next trip I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Luana again.

1. Excellent service helpful and friendly staff! - Everyone from front of house to service staff very polite and helpful2. Great location walk to everything! Experience Waikiki by walking through it! Forget the car (although parking is available for a fee) just use a bus or shuttle or taxi.3. Rooms are comfortable and well presented 4. Great rates for the location5. I am a person who puts in loads of hours researching hotels, reading reviews on every booking website, comparing prices, street viewing the area because i seriously believe that where you stay can help make or horribly break a vacation...the Luana Hotel, its facilities and staff helped MAKE our vacation.Room tips: Try get a high floor above 5th floor - my parents were on the 9th floor, my brother and his wife on the 10th, my wife and I on the 12th (we stayed seperate floors by choice hotel staff asked us if we wanted to stay near eachother but we declined) aside from the odd Harley motorcycle and random fire engine or ambulance that youd hear no matter where you stayed in Waikiki there wasnt much steet noise! Although Cityview rooms are facing the street so i suspect it would be something to be wary if on lower levelsAircon can be noisy if you dont like noise but nice and cool.One thing id suggest to be very wary of is donot have small children on the balconies the gaps in the upright rails were big enough for my 2yo daughter to slip through *shudder* we kept the door closed- i have informed the hotel of my concern.The room we stayed in was 1215 Partial ocean view which was outstanding (go for this room) awesome views!

Friendly, helpful staff. We arrived very early via plane and were booked into a room with ocean views straight away which was a godsend after our flight. The only negatives were a loud airconditioner and a hard lumpy bed. I'm not a good sleeper so this was a real issue for me. Apart from that it was a shortwalk to everything. Public transport was cheap and great to everywhere . Buses have a $2:50 flat fee. You don't need a car. Parking is expensive.Taxi to the airport was $40 including tip. We had 4 adults and a toddler and getting around was a breeze.

I'll be honest, I was a little worried about staying here, afraid it would be poor quality. It FAR exceeded my expectations - a wonderful place to stay! The location is GREAT - a quick 10 minute walk to the beach. Also it's a quick walk to downtown Waikiki restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly - we loved getting to know them. We really needed to save money on our hotel stay this time, and I honestly am not at all disappointed with the experience at the Luana. The balcony is great - the beds are comfortable - everything was clean and well taken care of. Nice to have a sink and fridge/kitchenette too in the standard room! It's not the absolute nicest you'll find, but I didn't miss out on the resort or 5-star feel at all. It was excellent!!

Our flight arrived early in the morning so we booked the previous night so that we could freshen up before hitting the streets. All staff were very kind and we never had to wait too long for anything. They were also very understanding that we didn't have any US currency to tip with until wee got to an ATM. We managed to fix them all up later that day. The room was generous with a kitchenette and the usual fixings. There was a slight damp smell coming from the old air-conditioner and it was too loud to have running during the night. The room was very quiet on the first floor. The shower is only suitable for smaller people and the room safe was not working, but we were offered a reception safe deposit box on arrival, if we wanted it.

Great place to stayThe staff were very friendly and helpful, the location was excellent and close to shops restaurants and the beach.The rooms were very good and well serviced. the amenities within the room were good and the hotel had a weight room as well as a small pool, with good seating provided around it.

This spot is a gem; love the location on the park and is actually quiet at night - out of the hubbub of Central Waikiki. Had 6 great days and nights. Will definitly stay there again on my 2 annual trips through Hawaii. Great staff, clean, and best location!

We stayed for 3 weeks in a 1 bedroom ocean view apartment. Our flight arrived at 9am so we arrived at the hotel well before normal check in time even so our apartment was ready for us. The apartment was just as shown on the website photos. the bedroom and kitchen were quite spacious however the living area was a little on the small side but satisfactory. The views from the balcony were great especially for the Friday night fireworks, around 7pm when we were there.The apartment was clean although the kitchen sink and bench could have been cleaned a bit better. The kitchen, had a large stove, microwave and fridge with ice maker. It also had plenty of pots, pans, crockery and cutlery etc, a drip coffee machine was provided and coffee was replenished each day. However there was no kettle to boil water for a cup of tea but managed with a saucepan. The location suited us as it was away from the hectic Waikiki area, Fort DeRussey Park was just next door and Waikiki Beach just across the park. "The Bus" and Waikiki Trolley stops were nearby, just across the road or around the corner, also the tour buses we went on pick/drop off stops were across the road.The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful as were the tour desk staff.The pool area was very nicely kept, there were gazebos with tables and chairs and sun lounges available along with towels, beach towels were also available from the front desk. The pool itself was not very large but most times we only shared it with a couple of other guests. Although the pool water was quite warm so not what we would call refreshing.All in all a lovely place to stay and it will certainly be our accommodation of choice for future visits.

Located close to the beach and shopping malls. When we were there, did plenty of walking and taking the bus. I would recommend this place to my friends. Just remember to get a room with a view away from the gas station. Not a bad hotel rate.

We spent 5 nights here and had a fantastic partial ocean view room on the 16th floor. After a stressful time trying to return our car it was so nice to finally relax in this well appointed room. Beds were extremely comfortable and room was clean. Had a microwave and fridge which was convenient to use. There was a resort fee of $15 a day included in price but even with this I thought the price was very reasonable compared to similar hotels. Walking distance to most places in Waikiki plus hotel shuttle was available as well as bus stops near hotel.Could not fault this hotel except air conditioning could get noisy at times but overall a fantastic stay and would definitely stay here again

Great location, close to shops, restaurants, beach and transport.Friendly and helpful staff both at checkin and concierge.Great room with ocean views and all the facilities you need.Would come stay again.

Good location for access to beach, shops and attractions. Partial ocean view room which was fine - lovely and clean. The only reason this isn't a four star review is because of our experience of the concierge service. They booked a shuttle service for us to Pearl Harbour and told us we could come back at any time of our choice - this was far from accurate as the shuttle insisted that we left at 3.30 and no later. We'd purchased a 'passport' ticket and wanted to make the most of it, so we weren't very pleased but had little choice but to turn up at the allotted time. The irony was that they failed to pick us up, having collected another couple from our hotel without checking their time slot, so we ended up standing there for nearly an hour. When we reported back, the concierge and activity teams weren't very bothered, however one of the hotel managers did seem to be concerned and apologised, offering us a free breakfast the next morning. We did have a great stay inspite of this blip.

The entrance to Luana is calming with the hustle and bustle of Waikiki around this hotel.  The zen like waterfalls greet you as you climb the granite staircase to the sliding glass doors entrance.  The bubbling water feature, along the staircase, held a Hawaiian fish hook, that sat atop what appeared to be a large piece of white quartz.  Upon opening the door to our room, the spacious surprise behind the door lured me inside to explore.  The large radiate tile floors expanded the entire room. The granite countertop and cabinets, extended for miles.  The room had a nice comfortable mattress, couch and chairs!  The sliding glass door, opened to reveal a lanai which held two chairs and a small table. It was the perfect spot to unwind and watch all of Waikiki unfold day and night.  No ocean or major mountain views.  We had the city (with lights at night!) and peek-a-boo mountain views.  Our lanai overlooked where Kuhio and Kalakaua Avenue fork, with lots of traffic, sirens and the occasional loud moped. However, at the fork in the streets, sat a small park with sidewalks, resembling a labyrinth, which ended at a water feature. Watching humanity below was entertaining.   Every day you could indulge for a cool refreshing, exotic beverage of H20 after walking around and melting in the warm Waikiki sun, provided by the hotel in the lobby area.  The detoxing water options were lemon & basil or lemon & cucumber.  Personally, the lemon and basil was perfect! The workout room is equally nice as it looks out onto the pool deck and pool. Easy walking distance to many shops and restaurants and the beach! While waiting on my partner to settle the room charges & daily parking with Saori (who was very nice, professional, helpful and courteous), at the front desk, I noticed a small fish bowl sitting on the reception desk counter.  The sign next to the glass bowl read, “Adopt Mumu & Lulu for the day!”  This hotel offers the comfort of home, even adopting a pet fish for the day.

This was a first time visit! What made our visit even better was due to two fantastic front desk clerks--Jackie and Elton. They go beyond a days work to make you feel special and wanted. The other clerks were friendly but there is something that is special about Jackie and Elton. Our room was great, could see the beach! Everything with in walking distance, shopping , eating and the beach. Housekeeping kept our room clean and stocked, when the hairdryer quit, they brought another one right up. Overall I recommend this hotel to everyone, it is a nice hotel. Will return to this location next trip!

The only complaint i would make is they could use some newer or nicer mattresses. Housekeeping was great and so willing to help out with our requests. Front desk staff great..helped us book our daily adventures. View from balcony was beautiful . We stayed in the partial ocean view rooms. Everything was within walking distance..beach..zoo.shopping was close. Rooms were good size and no noise issues.

Loved the location. Near all shops, Waikiki beach, and everything you need is walking distance away. The stay was really worth it because the room was very clean as well. All the staff was great. I am very grateful I stayed here with two of my girlfriends! We all enjoyed it.

The best room, bed and service we have ever received! Housekeeping is sheer perfection! A true delight with the most comfortable bed we ever slept on in a hotel!! Front desk was so helpful and the little cafe there has cheesecake to die for!

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. It is a very nice hotel, about 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach and Fort DeRussy Park. It is also close to downtown so there are many restaurants and stores close by. Our room was very spacious and comfortable, it was like a mini-suite because you had a sofa, a small dining table, a microwave oven, a sink, and a mini-fridge. The hotel has a really nice pool and gym.

So disappointed about my stay in Luana Waikiki two weeks ago. The air conditioner was so noisy and I couldn't get into sleep. Also the floor in the room was dirty, and it had only mandatory Valet Parking. I spent 10 minutes to check in because there was only one staff in the reception desk. I have no idea why they charge Resort fee without anything fancy...
user_name:
Garywudi
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice place with good service. The business centre with a mac and PC option was great and the free printing made life easier. Shuttle bus was handy. Parking was a little pricy at $35ish. Reasonably priced for the location. Bonus was the free yoga class, which was great. However not sure if id recommend it for first timers.

It’s my first time in Hawaii and my stay with Luana is simple the best. Overlooking Fort DeRussy Park and walking distance to the Waikiki Beach. The hotel also offers complimentary towel and beach chair available at the front desk. If you are into shopping, it’s a short walk to Tiffany & Company, Gucci, Volcom etc. If you are on a tight budget, the kitchen is very convenient and helpful considering that the cost of living in Hawaii is a bit expensive.The hotel staff is welcoming and very friendly. The housekeeping team is doing a great job. They always ensure that my room is clean. The housekeeping supervisor even asked me if I am satisfied with the cleanliness. I definitely recommend this place and will stay here again on my next trip!

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 2 nights, 10/1 - 10/3, room 1002. The room was a studio kitchenette, completely tiled and a comfortable size. The kitchen area was nice, had everything we needed. The bathroom fan didn't work, but we seem to find that alot in hotels. The bath towels were much nicer than the standard hotel towel!We never went to the pool, but pool towels were provided at the front desk. The front desk staff was friendly.We only heard 'noise' when people were in the hallway, which didn't happen much. There was no street noise.The hotel location was good. We could easily walk to shops and restaurants. It's next to Fort DeRussey Park and paved walkways through the park take you to the beach in 10 minutes. Our primary purpose in Honolulu was to visit the Pearl Harbor Memorial. From the Luana, we walked to the bus stop on Saratoga Ave (5 minutes) and caught bus 42 which has a stop right at the memorial (so does bus 20). It took about an hour to get there with all the stops, but it was easy - and affordable at $2.50 per person. The Luana served us well, we'd stay there again.

I use the Luana for my family and business trips and its perfect. It's on the west end of Waikiki on Kalakaua and less crowded and alomost every room is quiet. It is surrounded by a park like setting and not another highrise hotel. People at the Luana are young, professional and extremely helpful. My one bedroom room rate is the same for a regular room at at a big name hotel. The beach is a walk through a park away and beach towels and chairs are free for guest to use. Well worth the money.

I wanted to find a perfect place to take my wife and stay in Waikiki. I am raised in Hawaii only to come back from my Honeymoon, the front desk was very helpful, nice and resourceful. The bed was really comfortable and the partial ocean view was satisfying. There is the morning paper in front of the elevators, valet parking was very nice and quick. I would recommend Luana for future customers.

My wife and I had a stopover in Honolulu on our way to the mainland. We didn't want to stay in the crowded Waikiki area and fortunately this hotel proved perfect for us. Our room was large with a full kitchen and a view of the ocean. The hotel was within easy walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping center as was Waikiki. The room was quiet and the bed great to sleep in. Staff very helpful and recommended some wonderful restaurants in the immediate area. We will stay there again

Friendly staff, convenient location, clean room, reasonable pricing. Despite the room I stayed in did not have an amazing view, but the rest of the package defintely made up for it. I had a great time staying there and will 100% come back next time around.
user_name:
Davey H
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We chose the Luana on referral from the military bases. They offer government rates and we were unable to book at the Hale Koa or on-base billeting, but we found that this is a great hotel! The staff were all very professional and attentive, assisting in all aspects of our stay in Honolulu.

The incident that bothers me is that I was in the elevator and a bellman yells across the lobby "Hold the elevator!" He comes over with a luggage cart piled with someone else's luggage. Once he gets the cart into the elevator, he tells, not asks, me to push the button for the second floor. A small thing, but an indication of a lack of knowledge of the concept of hospitality.We lived on Oahu once for two years and now that we live on the Big Island we visit often when my husband has business here. We usually stay at the Ilikai or the Alana, but we weren't able to book either one this trip so we decided to try the Luana. It is good value as it has decent, though not luxurious, rooms for a price that is somewhat lower than the hotels we usually stay in. The entire hotel is not shabby, but on the verge of needing updating. The location is terrific, right in Waikiki but within walking distance of Ala Moana Center. If it wasn't for the elevator incident, I would be satisfied, though not thrilled, with my stay at this hotel.

Truly a great place to stay. Close to more than one beach and other attractions. The staff is friendly and helpful with information about activities and locations. We made use of the barbecue for some great meals by the pool.

We are having a great stay at Luana. The in room kitchenette has saved us during very rainy weather. We picked up food on our first night at The Food Pantry which is an easy 8 minute walk away and enjoyed leisurely breakfast and lunch in our room. The amenities have been great. Little touches like kona coffee available in rooms and lobby, wine on Fridays, umbrellas, yoga class, make this practical well priced hotel stand out. We loved being near fort de russy park and off the main drag of Waikiki beach since it was a little less crowded. Also the hotel accommodated our pre-checkin request for a high quiet room. The "partial" ocean view was perfect. We didn't feel slighted at all. Had a great view of the park and the beach from room 1015. We are using Honolulu as a jump off point to visit other islands. We plan to do this trip again to explore islands we can not hit on this trip and we would definitely stay at the Luana again.
user_name:
Allison2468
New York City, New York

review_body: We just returned from 8 days in Waikiki. We stayed at the Luana Waikiki. It was pretty convenient to lots of dining, shops and beach. The staff was very nice. Matteo was very helpful. If we ever get to go back, I would probably stay at the same hotel.

Stayed at the Luana Waikiki October 2014. What a grea location... lot's of shopping and restuarants in walking distance. Very close to the bus stop so you can go a lttle further.. Staff was great.. Matthew the Concierge was very helpful. Rooms were nice.. 5 minute walk to the beach. just an all around great place to say I would recommend.

We stayed for a week and my wife and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It has a great location as its close to all the shops and restaurants and your literally 10-15 minutes walk away from the beach. The staff were all very nice and would consider staying there again on our next trip to Oahu.

Heard of the Luana from friends while I was out here working and moved over for the convenience of a kitchenette. Wow, what a wonderful hotel! Not on the beach, but great location in Waikiki, close to everything. Rooms, accommodations, staff and amenities could not have been better! Extremely impressed with all aspects of my stay and will look no further on my next trip.
user_name:
Dwayne B
Waco, Texas, United States

review_body: We just stayed for a week at the Luana Waikiki while visiting Oahu for our son's wedding. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Anything we needed was taken care of. It was extremely easy to get the car when we needed it, and all the valet parking team never seemed to mind how many times a day that happened. :) Saori was very helpful at the front desk and always took care of any questions I had. We would love to stay here again! Esther C
user_name:
Esther C
Longview, Texas, United States

review_body: Great place for the price. Room spacious and clean. The pool was perfect. We really liked the location. The staff was very helpful,with suggestions and directions. We will definitely stay there again.

Took a chance on staying at this Hotel after reading great reviews on TripAdvisor!! Great choice. It was easy to make reservations the hotels direct website. Found a great price for the time and needs we were looking for. Unfortunately, this hotel only offers Valet parking with a $35 a day fee. But the night Valet person was great, super helpful, very friendly, and we were happy to tip him. The day time Valet was not as attentive, but nice. Check in was quite easy and the night staff was very friendly.The lobby is beautiful, clean, and very welcoming.Our room was great! Better than I expected. Spacious, super clean, very nice, and the beds were clean and very comfortable. Nice amenities, great to have the semi-kitchen, mini fridge was great, and we loved the small touches like the house slippers. We had a city view which we did not mind at all as we only spent time in the room for sleeping after our long days and nights out at our concerts and scheduled activities.We loved our short stay here and will definitely return for future stays.We had hoped to lounge at the beautiful pool, but just didn't have the time. We hope at our next stay we will have the pleasure to have more leisure time at the hotel. Saori also made check out very easy.Thank you again for a very nice and comfortable first time experience.

Firstly - We have been here a week and are still here but I am so impressed with this hotel that I wasn't wanting to wait until after my stay to write this review - I don't want people to miss out on the opportunity to stay here.We spent a lot of time researching hotels prior to our visit and settled on Luana Waikiki due to it's location and obviously price came into it. I have read some negative reviews but thus far can only agree with a couple of them.Yes the hotel is aging a little, however, I like it. It is clean and comfortable and above all the staff are amazing. Yes the lifts can be a little irritating as they are slow. The airconditioners are noisier than I'm used to but I didn't find it an issue at all.What does it lack - I would have liked a bar in the hotel for evening drinks, but you cross the road and there you are - a bar.The staff cannot do enough for you - just ask and they go out of their way to assist, even the night security guards go above and beyond.Ryan the 'bell boy' is the most amazing, friendly person you could meet - he even took the time to tune our Ukelele and I never saw him without a smile on his face. Matteo also is happy to help you with anything you want. Matthew and Tyler the concierge staff will help you with anything and always with a smile. All the reception staff are polite and smiling and the most helpful people you could wish for. One in particular - Elton went out of his way to assist us when we wanted pizza delivered and had a great sense of humour, displayed when we gave him "Aussie grief".Any negatives you can find about this hotel are put aside due to the attitude and pleasantness of the staff.Would I stay here again.....Heck yes.

My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Luana Waikiki and I was so impressed I felt compelled to share our experience!We disembarked from a 12 day cruise from Vancouver to Honolulu and had arranged to stay post cruise at the Luana. We arrived at the hotel around 9:30 in the morning fully expecting that we would have to store our luggage and kill time until our check-in time of 4:00 pm. We were delighted to be informed that our room was available immediately. It started our stay on a very positive note.We had chosen a partial ocean view studio with a kitchenette. The room was lovely and the view was amazing! Our room was located on the 11th floor and overlooked Fort DeRussey Park and the ocean. We appreciated the vintage Hawaii decor and found the room included everything we needed to be comfortable. It was extremely clean and very well equipped.The location is at the gateway into Waikiki and within walking distance to the beach as well as all of the shops and restaurants in Waikiki. There is also great access to public transportation and shuttles. A car is not really necessary unless you plan to travel outside of the Waikiki area. The hotel itself is a real gem! We have been travelling to Waikiki almost every year since our honeymoon in 1978. We have stayed at several different large hotel properties and also rented private condominiums for longer stays. I have to say that this is one of the most pleasant properties we have stayed at.If you can look past the slighted dated facade, you will find a lovely little hotel that is reminiscent of the Hawaii of days past. Rather than trying to modernize the decor, they have embraced the vintage Hawaii feel and the result is a warm and inviting home away from home. The lobby area is very comfortable and nicely decorated.They have included special touches such as cold water dispensers with cucumbers and mint flavouring to welcome you when you come in out of the heat. It is so refreshing and we took advantage of it each time we returned to the hotel. They also had a sunscreen dispenser mounted on a wall by the pool. I have never seen this before, even in a high end resort. What a wonderful idea! We were also very pleased to be offered ice pops out by the pool one afternoon to cool us off. Little touches like these make moments memorable and leave a lasting impression.The staff members were all so friendly and eager to please! We were always greeted with a smile and friendly word when we approached any of them. They worked diligently every day keeping the hotel immaculate for their guests. A wine and cheese social is held every Friday afternoon from 4:00 to 5:00 pm and it is a wonderful way to meet and visit with other hotel guests.It is difficult to find anything negative to say about this property. The only thing I could suggest is that they look at replacing the air conditioning units in the rooms as we did find ours to be quite noisy. It did the job to keep the room cool though. We also had the patio doors open most of the time anyway so it was only an issue when we turned the air conditioning on.We will definitely stay at this hotel again, and if you are looking to visit Waikiki in the near future, you may want to consider it for your stay. I am sure you will not be disappointed!

I recently stayed at the Luana Waikiki my 1st team in Hawaii and I absolutely loved it. The partial oven view was just as pictured and the hotel staff was more than friendly. I couldn't have wanted anything better my 1st time in Hawaii. The room was spacious, the pool was wonderful, and the location was right along the strip, so you were close to everything but also felt like a retreat due to the park being right outside your window.

Location, location, location. If you are looking for a cute boutique hotel on the perimeter of Waikiki, look no further than the Luana. The rooms are spacious each with a view of either the mountains or beach and if you're lucky enough to be above the green belt side of Fort De Russy, you can feel an expansiveness that other hotels in Waikiki lack due to the numerous high risers ( with 20 more going up shortly). The pool and workout facility are good and the service exceptional! The valet parking was convenient but a bit on the expensive side $35 a night but they are available for in and out privileges 24 hours! The only complaint is the air conditioning unit in our room was quite loud and we had to purchase ear plugs to sleep. A true gem, stay a little or lot but you'll love the calm spirit of the place in an otherwise frenetic Waikiki.

Stayed at the Luana for 9 nights from Sept 14th, and had such a great time we didn't want to leave. From our arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were thrilled with our rooms.. 2 partial ocean views on the 9th floor. They were very clean and comfortable, well equipped with lovely furnishings, and a great view across the park to the ocean. We found the housekeeping staff very pleasant and thorough.Front desk staff were always willing to offer travel, direction and local restaurant tips, and the complimentary beach towel service was a bonus. A big thank you to the concierge Tyler, who assisted us in local info, and booking tours.We thought the location was excellent.. just far enough out of the central Waikiki commotion, yet close enough to enjoy all that Waikiki has to offer. We enjoyed the 5-10 min walk to both the beach (through the park), and the main shopping precinct ( A good way to work off excess food and cocktail calories :)). And there's always the trusty ABC shop across the road.The cafe downstairs is open for breakfast and lunch, and offers tasty fare at a good price.It was very hot while we were there (even by Hawaiian standards), so we loved being able to walk into the front lobby and have complimentary icy lemon/mint water on tap. Also used the lobby complimentary tea/coffee service in the mornings.The only problems we had during our stay, were, the pool was closed for a couple of days due to a water quality issue, and the airconditioner stopped working one night.. Both were rectified quickly and caused us little inconvenience.As you can see by my review, loved, loved our stay there and would head back tomorrow!Many thanks to all the staff :)

The hotel was much better when under the Outrigger team. Very disappointed in that I reserved a 2 queen bedroom and during check in I was told that can't be guaranteed to me and of course we didn't get the 2 queens and neither did the 4 guests prior to us during check in. Check in took 30 mins because all the guests were upset they couldn't get the room that they reserved. Also the front desk was unable to tell the guests if their room was ready because they said housecleaning has not communicated with them all day. The air conditioner is louder than the tv and barely provided any coolness to the room. When we tried playing dvds, the movies would oftem just stop or skip. Also the bathroom didn't have a functioning lock.On top of it all there was a cockroach in our bathroom. We stayed at the Luana three years in row and will NOT be coming back. Sad because this used to be a great hotel.

We stayed here for 3 nights in August/September. Appreciated the friendly staff (from the front desk to the valet), the clean and spacious room (loved having the kitchenette and the lanai), the location was central to most shopping and a leisurely walk to the more central part of Kalakaua. My ONLY complaint is was the expensive parking fee. US$35 for valet is a bit more expensive than other hotel parking in the area, and is your only option if you've got a car.Everything else was terrific!

We stayed at Luana for 3nights to attend Arashi concert.We booked partial ocean view room and ocean view 1 bedroom.I recommend 1bedroom for family with older children but hotel room was comfortable enough to sleep for 3 adults.(we requested 2beds)The best thing was a view!!! The room was 16th and 14th floor and had a view of the park and ocean.Very very nice.I would recommend to book a room with at least partial ocean view and request a higher floor.With that kind of view in Waikiki, I think price of the room is a big bargain.The bed was very comfortable,even the hotel room has small kitchenette and basic plates and utensils.They don't have a formal restaurant but there is a small cafe open from 0700-1400, which we went twice.We didn't have time to wait in the long lineup at Eggs'things( which is very close from hotel) and we were all happy to have breakfast crepe and acai bowl at this small cafe.Don' t expect 5 star facility (no room service,pool was broken at the time,elevator takes time) but you can expect 5 star service.Front lady called ABC store for us to find out if they carry what we were looking for, she was very friendly and had a good smile at 11pm.Asked for an extra towel for house keeping(it was an answering machine maybe because late at night) Towel never arrived so talked to the front desk and she send someone right away, and he was a security guy.I talked to him earlier in elevator he was a very nice guy with smile.I gave him a tip for the towel but he declined with smile. He said this is my job! And again this is late at night.In the morning, they had a coffe,tea,lemon and mint water service in the lobby which was very nice.We didn't have time to enjoy but they offer cocktail night on Friday, with cheese and wine.They still have things that can be improved like housekeeping, answering machine is not a good idea,also used cups and plates were sitting in the sink(it's our job to clean...?)Personal touch like message card with candy or small chocolate or even a little flower will probably make a nice boutique hotel feeling.Everyone in Hawaii was so nice and we had such a good time,I am looking forward to go back and definitely to stay at Luana.

Second visit to Luana Waikiki, and first since becoming an Aqua property. The changeover seems to have been seamless, and our week's stay was just as enjoyable as the previous visit.The courteous and friendly staff enhance the holiday experience, and the location, overlooking the park and the ocean, and at the quieter end of the Waikiki strip is a winner. The view from a partial ocean view room is far more rewarding than what's on offer from nearby prestigious hotels at double the price.The pool area is pleasant and wind-protected, with plenty of sun lounges and shade if required, and a perfect place to watch the Friday Night Fireworks. Nice change for a hotel pool not to be bombarded with chlorine, but maintained at a comfortable level. The complementary local newspaper and free morning tea/coffee in the lobby provide a very relaxing atmosphere to start each day, and the proximity to many restaurants and public transport makes eating and local travel a breeze. Just a 5-minute walk to the centre of the Waikiki strip, and maybe 20 minutes to Ala Moana if you prefer a walk to a bus ride ($2.50). Further afield, the bus can get you very cheaply to the Aloha Stadium, Pearl Harbour, Waikele Factory Outlets, and Pearlridge Shopping Mall - all $2.50 unless you break the journey. The bus is a lot slower than your own transport, but many times cheaper than the shuttle tours you will be subjected to from the moment you arrive.I am often puzzled by some of the petty or nit-picking observations in reviews such as these, but we really couldn't fault anything about our stay, which offered value, location and friendly staff. All of these enabled our objective of a week's relaxation to be easily accomplished, and easily determined our choice for a return visit.If I had to pick out a negative, I'd have to mention that $35 a day for parking is a bit steep, and certainly over the odds for hotels in the area, but the valet staff were pleasant, knowledgable and super quick. Leave yourself some time to sit and people-watch in the comfortable rocking chairs at the front of the hotel

Just returned to the mainland after a wonderful stay at the Luana Waikiki. This Boutique Hotel is a hidden gem. In Waikiki, close to everything, yet quiet with a wonderful park and ocean setting.What wonderful surprise to see that the Luana offers free Yoga classes 3 days a week. They provide yoga mats and the instructor was fantastic.Also, the free bikes, shuttle van and beach chairs were a welcome surprise.

we love this hotel and it never fails to deliver!! we did notice this trip the pool area was lacking in cabana cover but we really only there for a quick dip.Great coffee and water in the lobby and a business area for printing off our boarding pass's. great front desk staff as well!!

front desk always helpful; concierge personnel very helpful; coffee and water provided very good; Protea café excellent; hotel felt comfortable and quiet, no chaotic experience; bell folk helpful in response to tour guide people - overall, enjoyed our experience very much (other than fan on AC very loud)

My sister and I stayed at Luana Waikiki August 27-September 4, 2014. We have stayed in the middle of the action in Waikiki many times but I enjoyed the quiet location of Luana better. Check in was a breeze. Though not easily seen, there is a ramp on the other side of the driveway for dragging up heavy bags which takes you right into the lobby. We were greeted by a young man with a beautiful smile and check in was quick and easy. Our room had a queen bed and sofa bed (which was actually comfortable) and fully equipped kitchen complete with plates, cups, glasses, flatware, pots, pans, utensils, toaster, coffee maker, microwave, 2 burner cooktop and small refrigerator. There was plenty of storage for clothing with 4 deep under bed drawers and a large armoire. There was a nice deep safe inside the armoire. Though small, the bathroom was adequate, however, the design of the door was a bit odd. A pocket door would have worked much better. We discovered we had an odd plumbing issue when we noticed water on the bathroom floor. A trip the the front desk for extra towels and a service request was quickly handled. Within minutes, a friendly maintenance man was fixing the issue with the pipe under the sink. Housekeeping was very good and kept our room very clean. The air conditioning was a bit loud but we got used to it and it kept the room comfortable. Although we didn't have a car, the valets would always greet us and talk to us when we were coming or going. The beach was a nice leisurely walk through beautiful Ft Derussy Park and it was nice to have beach chairs, umbrellas, rafts, water noodles, other beach toys free to take with us supplied by the bell desk. We did use the pool area one morning and it is a very tranquil setting with very nice padded towel draped lounge chairs. Though we did not use it, the gym was by the pool and a bar-b-q area was also available pool side. Again we did not use this, but there were laundry facilities available. The location of Luana Waikiki makes it easy to walk to Ala Moana mall, The Beachwalk, the Royal Hawaiian shopping center and restaurants popular in the area. There is a bus stop next to the post office which is a block away. But the quiet location of the Luana made it nice to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the more popular touristy areas along Waikiki Beach. Protea Cafe, on property, had the best muffins and fruit bowls for breakfast and delicious sandwiches and savory crepes. There were other items on the menu we would have tried but did not. The staff at Protea is very friendly and it was fun talking to them. Their prices are low for Honolulu so a very good value. All in all, the Luana Waikiki is a great location with friendly staff and comfortable rooms. I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

We stayed here in September 2014We arrived at 7:30am after a 10+ hour flight, therefore we arrived very tired. They let us check in straight away! AND gave us an upgrade to the room with a kitchen!The staff were ready and willing to always give us directions/advise on attractions and sites.The pool area is fantastic and the gym is nice.The only issues i had were the fact that our room only had a double bed. And the location isnt fantastic. Its really in the middle of waikiki, there arent many food options, although there is an ABC store across the road.

Stayed for one night in a one bedroom suite (2 queens in the bedroom, queen sized pull out in the living room). There were only 4 of us, but the space could have easily slept 6 comfortably. Only drawback was that the only bathroom was in the bedroom, other than that found the room (606 or 607…can't remember) to be spotlessly clean and well stocked w/ a full kitchen…great for keeping dinner leftovers to reheat for breakfast the next morning! Nice, quiet location overlooking Fort De Russy w/ views of the ocean a few blocks away, quick 10 minute walk or drive to waikiki beaches and shopping, the zoo, honolulu museum of art & Ala Moana shopping. Gas station right next door for filling up on the way to return the rental car. Small cafe downstairs right off the lobby for grabbing breakfast to go and coffee was just fine and reasonably priced w/ friendly staff. My son appreciated the lender toys & even pet fish to borrow for the stay. Every staff member we interacted with from valet to front desk to housekeeping was exceedingly friendly & genuine. We did not use the pool but it appeared clean and well maintained. The property is an Aqua property, meaning it's decor has a nice fusion of hawaiiana (including a genuine old Woody out in the parking lot) & contemporary...look for Kamaaina rates if traveling from your home island, other discounts were available as well. I have recommended this property to several others since our stay & will not hesitate to book here again the next time we are on Oahu.

Stayed in this hotel for about a week.The hotel has many services: fitness centers, bikes, wifi, pools and many more.I had a great time and the people there were very nice as well. Its location is great too, near the Waikiki center.

My wife and I have just spent 12 nights at the Luana and we found it to be a great experience. The room we had was very comfortable with great veiws of Fort De Russy Park. The bed was very comfortable and the room very clean and tidy. The location of the Motel meant you were far enough out of town to be away from the hussle and bussle but close enough to walk to shops, resturants and beaches. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, Ryan one of the bell boys was always very helpful accomodatting to any of our requests from simple directions to organising cabs. The concierge Matt was great organising tours and things for us to do. Overall it was a great experience and we would definetly stay there again.

This accommodation is located between the main hub (CBD) of Waikiki, and a short walking distance to the ALA Moana shopping centre and only one street from the beaches . If you don't like the trimmings of a resort hotel but still like a little more than just a room, this is ideal. The kitchette was a great saving, being able to cook meals reduces the over cost of your holiday.Our Concierge, Tyler was always attentive to our needs. What surprised us both was how much he actually remembered about us. Days after booking trips with him, he quoted back information about our family that we shared with him. It is that personal touch that goes a long way to making a holiday vacation that much more enjoyable. We've adopted him as our Hawiian son - a lovely guy who couldn't do enough for us.

Planning our first trip to Hawaii, I researched many hotels in the Waikiki area. After considering both quality & price, we selected Luana Waikiki. This boutique hotel was much more than we expected. Perfect location: close to all attractions, shopping, restuarants & the beach. Additionally, the hotel was clean, neat and offered all the amenities we wanted, including free bike rentals/usage. The best part was the service. Every staff member we talked to was friendly and always went above and beyond what was expected. They were out of bicycles, so the concierge staff jumped through hoops to get us some, at no cost. Twice, the staff spent a considerable amount of time researching the internet for maps, attractions and other items we had asked about. I felt as if they went out of their way to make our stay/experience great. One staff member in particular, Matteo, became our "go to" person for any questions/needs. His custoer service was great and he made us feel special during our stay! Overall great experience and we would definitely stay here again!

My husband and I just came back from a wonderful 2 week stay at the Luana. We really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is great. We booked a kitchenette room and it was perfect for reheating food and storing snacks in the fridge. The room was very spacious and had a beautiful partial ocean view. The location of the hotel is perfect because it's not in the middle of the hustle and bustle further down kalakaua Avenue so the area is quiet and very relaxing. The hotel is not far from the beach or the Ala Moana beach park or the mall, so everything is within walking distance. I highly recommend the Luana. thank you

This hotel is in a good location within walking distance to both the beach and shopping and restaurants etc. The room was a good size and the bed comfortable and clean. The bathroom was small but had adequate counter space to put things. The towels were good , as were the amenities. We had a small kitchenette which we didn't use but seemed to be well equipped. There was a coffeemaker and some tea bags. There are some stairs up to the front reception but there is someone to help with bags, so it is not a problem. Check in and out was efficient and the staff pleasant. For the price this hotel was good value. It is on a busy main road but when the balcony door was closed the traffic noise was not a problem. There are a couple of convenience stores very close by. Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is in a good location away from all the hustle of the main drag in Waikki but easily walkable to everything. My sister and I had a partial ocean view room with a kitchen and the only downside was the bathroom door-needs to be a pocket door cause it really got in the way. The AC didn't reach the bathroom very well so that could get steamy in there. Otherwise, the bed and sofa bed were comfy and the kitchen was great to have. There is plenty of storage under the bed and in the kitchen and the safe was great to have in the armoire. The hotel is very quite inside-hardly knew others were on the floor. The desk staff were so friendly and very accommodating. There are beach chairs, umbrellas, and all sorts of beach things to borrow and the walk to the beach takes about 7 minutes through the park. The Protea Cafe has the best crepes and yummy muffins. There is an ABC store and a Whaler's General Store right across the way for quick things and a bigger ABC store on the Beachwalk which takes a few minutes to walk to. Overall, I would stay here again without any hesitation.

Hotel had nice large room, refrigerator, microwave, balcony and helpful staff. Travel agent in the lobby. Matthew got us a trip to the Arizona Memorial last minute and at a really good price. Close to bus stops. Quick walk to shopping and Waikiki beach. Staff at front desk printed us maps to anywhere we want to go.

Awesome view of Ft.Derussy, we killed the kitchen. Steaks and lobster and salad..mmmmm must have if your gonna stay longer than 1 day. We used the grills, bbq some food and met an awesome couple. Free wine and cheese...mmmmmm call me a lush but that's okay, I still highly recommend it to other ppl.
