+ great value for money+ clean and spacious+ nice view over Fort de Russy Park+ small kitchenette+ helpful staff and bell desk (storage of luggage)- only issue was that the bathroom was way too small!When we will be back in Waikiki and not willing to spend 300 USD at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, the Luana will be our first choice to stay!

Great check-in service. Upgraded us to a suite for no extra charge. There were 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 children. The suite had a full kitchen and 2 balconies, 2 flat screen TV's. Our only regret is we only stayed 1 night. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Great location! Close to everything. Rooms are nice. Only real issues are way too much street noise windows are paper thin and A/C Units are really old and loud too. So if you like quiet when you sleep look elsewhere. Maybe a higher floor would be better we were on the 3rd floor. Staff are friendly too!

Great location, easy to get to shopping and beaches. Staff is very friendly and hotel very clean. Had a great time and will be back for sure. The staff showed a genuine interest in our needs and helping us get to activities or dining with ease.

I stayed here last week with my wife and two kids (1 infant and 1 toddler) and had a great experience. The staff here are very friendly, from the guest services folks to the bell boy to the housekeeping staff. The location is great because it is close enough to the action, yet not in the middle of the action which can cause the hotel room to be noisy. I would recommend this hotel to families that needs a good family friendly place to stay along.

wonderful staff, great location (10 minute or so walk to the beach yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle), very nice, little pool; free local newspaper and coffee every morning, kitchenette...expensive ($35/day) valet service, yet very efficient and practical. all in all, a very good choice.

We just returned from a six night stay at the Luana Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Having purchased 2 vouchers through Travelzoo for the stay averaged to less than $100/night. It was definitely located in a very convenient area just down the street from the awesome shopping/restaurants/night life on Kalakaua Avenue. We walked to the Honolulu Zoo and Waikiki Aquarium. There were also plenty of convenience stores to pick up drinks and snacks for your room. The pool area was very nice and the fitness room had nice newer equipment to utilize. It is an easy 1 1/2 block walk to the beach.The only downside was the $35/night parking fee which includes valet service. Most hotels don't offer free parking in Waikiki so you are left to fend for yourself and find parking, if you can, on the side streets off Kalakaua Ave. or on Ala Wai Blvd. Thankfully, we only had to use the hotel parking for two nights but be prepared to spend a bit of time searching for a parking space on the street especially later in the evening.

Friendly staff, very clean rooms and reasonably priced. Matteo was very attentive. I would really recommend this hotel to anyone coming this way. The location is very convenient. Any questions we had were answered immediate. Staff followed up with us as we were walking out about excursions.

This hotel was great an in a good location for me personally. Was my first time in Hawaii an loved the homey feeling of this place came wait to come back here again. Hotel staff was very friendly an helpful with anything asked of them. View from the room was great as well :)

Great Staff, great facility, super location. Would stay there again. The kitchenettte area was super. We enjoyed having all of our breakfasts and some lunches in our room. Quick walk to the beach. The Kalakuha avenue at night was "SUPER". Very festive and comfortable. Walking distance to very nice shopping and restaraunts.The Valet parking ws a nice perk.

The air condition is very noisy. It broke down twice when we stay there. The 2nd time happened at middle of the night. We could not open the patio door because there was no screen door. The house keeping was slow and late. I arrived at 2 pm and was told my room was not ready. The front desk said just a little wait. I had to walk up at 3:30 to find out my room was ready. Someday the house keeping did not show up in the morning. We wanted to take naps so we did not get room services for several days. Otherwise, the hotel is clean and in good locations.

Check-in was very efficient, room was very clean and rooms were cleaned well. One morning, a cleaner knocked on our door at 8.15am which was not good, but we found a slide that you can put in the door 'do not disturb', so that worked well. Great sized refrigerator and a bath as well as the shower was very welcome. The pool was great and the gym was very good too. The Protea Cafe was very good for brunch and the staff there were very friendly and welcoming. Porters at the front of the hotel could be reminded to say hello to people as you walk in or out, it would be a nice touch. It was a short walk to main part of Waikiki and also nearby beaches. Overall, we had a great time.Great central location at a much lower price than hotels closer to the mains section of Waikiki. We would recommend this hotel to those looking for a great price and great location.

I cant fault this hotel for the help of the front desk as mentioned in the Title, but the housekeeping is very disappointing. I've never stayed in a hotel where they don't do dishes. Mind you not that i cooked on premise, but there's the occasional cup/glass or a fruit plate that would remain in that sink when i return at night. One day, not even the garbage was taken out. I thought they would have recycling so i left 2 huge plastic bottles there..and there they sat for the entire week. I called the front desk once and voice my disappointment and Hui at front desk was kind enough to offer me a $50 credit for the lack of service for Aug 19. However this continued the next 2 days...i'm still here by the way and checking out tomorrow Aug 22. I've been here for 6 days. However instead of causing trouble for the cleaning staff, my husband told me to just keep quiet about it. I left a tip everyday for cleaning lady hoping i get service and before i complained, she took it, but no dishes were done still. After I complained, she didn't take the tip AND of course no dishes were done. So we have given up on that note. On a positive side, both Saori and Hui were very helpful at front desk and also Nickson (security guard) who came to check with me on computer issues, and he kept coming back at the business centre to check in on me! Also the valet guys are helpful with restaurant recommendation with the local crowds! Therefore, i would give this hotel a 3.9 out of 5. The beds were very comfortable by the way! Location a bit of a walk but it's quieter so we are ok with that. Valet a bit steep though.

This place is a great place to start your time in Hawaii! The staff are super friendly and helpful, the place is clean and low key, and the cafe downstairs is lovely (10% discount for guests). Ask for a room facing the water - it's a great view. Also take advantage of the free yoga class on sun am and the nearby park for some exercise. Pool is a canny dinner but the gym is fairly decent and great to have.
user_name:
bitemehard
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Last minute booking through Hawaiian Air Package. It's more like a 3.5 stars. I am not crazy with the tile floor, but they did provide slippers for all guests. Walking distance to beach and shopping and restaurants. Hotel has balcony you can sit and enjoy views. Our unit has microwave that was convenient. Not provide with all units. Pool and workout room was never busy. Parking is a challenge if you have friends picking you up. But they do let your friends wait in the car outside without a problem. Price is good for the location.
user_name:
Rachel W
San Marino, California, United States

review_body: I booked a quick 6 day trip to Hawaii and I found this hotel with just 2 days notice.This is an excellent hotel with great service and great rooms. It is located right at the start of Kalakaua Ave so it is close to all the restaurants and the beach as well.The room was comfortable, and I had a fridge and kitchen as well. Bathroom was on the small side but not too bad. I had a great view of the ocean. The room was always serviced promptly in the morningsThe pool and gym were great, although a little disappointing that there is no pool bar and no umbrellas.I want to pay particular compliment to Saori at reception who was able to get me a room straight away after my long flight and an upgrade with minimal fee.Overall, a great hotel!

I booked this hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very well maintained, and clean. We had a studio kitchenette partial ocean view. You are far enough away from the ocean that I would not spend the extra dollars for the full ocean view. I actually like to cook while I am on vacation. I specifically like making breakfast so there is no rush to the morning. The kitchenette had everything we needed. I cooked every morning and then a few night when we were exhausted from touring all day. They provide you with coffee for the coffee pot every day. Dish washing liquid, salt and pepper which is very nice. Having the grilling area is a real plus as well if you want to cook. The fitness center was excellent with lots of different equipment. Maybe because we were in Hawaii, but I was never in competition for any of the equipment. The pool was pretty small, but the beach was within a 5 minute walk, so it didn't seem to be a problem. The hotel as has chairs, beach towels, snorkel equipment and other beach items that you can borrow for the day. All you have to do is give them your room number. This was very helpful.There is also a laundry it you are there long enough and need to wash clothes. The beds were comfortable, however, we did not have a King bed, which we normally prefer. However, we both slept very well. The room also darkened very nicely, which is a big issue for me if it doesn't. The elevators were slow and in the mornings you could not get to the pool to just sit out side to read until 9a. We came from the east coast of the USA and being on Eastern time, it would have been nice to be able to get out by the pool even if I couldn't get in. You do have to pay for parking. It is Valet and there are no other options. I would have preferred to have parked my own car. There is a $15.00 per day Hospitality Fee. I assume covers all the use of beach equipment, chairs, towels, etc. Every person we encountered was extremely nice and very helpful. This hotel is in a very nice area, lots of shopping, restaurants, park and close to the beach. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 12 nights from 25 July until 06 August 2014.We cannot express our sincere thanks to all staff there enough. Without exception everyone we spoke to on the staff were friendly, professional and would offer any assistance possible with a welcoming smile. The small touches such as morning coffee in the foyer, fruit water, a basket of books on the pool level and complimentary newspapers were greatly appreciated. Our room - 1415 was clean and very comfortable with a great view. We enjoyed the coffee in our room and the housekeeping staff were excellent. A small malfunction occurred with the television while we were there and the maintenance man was quick and efficient and the problem fixed immediately.We will definitely recommend the Luana to our friends and look forward to our next visit.

we stayed at various hotels ranging 4-5 star in our holiday in Hawaii and Vegas,Yet I would rate the Aqua as our most enjoyable hotel experience offering great value for money. The room was a little bit dated but spacious, clean and comfortable with a great view, walking distance to restaurants and shopping and the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We would def stay there again

The location is just great. Easy walking to Waikiki, Beach, Ala Moana and convenience stores. Much quieter and friendlier than the centre of Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the Hotel has a homely atmosphere. The room and facilities are very clean with frequent room servicing. The complementary bicycles and beach chairs for guests use was much appreciated. The view from partial ocean view rooms is a bonus. Complementary coffee in the lobby in the mornings was appreciated and may be it could be repeated in the evening. The rocking chairs at the front entrance are a great place to sit and watch the passing parade. Nice touch guys. We totally enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay again and will recommend the Luana to anyone we know heading that way. Good value for money. Just keep an eye on the maintenance guys and don't let the little things slip.

We found this hotel to be comfortable and it provided lots of desirable amenities -- laundry, BBQ grills, balcony, kitchenette, spa, pool, valet parking. Convenient to shopping, the beach, and transit. Clean and classy! We loved the location ~ the view from our room, and the proximity to stores and restaurants. The staff was always friendly and helpful ~ enjoyed the rocking chairs out front ~ morning coffee and free news paper. The room had a well stocked kitchen which made it convenient to have breakfast right there ~ and we enjoyed that on our balcony. We truly loved our stay and would highly recommend it ~ a terrific value for the money!
user_name:
Lynne G
East Rochester, New York

review_body: First impressions. We were greeted at the front desk by sunny smile of Ebony. Come to find out, Ebony's disposition was like the weather, sunny and pleasant. Ryan was the first bellhop encounter. Ryan is an authentic looking Hawaiian dude, with a wide grin and a very hospitable personality with very helpful advice. Gavin was the other bellhop,had quite disposition but with a warm smile. My favorite was the valet Abraham, he had a surfer dude air about him, but he had the uncanny ability to make you feel special. IF he did this for ordinary me I am sure this was just who he is. All the staff was personable, if you were on the elevator with the hotel staff you were greeted warmly. The facility amenities included beach chairs which beat renting any day, wish they had umbrellas too. The refreshing water in the lobby is something I looked forward to after my daily island explorations. The pool was a little small but the water was fabulous,they didn't overdue the chemicals. The grill is wonderful feature, however, there were lines to get to that bad boy, if you want to take advantage of this amenity start early. The room was nice overlooking the park. The weakest link would be house keeping, The tub wasn't clean daily and sometimes we received full compliment of towels and sometimes we didn't. But overall the experience was like the name Luana - enjoyable! Would I go back definitely!

i would recommend this hotel it was very clean the staff was very helpful the room was great ,location was great everything you would want is in walking distance and if you wanted to go sightseeing they have bicycles available to their guests at no charge they also provide beach toys at no charge i stayed 1 week and could not find any fault with this hotel i will stay there every time i travel there everything in the room was up to date,clean ,a/c worked great and staff was very helpful and knowledgeable when i asked a question it was answered promptly if you do not stay here you are missing out the only thing that could have made it better would be if they offered continental breakfast then i would have given them a 5 star plus rating

We stayed for 7 nights in an ocean-view one-bedroom suite and found the Luana to be a perfect choice for our family of four. The one-bedroom set-up was exactly what we needed with new-looking appliances including two TV's, a full refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and range. There were plenty of plates, silverware, glasses and such for our daily use. The king bed was very comfortable and while the sofabed probably wouldn't have worked for the adults, it was fine for a 12-year old.The hotel staff were very friendly and attentive. The housekeeping was wonderful and patient with all the sand we tracked into the room and tub!! The pool was small but very clean and beautiful...it was a good option when we didn't want to go to the nearby beach. The deck was attractive and they have BBQ grills available. The lobby and mezzanine are relaxing and nice. They even have bikes, beach chairs, and a fishbowl you can borrow! The place is family friendly and the staff were warm toward our kids.The location was great for us--fairly close to the beach through the beautiful park and close to convenience stores, shopping, the Waikiki Beach area, food, and the shuttle stop across the street. When it was hot, it was a bit of a drag to walk to the beach but we actually were quite happy not to have stayed in the busiest part of Waikiki. The views were beautiful from our room and the park is lovely to look at and stroll through. We could even see fireworks from our room two separate nights.The newly opened cafe (Protea Cafe) is small but the staff are welcoming and generous with the portions. They greeted us warmly every day and the food was tasty. They even made a custom grilled cheese for our preschooler. They could skimp on the food portions and make more money! We wish them success with the cafe.One down side is that the concierge service is out-sourced to Expedia and so we didn't find the same kind of attentiveness or care you can get with hotel concierges. Because they are there to sell timeshares, you wonder whether they really are trying to give you the best deal or the best travel advice. The staff here were nice but I'm not sure this is the best model for service.

Great hotel ... Close to everything ....shopping walking distance ... Beach 5mins away......restaurants so many to choose from....location was great....Our room was partial ocean view ....view was beautiful could see the fireworks from our balcony..... With 2 queen beds, the beds were very comfortable... The bathroom was a little small but modern The only thing need more space for toiletries they should put a shelf at the bottom of the sink areaWas surprise at the kitchen area ....since we didn't have full kitchen .... All plates and cutely we're provided.... Staff was great ..... Would come back in a heart beat.....

Stayed a week for our family's first trip to Hawaii. Staff friendly. Good location within minutes walk to the Waikiki beach and the main shopping strip. Quieter backing DeRussy park with an Ocean view. Kitchen well equipped with newer appliances. King bed was comfy. Pullout sofa was not. Bedroom A/C unit too close to bed. Bathroom was very basic and needs to be updated. Wished for more breakfast options closer. Concierge was exceptional and very helpful.

When we checked into the hotel we had an issue with the deadlock on our door and we were moved to a 2nd room which did not have a bath tub (something we wanted). We slept there for one night and in the morning we contacted the duty manager Ona, who bent over backwards to move us to another room, once it was vacated and cleaned. He made sure we were completely satisfied and we greatly appreciated his assistance. He also provided us with a late check out. We will definitely stay at the Luana the next time we are in Waikiki. Thank you once again Ona.
user_name:
Paru C
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for only one night, but it was a very warm welcome to Hawaii. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and welcomed us to their hotel. The check-in was was very quick. In a matter of minutes were at our room along with luggage. Our room over-looked DeRussy park and the ocean. The room was clean, comfortable and relaxing after flying. The location of the hotel was in the middle of Waikiki and we were able to walk to the beach, shops and the many restaurants in the area. I would return again.

Stayed here for business for a week. The hotel is in a great location, walkable to restaurants, shopping, and the heart of Waikiki. The valet and front desk staff were very friendly and courteous. The lobby was clean and inviting, with complimentary coffee in the mornings. The room however, not too clean. Though the kitchenette was very spacious with tons of storage (but no microwave?), the bathroom and shower space were very tight. There was still old food inside the small refrigerator.. ick. The beds were ok comfy though not the best thread count for sheets. There was no closet, but an old fashioned wardrobe that was 8" too short for the length of my maxi dresses (and I'm 5'3"). It was a little dusty on the inside so I minded my dresses dragging on the bottom. Additionally, there was only a dented mini ironing board to try to iron the wrinkles out. At the end of the week, my clothes smelled like the old wardrobe. There was a small table for dining, no desk/work area. Walls are thin so when there are kids running and screaming in the late night, you hear it. The bathroom has no ventilation and becomes easily heated with the door closed. The rooms need an update to match their lobby and pool area. The construction next door (drilling cement) wasn't the greatest to listen to at 10:00pm on a weekday. Went to the Protea cafe- we weren't greeted, the food was too salty, the service was awful. We had to get their attention first each time and then ask for everything- utensils, napkins, another cup of coffee, the check. Tried out the Cheeseburger in Paradise around the corner- this is the place to go for a great breakfast with great service at a great price! The Luana is a three star hotel, value was ok for being mid summer, parking though is outrageous at $35 day. I actually would stay here again if I was vacationing and did not have to worry about my appearance. It just didn't work for my business needs.

I stayed at Luana for almost 2 weeks on business and vacation. When I arrived, relaxing water music was on the radio. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was quite nice and very clean. Loved the location, it was just close enough to everything without being right in the middle of it. The concierge was extremely helpful both in booking excursions and in giving advice and directions. The bed was very comfortable and the mint and cucumber water in the lobby was very refreshing. The mini kitchen was great to have. I loved every minute of my stay.

Excellent location, reasonable price, nice staff but has no breakfast in the premises. Overall hotel needs a facelift. I recommend it for short stay (2 days in my case) unless you get some upgraded room.

We initially booked at aqua palms but we were transferred to this hotel because aqua palms was overbooked but we have no regrets. The hotel is in a nice area, about 8min walk to waikiki beach. The room is good enough size, the bed is comfy. They have a couch that turns into a bed which was nice. They have flat screen tv. The bathroom is on a smaller size. They provide organic shampoo/conditioner/lotion which is extra cool. They have a mini kitchen with mini ref and microwave and they provide utensils such as plates, glass, spoons etc. The unit we were in in the third floor was quite. Their lobby is nice to just hang out. Checking in and out was a breeze, great customer service. They don't charge for kids staying under 17 so that was very helpful. We were only there one day for a layover so we didn't get to used their amenities such as their swimming pool. We have a balcony facing the street and i could see the swimming pool from our pool, it looks like a good size pool. They do provide free wifi. There is an ABC store just across the street. I would stay here again when i go back to waikiki.

I loved the location. It's a little outskirt of the main road but it's quieter and at arm's length from the quiet beach and shopping places.The room I stayed was with kitchen and it was clearly very useful. Complimentary mint & cucumber water in the lobby is supplied until late afternoon, which refreshed me up!

me and my teenage daughter stayed here for 10 nights. we spent at least 1.5 hours a day lating by the pool, a great area! the staff were fabulous! hhe concierge gave us a ton of info and he helped us book many activities we were doing. the rooms were a little out dated but not bad for the price! LOCATION! OMG this place was perfect! not right in the noisy area along the road but a quiet area with a great stroll through the park to a quieter part of the beach. a plesant 5 min walk to the royal hawaiian center where we had dinner everynight (i reccomend the doroku japanese resteraunt) overall i wound definatly go this place instead of chucking the extra money away at some expensive hotel when everything you need is here and more! 10/5

Very clean with friendly staff in a great location. On-site car rental was very convenient and the kitchenette was great. Overall a great hotel, especially if you are traveling with children. If we go back to Oahu we will definitely stay here.

We enjoyed our stay at the Luana Waikiki immensely! We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed the free bicycles available to guests. We were able to rent a car directly from the Luana. The Concierge was very helpful in planning our activities and other staff were also always helpful. Our room was super clean with an incredible view of the park and ocean (partial ocean view). The price was great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Mahalo Luana!

My and my husband stay a month and it was walking distance from the beach and shops and food. And great people work there and they take care of you, and it also has this nice little restaurant for breakfast and lunch. We would stay another month.

I stayed here with two of my friends for four nights in June. We booked the hotel through hotwire and got a great deal (compared with other Waikiki hotels). From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed the service provided by all the hotel staff was exceptional. They accommodated our early arrival with a room ready, helped us book tours, stored our colossal amount of luggage prior to our evening departure and always greeted us with a friendly smile. Aside from the wonderful staff, the hotel was in the perfect location, right at the start of the main Waikiki shopping street, less than a ten minute walk to the beach and a fifteen minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable with a large washroom and outside mini-kitchen area. The pool area was small, however never crowded with several lounge chairs and shaded tables. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

My family and I stayed here and it was perfect! It's just a quick walk to the beach. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. We had a kitchen in our room and it was very nice. There were grills to cook on by the pool, which was fun. There was plenty of room in the laundry facilities. There were boogie boards and beach chairs to use. The kids even got to adopt two fish for a night. That was fun! Anything we needed, they were able to provide and find a solution for. Housekeeping went above what I would have expected. We left dirty dishes in the sink as we were in a hurry to leave. I thought I would clean them when we got back from our excursion, but the maid and cleaned them for me! I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed at this property the last two nights of our trip. (We stayed with family the first four nights). Nice hotel near beach and shops. Good city view from balcony. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. Large kitchenette with mini fridge silverware and plates, but no microwave. Not sure why there was knife set. Kids enjoyed pool area. Hotel staff very helpful and answered questions and requests promptly.

I am active duty military for 18 yrs. I was in HI in the late 90s and the Hale Koa took care of me then. Now, they don't deliver food to your room which sucks if you have a family (and a pregnant wife). Plus I booked the hotel early enough and when I got there I was placed on a room with a bad view. Now, the Luana Waikiki gave us a better room with a better view with a cheaper price. Their service is excellent. Thanks! The Torres Family!!!

We stayed here because it was close to the Hawai'i Convention Center where I went to a conference, as well as close to the bus lines and the beach for my vacationing companion. It's very new, very clean, and the staff is very friendly. Our room had a mini-fridge, a sink and some dining wear (plates, bowls, cups) but nothing to heat the food with. We called the front desk and they brought us a microwave, which came in really useful since we stayed for slightly more than a week. We barely used the pool and didn't use the fitness center so I can't comment on that. However, they do provide beach towels and chair which is super-helpful (I don't know if that's an industry practice in Hawai'i, but it's nice). They do have cars for rent onsite, but they are more expensive than renting at the airport (even including the $35/day parking charge), but less expensive than renting from the agencies in-town. We rented a car for a couple of days from the airport and paid for parking at the hotel. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would come back again.

Great Room - Friendly staff from Check-in to Check-out... This hotel is in a good location for me - close to everything - but far enough out away for all the other hotels right next to each other in Waikiki.Would stay there again....

This hotel is clean, affordable and in a good location. But, pool, service and restaurant choices are lacking. Several reservations for dinner and taxi's were messed up. No alcohol or food at the very small pool. One restauant semi attached open from 7-2pm only. Gym is acceptable and you can walk to the eggs n things for breakfast and Halekulani is not far away for food and night music

My wife (is Japanese and her patents) loved the place, not far from the beach, Waikiki, an ABC store across the street, room was clean, the staff was very helpful (in English and Japanese) and the concierge desk staff very helpful. (Thank you Matthew Frisbie & Tyler H. your are the best!) Matthew order my tickets to the Day tour of Pearl Harbor and Tyler order my Front row Center stage Ticket to Legends a tribute to the King of rock and row, Lady GaGA and Michael Jackson. The Person who played Elvse looked very much like the young Elvse and sang like him too. the person playing Lady Gaga put on a wonder show and I think the real Lady Gaga would enjoy the show. The person playing Michael Jackson not only look like, sound and moved like him too. for the money you will not be disappointed.the day trip to Pearl harbor was wonderful. The Tour guide was funny and knowledgeable of the area's we visited. the only problem was the Navy close the boat ride to the USS Arizona because of wind. (second time for me no Arizona) but can not control nature, smile your in paradise. when I saw Matthew that day and told him what happen he grabbed the phone and was going to call about a pass for me, very thoughtful but I did not have the time for it. Thanks again Matthew very nice. Well I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.See Matthew and Tyler they will help you enjoy paradise even more. Frank
user_name:
Frank B
Foothill Ranch, California, Usa

review_body: This hotel is right next to Fort Derussey Park, which is perfect, away from the craziness of the center of Waikiki. Walking distance or a short bus ride to everything. Would of rated a perfect 5 but had requested a room with two beds, a kitchenette and partial ocean view. When we arrived was told there was only one room with two beds and a kitchenette which was not available. The room they gave us had one bed and a sofa bed. Changed rooms to one with two beds but only had a fridge and microwave. They did give us $10 off per night. It did have a nice view of the ocean also. We made it work. House keeping did not sweep the floors very well and only change the beds every third day, but always left plenty of towels.The breakfast restaurant which was closed for renovations opened the last day we were there which is nice, but there is no room service at this hotel.Did use the Concierge service and Travis set us up with some great tours.Aside from the couple of things with the room, we had a wonderful time and would stay at this hotel again if going to Waikiki.

Stayed here for two nights. Room was updated and very comfortable. The kitchen style bench is perfect, complete with fridge,coffee maker and sink. Nice balcony overlooking park and very central location. Waikiki and Ala Moana mall just a few blocks away. ABC store across the street.

We stayed here for 9 nights on our Honeymoon coming over from the UK. The staff at the check in desk were very friendly and welcoming at check in and throughout the stay. We had an ocean view one bedroom suite and the view was stunning. The exquisite beach and sea during the day and then the vibrant Waikiki skyline at night.The room itself was large and equipped with a full kitchen which included everything you could want or need during your stay. It was cleaned daily and the standards were excellent throughout the hotel.One of the great benefits of the hotel is its location. It is 5 minutes walk to the back and to the main strip on Waikiki however it is far enough away from the shops and restaurants (which can be quite loud at night) to ensure that you get a peaceful stay and a quiet nights sleep.We were also really impressed with the valet service. While this was subject to a daily charge (the same as most hotels in this area), the valet staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout. Offering an efficient service as well as directions when needed.While the hotel isn't as modern as some you will find, it felt welcoming and homely and the furnishings and additional touches in the room made it feel very much Hawaiian.We would definitely look to stay here again if/when we come back and we would also recommend it to friends who were travelling to Waikiki.James

To me perfectly located. Staff At The reception was Nice and Ready To help you by needs. Room was well furnished. We loved The kitchen corner with all You may need. The pool is cute, unfortunately there is No control on People Who make noise, screaming or else if You simply want To relax by The pool. I wish i gave a 4 stars evaluation, because we enjoyed our stay At Luana Waikiki. Fitness room is ok, but machines are definitely old. Room: I was Just disappointed by The bathroom,too Small compared to the all Room surface. Shower too low if you're over 180 cm. But what's definitely important by An hotel of such category is The first impression by Room entrance. As You enter Any hotel of The world cleaningness should always come At first place. Because "that picture shot" will remain in your mind. As we entered we liked the room, The view, But kitchen Was unclean, ok I am on an island,a couple of insects walkin can appear brought by The Wind,sometimes. But a fridge with so much dirty and dust on The bottom and dust a bit everywhere ( Lamp table, kitchen surface,bed lamp tables,etc) is unadmissible. If this aspect was so much more cared and acccurate it'd be a very good hotel,after all.

After searching online for a large amount of time, came across Luana Waikiki (part of the Aqua chain of hotels). The rate was very good in comparison to other hotels I had looked at, the 10% discount was a clincher. Booking process was easy and the hotel staff were prompt in replying to my questions and arranging pre-payment of the account. Unfortunately my flight was cancelled and I did not arrive at the hotel until the following day (day after the expected check in), the receptionist was lovely and I was surprised to discover that the hotel gave me a refund for the night I did not use (due to the flight cancellation). This was most unexpected and certainly made my stay all the more enjoyable. The room was large with plenty of space for my friend and I spread ourselves out.The decor is older and outdated, but this does not detract as the size compensates for the lack of modern interior design. Didn't use the pool as the weather wasn't so great, but looked clean and inviting. There is a fitness centre onsite and the free tea, coffee, newspapers, crackers in the day and sweets in the evening are nice touches. All in all a good stay and would recommend to those who want a comfortable room at an affordable price. The hotel is walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shops and bars and has pickup points for tours and the trolley across the road.

Have stayed here twice and loved it. Staff are so friendly, and the location is brilliant. Rooms are large and immaculately clean. Nice little kitchenette and fridge means you don't have to eat out constantly. Very well appointed. Great to have a balcony. Gym is well equipped and right next to the pool so you can cool off after a workout. The spa is also lovely and the massages sublime. Great to be able to walk to Waikiki Beach in five minutes and the shopping strips are also close. On site valet parking available for your hire car - we hired a car across the road and so were able to really explore Oahu. Essential to get out of Waikiki and see more of this beautiful island. Excellent value for money.

We had a great room with queen sized bed, couch, table and chairs, not to mention a nice kitchen area. We also enjoyed a view of the Pacific, all for under $200/night. Every other hotel I checked with $300+ for anything similar. I was fearful of getting a less desirable room, but was pleasantly surprised by the luxury of our wonderful space. Everything was spotlessly clean.The staff was a big plus. Every single one of them must have been having a great day, because I saw nothing but smiles everywhere I turned.When I compare this to other, more expensive, properties, I'm impressed at every turn.

I have stayed at many hotels around the world, and I must stay no one can compare to Ebony!! She made our stay here extremely enjoyable! She got us 2 rooms next to each other for 9 nights on a moments notice. Her knowledge was incredible. We had what we thought were some major problems with our credit cards, and she just smiled as she always did when we saw her, and said no problem we can work with this. She was quick, and explained everything and we were never to think we were wasting her time. The valets were just as outstanding. Everyone were very personable and treated us like a customer should be treated. Great job to the HR staff for hiring these great people!!

On unexpected last minute round the world trip, I decided to stay at Luana based on previous reviews.Fact is that I have been most happy with my stay at this hotel.Very friendly staff, nice big room, really spotless, good complimentary wifi installation. Room rates were also attractive.The Hotel provide beach towel free of charge. Bikes can be also provided.Location is also convenient with all nearby shops and restaurants.Should I have another chance to be in Hawaii, I will definitely check Luana hotel first.

My mom and I stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 9 nights (June 17-25, checked out the 26th) because the Hale Koa was booked for the duration of our stay. We wanted something close to the Hale Koa so that we could eat at the restaurants and enjoy the grounds there, and the Luana is just a 5-minute walk through Fort DeRussy Park from the Hale Koa and beach. Our stay with the Luana was memorable and very good. The lobby is pleasant, with bits of Hawaiiana for décor. In the morning there is fresh complimentary coffee on a lobby sideboard, and in both the morning and afternoons there is fruited ice water in the same spot. At the reception desk you will at times find fresh organic fruit, and other times delicious frosted rice cookies, or sometimes small puzzles like Rubix cubes and other games.We were booked into a room on the first floor, which was a good room. There will be no views to speak of on the first floor, but please remember that every hotel has rooms that are not equal, and we had paid an economy price for our room. It had a very large lanai because it was on the first floor. The downside to this was that halfway through our stay, a guest above us had used our lanai to dump their cans, cigarette butts, etc. This is in NO way the fault of the hotel. Sunday morning I went downstairs and let the front desk know, and Saori was very eager to ensure we had a pleasant stay, so she offered us a free upgrade to the 12th floor, which _did_ have a remarkable view of Fort DeRussy and the ocean. Our room on the 12th floor was essentially the same room. The differences: A microwave, a different closet, and because it was higher up, the glass door let in more light. The beds in both rooms were perfectly comfortable.Housekeeping was reliable, good, daily, and when we did encounter our housekeeper, she had a smile ready for us. The staff in the lobby (Tyler was one, Matteo from valet was another) were always smiling and saying hello or good evening.Parking is $35 a night, which is comparable to other parking in Waikiki, but it does allow you in and out parking, and it is valet. Tip: If you are military or a dependent with military ID, the parking at the Hale Koa is a short walk away, and you can by a monthly pass for $100, which is the best deal in Waikiki. Be prepared to show your military ID at the Hale Koa parking garage office.The Luana's best secret? The pool. It is on the first floor and is a little slice of heaven. There are a few cabanas that are free (be prepared to rent cabanas at other hotels). The pool, though small, is beautiful and immaculate, and there is a lush little garden lining the pool and cabana area to give a feeling of seclusion. There are also grills around the corner, if you're interested in barbecuing. Also available are free yoga classes in Wednesday and Sunday morning.We had a lovely time at the Luana, enjoyed the fact that it is a boutique hotel, and would heartily recommend it to anyone. We wish we could go back soon!!!!

The Luana Waikiki is the place to be in Honolulu! The room was immaculately clean, the ocean view is spectacular and the staff is impeccable! Over the years it's been a pleasure to see how the management and staff continues to impress hotel guests with new and innovative amenities that could only be expected at high end properties at a fraction of the cost! The one bedroom upper floor rooms are fantastic and the prices are more than reasonable! Next trip to Honolulu, the Luana Waikiki will be my first choice!

Stayed at Luana Waikiki five days.The staff was exceptional.Was able to check in early after a long fifteen hour flight.The room was spacious and nice view.stayed on the fifth floor,corner one bedroom.The beds were super comfy.Having stayed at several five star properties right on the beachfront in waikiki,this hotel comes very close in comparison due to the exceptional staff and overall hotel experience . If you want value for money than this is the best place to stay in waikiki.

Tyler our concierge was wonderful:) We went on three excursions with his help. Jackie at the front desk was very helpful.Adam Abraham, Markiel, and Mateo were very helpful for shuttles and our very heavy luggage. The rooms were clean and comfortable beds!!! The view from the eleventh floor was pretty good. It overlooked the park and we had a partial ocean view. This was a great experience at the Luana. Thank you, Teri and Audria

We stayed at the Luana Hotel for a few days while our son graduated, combining an event to celebrate as well as have a much needed delayed vacation! The accommodations are excellent, close to everything and still a quiet retreat. Our room was spacious and had everything we needed and more! The service was friendly and gracious, and the pool area, my fav spot, was not crowded at al and was very clean. We were granted an extension on our last day to be able to hit the beach one last time and come back for a shower afterward as our flight did not leave until evening. We really enjoyed our time there and if we ever get to come back, would not hesitate to stay again!

My family had just come off a 12hr flight and arrived early in the morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made a room up for us and let us check-in a bit early which was really nice. The bell-captain looked after our luggage and gave us a little tour of the hotel which was really nice. You can tell that the management look after their staff because their staff look after their guests. I will definitely be staying hear again.

What a gem of a hotel! As a travel agent, I totally recommend this hotel. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Quiet location, walking distance to all happening locations; beach, shopping, restaurants etc. Very clean and comfortable rooms. This hotel offers complimentary bikes, beach chairs, towels and only rents Volvo vehicles!!! What a special treat! We will definitely stay here on our next visit. Kudos to the wonderful staff, especially.......Kazuko, Ebony & Sori!!! Mahalo!

I am a local resident of Hawaii, and I stay at hotels in Waikiki pretty often for various reasons. I can’t tell you how important it is to find a hotel that I could call my home away from home. I was recommended this hotel by a friend and it was a great recommendation. It all starts from the front desk. The customer service was excellent. Ebony and Sunny (I believe he was the Front Office Manager) was so helpful during my stay. The room was amazing for the price you are paying for in my opinion. The rooms were pretty modern and very clean… and for a partial ocean view, you get a pretty big view of the ocean. I can safely say that I have found my home away from home!

Thanks for your attention .This hotel can offer you the best hotel experience in Waikiki ....serioslyThe whole package is awesome, affordability , facilities ,location and friendly customer focused staff, the gen manager even self publishes a flyer with tips for guests on "what's on....".thats cool and so Hawaiian.I've been travelling to oahu since I was 19 , few years later I worked for an airline , by virtue of that was staying in Waikiki ,...Alot ,Now even since leaving the airline I return annually . I'am 50 this year ,and wanted to spend it on oahu , the hotel experience the Luana extended made it the most enjoyable of all those years .So , Mahalo to The Luana and staff.

We have stayed at the Luana around 7 times, visiting about once a year. It was the Outrigger Luana before, and is now owned by Aqua. We choose to stay here due to the location, the quality/value of the rooms, and the staff. This time we sprung for an ocean view 1 bedroom suite. We were put into the top floor, room 1607. We previously had been on floor 6, floor 3, floor 7, floor 2, & other floors, but not a suite room or the top floor. It had a full kitchen, a separate living room and bedroom. The king size bed in this room was very comfortable. My husband & I slept well very night. Everything was great! We felt especially pampered this trip! The room was spectacular. It was well maintained, spacious had a flat panel tv in living room and the bedroom, and had the best view of the ocean with 2 outside patio doors. The hotel is close to the ocean, but not with ocean front hotel room prices. Like the fact you are looking over Ft. DeRussy Park for views to the ocean; it was very scenic. Housekeeping did a good job cleaning the room. We did not experience any sand or dirty floors as mentioned by other reviewers. One of the best things we like about the Luana is the location. On the edge of Waikiki, it is fast way to get in and out of town, with minimal traffic. The wifi my husband said only connected thru room 1609, which made it a little weaker. Love the water & coffee in the lobby. One con is the valet price: $35/day seems a little high when I compared it to the other hotels in the Waikiki area. A big, big shout out to our favorite valet, Abe! Thanks for all the great service through the last few years! Good to see a staff member from the Outrigger days!! Thanks to the Aqua staff for giving us a fantastic anniversary trip and the great room! Love the dining & shopping within walking distance. The trip of a lifetime, and one we won't forget!! We will be back! See you next year, Abe & the Luana Hotel.

Luana Waikiki was the best location for our trip. Very accessible & relaxing. Very clean. We're definitely coming back soon and will recommend to our friends. The staff were very nice and the valets are courteous & helpful especially Kevin. We feel safe at all times and love the short walk to the shops and the beach. Just love it.

Excellent Hotel and in great location, close to the town and the beach. Staff are really nice and even upgraded us as we were on our honeymoon!! Good gym and also wifi in every area of the hotel. The pool was nice and warm as well.

Pros:- great WiFi signal in the room (each room has its own SSID by room number)- free water/coffee/tea in the lobby at morning time- nice gymCons:- the pools is only suitable for dipping, not for real swimming (too small)- it would have been nice if the free water/coffee/tea in the lobby were offered 24 hours- a bit of walking to the nearest supermarket (15 min), but there's a convenient store downstairs

I have extended stays every year at the luana. Usually for a month or two. I stay on the first floor kalakaua street side. With the fan or air conditioning on at night I have always had a great sleep. This is a golden find. The park is right out the door and fantastic kalakaua luxury row shopping just a few minutes walk. The beach at Fort derussey is the best swimming and recreation beach around, as the reef protects the lagoon from the surf. The staff is always friendly and ready to help. I see many repeat customers that give the luana a family feel.

I have worked for an international airlines for over twenty years and have traveled literally around the world. I have visited Oahu sixteen times. Because I have been in the industry I am able to get hotels at special rates, which have included five star properties.In the past I stayed with a different hotel chain. The only reason I stayed at the Luana Waikiki, was because they have rooms offering ocean views which are considerably lower than some of the other hotels. I wanted the ocean view for this visit because I was travelling with a relative.It is my opinion that you don't necessarily need an ocean view, because most of your time is spent outside, and at the beach.I simply loved this hotel. I have an eye for details and must stay at a property which is sparkling clean. The ambiance is superb and the staff are awesome.I can't say enough about this hotel, and have decided to make it my hotel while staying in Oahu.They list themselves as a three star property, but I rate it more like a four star. I
user_name:
travel2542678
New York City, New York

review_body: We were placed on the 4th floor in a city view room, one of the dirtiest rooms I have ever stayed in, Do they not know what a mop is? Within 5 minutes the bottoms of our feet were completely black, the walls near the floors were dirty, the bathroom had hair on the walls that wasn't ours. We stayed one night before flying back to the mainland so I didn't bother complaining or trying to switch rooms. When we checked out we didn't even get asked how our stay was, nothing other than here's your receipt, not even a Mahalo? The door to our balcony was just a standard door with a pop button lock, no way to secure it from young children, and it had visible gaps which let light and sound in throughout the night. And the traffic, oh the traffic. This is located on a busy street, the combination of the street, door and poor window quality made for a sleepless night. Room design, there is a nice granite countertop and sink, it is the only thing in this building that isn't from the previous century. And what is the point of eating up the majority of the room with this if there isn't a microwave or toaster oven? The bathroom is tiny and cramped, you have to open the door and go in the bathroom, then close the door to get into the bathtub/shower.It does have stores and restaurants within walking distance, but because of the condition of the hotel and cleanliness I would recommend you run away from this place and book somewhere else.

Location of hotel was perfect for us. We could easily get everywhere we needed to go as we relied on buses and walking to get around. Staff at hotel were friendly and helpful. The cooking facilities were great. Would have liked more lighting in main area especially when eating dinner. Had fabulous views of the Fort de Russy park and could see the ocean from our room. Pool was excellent especially for kids. Good value for money.

We recently stayed a week. This hotel is very clean and the staff is extremely courteous and helpful - especially Rudy. We liked the close proximity to everything. The beach is a short 5 minute walk through the park. Our only complaint was the air conditioner was a little noisy.

Great hotel to stay in - comfy bed, clean room. The price was good for the room we got It was convenient place to walk to the beach, abc stores and the bus stops. The ala moana shopping mall is around 15 -20 mins from the hotel if you took a stroll - it is actually quite a nice, straight forward walk! Also able to borrow beach towels, and bikes for free!

The manager sonny was great! He was very helpful, always treated us like royalty. My brother, sister and I stayed in the suite with a beautiful well equipped kitchen. We asked for 3 beds, but got 2 beds and 1 sofa bed, but it was comfortable. Cleaning staff did a great job - always kept the floors, kitchen, and bathroom shiny, our bed linens were changed daily, beds were always neatly made. Vallet parking attendants were quick to bring our car, never hesitated to carry things for us. We stayed for over a week this past March. Everything was going great until our last night there. My brother and I decided to sit in the lounge area in the evening with other guests when the security guard came over and asked if we were staying there. I said yes, we've been staying here for over a week now, then to my surprise, she said out loud "Let me see your room card" I never felt so belittled. We could have chosen any other hotel, but we wanted to give them our business. Damo family

Clean and comfortable. Hotel is located where everything is in walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our particular room was nice and well maintained daily. The only complaint is the amount of pay for parking (35.00 per night). Parking fee in my opinion is outrageous.

The Luana exceeded all my expectations for the price I paid. The lobby and bar areas are absolutely lovely, the receptionists are sweet and they have two little fish in a bowl you can "adopt for the day"!They automatically upgraded my room to a partial view, when I'd just booked "city-view" for a one-night stay during a business trip. I could see the ocean from my lanai which overlooked Fort Derussy park. The room had a full counter-top with sink, plates, fridge (basically a half-kitchen), and a couch and breakfast table area and lanai. Almost a suite! Just lovely.Everyone at the hotel was super-friendly and relaxed. No crowds. It's a smaller hotel so you don't feel swamped by tourists like at the Sheraton or Hilton. They have what looked like a really nice spa with a bit pricey but tempting spa packages.The bed was super-comfortable. I slept so well. The only downside was that the bottom sheet was too small for the mattress and was loose on top of the bed, instead of being tucked under, which is really annoying but the only thing that wasn't perfect about my stay.The gym and swimming pool are on one cheerful deck with a nice view of park trees, etc. The nice thing is that the hotel is not up against any other hotels but has space around it and parks on either side. The swimming pool is small, but who is using a pool when you have the glorious Pacific one block away? The hotel is close to all shopping and beaches.One really neat thing--they have a limited number of free bicycles you can take out (based on availability)! I loved riding around town on a bright orange town bike, replete with helmut and a Kryptonite lock in case i could stop for a swim or do some shopping.Good vibes all around!!

Large comfy double beds. We had a studio room so no kitchenette but it had a coffee percolator, fridge, crockery and cutlery. Partial sea views were still lovely. Proper fun and swimming pool well worth checking out. You can see the weekly Friday Hilton fireworks from pool area. Good location although a bit further out than many other hotels - a bit beyond Hard Rock Cafe. Friendly staff and a very pleasant stay.

We stayed here because we wanted something that wouldnt break the bank but was close enough to the beach & im glad thats exactly what we got. The hotel was a nice price and walking distance to the Waikiki beach. The hotel room was a kitchenette so it was big. The rooms were clean. We purchased the city view & having a balcony to look-out from every morning & night was a big plus. The customer service was great especially an employee named ALLI. She was really nice, helpful, approachable and fun to talk to. I see a promotion coming her way. This hotel & staff was a great plus to our hawaii trip.

Obviously this isn't the Hilton, but it's good for what it is. The staff are really great. People are right about room cleanliness though, and they don't change your sheets while you're there, which is strange given the amount of sand that gets tracked in. The bottoms of your feet will blacken, so bring some baby wipes to clean of with before getting in bed.

The Luana is a hidden jewel - best kept secret on Waikiki! I have stayed in four stars throughout the world and this was one of my best hotel experiences! It sits between two parks and is conveniently located to public transportation and a 5 minute walk to the beach. I rode the complimentary bike to the beach almost every day (cruising through the parks half the time! It was beautiful.) Staff is very friendly and attentive - very accommodating. This boutique hotel went above and beyond with free yoga classes in the adjacent park (excellent instructor from Core Power Yoga), complimentary apples, water w/ citrus and mint, candy, bikes, and more. I have already sold this hotel to other family members who plan to visit HI soon - I raved about a wonderful 11 days here. Thank you Luana staff and management. I'll be back. BTW, the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in at a hotel. Room was very clean and daily maid service kept it that way. (Maid service doesn't wash dishes - that's fine with me.) Very well equipped kitchen. I bought from Farmer's market and the Prep Kitchen for groceries - great having the two burner kitchen setup. Back in San Diego - relaxed and refreshed.

A very positive experience from the time we arrived, during our short stay, and then upon departure. The guys out front were most helpful in helping us empty the car and delivering our bags to the appropriate rooms and they took care of our valet needs in a most professional manner. The front desk was very courteous and again, helpful, in all matters of checking us in and ensuring we even took advantage of a discounted valet charge. Check-out went smooth and, again, the guys out front took care of us and our bags upon departure much like they handled upon arrival. We very much appreciated the hotel staff from start to finish. And the hotel....would not hesitate to stay here on our next trip and maybe for the whole trip, not just a stop over. Centrally located, backed up against a well-manicured park, and easy access and short walk to the beach...you literally walk through the park straight to the beach, no busy streets to cross and no busy city sidewalks to access the beach from the Luana Waikiki. A hidden gem among the many non-beach front choices you have in Waikiki. I would definitely stay here again and I would highly recommend others to stay here as well...as I already have...and they did...and they loved the hotel and location!! Thanks for a great stay!

This place is amazing.. A perfect place to stay if ur staying in Hawaii for as long as u want.. The kitchen feature in the room is a very nice idea.. It helps u save money if u don't want to eat out. U can just cook in ur own hotel room.. Amazing place it's located at the heart of Waikiki strip.. Walking distance to the beach too...

The staff was very accommodating. They were nice and professional. The rooms were great. Excellent value for money. Good location, close to everything. Public transportation is close by and the only reasonable way to travel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Thank you Rudy (general manager). You're doing an excellent job.

This was a moderately priced property, as it was not right on the beach. One of the main reasons we chose it was because it was on the western end of Waikiki - thus easier to get back out to H1. We also thought it would be quieter. Our room was on the street side, and only on the 5th floor, so it was very noisy with street noise. The built in window units in the room are terribly loud. But the room was nice, the hotel staff was nice, however housekeeping fell short. For two days they failed to sweep the room well enough and missed a large pile of sand. On another day, they failed to clean the room all together. We received an apology when I brought the lack of sweeping to their attention, but they were not phased by the fact they missed cleaning the room all together. Their is a small cafe on premises, but it was closed while we were there. So overall - it was so-so - not great, but you don't pay a great price.

The locale of the Luana Waikiki is great for those people who want to be near the hustle and bustle of luxury row, without all the inconvenience of the additional foot traffic. Great restaurants and shops are only a few minutes away and I found the Luana Waikiki to fit my desire to be near things but outside the overall fray. The room was quiet (which I found amazing, especially given that it was Memorial Day) and clean. The staff was incredibly respectful and very accomodating. I plan to return to the Luana Waikiki the next I am in Honolulu!

My wife and I stayed at the Luana for the second time, over a three week period in May. The Hotel is in a prime location for Waikiki, close to the main shopping area, just a short walk to Ala Moana Shopping centre, the beach and restaurants. The staff are very friendly and willing to help with any problems tourists normally have staying away from home base. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and the house keeping staff who greet you with a friendly smile and Aloha every morning (thank you Elsie) makes it even better. It was a pleasure returning every day to a clean room, and the Air con on. The fruit flavoured water in the lobby is a beauty after a long day of activities.The pool is just the right size to cool down after a frenzied shopping spree, with the wife, and the gym big enough to do a work out to ready your self for another frenzied shopping spree the following day (with the wife).

We only stayed at Luana for 3 nights. I would've liked to stay longer!!I really liked the location, just a few minutes walk to shops and restaurants, 5 minutes walk through the park to the beach.I stayed at the Luana with my 2 daughters (20 and 21) in a 1 bedroom partial ocean view. It really was a lovely view!! It was nice overlooking the park, with the ocean in the distance.I loved the pool area, great place to relax and read my book, and have a swim, great way to start or end the day.Friendly staff, great amenities, great hotel. Would definitely recommend!Absolutely want to go back and stay longer next time.

My friend and I stayed at the Launa Waikiki in May 2014. The hotel is in a great location, just a short walk to Waikiki Beach and all of the surrounding shops and restaurants. There were a few bus stops just outside the hotel which allowed us to travel around the southern part of the island quite easily ($2.50 bus fare). The front desk staff were friendly and the concierge was very helpful. The rooms were a little dated and tired, but were clean and had good wifi and air conditioning. We enjoyed the pool area, as well as all of the amenities offered by the hotel such as the free beach towels, beach chairs, and bicycles. Overall, it was a nice hotel in a great location at a good price point.

I stayed at the Luana in May 2014 after my parents recommended it to me. I will definitely stay again! The staff were so friendly and helpful, amenities and facilities were great, beautiful room and an amazing view (partial ocean view room). We go to Hawaii often and will be staying at Luana from now on. Pool was my favourite part!

This property really met our needs for 3 adults. We had a one bedroom unit with sleeper sofa in the living room. The kitchen & bathroom were upgraded. We could have cooked full meals if we wanted to, but just used the kitchen for breakfast and leftovers, etc. The small restaurant on the first floor works great for a quick small meal. Our view was of Fort De Russy, very peaceful and beautiful with the blue Pacific on the horizon. Many restaurants and shops were a quick walk away. The beach was also near. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful with any questions or requests. We chose this property mainly for the price of a one bedroom unit and found that we have made a good choice. Perfection would have been right on the beach but I would return here. One minor issue - we had some elevator noise in the bedroom but it didn't bother our sleep.

Great Hawaiian feel. Kitchenettes available to ward off restaurant price shock. Easy walking to all the important places. Short walk to beach. Great activity center to tell you what to see and do. Had AC problem at 11:00PM. Fixed in minutes with cool night instead of waiting til tomorrow for technician. All personnel acted quickly and efficiently to any request. Maids responsive to requests for extra, towels, soap, etc. Surrounded by parks and plaza. Close to "Luxury Row" for shopping. Provided upper class accommodations at middle class prices.

You cannot beat the location of this hotel. It is clean, and the staff is WAY, WAY ABOVE average for staff at a busy resort city. You sure can find a much more fancy hotel, and one with a fancy restaurant, but you will NEVER find a more conviently located hotel that is this nice for the price. Views from the rooms are magnificent, and the street noise is not any worse than from any other big hotel in Waikiki. The staff goes out of it's way to be nice, helpful, and accomodating. We would gladly stay at this hotel again. Hope to return soon.

Although initially disappointed with what seemed a slightly remote location our thoughts were quickly reappraised once we had walked the five minutes down the road to the very busy heart of Waikiki.The hotel sits next to Fort Derussy Park and although feeling a bit dated in parts we enjoyed the hotel and it's facilities. We also enjoyed our partial ocean view room with balcony. The cleaning of our room was a bit hit and miss (bins not emptied) but all in all not a bad place to stay.

This hotel only had valet parking available at $35/night. WHAT?!!! That is crazy.Room- decent but nothing special (partial ocean view 2 nights)Bathroom- okBalcony view- niceFront desk customer service- I guess ok but she was NOT helpful when I questioned the required valet parking.I have never heard of a hotel making valet a mandatory charge?! That being said, I did use hotwire to book this on a whim. Hotwire DOES state that hotels may have resort and parking fees above and beyond the cost of the room but I've never experienced this before. You'd think if they were going to make valet parking the only option then they'd at least make it realistically priced.

For those who measure quality with good service, cleanliness, good pricing, and quaintness, the Luana Waikiki is the place. Loved the location by Fort DeRussey Park and in walking distance to the bus line, beach, park, and other sights of interest. Great room with a kitchenette and comfy bed after a long long day (or nite) of fun. Oh yeah free bikes, chairs and blog is board's. YAY!

Recently stayed with partial ocean view. Room was quite large, clean and view was as described.Friendly helpful staff in a hotel that has all that you need. It's a short walk to beach (about 5 minutes) as well as Waikiki shops. Easy access to public transport for going further afield. Excellent value and no complaints.

Not right in the heart of Waikiki Beach but close enough to easily walk there, Luana Waikiki (Aqua) is a great spot for a relaxing holiday break. With terrific and welcoming staff, a short walk to a not so crowded beach area, fantastic gym and pool area, clean, comfortable and practical apartments it was the right combination for us as a couple. The ocean side apartments gave a great view and cooling breeze. Would highly recommend for those who do not want to stay in the heart of Waikiki and not pay that price either. Keep up the great work - we will be back!

13 APRIL 2014, 11:07 AMWe stayed in room 1407. It was a one bedroom ocean view kitchenette . We enjoyed this stay.The bedroom was huge with a king bed, two large bedside tables, a chair, a desk and a television unit . The only issue was the air conditioner blows on one of the sides of the bed . Th louvers on the unit can be adjusted so that this is minimized but it still was a small issue. The bathroom was small but adequate . The only issue with the bathroom is that there was no anti-slip mat on either the marble floor or in the bathtub which resulted in some scary moments . In the master bedroom there is a very large utility closet which could store several months of food and a decent size walk-in closet with about 10 hangers ( there should be more ) and a very useful safe. One small touch that was appreciated was that there were two suitcase stands of the more typical one. This proves very helpful in living out of a suitcase. The bedroom has wall-to-wall carpeting which is old and tired and in need of a good deep cleaning with many stains .The living room had a relatively comfortable couch and a sitting chair as well as two lamps on two side tables. It also had some nice chairs for the kitchen bar . We spent a lot of time staring out of the huge picture window which gave us a beautiful view onto the park and to the ocean beyond. The room was relatively quiet with the exception of the traffic noise around Kalakala and sirens occasionally. This wasn't an issue with the air conditioner running, but I can imagine if one wanted to leave the windows open and not run the air conditioner that this would be an issue even on the 14th floor . The kitchen was more than adequate with a nice flat glass range, a very nice high end dishwashing machine, a very large refrigerator complete with ice maker , a toaster, a full set of knives, a coffee maker and even an Aroma rice maker . We primarily cooked breakfast although one could certainly cook almost any meal here. Dual chrome sinks were also a nice touch. The kitchen could do with a few more mugs for coffee and a few more glasses as well . A larger family might have issues with the number of items . The floors in the bathroom and living room are marble so be careful with wet feet as it's very easy to slip . Another thing that would've been nice is a real bathmat in the bathroom to prevent slippage something with the rubber bottom . A nice touch was in the lobby there were two large water dispensers with fruit-infused water. We loved drinking it every time we passed through the lobby. Lest I sound too picky overall we thought this was an excellent value and we enjoyed staying here . There are lots of electrical outlets which makes using electronic devices using easy . The location down at this end of Kalakua was excellent . It's a little bit less frenetic down here and yet it was only a couple blocks to many good restaurants . In fact , we found that if we went several blocks down to Beachwalk and turned right there were numerous terrific restaurants on that street alone. We enjoyed Bills of Sidney for breakfast and dinner, as well as the Hawaiiana for sushi which is funky but fun. Overall this is an excellent hotel and the staff was very nice. Ebony was particularly helpful. We did find the bed to be too hard but many people would like it just fine. It is definitely on the firm side . We ended up requesting an extra comforter and taking our comforter and the extra comforter and laying it below the top sheet to soften up the bed with a homemade topper. This helped a lot .Would we stay here again? Yes , in a heartbeat. The value is clearly excellent. We paid about $204 per night plus tax plus $35 in and out parking fee . In another hotel we would've had only the one bedroom and no living room and certainly no kitchen. The trade-off is really that there is a little bit of tiredness about this hotel , but I'd rather have a slightly tired decor and a few spots on the rug but have all the extra space and the kitchen and the refrigerator and the excellent location, and nice people in the hotel .

My stay here with my friend was fabulous. The staff always greeted you with a smile and an aloha. I thought the room was fairly big and very clean. It did get a little noisy facing the street early morning but nothing we weren't expecting or couldn't live with. It was in a great location as far as the beach an plenty of shopping. I love my stay there and would recommend it and would definitely go back.

We booked Outrigger Luana Waikiki through Donna Bender of MauiCalls who is an Outrigger Specialist. Although not on the beach, the hotel was centrally located and we could walk everywhere in Waikiki. The room was big and very clean. It was a little bit noisy, but Waikiki is a big city and we expected this. We would stay here again.
user_name:
Heidi W
Inver Grove Heights, Minnesota

review_body: We thought we got a decent deal on Hotwire as it was advertised as a 3 1/2 star hotel in Waikiki. However, I would not stay at this hotel ever again if it was free. We stayed one night in room 803 and it was the worst sleep we ever got and it should have a rating of 2 star at best. Cons:- the room were in need of updating - 70's decoration; the bath tub was nasty. the view out of our window was the top of another building. - air conditioning fan was very loud and there was no setting that was quiet unless it was completely shut off.- worst thing was the bed needed to be replaced- it is one of those bed that slope in when you sit/sleep on it. it was the worst hotel mattress I have ever slept on. Pro:- staff was friendly.

All the staff at this hotel are friendly. The hotel was very clean and in a great location to Waikiki and the beach's. Rooms were clean and friendly maid service. A big thank you to everyone at the hotel

Alli, Abraham and Nora were such a pleasure to meet and made our hotel and hawaiian experience wonderful. The consistency of going above and beyond was very much appreciated; allowing my month of residing there really enjoyable.

I found out "Luana" means rest & relaxation, and that's exactly what we got at the Luana Waikiki. From the moment we were greeted at the door, the staff was super friendly and helpful. Lovely walk across the park to the beach. My only wish would be to have a microwave or at least an electric kettle in the room, but we could get hot water in the lobby. It will be nice when the new restaurant is open in the hotel, but we found other places nearby. Thanks for making the last days of our wonderful Hawaiian vacation so pleasant. MAHALO!!

Love this hotel. We booked rooms for 17 people and the service was just great. The rooms are clean, quite, and very, very nice. It's a quite boutique hotel and the rooms are like living at home but with service. I especially appreciated the new service under Aqua. Mark and Sonny were fabulous. Thanks for the wonderful trip!

Everyone who works at Luana Waikiki is all smiles and very friendly. Matteo was particularly helpful in directing us to some great restaurants. The Italian restaurant (Bernini) he told us about had the best pizza my other half said he has every had -- and pizza is his favorite food, so he eats it often.

We stayed at the hotel for two weeks , the location in relation to the beach was great ! Having the park adjacent to the property is a definite plus , close to all amenities .  We found the staff satisfactory for the most part , however a Bellman , Ryan , was particularly helpful , cordial and accommodating . This kind of service is rare , we found ourselves only approaching him with any questions or concerns . Always a pleasure to deal with . I gave the service rating below a rating of " excellent " because of Ryan .

Mark and Ebony where great upon our check in. Very informative. Hotel is very clean, about 10 mint walk to Waikiki, but the walk is filled with a lot of shopping! If you need shuttle to airport call upon MAHALO ADVENTURE TOURS only $ 10!

I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights in early April. We had a wonderful view of the park below and also the ocean in a distance. It was an easy walk to the beach. The pool was very clean and warm! The room was perhaps a little dated but still ok and clean. The bed was very nice and comfy. We stayed on the 14th floor, and we do recommend that you try to get a room on the higher levels. It was also easy walking to all shops and restaurants. We will definitely stay here again next time in Honolulu.

I stayed 4 nights at the Luana Waikiki. I was traveling alone and I felt completely safe here. The rooms are nice, the personel very helpful. The hotel is perfectly located, no more then 10 minutes walk to Waikiki Beach and much quieter than the beach walk. The prices are correct, it's the perfect alternative to the expensive palaces. I would defnitely come back to this hotel if I ever come back.

We had two recent stays at the Aqua Launa Waikiki in March 2014 and enjoyed our stay both times. The staff is very friendly and made the check in and check out process very smooth. It was great that all the exercise equipment in the Fitness Room worked, as I’ve stayed in some hotels were that isn’t the case. The pool was well maintained and is a relaxing place to catch a few rays and swim some laps. Although I have stayed at the hotel 3 or 4 times total, I was pleasantly surprised to stop at the Mezzanine floor, which had some very comfortable chairs and tables to do some reading and relaxing when I know I needed to get out of the sun. The room itself was a studio kitchenette. It was clean and well maintained. For those needing more room, I’ve stayed in the one bedroom suite a few years ago with the ocean view and those provided a lot more room than the studio this time around.
