From the one bedroom suite, I could see the ocean and watch the people practicing Tai Chi in the park in the early morning below the room. Very pleasant view with the morning coffee. Finally, the guys running the valet parking are great.

Recent stay of one week in March 2014 in a one bedroom suite was very nice. Comfy chic upscale hotel. Staff was exceptionally polite and friendly. Comfortable bed and pillows. The Expedia rep at the front desk was helpful. Met the mgr in the lobby - really nice. This is a great value hotel - close enough to the beach and close to the nice shops and restaurants on Kalakaua.

Recently spent two weeks at the Luana late March /early April (travelled with my cousin). This was my fouth stay at the Luana and it never disappoints I was worried the new ownership may affect my stay but I need not have worried because we were well looked after, the rooms clean, staff helpful and I think it is one of the best locations in Waikiki( I have stayed in many different hotels in Waikiki over last 30 years) I love the ocean and park view.Well done and thankyou to all the staff for making this a great vacation.I will returnLynda Shivas

This was my first stay at the Luana and it far exceeded my expectations. Abe, the valet, was very friendly and provided great service. At the front desk was Jackie who is the best ever. She helped upgrade our room to an ocean view suite. The full kitchen was amazing to have. I loved the space and having two patios. The location is also wonderful because it's in Waikiki and only 10-15 minute walk to Ala Moana. In the mornings there is coffee and a great selection of tea. There is fruit at the front desk in the morning followed by crackers in the afternoon. There is BBQ space and a small pool area. Definitely recommend this hotel.

The staff were friendly and helpful, I went with a group of friends and we had two rooms. They had placed us on the same floor close to one another, but some one had moved one of our rooms before we checked in. The staff were able to move our rooms so that we were on the same floor, down the same hall, and about 5 rooms away from one another. The doormen were very polite and helpful and gave input on some places to go and eat, and bars to nearby. The location was great. The room was smaller than I thought it would be, and there was a kitchenette but no real way to warm-up food. The parking was a dud though because they only had valet for $35/day, or you could fight for street parking. I think the Aqua hotel chain is great, but this location is good only if you're staying for a short amount of time.

Enjoyed the hotel for a 3 night stay with a group of solo travellers. The service from all the staff , the large rooms and the perfect location are all perfect. Free bikes , beach chairs, yoga were very appreciated inclusions. Protea the small charming bistro for breakfast was delicious. There are so many thoughtful touches it makes it a hotel you will always want to return to.

Nice to not be on the strip of Waikiki amongst the crowd. Just a few blocks down and deliteful. Felt like a family run hotel instead of the behemouths like the Hilton. Used the hotel bikes that the bellman got for us-- great. Did the free yoga class that the hotel sponsors on the lawn in the park. The yoga instructor is truly an excellent one!!! Under a big tree the one hour class was a super treat. --- The staff were all super friendly and the vibe was nice. The staff all dressed somewhat casual- uncorporate--- I liked that. Was told the cute café in the front is closing--- bummer--- I thought it was excellent and the crew in there was really passionate about the food and quality. Went to the café twice and all 5 people working were interacting with all the guests and again ---- the vibe was great. Look forward to returning to this place.Cheers

This was my second stay at Luana, and it was even better than the first. The service all around is excellent (the bellmen in particular went out of their way), the room large, clean and comfortable, and we love the location on Fort Derussy Park, just at the edge of the Waikiki strip. The free bike, snorkling and beach chair rentals are a very nice added touch, as is the coffee bar in the lobby each morning. My mother and sister were in town at the same time and stayed at a nearby, well known and pricier hotel, and they regretted not staying at Luana, our accommodation was so much better! It is worth upgrading to a partial ocean view studio, so you can have coffee on the lanai in the morning and look out, over the park to the water and Diamond Head. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay, we have no complaints, and are already planning a return trip in November. Angel D.

I stayed at the Luana for about a week and it felt like home away from home. My room was basically a condo-style studio, equipped with a full sized kitchen (minus the dishwasher), average bathroom and balcony overlooking the Ala Wai Canal. It was nice to be in Waikiki without being IN Waikiki. Everything was so close, yet I didn't have to go far with the delicious Protea Cafe (try their acai bowls) and 'hardly-crowded' swimming pool on location. The valet attendants were great and always smiling, and their price for valet service was very reasonable compared to other hotel valets nearby. It was a very relaxing week and I look forward to many more stays here.

I made a last minute business trip and found this place on line. Drove by before I booked. Fabulous, Cannot say enough good. If you do not need to be "right on the beach" ( its two blocks thru a park), this is the place. Convenient to restaurants, hi end shopping. Easy in and out valet. Squeaky clean rooms, great people at the desk, housekeeping. 5 stars! Free beach towels and bicycles. Corvette/Porsche rental right next door.

My husband and I continue to return to Luana Waikiki after discovering it a couple of years ago (2010). It's close to the best and less crowded end of the beach, yet also close to all that Waikiki has to offer. We love the "Hawaiiana" decor and the heated pool is always sunny with a beautiful view of Fort DeRussy park. I appreciate the friendly and very helpful staff. For some reason, I always sleep soundly and feel refreshed and rejuvenated after vacationing at Luana Waikiki. We'll be back!

Really good stay here. We booked things though their Expedia service the pool was nice and cool even though it wasn't very big it was perfect. Our room was fantastic it felt like a home away from home. Close to everything without being right in town and only a 20min walk to alo moana which was super handy. Staff were excellent!!

My stay here was the best. The best thing here was the people that worked at the hotel. Alli the valet helped me so much, telling me great places to go and eat at. I can not wait to come back and visit again.

The hotel was decent for the price. It's just average. My husband and I went to Oahu for our anniversary. The hotel was aware of our anniversary upon reservation and again on check in (they asked if the trip was for a special occasion) and did absolutely nothing to celebrate or recognize the occasion. The housekeepers did not stock conditioner or lotion one day and as I'm sure you can imagine, after being in the ocean snorkeling all day, conditioner and lotion are both very much a necessity. I had to leave a note for the housekeeper the next morning asking for those to items to be stocked...I have NEVER had to do that before!!! I have never been to a hotel where those times were not replaced when used! We did use the gym and that was nice. We did not go to the small pool at the hotel but it appeared well taken care of. We did enjoy the complimentary bike rental one afternoon and rode those into the downtown area. We will most probably not be staying here again.

We booked into the Luana after 3 nights in a small, sister hotel room on the other side of Waikiki. Quite by chance and good luck we surfed and phoned our way through to Jana in Reception at this appealing boutique hotel facing Fort De Russy Park at the quiet end of Waikiki.What a lovely surprise. And excellent value for money.The hotel exudes a sort of old world charm with its high ceilings, beautiful red wood timber and an interior design that has captured the allure of the Pacific. Our own suite on the Mezzanine floor had a certain air of faded gentility - obviously showing some wear and tear, but with an island ambience and a daily service that made our 8 night stay (at a little over the price of the hotel room) very memorable.It is handy to everything - bus services to all parts of Oahu, Ala Moana, Museums China Town, Downtown etc - but it was still tranquil and private so that you had the sense that you were staying in your own spacious 1 bedroom apartment.

The staff at this hotel are the best ! very friendly and helpful. Alli the parking attendant provided a warm caring attitude 'great job'' .Jackie at the front disk greeted us every day with a smile and was very helpful. This hotel is clean and quiet away from noise of busy Waikiki .Our room over looked the park which provided a nicer view then most hotels. Great location, everything is within walking distance in Waikiki . Food store across the street for the basic needs ,beach 5 min walk away .Rooms clean ,housekeeping always prompt and did a great job always left a little something extra to make our stay more comfortable

I took my best friend to Honolulu to celebrate his 52nd birthday. He flew in from Seattle and I flew in from Atlanta. His best friend and her husband both joined us. They flew in from Atlanta as well. Our stay at Luana Waikiki was superb. When we stepped out of the cab we were greeted with open arms and tight hugs from the hotel staff. For a second I thought we were on candid camera, lol. We immediately felt welcomed!!The concierge professionally demanded that we did not touch our luggage and he handled it with extreme care. Such a nice guy! The front desk staff were professional, patient and friendly. We stood in a one bedroom suite and I must say that the bed was very comfortable and the pillows were fluffed. We had a beautiful balcony view as well. The Protea Cafe service was perfect and the breakfast was awesome and reasonable. The hotel was extremely quite and clean and it is walking distance to the beach and shopping. Housekeeping was timely available for our needs. The pool area was relaxing and we had access to the gym. Although we toured the spa, we didn't get the opportunity to get a massage but we will during our next visit. We enjoyed our stay and I will most definitely come back!!!! A great hotel for a reasonable rate.. I recommend Luana Waikiki!!!!

My adult daughter, my husband and myself stayed at the Luana Waikiki for twelve nights ending 8th April. When we arrived we had problems with the air conditioner in our room on the 4th floor and were upgraded to a room on the 11th floor, What a great view from our room, loved waking up each morning, pulling back the curtains to a view of the sea, the park and some of the city. Had some issues with the t.v, [stopped working twice] but were compensected for that with vouchers to the adjoining cafe and a good price on our car parking. The staff at all times were fantastic, the Luana should be proud of them, hotel itself is dated but very comfortable and in a great location. Pool area very comfortable and laundry was so useful. My complaints, airconditioner in room is very noisey [but you get use to it] and $35 per night for parking is far too much, Bathroom is very small but served it's purpose, Will return to stay at this hotel,

Your Concierge, Matthew Frisbie is terrific. He really handles people with courtesy and respect. Helps when he knows someone is unable to take a booked tour, because the person had surgery. Thanks for such wonderful care which Matthew provided. Sharon Pauls-Rathore who was at Luana in March.

We stayed recently for 3 nights at the Luana Waikiki. We booked on a hotel website, and for what we paid it was a good value. We were put on the 4th floor facing the city and park. It was just an okay view, but we could see a sliver of the ocean as well from out deck so on a higher floor it would have been a good spot. The room was clean but a bit dated, the bathroom was outdated but clean as well. We had a very comfortable bed, and our kids shared the pull out couch and seemed to sleep well. We enjoyed the use of the fridge, and dishes in the room.  We had no smoke detector, which we didn't realize until the last day, it had been removed and the wires were sticking out, but by the time we saw this we were checking out. The staff was amazing at this hotel, however and we especially want to thank Adam! He was very friendly and helpful. We were loaned boogie boards and sand toys and the kids loved this! The valet was awesome, the staff was smiling and helpful all the time and quick to get you what you needed. We liked the free coffee as well in the lobby and grabbed a cup on our way out daily. We stayed here for 3 days and had a rental car to tour the island, and for this purpose it was good. No resort fees and since we were not there during the day we didn't mind that there was smaller pool and it was a 10 minute walk to the beach.I would stay again for a night or two if i was in Waikiki to do business or tour the island but would not spend an entire week here or stay if i was celebrating a honeymoon or something as it was not as modern as I usually like. With that said, maybe other higher rooms or newly renovated might be better. There was some traffic noise at night, but it was quiet by 10 pm or so aside from the odd horn or siren. ABC and gas station right next to it, so it was convenient for snacks and shopping.

Stayed here to attend a convention/have a mini-vacation. I chose this hotel instead of Ala Moana hotel because I wanted to be a little closer to Waikiki, but not too far from the convention center.The rooms are big enough for two people. The refrigerator is nice to keep those tubs of poke you buy :)The bus stops right in front were very convenient. I had expected to walk to the con center but it was too hot so I opted for the 4 min bus ride. It was worth the $2.50.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The towel rental system is great. We also borrowed the chairs one day to relax at the beach. The only con is that the gas station is right by your window if you go with the city view. Motorcycle noises during the day, trucks peeping at night. Even with the windows and doors closed. But we were both the kind where noise doesn't bother our sleep, so it was cool. The air conditioner was pretty loud too, but we didn't need it at night staying in early April.I also got to see half of the fireworks for...Hilton? on Friday. I wish the staff told us about it when we checked in on Thursday. I would have gone to a place where I can actually see it... Oh, when I say "half" I don't mean half of the duration of the fireworks. I had half a view. Which was enough to make me happy :)I would stay here again if the price is right, but then I say that about most hotels.

We stayed here before and after a cruise and we were very impressed with the staff and the condition of the hotel. Although older, is was maintained very well and the location is excellent, close to shopping, restaurants, and beach. We didn't rent a car and walked everywhere.

I got the cheapest room not thinking it would be much, but it was big, beautiful and spacious. It contained a queen bed, sofa, flat screen TV, little table for two, and a mini kitchenette area (no stove) with a granite counter top. I absolutely loved it! I would definitely stay there again and would recommend to anyone looking for a decent place to stay that's well situated in Waikiki. Staff is very welcoming and helpful. Great service.

We stayed for two nights recently, and I can sympathize with the reviewers here who mention street noise - like many others, this hotel is located right on a very busy and noisy main drag in Honolulu.We were fortunate enough to have a room on the 12 floor facing the ocean ("partial ocean view") and the street noise was no problem at all!The staff was attentive, courteous, and professional, and the room was nice (I like to have a kitchenette). This place is within easy walking distance of the beach on Waikiki and also the shopping in Honolulu.We had a very nice stay, and would recommend as the rates are reasonable for the area.

Stayed for a night the staffs are great makes you feel at home right away...the rooms are big enough with a kitchenette but because our room is situated on the second floor facing the street, you could hear street noise.The room is clean and comfortable no complaints there, they serve coffee in the morning at the lobby and fruit flavored water as well.No dining facility except for a third party operator located beside the front entrance that serves breakfast, lunch not sure about dinner.Overall, we rate the hotel fair.

We needed to stay within Waikiki to be near family, and this turned out to be a great budget-conscious option. The "partial view" was a great view, since the hotel is esconced within a park area. Very nice and helpful staff. Room was standard hotel size but kept clean and we loved having a kitchenette. Staff responsive when we needed extra supplied. Yes there is street noise due to being on the busiest boulevard (bring earplugs if you have want to leave window open). But we knew that, and our other low expectations for a condo/hotel were not borne out. Our budget was not in the 5-star range so this allowed us to stay longer in Hawaii and save $ to rent a care. And longer is always better.

I was highly disappointed. The rooms are teeny tiny and the beds even more so. Bit sure which rooms had queen sized beds but I saw three and all had doubles. The decor is 70s shabby and the cleaning staff can't be bothered to throw out a paper cup in your room. Just basics there.. The same hair on my shower walls (which were not mine) were there for the whole three days. The front desk staff could really not be bothered. The pool is tiny. Parking is 35 dollars a night!!! Only thing that's great is the location. I would have rather tacked on an extra 30 and went to the outrigger or Sheraton.

Good location, very friendly and helpful staff, room was very comfortable air conditioning worked well and made no significant noise. If you want beach front this is not the place to go as you have to walk about 10 minutes to the beach; hotel will provide beach towels and chairs free of charge.

Location of the Luana Waikiki was good, next to Fort DeRussy park and an 8 minute walk to the beach. There is a bus stop, two minimarkets and a Coffee Bean across the street.The lobby is attractive. The staff was friendly and helpful. We reserved a one bedroom condo and got upgraded to a large one bedroom. We were on the 10th floor and there was a lot of street noise until 3 am with the sliding doors open.Several things needed fixed but when we called they sent a maintenance man up within several hours.The only negative was the carpets in the elevators were dirty and the floor numbers on one elevator were illegible. We would gladly stay there again.

Hotel is nice we come out here to do crane work a lot and above all I would like say our valet pick up/drop off with Alli is perfect. Her super positive attitude, humour, happy personality and speedy service is top notch! After a long day at work it is nice to see her and have her work so hard for us! Thank You Alli

I just got home from a 10 day stay with my boyfriend at the Luana Waikiki and had a great time!If you're thinking of staying there - here are pros/cons Pros:1. Comfy beds. We slept so well every night2. Great showers: Water pressure was fantastic3. Location: Close to the beach (nice walk through a park to get there), close to the mall, but further away from Waikiki which we liked since we were away from the crowds but close enough to walk there4. Laundry facilities: You could do your laundry at the hotel which was great.5. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs at no extra charge6. The staff were friendly and provided good service7. There was also a gym with equipment enough to get a good workoutThose are generally the most important things for us. As long as we sleep well and the rooms are clean and in a good location - we're happy!But just a few things to keep in mind in case you're looking for more than that:Cons:1. PARKING. DO NOT PARK HERE. $35/night is a total rip off. There's a public parking lot if you drive past the hotel and turn left at Kalaimoku street (beside Tiffany's). The parking lot is on the left (0.2mi away from the hotel) and costs $20 for the night. 2. Elevators: these were really slow and sometimes annoying3. No room service/hotel bars/restaurants. There's a small restaurant called Protea but that's only open from 7am-2pm. If you're feeling hungry past then, you won't find it at the hotel although they provided some very good restaurant recommendations that were within walking distance or a quick cab rideAll in all, a great stay. Our only regret was parking there. Other than that, it was a good price for a decent hotel.

The staff at this hotel is consistently friendly and helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the beach and terrific shopping. There is no live entertainment or bar so it doesn't have a party-resort feel. But there are plenty of nearby venues to be enjoyed that won't interfere with your sleep. There are views of the ocean and the lovely park just below. There is plenty of storage space in the rooms and the bed was very comfy!

I highly recommend Luana Waikiki!Although our family has stayed in many different hotels in Waikiki over the years, we always come back to Luana! The word "Luana" means - joyous, happy, contented, and relaxed, in Hawaiian, and this is definitely the most appropriate name for this very comfortable hotel.After staying in some of the bigger, more expensive, resort-style hotels, we realized how much we missed the cozy, homey atmosphere we always feel at Luana. This little gem is the certainly the best deal when you consider the price, location, convenience, and amenities.We love the location because it's just a short walk to all of the activity, dining, beaches, and shopping, but just far enough to be away from all of the hubbub and action in the center of Waikiki. It's also an easy walk (or trolley) to Ala Moana shopping center.Even though we are not right on the beach (which for the great prices of the rooms is a small trade-off), it's only a short walk through the park to the beautiful beaches of Waikiki. Whenever we feel like taking a dip in the ocean, talking a sunset stroll or spending the day lazing on the white sand, it's all just a few minutes away.Some of the features we've always loved about the Luana are; - Clean, comfortable rooms, with lanais (balconies).- Many of the rooms have kitchens - which is rare for most hotels and is a great convenience. - A refreshing, heated pool with plenty of nice lounge chairs for relaxing and soaking up some rays with some cool, shaded areas as well. - Nice gas BBQs not far from the pool for guest use (great for steaks, shrimp, burgers, fish or veggies!).- A beautiful view of peaceful Fort DeRussy Park from the pool area (and also from many of the rooms).- Two different car rental locations are only a few minute walk away (next door and across the street). There's a 24 hour convenience store next door as well.- "Ville de Coco" day-spa, massage and nail salon - on the mezzanine level. My wife loves the relaxing massages here. - The large and comfortable lounge on the mezzanine has many areas to sit, relax, read, have a business meeting, study, or just watch the big screen TV.- Free Wi-Fi in every room and throughout the building and pool area.- The laundry room is clean and very convenient. It save us from having to bring too much luggage when we stay for more than a few days.- Proteus, the peaceful little cafe at the lobby entrance, has great breakfasts, lunches, smoothies, cocktails, and pizza! The Luana has recently changed from an Outrigger hotel to an Aqua managed hotel, which made me wonder if the quality of my family's vacation would change at all. I was so delightfully surprised that we actually like it better now and were not in any way disappointed.The new staff is just as pleasant and accommodating as the previous staff so, as usual, we always felt comfortable and at home.The new management has considered and added many nice new amenities which we really appreciated!Just to name a few; - They now have new, free bicycles to lend to guests (a great deal considering the high cost of bike rentals in Waikiki).- There is free, delicious fresh brewed Kona coffee and a variety of nice teas waiting in the lobby every morning.- Plenty of new beach towels, mats and even beach chairs for the asking.- Free morning yoga in the park nearby .- The free wifi throughout the building has been upgraded for speed and ease of use.There are several staff members that I would like to take the time to mention by name and thank for their help, great attitude and big smiles everyday. Rudy, the new general manager is a sweetheart and he's doing an excellent job of keeping the Luana a great place for our family to relax and enjoy our time in Waikiki.Mark, the new Guest Services Supervisor was a pleasure to deal with. Matt, the concierge is one of my best friends whenever we're in Waikiki. Not only does Matt have extensive knowledge about just about anything you might want to do while in Hawaii, but he is always quick to make a dinner reservation (or recommendation), book a sightseeing tour and generally just be super sweet and helpful about any information or assistance you might ever need. He's also fluent in Japanese, which is a nice bonus when we have friends from Japan come stay with us. (there are also several other staff members who speak Japanese)Alli, Abe, and Ryan, the parking valets, always provide us with big smile and a welcome feeling (with or without having a car). Ken and Mathias, the bellmen, also always make us feel happy to return.A big "Mahalo" to the Luana and all the staff for making our stay wonderful (again)!In conclusion - although there are a multitude of hotel choices and options available in Waikiki, in my opinion, the Luana is by far THE BEST!. (It's also the only place I felt compelled to write a review about).

My husband and I have twice booked vacations in Honolulu through a travel agent. We enjoyed the Luana Waikiki the first time we visited and so we were very pleased to stay at this hotel again. We were on a lower floor this time (9th instead of 15th), but the view of the ocean was still beautiful. (We could see just the very top of Diamond Head from the 9th floor.)The hotel lobby is quite attractive, and they serve complimentary ice water flavored with fresh lemon and regular and decaf coffee daily. The rooms are very clean, and everything in the room (refrigerator, TV, AC, lights) worked. The AC was a little noisy but kep the room comfortable for us. The bed and pillows were satisfactory.The location of the hotel is very convenient to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. I actually prefer to stay on this end of Kalakaua Ave because it is quieter at night. (The larger hotels located in the midst of the shopping district are more likely to have traffic noise.) The hotel itself (including the other guests) was very quiet throughout our stay, which I really appreciate.I do not know the actual price of the room so it is difficult to comment on value, but I would venture to say that we were able to take advantage of one of the best deals available on a Hawaii vacation. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we visit Oahu in the future.

I spent hours agonizing over where to stay in Honolulu. I had a price point in mind and had a difficult time finding a hotel. I came across the Luana. I could not believe the rates were lower than my price point so I wasn't expecting a lot. The property exceeded my expectations. The rooms are spacious and clean. The beds/pillows are comfortable. The partial ocean view rooms are more like an ocean view room--our room had a beautiful view on the park and the ocean. The refrig was decent size and nice to have for our own beverages and sandwiches. The pool area was clean and had comfortable lounge chairs and provided nice beach towels. Also provided suntan lotion by dispenser if you had forgotten yours. Complimentary coffee and infused water was nice. Complimentary boogie boards and floaties to take to beach as well as bikes to check out. I regret not taking advantage of the bikes...maybe next time. Protea café is right outside front doors. They serve an excellent breakfast and large portions. Hotel is very accommodating for people with flights in the evening. They will hold your luggage for the day and will provide a room at half rate if you need a late check out. Location is excellent if you don't need to be right on the beach. It is a 10 min walk to the beach but we felt like it was worth the walk for the excellent price of the room. A little exercise never hurts anyone! The beaches are very crowed in Waikiki, however, this end of the beach is nicer, wider, and less crowded. The main strip of Waikiki is very noisy and congested with traffic, the hotel is located in an area that is a little less hectic. At minimum would recommend the rooms with partial ocean view..it's well worth the extra money.

My husband and I unexpectedly stayed at the hotel Luana after the Aqua Aloha Surf, a hotel we booked on 10/6/13 for 2/28/14-3/7/14 notified us upon our arrival that they were overbooked and that they rebooked us at the Luana Waikiki. I enjoy planning our vacations and plan most of our activities, restaurants and car rental based on where we were staying so when we were told this after a 6 hour flight from Arizona we were completely shocked and disappointed. We booked our stay at the Aqua Aloha Surf almost 5 months before and are both very seasoned travelers who have fortunately never encountered this before. We were told by the front desk at the Aqua Aloha Surf that the Luana was nicer and would enjoy our stay there. So, they gave us a box of chocolates and paid for our cab to the Luana. Upon arriving at the Luana, it seems they were not informed completely about our stay. We the displaced travelers now had to finish the job of the staff at the Aqua Aloha Surf and go over our rates & the parking fees (as they were less at the Aqua Aloha Surf). We had to take time out of our vacation to advise people of what they should have known. This to me is not ok and poor customer service. Not to mention that the girl at the front desk of the Luana was quite condescending when I mentioned how dissatisfied I was with my husband and I having to spend our vacation time discussing all of this with her. It was our vacation that we planned for well in advance and we should not have had to been aggravated with all of this. Our room was not ready upon our arrival so we went to lunch and when we came back we were able to go into our room. The room was fine, simple but comfortable. We stayed in a deluxe room. We had a partial kitchenette, sink, refrigerator, cutlery, cups, plates, coffee maker, no microwave. The bathroom is very simple, they do provide soap, body wash, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. There is a tub/shower and the towels are of a decent quality. The bed was comfortable as were the linens. We had a small table in our room, which worked well on the days we left early and picked up something for breakfast from the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf across the street. We had a city view and a small balcony that had 2 chairs and a small table. Our view was of Kalakaua, the gas station below and a side view of the pool. It was not loud every night but there were some times that were louder than others. There is a ton of drawer space and a decent amount of hangers (if there are 2 or more people, I would recommend bringing some extras or ask for more). The room also has a small ironing board and an iron. Wifi in the room is not great and only one person can access it at a time on their device. The room overall could use some upkeep, as we noticed some wear on the walls and on the amoire. The hallways look like they too are ready for some renovations, we noticed stains on the carpets but overall they were not horrible. There are 3 elevators and they are fairly quick, although we did have to wait a little longer on occasion. The lobby is pleasant and they offer free coffee and tea in the morning as well as water with cucumbers or oranges in the afternoon. There is a bar upstairs that we did not see being used as well as a nice sitting area and shell collection. There is a small café just outside the lobby and they offer breakfast and lunch with limited hours. There is a valet and you can park your car for $35 a day. The location is very convenient and ended up being fine for most things we had planned(a bit of a walk for some of the things we planned and we even had to cancel a few things based on how far things were from the Aqua Aloha Surf). There is an ABC store and another ABC type store right across the street, a gas station next door, as I mentioned earlier the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf is across the way and is great for a quick breakfast or cup of coffee or tea. Kalakaua has a ton of upscale shopping and some restaurants to choose from. The #23 bus is on Kalakaua and Saratoga should you want to take it to Diamond Head-you will want to pick it up on the same side of the street where EggsNThings is located. If you wish to take the bus to Downtown Honolulu you can catch the #2 bus right in front of the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. We feel the overbooking at the Aqua Aloha Surf is understandable but we do not feel we were properly accommodated. The Luana is fine but is it that much better than the Aqua Aloha Surf? Possibly if they comped us a night or upgraded our room we would have felt better about our stay, but neither of those things happened. Being displaced is not a good way to start a vacation and it followed us throughout our stay since we had to change plans due to the distance from things we originally scheduled. Overall, our hotel was not the main reason for our visit to Honolulu and we did not spend a ton of time there, but the hotel itself was pleasant enough.

Just spent 3 nights at Luana Waikiki and it was exactly what I expected - a good place and a great deal. The property is dated, but extremely well kept... clean, spacious rooms - down side no microwave; small pool, but nicely kept; good location -just a few blocks from shopping and plenty of restaurants; 10 minute walk from the beach - a nice walk through the park to get there, they have complimentary beach chairs, towels, bikes they you can take to the beach. Ate breakfast at the hotel a couple of mornings and it was very good.I would definitely stay here again

Just returned from Hawaii-Oahu on Wednesday 03/12/14 and I stayed @ the Luana Hotel and it was great. I really loved the hotel it is beautiful. The hotel did not have a rating when I booked through my travel agency so I was skeptical but it turned out to be very nice. My room had a mini kitchen, no stove. The front desk staff- hi Ebony was great from check-in to check-out. The concierge Matthew F. was very helpful from the time I checked in, he helped to arrange my tours and confirmed my departure transport to airport so I didn't have to worry about calling. The evening concierge was very nice and helpful also when I decided last minute to change one of my tours. This is my second trip to Hawaii and definitely plan to return again and to this hotel.

What a treat to be received by a hotel valet (Alli) who was not just about parking cars...but really cared about and wanted to help each and every guest...(even if they didn't have a car)!! From day one...Alli was incredibly informative about restaurants to go to and places to see...by day two I realized that she was the best "face" of Luana Waikiki... always cheerful and an incredibly hard worker. Even more impressive was that Alli helped guests even on her own time..when not working! The other staff were also always friendly and helpful...The room and lobby were beautiful and clean..Overall I would highly recommend and I look forward to returning...Congratulations to the Luana Waikiki for having such extraordinaire employees who go above and beyond the call of duty to give all guests the best experience possible!!
user_name:
Sandra N
Lake George, New York

review_body: Having learned Aqua Resorts took over this hotel I took the "Snooze'n Crooze" package, (room/car/parking), that Aqua Resorts offers. Unfortunately, this staff has not been fully informed of this package which caused a confused/slower check in and check out, (barely made our flight out). I respect Front Desk Jackie for her diligence for assisting with our room, parking and billing. My husband and I had a repeated nice stay-beautiful view, but very noisy a/c; met all our expectations except the parking situation, (valet guys were great). One more note, be careful, the tub is very slippery; no hand/grab rails.

My daughter-in-law made the reservations for us (thru another site that is NOT flexible with changes!!), but we had a bit of a mix up on what nights we were staying. Brenna, one of the check in staff, spent quite a bit of time with us making everything right. Even the manager came out to see what he could help with. Talk about amazing customer service. Never once did anyone pass us off or say they couldn't help us. I really felt like Brenna worked with us until it we had everything fixed. All the staff throughout the hotel were always polite, cheerful, and helpful.The lobby and rooms were clean and beautiful. Each room has a wonderful lanai with chairs to enjoy the views. Good job Luana Waikiki!! Thanks very much!

I spent a week in another hotel and moved to this hotel. First impression of my room, very nice. It was big, had a small kitchen setup, a large lanai with a great view over the park. The woman at the front desk was sweet, and allowed me to check in early. The pool was wonderful compared to the previous place I stayed at. The cons: the air conditioner was not working, it was an old window air conditioner. The maintenance men came in and fixed it. Unfortunately, it went off again in the middle of the night and it was quite warm and uncomfortable. The next morning while I was getting ready to check out it was hot and not fun to rush around in a hot room. I've learned that the air-conditioning unit has been replaced. I would stay here again.

This hotel has been recently taken over by a new owner. Our impression is that it is at a crossroads. It needs some investment to bring it current and less tired. If it doesn't get it could be on a downward slide. On balance our experience was very good for what we were looking for. The reception was very welcoming and the room was fine. A few nicks here and there but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The A/C was a bit noisy, but it worked like white noise. We booked a partial ocean view and we had that with the water being about a quarter of the mile away. A large park adjoined our side, unlike the gas station and/or busy street on other sides. This made the area seem very welcoming for someone coming from a snow bound home. You are at one end of the Waikiki strip and this enabled us to walk out and back as much as we wanted. You are close enough that the beach was reachable although I would not have wanted to pack a lot of beach gear. We didn't and just walked from one end to the other and continued onto and up Diamond Head, and back. A good day's walk.

I stayed here for 8 nights while traveling on work (with some vacation mixed in). The hotel is located on the more north end of Waikiki, and I thought the location was great. It was a short walk to the Convention Center, and it was also easy to walk to the shops, restaurants, and beaches of Waikiki or to the Ala Moana Center. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing east, so we didn't have too much of a view, but we did have a sliding glass door to a small balcony. For the most part, the room wasn't too loud, except sometimes in the morning traffic could be a little noisy. The room itself included a small kitchen area with countertops, a refrigerator, a coffee maker, dishes, and utensils (no microwave). There are also 2 gas grills available to use down at the pool area. The room was clean and spacious, but the decor was a little dated. It seems like this is an older hotel that is slowly being upgraded. The hotel includes a small pool and a small gym (but I didn't use either). There are also washers and dryers available to use for about $1 each. The restaurant downstairs (Protea) had really good breakfast (it's a little pricey but so is everything in Waikiki). Some downsides to the hotel: the elevators were really slow and inconsistent, parking is $35 per day. The hotel staff were great, particularly the valet staff and the concierge. The hotel is on the small side (15 floors), which is kind of nice because there's less noise and people coming and going. Also, for the price point, I think the amenities and location are excellent. I would definitely consider staying here again if traveling to Waikiki. The only deterrent for me might be the parking rate.

I booked this hotel through Hotwire. If you are unaware how Hotwire works, I chose my star category and location and, once I paid for the reservation, then I got to find out where I am staying. I chose 3.5 star thinking I was getting a nicer hotel. This was far from 3.5 star.The room I was assigned had to be the worst room in the building (maybe saved for Hotwire guests who tried to get a good deal!), it was on the 2nd floor with a city view. The view was really of the gas station right next door. This property is right on Kalakaua Avenue which is super busy. The road noise was unbelievable. The door to go to the balcony was literally a wooden (swing open type) door, not a sliding balcony door like most other hotels. 3.5 stars? I had to change rooms after one night (so that I could get sleep). I had to pay an extra $30/night for a partial ocean view and at a higher floor. I'll admit it was a little better, (I got a sliding glass door this time!). Still a little noisy when the door is open, but that comes with Waikiki.Parking was $35/night which I find pretty ridiculous. I have stayed in Waikiki several times and most places are $25/night.Also, don't be fooled by the pictures. I thought the pictures made the hotel seem really nice and updated. The hotel seems to have been renovated at some point by adding granite countertops. I believe this must have been the extent of the renovation. I'll admit the countertops were nice but rest of the room was a little dated. Wicker chairs, old looking bedding, etc.On a more serious note, I traveled with my family including an 18 month old. The balcony railings were not safe for her. I doubt this is a Luana Waikiki issue, and rather a code issue, but my child could have easily fallen through the rails. I don't say this to bring the property down, I say this as a parent who looked over at his child playing on the balcony and freaked out realizing what could happen. I'm sure Luana Waikiki is up to code (or at least I hope they are) but I have no doubt my child could easily fit through spacing of the railing bars. See my attached picture and judge for yourself. Needless to say, the balcony door remained shut.I don't have a vendetta against the property nor Hotwire. I will use Hotwire again. But just be aware that things are not always what they seem (3.5 star?? Maybe 2) and you get what you pay for (I got a great price on the room before I paid to change rooms).

Booked through Hotwire so I didn't know what I was going to get. It isnt a big-brand hotel but my experiences with Aqua properties in Honolulu so far have all been good. The Luana was an Outrigger property but now its part of Aqua. For around $130 you get a HUGE room with kitchenette including all you need, fridge, sink, microwave and plenty of counter space. Had a 2nd floor room with a King and sofa bed. Front desk was hugely helpful, got us into the room at 11am which was awesome. Pool is lovely with a view of Derussey Park and plenty of chairs. The Luana is right on Derussey park so walking to the beach is very pleasant and you can easily access the beach from the park or through the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Close to great dining and pretty much in a perfect place. This place is quieter than other hotels I have stayed in since the rooms are oriented toward the park and not the street.

We stayed at the Aqua Luana for 2 nights mid February 2014 and were up graded ( much appreciated) to a corner , well furnished one bedroom suite with full kitchen, partial ocean view , and balcony on 4th floor overlooking Fort deRussy park.( Better views I would think from higher levels) Bathroom quite tiny, but suitable for our short stay.Reception Staff were very helpful even with an early check in. The position is central to main strip, restaurants, ABC supermarket , the beach, as well as pleasant walk to the famous Ala Moana shopping centre! Definitely good value for this accommodation.

We spent a week at this hotel, and considering the price we paid, the rooms were clean and in good repair, the personell was effcient and friendly. The pool area is rather nice (pool heated and very clean) and overlooks a nearby park, towels are provided and the longe chairs are covered with new covers daily. The little restaurant near the lobby provides good quality healthy food and even nice mixed drinks. We had a very good stay, and nothing to complain about. Like most other hotels in Waikiki this hotel is located along a major road and if you plan to sleep early you just have to make sure to close the window well and close the curtains. I would recommend this place to friends.

Stayed here Feb 25-27 and found staff, front desk, Matteo at valet service, activity counter clerk very informative and polite. We were able to get a inner city tour within 1/2 hr arriving, took it as our room wasn't available for another 4 hrs.. Discover Hawaii, driver Keith was terrific, funny, informative.Room was very comfortable, clean. The small café attached provided excellent breakfasts, service..Prices were good also...so were their omelettes..

James W. was wonderful. He witness my cane breaking and ran to see that I would not fall. He offered a wheelchair to help me, I want to thank him for that! He was very attentive to all our party and our needs. When calling to ask the front desk for a pharmacy to replace the cane, not only did they give us a name, but told us there were several to choose from. BTW, we were on the phone and they sent someone to knock on our door to tell us about the pharmacy. Your staff was always helpful and friendly...just need to work on housekeeping issues.

Friendly front desk staff and housekeeping staff. Clean room and pool area. One thing we didn't like is the valet charge is $35. Per night. Balcony was nice and terrific view in the partial ocean view room. Overall all stay was good would recommend it.

We stayed here for 3 weeks in August-September 2013. We just loved the location! This was our 3rd trip to Honolulu and earlier we have stayed in the other end of Waikiki. We enjoyd the peacefulness and the view was amazing, most of the days we got the pool to ourselves - loved it:) Short walk to A la Moana center to do gorgeous shopping and catch a bus to other parts of island and the beach was only 5 minutes walk away. We will return!

I got a great deal here for 2 nights so my review is skewed. I can see how some are saying it's noisy and the room decor is outdated. These things don't bother me. It's Oahu. It's loud. Not on the beach either. But the front desk staff has been helpful and nice. And while the balcony is small, it's big enough for me. Overall, I think I got a really great deal on the room and on short notice (<3 days).

We were so happy with every part of our stay. We wished we could stay longer. It was a very welcoming place to stay. The staff always greeted us with a smile.we would definately choose the Luana to stay at the next time we travel to the area.

We spent 9 nights at Luana from 14-23 February. Loved the location of the hotel. We had a high level room with a kitchenette, it had great views of the ocean and Fort De Russy Park. The downside was that the balcony was very small. It wasn't noisy. The pool area was great, although the water temp in the pool was very warm, it actually felt like it was heated.The housekeeping was done at different times of the day which was not a problem, as we were out most of every day, and would pop in at different times to either find it done or not done, which was no issue. The staff were ALWAYS friendly, especially those working outside the hotel. There is no bar or dinner options within the hotel, however it is close to everything in Waikiki, so it was good exercise to get out and about. We would stay here again, great value for money in a city which has really expensive hotel rooms.

The stay at this hotel was very pleasant.Friendly staff, ValetHad a great view of Waikiki.Walking distance to most attractions, restaurants, and night lifeAll the people were more than helpful!Love this Hotel, relaxing!

We spent two weeks at this hotel and highly recommend it. The management and staff were very friendly and helpful. We met the manager Rudy Fao he was very pleasent as was the Concierge Matthew Frisbie. The room was clean and well maintained by housekeeping.We will certainly be returning for our next vacation.The Weber`s

We stayed at the Luana for 7 days this month, it's a decent hotel, fairly clean. They offer free yoga and bike rentals which we didn't end up using, but it's nice to know it's there. The only complaint we had was that the daily housekeeping was mediocre, they were in the room early (as in if you weren't out of the room by 8-make sure you have the do not disturb sign up) but sometimes things only seemed half done, the floors never seemed fully swept and they would just leave unopened toilet paper rolls and tissue boxes in the washroom even when not needed, they didn't take out garbage unless it was placed in the small garbage can so as a result we had empty bottles and pizza boxes on the counter. All in all I would recommend the hotel if you're going to Waikiki to see the sights (as we were) as it is one of the simpler hotels on the strips and not a resort experience-which is what we were looking for.Quick tips-avoid the coffee in the lobby and rooms, it's very weak and the pot in the lobby always had a funny taste to it. There is no room service or pay per view movie rental option so come prepared.

My husband and I stayed here Feb 9 - 19 2014. We were so pleased with our choice - the staff were so very friendly and accommodating, especially Jackie on the front desk and Marco (?) the bellman. They were so gentle, calm and helpful. The room was clean, bright and cheerfully furnished with tropical prints and furniture. The bed was very comfortable! The kitchenette was extremely well equipped, clean and modern. Having some cooking and food storage facilities is a BIG money saver and makes it feel more like a home away from home rather than an impersonal hotel. We had a partial oceanview studio kitchenette on the 9th flor. It had a small lanai, and the view was fabulous - overlooking Waikiki to the east, peek a boo view of Diamond head, gorgeous full view of Fort DeRussy park, and of course, the ocean in the near distance. We saw whales several days from our lanai & the sound of birds in the park each morning was so nice. We did hear a fair bit of traffic noise from Kalakaua Ave., but it is to be expected given the excellent location of the hotel. As we always do anywhere we travel, we used earplugs and that cut most of the traffic and air conditioner noise.The pool, though on the smaller side, is much bigger in reality than what shows on the hotel website - and what a beautiful warm temperature!!! Very clean as well. Even on cloudy, rainy days, the pool was heavenly. The pool deck is very peaceful as it is on the park side of the hotel. Very comfortable loungers, greenery, cabanas for shade. We also used the exercise room, which was small but well equipped, bright and clean. We used the guest laundry which was very convenient and reasonably priced. Again, a nice "home away from home" feature, especially for long stays.Ft. DeRussy beach is just a short peaceful walk through the park from the hotel; super nice mellow beach. The hotel provides complimentary beach towels, beach chairs and other items to guests, which we made use of. The hotel even offers the loan of folding bicycles to guests; we didn't get a chance to use them, but the general manager showed us how they worked and they seem ideal for touring around Waikiki. All the action of Waikiki is a short walk from the hotel, most of the main public bus routes have stops very near the hotel, Dollar/Thrifty car rental is just across the street & lots of restaurants nearby (including the very good little Protea Cafe in the hotel lobby - great gluten-free pizza!). The closest grocery store is a 10 minute easy walk west, on Hobron Lane (Food Pantry).A couple of notes: this is an older building (early 70's) that has been well-kept. However, the patio doors are very thin (single pane and not sealed) and let a lot of noise in. Also, at least in our room, although the air conditioner worked well, it had a very loud fan noise and vibration. We requested that maintenance look at it, but it didn't seem to resolve the noise. We used earplugs at night and that helped. All in all, however, highly recommended, especially for longer stays. Try to get a room as high as possible, and definitely go for a partial oceanview and as far towards the south side of the building as possible to avoid traffic noise.

My family had raved about this hotel so we thought we would give it a try.They were right.The hotel is spotless. The location perfect- close to everything but right next to Fort DeRussyPark for a wonderful view and quietness. A small restaurant is attached- Protea- for outstanding breakfasts!While this hotel is under new management it is being beautifully run by their new manager and staff. Every request was promptly taken care of with a smile. We will be back!

If you'd rather have some privacy in a quiet, convenient location, this is it. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and nicely furnished. The staff go out of their way to be helpful and friendly, but not in a forced or fake way. We've stayed here several times and the staff, facilities and rooms are always wonderful. We especially appreciate being able to have a kitchen and/or kitchenette and the ease of valet parking. There's also a small restaurant that serves great breakfasts and lunches at reasonable prices (for Waikiki).

We decided to stay here as a last minute decision. We were welcomed with a warm smile at the valet, then again when we checked in. Our room was amazing, with a one bedroom, living room, and a full kitchen. Very clean, pleasant, and relaxing. My kids were bummed that it rained the whole time, but surprisenly the pool was heated! So the weather didn't bother them one bit. Would definitely stay here again.

This was our second stay at the Luana Waikiki, the first in December 2012. When we saw that the ownership had changed we were concerned but there was no reason for it. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is perfect for us, a bit quieter than in central Waikiki. Our room overlooked Fort DeRussy Park and out to Diamond Head, it was spectacular! Room was quiet, didn't hear any noise from inside the hotel and the air conditioning provided enough white noise to drown out the traffic. We LOVED the BBQ facilities and the kitchenette. We didn't use the pool much but when we did it was enjoyable. We were so happy to see that the amazing Concierge Matt (who had been so helpful to us in 2012) was still there, he is a real gem. We also worked with Andrew who arranged a spectacular Koko Crater hike for us. Both really know the islands and are good at what they do. We are looking forward to our next trip to Hawaii and will definitely stay at the Luana Waikiki!

Love, love, love… I wished we could have stayed longer. The room was a home away from home. I felt pampered and privileged. The room was beautiful, marble floors, dark cherry wood finishes, full kitchen, area for entertainment, large California king size bed, washer dryer, nice deep bathroom tub and shower. “Awesome” is the word I would use for this room. Although the weather wasn't as the typical ideal Hawaii weather, the rain and cloudiness didn't stop us from enjoying the heated pool as well as the beautiful Waikiki views. We didn't use the gym because of the fact that we were on Vacay (vacation). All I could think about is the food and how ideal it was so close our hotel was to restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful; they answered all our requests and accommodated all our needs. By far it was a very pleasant stay at the Luana West in Waikiki and for the price, can’t be beat. We booked another night and enjoyed every minute of our stay, definitely will be booking in the future again.

Photos of hotel rooms can be deceptive....not this one. Everything was right on and accurate!Lovely rooms, staff are cheerful and helpful. There are even some free activities offered. If you want to be in the midst of all the Waikiki action, this is not the place . We loved the fact that it was super quiet, yet only a few minutes walk to everything. Fort Derussy Park is right next door and all the buses stop outside the hotel and there are lots of good places to eat close by. Only problem we had was the wifi did not work.However Aqua hotels are in the process of upgrading this. If you want a truly relaxing holiday, you can't go wrong with this place. We love Aqua.Mahalo - J
user_name:
Genevieve C
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a great time here for three nights. 12 Feb we checked out and took a cab to the airport. I accidently left my carry-on bag in the cab and watched as he drove away......... I was sick to my stomach as all our memories and pictures from a round the world trip along with lots of other personal stuff were in the bag. What to do?????I called the hotel immediately and Sonny reassured me he would do everything he could to help me. But we had to catch our plane so we left for Kona. The next morning we got a call from Sonny saying that they had our bag!!!!!!! What a relief.The cab driver had returned the bag and the bell-hop Matteo who had order the cab in the first place knew exactly who the owner of the bag was. To Sonny, Matteo and to the driver Mr Le of Hello cabs, I can't thanks you enough for your efforts.The staff at the front of this hotel do indeed work together and know who is who and they certainly were watching out for us on these past few days. All three have earned by respect for their efforts. Thanks for a good stay with a happy ending......Norm AltenhofCalgary Alberta

This review is long overdue.We stayed for our honeymoon in October. The location is amazing - still downtown but far enough away from the overcrowded areas.The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Thanks to Andrew from the concierge desk for helping us book our tours!Our room was very nice. We were on the 7th floor and had a partial ocean view. It was beautiful. We could see the sunrise from our room when we were jetlagged the first morning. There are blackout drapes though so we did sleep in the rest of the time.The kitchen is a nice touch, although we used it very little.Our bathroom was pretty standard.The pool area was not amazing, but it was only open the first day of our stay. I think it was closed after that for remodeling, so maybe it is nicer now. Overall the pool area is quite small, but what is the point of going to an island if you are sitting by the pool?! It is a quick walk down to the beach where you can rent chairs and umbrellas. The hotel has beach towel service, which is great.The fruit water in the lobby was amazing every day.We definitely enjoyed our stay here and would love to come back.

Third year in a row staying here ... wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. We love the location, decor and hospitality. The staff are very friendly and the concierge, Matthew, went above and beyond our expectations for planning events, bus trips, etc. The rooms are spacious and well maintained and the partial ocean view on a higher floor offers a breathtaking view. The lobby and mezzanine are tastefully decorated and kept very clean. The smoking area out back is an added bonus for smokers. It always feels like "home away from home" and we hope to continue to stay there for years to come.

My last review of this hotel was lukewarm, but I stayed again because the price is right and the area is good. This time we stayed in a 1 bedroom ocean view deluxe. What a difference! It's a nice corner unit with a view of the ocean, the pool and the city. It felt much more comfortable and had a lot more space. It also had an extra balcony (with a city view). The kitchen was well stocked and had all the conveniences of home. Staff was friendly and the transition from Outrigger to Aqua seems to be going fine. We had a great time.

Would not hesitate to recommend this accommodation. Staff are committed to ensuring you enjoy your stay. Personalized service and level of care ranks 12 out of 10!! Rooms are spacious, well appointed and extremely clean. Public areas are welcoming, beautifully decorated and well maintained. Appreciated the complimentary tea and coffee service in the lobby each morning. Would not even consider staying elsewhere in Waikiki. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so enjoyable and special.

We visit my father in law each Christmas. We found that this hotel is near his apt and close to Waikiki area. Our room had an ocean view and a nice kitchen, equipped with stove, microwave and refrigerator. Hawaii is expensive, so if you can bring back leftovers and eat them for another meal, that's great. Room was clean and staff was friendly. This was our second stay at this hotel but heard it will be another chain in 2014, so we'll have to see if we stay again in 2014.

Had a wonderful stay. Staff all very friendly. Hotel is close to everything and overlooks a beautiful park. Rooms are everything you need. Great pool and gym. Matt at the concierge desk is awesome-very helpful. Thanks for a great stay. Definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Luana for a week in January 2014. The hotel is conveniently located and within walking distance to almost everything on Waikiki beach. The hotel staff were great especially the concierge. He was extremely helpful assisting with ground transportation and arranging tours. The café had good food for a reasonable price and the staff were friendly and courteous.

Was lucky enough to visit Waikiki for 5 weeks Dec-Jan 2014 with my mom and brother and stay at the Luana. This was my third time staying here and it remains one of my favorite places. The location is perfect ..great walk to the Zoo, shops,beach at one end and to the Ala Moana,Canal, Ward Center at the other end. Pool is in the sun from 9-5 every day with the most comfortable lounges with towels of any hotel in Waikiki! Great bbq area and cabana's and chairs to relax in as well. Cheapest laundry facilities (washer and dryers) and good fitness center on pool level make things very convenient as well. New management made the transition of ownership very easy and updates are already being seen so a very positive sign of even better things to come at the Luana ! I can hardly wait for my next trip back!!

Had a wonderful stay in every regard but one. Staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, room was lovely, location great. The only thing that was a pity was the pool was sloped and not safe for poor swimmers. I wouldn't go with small children again as a result.

A frequent "come-backer" to the Luana Waikiki, my wife and I approached our recent stay with some trepidation, having just heard that the management group had changed from Outrigger to Aqua on January first. Well...., NOT TO WORRY!The hotel is still in that wonderful "away from the crowds but close to everything" location, the lobby is still one of Waikiki's most beautiful (the shell collection is hands down the finest we have ever seen), and the staff, while new faces, are just as caring, attentive, and helpful. General Manager Rudy Fao could not have been more pleasant, and his leadership obviously filters down to his staff, who made us feel welcome immediately, and were ready to answer all questions and help whenever possible. Mark Turina, Ebony, Jana, Jenn, and Romeo were names easily remembered for their attention to our stay.As we said, NOT TO WORRY. The Luana Waikiki remains that hidden jem on Kalakaua offering excellent value, superb location, beautiful, well appointed rooms, a lobby that won't quit, and staff dedicated to making your stay one to remember. Make your reservations early. The secret is out.Charmaine and Stew Leber

Great location only a few minutes walk to the famous Waikiki beach! And value priced! Rooms are nice, clean, full service, laundry for guests, restaurant, free coffee, desk staff are courteous and knowledgable, bell hop had all bus numbers, and would call a shuttle if needed. 16 days, got us a few months of well deserved rest! Planning our return trip back here next year!

Soon as I arrived, valet was very helpful and was so throughout my stay. He explained the process and stated we weren't obligated to tip and don't feel pressured. :O super friendly valet team.Check in was great! Answered all my questions and was more than willing to help! My cousins checked in a few days after me they were assigned room on different floor but front desk was able to adjust that to have them stay on same floor. Thumbs up.There was snacks/fruits/chinese new year candy for free at front counter, freebies! Just adds to the touch of my day when I leave and when I end my night, smiles!Room was perfect for wife and I, spacious! Even had desk and coffee table. AC was loud, had to turn tv volume up BUT leave balcony door open and let fresh breeze come in!! Turn that ac off! :)Over all A+ would love to stay here again!!

Would just like to thank all the staff at Luana for such a wonderful stay. The staff were amazing and so friendly and helpful. The hotel is located handy to everything. The room was spotless and clean. My husband and myself and daughter had a wonderful 6 days there and I would highly recommend the Luana to anyone that is travelling to Honolulu. Couldnt have asked for anything better. Thank you to all the staff once again for such an awesome stay.................We didnt want to leave.James who greets you and takes your bags off the bus. You are awesome...We were there january 2014.

From the moment we arrived at 9.30 in the morning and we were able to check in to the moment we sadly had to leave was totally fantastic. The rooms were comfortable and clean with the most amazing views overlooking a beautiful park as well as city skyline views. All the staff couldn't have been more friendly and the facilities were great including a beautiful heated pool and day spa. The only thing I could fault was that the air conditioning units are a little noisy but at least we had air conditioning. We stayed with family and friends and everyone had a fantastic time.

We stayed at Luana Waikiki for 5 weeks in December 2013 and January 2014 and we loved every minute of it. We have stayed here before and we only have good things to say about our times at Luana. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and a short walk to the beach through Fort DeRussy park is lovely. We also enjoyed eating some breakfasts and luncheons at Protea restaurant which is right in the hotel. Best Acai bowls in Waikiki!Great hotel to stay in!

When you enter the lobby you know you're in the right place. Friendly staff, exceptional cleanliness, great décor. Toss in free WiFi in your room, toys to borrow, complimentary newspaper, good and timely maid service, granite in bathrooms, nice pool, chaise lounges, beach towels... Great bang for your buck. A walk through a beautiful park (Beach Boys just happened to be playing a corporate event there and people could sit and watch freely!) brings you to the great sandy Waikiki Beach, just 5 or 6 minutes away. Loved the balcony, the flat screen tv which had a kazillion channels, fridge in room, coffee machine and very private bathroom quarters. Do not settle for less just because you are in Paradise. This is a great hotel and worth the mid-range price. Many hotels cost way more, and offer way less.

Stayed here during the first week of Jan. A pleasant surprise that the location is off Waikiki central where there is a big homeless population. The hotel is in front of a large military park and it is just one big block from the quite stretch of Waikiki beach.The hotel lobby is intimate and my room is a good size with a kitchenette. The pool deck is also good and clean with free cabanas.Staff was great and eager to assist.Will definitely return.

Stayed over New Years (during the transition from Outrigger to Aqua...was rather smooth, but new staff seemed a bit overwhelmed initially). Had a partial oceanview kitchenette, which provided a great view of Fort DeRussey and the ocean...we were able to watch the NYE fireworks from the balcony. Room was clean and well-stocked with items for cooking (at least 2 grocery stores are within an easy 2 mile drive, which saves on food costs). Air conditioner was a little loud, but no worse that other hotels I have stayed at. Easy walk to the beach and other hot spots in Waikiki. As other reviews have mentioned, pulling in with a car can be tricky between the small driveway and the rather busy sidewalk (depending on the time of day). The 24 hour valet was nice and efficient in getting our vehicle to us quickly. Free wifi was nice (if a bit slow) and the bathroom was a bit small, but the room was really a great value.

Rented a condo from an owner at the Luana (was Outrigger, and became an "Aqua"-owned property on Jan 1, 2014). Space was great for amenities, in-room air conditioning kept things comfortable, and provided white noise which helped with very echo-y hallways.Staff after the sale became quite loud in the morning, and were slightly less helpful and professional than when it was Outrigger. That may be because of so many new faces.Valet parking and entering/exiting on foot was awkward because of driving in from the second entrance. Often cars would park in the small curb area where you had to reach the front doors and it was often crowded, sometimes dangerous with vehicles pulling in.Pool is tiny, but if you just like to bob it's suitable. A fair number of deck chairs.The gym is pretty sad, and could be better cleaned. One TV, not visible from each machine. Usable for your most basic and desperate of workouts.Overall, totally livable and pretty pleasant though for more frugal accommodations. Location was super, an easy stroll to major attractions, shopping and bus stops. No more than 25 minutes to anywhere in the downtown Waikiki area. Eight minute walk through the Park to the beach. Convenience stores across the street.

Our travel agent seemed to think that this is a four star hotel; not so much! We would rate it a 2 3/4 at the most. The décor in the rooms is totally outdated and in need of an upgrade. The furniture was dinged and scratched. The chairs were uncomfortable. The concierge only worked limited hours, but that may have been a good thing because she gave us incorrect information (luckily we did not follow it). The snack bar off the lobby had decent food, but seating was very sparse and it only was open for breakfast and lunch. If we return to Honolulu, we will be looking for a different hotel.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki for a week during Christmas 2013 and overall we really enjoyed the hotel and its facilities. We had a studio room with kitchenette overlooking the street. It was reasonably priced. The room was very large and clean and the bed was comfortable and we had no problems with street noise on any night so long as the lanai doors were shut. The Hawaiian decor in the rooms was fun and made me feel like I was on holiday without being tacky or overdone. The air conditioner was a bit noisy so we couldn't leave it running overnight but as we were there during winter we didn't find it too hot at night anyway.The location was great, just a short stroll through the park to the beach or up the road to the main shopping area. Easy walking distance to Waikiki beach, restaurants, Ala Moana mall, the Honolulu Zoo and bus stops. The pool area, although not luxurious, is very clean and the water is warm for swimming. We used it a few times and enjoyed it but we wanted to spend most of our time at the beach anyway. The bbq's were great to cook a Kiwi Christmas dinner on!Some minor downsides of our stay here were that we were staying here on our honeymoon and we had to ask for our honeymoon amenity even though it was clearly written on our booking. The gift itself was pretty dismal - a 375ml bottle of sparkling pear juice. It might have been nice to receive a full sized bottle of wine or something more like that. Also the concierge gave us incorrect information about the buses but we were soon put on the right path by some friendly locals on the street.Overall we had a great time here and would return.

We are fans of this reasonably priced hotel/condo and its view of Fort Debussy Park. If you've stayed before you may not be aware that at midnight the management company changed to Aqua, and its no longer an Outrigger property. Just wanted to assure you that do far so good. No glitches and the desk staff seem earnest to please.

We stayed 10 days in Luana hotel and it worked great for us. It's not in the main Waikiki area but you can easily walk everywhere. We had lunch in the park almost everyday and close to the beach for sunsets and dinner. The only draw back for us was we like to leave our lanai door open for that lovely breeze but being on the main road it was noisy.( all night you can hear sirens). Our room was larger than most others so we had plenty of space. Full kitchen, nice bathroom, great service . Pool area was small and well kept up but we didn't use it much. A small restaurant in front of property was very good but usually full. Lots of places to eat in the area and down on the beach area. Front desk very nice to work with and concierge for outings. Never rent a car we just shuttle from the airport. Getting around by bus or walking is easy to do. Lots of tours for around the island or to visit the US Arizona.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 weeks in September, and had a great stay. We had a one bedroom ocean view. From the moment we got there, we felt very welcomed. Great, friendly staff, from the front desk, to the valet. Amazing views room the room. On Fridays we could see the fireworks from our lanai. Laundry room convenient, although make sure to bring your own soap, there is no soap machine. Swimming pool is nice, very deep, it's great to cool off in at the end of a hot day. The pool is bigger in person then it looks online. Location is great. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for 4 nights recently. We didn't mind the distance out of the centre of Waikiki. In fact, it probably was a bonus to be a bit of a way out of the craziness of it all & was a nice stroll in and out. The room was quite spacious but basic. The air-con was very noisy & kept on clicking on & off during the night so it was noisy. We were on the 15th floor but the traffic noise was still very obvious & the sirens were relentless. The staff were courteous but not overly warm or engaging. It really is more 3.5 stars than 4 stars. Also had a massage at the spa there at the Ville de coco. The therapist was very competent but I thought the 30 min massage was really expensive. Had a breakfast at the little cafe - very nice. The waitress was so friendly. Found out that on January 1st it will no longer be an outrigger but part of the Aqua chain. Don't know of this will be an improvement.

We stayed at the hotel over Thanksgiving. Overall it is not a bad property. The bathroom could have been cleaner. I don't think they spent a lot of time cleaning it. Valet parking in very pricy at 25 dollars per night. I would stay here again. Good location and easy walk to the beach.

I had a quick trip to Honolulu and needed a place for just 3 nights. The Luana hotel was a great choice. I easily walked the 2 to 3 long blocks to the beach and swam each day. The room setup is nice with a small refrigerator, large kitchen type counter, dishes, knives, etc. The air conditioner worked great. The hotel is close to two ABC stores and several places to eat. There is a pool, work out room, and laundry that I did not get a chance to use. The second day front dest staff was more friendly than those on duty the first day. I asked for a room upgrade the second day to a higher floor and got one on the 15th floor for only 10 dollars more. Each room appears to have a small balcony with two chairs and a small table. A travel and booking service is also represented in the lobby and I found the lady there most helpful and friendly. This property will no longer be managed by "Outrigger" after the first of the year so there will probably be a complete staff change. My hope is that the room costs will stay reasonable. Check for AAA and AARP discounts.

We stayed 2 nights at Outrigger Luana Waikiki and it was beyond our expectations. Due to the price we were worried that it wouldn't be a nice hotel. But, it was fabulous. I don't know why people would pay 2 or 3 times the price to stay elsewhere. It is not right on the beach but it was within walking distance. We had 5 couples in our group and everyone was pleased with the accommodations. The hotel was very nice & clean. The staff was very helpful & friendly. We were thrilled with our choice.

We booked this hotel through Costco Travel for a short stay prior to the NCL Pride of America cruise. We booked a city/park view room, rather than a partial ocean view room, on the consideration that the beach is a couple of blocks away and we wouldn't be able to see it anyway. When we arrived, we were shown to a room on the second floor overlooking a gas station!!! No "park view" at all. The gruff, large man at the desk told us that we had booked the cheapest accommodation and this was all that was available. He said the hotel was full and he could not upgrade us even if we paid for it. I put my foot down...this was my first trip to Hawaii in many years and I did not want to spend it looking at a gas station...a very run-down one at that. Fortunately, a nice clerk in the back came to the desk and found a better room for us...this one on the third floor, and overlooking the triangular park in the middle of Kalakaua Avenue.
