This was much better, even though there was a bit of traffic noise from the busy street. Another odd thing about the room is that there was a huge kitchen, with cupboards, plates, utensils, refrigerator and a big sink, but nothing to cook with! Not even a microwave. Our theory is that this hotel is also a condominium, so I guess people renting the rooms as condos are supplied with a microwave. In view of the size of the kitchen, it seems as though the hotel could spend a couple of dollars adding microwaves, making the rooms truly useable. Many inexpensive accommodations provide microwaves these days. Parking was expensive at $25 for the one night we had a rented car. And they even wanted to charge 99 cents to make local calls....so bring your cell phone. Did not try the wifi supposedly provided as I could rely on the fast 4G service in this area for smartphone use. On the plus side, the walk through the park to the hotel was pleasant, and the crazy/busy part of Waikiki was about 10 minutes away on foot. Had breakfast one morning in the Protea cafe and that was good. The other mornings we picked up picnic breakfast food at the Whaler's grocery across the street and took it to the beach!!

We stopped in Hawaii on the way back from UK/USA holiday to get a bit of R&R. Reception Staff and the concierge were very helpful. The room we first got was clean and and appeared to be very clean however on turning the air conditioner on we had a very nasty odour in the room. We stayed in the room the first night however after going out that day and coming back to the same smell we asked to be moved. They moved us to another room, up a few higher levels which was lovely and had a view of the ocean. The hotel was at the top end of the main tourist strip which was a easy walk, as was the beach and other hotels. Also if you want to go to the main shopping center there is a variety of options such as the trolley buses and local bus service. There was a little restaurant in the front of the hotel however it only holds about about 16 people and are only open for Breakfast and Lunch. The hotel is in walking distance of a variety of other restaurants and a supermarket across the road if you want to bring food back to eat in the room.
user_name:
Jacky D
Apple Tree Creek, Australia

review_body: So, after switching rooms and checking into a 'clean' room-found a large cockroach. When I told the front staff about it, they didn't seem surprised and said they would have someone clean it up (I was forced to kill it). They never came. Second request, it was cleaned, but when I asked for some leniency or discount for a 'late checkout' the answer was no. I think the least they could do was give a discount off the 113 dollar charge to keep the room from noon till 7. Also- be warned you get 1 coffee packet per day, will be charged for more. There is NO room service. I have stayed at this hotel before, and it was good, but I am extremely disappointed in the lack of customer service.

Very nice. Close to everything without being in the center of too much of the busy area. Staff and concierge desk very helpful. Post office & several restaurants around the corner.Would stay there again versus other hotels right in the heart of Waikiki beach area.

I booked a two double bed room. Was assigned a suite with one bed and a separate kitchen and living room (they did ask if I was ok with one bed). The suite was spacious and clean. Towels were clean. There were 2 tvs with the standard networks and the wifi is complementary. Staff encountered was courteous. Location is good with a 10 minute walk to beach and a walkable distance to the Ala Moana shopping mall. There are many nice restaurants within walking distance. Tried the hotel restaurant for breakfast. Food was fine. Service was attentive. Bus stop is across the street on Kuhio Avenue.

The room was clean with a comfortable bed and comfortable hideabed couch. There were lots of drawers and a well stocked kitchenette with even a corkscrew. The microwave was new.The pool was nicer than most with comfortable loungers. The covers and towels were kept clean. The staff were all courteous. We stayed for 8 nights. It's the nicest and quietest Waikiki hotel of 3 I've stayed at, in the past 3 years.

The staff are very friendly, check in was efficient. We were early, and our room wasn't ready. They called housekeeping and it was done within 10 minutes. We were upgraded to a much larger room, with a kitchenette (no stove top, no oven, so not the same as you can reserve). No balcony, and it was on the 2nd floor, but nice overall. Overlooked the grounds for Fort Derussy, not some other hotel or parking lot. Biggest problem was the loud air conditioner, but we just put it on cold during the day and turned it off when we got in. The ceiling fans kept us comfortable.Just a five minute walk to the beach, where there is another Outrigger with a beach side bar and good happy hour. No bar or dinner restaurant in the hotel. but there are so many choices, it didn't matter. ABC store across the way in case you forgot anything or want some souvenirs.

We stayed at Luana outtrigger for three days during our stay in Honolulu.There are a lot of hotels closer to (by) the beach, but the price for those were much more expensive, and since we were going to another island and stay by the beach we did'nt think it was worth it Honolulu. We did'nt regret our decision!The Luana Outtrigger was clean and fresh and the staff was very friendly!The location was great, close to shops and restaurants.We had a five minutes walk to the beach, 15 minutes to Waikiki beach- no problems!Free wifi and free towels when you were going to the beach.One late evening the shower broke, but that was'nt a problem! We just called the maintenance, and the problem was fixed within 10 minutes!We visited the spa once, and got a Swedish massage, and that was great!!We would defiantly stay here again!

Recently stayed for 9 nights as a family of x6 including x4 adult children - we got adjacent rooms, x1 with x2 bedrooms and the other with twin double beds on the 6th floor - outlook over adjacent park, distant ocean views and down to pool was very pleasant - aircon was a bit noisy for a good night's sleep but welcome relief from the heat - apartments getting a little old but are clean and functional - location is off the million dollar beach strip with all the hotel-only room configurations but still only a brief walk to the beach and everything in town - tours, taxi's, busses and connections are all easily accessible - staff were always very helpful - overall a very good value package for a big family - and yes, we would definitely stay there again! - Marc C, Sorrento Vic Aust

We stayed three nights on the third floor overlooking the main road. There is no sound proofing and the traffic noise is horrendous so sleeping is very difficult. I can imagine however that the situation would have been much different on the tenth floor or better still the ocean side of the hotel.The hotel is well positioned for restaurants; shops and the very crowded beach plus probably the largest green/picnic area in Waikiki. Our room was OK but getting a little tired.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Room very clean, beds comfortable.Would return here next time. Close to everything, quiet room on 3rd floor.Small restaurant serving breakfast, which was convenient delicious.

We stayed one night while passing back thru Honolulu on our way home from Maui. After having delay after delay at the airport and getting in 5 hours later than we had expected, Ryan at the front desk was very welcoming and friendly! Our room was upgraded from a standard to one with a full kitchen/living room, and separate bedroom area. The set up would be IDEAL for anyone staying longer than just a night or two. It also had a wonderful view of the park and ocean. The only downside I can think of is the lack of dining options immediately close by. The Hard Rock wasn't far, which we walked to for dinner. But the next morning we had a little difficulty finding something. The coffee shop/café connected to the hotel was completely swamped being smack dab in the middle of breakfast time, so we set out walking. Finally stumbled upon the Royal Hawaiian Center mall with a food court. Besides that tiny thing, our stay was PERFECT! Thank you!

I just stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki and it is no ka oi!!! It is the best. Situated on Kalakaua and the Fort Derussy Park it is great for getting a quiet rest away from the middle of Waikiki with all the traffic and people. The hotel is circled by the park instead of highrises. Each morning I took a wonderful walk through the park to the beach and along the shore there is a nice wide sidewalk heading towards the harbor...great safe park, no vagrants. The hotel itself is a smaller boutique hotel with a lovely lobby and the greatest staff. The front desk goes beyond to make sure you have everything you need, the rooms are nicely appointed with a great kitchen area (granite counter tops, stainless steel sink, etc.) and the beds are SO comfortable and all with the hawaiian theme. I was on the 14th floor with an ocean view and a peek of Diamond Head. Be sure and ask for the 'park side' of the hotel and try and get high up if you are looking for quiet. The A/C worked great and it was wonderful to come back to the nice cool room after doing different day tours in Honolulu. I will definitely go back and stay at the Luana...it is the best!!!

we stayed here for 10 nights and the room and service here were great. The cleaning and service in general was of a high standard. This hotel is situated just outside of the really busy area of Waikiki and quiet. We were on the 12th floor facing the mountains and had no issues with traffic noise. The room was very spacious with queen bed and good sized wardrobe.The trolley service that took you all over Waikiki is only one street away from the hotel. The fruited water in the lobby is a great idea and very appreciated on the warmer days.great place to stay and we will be back.

We just checked out of the Outrigger this morning. We were there for three nights. Our stay was lovely. Hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. Both concierges, Matt and Stacey, were very helpful. We liked that this hotel was a little away from where all the action is. It is an easy walk to the restaurants and the beach. We were glad we did not rent a car here. Traffic is unbelievable...all the time.....use shuttles, trollies....or walk. We went on two Discover Hawaii tours.....booked them at the hotel. I highly recommend this tour company. We took the pearl harbor tour and the circle island tour. Both were informative and fun.one night we ate at the Shore Bird restaurant in the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach....noisy....and you cook your own food on very hot grills.....I grill 2 or 3 times a week so this wasnt very exciting for me....but then the second night we went to The Top of Wakiki which is wonderful....service fabulous and food great....it is located on the 20th floor and it slowly spins.....very slowly and you dont even realize it.....would highly recommend this place.....happy hour from 5 to 7 so go a bit before your reservation and have a drink at the bar.....Groceries are very expensive in Wakiki....walk to the Food Pantry not the ABC stores....it is still expensive but better than ABC.....if you can fit some non perishables in your suitcase you should. Raisin bran was $8 a box and english muffins were $6....if you have room it is easy to slip food bzgs between your clothes....save your money for better things! Aloha!

Our 7 night stay was most enjoyable. From the 14th floor our room had lovely view over Fort De Russy Park to the water. Excellent spot on the Lanai for the fireworks on Friday night. We had a kitchenette so useful to have a microwave and fridge etc. We asked for two beds but room only came with nice queen size bed and sofabed. The sofabed was alittle squeeky and hard. Housekeeping everyday made the beds and replenished the toiletries, didn't seem to clean the floors. The pool area was a good place to relax and seemed clean. The issue for most people seems to be the location of where they stay in Waikiki. This hotel is just a few steps away for the heavy tourist hotel strip and we loved that. The staff, no matter what time of day were always helpful.

We stayed here for four nights prior to our cruise back to Sydney ,the Staff at this Hotel are the friendliest and most helpful people you could ever meet .A big thankyou to Cassel who helped me out with the Wifi connection .The fruit water cooler in the foyer was great after a long walk around Waikiki very refreshing .We had a room at the front on the first floor quite a large room with a great balcony ,very clean and the bed and pillows were the best ,the shampoo etc was of good quality .The Pool area also very good nice once again to cool off after our many walks .Maybe the only downside was the road noise and the airconditioner ,but we would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel and we would definitely stay here again .

The staff here are wonderful and the hotel has kitchen facilities as we were over eating every meal at restaurants by this stage of our holiday. Great pool area and just all over a good place. Off the beach it is a walk to waikiki which suited us and was close to everything. Great place to stay and we will go back.

My sister and I have stayed at Luana for the last 10 days and we have had a great experience. Staff are friendly and vey helpful, rooms are cleaned everyday and pool and gym area are always clean as well. No room service is available but there is a cafe downstairs open 6.30am til 2pm.What did we miss? A hotel bar to have a nightcap or afternoon cocktail, room service, a quiet air conditioner in our room (so noisy) - that's about it!Beds are very comfortable and pillows are great! Yes, the hotel could do with a bit of a spruce up but it's still a great place. Bathrooms are small but we got the opportunity to see a couple of rooms at other hotels in the same price range and they are all similar, too small for 2 people but still good.The walk to Waikiki beach is about 10 or 15 mins away but we thought the beach here is much nicer and less crowded.

Overall a good experience. The front desk was accommodating and we were able to check in early after a long flight from Australia. We needed our luggage stored due to a late flight on check-out day and the staff made sure we were well taken care of. Our room was clean and adequate. The location was great, within walking distance of beach, shops, eateries. Would stay here again.

After reading the reviews here, we asked for a room on the higher floor. We got a room on the top floor, the 16th floor, facing the right side of the hotel (left side is the gas station) so we got both park & ocean view. We were able to sleep without hearing the cars when the balcony door is closed. The a/c is loud so you will need earplugs. We asked for two double beds with our one bedroom with kitchenette but we only got one double bed & a sofa bed. The sofa bed is ok. The lady at the front desk said that they only one room with two double beds in the entire hotel.The room is clean & size is ok. The cleaning staff does not sweep or mop the floor in the room daily so it's really dusty. Waikiki is very dusty so that makes it worse. There are ants in the kitchenette so you need to watch where you store your food. The hotel is old & the cleaning staff does an ok job keeping it clean. The carpet in the hotel hallway on the 16th floor is old & smelly.The staff is friendly & helpful. It's probably the best feature of this hotel.Originally, we booked with P.G. Plover to go to the Waikele Outlet Mall. However, the shuttle bus (operated by Roberts Hawaii) only has a few pickups locations thoroughout Waikiki. The bell desk attendant told us the hotel uses a third party company to drive customers to the mall for the same price, $15 round trip, but they pick up customers at their hotels. We cancelled pur reservation with P.G. Plover & went with that recommended company, Ali' Trans & Tours. What a mistake!!!! The bus was dirty, smelly & the seats are stained with god know what. There was no seatbells (unlike Discover Hawaii Tours shuttle bus) & no a/c. The driver was crude & drove like a maniac. He barked at customers rudely. I told the lady at the front desk they should not use that company as that brings bad reputation to their hotel.

We've stayed here on several visits and have always returned due to the location, value and wonderful, professional, friendly, helpful staff. Although it's changed ownership a few times, e.g. from Castle to Outrigger now, and the prices have gone up a bit, but many of the staff have pretty much remained which is a good sign. Some even remember us from prior years' visits. Rooms are functional and modern with comfortable beds. The pool is rather small but we mostly spent our time on the beach anyways, which was a short 5-minute walk thru Fort DeRussy park. Every place in waikiki is within walking distance from here, even the Ala Moana Shopping Center. This is a perfect stay-cation if you do not need luxury settings, no pomp and such, but want a home away from home in waikiki.

We were give a studio room on the second floor. It's quite spacious, but the bed is small. Not even a queen size, I think. The aircon is a built in wall unit and makes loud noise. Without it, the street noise get loud. My long flight to Honolulu never end and the engine noise lives on, it seems. I understand that Waikiki area is very sought after and prices are generally high,but taking over a condo, not bothering doing much to it and calling itself a boutique hotel is not the way to go. I'd not recommend it.

We had 5 nights at the Luana, three adults. Checked in just before midnight, the staff member was just so professional. The staff we just amazing. They absolutely went out of their way to help with Phone numbers, taxis etc. We had left a wallet in a taxi, they helped us track them down.The hotel also has an Expedia staff member to assist with tour advise. The lady that helped us was just wonderful and professional. Great advise on Pearl Harbour tours, markets and fishing trips etc.The room was well air conditioned, not too noisy, great views, walking distance to shops, restaurants and the beach, which is about 10 minutes away.

I usually don't feel the need to write reviews on hotels, but I loved staying at the Outrigger and the front desk and concierge service were awesome. I was traveling on my own to attend a friend's wedding and didn't spend much time in my room, so I wanted a hotel that was priced reasonably and also not too far from Waikiki. The Outrigger is only about a 5-10 minute walk from the beach, and there are also fast food restaurants, nearby ABC Stores, and tons of shopping down the street (Kalakaua Ave). I had a city-view room with a small balcony and although the street noise did bug me the first night, I really didn't even notice it after that. My only complaint about the rooms would have to be the loud air conditioning. The hotel concierge, Matt, was very helpful whenever I had questions about bus routes or setting up a car rental, and made sure I always had everything I needed.Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for those traveling solo or looking for a hotel slightly cheaper than the beach fronts. Great service and good location for the price!

Loved this hotel,great location(away from busy Waikiki end) clean,fantastic beds,great kitchen,lovely fruit flavoured water in reception, nice clean pool,short walk across the park to the beautiful beach-Great photos at sunset.We arrived at 1130 pm wrong room configuration was given to us.Spoke to John who was very nice and changed over our room- no problem.We enjoyed our 4 nights stay. Watched Friday night fireworks from our balcony.

Overall a good experience,hotel is well situated ,handy to restaurants and public transport.Room was quite satisfactory and well set up with a good comfortable bed, kitchen ,bathroom etc and was serviced daily.One gripe was that the concierge service left a little to be desired ,although we spelled out what we wanted for trips and experiences we seemed to get what was easy to sell and at the top end of cost and very few other options were given. I found that the bellhop was a much better bet as he seemed to know more of the local scene particularly with regard to best shopping and transport options.WiFi was o k but did cut out from time to time . Pool was great and a visit to the Army Museum in front towards the beach was well worth while , Would suggest that you try to get a room towards the gardens and beach

Loved this wee hotel right through from the great location, helpful obliging staff, well appointed kitchen and the oh so comfortable beds.....like sleeping on clouds !!!! The only slight downer I think would be the cafe but then there are so many amazing places to eat nearby that their opening hours are really not a problem. Would stay here again in a heartbeat !!!!!

I am picky on where I stay and love a great, clean hotel room. Well this is it! The Outrigger Luana is a lovely place to stay, from the service, to the clean rooms, to small things like the amazing fruit flavoured ice cold water in reception which is the best after a day of walking around!The small cafe underneath had great food, the pool is lovely and nothing is but a short walk away. Definately great value for money in Honolulu :)

While selecting Hawaii for a stopover on a round the world trip from Perth, Western Australia, we selected this hotel from Tripadvisor user reviews, and must say that this hotel did not disappoint us.We stayed for four nights from the 18th August 2013 (we were going to stay three days, but the hotel had a deal of buy three and get four nights).We were in a room on the 15th floor (Room 10, with kitchenette and ocean/ park views), and as you can see from our photos, the view is to die for. It may not be on the actual beach front, but may as well be. We would have preferred a slightly wider/ deeper balcony. If you have issues with heights, then this small balcony is not going to help you with feeling grounded at all. But you do not need to sit on the balcony to get this great view of the sea and Diamond Head (Which rises above the other hotels).The bus routes outside the Luana gave us easy access to everything we wanted to do (From going to Diamond Head, to Ala Moana Shopping Centre).We used the kitchen in our room for making many of our meals, and managed to get pretty much everything that we wanted from the local shops. Just like being at home in Australia regarding food.The staff at the hotel were all very professional and appeared to be naturally happy (Not your usual pasted on false smile that we are used to in many hotels).The Luana is very neat and clean. Our room was cleaned thoroughly each day. And if we got back to our room before midday for lunch, we were fortunate each day to find that our room had already been finished, so we would not be disturbed.We did not try the cafe on the ground floor, as each time we passed by it was fairly full.There is a pool which was fairly small, but as we are a couple of minute’s walk from the beautiful beach, you may never use this yourself. We used it once, and prefer the sea ourselves (Even if a German tourist had just had their arm bitten off by a shark the day before).Food shopping wise:There is a small convenience store on the opposite side of the road (Called ABC store), in fact, the ABC stores are everywhere you go here. They carry everything from bread, milk and cheese, to tourist T shirts and fridge magnets.We found the supermarket shopping to be much cheaper and better selection at the Foodland supermarket at the nearby Ala Moana shopping centre (Catch the bus or walk there, if you are OK with walking, it is not that far, and you get to see more of the place into the bargain. We did find that although the bus system is cheap to use, it was hard to get a seat each time, as it is used by a lot of people, and when you are stuck in long traffic jams there and back, it doesn't save you much more time than getting some exercise with the walk anyway).Next time we travel from Aus to the USA we will be stopping off at Hawaii again, and would not look any further than this hotel ourselves.Clean, Convenient location and great staff 10/10 for us.Mark & AndreaPerthWestern Australia

I recently stayed at this OutRigger Hotel. It was a pleasant surprise. It was at the quiet end of Kalakaua Blvd near Kuhio. At least this is about as quiet as Kalakaua gets. The hotel has a small but very nice lobby. There is a small restaurant that is open early and closing just after lunch. The food was good and reasonably priced. The room had a lanai and a kitchenette. There was a small refrigerator, sink, and dishes. I wish it had a mircowave but didn't. The room was rather nice with decent furniture, nice beds, and tile floors. I have no complaints and had nice views of the Ft. DeRussy and a peak a boo view of the ocean. The pool was nice and not too crowded. There is free WiFi throughout the hotel and using the PCs in the lobby allow you to print your boarding passes for free. I would recommend this place. Some of the other Outriggers like the Ohana West and East are further down Kuhio in the thick of things but noiser. The staff was very nice. I would call this place a top of the line second tier hotel. The first tier hotels are nearer the ocean.

Great location. 5 min walk to beach. 5 min walk to shops and just keep walking for more shops. Next to lovely park. We had a partial ocean view with kitchenette and it was great. Comfy beds, enough room for 3 of us, nice little balcony. Staff very helpful, friendly and personal. We had the gym and lovely clean pool to ourselves most times. ABC shop across the road and a lovely thai restaurant we went to twice is highly recommend. Bus stops nearby also. Loved it and felt very at home. Would stay here again.

April 2013 was our 2nd time staying at the Luana and it was just as good as the first time. The staff were as pleasant,courteous and helpful as always. We stayed in a kitchenette with partial ocean view, with a great view of fort derussy park as well as the ocean. One big plus for us this time, is that we were able to have a great view of the Friday night fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Luana location is within a 15 minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping centre as well as downtown waikiki. Luana is also located on the edge of Waikiki and is much quieter than the centre of Waikiki. The beach is just a short walk across the Fort deRussy Park. The city bus transportation is directly across the street where Kuhio and Kalakaua meet. I exteremly recommend this mode of transportation as it will , take you wherever you want to go. The fare is $ 3.00 per person, great value for touring the Island. The room has air conditioning, inroom safe, oversized mini fridge,two burner stove top and microwave. We found this very useful as we did not feel we had to eat out for every meal. There are tons of great resturants nearby, if you don't want to cook. There is a deck with cabana's and a swimming pool, exercise room and laundry room. We Highly recomend the Luana to every one.

Right next to Ft. DeBussy. Mil I'D cardholders can get a monthly parking pass from Hale Kia garage for $100, less than 4 nights cost at hotel. A nice view if you are above 12th floor. Small refrigerator but some rooms don't have microwave (only allowed so many in blog). Bed was a little lumpy and uneven. Fitness center and pool are nice but why couldn't I open my eyes in the water? Restaurant on site, breakfast & lunch only. Laundry room. Would stay again.

For value for money...I don't think you could beat this hotel. While it is a short walk to the main shopping area of Waikiki...the outlook over the park to the ocean was much nicer than looking into another hotel. Took less than 15 min to walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The staff were very helpful and rooms (we had three) were all clean and comfy.

My husband and I stayed here on the first part of our Hawaii trip. His brother lives in Oahu and the hotel allowed him to park in the garage when picking us up and dropping us off. The room had a nice kitchenette which was very helpful to me as I have food intolerances and cooked many of my meals. The hotel was located near the beach, there was a short walk through a park to get there which we did not mind. They had a very nice pool area with luxury loungers and tents. It was a little small but since the pool was not crowded, it was fine. The beach was very nice and we spent a lot of time on it. There were little bars and stores along the way incase you needed anything. Stafff was helpful and kind. We would stay here again.

15th.floor partial ocean view kitchenette room at a reasonable rate was everything we could have wanted. Lovely view from the lanai over the park to the ocean, and certainly a lot quieter than further along the Waikiki strip. Only a few minutes walk along Kalakaua gets you to the activity of Waikiki. The front desk staff were obliging, helpful and friendly, as were the valet guys. The parking fee was probably a bit steep, but I don't think there is cheaper parking available at any of the major Waikiki hotels, and the valet efficiency and good humour went a long way to justifying it.Lots of traffic noise is hardly a surprise given the location, but a room on a higher floor and overlooking the park certainly minimises the distraction.Free wifi was excellent, with a strong signal and no need for constant sign-ins. The view of the Friday fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village was indeed a classic Hawaiian experience from our lanai, and the echos against the hotel buildings of Waikiki were spectacular. We intended to eat at the Protea Café, but without any air conditioning (only ceiling fans) it was just too warm in there for comfort, so a visit to Vit's across the road provided an excellent meal at a reasonable price. Also great value is the 24-hr. Wailana Coffee House, just a short walk across the park.Outrigger Luana is close to everything you need in Waikiki - shopping, dining, transport, ABC stores everywhere, pleasant staff, and comfortable accommodation. Shopping nearby at Ala Moana is a bit hit-and-miss during their renovations, but it's worth making your way out of town a little bit to Kahala Mall, Pearl Ridge Shopping Centre or Waikele Factory Outlets for more relaxed shopping. Also Windward Mall at Kaneohe on the North Shore is good value. These are all easy drives, but a $2.50 bus will get you to any of them.A very enjoyable stay at Outrigger Luana, and we will certainly return.

Woke up with an itch and rash . There were bed bugs in my sheets.The hotel did gave me a new room. The staff was helpful but I don't think I was the first one with this problem .The manager never contacted me and I think they don't feel bed bugs are a big deal.

Stayed here for four nights enroute to San Francisco.Whilst we had to wait to check in,the staff did their best to ensure that our wait was kept to a minimum.The rooms were spacious and well decorated,enjoyed the bed and thought it was very comfortable.We had a room fronting the main street,this is a busy road.If you are a light sleeper,suggest that you ask for a room at the back of the building overlooking the park.The laundry room was a huge bonus,we managed to get our washing up to date,had a plunge in the pool whilst our clothes were being washed.We didn't eat in the hotel,with so many eating houses close to hand we decided to eat out.We tended to spend a lot of our time at the beach,especially in the late afternoon when the turtles came close to shore.....amazing.We used the Outrigger Reef on the Beach for refreshments and the occasional meal,its location is right on the beach,the sea is just yards away.There is a military museum along side the Luana which is well worth a visit,it gives a historical insight in to military life on the island.

As a frequent patron of Outrigger venues, I found the Luana to be a bit of a disappointment. Had I never stayed in an Outrigger before, I would have given this place a 4, but holding it against the standards of the other Outriggers, it's going to have to be a 3.First off, let me say there was absolutely nothing negative about our stay here. Everything was clean, everyone was super friendly and helpful, the price was decent, it's in a good location, and they took good care of us while we were there.That being said, the fact of the matter is that staying in Luana is nothing to write home about. The rooms, although clean and comfortable, are outdated and uninteresting. Tiled floors and swamp-cooler A/C make the room unattractive; let's just say you wouldn't post a photo of your room to share with your friends. The hotel's lobby is small and unexciting, and you probably won't even notice the single shop and restaurant because there's not much there. The pool area is nice but also small.Overall, it was an average/good experience. The location is great and the price is decent. It's definitely a step up from a Motel or budget hotel, but it's not up there with resort hotel or condo. An average hotel with an average experience equals an average rating. But if I'm looking to stay at an Outrigger in Waikiki again, I think I'd rather revisit one of the other hotels.

The carpeting and furnishings appear to have been last updated in the 1970's. The condition of everything is fine, but a bit spartan. The alcoves down the hallways, for example, were made for tables and decorative displays but all are empty - just plain white painted walls and old aqua patterned carpet and absolutely nothing else in the hallways. Not that this is a deal-killer, but it is an example that these are basic, and not luxury accommodations. The location allows easy access to all the visitor attractions, much of the shopping and dining within east walking distance.

Just back from our visit to Oahu - and we cannot say enough good things about our Room at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki. Our room was very large and comfortable - felt more like an apartment than a Hotel room. The staff was great, very knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions during our visit. Parking was expensive in my opinion, but I hear it is going rate. $25 per day/unlimited in and out privileges - and valet. The Valet guys were very quick at retrieving our car each time we went out, which was often. This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach, but with that said it is also a very healthy walk to get to Beach, Restaurants, Shopping. So have a car or use the convenient Bus or Trolley stops nearby. Fort DeRussy Beach was a quick walk through the park and had less of a crowd - we found if you went down to Waikiki Beach there was No parking and always very crowded with people. Skip the restaurant attached to front of hotel (Protea Cafe) Only open Breakfast and Lunch - Small and expensive, you can get better food for cheaper down the road at the beach. We went down for breakfast the 1st morning and saw something disgusting and reported to hotel front desk staff and were told they were a separate entity and not part of Hotel. We did NOT eat there again and neither would anyone else that saw what we did or heard our story.

On our 2nd night out of 10 nights and I'm so disappointed. Internet is crap and frustrating. My husband especially checks his work emails on a regular basis and it is slow and cuts you off. Every time I leave the room with my phone when I come back I have to resign in then it tells me my username and password are incorrect even though they are right and keeps locking u out. Balcony so small u can't go out on it, actually one person can, which I have, but definitely not two comfortably. Air conditioner noisy if balcony door shut so I keep the door a little open as the traffic noise blocks out the noise of the air conditioner. Had no sleep last night and again tonight is heading the same way due to now traffic noise and the air conditioner noise which was supposed to have been fixed today!Decor old and outdated.I have stayed in a lot of hotels all around the world and this is by far the worst. Sorry Outrigger Luana but had to release my frustration!!I know they say you get what you pay for but this is not worth anything.

Very positive stay at the Outrigger Luana. Even though we faced the mountains, could just squeeze the view of the fireworks on our balcony from the Hilton. Our room was on the 3rd floor but we found the balcony to be a delight as the fountain in the park and busy intersection to be perfect for people watching. I did not like the ozone fan so we turned it off ... too noisy. The kitchen was very nice but a bit odd there was no microwave?! We used the fridge and enjoyed dining in the living area and balcony. The pool deck rocks. While the pool is smallish it's really deep and lovely tile. Great way to finish off the day after the beach. Lots of sun out there on the deck. Parking was really convenient with in/out privies. $25/day is a sponge but that's the going rate for Waikiki so be it ... for the convenience of having a car. Stay again? Absolutely ...

First I must say please make the hotel sign outside bigger, i drove pass this hotel had circle, i missed the small sign outside. I had a nice time at this hotel though. The staff was great, every staff member we met were very nice and helpful, they assisted us with what ever we needed. The concierge hook us up with our tours and we were set. We got a room with the city view and views were tremendous. It was on the 16th floor so street noise didnt affect us that much. This hotel is on a major street that leads to the beach so its busy . Our room had a king size bed with a full kitchenette. The room was nice but the problems we had were, there was no kettle, the pots and pans didnt look in great condition (wife was not happy), and there were ants on the counter that jump on our cheesy bread when we left it for a bit. (wife was not happy). We didn't report these things so thats on us. We were having a great time so we didnt let these set backs ruin our vacation. I would stay here again, but i might have to convince my wife to.

We couldn't have asked for anything better that was off Waikiki Beach. It's an easy walk to the beach, stores and restaurants. The rooms were excellent, the staff, friendly and helpful and the price was perfect. I rented three rooms for our family and everyone was happy with my choice.

Great family vacation at the Outrigger Luana . The staff at the hotel were absolutely great. Friendly courteous and helpful made for a great family vacation. Towards the west end of Wakiki we were close to the beach , car rentals , convention centre, grocery store. Great trip, nice hotel, great staffHighly recommend it!Polihronis Family

Although run by the Outrigger hotel chain, the building was constructed as condos. My unit was set up like a studio apartment. The furnishings and full kitchen were wonderful. I LOVED the honed Travertine floors! But I disagree with what was reported by other reviewers. This hotel is not conveniently located. It is not walking distance from the main part Waikiki, nor the beach. There are very few restaurants in the area. I found it necessary to take a taxi practically everywhere I wanted to go. This really added to the cost of staying here.The Ville de Coco Spa was terrific. I had a massage, manicure and pedicure during my stay. They were all first rate, and the prices were what you might expect. The Protea restaurant is not as advertised. It was built as a coffee bar, but had a few tables added and a kitchen. There are four two seater, high top tables and one large table where family seating takes place. They close each day at two in the afternoon. While the food is quite good, the place is noisy, stuffy and cannot really qualify as a cafe, let alone a restaurant. Although this hotel is not what I expected from the advertising, I believe it would function well for the business traveller or perhaps families planning to stay for an extended period (the kitchen, gym and laundry are a convenience). A car is a must, but be prepared to pay $25/night for parking (pretty standard on the islands). If staying in Honolulu in the future, I will probably stay nearer the action, nearer the beach, where everything I want is within walking distance.

Just spent 10 great days at Outrigger Luana. 16 - 26th August, Located at the Fort Derussy end of the main strip it was approx a 10 minute leisurely walk through the park to the beach and a 10 minute walk down the strip to the start of the shops, about 15-20 minutes slow walk to International Market Place. We were in a room on the 10th floor overlooking Fort Derussy park and with a uninterrupted ocean view. The room was spacious and clean with a small fridge and coffee machine.The pool area was adequate and was never overcrowded. All The staff were all amazing and always willing to help, but a special thanks to the bell boys always ready with great advice and to book us taxi's shuttles etc.If you are looking for a nice hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the main strip (but close enough to walk to / from) than i would suggest you take a look at Outrigger Luana.

Three of us shared a comfortable seaview room for 5 nights during a conference. The housekeeping (kitchen) amenities were excellent and saved us lots of money. We shopped for semi-convenience foods (poke!) at a Safeway about 2 miles away (we had a rental car). Staff were friendly and helpful. No bar in hotel, but we bought beer at the handy ABC store and enjoyed the balcony. A nice feature is the park that almost surrounds this hotel, full of birds and a nice walk to the beach.

We stayed one night in transit from Kauai back to Canada. This is a wonderful location as it is walking distance to Waikiki Beach (10 minutes) and Waikiki Beach walk for restaurants and shopping. Both the front desk staff and the concierge have lots of tips and information about the area. Both city buses and trolleys are close by for convenient transportation. Overall this is a wonderful location for a stay in Waikiki and we will be back.

Can't beat the price, and the rooms are spacious with fridge. I had a city view room, so nothing special there, but who's hanging in the room in Hawaii. The location is just off the madness of the Waikiki strip, and the walk through the park to a very nice beach is great. What I'd suggest is management figuring out how to give privaleges at other Outriiggers nearby...the Embassy Suites provides this for guests to use the facilities of the Hilton Hawaiian Village...how hard can it be to at least have pool access at the sister hotels. Great little hotel, I will stay here again.

Good room, clean building. Good staff that is friendly. GREAT concierge planned our entire stay. Priceless. Good price. Good SHORT walk to beach. Good location slightly away from waterfront and the hubbub that goes with it. When it was time to go to the beach 5 minutes to the sister outrigger reef hotel where the Shore Bird restaurant is located (see my review). Perfect all around

We stayed here for our honeymoon in July 2013. The staff was so helpful and friendly! We stayed Sunday to Friday and had no issues for the 5 days we were there. The pool was nice and quiet! It is within walking distance to shopping and the beach. The valet parking was worth the price per day! Our room was clean and had a view of the mountains. We couldn't hear the noise from the busy street in front of the hotel. It was a relaxing hotel. Your just outside the busy hustle and bustle but close enough to do so high end shopping and excellent restaurants. Would recommend to anyone!

This hotel is reasonably priced, but service is pretty ordinary. The location is just outside the bizarre Waikiki strip, so you don't have to cope with living in the midst of mania.Not all room views are equal ....we overlooked the air conditioning of the community hall next door The pool was ok but I don't know what they chlorinated it with but it made my eyes sting. I always had to wear goggles.Staff are attentive, but a bit laid back. Perhaps a highlight is the little restaurant just outside the foyer the Protea Cafe...very nice breakfast and lunch food....it isnt open for dinners but I am sure they could do tapas and cocktails.Concierges were really good organising activities, very efficient ....but not imaginative. They are selling their product and that's about it .I feel a bit guilty because they were not 'bad' but I rather think they could have been better .When I go back to Oahu in a couple of weeks I am going to compare one of the two adjacent hotels....Ambassador and Gateway...I suspect they deliver just as good a service. More cheaply!!I am a person who likes to talk to fellow-guests in the lift/elevator....there is a lot of military personnel being housed here. Nice folks. But at times you would hit the lobby and think it was boot camp. I don't know that I want that in my holiday hotel. I was also pissed that although there was a coffee maker in the room , there was not a kettle. I don't think that if you drink tea that you always want your water run through a cheap coffee machine. Also a small microwave would not go amiss...given that rooms are apparently studios. And personally I need milk not 'creamer' powder. It helps me sleep, and I need to be able to heat it. But, as I say, I feel sort of guilty...because staff were nice and I don't like to nitpick.Maybe Asia has spoiled me but Bangkok and Bali could show this place a thing or two .

Pros - location. Slightly back from Waikiki Beach which means huge savings in $$$. Easy walk to beach, restaurants, bars, shopping. Trolley to Ala Moana over the road. Great views, spacious rooms, well equipped kitchen. Great friendly staff!Cons - our room on top floor had very noisy aircon, and noise from elevators very annoying at night. Furnishings getting tired, sofa uncomfortable and old. Pool area very nice but could do with some umbrellas for shade when required (and a pity about the smell of fried chicken from the garage next door)

We've stayed at this Condo Hotel from January 13th to January 23rd 2013. We had already stayed at this location in 2008 and loved it: that's why we came back. Clean room with a kitchenette on the 10th floor with view on the city and mountain(last time the view was on the park and the ocean:more quiet). Small pool but sufficient. The location is perfect: a 5 minute walk from the busy "In" places, stores and shops on Kalakaua Avenue, but yet far enough to have peace and quiet. A 10 minute walk from Fort DeRussy Beach (part of Waikiki Beach).Location,location,location! The prices are fair. The only thing you can't escape in Waikiki if you rent a car is the parking fees: an additionnal 25$ a day. That's life! But you can get around in Waikiki and Honolulu without renting a car. The staff is very friendly and helpful.That's probably where we'll stay (again) next time around. Mahalo & Aloha!

Stayed for 6 nights this past week on my honeymoon. We got upgraded upon checkin. We had a wonderful view of the ocean from one balcony and a nice mountain view from the other. The room was spacious. We had a full kitchen and made use of it throughout the week. The location was good. Right across the street from ABC store, Dollar car rentals, and a bus stop. One bus takes you to downtown Honolulu. 5-10 min easy walk to the beach and the same to all the shops and restaurants in Waikiki. The pool looked nice but never used it (why would you want to when you have one of the most beautiful beaches at your doorstep?). The only thing I can say that is negative is the parking is valet only and cost $25 per night. Parked for only one night but got charged for two, however the front end staff quickly took that off the bill (apparently it's a common occurrence to be charged extra days).

This was a surprise. We were really happy with the accommodations. The rooms are clean and the staff very pleasant. It is a short walk through the park to the beach. The beach is on the west side of Waikiki beach. So much less crowded! Bring a mask and snorkel there is a wonderful reef to explore. Honestly can't wait to start here again.

This is not a fancy waikiki hotel, but it is nicely redone. We had a 1 bedroom with full kitchen, great so we did not have to eat out every meal. Good location at the top / north side of Waikiki. Small walk to beach across the park. Overall the hotel is good, clean, comfortable. Do wish they had a hot tub. The pool seemed to be salt water, don't open your eyes under water! They do have 2 barbecues which is great, but can be busy at times. Overall nice hotel, great price and if you don't mind a little walking it is good place to stay.

I stayed here for 3 nights, back in November 2012, and now that I'm a Trip Advisor member now, I wanted to write a review for here. This place is really nice! I wasn't sure at first, but, after 3 nights here, I can say, I really enjoyed staying here. The front desk staff was very nice, and friendly, they upgrade me to a higher floor, although facing towards the city of HNL, and some nearby hotels, I was worried about street noise at night. Nope. Didn't hear a thing at night. The walls and windows, are insulated very well. I found the bed to be very comfortable, as well as the AC unit very quiet. I'm a light sleeper, and this is very important to me. The room is very roomy, nice shower pressure, hot water, roomy bathtub, etc. It is just a few easy blocks to walk to the beach, no biggie, it's nice to return to a quiet hotel room, away from all of the Waikiki noise. On my last night here, I had a very early wake up call for a 5am shuttle to the airport the next morning, some rude hotel guest were partying down the hallway, I called security, they quickly came up, and shut down their stupid party, and kicked out some other people that these rude people invited up to their room. Major Kudos to the staff!!!! I've been to Waikiki a few times, I would stay at this hotel again, highly recommended!!!

Our family stayed from 06/17-6/23. Front desk staff were amazing. Always helpful. One of our room's a/c unit was not working when we arrived and they quickly had maintence up to fix it. Our rooms were always clean and fully stocked. Loved that the hotel was located right downtown and walking distance to the beach, dining, and shopping. Will definetly stay again at Outrigger Luana Waikiki.

So many ++'s but it comes down to a good night's sleep doesn't it?! We were greeted by an amazing valet/bellman at 10:30 pm at night, checked in and found out we were upgraded for our one night stay to the top floor (1606), but as we arrived on the floor my husband's spidey sense went off when he could hear the mechanical room thumping away as soon as we stepped off the elevator... and there it is folks... all night long! A couple times a minute thump, whir, click click click.Our one bedroom kitchen, living room, two balcony room with THE most amazing views of the ocean doesn't mean diddly when you don't get any sleep.Strengths:Customer Service - excellent (although it does freak me out a little when the front desk agent is a self proclaimed 'crazy' night staffer)Valet service was excellentRoom views - probably one of the best unobstructed views in HonoluluPool - pretty terrificFitness room - well appointedRoom - upgrade was acceptableBalconies - small but functionalBeds - TOO SMALLRooms (Fit & Finish) - Tired doors/Windows/entrance ways/sliders/screen doorsFurniture - was comfortableLocation - centrally locatedKitchenette - liked the granite, dishes & utensils seemed tired, but functionalBathroom - dated but functionalGood $$$ for Honolulu. We stayed here for one night before going to our final destination for a week because we got in so late and it was a $200 savings for our late arrival. As part of our planning we are not disappointed we made our stop at the Outrigger, would just make sure we were a little choosier about our room even on an upgrade!

Stayed here for a couple nights before boarding a Hawaiian cruise ship. On the plus side, the staff was very hospitable and friendly. Rooms were clean but very average. We had 1-BR suite & kids had very uncomfortable sleep on extremely thin sofa bed mattress. Kitchen was barely stocked with even bare essentials (ie: no paper towels, etc.). Location was at far end of a very busy strip, so will have to walk quite a bit to get anywhere if you don't want to take expensive taxis. Beach closest to hotel is very small and narrow, and filled with never-ending rocks once you enter the water, so be aware. Coffee shop is extremely small, but fine and convenient for quick breakfast. We appreciated their offer to hold our bags and let us into a facility to shower and change on the day we checked out, but were still planning on getting picked up back there again after a tour later that afternoon. Problem was that this facility had non-flushing toilet, no toilet paper or paper towels, no soap whatsoever (for sink or shower) and a shower that literally dripped out the thinnest and coldest stream of water you can imagine! Impossible to take a shower in there after having already gotten greasy with sunscreen and needing to rinse off salt water from our morning snorkel tour. Would not waste time here again.

This was my first visit to Honolulu but I was told by my husband about the Outrigger luana waikiki because he stayed there years ago. First the front desk staff very great. They were friendly, helpful and Cared about my stay. The hotel was convenient to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. I was upgraded to a deluxe room with a full kitchen which was great however this is where the problem began. Bugs not bedbugs but ants and cockroaches. I know it's an older hotel but I have a problem with having ants on my things and so afraid of taking them home. The first room had them but the kind manager at the front desk changed my room for me. At first look there didn't appear to be any in the 2nd room but I was mistaken. Ants in the microwave, rice cooker, sink, salt shaker, dishes, and some die ones in the refrig. Each time I called the front desk about the problem they responded immediately. A very pleasant gentleman came up to spray the ants twice. The spray didn't kill them but I think that's what killed the roach the size of my thumb. The spray although a natural environment friendly spray was too much for me. I have allergies. but more so I do not do well around bugs If I would stay there again I would not have a kitchen which may reduce the changes for ants. If you can deal with the ants then it's a good hotel. Please please get an exterminator.
user_name:
Aquanetta B
Woodway, Texas, United States

review_body: We stayed here for two weeks with three kids. What I like about it was that it was set back across the park and had a pool which was a lot quieter than the hotels on the beach front. We had a deluxe room with a bedroom and kitchen which made it very roomy and comfortable. We were able to cook our own meals and have breakfast at our own leisure whilst sitting on the balcony overlooking the park and beach. The location was handy to all the good shops and the beach and restaurant. We had a fantastic time, found it very relaxing and a good price for what we got. We are already planning to return.

We have stayed at several other hotels in Honolulu and found that that the Outrigger Luana Waikiki was the most comfortable for the price and our needs. It is convenient to all the restaurants and shopping of Waikiki, but far enough way to be quiet and peaceful. We walked to Aloa Moana shopping centre, the beach and restaurants easily, but trolleys are close by.Our room on the 12th floor was a partial Ocean view and overlooked the park so there was no noise from traffic or party goers. It was peaceful and pleasant sitting on the balcony at sunset with a glass of wine before we ventured out to one the many good eating establisments in Waikiki. The small kitchenette allowed us to have our own breakfast and coffee in the room and added to the size or the room. It was spacious and each room had a balcony with a good view. The bed was clean and very comfortable and the plenty of lovely pillows. The pool and barbecue area were excellent and even though the pool is small, there are plenty of lounges surrounding it in a sunny peaceful setting (no other hotel s or buildings looking into or shading it). The staff were all very helpful and friendly. We would certainly stay there again.

This was our 1st time going to Hawaii, I book this hotel by the reviews and they were right, all staff are great, helpful, friendly. Concierge is helpful to give you directions and hands you a local map. Hotel is surrounded by a park and walking distance approx. 5 to 10 mins to the beach thats back of hotel. Waikiki Beach is approx 15 mins walking distance or take Bus 22 . Our room was on the 9th floor our room #917 facing the city street, great view to all directions, We had a Kitchenette fully equipped to cook, toaster, microwave oven, 2 burners, sm fridge. Queen size bed and sleeper sofa. Room was very clean. Hallway of the hotel is hot. There is a pool, gym, bar-b-que grill, Valet parking is $25. We didn't rent a car, we used the 4 day bus pass Next time we will rent a car to go to the longer drives. Every time we walk back to the hotel the valet person would always say welcome back, that was nice. across the street you can buy some groceries from ABC or General Store, its expensive. or go to Coffee Bean. Next door you have a Gas Station that has a car rental, across the street is Dollar Rent a Car. Around the corner on Saratoga st are all bus lines you can take to Ala Mona Mall or to Ala Mona Beach that is across the street from the Mall. Also if you need towels to go to the beach, go to the Front Desk they will give the towels there and on the 1st floor you can dropped them off. Walking distance to the International Market Center, Hotel has a small gift shop, and a restaurant that is open for breakfast and lunch. I would return back with my family again.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana last week. The property was great. The rooms had a lot of space and each room had a balcony with a good view. The pool and barbecue area were excellent.The desk clerks were more than helpful. They even remembered our names. They knew the area well, and all of their suggestions were helpful.The price of the hotel is reasonable and it does not charge a resort fee. It has a good location, but it is about a fifteen minute walk to the beach.

The room was comfortable, clean, convenient to restaurants and shopping. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The bed was very comfortable and the pillow was the best. The room and the pool area were very clean and nicely maintained. I would stay here again in a minute. It was worth every penny, you will not leave this hotel unhappy.

I promised to complete this review at check out from the Outrigger last week. Stayed for 10 days and want to share it was a wonderful experience from check-in to check-out. Every staff member we encountered was nothing but an absolute professional! The room itself was wonderful and well maintained. The hotel is close to just about anything you might want to do including the beach, parks and a great shopping district! If I get the chance to return I will always opt for this great hotel and staff!

This hotel is in a great location. It is a 15 minute walk to Ala Moana Center and close to many bus stops. Waikiki Beach is 15 minutes away too. It is a smaller property so getting in and out is simple. The pool is nice and quiet and relaxing. The rooms are very basic and have an unpleasant scent. The rooms and hallways have a musty smell which is always present. Turning the air conditioner on is like having a jet engine in your room. My room had a sink, fridge, plates and utensils but no cooking appliances. I had a great rate so I accepted the shortcomings of this hotel. I would not have been very happy if I had paid the rack rate. The rooms are cleaned well and the front desk reception are very pleasant.

this place was awesome very clean nice pool & gym!!! awesome staff and very helpful too !!!! Angelo up in front was always a great help with info on surroundings and area attractions sights to see & places to eat....we are heading back in mid july and have already booked our week at this location again and plan on makin it our spot to go to when stayin in honolulu!!!!
user_name:
Arturo Tido E
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: The Outrigger Luana is awesome... clean, comfortable, quiet, spacious, and by far the most helpful, courteous, happy staff of anywhere we have ever stayed!!! Will recommend to all family and friends. We look forward to staying here again!!!

We chose this hotel because of it's location and the fact that you can get a military rate if you call them. The Hale Koa (a armed forced recreation center) is right across the park/street from this hotel and if you have your military ID you can use all of their amenities as well as the Outriggers. This was a major plus for our military family. Our hotel room had a kitchenette and was a partial ocean view room with a balcony. The balcony view was awesome, especially at night! The hotel is very near shopping, the beach and other touristy Waikiki stuff. We also parked our rental car here and were charged $15.00 a day for valet (military rate) the civilian rate is $25.00 a day, unlimited access in and out of the garage. For Waikiki, this is a pretty good rate. The valet parking attendants were also very nice and offered any information or directions that we wanted. The gym is pretty adequate and offers your normal work out machines and equipment. The pool area is nice and has gazebos if you would like to take a break from the sun. The little cafe was also reasonably priced, its located in the front of the hotel and you can take food to go! I would definitely stay here again.

This is a very nice hotel with a balcony, pool, kitchenette (toaster, coffee, fridge, dishes). Very clean and safe. The staff are helpful. The concierge helped us book a few things, which was helpful, but we also spent more than we would have if we had booked on our own (car rental, Pearl Harbor tour). Few big blocks from the beach, but a pretty central location.

The Outrigger Luana is a pretty good place to stay. I can't complain about the cleanliness, or the amenities provided by the place. We stayed in a studio style condo, and we had everything we needed. We didn't cook at all, but there were pots, pans, silverware etc if you are so inclined. The place was cleaned daily, towels replaced and all the works so it made the stay comfortable. We were on the 4th floor and we had a tiny view of the beach, I would imagine the people up higher than us had a great view!! By the way they did have a nice little patio with a couple chairs and a table so you could sit outside and enjoy the awesome Hawaii weather. Overall it was definitely 4 out of 5 stars. I would stay there again, although I think I would prefer a place a little closer to the beach. The walk to get to Waikiki beach is about 15 minutes I would say, but it is very close to all of the shopping right along the main drag if that is more your thing. The only thing I really didn't like very much was that they charge $25 a day for valet parking. I guess if you are going to Hawaii this kind of overpriced non sense is to be expected, but still not too happy about that.

We have stayed here a few times and take advantage of the specials that they have from time to time. The suites are always very nice and roomy with a king size bed in the room and a sofa bed in the living room. The full kitchen is nice and fully stocked with pots and pans and everything you need for cooking in. Some of the pans in our unit were in need of replacement, everything we cooked stuck to them. There was no ice maker in the unit so we had to bring ice from the first floor and put in the freezer, it would be nice to have one in the unit. The bathroom is located inside the bedroom so you have to enter through the bedroom to utilize it, would be nice if you could enter from the hallway not to disturb the sleeping. The view was nice over looking the park, it is real quite compared to the waikiki hotels right in the heart of waikiki. We had one problem which was when we were ready to go to sleep, we turned down the sheets and to our surprise there was drippings of dried blood or something red/brown on the sheets. I immediately called the front desk and they came up and brought us a new set, and apologized for the problem, this really grossed me out and did not know how the maid did not notice it. The location and price is good and I would stay there again, but I would check the bed sheets first when I arrive.

We stayed here with friends so we had booked two rooms and an apartment. All of us were very pleased with the standard of accommodation we received and felt it was great value (especially the discount for over 50's!). We had friends staying in the Waikiki Sheraton at the same time, it cost three times as much, and while their room had sensational views over Waikiki beach to Diamond Head, their room was smaller than ours and had less facilities. The pool at the Luana is nothing special but the nearby Waikiki beach was beautiful, so that was not important to us. The staff at the Luana were just gorgeous, really helpful, happy and friendly. The small café did wonderful breakfasts at great prices, and the staff were very obliging when we were in a rush to be ready for our taxi. The Luana has a handy ABC shop and some restaurants across a small park in front of the hotel, and it is a five minute walk from the Hard Rock Café and Beach Walk, where we found some great bars. A couple more minutes walk takes you to the centre of Waikiki.

My travel agent recommended the Luana for us as we wanted to see the beach & ocean but not all the crowds-perfect!!!! It was so peaceful-staff was so professional & polite. Overlooks Dussey Park just a nice place to stay-had a room with kitchenette which was very handy-and enjoyed the Potea Cafe each morning as well. Can't go wrong here for sure!!!!

Centrally located to most everything in the busy town of Waikiki. Affordable and just a short walk to the beach, restaurants, and coffee shops. Ocean view room was a great value compared to others in the area. Would recommend!

This hotel/apartment is in a great location for Waikiki, however the rooms are getting on a little, but are clean and tidy. The bed was great very very comfortable. Views were ok over the park.We found the only real drawback was the noise. Even high up we could hear the road noise and people pulling their luggage over the tiles in the street, I suppose its because we live in the country and not used to the traffic. The road outside was very busy so be warned. I suggest ear plugs would help if it bothers you.

I stay at this hotel on quite a regular basis. I'm set up here through my job. As is most of the hotels I stay at for work it is never anything to write home about. The rooms are ok. Views are also just ok. Never been to the spa here, but I hear great things. There is a little café here that is open for breakfast and lunch that is fantastic. If it were open for dinner I'd eat all 3 meals there.  The staff here are alwaysfriendly, but never seem to be exceptional in any way. For the first time in Hawaii I had an extra day to do as I pleased. I decided to rent a car. I pulled up and was greeted by Will. He was an extreme gentleman. Later that evening I went out and was helped by Randy. He gave me great recommendations on where to have dinner and was quite knowledgable on golf courses on the island. To think all I had to do was rent a car to be treated like a VIP. Basically the review is specifically to say the valets here are standouts.

We stayed in this hotel for 9 days in May. Upon checking in we were told we had been upgraded from the Partial Ocean View Kitchenette I had booked to a 1 bedroom suite! The suite is fantastic! A full kitchen, separate lounge, separate bedroom and 2 balconies. One overlooks the pool and the other Fort De Russy Park and the ocean. The beds are sooo comfy. The staff at reception are helpful and friendly and your room is serviced daily. You get fresh towels and clean sheets!They have a fantastic water cooler with fruit in the lobby and if you need a beach towel just ask at reception. We had a great view of the Friday night fireworks from our balcony on the 5th floor.The only thing I would have liked that I didn't have is an airer in the room for swimmers.The hotel is located away from the heart of Waikiki so is quieter but still only a short 10 min walk to the centre of town. There is a bus stop across the road. Buses will take you anywhere on the island. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting Waikiki!

We booked a partial ocean and was happy with our room on the 6th floor. It offered a view of the ocean and looked over Ft. DeRussy Park. The room was a nice size with a balcony that was a little narrow, but we enjoyed sitting out there on a couple of occasions. The was a kitchen space with a refrigerator and dishes, but no microwave.We were able to watch the Friday night fireworks from the 16th floor and that was very nice not to have to go down to the beach.The people at the reception desk were very friendly. We were offered the opportunity to ask for a higher floor the next morning, but decided to stay where we were.The hotel was conveniently located without being on the main drag.We were able to rent a car from Dollar Car Rental across the street for a fantastic price on-line. We drove out to the Dole Plantation and the Punchbowl on our time schedule instead of being on a tour. Bring your GPS with you! The price for valet parking at the hotel is $25 per day.A nice plus was having cold water with fruit slices at the entrance- especially for those of us not used to the heat.\
user_name:
Merry Gayle M
Taylors, South Carolina

review_body: Great 1 Bedroom, 1 Bath. Fully stocked; spacious and clean. A great place to come "home" to after a long day of sightseeing. Not in a congested part of Kalakaua Avenue so getting there and leaving by car is not too hard. Staff is very friendly and professional. Valet parking is $25 per night; seems pretty average for Honolulu. Full-sized refrigerator; if you keep it well stocked from Foodland a couple of streets over (ask for directions) you can save $$. When staying in Honolulu, we would choose to go there again.
user_name:
James H
Currimao, Ilocos Norte, Philippines

review_body: Great Hotel, wonderful location. If you can spring for an ocean view 1 bedroom suite with kitchen you will be very happy. The ocena view rooms are a bit quieter, away from the main road. You overlook Fort Derussy park, which is all that stands between you and the beach. Rooms 1106, 1206, 1406, 1506 and 1606 are presumably similar rooms (1 bedroom suite with kitchen) Two balconies, one overlooking the pool, the other looking to the ocean.Overall the hotel is charming and the staff friendly. Clean, safe and comfortable. Bed was wonderfully comfortable as well. A great place to stay. I could imagine the lower floors facing the mountains would be quite noisy, especially if you had the balcony doors open.

This is a great hotel, the best part was that our flight was late in the evening and we had to check out in the morning. They kept our luggage in the storage room while we wnet for a stroll. We could also use their pool area or go to the beach, come back and use their facilities to freshen up before our flight. Everything is in the vicinity, there are over a million ABC stores and food pantry is prolly only a 10 minute walk. Lots of food options and the bus stops are everywhere, incase you did not want to rent a car and pay high parking rates. The bus is really convinient and it will tell you the sightseeing spots at every stopover. $2.5 per person per ride. Love the hotel, would definitely be back ...

We stayed here in a double room with an ocean view. The "partial ocean view" had a very brief view of the water but it was very nice nonetheless. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff helpful. The pool was also very nice. We spent a lot of time there. We also enjoyed the restaurant attached for brunch - they had an excellent happy hour. This hotel is located very close to waikiki beach and the lagoon. We really enjoyed the location.
user_name:
Fleming W
New York City, New York

review_body: This was perfect for what we needed. We thought the staff was exceptional, the concierge Matt was helpful (always willing to draw out a map) and housekeeping amazing (that's where the real work is). Our room was clean all the time. Everything looked new (just like in the pictures you see) and the beds were very comfortable. The shampoo, conditioner and lotion smelled so good. It was a short distance from all the action but after a while we started to enjoy the walk. We loved Fort DeRussy beach the most (spent a lot of time there living it up), it was a pleasant five minute walk through a beautiful park and we actually quit going to the busy Waikiki beach section after we started going to this beach basically because it was so close. We did get the hotel room that was right over the busy gas station and the first night there we thought it was so loud. After that, it didn't really bother us and we enjoyed the people watching aspect of it after a long day. We never did try the room service, spa, pool or the gym because we just walked over to the beach or left for the most part. I'd definitely stay here again and I've been recommending it to everyone back home. It's simple and clean but also good quality. No resort fees which is great (we did not have a car to park, there is a fee for that). I don't have one bad thing to say about this place as we were 100% happy with our experience here. Checking in and checking out was a breeze.

I loved this hotel. It was a few steps from Waikiki and shopping and a few blocks from the beach. The room had plenty of room and easy access to WiFi. There was a nice balcony to view the city. The clerks were very helpful and courteous. And there was easy parking with all night attendents. This is my fourth stay at this hotel and the great service is always the same high value.

We began our first Hawaiian vacation at this hotel. I chose it because of the price, good reviews and location. We were only in Waikiki for 2 nights before moving up to the North Shore for the remainder of our stay. We live in a large urban area and like to get away from the crowds on vacation. So while we wanted to experience Waikiki we didn't want to be in the middle of all that chaos. The Luana was a good choice. I booked our room - a partial ocean view- through American Express when it was on sale. The day before we flew out I called and requested to be as high as possible while still with an ocean view. Upon arrival they gave us a small upgrade to a kitchenette, partial ocean view - #914. The room was nice, but not especially large. Probably about 250 -300 sq ft. It had a 2 burner stove top, microwave/convection oven, small refrigerator/freezer and a sink. There were also a couple of plates, glassware, mugs, and silverware - along with a 2 cup coffee pot. There was a Queen bed and a small futon type sofa, round table and tv. The bathroom was small, but did supply a hair dryer. We had a small step-out balcony with 2 chairs and a small round table. We had a nice view of Waikiki, Fort DeRussey Park, the ocean and a roof down below. :)It was fine with us and we loved not having a high rise building next to us! We had a pleasant stroll through the park one morning and the beach down at that end is great - very wide, things to eat/drink are available along with chairs and umbrellas. The center of Waikiki is only 10 minutes or less away and gave us a chance to burn off some of those calories we ate! We had a great time and felt very safe the entire time regardless of the time of night or day.On Friday night we were able to see from our balcony the fireworks the Hilton Hawaiian Village sets off at dark - about 7:45 pm. Another great feature because we were high up, was to hear the fireworks echoing off the skyscrapers in the area. Very cool!The staff at the Luana were very friendly and courteous. Our car was available within minutes of asking for it. And I loved the flavored fruit water that was available in the lobby when we returned from our walks. We never had any problems with noise. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Our family ( 2 adults 2 teens) stayed here in mid-April for 8 nights and would recommend this hotel to everyone. The staff were very helpful and friendly no matter what time of the day, the housemaids did a great job and our room was always spotless. We had a park view room so very little road noise and loved how central to everything we were. Would have liked somewhere to hang our swimwear to dry though. Will stay here again if we were to return to Hawaii. Mahalo.

My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for six nights in April 2013. We disembarked our cruise in the morning and were able to check in immediately upon arrival which was a bonus. Our room was large overlooking the park, whilst not having an ocean view, didn't matter because we didn't spend much time in the room preferring to take in the sights of Wakaai.The staff were friendly and very helpful, especially the guys out the front, the concierge was very informative when it came to booking tours.The cafe at the front door served a lovely breakfast, with friendly staff.Free WiFi was a pleasant surprise after being charged on the cruise.I would have no hesitation staying in this Hotel again,and recommending it to my friends.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in late April/early May.We arrived very early and were able to check in immediately which was a great bonus.We had a very large studio with kitchenette. The view was of the park, main road and partial ocean view.The hotel and room is older but very functional and clean.We had a 2 burner hot plate, sink, fridge, microwave and plenty of dishes and utensils. It was easy to make breakfasts and some other meals. It saves a lot of money in this expensive city.The room also has a large bed, table with 2 chairs, couch, bedside tables, wardrobe, lots of drawers and plenty of bench space. There is a flat screen TV.The bathroom has lots of bench space as well as a shower over the bath. Having a bath tub was a real and much appreciated bonus.There was a bit of noise in the room when the door to the balcony was open but it was minimal. I am sure it would be much noisier in the centre of Waikiki. Bring ear plugs if you are very noise sensitive, although my husband didn't use his.There is a laundry which I used several times. I used it in the morning and never had to wait for a machine as there are several.There is also a small gym with most of the basic equipment.The pool looked inviting and appeared to be well used.Free wifi is available in the room and it worked extremely well.All the staff we encountered were friendly and polite.Finally - the location.
