This hotel is in a brilliant position. Just out of the mad hustle and bustle of Waikiki but close enough to walk to most things you would need. The centre of Waikiki was a very pleasant 10 minute walk, Ala Moana was about 25 minutes in the other direction. We also walked to the Aquarium and Zoo.This hotel ticks all the boxes, is great value and we would definitely stay there again.

We stayed here for 2 night after flying in from the east coast. Check in was easy, and our room was spacious with a kitchenette and a decent sized lanai with a partial view of the ocean in the distance. We were overlooking the park, but were in a room close to the main road, so there was considerable road noise. We were able to sleep through it pretty well, though. Waikiki beach is a short walk. There is a cafe that serves breakfast right outside of the front lobby which opens at 6:30 despite the sign on the door which says they open at 7.

This is my second stay at The Outrigger Luana in six months and I now consider it to be my hale (home) in Waikiki. First let me state that I consider the "Outrigger" brand to be the best in Hawai'i. Every Outrigger, I have stayed at, has exemplified Hawaiian sense of place and aloha spirit. The Luana is a boutique cond/hotel located about five minutes from what I consider to be the best beach along the Waikiki strip To get to the beach you simply walk through beautiful Fort DuRusy park to beach access between the Outrigger Reef and the Waikiki Shore hotels. The beach itself is wider and less crowded then the iconic section that fronts the Moana andRoyal Hawaiian, There are concession stands that rent every conceivable kind of water equipment; surf and paddle boards, buggie boards, kayaks, and paddle wheelers. The waves break far out so this spot lends itself to swimming. But what about the hotel itself? The standard rooms are about 300 sq feet, not including their generous balconies. Renovated about 2004, the furniture is beginning to show its age, but the style is Tropical Retro and the weathered appearance just ads to the vibe. Each single has either a small kitchen or kitchenette with microwave. There is flat screen televion and Internet access In every room. The rooms themselves are immaculately clean and the mattresses are very comfortable with douvet style bedding. At the Luana it's all about room location. The best rooms are on the Diamond Head side closest to the park. These rooms afford excellent views of the park and ocean and rival those of the much more expensive Trump Towers. the pool is small but maintained at a comfortable temperature. it looks out over the green belt and I have never had to wait for a deck lounge. For me, the best part of the Luana experience is the staff. They couldn't be nicer or more helpful. This current stay I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite and I never want to leave. Yes you can spend a lot more money to be right on the beach but you won't be treated any better for any price. The Luana is adjacent to Beach Walk and luxury row. it is located on the less crowded West end of Waikiki. Mahalo Luana for making my stays with you so pleasant. it goes without saying that I will be returning again on my next.visit.

We travelled to Hawaii for a 5 night stay. The Luana is a small hotel & it was a quiet & relaxing stay. Easy walking distance for nearby shops & to catch buses for tours of the island. The Concergie Stacey was excellent & helpful, offering guidance & advice on shows to attend, like the luau & the Big Island by plane. Breakfast was tasty & staff was polite & very helpful. We used the laundry on the 1st floor to catch up on washing. It had a kitchenette & we asked for a kettle for tea making. Close to the beach & other hotels for restaurants. Big room with comfortable beds. We would definitely stay there again. We reserved room before leaving Oz & it was an agreed price & that is what we paid in the end, with one night free. Good value for money.

This hotel was right on Luxury Row. Great views of the city and with a kitchenette it was perfect to spend several days in prior to our cruise. Our check-in did not go smoothly at all! It was almost as if they did not want to give us the early-bird special that was booked weeks in advance. I had confirmation numbers and a print out and tried to show it to front desk personnel but they did not even look at it, saying that the reservation was booked under something else. It eventually got straightened out but after traveling for more than 12 hours it was annoying. Valet parking is $25 a day in and out all day. That was OK – a little over priced but at least there was parking.The restaurant in the hotel was very nice and the food was good and for Hawaii was reasonably priced. The staff there was very nice and so was the valet parking staff. I could only get internet very early in morning after that it was VERY slow and frustrating. That included my phone and laptop. The Concierge is EXTREMELY helpful and Stacey really helped us out one day. She made phone calls and arrangements for us and took a lot of stress and pressure off of us. She was the best! Loved the water with fresh fruit in it in the lobby. So refreshing after walking up and down Kalakaua Ave. The room was definitely spacious and the beds were comfy. The kitchenette was an added plus and was stocked with dishes and other items we needed. It’s a small frig but that was all we needed. The bathroom was a nice size and updated.One of the days we were there our room ended up not being cleaned. We had been gone all day and came back around 3pm to relax before going to dinner – room was the way we left it that morning, thank goodness we are very neat. We called down to get some fresh towels which they brought up right away and asked if we wanted our room cleaned right then?! We found out that they clean rooms late or so we were told. I wasn’t sure what to make of that, it didn’t happen again.Overall I would stay there again if I am ever in Hawaii again.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for five days in a one bedroom condo. The condo was a fine room with a king size bed, a nice side living room and kitchen that looked out over the Pacific Ocean. Make sure you get a room on the higher floors. We had made this request in our reservation. When we arrived, they did place us on a lower floor but readily adjusted to our request. It was obvious that they were customer centered. Those have the best visibility of the ocean. We were delighted with the hotel, its proximity to downtown Waikiki and the beach.

We spent 8 days at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki. It was wonderful,the hotel was center to everything we wanted to see. The staff was outstanding even the maid service. We saved money,the beds were comfortable and the rooms were spacious and clean. We would return tothis location again.
user_name:
Bigd S
SeaTac, Washington, United States

review_body: I had initially wanted to stay at the Outrigger Reef due to its cultural program and nightly live entertainment at their poolside restaurant, but I am VERY glad I went with the Luana because we saved a lot of money and we were still close to everything we needed.We booked through www.outrigger.com about 2 months before we left for Hawaii and they were offering a number of promotions for discounted room rates. $139 a nigh for a park and ocean view room? I'll take it. We arrived at the hotel at about 4pm and we were checked in right away. It was a really smooth process. The staff members were very welcoming, everyone from the bellman, to the valet attendant, to the front desk, to the concierge. Every time we came back to the hotel we were greeted at the entrance and that was a nice touch. The room itself was a standard room with a mini fridge and a sort of kitchen counter area with a sink and dishes. I was actually surprised at how spacious the room was. The room even had a pull-out couch. So for the price we paid, we were very happy. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job of ensuring that the room was always tidy pretty much right after we left for the day (I know this because we went for breakfast once, came back, and the room was immaculate).The hotel is located on Kalakaua Ave. which is pretty much the main strip near Waikiki beach. It is literally a 10-minute walk from everything you need. There were tons of restaurants, shops, convenience stores...so many things to see and do. The International Marketplace was also really close, which was great. One thing that I liked a lot about the location of the hotel was the fact that it wasn't too far into the strip because we ended up walking to the Ala Moana centre area, which was in the opposite direction of the beach, but the distance was just right. It is also located near the Bus stops (GREAT way to get around the island!).I did want to compliment the service of the concierge and the bellmen at this hotel. I used to work at a very large hotel in downtown Toronto, so I do look out for the quality of these two services whenever I happen to travel. Matthew at the concierge desk was awesome. We booked a trip to the Polynesian Cultural Center with him and he got us some amazing seats at their evening show. He also gave us some good advice when it came to other excursions that we saw in the coupon books that you find everywhere. Another girl who was working with him suggested one of the best hole-in-the-wall restaurants in the area for real Italian pizza (V-lounge near Ala Moana) so that made us happy as well. Matthew referred us to the bellmen when we needed transportation to the airport because they were able to get us a better deal on shuttle prices, which was great because we had to make a few trips to the airport (inter-island day trips). One of the bellmen, I think his name was Devin, arranged a shuttle for us which arrived promptly at the scheduled time. He made some small talk with us while we were waiting and made us feel right at home. A+ for the staff here!The Outrigger Luana Waikiki is probably the median in terms of pricing when it comes to the Outrigger hotels in Waikiki, but it was perfect for us. Great quality and great service, that's what matters.

I booked this hotel mostly for its distance to the convention center (just a 10 mt walk). There are closer hotels but I was very glad to have picked this one. The staff couldn't have been nicer, my room was roomy (an efficiency room), the wifi worked great, the Protea cafe was perfect for eating in or taking away. And really good water pressure in the shower which is why it gets a top rating!!!!
user_name:
TessM
New York City, New York

review_body: Well built older hotel - everything worked well in the room and water pressure was good in shower/bathtub. Nice bath amenities for those of you who need to pack lite and not bring your own. Relatively quiet within the building and other than some hallway sounds the walls were not paper thin and didn't here much noise from other tenants. THE ONLY MINUS (and it can be a big one) is the street noise being located on busy Kalakaua Avenue. We were on the eleventh story and still heard it quite well (particularly on weekend) however the ac/fan is loud enough to drown out the noise (which can be another minus if you don't like a/c noise - we just had it on fan which was quieter but did the trick - I got used to the fan sound after second night!) SO TIP WHEN BOOKING ROOM: Book at least a partial ocean view which is higher off of ground and request a room on the park side as opposed to the street side if possible and you'll get much less street noise.Not fancy but very nice hotel for a moderate budget. Conviently located next to everything you need for a comfy stay including a Thrifty/Dollar car rental right down street and convenience stores across street (we liked "Whalers" ). Nice little gift shop in lobby and Protea cafe was very good. Hotel staff very proffessional and friendly. LOVED THE FRUIT FLAVORED WATER they have in lobby - very nice touch and popular! They put all kinds of fresh fruit and even cucumbers in the water cooler and it makes for a delicious, refreshing drink! Booked a partial ocean view hotel room for two and was just what we needed - had a comfortable queen bed with a pull out sofa/sitting area as well. Room was spacious and came with an in-roomsafe and closet, big tv and table area, kitchen sink and counter, cabinets and utensils, coffee,sugar,cream packets (first packet of coffee free - one dollar per packet after that.) Could have used a microwave but unless you book a room with a kitchenette you won't get one. Nice balcony area with chairs and small table. Adjacent to Fort DeRussy park which is a nice little place and you have nice views of it from hotel. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay at Luana and I would definitely stay again!!

Hotel is located on the street where most of the restaurants and shops are located. To Waikiki beach you have to take a 10 min. walk trough the park. The only complain is the pool, is small and no sunshine in the morning. The Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean.

This hotel was great. It was not right on the beach-but very close-within a few blocks and walking distance- and because of this was a little less expensive and maybe not as "luxurious". They had an awesome mini-kitchen in our room with pretty much everything you would need. The staff was more than helpful and could always answer questions even at 5am. the pool area was nice. the only downfall was that on nice days it could have used a few more chairs but the chairs they did have were very comfortable and they had beach towels available. I was completely impressed with the hotel and I can say we got more than we paid for!

Our family stayed at the Outrigger for 7 nights from the 27th March to the 4th April my wife and I and 2 teenage daughters in 2 rooms on the 6th floor. Checkin / checkout was very quick and easy. We purposely didn't book rooms with kitchens as this was a family holiday and I didn't want my wife doing any cooking at all she deserved a well earned rest from the daily chores, and we all enjoyed eating out in the many different restaurants Waikiki had to offer. We choose this hotel as it was a little distance from the centre of Waikiki without being too far away, the location was perfect. Partial ocean room over looking Fort De Russy Park and the city a great view both day and night. Our only disappointment that there wasn't 2 single beds in the girls room so one had to use the foldout sofa bed. As the hotel has full moving the girls to another room was not possible on arrival however Cassel did manage some days later to offer another room but the girls decided not to move. The hotel was just perfect for us, spotlessly clean rooms, serviced every day, small pool with a great gym, coin operated laundry and a small cafe Protea with friendly staff and an ABC store across the road. The hotel is certainly not the most modern in Waikiki but it certainly has everything you would need for a short or long stay and for our stay it was perfect. Thanks to Cassel and Devon for their friendly professional service. Overall we had a great stay and holiday in Honolulu.

Nice location if you are going to stay in Waikiki beach and restaurants are all a short walk away. It is a bit dated and could have used a bit more cleaning. The staff were great really could not have been more helpful with any request. We were on a lower floor and the street noise was always there no matter what the time. Rooms were large and fairly well equipped.

We stayed here for 7 days and hemmed and hawed about it before hand. Couldn't decide if having extra space and more importantly a full kitchen was worth giving up a beachfront hotel. Well, we were right to keep this hotel! The condo, a one bedroom ocean view was clean, with a great full kitchen and dishwasher, two lanais, and comfy beds. The beach on the other side of Ft DeRussy which the hotel is basically in, is 5 minutes of walking- downtown Waikiki beach is a good 15 minute walk past posh shops and plenty of restaurants and ABC stores. We got in really late on arrival day and hit the ABC store for milk and things for the AM. I loved this hotel, having the space with two kids and fixing breakfast and lunch was so great! We will stay here again. Only caveat, the pool is very small, and only some units have laundry- there's an old laundry room in serious need of updating...

A good find: the rooms are updated and clean, staff is friendly, location is good. The Outrigger Luana Waikiki is not on the beach, so you do not pay the "on the beach" prices that other hotels in the area command. The hotel is within walking distance to all the beaches/shops/restaurants of Waikiki.

Great location. Many resturants nearby, including PF Changs with reduced price food menu 11A to 5P. Friendly staff. Decent pool. Very good workout room. Main complaint : Noise. On busy road, direct route for every fire truck or emergancy vehicle. It doesn't matter much if you leave sliding glass door open or closed, because the glass door has thin single pane glass. If you want a quiet place to stay, I would try and get a block or two away from Kalakaua Ave.

Great price for the location, cleanliness and service. Rooms were clean al biet a little dated. Staff were AMAZING. Always friendly and willing to help. We booked all out tours through the concierge and were happy with the companies recommended.Located on the better side of town, 5-10 minute walk to the beach and main strip. 2 minute walk to the bus stop and a 20 minute walk Ala Moana shopping centre. Generally one of the first to be picked up and first to be droped off on tours. Rooms can be a little noisy if the balcony door is left open and there are only two computers in the lobby, so there can be a bit of a cue for their use.

We chose this hotel for its location to both the beach and walking distance to shops and the mall. There were three adults in the studio suite with kitchenette with micro/convection oven, two burner ceramic cooktop, granite counters, mini fridge and fully equipped. Although we didn't cook the fridge and microwave were a bonus for breakfast foods. We were on the 14th floor with a balcony overlooking Fort Deroussy park and a partial ocean view. It was lovely for a morning coffee. Yes it was a little noisy with traffic if the door was open but quiet at night. The staff are AMAZING, some of the best I have ever met, so friendly! The hotel has a small fitness room on the 1st floor, a wonderful HEATED pool with loungers and an area to BBQ if you want to cook. The Protea restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch, it small only a few tables but the breakfasts are yummy. We would definitely stay at the Luana again.

Reserved 3 month in advance and it was definately a good deal. Place : Only 5 mn walk to the lively central road. 3mn to Eggs'n Things. 30sc to Bus Stop.Room : Simple, clean, and wood furnitures with pinapple carving added a charm. Spacious shower room with folding cuchon chair ( accessible for wheelchair users) was very comfortable. No bathtub. View : Great view thanks to the park next to this hotel. Beyond the green with few people, you see half ocean view and the other half of hotels by the sea. Loved reading books at this balcony.Accommodations : Cozy size pool is quiet and comfortable for sunbathing. Gym. Small cafe for the Illy coffee and pastry.If you want to spend money more on activity and foods, this is just what you need for comfortable stay in Waikiki, isn't it?

First saw the hotel while visiting family who were guests at the hotel and were impressed by the quality of the rooms for the price. Early in March we stayed at the hotel while on Oahu for business. The staff are friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. I had read reviews commenting about no WiFi in the room so brought my own wireless router for use during the stay. Much to my surprise I didn't need it - the room had free WiFi. Parking charges are comparable to other hotels in Waikiki ($25 I think) so we did not use that particular service. Being retired military we get discounted parking at the Hale Koa Hotel where we parked our car. This hotel is very close to that parking lot so was perfect for our needs. Next time we have to overnight on Oahu this will be our choice.

We were very happy with our choice to stay at this Outrigger Hotel for an 8 night stay. We wanted someplace near the beach and central to downtown. Our room faced the City Park side on the 14th floor. We enjoyed sitting out on the deck in the early morning and late afternoon watching the traffic coming onto Kalakaua Ave into the city. (It's amazing how much traffic pours into the city on a daily basis! A little noise - but not unbearable.) It was a pleasant 8 minute walk to the beach. The studio room was well suited with a 1/4 sized refrigerator, a couple coffee mugs, a smattering of flatware and dishes to use with take out or basic no-cook food items. There's also plenty of space to store away your clothing items, shoes,and luggage. We asked for extra pillows and got them without a blink of an eye. Each room had a dish rack and dish soap for our use. Our bed was fairly comfy, too. We did work from our room part of the time, so having internet included with our rental was very handy. There was plenty of room to work at the table near an outlet, on the couch, or even on the deck with a cup of coffee. The front desk staff was nice enough, but not always readily attentive to you when you walk in. Once or twice I waited with another guest for someone to come out to assist us. We parked our car valet the whole week, so the valet staff knew & greeted us daily. We even got suggestions for food places once or twice from them. NOTE: The front desk has beach towels for guest use - towel return on 1st floor near the pool entrance. We would definitely come back another time in the future. Mahalo for the great stay.

We spent three nights at the Outrigger Luana after a 7 day cruise. We upgraded to an ocean view and were given a condo, with a king bedroom, living, and kitchen area. Wonderful space for the price. We were on a corner so we had an ocean view from the living area and a city view from the bedroom. Both opened out to the balcony with 4 chairs and 2 side tables. The staff could not have been nicer. We opted to rent a car, and use the valet parking, and we never waited more than a few minutes to drop off or pick up. It's not a bad walk to the beach through Fort Debussy Park, but if you want to be right "on the beach" this hotel is not for you. For the space, you cannot beat the price! The on site restaurant closed at 2:00 so you have to explore Waikiki for dinner options. We definitely enjoyed our stay!

We enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. Clean and comfortable. Easy location within reach and friendly staff.We booked our activities through the concierge and he gave us tour discounts and a free breakfast buffet provided we attend a sales presentation for two hours. We figured we check it out. What a mistake that was!Whatever you do, don't attend the sales presentation. The sales rep will tell you about investing with Wyndham. We knew it was a scam and told the sales rep that we were not interested and inform her that we don't want to waste anyone's time with this sort of deal and left within 90 mins. Having never heard of the company nor not having the opportunity to research what the investment is about we confidently said 'no' and left it at that.DO NOT BE PRESSURED TO ATTEND THE SALES PITCH. IT'S NOT WORTH YOUR TIME!

Outrigger is in a great location!! It is apparent it was once a luxury hotel but it is a little bit outdated now. It is very clean and the staff is super amazing! Everyone is friendly and We felt very welcomed. We had a problem with our airline so arrived late without our luggage. The hotel clerk John immediately started making recommendations for nearby toiletries and late night food. They next day we left exploring and gave them notice about the arrival of our luggage. It was so nice to return to find the front desk had already took our bags to our room. The location was great.... Right near everything you can want or need. Great food, drinks, shopping, and souvenirs within walking distance. I was pleasantly surprised to find that we were in the heart of luxury shopping and dining. Loved the beautiful parks on both sides. made for great morning walks. Those are great perks for a "budget" hotel. My favorite thing about the hotel was a great balcony. I woke very morning to a beautiful sunrise over the mountain tops. Then a great walk in the park and along the beach walk (along Fort Durresy). It was great start to my day.

Awesome place : perfect location next to derussy park: beautiful walk to the beach through florals in park: small local church in park - outdoor tai chi in park locals very welcoming- hotel safe , clean , and served all needs....it is not a high end hotel but it feels like one - great restraint on site for breakfast and lunch - upgraded our rooms with a huge patio roof lanai it was amazing! Walked to bus stops, tour pick up across street , no need for a car, walk to dinner, will be back!!!!

We had a corner suite on the hotel so we had 2 balconies with 2 great views, the beautiful mountains and a park view with a sneak peek of the ocean. We were close enough to the ocean and shopping to be able to walk. We really enjoyed sitting around the pool and dipping in the pool. We met a lot of nice people whom go to this hotel every winter. All were from Canada. The hotel staff were very helpful, including housekeeping.Next time I would travel in March. February is Hawaii's rainy month. We would return.

This is a great hotel. It's at the start of the strip and next to a park so it's a little quieter which we liked at night. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the heart of the strip. And the beach is a 5 mins walk south of the hotel through the park. The staff were all nice and friendly and we liked the fruity water in the lobby every day. This part of the beach wasn't as crowded as the main part of the beach with all the big hotels and resorts. We liked having a kitchen which helped to save on time looking for something to eat and on food cost which is expensive in Hawaii. Our room had a two burner stove, coffee maker, toaster, microwave oven which also doubled as a convection oven, mini fridge along with the pots, pans, cooking utensils, plates, cutlery etc. The bus stop was right across the street along with an ABC store and a general store. A little further walk about 5-10 mins is the Food Pantry grocery store which is where we bought our meat and stuff to cook our meals. At the front of the Food Pantry store is some food vendors for take away. Right across the street from the hotel is also the Thrifty car rental and next door is a gas station. So, everything is close by and the advantage of being at the start of the strip is that you avoid all the traffic when you head out to see the rest of the island. We would stay here again. Our room was clean and spacious and had a balcony.

We loved our stay there. The room was very cheery and very large. Also included was a kitchenette - no cooking appliances (no store, no microwave) but a mini fridge and sink we're very helpful. However on the last day we found mini ants on the kitchen counter. They may be difficult to keep away as we were on the second floor. Mostly everything is without walk distance and is pretty conveniently located to the beach. Staff was very helpful. However the parking garage is pretty expensive, although it might be the norm in Waikiki. Internet wifi access was good.

This place is very nice and by Hawaii standards relatively inexpensive. The rooms are clean and the area is away from all the hassle of Waikiki. The surrounding area is nice and there are resturants nearby. We were looking for a place for breakfast and discovered the little cafe at the lobby of the hotel. The name of the place is Protea and the food is great. It's small but if you have to wait it is well worth it.  If and when we go back to Honolulu we will stay here for sure.

We weren't sure how this hotel was going to be and were very happy we chose it. We spent ourtime while in Waikiki here and at another hotel which hands down for the money, this was thebetter choice. The room was spacious with a kitchenette which made it comfortable and it wasclose enough to walk to downtown Waikiki, yet far enough away to escape the hustle and bustle.The front desk was extremely pleasant as was the cleaning crew. The valet seemed a bitunprofessional and was not the best representation of the hotel. They hung out in front of theplace, never heard a hello or goodbye from them. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back.

The hotel is on the edge of the main Waikiki hotel strip so is much quieter, especially on the upper floors overlooking Ft DeRussy Park. The room we stayed in was privately owned , but managed by the hotel, and was spacious enough to accommodate a comfortable queen-size bed, a sofa, a small dining table, and a mini-kitchen suitable for preparing breakfast or a cold lunch (i.e. no microwave). We found that not being directly on the beach was an advantage, since we were away from the crowds, and only a 5 minute walk from the relatively quiet beach at the foot of Ft De Russy Park. The hotel staff were welcoming and helpful. We did not have need to use the small hotel restaurant since we made breakfast in the room and sampled some of the first rate restaurants nearby. The rate was very reasonable and since the hotel is on several bus routes, we had no need of a rental car or parking.

We loved this hotel, and will come back again.We stayed with our 2 kids in a 1 bedroom apartment. We stayed on the 16th floor, and had to be careful the kids didn't go on the balcony, but kept the doors locked. We would prob try and get a lower floor next time though. Beautiful views to ocean were a bonus.Room was spacious and clean. Full kitchen handy, although there were only convenience stores nearby to get groceries - no large supermarkets. Modern furniture, and plenty of storage for our 8 day stay. Lots of tv channels, and free Internet.Staff were fantastic and very helpful. There is no room service, and there is only 1 small cafe downstairs open until 2pm. Not licensed. This didn't bother us though, as we could walk 5 mins to main Waikiki area, and there were even shops across the road. Pool area was small but lovely and quiet. BBQ facilities too. Great hotel for families - nice and quiet, but offers all that other Waikiki hotels offer. Excellent value for money. Would definitely stay again!JBPerth, Australia

My wife and I stayed here for 7 days. Our room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We loved our view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beach is really only a five minute walk and you walk through Ft. DeRussy Park. You do not need a car, everything you may want to do is in walking distance. The buses stop right across the street.

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights when we moved to Honolulu - our apartment was being painted and this was a nice chance to add a little vacation to our move. The location is great. It's on the edge of Waikiki so it's not in the heart of the noise, but easy to get to everything - Ala Moana is a short, pleasant walk and the Fort Derussy park area is nice to stroll in. Our room was very nice, large and comfortable. It had a big kitchen area with plates and silver ware; but nothing to cook on - a microwave would have been a nice addition. The water pressure was Awesome, making for a fantastic hot shower at the end of the day. The staff were so helpful, I dropped a camera lens hood off my lanai and they were very kind and helpful letting in in the first floor apartment to retrieve it. Since we were moving we had LOT's Of baggage and the staff could not have been more helpful getting it in and out of our cabs. We'd certainly stay here again and warmly recommend to family and friends.

Good location to shopping & beach. 10-15 minute walk through park to the beach. Reasonable rates. Ask for a room that overlooks Fort DeRussy Park. Accomodating & friendly staff & concierge. Pool area & fitness center on the small side but very adequate.

My family and I have just returned from a week at this hotel. We really enjoyed it and would happily stay here again in the future.We booked a one bedroom deluxe ocean view room with a full kitchen. The kitchen was great, very well appointed with an enormous fridge, microwave, stove and oven and dishwasher. There was enough crockery and cutlery and cooking implements. We were able to cook full dinners here for us and the kids.The living room had a fold out couch which the kids slept in while we had the king sized bed in the bedroom (which was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in!). The living room had a small balcony with a view over Fort De Russy park and the bedroom had the same size balcony with street views. Each balcony was big enough for 2 chairs and a small table. There was only 1 bathroom which was off the bedroom, which meant the kids had to come into the bedroom overnight to use it. Each room had it's own TV which was great for the kids first thing in the morning.Being set back from the beach we had water views between the beach front hotels, but not sand views. The view was lovely though with the park land in front of us. We also had a ringside view of the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton.While this hotel is not in the main block, it is a very good location, a short walk from the beach, a short walk (3 blocks) from the convention centre (I had a conference to attend) and a nice walk around the park to the Hilton Hawaiian Village if you want to take advantage of those facilities (the lagoon is brilliant for the kids.) It is better located for the Waikiki shops, International Market Place than the Hilton, etc. It is a short bus ride or about 15-20 mins walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. It is surrounded by restaurants, so if you want to eat out it's easy to find something.The hotel looks like it was last decorated when the Brady Bunch were here but it is clean and the staff are wonderful, nothing is too much trouble (we had an air conditioner problem and within 20 mins maintainence was there to fix it;) , they remembered our names when we walked through the lobby. The kids received a backpack activity pack on arrival. This hotel is much smaller than the main ones, but this means that it feels like you are a person and not a number. The lobby has a small shop but it has irregular opening hours. There is a small cafe attached to it, but it is tiny and only open for breakfast and lunch (great food). It has a spa, a nice pool with banana lounges, and an activities desk.Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and would choose to stay here anytime in the future happily.

My best friend, cousins and I stayed at this hotel while I was in town visiting family. My grandfather had past away and after the services we just needed to get away and relax on my last day in Hawaii. The view was ok but still great for being in Hawaii. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are beautiful. My best friend and I needed to weight our luggage because we did some major shopping...lol and the hotel staff was very helpful in taking our luggage and weighing it for us and taking it down to our vehicle and loaded it for us. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

We only stayed here for 2 nights, but thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. We were upgraded to a room with a full kitchenette and had a very good view from our 10th floor balcony. The fitness centre and pool were well kept and enjoyable. The service was consistently good - they let us store our luggage before our room was ready (we arrived in the morning) and they stored our bags for us after we checked out since our flight wasn't scheduled until the late evening. We also were welcome to use the pool, deck, and shower facilities until we got picked up for our return flight. The small restaurant is only open until 2 pm., but it served delicious food and had great service. Barbecues were available for guest use.

We did a timeshare exchange and at first we were disappointed that the Luana was not directly on the beach. But the disappointment faded as soon as we arrived. The Luana is just a short 5 to 8 minutes to one of the most beautiful stretches of beach in Waikiki and only one block from great shopping and restaurants. Our one bedroom suite was on the 16th floor on the corner. We had a great view of the ocean. Diamond Head, and the city. We were able to watch the fireworks from another hotel right from our balcony. The staff were absolutely wonderful.. We will certainly return to the Outrigger Luana.

My wife and I stay at the Outrigger Luana Because of location and price. Our trips to Hawaii go well into double digits. We have been traveling to Hawaii since 1980. Stayed elsewhere but find that being able to eat in makes the stay nicer. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Mr Cassel Smiling all the time. We will be returning next year(lord willing) with our three grandchildren. Again staying at the Outrigger Luana.

The entire hotel area was very clean. Nice (but small) pool area with wooden lounges. Lobby is very small - but very neat and clean. We had a room with a kitchenette and I read other reviews that said their kitchenette had a sink, stove-top, microwave, refrig, dishes, pans, etc. Someone must have stolen ours because we had NO stove-top, NO microwave but did have a refrig, coffee maker, dishes and pans. I paid for a view of the city & park. The park is Ft. DeRussey and the city was surrounding high-rise condos & other hotels. Plus below us was a very busy gas station and since we were on the 5th floor - - it was very visible of cars going and coming all night long. If you are near the front - - it is extremely noisy with all of traffic on Kalakaui & Kuhio Streets. It seemed that 'ALL' emergency vehicles went by the hotel with their sirens blasting the entire distance of Waikiki. The hotel is at the edge of Waikiki and a block away from very high-end very-expensive shops such as Gucci, Coach, etc. I found it 'NOT' to be within easy walking distance to anything except an ABC store of which there is one in every block of Waikiki. The person who checked us in made a mistake in our check-out date when he punched in our 'room-keys' and so we were locked-out after two days and so we had to go to the front desk and have our keys re-keyed.

We booked a City/Park Hotel Room, which had no mention of any kitchen facilities but came with a sink, small fridge, dishes, dish drying rack, coffee maker, and utensils. We were pleasantly surprised! Add in our AAA discount, and our vacation was off to a good start!The staff was super friendly and made us feel welcome, and the hotel is very conveniently located. Everything was just a few blocks away, so that was definitely a plus.Valet is $25 per day, but alas, that's pretty much the going rate in Waikiki.The only downside is that the hotel is located at an awkward intersection, and we had to drive into a crosswalk to get on the road. Some confusion, hilarity and honking ensued.

My wife and two children(12 and 16) spent 10 days at the Outrigger Luana over the Christmas holidays. We were very pleased on checking in to be upgraded to a two-bedroom unit, room 718. While it 'only' had a city view, the size and convenience more than made up for not having the teeny view of the ocean between the Trump tower and Hilton tower. Two spacious bedrooms, washer/dryer, full kitchen, two lanais and a huge open area that can't even be called a lanai made this a perfect long-duration stay. I've heard some complaints from previous travellers here about street noise - we live in a rural area and are used to sleeping in complete silence, but city noise doesn't bother us - it's part of the whole experience - if you want to escape it, stay high up on a beachfront condo - that's the only way you will. We loved the short walk through Fort DeRussy park to the widest part of the beach - barely 10 min - towels from the hotel if we needed, and yes, the fruit water in the lobby - my oldest son would fill up his water bottle with it before setting out each day. If you are a family/couple who has travelled a lot and are 'relaxed' travellers, this is the perfect place. The staff are all friendly and accommodating, rooms were always clean and comfortable, and if you're every grumpy about something, step outside - it's Hawai'i! Yes, valet parking is $25 a day, but that's standard everywhere in Honolulu, and given the cheap price of rentals if you book ahead, it balances out compared to other cities. Every evening we enjoyed the walk down Kalakaua Ave., and the Outrigger Luana is just the right distance away from the truly busy part of this great strip. Never ate in the restaurant as we ate breakfast in the room and usually would eat a late lunch/early dinner out, but it looked more than fine. If we are lucky enough to return or know friends who are going to Oahu, we would definitely recommend the Outrigger Luana.

My friends and I just returned last Thursday. Had a absolutely fabulous stay at the Outrigger Luana. Everyone remembered your name and was extremely friendly. Thanks Rueben!- the walk to the beach and to the Hawaiian Village Hilton was just a short journey. It was worth it for the price the Outrigger charged.as opposed to the Hilton. My friends stayed at the Hilton and their room did not have the amenities we had. I recommend the room with the Kitchenette. Use your AAA card and you can get a nice discount. Aloha! and Mahala!

We have now stayed at three different Outrigger hotels and condominiums, and once again, found that the Outrigger Luana Waikiki is just as lovely as the others. Each Outrigger is different, yet all three have the same lovely and calm atmosphere. Everything is nicely decorated and is kept clean and is very inviting. We would definitely go back to all three.  Location: The Outrigger Luana’s location is perfect. It is just a few walking blocks from Waikiki Beach, the Beach Walk with all its lovely shops and restaurants, the US Post Office, and is on the main street, Kalakaua Avenue. There are shops and restaurants right outside the Luana. Local buses run frequently on this street and you can take them everywhere, including to such places as the Bishop Museum and Iolani Palace. Yet, it is not a noisy street. There is a small park across the street, and of course, it is next to the beautiful Fort DeRussy Park. Staff: As you arrive, you are greeted and assisted by Luana staff, who is always on duty outside. Each time we entered or departed from the building, we were always cheerfully greeted and welcomed back. As you walk up the stairs from the street entrance, there is a lovely restaurant open 7:00 am – 2:00 pm. Then you walk into a charming lobby with just one small, yet cute shop, with a helpful shop keeper. The entire staff did its very best to make the stay a extremely pleasant stay. Room: We chose a room with a city view and it was perfect. Located on the first floor, the room is nicely decorated, and it had more than ample storage. As we walked into the room, the bathroom was on the right. On the left was a kitchen area with a sink and small refrigerator with a long counter top with cabinets above and several large drawers below. In addition, there was closet with cabinet space below, a lovely TV, a nice-sized desk, coffee table, couch and a king-size bed. Outside the room was a large, closed off concrete area with a view of the night city lights that is just breathtaking. You can, of course, close the curtains. The floors above have balconies. Facilities: Located on the first floor, we were near the laundry room, which was very clean and had several washers and dryers. The gym provided excellent equipment with floor to wall windows and overlooked the loveliest pool. Before you leave, go to the top floor and you get a wonderful view of Waikiki. Aloha!

Stayed the week before New Years day. Nice, spacious, clean room with kitchen (sink, stovetop, microwave, refrigerator, dishes, utensils, pots and pans). Beds were comfy, and noise from other rooms and hallway was minimal. Too much street noise to have balcony door open at night even on 16th, top floor. Arrived at 9 am (flight in from Sydney; booked with note of early arrival); staff got us into a room by 11 am. Staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel is a hike from the beach and shopping, but the city bus ($1.50 per ride) stops nearby. Paid $175 (including taxes and fees) for 3 persons per night.

We stayed here for ten days in a partial ocean view room faced the park on the 14th floor. The location is very convenient to go wherever you want in Waikiki and a short walk to the beach.The room was basic and a little small, with a kitchenette well stocked. We'd stay here again.

Stayed here days before my wedding. Amazing bellhop and concierge. Room was clean a little small but absolutely awesome! Even had dock station for iPhone. Would stay here again. Short walk to beach :))

We stayed here for the Honolulu Marathon. A great location to get to everywhere we needed to be. Friendly and helpful staff and very nice rooms. Loved being so close to Fort Derussy to watch people and birds. Would definitely come back!
user_name:
Amie D
Boulder, Colorado, United States

review_body: I booked my kitchenette suite on-line for $119 which is a good price for Waikiki. The kitchen is well-equipped except for a coffee grinder and when I phone housekeeping, they said they didn't have one. The cafe offered to grind my coffee beans for me at no charge. Considering the size of the Outrigger chain, they should have at least one coffee bean grinder on hand. Hawaiian coffee is highly advertised.The room was very large and comfortable. I was on the 15th floor and despite being so high, the noise from Kalakaua was enough to disrupt my sleep. Since the regular rooms have a fridge and sink, I wouldn't get a kitchenette next time but would put the money towards a room facing the park. When I went to the pool, all the towels were gone and there was no way I could see to get more. Perhaps there was a phone to housekeeping but I didn't see it. There is a barbecue and some bar tables at one side of the pool area overlooking Fort Derussy Park. You could watch the sunset from there.The hotel is at the Honolulu end of Waikiki. I walked to the Ala Moana shopping center and there are bus stops very near the hotel. If you walk the other way, it is not far to all the Waikik restaurants and stores. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly.

Spent three nights here in a studio unit with a kitchenette. It was great to be able to make breakfast in our room. We had a 'partial ocean view' on the sunny side of the building. Couldn't spend much time on the lanai because of the bright sunlight. This place is across a large park from the heart of Waikiki so you're not bombarded by the tourists, but you are close enough to go there when you want to. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The concierge was very helpful in planning a tour of Pearl Harbor.

My mom and I booked our weeklong trip 8 months in advance. We got there and they told us that they were overbooked and were gonna send us to a different hotel with an upgrade. They paid for the cab and sent us to the ghetto, there was a homeless man sleeping at the door of the new hotel. I was not happy, alongside our room was not even ready. Two hours later we made it back to the Luana, they upgraded us from a studio to a one bedroom partial ocean for the trouble. That was nice. The room was very nice and the beds super comfy, I slept on the pull out sofa bed and surprisingly it was comfy as well. They also have free wifi in the rooms and a free inroom safe that ended up being used more than I thought. The rooms are very spacious and provided a lot of room. Complaints: I am under 5ft tall and the shower head hit me in the chest, it was so short and not adjustable. They give you one coffee bag per day which is enough for one cup of coffee and they charge you for extra. Also, our sliding glass door to the lanai was extremely hard to open and didnt lock.All in all, I would probably stay here again, it is very conveniently located, you are in the middle of waikiki so you can walk easily to the mall, beach, fort derussy, pink trolley, etc. Also, they have the most delicious water in the lobby all day long with fresh fruits inside and they have a snack around 2pm. P.S. they set up travel for us (by our request) to the outlet mall, dont ever go there it is a waste of time and money, there is only a handful of stores.

We stated here in our first trip to Hawaii with a view of running the Honolulu Marathon. The hotel rooms are bested aimed at travellers seeking independence as you get a kitchenette rather than a fully serviced hotel. This was perfect for us. The hotel is situated in Waikiki and near Ala Moana, with full restaurants and shops nearby. I'd stay here again.

This was just your basic hotel room, with a kitchenette- which is actually somewhat difficult to find in Honolulu without spending a fortune. It was clean, and the kitchenette does save some money on food, though it's hard to store/cook a real meal with just a 2 burner stovetop and a mini-fridge. Still, I thought the value was good for the location and the level of hotel. Staff was extremely friendly, and checking in and out were a breeze. They put a very small hold on my card for incidentals, much less than I was expecting (it was either $20 or $25). Beds were very comfortable. Partial Ocean View room gave a very nice view of the ocean and the park. And the cafe downstairs had good coffee and breakfast, at prices that are about average for the area. I would stay here again.

I have stayed here three times over the last couple of years and absolutely love it. Close to both Waikiki and Ala Moana, and a lovely short walk through Fort Derussy Park to beach. The staff are friendly and helpful. Can't imagine I would stay in any other hotel in Waikiki.

My wife and I spent a week during Thanksgiving week. There is a tone or mood that every hotel creates not just by its ambiance but also by its interaction with guests. This place has got it right! You feel welcomed and appreciated. Staff are gracious, friendly and helpful. It's a small hotel and we enjoyed the quieter atmosphere. We had a corner suite, ocean view, with full kitchen on an upper floor. It was great. Two balconies, well equipped kitchen, living area, good sized bedroom, bath and a large closet with safe. Clean, comfortable, simple and dignified. Loved the location. You overlook Fort de Russy park. A very short walk to the beach and all the shops in Waikiki. Easy access to public transport. We walked to the Ala Moana Shopping Center in under 20 min. The concierge staff were very helpful in helping us sort out our tours and planning our week. The pool was a refreshing option after a busy day touring. There is a bar b q area where you can grill a steak etc , all well organized. Very happy holiday here.

After extensive research on Trip Advisor, I chose this hotel for my husband and me, and couldn't be happier. As we had a 12 day stay, and also having had a night in a Honolulu airport hotel and 7 nights on Maui, we needed an economical place to stay, and this fitted the bill admirably.We chose a studio apartment so we could self cater and to cut costs, a city view room. We received a seniors' rate (50+), so were extremely happy with the cost. The view was not so good (the garage), but luckily we were on Floor 10, so had more of an outlook. The lanai was quite small, so we didn't use it. We had enough space in the room and more than enough equipment to self cater. We did discover that the extractor fan needed to be used even when making toast, and although small, we managed to fit in what we needed in the fridge.The pool area and the pool itself were both small, but chairs were always available and the water was warm. For shade, which my husband needs, you could either sit in one of the cabanas or drag a chair into a shady spot. My husband used the bike in the gym and was happy with that.I was a bit concerned about the position of the hotel, imagining it being miles from anywhere, but found this not to be the case. We walked to and from Ala Moana Mall, which took about 25 minutes, but is flat so not taxing (except when lugging home groceries and shopping). As for Waikiki itself, it's close to everything, and it's not far to the beach either. We only caught a bus once, to and from the Ward Centre, and the bus stop is close to the hotel.The front desk staff were always polite and helpful, and we organised 2 trips through Matt, the concierge, both of which were good. Our rooms were always cleaned well, but we did do our own dishes and disposed of a lot of our rubbish ourselves. I was surprised that towels were changed daily which, although nice, is not so common in hotels nowadays. As an environmental issue, I think they should actually change this and use the system that other hotels have to indicate when you'd like a towel change. Toiletries were of good quality and replenished when necessary.We had breakfast in our room most mornings, a few lunches and most dinners. We do like our food, but would rather save our money for shopping, which, along with some R&R, was the purpose of tnis trip. We actually got most of our groceries at Foodland, at Ala Moana, a much cheaper option with much greater variety than the ABC stores.I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a comfortable, economic option of Waikiki accommodation.

we stayed for one night on a stopover. Got a great rate with aaa on a "studio with no kitchen" which actually had counters, dishes and a goodsized fridge.The rom was recently updated and very nice with a great bed. Our partialnocean view was completely unobstructed over the park.The beach is a bit far but a nice walk through the park.If you have a late flight, there isnt a hospitality suite but you can use the bathrooms at the pool to shower. They arent great but they get the job done (unfortunately without much hot water!)

Booked a 1-bedroom, 1 bath through owner. After extensive research to get best accommodation, best price, and best location, I found that the Outrigger Luana was a good value. There were 2 adults and 2 teens staying at this hotel/condo unit and while the King bed worked out fine for adults, the pull-out sleeper sofa was a little "rough" for the teens. The unit's bath and kitchen appeared to have been updated nicely with granite and I particularly liked the tile floors throughout. We had a nice view of Ft. DeRussy Park from our lanai and was able to view the fireworks the Friday night we were there. The front service people and valet folks were friendly and helpful and we stopped several mornings for coffee and pastry at the small downstairs restaurant. The downside was that it was a bit of a 'haul' from the center of Waikiki for us senior adults but still worth the value. I'd certainly stay there again but would probably book a larger unit if there were 4 people.

This hotel was fantastic for the price! The staff were amazing, the room was good (we stayed in a POF kitchenette). The only thing slightly negative thing I could say was the balcony door was very hard to open. But that's really the only issue we had! Highly recommended if you don't mind being just a little bit from the main action.

This was my third stay in eighteen months. Outrigger Luana is a boutique hotel - the staff are always friendly and helpful, the location on the park is wonderful and so close to the Waikiki action and the beach.The one bedroom apartment was so spacious and the view was sensational.

We stayed here for several days while attending a friend's destination wedding. We had booked the room with Expedia several weeks in advance and felt that we had gotten excellent value for what we had paid. It was a walk to the beach, but you walk right along Kalakaua Ave. which has tons of shops and restaurants along it (so many of these restaurants are fantastic) and the walk wasn't far at all. Mind you, I did have to walk to the Sheraton Waikiki in heels for the wedding and I honestly didn't think that it was too far. Even my toes agree. :-)We had two queen beds, a small desk, TV, nightstand in the room as well as a kitchen sink which was great when two of us were trying to get ready for the wedding. Tile floors throughout made it easy for housekeeping to keep things clean. We didn't have a great view from our porch, but we had no loud noise and the porch was still really nice when we hung out there at the end of the day.There was $25/day valet parking that we needed to use that was pricey but seemed to be par for the course in the area. The attendants were really cool and attentive and always brought the car to us quickly. The front desk attendants were also great and gave us beach towels upon request. We only ate at the cafe at the hotel once, but the food was reasonably priced and tasty - it was also prepared super quickly and this was really important because we were running late for the wedding when we grabbed our lunch here.One small touch that I really loved was the complimentary water that they had in the lobby; there's a table to the side with ice water sitting there that has tons of tropical fruit in it to give it flavor. It really was a treat and was a great way to start a day of exploring; I'd grab a glass of it whenever I'd leave the hotel.

We had a great time, the staff was amazing and responsive. The value was unbeatable for Waikiki and the location was tops. Would consider staying again. We were in room 420 and there aren't a lot of natural light, but there is a small lanai (balcony). :)Treadmills were awful and need service. Our door no. was missing so we had moderate confusion finding our room. Microwave in room would be great since there is a fridge and kitchenette. I believe some units have them, some don't.

we didn't know that rooms with a kitchenette only have queen sized beds...which in reality seemed like a little bit larger than a double. When we asked about it, the front desk suggested that someone sleep on the pull out sofa. Umm...no. We figured it was only for one night, so we could make do with what we had.The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but most importantly, the room was clean. It seemed like it had been remodeled, but it still had a bit of "old Waikiki" charm. I realize that some people might not like that...it's definitely not a luxurious hotel, but it's a practical room. Our view overlooked the park across the street..nice, but it was quite noisy since Kalakaua is a busy street.Since we didn't spend a lot of time in Waikiki, we probably should have stayed outside of Waikiki and thus save a few bucks in parking...but it is a convenient location. Only bad thing is their entrance. It's a bit hard to drive into/out of if there's a lot of people on the sidewalk plus the street traffic.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki in Central Honolulu in August 2011. Right from the reservation stage the staff were great. They were all very helpful giving information and getting things done.The hotel location is perfect, very central for visiting all the attractions and places of interest but not too close to the noise and crowds. The beach is 5 mins walk through a good park, the shopping and restaurants are less than 5 mins walk and the bus stop right outside the hotel to go to other places. The rooms were very spacious and clean with a good kitchenette with a fridge. It would have been better if they had a microwave and a kettle for us British who like our cup of tea. Also, they did not have the ordinary English Breakfast Tea bags which we like although the staff were good enough to try and get us a couple of them when we asked. We bought things from a supermarket nearby and had breakfast in the room which was convenient but would have liked to have a microwave and kettle.The hotel had a small cafe on the premises which was ok for light snacks and drinks. But it was easy to walk to the main area to eat. The swimming pool was small but nice and there was also a small gym. The main plus was the staff all of them so helpful when we needed anything. We stayed there for 7 nights and enjoyed it and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to everyone and go there again as the room rates were very good value. We were looking at a lot of hotels when we were planning our trip all the way from the UK and found the hotels in Honolulu quite expensive compared to other areas in the USA. But the Outrigger Luana was very reasonable and good value for money for the quality and convenience.

Nice, clean, convenient and practical hotel for an Oahu vacation. The staff at this hotel is great. Everybody from check-in desk to valet parking attendants were awesome. Always friendly and helpful and always had a smile on. We had breakfast at their Protea Cafe and it was very good. Great service there too. The rooms were comfortable and our 5th floor room facing the park was very quiet. Never heard any loud noises from outside or inside the bulding. This hotel property is on Fort DeRussy Park. It's about a ten minute walk to Waikiki Beach and about four blocks from International Market Place.Overall, I would definitely stay here again in the future.

good location, excellent room, nice people, no car required, would stay again and recomendbuses to everywhere within walking distance make sure you visit the everything eggs just round the corner best french pancakes (thin ones)ever!

We have been to Waikiki on many an occasion. Our recent stay at the Luana in October was exceptional, highlighted by a most accomodating front desk staff, concierge, bellman service and very attentive house-keeping. The location is excellent, close to the beach and all that the Waikiki experience offers. Our room on the 16th. floor facing Fort Derussey Park, Diamond Head and the beach afforded us a view that was nothing short of spectacular! The studio suite was handsomely appointed with a full-service kitchenette. We had the opportunity to view the one-bedroom suites for our next stay. They are equipped with full-sized kitchen appliances, ideal for longer visits or those who want to cook in. We would highly recommend this property for your consideration.

The staff could NOT have been nicer. They were so helpful and so cheerful--just wonderful to be around.The room was fairly good sized with a kitchenette. All tile floors which is good if you're dealing with sand, heat and humidity.

I have stayed at this property twice. It is in a good location for public transport to get around. If staying in Oahu for more than 2 weeks, buy a bus pass as it will work out cheaper for trips around the island. The staff at the Luana are very helpful. The bedding was fresh and sweet smelling. The amenities were everything one could wish for. The daily maid service was good. As one would do in their own kitchen, rinse out coffee cups and coffee maker before leaving the apartment each day and keep reasonably tidy. Would recommend staying in an apartment here as it gives more amenities if visiting more than 7 days.

We spent 12 days at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki in a studio kitchenette unit. It was clean, well presented and had a terrific view over Fort Derussy park and the sea. Being on the edge of the main Waikiki hub it was for us the perfect location. Close enough to easily use the shuttles and 'the bus' with the shopping and food hub in easy walking distance, but far enough away to not be bothered by the late night crowds. The concierge crew Meena and Matt did a great job on our tours and helped make the Hawaii experience a memorable time.

Good location but:- room cleaning everyday is poor: floor was not cleaned (still had some sand from the day before I accidentally brought in), cups were left dirty, coffee maker was left with old coffee in it, bathroom was not cleaned. In summary, bed was made and towels folded but that's it.- internet is dial-up like. The wifi and the cable in my room weren't working. I had to connect to the neighbouring room wifi. I told the reception about that, and basically I had to call the internet provider myself (Oceanic Time Warner). They fixed it the next time, but I still experienced drop outs, poor connection and very slow speed. A major inconvenience for me as I needed for work.- the a/c is VERY noisy (like those they used to make 30 years ago)- gym and pool are small.In summary, make your own opinion, but considering the choice available in Waikiki, I won't be staying here again!

We were there for 12 nights...Absolute fantastic experience, the staff were all very helpful and polite. Nothing was a problem to any of them. The hotel was clean and tidy, the beds were very comfortable. The location of the hotel was far enough from the hussel and bussel to have a very relaxed atmosphere. Would most definatly stay there again.

When we got here we were panicing because hawaiian airlines canceled our reservations but we were saved by Heather here at Outrigger. She solved our problem with excillent customer service which turned out trip around for the better. I would highly recommend this place to others as it very relaxing and a great view of the ocean from our room!

I stayed in a 1 br with full kitchen for a week. I originally booked a studio kitchenette, so the upgrade was a nice surprise. For the cost, if I would have received the original room, this would have been a 2 dot review. I was in room 907 which had a very nice ocean and city viewThe problem, the rooms are incredibly outdated for the price point compared to other, similar hotels in Waikiki.I'll start with the good though:- Pleasant front desk and valet staff- Great ocean and city views from the room- Less than 5 minute walk to the main shopping on Kalakaua- The kitchen was fairly well equipped- Quiet Now, the not so good:- This is a condo hotel- The room decor is more budget rental condo than mid-level hotel- The kitchen had a fairly strong odor probably coming from the plumbing - The concierge couldn't help with basic tasks and couldn't assist with retrieving printouts for some reason he tried to explain unsuccessfully- Walls were shabby and dirty If the price were about 30% less, I would recommend this for budget travelers, but at the prices they are asking, I would recommend spending $20-30 more for a room at the Outrigger Reef or Waikiki.

The room was clean and the staff friendly. The hotel was beside Fort DeRussy park (nice park), and not too far from the beach and Waikiki's shops and restaurants so it was very convenient.The hotel restaurant offered some of the best breakfast we tried in hawaii. Those açaï bowls had fruits so fresh and tasty !

This hotel is ok, if you are after one of the original Outriggers, which is much older and a bit more run down. A weird set-up with the kitchens. We had a room with a huge kitchen and all the utensils, however no hot plate, microwave, etc. I guess it would be ok if you were bringing food back to the room to make salads, etc. My main complaint is there wasn't a basic kettle to be able to make a cup of tea. They supplied tea bags, but only a coffee maker. Reception said that it's because we don't have a full kitchen (one of the rooms who do have a hot place, microwave, etc). However, that's even more reason to supply it and if you are going to supply tea bags at least supply a kettle. When we asked reception for one on our first night they said they had "run out". On our last night in from Maui, I complained and they brought one up in 5 minutes. Also, our air conditioning unit was extremely loud - an older model.I really expected better from an Outrigger hotel.

The Outrigger Luana is a wonderful place to stay! There isn't anything about this hotel that I wouldn't give a 5 star rating. The staff is absolutely incredible and each and every person we talked to was so nice and went out of their way for us. The rooms are clean and updated. We had a studio with kitchenette and it was nice to have a sitting area. Love having the kitchenette to make breakfast before starting the day. The beds are very comfortable which is so important for a good night's sleep on vacation. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and in short walking distance to everything...shopping, dining, and the beach. Some rooms have an ocean view but we don't care about since we aren't in the room that much and don't go there to sit in the hotel. We will stay there again and again and would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Mahalo!!!

They truly represent Aloha and make you feel like Ohana! From the first day there to the day we left the staff at the Luana are the best. The room was fantastic and we had a beautiful view of the park and the ocean! The hotel was very clean and warm, very inviting and the decor was wonderful. The staff answered every question that my wife and I had and they did not make you feel rushed even if they were busy. They have a great location and are close to public transportation and restaurants are in close walking distance to everything else. The Protea cafe on site is a great place for breakfast or lunch the food and staff are wonderful. Our flight home was not until 10 pm and check out was at noon but the staff stored and locked up our luggage and gave us a pass key so we could still us the restrooms and the pool and showers if we needed to until the shuttle came for us at 7pm. I will be recommend this hotel to all our family and friends to stay at on their trips to Honolulu. Mahalo

First, let me say that this hotel, is very clean, and the staff (with the exception of the concierge) is very helpful, friendly, and willing to answer your questions, The room was clean and comfortable, although small, If this was somewhere else, it would be a 2 star at best. But, this is Waikiki, so, it's location. location.I also think that $25 per night to park your car is way to much, even with it being valet parking (no option for self parking} I do have to admit, the valet, and bell staff we great. When we go back to Waikiki, we will probably look for somewhere on the beach, if we are going to pay this much.

Mainly a business trip but had a couple of free days. Staff was most helpful and the mezzanine area was quiet and accessible for an impromptu business meeting. The in-house cafe-Protea was very good for breakfast. Hotel had great access to all the Waikiki action without all the congestion.

From the moment we called for our reservation to the day of checking out was a smooth and enjoyable process! Check-in was a breeze and the smiles and greetings made you feel like you were a local more than a tourist. The first thing that caught my eye was the cleanliness of the facility. Everyday our room was clean and sheets were made up nicely. I have traveled to many places in the world and never have I seen a room so clean! The rooms were in excellent condition and the use of tile for the flooring was a plus for me. Be sure to use the Expedia travel consultant at the front desk to schedule your tours and trips while in the island. Matt was super nice and always made sure to stop us in the lobby to ask questions about the experience to pass on to other guests.For the price and location, this hotel is a must stay!
user_name:
Judson L
College Station, Texas, United States

review_body: I stayed at Outrigger Luana for a week on vacation in September 2012. My room was beautiful and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The view from my room was great. The location was approx. two blocks from the beach and away from all the noise. The bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed my stay very much and would stay there again.
user_name:
Dorothy A
Alamogordo, New Mexico, United States

review_body: I stayed at the Outrigger Luana in Waikiki from Aug 18-24. It was amazing! Ok, firsts things first: it wasn't the prettiest of hotels. Meaning, it was a bit dated. But everything was spotlessly clean. And the customer service was spectacular. Easily rivaled the 5 star hotels I've stayed at. The front desk staff made check in fast and smooth. The porter who carried our luggage to our room was friendly and talkative. The concierge was able to direct us to some amazing restaurants in the area. The room was cleaned to perfection on a daily basis, despite the fact we kept dragging in sand. Honestly, there isn't anything negative I could say.The location is prime, close to restaurants, shops and the beach. The restaurant attached has great breakfast, you should definitely try the crab cakes eggs benedict. They provide beach towels, which are always available at the front desk. And bonus: they had laundry facilities on the second floor, open 24 hours. Which was great, as I was going to Japan afterwards for 12 days and really needed to do some laundry.They set up airport transportion for me when I left, which was only $12 (compared to the $35 spent on a cab on the way in). The concierge did not book any trips for my friend and I (as we pre-booked all the excursions we wanted from home) but when he found us on the street at 6:30am, waiting for a tour bus to pick us up, he stopped to make sure we were all right and reassure us that since we were now on "island time" the bus may be 10-15 minutes late. He didn't need to stop at all. We didn't notice him, he went out of his way to chat with us that morning, which was much appreciated.Overall, Outrigger Luana was the icing on the cake for an amazing Hawaain vacation.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks, as a party of 6 for my little brothers 21st Birthday.After a horrendously long flight we touched down in honolulu and were greeted by our transfer rep, and quickly driven to our hotel! Check in was quick, easy and efficient, and we were directed up to our rooms. Both rooms were fairly spacious, with 2 huge beds, a kitchen area (will come back to this), well equipped bathrooms and a small balcony.The rooms looked a little outdated, but did the job and were very comfortable. Both rooms had a 40+ inch TV with plenty of channels, the whole hotel had free wi-fi and both rooms had air conidtioning units which worked a treat.The beds were big and comfortable, the bathroom was of a good quality but the kitchen was disappointing. We had a fridge, and that was it. No hobs, oven or microwave - which made the kitchen kind of useless. The fridge was used constantly though. So cant complain too much.The hotel pool was very small, but we had enough space to have fun and swim etc without being on top of anyone, the sun loungers and gazebos on offer were of a very good quality and the pool area was very clean. The gym also was clean and had enough features to keep me happy.The location was good, close enough to Waikiki and all it offers, but far away enough from all the noise, hustle and bustle.All in all a very nice hotel, would stay again if I return to Hawaii!

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary "staycation". I've read the reviews on tripadvisor and booked the hotel because of the reviews and the great kamaaina rate that was offered. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the hotel. All of the staff was friendly. We were upgraded to a room with a kitchenette which included stove, fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker with coffee, tea, sugar and cream and all of the necessary kitchen utensils and plates and cutlery. The bathroom has hairdryer (not very strong) soap, lotion, shampoo,and conditioner. I loved the the soaps and shampoo and conditioner it smelled soooo good it has a pikake flower fragrance but its not overwhelming. The room was clean it had 1 bed and a pullout couch. The tv was flatscreen. The lanai overlooked the Kalakaua statue and the waikiki strip. There is a small cafe downstairs, Protea. open 7am to 2pm and they offer happy hour 11-2 we I ordered breakfast and took it back to the room. They also have a bbq area, gym and pool. (we didn't use any) The hotel is a close walk to everything. The furthest we walked was to Waikiki Walls, the beach near Kapiolani Park, with no problem because we were there to enjoy everything we took our time and didn't rush. Ft Derussy Beach is also right across the street from the hotel too if you don't feel like walking that far to the beach. There are lots of restaurants from pricey to budget nearby. The Royal Hawaiian shopping center has a food court inside. On Lewers street there's everything from Ruth Cris, Yard House, Giovanni Pastrami, and Subway plus more. We had a late lunch at Hard Rock Cafe on Beachwalk super close to the hotel. They have happy hour almost all day till 7pm and also a live band (check the schedule I don't think its every night) we sat at the bar and the bartender Patrick is super cool! Lots of shopping but ala moana shopping is nearby too but I wouldn't walk there. If you have a long stay. There's also Sam's Club and Wal-mart nearby you can get some goods from there and not pay "waikiki" prices. There's also a small bar right across the street from the hotel called Bambooze. We only discovered it as we were walking back to our hotel late one night. They have a pool table, and darts also drink specials there too. The only gripe I(we) had was there's road construction going on (not the hotels fault )and there were steel plates on the street so EVERY car that passed over it we could hear the loud "Ka-Donk Ka-Donk" even though the lanai door was shut. I had the A/C on full blast to drown the noise (but I like the A/C on full blast anyway). A few shots of whiskey also helps drown the noise, so says my husband. Other than that noise everything was pretty quiet. It won't last forever so don't let that discourage you. Hmmmm maybe that's why I got the upgrade...I don't mind tho.I will definitely stay in this hotel again for the location, the hotel, and the Aloha.

I had the pleasure of staying at Outrigger Luana for 7 weeks this summer and was thoroughly impressed. The hotel is very well managed; the staff are always polite, friendly and helpful. Maintenance and security is also fantastic. The valet guys are an excellent bunch, always upbeat and considerate.I love the location of this hotel, nestled in Fort DeRussy park. It seems very peaceful compared to the crowded hustle and bustle of the Waikiki hotel district. The short walk to the beach through the park is very pleasant. My group enjoyed barbequing by the pool, a great place to chat with fellow guests. I had a kitchenette room, which had everything I needed to make great meals (I can't do restaurants night after night.)By the way, the little store in the hotel has fantastic items and prices (I compared elsewhere, even with the Stadium flea market.) Also Coco's spa in the hotel is great. I had a mani-pedi and thoroughly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again if I returned to Waikiki.

Although not right next door to Waikiki Beach, it was only a short 5 minute walk. I actually preferred the location because it wasn't as noisy or busy compared to other locations closer to the beach. Likewise, most attractions, including the Ala Moana Mall, Fort de Russy, and major shopping were within walking distance.
