The rooms were clean and my kitchenette was well equipped with a fridge, 2 burner stove and convection microwave. What made my stay worthy enough for me to write my first ever review would be the staff at the Luana. From the front desk staff like Angela, Cassel and Ryan to the valets like Matt and Will, they went out of their way to ensure my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. They were all friendly, accommodating and very knowledgeable about Waikiki and Oahu. I couldn't have picked a better hotel to stay at and would definitely stay there again should I find myself in Waikiki in the future.

+ Close to ABC stores, but what isn't in Honolulu+ Decent hotel with Queen size bed and sleeper sofa+ Free water in the lobby+ Free printing of boarding passes+ Kitchen like area with sink and dishwasher+ Good view from higher floors- Would have liked to be closer to the beach- Valet only parking at $25/night- Awfully snotty and rude when we asked for extra towels- Additional required service fees for house services

We booked a room with two double bed as my friend and I were sharing a room. However, when we checked in there was only one double bed. After speaking to front desk stating that we have booked with two double beds months prior, he explained to us there was a military convention and all the two bed bedrooms were taken. As there were 100 more guests leaving the next morning, he asked us to go back the next morning. Which we did...to be told there is nothing again. So my friend had to sleep on the pull out couch for two nights. Housekeeping was horrible. The floors were not cleaned. I dropped a fork on the floor and was too lazy to pick it up. That stayed there the whole entire trip. Hair that I shed was on the ground the next day. Hair in the tub was there the next day. Gross. The staff were all very friendly. When asked where to go for dinner the first night because we arrived extremely late, front desk suggested a great cafe which is only a short walk for us. And the food was great. All in all, it is not a place I'll stay again if I ever go back to Waikiki. However, during the time that I stayed there, it was ok.

After being jet-lagged we checked into the city park view studio room with a kitchenette. The entire room was very comfortable and clean. Although our room was overlooking the park, the city noise was not a problem for us. There is a small grocery store directly across the street from the hotel and also lots of sushi restaurants. The Waikiki beach is about a 15 minute walk and there is a shopper's paradise also in walking distance from the hotel. All of the top designer stores like Gucci, Prada and Louis Vuitton; just to name a few are all very close to the hotel. Also, there is no wi-fi in the room but you can connect in the lobby. Our overall stay at Outrigger Luana Waikiki was great! Thanks! Harbor Town Fly Fishing

Started off rough with a call while we were still on the airplane that our room class had been sold out. Very disturbing since the reservation had been made months in advance. Worked out fine with a nice ocean view room with no kitchen which we did not need anyway. Everything else was good to very good. Staff was very good, shop was very good with some of the best prices in the area. the little Protea Cafe was just that...little.5-6 tables and cramped. However, the food was good and so was the service. The rooms were clean and well kept and WOW the view.

My wife and I stayed here last December and it was clean and friendly.It was a bit crowded with the National Cheerleading camp going on but still peaceful.Close to anything you need.I would stay again!

The view from our room was great with a great view of the regular Friday night fireworks. The staff is very helpful and courteous. We have stayed here several times. The street side can be noisy at times but the trade off with Derussy Park closeby is worth it. A leisurely stroll takes you to some excellent restaurants and diners. Love it!

This is our second time staying at the Outrigger Luana Wakiki. We love this hotel for a number of reasons: 1. the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful,2. the location is ideal- the hotel is next to Fort DeRussy park with great views of the ocean and park and so is very relaxing; 3. but at the same time, you are 2 blocks from all of the Waikiki action so can easily get to restaurants and shopping.; 4. there is a nice small pool for sunbathing but you are an easy walk to the beach; and 5. the hotel suites are great, with a full kitchen, large rooms and great views, plus you can get great deals on the rooms through Travelocity. When we visit Hawaii again, we will definitely stay here.

The luana is a great base for your stay in Waikiki. 5/7 minute walk to the beach and to the main shopping/restaurant part of Kalakaua Ave. The room is really big. We had a double double room on the 15th floor with partial ocean view and it was amazing. There are 2 small supermarkets and a Peets coffee bean and tea leaf right across the street. As other reviews have stated we weren't that impressed with the concierge. As this was our first trip to Hawaii we were unsure about what was available and options etc. We said what we would like to do (what to see, but specified that we didn't want to take up a full day) we were more or less told only one option was available and that it was "the best". While on the excursions we found out that othe packages were available that would have suited us better (shorter days). The concierge just sold us the most expensive package without selling us a package that we would have much preferred. If you have any questions about excursions we took feel free to message me.

FIRST OFF: Had it not been for the concierge, I'd have rated this hotel 4 stars. Hotel management passed the buck on the issue that  we had with the concierge, telling us that the concierge is a separate entity from the hotel (they rent counter space from the hotel).GREAT HOTEL:This hotel is clean and the furnishings are relatively modern and in good condition.The cleaning staff are friendly and quite attentive although we typically choose not to have our room cleaned every day while we are staying in a hotel. During our stay, if we encountered the cleaning staff in the hallway, they would always ask if we needed anything fresh, even though we were not needing our room to be cleaned.The hotel is ideally situated on the main street: Kalakaua Avenue. It is a quick 5 minute walk to the main shopping strip in Waikiki, making it a little quieter; without the throngs of people milling about outside the entrance.It is also a short walk (7-10 minutes) to the beach near the Kale Hoa Hotel. This beach is quieter than Waikiki beach, I imagine in part because it is not a sandy entry into the water, it is a little more rocky.If you want shopping there are two terrific choices: 1. The main strip on Kalakaua Avenue which offers various ABC Stores, touristy, souvenir boutiques and other higher end stores like Tiffany's, Hermes etc.2. you can choose to go to the Ala Moana Shopping Center (15-20 minute walk), a rather large, outdoor center which offers a vast array of shopping choices, as well as dining.Directly behind the hotel is an open air park, Fort DeRussy, which provides a nice area for strolling.A nice touch that the hotel provided in the lobby was self-serve Spa Water. It was available from the morning throughout until supper time. It was flavored with pineapple, strawberries, cucumbers. It was very refreshing and we looked forward to it daily after our long walks, exploring the immediate area.THE DREADFUL CONCIERGE:My one, and only, dealing with this service.At 8:30 am one morning I stood behind a woman who was asking directions to Diamond Head. She was given very thorough instructions as to where to catch the bus and was offered other various unsolicited information. That made me quite pleased as I was hoping to be equally informed about my destination.I was going to Pearl Harbor and asked about the bus system. She said it would take me about 1.5 hours and she did not offer any other information. When I then asked if a shuttle was available she said there was one and pointed outside saying that I needed to talk with the valet to arrange that. Once again, no other information was being offered. I proceeded to ask if there was an advantage to taking the shuttle over the bus...she reiterated that the bus would take much longer than the shuttle and that I'd be better off taking the shuttle. She basically brushed me off.The total shuttle cost $16 per person, return, (we were two) and was quite flexible for pick-up times.Upon arriving at Pearl Harbor (9:30 am) I learned three things:1. If you don't arrive by 8 am or don't purchase your tickets online, you'll likely not get tickets to the Arizona as they are sold out.2. You are not allowed to bring a bag (back-pack, purse, etc.) into the venue.3. It costs $3 to check your bag into the manned storage facility.My utter disappointment with the concierge was that she should have, at the very least, told me the 3 issues listed above. I learned from my very helpful shuttle driver upon return that the Aloha Stadium Swap Meet, Hawaii's largest open air flea market, open on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays, had been a mere 5 minute walk from Pearl Harbor. That would have been helpful to know from the concierge as well.She was an utter disappointment and the hotel's complete lack of desire to rectify a situation that, in my opinion, reflected on their hotel was a let down. They dropped the ball in that respect.

This was my first visit to Waikiki and I was not only impressed by the beautiful scenery, but also the kind and helful staff at this hotel. They were always helpful, remembered our names, gave directions and did just about anything a guest could ask for with a smile. I recommend this hotel to families and individuals. It's within walking distance of everything. The beach is a short walk thru a lovely park and the shopping is just a few blocks down the road-an easy walk and it's refreshing to be just a few minutes from the hustle of that shopping area. If you decide to make the Outrigger Luana Waikiki your home base for your stay, be sure to say hi to Cassell, he works at the front desk and is one of the nicest people I have ever met. He exemplifies hospitality and truly made the hotel portion of our vacation memorable. Super nice people and a great location.

This is a little gem, great service and close to everything. If you want something really special you'll be disappointed but the staff, price and location make this place. Best part of the beach is right across Fort Derussy park about 500 metres. It's a little noisy from the road traffic if you have a city view.

Nice hotel, with very basic amenities in room. Dedicated high speed internet access in each room is a nice touch. Pool area and gym are small but adequate. Staff are also generally friendly and helpful. The one over-riding problem with this hotel are the noise levels. Windows are old single pane, with balcony doors that are also old with no sound proofing. Hotel is located on the very busy main road running into Waikiki . From 0500 - 2345L every day the noise problem really does spoil what is an okay hotel in a nice location. Unfortunately in July the hotel is full most days, so the hotel has not been able to offer a room change that can avoid this problem. (Stay away from all rooms ending in 16/18/&20. Rooms ending in 04 also back onto the lifts which are 'old school' and Bing! very loudly very time they stop on your floor!) We were in 520, perhaps 1520 & 1620 would be high enough to avoid the noise.

Priced right and you can find deals from Outrigger rough out the year. Great kitchenette, everything was new and clean. Stock up at Walmart a few miles away on bus route. Nice grills in separate area by pool always available. Pool does close early though. Lots of help from Bell staff and front desk and a couple of computers for public use are free. We used fro a couple of days while exploring rest of island and then moved down to more expensive rooms on the beach.

I normally don't use the word awesome, but our recent trip to Oahu was just that. The Luana Waikiki is welcoming comfortable and conveniently located. Everything seemed to be within walking distance. I'd love to stay there again.

This hotel is in a great location just a couple of shorts blocks to the centre of Waikiki. It was good to be out of the main hustle and bustle, to busy for me. The hotel staff were friendly and the bell hop guys are fantastic. Nothing was to much trouble and they sure know Waikiki!The room was clean, good beds and pillows, serviced daily and all amenities replaced everyday. Nice pool area but it opens late 9am and closes at dusk which is a bit early if u want a cool down at night. ABC shop and Whalers General store across the road and you can get everything there (good wine also). Trolley stop also just across the road and when you return on the trolley you just get off at the Hilton Hawaiian and walk through the park, takes about 5 mins if that. There is really only one major issue with this hotel and thats the A/C it's SOOO noisy you really can't sleep with it on. I wear earplugs but still had to turn it off and it wasnt to hot so survived!The hotel is not 5 star and they don't profess to be, it is great value and I will go back again for sure.

We booked this hotel after researching hotels on Tripadvisor... we are so pleased that we booked this hotel. The Hotel is 5 minutes walk from the heart of Waikiki, therefore there was no city noise at all. We were travelling for 6 weeks and were in Waikiki 3 times in that 6 weeks for flights etc. We were so impresssed with the room and the staff on our first visit of 3 days that we booked the Hotel for another night before our flight to Canada. We travelled to the USA and Canada and had planned to get a connecting flight to our home in Australia via Honolulu. Due to flights delays in Calgary we missed our next 4 flights to Australia. We were lucky to get a flight to Honolulu from Calgary and could not get a connecting flight to Australia till 3 days time. We found ourselves in Waikiki for 3 days with no booked Hotel. We were extremely happy to find a room at Outrigger Luana, we booked a Park Room with a kitchenette..... we were happy to be staying at a comfortable Hotel. When we arrived at the Hotel very tired and too early for our checkin... the wonderful staff were happy to check us in early and also they up-graded us to a wonderful room on the 11th floor.... a room that was a suite..we were so thankful to the wonderful staff.The Hotel is close to the hub of Waikiki but 5 mins walk away, the rooms comfortable and clean. The rooms we stayed in had a kitchen with fridge, microwave and oven. The rooms were airconditioned and had opening doors and windows if you wanted fresh air. Rooms also had a safe and had free wifi. Downstairs there is a pool and a laundry(great for travellers) and computers in the lobby with printing facilities. The Hotel is a 15minute taxi from the Curise Terminal for those going on the Hawaii Cruise. There is the Cheesecake Factory and also PK Changs for a great meal 7 minutes walk from the Hotel in downtown Wakiki. We would be very happy to stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to anyone else travelling to Honoulul.

We needed a quality place to stay and that's what we got at the Outrigger Luana. The rooms were very clean and well kept. The staff were super helpful with any questions we had. This was our first time to Honolulu. Luckily we ended up in the area where we did. After a stroll down towards the busy end of Waikiki, I was super glad we didn't stay down that way. There are way too many people and the beaches are super crowded. We went to the Fort Derussy beach and it was nice and quiet and far less crowded. We were across the street from the bus stops that went into downtown which was super convenient. We had a city facing room on the 10th floor. Noise wasn't bad at all since the a/c was running and drowned everything out. The kitchenettes are equipped with the necessities and we made use of them to save some cash on dining out. Overall I was super pleased with the hotel and would definitely recommend it.

i stay in luana hotel in 15days, i noticed the room was so very clean, the staff is very friendly; ( analyn gima) i really appreciate your excellent service in my room in 15days!!!...if i would go back again in this hotel,i want analyn gima to service my room again..if its okay for the area gen mngr.give my regards to her and mahalo plenty...i will recommend this hotel,, my family and friends..."Aloha & Mahalo " Analayn!!!:)

This hotel is at the beginning of the big shopping street in Honolulu so you are in walking distance. The beach is about two blocks away too so very good location. It is a pain to find this hotel if you have never been there. There is no big sign outside and I drove by it twice before I realized this was the hotel. The staff is very friendly, from the valet to the front desk to the cleaning lady. I booked partial ocean view and had a good room on the south side of the hotel. Not noisy and with a nice view of the park where elderly folks do tai-chi every morning. Suite was good with a large kitchen but no microwave! I had a refrigerator, plates, cups, knives, forks etc. but without a microwave all of that is no use! Bathroom was large and clean. Bed was comfortable and nice little balcony. Some stupid drunk guys thought it was funny to throw beer bottles off their balcony on the 14th floor onto the pool deck so the pool was off limits for 5 days. They had to drain the pool and clean the entire pool deck and the pool because of shards of glass. Thanks, guys!! Luckily, we were allowed to use the pool of the Outrigger Reef hotel which is a very nice pool so it was not a big deal, just a little walk.

Wow is all I can say. We stayed at this location at the end of April 2012. Our stay was outstanding. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Always smiling! Ryan at the front desk was our man. Always guiding us in the right direction. This place was clean!! Which means a lot to me. I read about a lot of other hotels in Waikiki that had bugs. Bed bugs...yuck. So I was happy to see NO bugs at this hotel. 10 out of 10 for being clean!! We found that the location was perfect walking distance to everything. We rented a car for a few days and drove around the Island. It wasn't hard to find the highway from here and the staff were very prompt in bringing our car up for us. The pool area was great too. It was nice to come back from the beach to relax by the pool. I had mentiioned that it was our Anniversary and they had upgraded our room and gave us a nice note attached to a bottle of sparkling pear wine. Very nice touch :) All in all we love this place and we will be staying here again someday. Wish we never had to leave. Aloha to all the staff! You are the best. Nice job!

Had a "partial ocean view" studio with a kitchenette that had an awesome view of the park & ocean. Friendly & helpful staff provided great service; especially, Maya, the concierge, who book several excursions for me before I arrived. I'm disabled & her help was thorough & greatly appreciated. Accessible accommodations accept balcony too small for my chair-- no worries because kept large sliding glass door open to enjoy view and breeze. This isn't the Halakalani but you're not paying 400-600 clams per night.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana during our Senior Trip. We had 15 students and 6 sponsors. We found the staff (Sean, Ryan, Chris and Angela) to be the perfect hosts. They were very helpful throughout our stay. The went above and beyond. Check out was at noon, but our flight did not leave until 10:00pm. They made arrangements to store our luggage so that we didn't have to tote it around all day. We will definately staff here again. Everything was clean and great!

We stayed at the Luana in April 10 - 19 2012 and had a wonderful relaxing time. All the staff were extremly friendly. I have never been any place where the staff could constantly be pleasant and have a smile for you everytime you saw them. We had a partial ocean veiw room which over looked Fort DeRussey Park which was absolutley stunning. We were able to get partial view of the fire works that are every Friday night from the Rainbow Hilton. and had a good enough view to take a video of them. We loved the kithchenette which gave you the option to eat in if you wanted to. We found the room was very clean and spacious. Plently of room to move around without banging into things and each other. The Pool was small but found it was actually more than enough. The Pool opens at 9:00 am, but wished it had opened earlier plently of longe chairs and they porvide the towels. Coming from Mountian time we are up early and looking for things to do. You are close to everything , even an ABC store( lol ). The beach is a pleasant walk through Fort Ðe Russey Park and only takes about 5 mins. Shopping is every where and you could actually walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. The Zoo is a little longer walk but this way you get to see the full length of Waikiki beach from the high end shops to the international market place. We would like to give specail thanks to the front desk staff and the bell captians they helped us out with a smile. Hope to stay there again !

We booked the Outrigger Luana via wotif.com, after coming by Tripadvisor to read the reviews. Since the majority of the reviews were excellent/very good, we went with it. I'm so happy we picked this over the other hotels in the area (a little further from the beach and shopping strip that the bigger hotels), because we had such a great time. The staff from valet and front desk were super friendly and happy to help out with anything. The hotel furniture and decor looked new and clean. We had a room on the 16th (top) floor with park view and even a kitchenette. It was spacious enough for three girls and all our junk.I'd definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends visiting Waikiki, and would certainly stay here again should I be lucky enough to go to Hawaii again!Points to note out: It's a ten minute walk to Waikiki Beach through the park (won't be a problem for most)It's a five minute walk away from the main shopping strip of WaikikiThe pool only opens at 9am, which wasn't the greatest when I wanted to make the most of the sun and up at 7am most mornings (damn jetlag!)Must be said again, the staff of this hotel are brilliant!

I've stayed at plenty of top-notch hotels during my travels and the Luana, in my opinion, is just as good. I was in Hawaii in April and had an excellent experience. I booked a partial ocean view suite and much to my surprise, upon arrival, was upgraded to a full ocean and city view. My party and I loved the location. We were able to go just across the street to meet all of our tours. The trolley and bus stops were there as well. As much souvenir shopping as I did there were a few last minute things I needed and found that the hotel gift shop had very reasonable prices that fit he bill. This was our second experience at the Luana. It was our hotel of choice in March 2011 when we visited the island. When we read the reviews then I'm glad we pushed aside the negative reviews and went with the majority of good ones. We would certainly go back!!!!

This was okay for a moderately priced/budget-friendly hotel. I had booked it because we were not planning to rent a car until the last half of our trip to the North Shore. As it turned out, we needed to rent the car for the entire trip. So once I factored in the additional $25 parking fee per night, I didn't really feel it was that great of a deal.Some of the pluses: really nice, friendly staff (the valet staff would try to help us with suggestions even if we weren't checking out the car for the day); fruit-flavored water was refreshing and welcoming when coming and going; nice view of the ocean and park from the room.Some of the negatives: The bars on the lanai in the room were kind of wide, so if you have young kids you have to be hyper-vigilent. Pool did not open until 9am. I really think the pool should be open at least by 8am. With our 5 y.o. (who loves the water) we found that we had to trek down to the beach and back and then use the pool before going out and touring. Also the location (while quiet) was a little too far away from the restaurants and attractions in Waikiki.Overall it was a fine experience, but we probably would not stay here again.

Take no notice of any bad reviews of this fantastic hotel !! It is absoulutely brilliant !It caters for all your needs for a Honolulu / Waikiki trip, is close to the beach , close to the shops, yet just far enough away from the hustle and bustle and noisy downtown for a peaceful time !Yes, there is a little street noise ...this is a busy city, but if you go for a high room there's no problems at all.The staff are superb and you couldn't ask for a friendlier more helpful hotel.I well recommend the Luana to anybody ...especially first timers to Hawaii.

I think that if anyone had a bad experience here, it is probably because they expected Taj Mahal luxury at a motel 6 price. When traveling, you have to be realistic and if you are a reasonable, normal human being, you realize this hotel goes above and beyond. After searching the internet and reading all of the reviews for hotels in Waikiki, I booked a week vacation at the Outrigger Luana. I was hesitant due to the price being so much less than a lot of the other hotels in the same vicinity, but all of the reviews for this place were so positive. After getting there and the warm welcome we received from the staff, I felt very good about my decision. My best friend was traveling with me and he is a little more picky about places than I am, but he kept telling me what a good job I did choosing the hotel. He is very travel savvy and always wants a good deal. The rooms are not lavish, but very comfortable. We had a fantastic partial ocean view from the 14th floor and could see all the lights from the city at night. I had requested partial ocean view when booking and the view did not disappoint. The entire staff was so accomodating and friendly. They really try very hard to fill all requests and that cannot be easy to please a bunch of traveling tourists. The parking situation may not be ideal for some travelers who are not used to such a lack of parking in a city, but Ifeel that the valet only system the hotel has in place is very secure and convenient for guests. The $25 a day is well worth it for piece of mind and ease of use. (We met other people who had been towed when trying to self park at other hotels) They always have a smiling, friendly valet out front to get your car very quickly. With our flight leaving late at night the last day, I was able to go to the beach after checking out and come back to the hotel to change clothes, shower, and get ready to leave. They have bathrooms with showers in the pool area and the bell hops keep your luggage locked up for you so you can enjoy your last day there. They never seemed irritated, even though I kept getting my bags out and then having them put them back up. I will definitely go back to this hotel next time I am in Honolulu! Thanks for making my trip there so great and making feel at home in your hotel!!!
user_name:
Chris S
Fort Worth, Texas, United States

review_body: Anyone who rates this a good hotel has never stayed at a nice hotel to know what good/great is! Upon our check in we asked about a late check out as our flight left in the evening OR to rent the room for a half day. Ryan told us they were booked solid & did not do late check outs & as they were booked up could not do a half day rental. We also asked for a quiet room as I suffer from migraines & if I happened to get one, we needed a quiet space. BUT as they were booked solid we had to take what they had, room 109....what a terrible room. It is right by the elevator & near the laundry room so you clearly hear all the comings & goings & the pop machine, which every time, when started up sounded like a jet engine, great when you are trying to sleep. The air conditioner was awful as well, again like a jet engine taking off. House keeping was hard to come by. We had to call up to have our room cleaned. They also didn't seem to like to leave soaps etc each time. There was a yellow stain on the bathroom wall....never cleaned off... We were kept up one night by very loud partying, thank-fully that was only one night. Regarding parking, we parked for one day. We told the front staff that we no longer had a car & what needs to be done. We were advised, nothing. Upon check out they tried to charge us for 4 days & then the gentleman which whom we spoke to, it seemed tried to blame us...On our last day we decided to ask a different front staff about the late check outs, seems that yes, they do have them AND do half day rentals. I searched the internet & it seemed that Ryan was full of.....they had lots of rooms for rent. We would have paid to upgraded to a better floor/room when we checked in but were told wrong info. The only nice/positive aspect about the Luana was the fellows that worked the valet service & the bell hop, great guys, very friendly!!

There was nothing bad about it. Our kitchenette room had everything you need for cooking your own breakfasts/lunch. Lovely view of the ocean and city at night. Main road running past the hotel noisy, but who cares when you're out and about during the day. Enjoyed the balcony every morning for sunrise with cup of tea. Free wifi worked well for us. People on reception faultlessly pleasant and helpful. Lady at the tourist advisory/help desk was excellent, very efficient (much better than a useless one at the hotel across the road I by chance had to speak to). Pool quite small, but didn't really use it anyway. A/C was a bit annoying as it came on often in short bursts.Located towards the end of one of the main roads into town, so made a nice little walk each evening to get dinner. Easy walk to the beach around a pleasant park. We'd definitely stay again.

My husband & I returned from Hawaii on April 23th and had a great 8 days stay(not long enough). We had a room on the 10th floor with a partial ocean view, wow, it was beautiful. With that view we also got to see the hub of Waikiki and it was beautiful at night all lit up. Our room had a queen size bed was a decent size. The room comes with a fridge(half size of a normal) but still held lots, also a toaster & coffee maker as well as dishes for 4 people, cutlery, knives and glasses. We sometimes had cereal and yougurt for breakfast. But there are so many places close buy, 3 to 5 minute walk from this hotel, specially on Lewers Street (lots places to eat on either side,north or south, of Kalakaua Ave.) I know some people complained about street noise, I didn't find that a problem and I am a light sleeper. Also the rooms have a small balcony with two chairs & a little table. Nice to have a cup coffee in the morning and a drink in the evening. I also found the staff to be very helpfull and pleasant. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Also wanted to mention that there are lots of bus stops close by, and a really reasonable car rental place across the street from this hotel (I think it is called Thrifty rentals). The Ala Moana Mall is about a 15 to 20 minute walk depending on the person but it only took me 12 minutes to walk there.

WE stayed at the Luana for 8 days....it was very good. The staff and hotel amenities was exactly what we were looking for. The room was clean, came with fridge. Though we were expecting a full kitchen. We had the partial ocean view kitchenette and the view was excellent overlooking Fort Derussy Park and the beach.. we were sharing the beach with the clients of the Trump international hotel and the Military and Hilton clients... we were on the 15th floor so was quiet. The location was perfect, the ABC store which carried most of what we needed was right across the street...the awesome waikiki downtown was only a 7 -10 minute walk... The Bus stops right across the street...the concierge was very helpful. We would definitely stay here again... one of the small things that i particularly enjoyed was the large refreshing container of ice water with fresh lemons/limes etc in the foyer and the free wifi. The also had 2 apple laptops for client use. WE found there was no need to rent a car, though there was several rentals close b, as well the Outrigger Luana is one of the first hotels from the airport so we were dropped off first. Though the pool was small it had what most would need, great excercise room, plenty of towels even beach towels available. Great stay, great location. They even had BBQ/Grills available to use.

I stayed there for 4 nights and it was a great experience. The good things, the staff are welcoming and helpful. Especially the guy named John. He gave me some advises and tips for my trip. He took the time to answer all my questions thoroughly. The room is pretty big. It's bigger than the one I had at Hyatt Regency. The location is great. it's on the quieter side of Kalakaua. But only mins away from the shopping district and restaurants. If you are going to surf don't choose this hotel. it's very far away from the beach. So you don't want to carry your huge surf board and walk half hour back to the hotel.The bad things, the internet is extremely slow and unstable. when it works it's fast enough to browse but when it's acting up, it's annoying. the hotel is right next to a gas station which can be very noisy with all the sport cars and motorcycles showing off especially if your room was right next to it. But i'm a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me at all. Overall it's a quality hotel. It's well worth the money you spend. If you are out during the day and only spend there at night, it's a great choice. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who doesn't like to spend too much on lodgings.

Great value for Waikiki area. Clean, well appointed rooms. Had the standard room. Would go for the kitchenette with microwave in the future if staying longer. A little too noisy for the City view room as others have said (motorcycle reving engine early in the morning at the gas station next door, sirens, yelling drunks at night). But, overall, fine for what I needed. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The bathroom sink drain did not drain well and needs fixing. The place is away from the Waikiki hustle/bustle, nice to avoid all the traffic and fits my trip need. Good internet connection (important), too. Got to know the valet people, nice and friendly, especially Matt. The valet fee is expensive and is prob. the only thing I don't care for, but that's Waikiki. Used the fitness room. Small, but enough for the exercise. Didn't get to use the pool.

Well appointed, spotless rooms, balcony, free wifi, pleasant staff, terrific location (so close to the beach, buses, shopping, etc, yet quiet for Waikiki) & nice fitness center. All this at a surprisingly low price! Their web pictures don't do the place justice. The furnishings & decor are very islandish. From our 7th floor room (close to the corner of Kalakau facing Diamond Head), we enjoyed views of Waikiki, Fort DeRussy Park & the ocean.Don't miss the fruit flavored water & snacks in the lobby.

Best value-priced hotel we've ever stayed at. 14th floor studio suite with a spectacular view of the ocean and Waikiki skyline. The suite could use a bit of a tune-up but was very clean and comfortable. The staff are second to none! Highly recommend!
I have visited Oahu many timesAnd always stay at the outrigger luanaIt's clean and close to everythingBut away from the crazy people and carsBest pool around

This hotel is always clean, roomy and very comfortable. The wifi is free and works great in the rooms. There is now a little coffee shop that is open for lunch and breakfast on the first floor, now which is so nice to have! The hotel is centrally located to grocery stores, shopping, and the beach. They have a very attractive pool. I have yet to book a massage at the spa, but I will on my way back through next week. The staff is extremely helpful, whether you need to send a fax, or ask questions about the area.

We enjoyed a one bedroom deluxe apartment on the 11th floor and WHEN we go back, we will return to the Luana and ask for the same apartment. Amazing view! The staff were incredibly helpful especially the boys on the concierge desk, who gave us great tips and heads up on the best way to do things including hiring a car, great restaurants to eat at and shuttles to different shopping venues. The tour desk helped us organise day trips and hire a car for a round island day trip. The Luana is very close to downtown Waikiki but in a quiet little corner in Fort Durussy Park - beautifully kept grounds and great for an impromptu game of soccer with the kids. We enjoyed the fact we could visit the busy centre of Waikiki and then return to our little slice of heaven. If the budget allows, go for a room with a view. You will not regret it.

We booked this hotel because we were told that our 'usual' Outrigger property would be under renovations. The price was very reasonable but its off the beaten track. An easy walk to the beach or other Honolulu destinations but a bit of a challenge for older folk or people with young kids. Pool area is very small and a large family had taken over much of the space on the day we visited. Our room was on the city side (ie: right on a main street) so it was very noisy (especially on Saturday night) with lots of foot and vehicle traffic. The room was very nice and seemed to be newly decorated but only had one double size bed. We have come to expect a queen or king at most hotels so this was a little tight for two of us! Staff was very polite and certainly exemplified the Outrigger spirit which we enjoy.

Stayed at the Luana for 10 days with my boyfriend in January 2010. The location was great, the room was nice, and the staff was friendly. There was nothing spectacular about the property but it was well kept, had a pool, a gym, and was close to just about everything.The beds were comfortable, free wi-fi, an area where you could prep food and a lanai. We did face the street but didn't find noisy. Overall a good value.
user_name:
TravelinTiffNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Nothing exceptional here. Clean small accomodations but very noisy if you face the street, which we did. Staff was friendly and attentive. I booked through Costco and they told me it was value-priced and good if you don't spend a lot of time in the room, which suited us just fine. Close to the beach (about 8 minute walk). Decent but noisy.

They upgraded our room at check-in, and at no additional cost. Both the master bedroom and the Living Room had access to the lanai, and we had a full ocean view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The place was clean and spacious. This is a good location at the north end of Waikiki, with easy access to bus/shuttle locations. We would definitely recommend this resort for people visiting Oahu.

Very clean room. Beds were very soft ad comfy.We had a city view so it was noisy from the traffic.We planned our trip through Expedia but I didn't realize that 2 double beds we booked wasn't guaranteed. We ended up sharing 1 double bed fro the whole stay and couldn't upgrade because it's a small hotel and was fully booked at the time.We had a late flight out so we needed to kill time. They allowed us to watch TV in the lounge up stairs for a few hours which was great and very comfortable.Front desk staff were very helpful.Over all a good stay.

1st time in Hawaii & Outrigger Luana Waikiki is just perfect. I found everything within easy walking distance but away bit from all the noise of beach traffic. Great room, lots to keep you busy. Staff excellent and always welcomed you "home" when you came back from a day out. My daughter and I had a wonderful time. I would definitely choose the Outrigger Luana Waikiki next time!T.Dunlop, Williams Lake,BC

This hotel was, by far, the best hotel in the area. We stayed at a few other hotels on Waikiki beach during our trip, and we believe the Luana Waikiki surpassed them all! It was located in a nice part of town that was close enough to the shopping and dining to walk their in a matter of minutes but far enough away that you didn't get all of the street noise other hotels get. The service was impeccable, too! We were pleased with the friendliness of the staff and their quick responsiveness to any of our needs. A+!!Overall, this would be my first choice for a place to stay if we ever travel back to Hawaii. It doesn't get much better than this!

Very nicely appointed room. Friendly, helpful staff. Surprisingly good for the price of the room. Close to everything, but not on the beach (similar hotels on the beach will cost 3 or 4 times as much). Had a kitchen with all the utensils, cooking stuff, etc. even though we didn't use it much. I would highly recommend staying here if going to Waikiki. It is located right next to the park so it is a surprisingly quiet place to stay in Waikiki and the views are very good.

I stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki March 6th-11th. The hotel has all the basic amenities pool, fitness center, etc. I was very pleased with my room and the location of the hotel- within walking distance of the beach. In addition, the hotel staff was very helpful and polite especially the bellman Josh. I would highly recommend the Outrigger Luana Waikiki!!
We had a wonderful time. Hotel staff was very friendly. We got there on the final day of celebration. The hotel is a short walk away from the Hilton Lagoon. We plan to come back

This is an awesome property; privately owned and you can view it on VRBO.com listing 273674. Fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer 2 double beds in the separate 1 bedroom and views that take your breathe away. The owner and staff are great to work with and everything you could possibly need is here and what you see in his photos are exactly what you get, no surprises just a beautiful suite to relax and enjoy. This is a corner suite on the 12th floor with 2 lanais and unobstructive views of the ocean and park.

Organised two rooms with partial ocean view & was very happy with the quality of this hotel. Rooms are clean, large & quiet (on 8th floor) & staff welcoming. Easy walk to the heart of Waikiki & Ala Moana. Safe location.

I broke up my journey to Honolulu staying in two seperate properties in Waikiki. Working within the travel industry I wanted to explore the options available.I have only positive things to say about this property. Upon arrival we were upgraded to an exceptional room up on the 16th floor. City view room with kitchenette faclities. This was amazing...We spent the beginning of our stay in a hotel room (at an alternative hotel) however having access to a kitchen was a blessing. We appreciated being able to make sandwiches etc.The reception staff were more than helpful. Pool was quiet, quaint but very lovely. The gym was very modern and spacious. This hotel would be ideal for families, or people who require more space. The rooms were incredibly spacious with a gorgeous balcony view.I loved my brief stay at the Luana, short distance from shopping and resturants. However a bit of a longer walk to the beach. If spending alot of time at the beach is a must, I would suggest breaking up your stay with a property right on Waikiki Beach.PS. Free Wifi in all rooms!!A+++!

I enjoyed my stay at this Outrigger. Be prepared to not have a view unless you upgrade when you book - which is what we did.The room was of good size with a couch and cooking facilities (part of the upgrade).It is not in the 'centre' of Waikiki but really its only a five minute walk to everything that you need.If you don't feel comfortable hiring a car just use public transport. It is cheap and there is always a bus around the corner to take you around.If I had the money I would probably stay at a resort in Waikiki but if you are budget conscious then this is the place for you.Don't expect great things for the pool....just go to the beach or the Hilton Resort instead!

my husband i stayed at the Luana for our trip to Oahu. it was a great deal for the price since everything in Waikiki is expensive. the room was bigger and nicer than we expected. had a fridge and a ton of counter space, dishes, cutting knifes, ect. everything but a stove/microwave. we had our own lanai with 2 chairs.comfy couch as well in room. staff at hotel was very nice and helpful. as well as the concierge that set us up with transport to haunama bay. my only complaint was the restaurant. horrible service and food. and took a very long time to receive my greasy omlette. The hotel is close to the beach, just a few minutes walking.All n all i had a great time there and would stay again if I was in Waikiki and would love to check out one of their other properties in another location.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana for the first time Feb 22 - Mar 2, 2012 and we were very happy. We found the staff to be very helpful and kind, the room was very clean (that's all that really counts for us). Our room was a city view studio, however it had a great counter with sink, all the dishes, bowls you need with a small fridge and coffee maker. Although you cannot cook in this room category we had fruit, cereal, milk, cold cuts, cheese, pre-made sandwiches even a bbq chicken for those times that we just wanted to stay in and they brought us a kettle. We use the pool a lot and I watched them scrub that pool deck every morning from my lanai with a big buffer and we never had any trouble getting a deck chair. If the beach is for you it is a very short stroll to the beach. The staff knew "The Bus" system which is easy to use and cheap at $2.50 but can be crowded. We will stay there again and have no problem recommending the property!The hotel is an easy walk to all the major high end stores and is also an easy walk to Walmart or the Ala Mona Center for groceries, although we did find the ABC Stores to be pretty competative. Happy hours abound close by too.We are walkers so it takes about 1 hour to get to the base of Diamond Head, about an hour up to the top and back and another hour to complete the circle back to the hotel. It is worth the walk!

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki hotel for seven nights from February 5th to 12th in a studio room with a kitchenette. The room was exactly as advertised, but the hotel itself is an older though renovated building. This means, as others have pointed out, that there is no central air-conditioning. Instead one has a somewhat noisy unit in one’s room. While the bathroom had a large shower, there was no bathtub. A minor point perhaps, yet one that may be important to some.The hotel is located on Kalakaua Avenue which is the main drag in Waikiki. OK, so you are not on the beach but nothing is very far in Waikiki. Considering the climate of Hawaii, just about everything is within walking distance. All in all we had a good time.

The Outrigger Luana is part of the Outrigger series of hotels in Waikiki, and this one is a ten minute walk from the beach on Kalakaua Avenue. The hotel itself is average with clean large bedrooms, but small and slightly outdated bathrooms. The lobby also appears small for such a large hotel but it has a lot of seating. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and ready to help with whatever guest needs require their attention, whether it is directions to a restaurant, recommendations for activities, or early check-in. The major drawbacks to the hotel room were the cramped bathroom space, the cracks along the building's interior hall, and the old fashioned decor throughout the building. The rooms do have a medium sized refrigerator and are stocked with cutlery, dishes, and glassware. If renting a car, be aware that parking at the Luana is a steep $25/day charge. Its convenient location to other beach front hotel resorts and the active shopping areas on Kalakaua Avenue but slightly out of the main hubbub make it worthwhile.

Just stayed at the Luana for 5 nights while vacationing with family in Oahu. The hotel itself is just average when it comes to the room which has basic appointments. The bathroom was small and the decor a bit dated and in slight disrepair (cracks in the wall and paint discolorations). However, considering its location about 10 minutes to the beach and 5 minutes to high-end shopping and restaurants, the price makes the Luana a good value. The rooms and the hotel were clean, the staff friendly and helpful, and our room had a kitchenette with a small fridge, and plates, cups, and utensils, but no stove or microwave. We originally selected this hotel based on perceived value and though there is no direct beach access, or sweeping views from your room, the location is right at the edge of the action giving us what we wanted: access to the action, but just far enough to not get swept up in it. For value minded travelers, I would recommend this hotel.

Just stayed at Luana over President's weekend. The location was great, a short walk to a lot of food, bars and about 5 minutes to the beach. The rooms aren't anything fancy but they have everything you need, including a little kitchenette. The staff was friendly and accommodating the activities desk is very helpful and knowledgeable about things to do. The pool is very small, but who needs the pool when you have the beach right behind you. I only went to the pool to lay out and tan one day when I was too lazy to take the 5 minute walk to the beach. The fitness center is also decent. This hotel is one of the best options in the Waikiki area for the price.

I stayed in the outrigger from October 18th til the 29th 2011. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the fron desk. The lobby is a little dated but very well air conditioned throughout the hotel. The room was very clean, simple and very comfortable beds. It included a small kitchenette for making toast and coffee in the morning.there is a small freeze/fridge as well as a balcony overlooking the city with an ocean view!They have a well kept pool outside and a nice sun deck with towels put out every morning [front desk is happy to refresh your towels anytime!] and an outdoor bbq area next to the gym. There is also a reception area on the 2nd floor which has different events-wine tastings... Also it is a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach and right along the main strip close to lots of great shopping and restaurants! I went for nightly walks and discovered so many great places [Cheescake Factory, Ala Moana Center [the largest open air mall in the world] , Keos thai restaurant, and my favourite Italian restaurant Arancino- lobster to die for! Very high energy!! I walked through all the hotels around the city. Gorgeous gardens in the Hilton Hawiian Village with flamingoes, turtles, parrots, koi fish, penguins! Great prices for what you get! The front desk is very helpful and if you plan on extra activities its cheaper to book through this hotel. we did the North Shore shark cage diving as well as the dolphin/snorkelling catamaran tour. Both were amazing and picked us up in a shuttle and drove us back for an xtra fee. I would definately go back again and recommend it to everbody!!

We stayed here one night in a City/Park View hotel room (it faced the city). It was clean, comfortable, and was what I'd expect for the price we paid. I'm unsure what else we could have expected and found it to be great value. The fridge was a great size, even though we didn't need to use it. The coffee and tea selections were adequate; a few herbal tea options would have been a nice touch. The size of shampoo and conditioner provided were generous.Front counter staff were all pleasant. Could have done with a few more smiles, but we managed to elicit a few after the initial greeting.All in all, a good value experience. We will be staying there again for three nights in a few days' time when we head back to Waikiki, so I'll be interested to see if our experience is the same this time with a Partial Ocean View hotel room.

This year, we tried a 4 day stay at the Outrigger Luana in Waikiki. The views from this hotel are really great in that it overlooks Fort Derussy Park; some rooms would include an ocean view. The bed was the most comfortable one we've experienced in our travels. While we hadn't requested a suite with full kitchen, we were pleased to be provided with a fridge, toaster, dishes, cuttlery and coffee maker but no cooking facility. The kitchen and bath areas had granite countertops and marble surrounds. TV was a flat screen model. The lanai was rather small and there was a bit of a problem aligning the locks on the lanai door. There is a guest laundry area. The pool lounges had comfy mattresses on them. Now for the negatives: the pool is too cool, which is becoming an annoying complaint of visitors to Hawaii. The other concern is bus service could be more conveniently located. All in all, I'd recommend the Outrigger Luana based primarily on the hotel itself and it's picturesque location in Waikiki.

We thought we got a steal. From the valet parking up front, front desk and services we could not have ask for more. The room was like an efficiency apartment. Comfortable bed, dining table/chairs, granite counter top, dishes, frig, sleeper couch and balcony with ocean view. Location was great, shops and waikiki beach a walk away. For a busy street we were impressed at how quiet it was. The rates, (which we searched around for) were more than great and yes you have to pay for valet parking, but most hotesl in Honolulu charge for valet. Besides, they had our car to us usually within 30 seconds...no joke. Best of all was the service, EVERYONE there had a smile and made you feel welcome. Thank you again Outrigger Luana!

This was on my honeymoon so when I first open the door I was expecting a surprise rather it was a shock. The good: big fridge, LCD tv, iPod dock and an OK view. The bad:a double bed mattress seemed very old as we both felt like we were sinking into the bed and no we are not obese. We had uncomfortable sleepless nights and the streets were noisy we lost count how many times you could hear police sirens going off? The gym is fairly average air-con keeps going off so you had to keep to turning it on and the equipment is pretty average. The front desk staff are pretty dull and not as friendly as you expect them to be. The bell men at front are very nice and chatty though :) always saying hello they make up for bad service at front. Only one shop that's overpriced inside. 2 computers to share amongst all guest :(. In the bathroom you can't bloody turn the taps you will see what I mean if you go to luana. My partner and I think it's overpriced and overall we didn't feel it was clean the place has a weird old smell to it. Not a good experience at all what a shame. We moved to another hotel down the road as we didn't feel comfortable at luana. And not to mention the cutlery was dirty such as knives and spoons it was awful had to buy own cutlery!!

The good: Great location, small kitchen - The bad: double bed, very expensive valet only parking, needs to be renovated - The ugly: stained carpets, strange smells and noisy between rooms. Our stay was average at best.

We chose this over the military hotel right across the street because this hotel had kitchenettes. The room was spacious with a balcony that had beautiful views of the sunsets. Of course that rainbow every afternoon was a nice treat too. Clean room and helpful and friendly staff.Close to lots of activities The only caveat was the $25 daily parking fee. We used the military parking lot just around the corner instead( retired, and still watching the budget a bit).We plan to use this hotel chain again in our future travels.

Stayed for 6 nights in January 2012. For those people wondering if this is the place for you, it is if you want a nice place (but not 4 or 5 star luxury - think holiday Inn Express without breakfast) close (but not in) to all the real bustle. Hotel is on the main street for action in Waikiki about a 5 minute walk to the start of all the fancy shops (Coach, Juicy, Apple etc, etc - warning guys, there is lots and lots of shopping). the area is not scary and the only (well dressed) hookers we saw were right near the International Village. By the way, if anyone thinks Waikiki is second rate or that Oahu isnt a desirable destination let me help you out. Its awesome. Fab beaches, lovely people, good prices, terrific sites. Its clean (almost no litter) safe and did i mention those beaches?Ok back to the review. Room we had was nice - tile floor, queen bed, roomy kitchenette with bar fridge/freezer (very roomy - we found out why - these places are individually owned and then rented out under mgmt contract) with a small but servicable balcony and much needed a/c. the street is noisy at night but with the door closed and the ac on, it didnt matter.Pool area is smaller but certainly in scale with the hotel and with a nice sunning lounging area but we never used it. I mean have you seen Waikiki beach? Its awesome and only a 10 minite walk through the park. Didnt try the restaurant but others did and said it was fine. There was a coupon for 15% off in the little book we got at check in.Ok so if you are a value traveller with taste (and you know who you are, dont you?) go ahead and book this place. If we had bought this on priceline or hotwire it would be in the 3 to 3.5 star category.Money saving tips. the parking is high - 25 bucks per day and its valet so you gotta tip. Dont bother searching for options (like i did). If you have a car you will be parking it here. So, what to do? If you are on a really tight budget, get a bus or cab here and get around the town and island by bus. Or rent a car a day at a time for say two days of your visit. There is a rental place (Dollar) across the street and just rent it for the day and return it back that night. Do that for a couple days to tour the island and you are good as gold.Happy hours are great and oh so cheap. We had drinks/dinner at the Shereton Rumfire a couple nights. Its great and right on the water with free (and good) music. You should go! Dukes at the outrigger was also terrific and we went to the Kona brewery pub and the beer and natchos were top drawer. Its out of town a bit so you would need to drive. Also, you will want to put a few cold ones and some fruit and snacks in that handy kitchen. you could go to one of the many, many ABC stores and pay a lot - but does that sound like us? Nope, we found a local grocery store (a real one - safeway size) called the food pantry right in the thick of Waikiki and walked over there each day or so for supplies. its about a 10-15 minute walk away through interesting and non-scary streets. Its open until 1 am and the address is 2370 Kuhio Avenue which is on a road that starts across the street from the hotel. You must buy some pinappple - its out of this world.Also, sign up for Groupons and living social deals for Honolulu a couple months before your trip. We did and got some good deals on outings in particular a 90 minute catameran harbour sail for 10 bucks each. It was fun and the drinks were only 3 bucks each and left for in front of the Shereton.We walked up Diamond Head, drove to the North shore and Leeward coast and toured the Royal Palace free music Friday from the Royal orchastra. All terrific. Driving is fine, by the way. Drivers are courtious and the speeds are moderate. Get a decent map and you will be fine. Much better/nicer driving than any big mainland US city. There is a 700 booth swap meet at Aloha stadium a couple days each week and free fireworks friday night on the beach at 7.30 in front of the shereton. So, in summary, a great value hotel in a good location in a fantastic place. there are many places fancier but we will come back here. As for Wakiki and Oahu, youve made a great choice. Enjoy!

We just finished a 8 day stay at the Luana. We have been in Waikiki at 10 hotels and by far this was the cleanest, friendliest, and the best location in the area. It is not right on the beach, but a short walk through a lovely park to it. The staff is always helpful. There is no foot traffic through the hotel, so you can go to the pool and feel that you are not on view by everyone walking through to the beach. The parking staff is very helpful, and though there is a daily charge it is no higher than the standard fee, and you have in and out privileges. The cafe on the front of the hotel serves a nice breakfast and lunch and is like the rest of the hotel friendly and clean. If you want a wonderful location, a clean and comfortable room, and even a gift when they were told it was our wedding anniversary, this is the place to come. If we go back to Hawaii, we would not go anywhere else.

Hotel is walking distance from everything in Waikiki! Shops, beaches, restaurants, etc. Rooms were spacious and clean with extra sink and fridge. Staff is professional and friendly, and helpful. The valet guy even got us a limo taxi for our ride to the airport!

As a budget traveler, I was very happy to find a hotel like the Outrigger Luana. Room: We had a studio with kitchen on the 6th floor. The room was very clean, the bathroom spotless, the king-size bed comfortable, and there was a flat screen cable TV. The kitchen had a small fridge, microwave oven and electric burners, a toaster and coffee maker, so we were able to cook some meals. There was a fee to use the internet in the room, although there is free wireless in the lobby and in the pool area. The daily local newspaper was free for the taking.The room had a balcony, which looked out on the small triangle park at the Kalakaua/Kuhio split (King David Kalakaua statue), and has a (somewhat obscured by other hotels) view of the mountains and the city. I watched the MLK parade from the balcony. The drawback of this room location is the street noise, so we could not sleep with an open balcony door and had to resort to using A/C. With the door closed, it was very quiet, but the A/C was loud. Next time I will request a room on the backside of the hotel. Amenities:The outdoor pool is on the first floor and was never crowded when I was there. There is no jacuzzi, but a nice sundeck with a BBQ pit that guests can use. There is also a nice fitness center by the pool.Service: Everyone at the Luana was very helpful and friendly, from the desk clerks and valet parking to the housekeeping personnel. I can't say enough about this, as this is not always the case in Waikiki hotels.Location: As other posters have already mentioned, the hotel is not smack dab in the middle of the bustling Waikiki tourist strip but a few minutes' walk from it. It is also not by the beach, which is a 5-10 minute walk (depending on one's pace) through the Fort de Russy park right behind the Luana. My husband had an easy 10 minute walk to his conference at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is also less than a mile from the Ala Moana shopping mall, also an easy walk. The Bus stop is across from the hotel on Kuhio St, and route # 2 takes you not only to Ala Moana mall but to some of the tourist attractions like the Iolani Palace and Kamehameha statue. Plus: great value, very clean, very friendly service, good locationMinus: charge for internet use in room, $25 parking per night

We stayed at the Luana in January 2012 for almost a week. The hotel is not a new property, but was very clean and well kept. We liked the style. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The location was at one end of the Waikiki strip, which was nice, as slightly less touristy than many other Waikiki locations, and only about 3-4 blocks from the beach.The 2-person room was large enough to not be cramped, and the bed was better than 90+% of the hundreds of hotel beds I have slept in. The rooftop pool/patio area (about 2 floors above street level) were nice, clean, and well kept; they were also kid friendly. We enjoyed the use of the (free) barbecue grill. We bought food several times at the Food Pantry market about 7 blocks from the hotel, and were able to eat well and (relative to eating out) cheaply. Note - bring food from home - Hawaii caused sticker shock for us small-town US midwesterners. If we come again, we'll bring less clothes and more food! The in-room refridgerator was large enough to be really useful. We were able to save on breakfast by using hot water from the coffee maker to make instant oatmeal. The staff were helpful and used their microwave for us on a couple of occasions.One negative I found - the hotel was rather noisy in the early morning a few days, which made sleeping after 7 am a challenge.Bottom line - we found the Outrigger Luana to be a pretty nice spot and a great value. We'll likely use the Outrigger Luana again if we return to Oahu.

Hi I recently stayed at this hotel and I must say it was not modern like the ones on the strip but the staff there were very helpful, the room was clean and had good space with cooking facilities, about a 10 min from the beach at the far end of the strip which is full of designer shops as well as nick nac shops. I am pleased with the location as it was not smack in the middle of all the bar's etc so if you are looking to be more in the centre choose another hotel although thisis only 10 mins to the centre of all shops and bars, Beaches are beautiful but I found the charge of the sun beds a bit steep 25 dollars for 1/2 day rental so check prices before you hire. but all round loved the hotel and location. The pool was not very big only about 19 sun beds and sun there late afternoon.I was also on a cruise Pride of America which food was good, rooms small but clean, drinks around 6/7 dollars, casual was the dress which wish i had know before I went as took far to many evening clothes which really wasn't required. could not find anywhere to write an individual review for this ship would recommend.......

Frankly speaking, after seeing hotel around this one, we were happy about our stay in Luana. You will notice many of other hotels are situated along the main street which is very noisy.Me and my husband (29 and 45 y.o.) were in this hotel from Jan. 1 to 7, 2012. We booked a hotel room with a kitchenette (ocean view), but were upgrated to a studio with a kitchen on the 8th floor ocean view, and were completely satisfied about it. It was not brand new, but very clean and really nice. The only problem as many people mentioned is the traffic noise, but we slept well.However, if you are thinking about this room for an extended family (with a child or children), then I wonder if the sofa bed that is in the living room would be good, because it has two pillows that are not comfortable to sleep on.I do not know where the people who say the hotel was dirty stayed. The hotel was clean and nice. The people who are working there are helpful and patient.The parking is only valet, 25 USD per night, efficient and fast.If I stay in Honolulu again, I will stay in Outrigger Luana, - other hotels didn't look better, but were more expensive.

Hotel is durty n stuff is careless.We are here for 12 day stay with my 3 kids. N floors are very durty when they clean it looks like nothing was done .. I will not never stay in this company.. Service is got to be a night mare....Manuel serna ..

When this trip was booked we wen into panic only 2 days out and switched to this venue. We had heard that some hotels in the main drag were noisy at night. This was by far the friendliest hotel and best decision we ever made. An easy stroll up to the main drag but much quieter at night. We looked over the park and out to the ocean. The staff here became our friends and we too knew all of them by name when we returned we even send them Chrissie cards. Nothing was too much for these incredible staff. If our family from Oz rang they would chat and tell them where we were that day. I left my heart in Hawaii and when we go back possibly later this year we will stay at the same venue. Oops! don't tell them I still have the key. Hope Chris and Micah and Kenzl are still there when we return. You know what they say if your lei goes back to the shore you are going to return mine did and I am.

We spent part of our honeymoon in Hawaii, this hotel was fantastic. Free coffee and pastries in the morning (get there early!) lovely pool (smallish, but really nice) with a great sun terrace. Great location, not right on the strip which would be noisy. Within walking distance of all of the good shops and restaurants, next to the park and beaches close-by. Our room had a kitchenette, which was brilliant. We will definitely be going back one day!

The service was great-with a very nice welcome. The hotel rooms were very nice and some include kitchenettes. The location is very good! This was a first-class hotel experience and I would recommend it as a choice hotel. This made our trip to Hawaii very enjoyable!

Reserved a 1 bedroom suite with very nicely appointed kitchen. Next to peaceful park and close walk to shopping, the beach & restaurants. Staff are friendly & helpful especially valet & concierge. We didn't use the pool as we went to the beach each day but did use the bbq grills for dinner. Comfortable bed & sleeper sofa, two veranda's, very clean. Bathroom is large; access is via the bedroom. We would stay at the Outrigger Luana again.

The hotel is in a great location, close to restaurants and shopping. The rooms were great with clean sheets, but the bathroom was small and could use some updates. We were on the 4th floor and I could hear the noise from the road, the culprit being the windows. A car alarm woke me up at 4am in the morning and I could not sleep for the rest of the night (I am a light sleeper). I have stayed in many downtown hotels where the noise insulation was much better.The hotel had kitchen utensils, silverware, refrigerator, but no microwave! We did not ask for one as we stayed there only one day. Note that parking is valet only and $25/day. And there are no ramps / elevators to take the luggage to the lobby - you have to carry it on the short flight of stairs at the main entrance into the lobby. The folks at the front desk were very polite and helpful and I was quite happy with the service, but then we did not have much requests from them.

We are are on day 7 of our 9 day stay at the Outrigger Luana. We have a studio suite with a kitchenette and a partial ocean view. We couldn't be happier with the room. The kitchen is truly a kitchen with quality appliances and decent cookware and plates. Everything we need to keep dining costs down in a costly city. We love enjoying toast or a bagel with our coffee in the morning before we head out. A couple of scrambled eggs are a snap as well.The facility is not brand new, but certainly well maintained. The pool area is very nice. The lobby is simple but again, attractive and well maintained. The service staff are excellent; very friendly and efficient. While they appear to be a separate company the valet attendants are superb. They know us know and are prompt and so cheerful.The Outrigger Luana is a great value and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

this is a nice clean older hotel for a reasonable price, centrally locatedeast balconies overlook Fort DeRussy military base with views of the ocean 1/4 mile awayrooms are a good size and are clean with microwaves and fridgesit is a bit noisy from the street below and it's a bit of a walk to the oceanthe pool is clean and a little cold. The exercise room is decent.there is a good little restaurant in front for breakfast only. A nice Thai place across the road with a Tony Romas down the street, otherwise not much else close byshopping is a bit of a walk to the designer stores on Kalakaua avethe hotel is good 3 star for a couple of nites if you don't mind not being on the beach

I was in Waikiki last January on business and was able to stay at a couple of high-end hotels on the beach. This time I was on my own nickel and looking for a hotel with the best balance of quality, convenience, and (relatively) low price. I read a lot of reviews before choosing the Outrigger Luana. The mostly very good reviews have proved accurate. The recent reference to "underrated gem" is a good one IMO. If you're looking for a big, flashy, new hotel, go elsewhere. From its small lobby to modest rooms, it won't wow you. But if you want to save a few bucks while staying in perfectly nice accomodations in a good location, choose Luana. Trying to picture the location before I got here, I was pleasantly surprised how close it really is to the stores and restaurants --the high-end Kalakaua strip begins just 1 1/2 blocks away. On the other hand, while you are on the ocean side of Kalakaua and do not have to cross a street to get to the beach, it is a good though pleasant 10 minute walk thru Fort DeRussey Park to get there. Even though I am in a corner room on the first floor (which is 2 floors above the ground) and facing the street I have not been bothered by noise. An unexpected benefit of what might seem a bad room selection is that the first floor rooms have larger, more private balconies. The handy kitchenettes in the room make for very convenient sun-bathing - just pop in and grab something to eat or drink.

A really nice, older hotel. We booked a "city view" room and got a fantastic AAA price. The room # 319 was absolutely the noisiest hotel room that we have ever stayed in. We could not upgrade for the night because there was no availability of other rooms. The Outrigger Luana website should provide far more information about the noise that is generated on the street below, particularly the motorcycles and the gas station below. It was a nice hotel, and a nice room. It was just so noisey that we had a hard time sleeping.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. We just moved to HI and our housing was not ready so decided to stay in Waikiki to see what the tourist side is like. The hotel is at the beginning of all the tourist areas. It is about a mile from the beach, which is not bad, it is a nice walk. Nearby are nice places to eat and things to do. It is also near shopping. The price was reasonable and the view was good, had a partial ocean view which overlooked a park, the strip, and a great view of sunsets! Also the room had a kithenette which would have been of use if we had stayed longer but it was nice to have. THe concierge service was good, always able to point us in the right direction. The only negative is that there were no restaurants in the hotel which I would have liked, some of the other outriggers had buffets and other eateries/coffee shops. Would I stay again, yes.

Not your 5-star hotel with many restaurants and other amenities, but this venue is perfect if you want a place that is convenient to Waikiki beaches, shopping, and other hotels; is compact and personable; has a home-feel to it (we had a kitchenette studio), and enough amenities that other bigger hotels offer: exercise room, swimming pool, launderette, gift shop, internet service with two PCs/printer in the lobby, free wi-fi in the rooms, and a small restaurant at the entrance that serves breakfast and lunch. We'd preferred a self-parking garage, but the valet service was excellent and efficient. We've stayed at many moderate/smaller-sized hotels in Honolulu and find this to be one of the better-valued hotels in that class. It is certainly one that we would consider on a return trip!

I had the great pleasure of staying at the Outrigger Luana in Waikiki. It has been many years since I lived here and I could not find the hotel (things have really changed). I called the front desk from my car and was literally talked right in. What great service. The staff is great. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I cannot wait to come back again.

We first stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki in 2010 and were so impressed with the property and service that we booked it again for 2011. From the location (quiet but easy walking distance to beach, park, shops, restuarants) to the large, comfortable and clean rooms (with views) to the outstanding service and friendliness of the staff - this is has become our "go to" hotel when we visit our family in Oahu. The only negative for us was the somewhat noisy (but well working and powerfull) wall unit A/C; but we did not need it much with large sliding door with balcony.

Very clean room and comfortable beds. I had a partial ocean view room , with a lovely view of the city lights at night. The pool area was nice too , not overcrowded with plenty of chairs. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend the Outrigger Luana for comfort,good location and reasonable price. Nice location next to the park and easy walk to shopping and Ala Moana centre.

Traveled to Honolulu with my mother-in-law to celebrate her birthday. Wanted to stay in Waikiki a few days before spending the remaining with family at their houses. Did not want to be smack in the middle of Waikiki but on either far end. Great location. Directly behind Fort De Russey park area & Hale Koa Hotel. Chose a kitchenette with partial ocean view- lucky to get 12th floor with wonderful view and great amenities.

For the price you pay, you can't find a better place in Waikiki. Staff was real friendly. Didn't care for being reqired to have valet parking for $25/day, but such is life in that area of town. A tricky place to find, we got there late at night the first day and had to circle three times before finding the tiny driveway just past the Aloha station to get into this place. But after we were in the staff was accomodating, the room was clean, and sound-proofing was pretty good. Beds were quite nice also with soft sheets, which isn't always the case as we found out staying in other places on our trip.

Service: The bell-hop and concierge were lovely and great - the concierge, Karla, helped us organise all our tours, booked our restaurants and gave us advice on where to go, etc. Excellent service! The other front desk staff were friendly and OK as well - just not a great.Room: The room we got was on level 3 so it got pretty noisy in the mornings with the traffic outside. We couldn't really sleep and got up around 6 am - 7 am most mornings - which isn't too bad as we got to the beach early before the crowd. The room had an airconditioner but it was rather loud. The room was clean and the cleaners are lovely. The bathroom is a bit dated and had no ventilation. There was a little kitchenette area with cutlery avaiable. No cooking utentsils or stove or microwave so you can't really cook in there.Location: The location is quite good - it's at the start of the strip next to a park so it's a bit quieter which is great. The nearby beach is a little rockier than the central beaches but it's a nice walk and not far at all to get there. Beach towels are provided. There's an ABC store close by incase you need anything. There's also a small pool on the first floor but we didn't use it - use the beach!

My wife & I came to Honolulu for our honeymoon.
