I read the reviews on Tripadvisor and spoke with our travel agent, and she also recommended the Ourtrigger Luana Waikiki as it many of the features that we were looking for, such as a kitchen to prepare some quick meals, close enough to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but far enough away that we wouldn't be kept up all night long due to noise, and the price was more than affordable.Upon arrival, we were greeted by the friendly bell hop/valet. We weren't sure if we were going to be able to check in early, as we had arrived about 4 hours prior to check-in time, but were very pleased when we immediately were given our room keys. Our 8th floor, studio partial-ocean view condo was very nice and clean. The view overlooking Fort DeRussy Beach Park towards the Pacific Ocean was absolutely beautiful. Our only small complaint of our room was that the air conditioning unit was a little loud, but I wouldn't have traded it for the world as it kept the room cool, even in the 38°C heat (corrected for humidity).We visited the concierge, Angela, who was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in giving us advice for places to eat and booking us on some amazing tours. We were even able to book a few tours through her for our following week on Maui, as she was originally from the island, so she had a vast amount of knowledge on what to do and see there.The restaurant, Protea Cafe, located just outside the lobby entrance, was excellent for a quick breakfast. They are only open for breakfast and lunch (7am to 2pm). There is not a lot of seating, but it was nice to be able to sit and chat with likewise travellers at the over-sized common table, or at one of the handful of other tables. The food was very tasty and I would highly recommend the Amazon Acai Bowl.The Outrigger Luana Waikiki, in our mind, is in a great location, and of exception quality for the price-point. We will definitely stay here again on future trips and would highly recommend it to our family and friends.

We arrived about 5 hours before the check in time of 3pm, but luckily we were able to get into our room a couple of hours early due to the previous occupants having already checked out. The room itself is of a very decent size and with all amenities/facilities you'd expect. I did notice the bathroom floor was not as clean as it could have been, most notably quite a few black hairs on the floor. No room service is offered and sometimes the hallway noise was a little loud. One bed had an awful scratchy woolen blanket, the other a fluffy soft one. However, these minor room complaints did not affect our overall satisfaction with our stay seeing as this hotel is so affordable, yet just minutes by foot from the beach and central Waikiki. In fact, the hotel is situated on the quieter end of Waikiki where you still get access to all that Waikiki has to offer but might sleep a bit more soundly at night than some other hotels' guests.Hotel staff was friendly enough and the valet parking convenient. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

I booked this room as it made sense for my wife and I to spend a night in Oahu after spending the week in Maui due to the timing of our international flight. I was looking for a clean affordable place near Waikiki. I had stayed at Outrigger properties before and they generally are nice hotels. The staff was nice and the location on Waikiki was hat I was looking for. The room is basic with a sink. The bellman said it was an upgraded Motel 8 but that part was fine. What I had an issue with was the traffic noise from the street; the motorcycle engines revving next door; the noise from the hallways; the noise from water running through the pipes. I was hoping to get a good night's sleep but no luck. I called the front desk but was told there was nothing they could do so we put up with it for the night. If I was staying longer than a night, I would have changed hotels. A good night's rest had to wait until we got home.

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki in Honolulu. It was our first visit to Hawaii and our main concern was cleanliness due to the stories we had heard about bed bug infestations. The Luana was exceptionally clean and very well maintained. Rooms were small, we had a kitchenette which was furnshed with everything you would need to prepare meals. Housekeeping was very efficient. I liked the area as it was quiet and near a few C-Stores where you could pick up snacks and food. I would recommend the Outrigger Resorts to anyone looking for cleanliness and a good value.

I stayed at the Outrigger Luana from October 5 through 11. Although not a resort in any way, I found the Waikiki location (the end of luxury row) to be truly ideal. Luana is situated on a quiet but extremely safe block of the main thoroughfare Kalakaua Avenue, adjacent to the very well kept and lovely Fort DeRussy Park. It is important to note that one of Waikiki"s dirty secrets is the sheer number of prostitutes lining the main streets beginning at 9pm nightly. This is particularly odd as the high end shopping (Cartier, etc) is open until about 11 pm. So it is quite conceivable that you will come strolling out of a luxury boutique with your signifigant other and happen upon an unsavory transaction. While more luxe than the humble Luana, the Moana Surfrider and Grand Hyatt suffer from a problem of agressive streetwalkers hovering about their entrance.. The Luana doesn't have this problem, so that is a plus, and sadly a rarity in Waikiki. Now onto the rooms themselves, I personally enjoy the signature Outrigger aesthetic, full of islands theme lamps etc, after all, I want to feel like I'm in Hawaii. What I did not enjoy about the rooms were the small bathrooms and bathtubs. Also I found it bizarre that there was a fully equipped kitchenette, with no microwave or burner. The beds were quite comfortable, and housekeeping was thorough.Lastly, I must talk about the customer service. Moat of the front desk staff were helpful (particularly John who works late night). However the worst service that I received during my entire stay in all of Hawaii was from Lily Tran, the gratuitously nasty front desk manager. Once, she brutally scolded me when I asked for directions, shocking both me and my fiance, and on my last day she was again rude and unhelpful. I suppose I am not alone, as ive noticed that several other recent TripAdvisor reviews have been unimpressed with Luana management. I personally hope that company promotes the gentle John while retraining the sarcastic and mean Ms.Tran in the art of customer service (or at least common manners ).Summing up, one rude employee would not turn me off from staying here. Although if money is no issue, then I also recommend the Kahala for the finest that Honolulu has to offer.

We stayed eight days. Great location close enough to walk to the beach, restaurants and public transport across the street. Room was clean, there was a small fridge, plates etc, no microwave but adequate for light snack. Staff were great. We were given access to showers and luggage storage as we did not leave until 7pm. Free wifi and two apple computers in the business centre. No charge for the extra person in our room for three nights.

Stayed here for a weekend. Location is ideal for those looking to be near the action of Waikiki but still want some peace and quiet. Our room had a view of the park which made the stay a bit better. The room came with a kitchenette, sink, mini refrigerator, utensils. Very nice looking with a Hawaiian theme but not over the top. It came with a safe which was a bonus. The bathroom was a tad small but the size of the room made up for it. If you have AAA/AARP make sure you reserve the room using the discount, it will save you a bundle. The staff were all very friendly, even the valet who we made work. Not once did I get a complaint, or a sigh or a rolling of the eyes when we asked for our car. Free wi-fi in the room is a huge plus in my opinion. Also the business center lets you print out your boarding passes, reservations, or car rental documentation for free. That speaks volumes about the service and the class of the hotel. Their is a cafe inside the hotel whose food is fantastic!My only complaint was that we had to book an extra day as our flight out of Honolulu was not until well after check out time. We asked if there was some way or something that could be done to accommodate us, we were told yes book an extra day. That brought down the rating a little bit, they could/should have at least let us stash our bags someplace until it was time for us to leave. The hotel was not that busy so I did not understand why they could not accommodate us.Overall I would recommend this place to others and if I came back I would stay here again.
user_name:
mattf06
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel rooms smell a bit musty but that's pretty much my only complaint. Great value for the room - comfortable size, CLEAN, fresh towels everyday. The staff were friendly and very accommodating - after checkout, we asked if we could lounge in the pool deck for a couple hours and were given access to do so. Good location - right next to a gas station for snacks/water; across the street from restaurants and a short walk from Thrifty/Dollar Rental. Parking was a bit expensive but for 1-2 nights, not a big deal. Would stay at this place again for sure.

Me and my wife stayed for five days at the Luana. Nice boutique hotel. Nice lobby, room was average size. One complaint was the water in the shower, had to fidgit for awhile to get the right temperature, but no big deal. Fairly poor management. My wife and I were getting changed for dinner in our room, when another couple walked right in?? We phoned the front desk and asked how this can happen. They said someone accidently double booked our room and apologized. We asked to speak to the manager because this was unacceptable, but never heard back from anyone. Aside from that, a decent hotel with good location. Would not stay here again because of the manager not getting back to us about our complaint.

After reading previous reviews, I felt like choosing this hotel was a risk.....NOT! :-) the moment we stepped in for check-in, I just concluded that I did the right choice since my main goal was to find a hotel at the end of the strip, away from the central crowd but not far from it as well. And since it's the end of the strip, I can walk from end to end without missing a single shop :-) and in coming back I walk the other side of the street..still not missing any single shop. We got an excellent one bedroom room 1507..overlooking the greens of fort de russey, which is also a good place to jog, and there's 2 tennis courts in the park, I'm not sure if it's free but looks like it. We saw neighboring hilton's fireworks from our balcony which runs from the bedroom to the living room...we had full kitchen were we cook light breaky which is good way to save some money. We can also see the ocean, only 5 mins or less walking distance.. The hotel has a little pool and gym area. Free wifi is really a big bonus since some hotels charge you. Altho I was able to use mine just for one night because I had issues with my iPad which they also willingly helped me resolve, but unfortunately just didn't happen.. But the gesture was really a big plus! Good costumer service indeed. Rooms were cleaned everyday too. Altho yeh, I hear garbage trucks and buses starting to pass by earlier than my waking hours but hey it's Hawaii, wake up early and enjoy the morning sun and clear water! So I didn't let it bother me. During the last day, our trip coming home was still at 8:30pm so they were nice enough to inform us that if we get tired before then, we can stay at their mezzanine and relax in their comfy chairs watching shows in their big screen tv, which we did and I even doze a little bit :-) our luggage was left in their concierge so we don't have to carry them while waiting for the time. And yes, they also told us if ever we need to take a bath during those times after check out, we can always use their bathroom by the pool.. Very accommodating indeed! It seems that they know that there are really people who's return flights are even later than their check out, so they came up with this option :-) We took a taxi going to the airport, costing $33 and we just gave tip as well. We rented a car overnight, and since the hotel charges $25 for parking, and because one of the helpful reviews here said there's a $5 place for overnight parking in a post office near this hotel, we looked for it and to our great surprise it's just almost behind the hotel , which is like 2 mins walk :-) all in all, I'll come back to this hotel if given a chance and yes, I'd recommend it to others as long as the good service I got will not change and if not, even better :-)

We have just returned from staying in Outrigger Luana and have to say how pleasantly surprised we were with the quality and location of this hotel. We had a one bedroom apartment on the 5th floor which was large with views of both the city and the sea. The kitchen was well equipped and modern. The hotel is only a short walk from the centre of Waikiki and a pleasant 10 minute walk through a park to the beach. We found the staff very knowledgeable about the area and keen to help with any questions.Reading other reviews it seems to depend which room you are allocated as to the experience you have. We had a corner room on the 5th floor which had lovely views and was quiet so didn't have any problems.One nice touch is the drinks machine in reception which contains iced water with fruit in which is very welcome after a day out in the hot sun.

The standard room is pretty impressive. Ours was spacious and had a kitchenette with a small refrigerator, a couch, and a lanai with 2 chairs. The floor was tile, which I thought was a nice touch. We were able to check in early at 1 PM. I was also pleased to receive a complimentary paper. The beach is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There is a small pool, but it's not very impressive. The only cons were the expensive parking ($25/night) and the loud traffic. Parking was confusing as well as the entrance and the exit are counterintuitive. The valet was fairly rude when we were confused as to where to pull in. Overall, the hotel was a good value and a comfortable stay.

In a great position next to the park with beach views. Older Polynesian style which we loved. we had a large corner room on the 9 th floor with a kitchenette which was ideal. The staff were friendly and efficient....rooms expertly cleaned daily, always lots of fresh towels and incredibly comfortable beds and clean sheets almost daily!Small pool area but good for a cool down after a day exploring the wonderful island of Oahu!

I've stayed here numerous times on business. They really get it right...my only complaint is that their parking is a rip off. That said, I find the rooms to be very comfortable, the bathrooms are immaculate and the internet works great.If I could change one thing, I wish they upgrade their aircon units. Man, these things are loud. They have them situated in the corner of the outside wall...so the cold air never reaches the bathroom. And, when you are using your computer at the desk, the aircon is blowing directly on you...again, being a business traveller, I probably notice more that a vacationer.Great location to reach all of the restaurants and bars - you can walk anywhere and be there in a few minutes.Staff is generally very reserved, not overly nice, but professional.By the way...if you don't mind a short (5 minute walk) you can get a 3 day parking pass at the Hale Koa parking garage for $16 per day. Sure beats the $25 plus tips at the Luanna!

Loved this Hotel, will be going back with family next year, roomy, sleeps 6, clean and had its own kitchen and laundry, great pool area, very quiet, 5 mins walk to waikiki beach and International market

Hotel was decent for the price, but the parking was a rip off! also don't ever make any deals with the Bell Man Anthony,as he will approach you to see if he can make a side cash deal with you for parking for less than the hotel charges, because he will retract the offer later due to him lying to you, so whatever you do, Do not let him try and make a deal with you on the parking cause he will screw you!!

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 1 week. When we first came to the room we found terrible rotten smell there. Staff found that some food was left in the sink and we waited for an hour before it was finally cleaned and air in the room became a normal. Bathroom was not very clear, we found dirt on the faucets and black hairs on towels.On the first day Internet was not working in all rooms, it was also down many times during our visit.Elevators are old and slow.Shower was designed for a 5 foot tall person, so if you are taller you need to bend to take a shower.One day we had a plumbing leak in the bathroom so I have very unpleasant experience with toilet water from the room above dripping on my head.Hotel is a no smoking, but when someone smoked on their balcony in we can feel it in our room so we need to keep balcony'd door closed. Since balconies are not isolated from each other you can smell what people cooking in the next room.

We originally stayed at a hotel across the road and it was totally unsatisfactory so, desperately wanting out of there we found the number of the reservation desk and Margaret on the other end, hooked us up with this amazing hotel.The rooms are clean, bright and inviting with tons of space. We were also lucky to have a "partial ocean view" but we could see all of it and made for a pleasant coffee morning. The staff are super helpful and friendly and gave us towels for the beach, delivered our luggage to the door and were generally very chatty.They have other good amenities such as a laundry area (you can buy detergent in the lobby shop as well as other toiletries you may need), a gym, a pool, a bbq area, a spa and salon incase your nails need a rescue!I could say more but I think prospective guests have to see it for themselves.

we stayed at this hotel early august. the hotel is very friendly and the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable, however, the aircondition is noisy. the hotel has a nice pool which gets the sun in the afternoon and there is a small but well equipped gym. the location is 5-6 minutes walk from the beach and about 10-12 minutes walk from waikiki main beach. there is only a small cafe in the actual hotel no other restaurants however, there are plenty of restaurants and bars around the area so no real problem. value for money.

We loved this hotel because:* The employees were very very nice* They have beach gear (boogie boards, beach mats, beach chairs, etc) that previous guests left behind that they loan out to current guests for free.* The restaurant attached to the lobby has delicious food.* It is adjacent to a park, which was great fun for the kids.* Valet parking was very fast and friendly.* The location is great - because of the park, it's quiet, but it's an easy walk to anywhere in the Waikiki area. There is a convenience store/gas station next door, as well.* Very quiet rooms.

if you stay in this hotel dont accept room 107 as this room is opposite the ice machine and washing machine and drinks vending machines people leaving the door open all night the lady who works in the hotel coming for ice at 5.20am every morning echoing all over the hotel spoke to manager about noise he put a small notice on the door other than that not interested could not wait to move out of hotel

We stayed at the Luana Waikiki for 7 nights. Before I confirmed the booking I made it very clear that there were 2 couples staying in the room, and that I required 2 proper beds, not sofas/trundles/bunks. This was confirmed, but when we checked in, one of the beds was a sofa - initially very disappointed, but it turned out that the sofa bed was okay, but still not as good as a bed. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit (14th Floor) with a kitchen and oceanview, it was comfortable and serviced daily. Most units are privately owned, so what the owner supplies in the unit, is it, - our unit didn't have a kettle - strange. The Hotel is located within a 5 minute work of the beach, and main street of Waikiki. All the pick up points for the tours, and the shuttle trolleys/buses to the shops (Ala Moana) are very close. There are hotels on the beach that are closer to the shops, but you pay a higher daily rate. The Hotel itself was very clean, the pool was great, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We liked the location because it was away from the hussle and bussle of the main street, but close enough - you need to walk a bit, because the food available is excellent - do not miss the Cheese Cake Factory, and P F Changs. Angela and the other customer service staff at the front desk tour section were wonderful and extremely helpful. Be advised that if you rent a vehicle you will have to pay $25 per day to park it at the Hotel - this, I am told, is pretty standard.

Booked a room w/kitchinette and partial ocean view, and room was as described, functional and comfortable. The small kitchen had all the basics a couple could need for making simple meals, a table was adequate for 2 to eat, the TV a big screen LCD, the bathroom small with shower-in-tub. Internet was complimentary and reasonablly fast. Check-in was fast and easy. A lovely little coffee shop/restaurant was attached to the hotel and located right outside the entry to the hotel.All-in-all could have been a perfect Waikiki spot was it not for the flaws: - Shower was temperamental and oscillated between working and returning to faucet  with no effect by manipulating the shower handle.- Houskeeping was consistently poor-to-non existent No sign of housekeeping what-so-ever day 1 No fresh towels/bathroom soaps day 2  No cleaning of tile floor in kitchen area 3/3 days (unable to walk barefoot without  hitting t the same sticky spots and getting dirt from days prior on feet). No cleaning in kitchen area glasses 3/3 days- Had to remove huge cockroach from bathroom day 1- Elevator problems all 3 days, with one of the 3 being out of order and status display in  elevator out of order showing "L" no matter what floor you were at.- Only one Ice machine on Pool level in laundry room.So in conclusion: the facilities are there to make for a comfortable stay, but the consistent poor housekeeping in particular is a turn-off. And the cockroach did not help the Mrs's confidence in the overall cleanliness even though I told her she was in the "Tropics"!.

I stayed in the Outrigger Luana for 15 nights on business. By the end of the trip, it felt like home. I didn't want to leave.The location is perfect. It's on the main drag through Waikiki, so everything is in walking distance. Shopping, food, the beach. However, it's at the very end of the touristy part of the main drag, so it's fairly quiet.The price was good. It has a nice pool, but no hot tub. It also has coin laundry facilities, which are a must for a long trip. They provide free newspapers outside the elevators on every floor. There are two computers for public use and they will print & fax for a small fee.I stayed in a studio kitchenette on the 5th floor. Small balcony. The bed was comfortable. Free wifi. Flat screen tv. LOTS of storage space. A fairly comfortable couch and a table for two. The bathroom was fine, except that it lacked an exhaust fan. The kitchenette consisted of a microwave, two burner stove, cofffee maker, sink (w/ dish soap, sponge, & drying rack), and mini-fridge. I saved a lot of money and extra pounds by not having to eat out every meal for 15 days.Anthony works in the hotel and as a valet. Jacob works as a valet. Both were exceptionally helpful & very friendly. They got to know me and my preferences, greeted me every morning with a smile, and were always available to lend a hand. Housekeeping did a good job. It was very clean. The front staff were mostly unremarkable.I will definitely stay there again.

We had a great week staying at this hotel. The kitchenette came in handy for taking care of breakfast, although the sticky buns from the coffee shop across the street were delicious. The staff was always very helpful and friendly. (Staff stored our luggage for free and gave us access to the showers by the pool on the day that we were leaving so that we had a homebase after we had checked out of our room.) The room was clean and perfect for our needs. The sliding door to the balcony was difficult to open, but if that is the worst I can say, than it wasn't a huge deal. The pool area was nice and usually quiet. The location is great. Out of the crowd, but walk a couple of minutes and your in the thick of things. The beach is an easy walk to get to. (Ask the staff about borrowing an umbrella or other items that they have in a storage area.)Thrifty car rental is across the street to rent a car for day trips and bus routes are nearby.

have just returned back to australia from a 30 day vacation in alaska & hawaii 18 nights spent at the outrigger luana were over the last twenty odd years(previously waikiki terrace) we have been frequent guests We have always recommended this hotel to our friends because of its location and friendly staff.Travelling with friends this year we were all disappointed with the manners and rudeness of little ryan at the front desk as all the other staff are exceptionally friendly , cheer full and help full This lad should make sure he knows what is going on before he gives advice , and when guests are checking out and have just payed out a couple of thousand odd dollars a smile and a simple thank you we think would be appropriate Maybe management could provide counselling to him and make him aware that we are helping to pay his wages, as it is a shame to have a very relaxing holiday and leave unhappy because of bad manners .Having said this we still recommend this hotel ( kassell and the rest of the front desk staff are tops)clean close to everything good beds and nice surrounds

We spent two nights here. I am not that fond of Waikiki because it is so overpriced and touristy. We are from another Hawaiian island and when we HAVE to go to Honolulu it is difficult to escape the tourist scene. This hotel offers well priced rooms, good location. The restaurant is not a typical "hotel restaurant" it is more a hole in the wall. We did not eat there, so cannot comment on the food. The room was comfortable and clean. Very adequate but at this price we did not expect "over the top" resort-style rooms. The valet parking seems a bit expensive ($25 a day) considering we were ony paying (special HI resident rate) of $99 a night. All it all, though, it is a good place if you can get a decent price. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Nearby Derussy park very pleasant with access to the beach.

We stayed here for 4 nights and we were glad to be leaving. Overall it was a fine hotel, decent price, decent location. But when it comes to some of the small things they added up. We checked in quite late (after a 6 hour flight delay) and the guy at the front desk was pushy and inconsiderate. The room was fine but the shower was made for a 5 foot tall person. So short you could barely have a shower. We booked an excursion through the activity desk which was very useful, but my husband and I both felt like we were being pushed into booking all of our activities there. It's obvious they have a deal with the other companies. All we kept hearing was "well you should book that soon they fill up fast. Would you like to book that right now with me? It's better to book it all here."When we finally check out the final shocker was our bill. We had paid our hotel previously so we weren't expecting any charges. Not the case ... Apparently, local phone calls are $.99 a piece! So calling to confirm our shuttle and car rental, etc. cost us $2.97! Couldn't believe it.

The room we stayed in was a studio style but on a lower floor (not my preference). There was advantage in having your own kitchen (no cooking faciliites, but grills are available outside). The bed was comfortables, the room has free wifi, the bathroom was OK. The hotel has been renovated at a high level (flat TVs, new beds etc.) but the bathroom fittings were old.I would stay again if only for the value, although is is a few blocks walk to the beach,

The staff was amazing...courteous, friendly, and helpful! Impressed by the cleanliness and decor. Great Kama'aina Rates...the hotel is only 30 minutes from home, but if felt like a vacation! Will definitely be back!

Our room on the 14th floor overlooking the park/ocean was pretty quiet (hotel is in noisy neighborhood). The room had marble floors, granite countertops, tropic-themed furniture, well-supplied kitchen cabinets and a fridge, even though our room did not have a kitchenette. The kitchen supplies were good for eating luscious papaya, pineapple, mango in the room.Beds were very comfy, especially the pillows. The ambulances in the middle of the night on Kalakaua may wake you.The hotel is a (short) walk from Waikiki and Ala Moana beach, but we mostly snorkeled at Hanauma Bay and Lanikai Beach. The hotel is close to the magnificent mile of Honolulu.Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.Hotel has free high-speed wireless internet and the connection was good.Hotel has valet parking, but the post office in Fort DeRussy park had overnight parking for $5/night.

Fantastic hotel! Staff was amazing from check-in to check-out! They were able to check us in a few hours early which was very much appreciated. Our room was very nice with a wonderful view of the city, park, and ocean! The valet's, Eric and Anthony, who we ran into several times during our stay could not have been nicer! Always willing to give us directions or restaurant recommendations!Hotel is within walking distance of anything in Waikiki! Definitely will be staying here again!

Great property for families. Benefits of hotel/condo set up. They upgraded us at no additional cost- Nice 1 bedroom suite w/kitchen and two patios, ocean/park view. Staff (especially front desk, Cassell, and bellman Josh) went out of their way to be kind to my kids, offering use of wake boards (which we didn't even know they had). Property has towels for the beach, wake boards, so did not have to buy or bother. Location handy. Not on the beach, but short walk, and did not need a car, because Dollar rental car was across the street. (cheaper to rent for a day, then to pay for parking in Waikiki). We highly recommend. Good bed & nice linens. Only iffy was Housekeeping- OK, but did not always empty the trash every day.

It was affordable and convenient however the room was not updated. There was chipped paint in the bedroom and the bathroom tiles were loose. When we took a shower it was hard to not get scalded because the distance between cold and hot was fractional. With that said the staff was friendly, the food in the very small restaurant/cafe was good, and although small and cold the pool was fun and comfortable.

To be completely honest when we opened the door to our hotel room in the Outrigger Luana we instantly dropped into a depression. To be fair we had just come from Maui staying at the Waldorf Astoria Grand Wailea. We just had an amazing time in Maui then we came to Waikiki where everything is old, ugly and busy. It was like going back in time in a movie, kind of like being in a Vegas/San Francisco in 1970. There is nothing attractive in Honolulu, driving from the airport to the hotel was even a disappointment. The buildings are old and weathered, the city and beach is packed with so many tourists to trip over. We ended up switching hotels which provided much better room quality and staff who really interacted with us. Overall a hotel stay can really help the quality of your trip, we definitely regret this choice as we thought we were getting much higher quality of hotel.... the Outrigger Luana certainly did nothing for us.This hotel would be better suited as for people who are on a budget, backpackers or for those who cant really afford to travel but do so anyway.

Ended our holiday on the Hawaiin Islands at this hotel, just last 2 nights. Perfect location. Twin room with en suite, free WiFi, hotel staff very friendly, nice restaraunt at hotel, only small but get great breakfast. Ideally located withing easy walking distance of beach and town. Would use again if visiting Oahu

We had reserved a 1 bedroom condo, but were pleasantly surprised to get an upgrade. Our 2 bedroom condo was very clean and nicely situated in the corner of the building. We had an extra large lanai off the main area and two smaller lanais (one off each bedroom). It was a very pleasant stay right in Waikiki adjacent to Ft. DeRussy recreation area. Just a 5 minute walk to the beach. If you have a car, you will pay $25 a day for valet parking. That's how it is in Waikiki. We used to live in Waikiki in the early 90's, and we even had to pay for parking then. So just figure that into your nightly rate. I'm giving this stay a 5 star rating not only for the condo, but also for the friendly staff. I called for a wake up call of 5am for the morning we were checking out. I asked if the valet would be available at that time too? Of course, the guy said. We were again pleasantly surprised to have our car waiting for us in the driveway at 5:30am, without having to ask. Great service!

The Outrigger Luana went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. They stored one suitcase for us for several days so we didn't have to pay while we traveled to Kauai. Our room was fine, with a wonderful small kitchen. Just below our hotel was a farmers market so we had fresh food minutes away. We usually stay down at this side of Waikiki away from the hussle and bussle of all the crowds and hit the beach via the Hilton. What has changed is this hotel is at the beginning of the new renovation of Waikiki and the very beginning of all of the best stores. So if you are a shopper you'll love this hotel, clean, friendly and convienient! There is a pool, work out room, laundry and ice. Good hotel for the price.

His is not a hotel but a collection of condos ranging from studios to two-bedroom units. Each one is decorated.differently and there are a variety of layouts. I have stayed here a number of times in various units and I have never had a bad stay. Each unit has either a full kitchen or kitchenette. The place is immaculate. Depending where you are in the building you will have city/mountain/or ocean views. The property is not located right on Waikiki but is located one block in back of.the Hale Kia away from the beach. It is several blocks out of the mainstream, which can be a blessing in terms of much less street noise. If you have to be in the middle of everything right outside the door, this is out of the way. Leo's Asian restaurant is right across the street and the Luana now has a little restaurant right outside the lobby instead of a coffee stand. Opens for breakfast at 6:00. Hotel has a nicely done workout room and pool area. The hotel facade not have a fancy facade so you might not notice it but it is a gem. The staff are universally pleasant and helpful. I have stayed here for business but I would choose this for a family vacation. This is not a big, bustling place just a smallish oasis near but not in the chaos of Waikiki.
user_name:
Nancy33208
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice room and nice location. I was there for 2 nights. First night was nice. Second night my family came to visit and when we walked into the lobby the front desk guy ( John ) stared at us and did not acknowldeged or greet us as a guest. When my daughter and I walked out of the lobby to grab some dinner, he stared again and didn't acknowledge us, not even with Aloha..... When we came back from the store, he did the same thing and I innitiated the Aloha to him. I am ashamed that he is a representative of the outrigger brand.

I visited Honolulu for one week on a business trip in April 2011. This is a good hotel a short, 5-10 minute walk from the Waikiki beach front. I was on the 10th floor. The bed was adequate if a little too soft. The WiFi connection was included in the price. The room provided a refrigerator and a full set of kitchen utensils, very practical to avoid having to eat at restaurants all the time. At a price of $C 136 / night, I was very satisfied by the price quality ratio at this hotel.

My husband, and 3 year old daughter stayed here for one night while attending a wedding in Waikiki. We stayed in the Ocean view 1 bedroom suite, and my ONLY complaint is that we couldn't stay longer!! The room was clean, nice, and huge! Everything you need and is like staying at home, but away from home! We were greeted by Jensen, who was awesome and had excellent customer service. Overall, I wold have to say that we had an A+ experience here and will def stay here again!!!

My husband & I stayed here over an extended weekend. The hotel was in a good location for us since we basically used it for sleeping. This was our first visit to Oahu & we were out & about exploring the island. What was good about staying here was that we did not have to drive all the way into the heart of Waikiki but were still very close that we could just walk to all the sites there. The beach is about an 8 min walk through a lovely city park. The hotel staff was friendly & very helpful. Our room was clean & beds very comfy. The small restaurant in front of the hotel, Protea, was very good. Great muffins!

This hotel is perfect for the money. The location is fantastic, 5-10 minutes away from everything. Its clean and comfortable. We chose this hotel because we knew we'd only be in the hotel for a short amount of time each day and didn't want to spend money unnecessarily, on a higher priced, beachfront hotel - it wasn't worth it to us. And this worked out perfectly. The staff was all very friendly and welcoming. Our room had a small kitchenette, a couch, table / chairs, balcony and still was spacious enough to be comfortable. Maybe the only tiny drawback was a plumbing leak in the bathroom that resulted in puddles on the floor throughout the day, I reported the problem but it was not repaired. Not a problem really, threw a garbage can underneath it and went about our day - just a tiny hiccup. The restaurant near the lobby was great for a quick breakfast stop.Would recommend, good value & location!

For a very reasonable price you have a lovely ,clean , comfortable room.The staff were very friendly and helpful. I found it actually quite a pleasure to stay a little back from the main hub of waikiki.. To be able to walk less than 10 minutes from the beach/shops and have such peace and quiet in such a lovely setting i wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. I will absolutely choose this hotel on my next trip.The partial ocean front room i was in had a fantastic view of the water and a delightful ocean breeze.

My wife and I stayed here and we were upgraded to the studio/kitchenette room. The service was excellent mainly because the valet folks were so helpful and nice. Each time a valet attendant brought your car from the garage, the attendant would ask if you need help with directions or need recommendations on places to eat or hang out. The attendant would always give you a smile unlike some other hotels where they just wait for you to get out of your car. What really needed improvement was the house cleaning. On the first day, we had received nice bottles of lotion, shampoo, body wash, and actual kleenex. After the first night, the house cleaning staff refilled with generic bottles. Instead of kleenex, housekeeping gave us a roll of toilet paper in its place. I wish there was more consistency instead of downgraded goods. The beds were neatly made, but I would have to make the extra effort to ask for the same goods or else I would be downgraded on goods. The location is nice. A good 10 - 15 minute walking time to the International Marketplace. The beach is not far. It is also a 10 - 15 minute walk. If you rent a car, the fee is $25 per night and valet is the only option for parking. There is no self parking. There was the first afternoon when I checked in where it was really noisy. There was construction right next to our room. I could not take a nap because we were not warned or had any notice prior to getting into our room until the drills and hammering started. The AC machine was also very loud.

Everything worked out great here: Good location with open space near by; views of the ocean; friendly staff; nice room with kitchen sink and fridge; good price (about $120/night); pleasant pool. I can't think of anything wrong with staying here, would definitely come back.

The location is good, staff are helpful and friendly. We booked a partial ocean view room and enjoyed a good view of the park and ocean. It was much quieter at night than other hotels we have stayed at further down Kalakaua street which meant we had a much better sleep. The housekeeping staff could work a little harder on their cleaning, but overall, it is a good place to stay.

this was my first time to Hawaii, so my husband & I were pretty nervous traveling with our 2yr old,but the staff made us feel so comfortable. the staff was GREAT.. whenever we had a situation there would always be someone to help us. we enjoyed our stay & would without a dought recommend this Hotel!! gorgeous view.. to the left- city view. to the right - park & beach view!!

Best thing about the hotel..... Great valets for parking and free internet. Room was kinda dirty. Traffic noise is terrible. Dinner at hotel is just so so. Store inside hotel was hardly ever open. Staff at lobby were not great. We stayed for free with Choice Hotel points, but I would have been annoyed had I actually paid.

Stayed here for one week at the end of April 2011 and so worth it! Valet guys are wonderful, professional, helpful, and kind! Rooms were very spacious and clean. We were on the balcony every night--even slept out their on our last night! :)View is great, price is great, the location is perfect also. I recommend this to everyone. You won't regret it!

I'm surprised this hotel continues to receive great reviews. I booked it based in part on them and I was thoroughly disappointed.The room looked and felt dirty. During my one week stay, there were pillow stains almost everyday - including dried blood. A cockroach was found in the bathroom in addition to at least two other unidentifiable bugs. Stains were also on the sofa, chairs, and window curtains. Although the room has a "kitchenette", it didn't even have a microwave. The air conditioning unit did its job well but it was also loud which made it hard to sleep. It did, however, drown out the loud traffic noise coming from outside.Service at the hotel was appropriate but at times it was cold and certainly nothing special like others have raved about. I was told parking is by valet only and it's expensive. You're better off parking somewhere else and then walking back to the hotel. The location isn't bad as it's on the cusp of Waikiki but there's no direct beach access.My advice? Do yourself a favour, pay a little more, and get a better hotel somewhere farther down Kalakaua Avenue inside Waikiki proper. I left Hawaii feeling cheated. I'd paid for a hotel billed as three and a half stars but it was actually a Super 8 in disguise.

I rarely write reviews but wanted to provide the Outrigger Luana with a positive rating for others who are making a decision on where to stay in Waikiki. The location is central, rates are reasonable, and the customer service was fantastic. The staff was accommodating to requests and extremely friendly. I'm quite surprised that someone found the customer service lacking because everyone I dealt with couldn't have been nicer.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana for 10 days in April 2011, and had booked a partial oceanview room with kitchenette. The room was very clean, nice bed, granite countertop and flat-screen TV. The most amazing thing was the view - we used the balcony everyday for breakfast or drinks at night and the view was amazing! Very good service at the lobby, very friendly people.The pool was great with compfotable chairs and a few tables under gazebos.For the price, I think this is one of the best values in Waikiki. Very close to the convention center, short walk to the beach and the many restaurants of Waikiki. Would definitely go back if I stayed in Waikiki again!

I was disappointed with the customer service at Outrigger Luana. This was my first experience with an Outrigger property and I was not impressed. I called about 4 times to confirm the availability of a room with 2 double beds and a pull out couch because I was travelling with friends. On all 4 calls, they said this was a room type, but could not guarantee that we would be assigned this. When we got there I was at first pleased that we were assigned to a room with 2 double beds. Later I found out that we were assigned to a room with 2 double beds, but the couch did not pull out into a bed. After my multiple calls, I was so disappointed that they did not inform me that this was an option too. I had researched hotels for days before selecting one and multiple hotels had 2 double beds. It was the pull out couch (=3 beds) that made this hotel unique and made my decision. So, I asked at the front desk if it would be possible to provide a roll-away bed to make up for the "one room in the hotel that has 2 double beds, but no pull-out couch". Not only were they not willing to do this without cost, they were rude about how they handled it repeatedly asking- "i could give you a room with a king size bed and a pull out couch. Would you like me to do that?" threatening as if the whole point was lost on them. Although I knew the room type was not guaranteed, I was misinformed because I had called to check on the types of rooms multiple times. The customer CARE just wasn't there.Also, beware of the attached restaurant, one of my travel companions saw multiple bugs near the creamer/sugar while going to get coffee one morning.
We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We would definitely stay here again if the opportunity arises. Quiet, clean and to sum it all up definitely one of my favorites.

We had a wonderful visit to Waikiki, made especially enjoyable by our stay at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki. The staff was helpful and very personable. Our room was very clean, comfortable, and nicely appointed. We found it a great value for the money.

The Luana is a quaint Resort located in the world-famous Waikiki. Being on the north (?) end of Waikiki it is close to the visitor attractions in the area without being right in the middle of the craziness.The resort was exceptionally clean and the unit was well appointed. The staff is top-notch and they made our stay memorable. Everyone from the valet to the night manager went above and beyond, and each truly possessed the Aloha Spirit.Our stay was so memorable that future visits to Oahu will include this little gem...extra special thanks goes out to front desk manager Chris, he is a true ambassador of the islands.

The Outrigger Luana is not posh, but it is comfortable and well-located for anything you'd like to do in Honolulu. I was upgraded to a unit with a kitchenette, and this saved me money on breakfasts. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, but I slept well all 4 nights. I'd go there again for sure.

Excellent Condo clean nice staff we stayed 8 weeks could not do better, safe location.Close to beach just across the park chairs available from the front desks or the bell boy who are all very nice. BBQS are also very good. THEBUSes are just across the road.With three lift there is not much waiting. Would book again!!!From Buckinghamshire, England

Sup everyone! I'm back 2 Waikiki 2 party! Da best spot 2 be is Outrigger Luana! Go see braddah Chris @ da front desk! He da man! Everyone there is full of plenty aloha! Go check it out u won't be sorry! C u down there! Aloha!!!

Rooms are attractive, kitchenette was wonderfully convenient. We hit Costco on the way from the airport and stocked up on snacks and drinks. Very easy walk to Waikiki nightlife, restaurants and beaches. If you are military, this is a great alternative if you can't get in to the Hale Koa but still want to use their facilities. Extremely friendly staff. We had a tsunami warning, nice to know the hotel actually sits outside the evacuation area.

Since we have young kids, we usually stay at condos. This place leaves something to be desired. The floor wasn't clean enough when we first checked in for us to walk on barefooted, yuck. The pool is small. Maybe we're just spoiled, I expected a bit more. There was free internet, however, speed at times was super slow. It was better using my phone.

This hotel offered a very relaxed environment for the 4 days we were there. The kitchenette was clean and user friendly considering the size of the space. The staff was very attentive when helping with bags, offering extra towels, and giving great recommendations and directions. The staff always made sure you fely welcome everytime you returned to the hotel by giving a friendly ALOHA! I will certainly return to this hotel on future visits to Oahu. The price was perfect and the location good, although bring your walking shoes instead of your cute shoes because there is a lot of walking.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially the bell hops and valets and the on-site tour reservations. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. We liked that the hotel was not in the heart of Waikiki as there was still some noise, but was not in the heart of it all. Yet all the shopping and restaurants were only a short walk away. It was not on the beach, but it too was only a short walk away. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Expect some noise, (people, sirens etc), but I don't think there are many spots where the noise would not exist.

Location..location...Location!If thats all you are worried about... this a great hotel for the price. Its minutes to the beach, shopping, resteraunts, bus stops and places to go to redeem ur Go Oahu Card. DirtyFound a coackroach in the bathroomStained floorsStained Sheets and pillow coversthe deck looked like it had never been cleanedFriendly and courteous staff

This was not our first choice hotel in Waikiki, but as it happened, it turned out to be the best place we could have possibly stayed. It is close to all the local attractions and only a short walk to the beach, but in being located just away from the main hotels it is a lot more peaceful at night. Should you wish to join in the local nightlife (and you will) then a short walk will get you to all you need.The rooms are spacious and clean and I would suggest paying that little extra to get a sea view even if it is the restricted view, it is well worth it. The hotel staff and its facilities are excellent and with free WiFi available as an added bonus. My wife and I stayed here for my 50th Birthday, and once the hotel found out they laid on a bottle in my room. A nice touch and we were both surprised and pleased, but then again the staff as mentioned before were only to pleased to help out and make sure our stay was a memorable one. Trust me.. it was.

My wife and I stopped over for 5 days after a cruise around the islands on NCL. We enjoy the beach but not all day long and prefer to spend time visiting other locations on the island. This hotel suited us perfectly, we got a delux corner sea view suite with two balconies (room 906) for about the same price or less than a small city view room at the beach side resort hotels. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, always greeting us with a smile. While we could not check in until about 2:45pm, we were offered shower facilities and a secure location to store baggage until a room became available. The coin operated laundry facilities were all in excellent working condion (4 washers and 6 or 8 dryers), a relief after spending 7 days on board ship with no self serve facilities. We found the rooms and kitchen facilities to be very clean. The only minor criticism is noise from a nearby construction site was quite noticeable early in the morning (6:00 am), particularly the beeping from reversing trucks, a surprise on the 11th floor. As mentioned previously the valet service parking fees can be avoided by self parking in a multi story garage a short pleasant walk in the park behind the Luana. A $16 per day fee is charged for a prepaid stay of 3 days or more plus a refundable $10 deposit on the automatic entry token. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others who do not need the convenience of a beach side location. For those that are intending the spend time on the beach, it is a convenient 10 minutes or so walk through a beautiful well maintained park.

Wonderful staff, so friendly and accommodating. Especially Anthony and Jacob in valet and Ryan at the front desk. Service all around is excellent, rooms are newly remodeled and comfortable. Recommend the studio with kitchenette, all you need to have meals or snacks in your room. Location works, minutes to Waikiki Beach thru Ft. Derussy Park, close to Hawaiian Village, shopping and restaurants. Would stay there again.

We had a lively family room on the 8 th floor. The view on the park is spectacular. The fire works right out front! We enjoyed the full kitchen and the kids in the living room. Nice for us to have a BIG room with the king size. We stayed at three hotels this trip. This was really good value. Lady at activity desk was wrong about everything! We did the opposite to her advice and did fine. She said that renting a car for that day or the next is impossible! They only check the company that they use! I went up to our room and called one out of the phonebook. Next day was no problem! She also said Hanauma bay wasn't worth it. We drove there, parking was easy, no one there (overcast day , storm coming may be reason) so we went down, had a great time!

Oonly a short distance (2 blocks) to the beautiful beach. Close to reaturants and car rentals (accross the street). Clean and confortable room. Mountain view is great in the morning with sun over the mountain. Being located away from higher building is a plus in my book. 123 Stores (3) within one block. Staff most helpful. We had a two week stay and wished for more. Definitely see the Army museum located nearby if you have the time. Would come again. Nothihg negative and the carry out Pizza from the in house coffee house is great.

We choose the Luana, as our regular hotels were all booked. Thanks to others on trip advisor, we gave it a try. WOW! The service was fantastic! from the valet to the front desk to the little spa, I could not have asked for a better experience. 'The room was perfect. For such a great rate, I sure didn't expect what we got.We had forgotten the stroller for our daughter, Chris at the front desk tracked one down for us to use for the day. I felt like every time we turned around, someone was right there to help us out...Mahalo!We will definately be back and reccomend the hotel to others.

This was our 2nd time to Hawaii. (First time was our honeymoon, 22 years ago.) We were really pleased with our choice to stay at Outrigger Luana. It is a smaller hotel which gives it a more personal feel. Now, after being home for nearly a month, we often think about the friendly staff who always seemed genuinely happy to see us coming and going on our daily outings. They were kind hearted, helpful, & interested in our adventures but very respectful of our privacy. In all our travels we have never felt so at home as we did at the Outrigger Luana.During our 14 night stay, we were able to experience 3 different rooms, all with kitchenettes. The first night we were facing the main street which was a nice view but a little bit noisy and no view of the ocean. On the second night we moved to a room facing Honolulu. From our balcony we could see the pool and a little of the park and ocean. This room was somewhat quieter and we really had no complaints. Being the curious travellers that we are, we wondered what the rooms across the hall were like and asked if we could be moved to one if one came available. Well, that was the best room of all! We now had a beautiful view of Waikiki, Diamond Head, Fort DeRussy Park and the ocean! In the morning, we watched the sun come up and we would have our coffee and breakfast on the Lanai while listening to the birds and watching the people do Tai Chi in the park. The free newspaper was always just outside the door by the elevator. The free in-room internet was an added bonus. We were able to look up information on places to see, things to do, where to eat etc.On the first floor, above the lobby and mezzanine, there is the pool, gym, outdoor BBQ area, laundry and ice. The gym is fantastic and surprisingly, has more than just the basics. Also, it has a nice view looking out to the pool area.On the main floor (lobby) there is a business area with two Apple computers and a printer (no extra charge). A small gift shop is also available. The mezzanine has a spa where guests can go for luxurious pampering. Hotel guests get special rates on most services. There are also several sitting areas and a large flatscreen TV. At the hotel entrance is the Protea restaurant which is a great place to have breakfast, lunch or grab a quick snack.Clean beach towels are provided daily at the front desk. Free coffee is provided only on the first day of stay, after which you can purchase more for $1 ea. at the front desk. Kitchenette came with microwave/convection oven, counter-top stove, small fridge, cookware and eating utensils. Frying pans & spatulas were all well-used in the rooms we were in. Beds were very comfortable and extra pillows are provided. Every room has a safe. Flat-screen TV, tile floor and granite counters throughout.Great location, 5-10 minute walk through beautiful park to beach. One mile walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center (Walmart & Ross just behind). ABC convenience store across the street from hotel. Eggs & Things restaurant on Saratogo across from post office offers beautiful omelettes, and amazing pancakes! LOVE the coconut syrup! At the nearby Fort DeRussy Beach, the Hale Koa Hotel (military) has excellent Mai Tai's for $3.50 during happy hour. Sit back, watch the sunset and listen to live music while doing some people watching. On Friday nights, there are spectacular fireworks. Awesome! Also the nearby Outrigger Reef Hotel's Shorebird Restaurant has a Sunset Special 4-5:30pm. It is a 1/2 pound choice sirloin with all you can eat salad bar for $14.95. After 9:30 pm there is Karaoke and drink specials. The only complaint we had was the $25 a day valet parking fee. It cost us just as much to park out car as it did to rent it. Don't rent from across the street or anywhere in Waikiki. Rent ahead of time with hotwire.com. $20 a day versus $90. Overnight parking is available at the nearby post office for $5 until 6 am. Nearby Fort DeRussy also has parking available at a reduced rate for longer usage. Call (808) 955-0555

Just on the edge of Waikiki, its close to AlaMoana shopping center, yet not dead in the bustle of the tourist trap. The folks who staff the Luana are truly local in their style and heart. The word 'luana' meansto live in comfort and at ease. The Outrigger Luana fit the bill perfectly for us: the price was right, the staff friendly, and the hotel in just the perfect corner of the islan. If I need a hotel on Oahu again, this would be my choice. We also enjoyed the Protes restaurant in the hotel.....excellent food and service.

We like Waikiki and Honolulu, and we don't rent a car when we're there. The Luana is a nice, quiet, clean place in a great location, convenient to the beach strip and right across from buses to other Honolulu locations. And it's an excellent value.Our room was spacious and a full sink, microwave and good-sized refrigerator. There was more counter and closet space than we could ever use. The hotel is essentially in the middle of a park, and we had a nice view up toward Fort DeRussy. The pool area is small but immaculately well maintained and -- in early May, anyway -- never overcrowded.The staff in the lobby could not have been nicer, and the whole place just feels like a condo, without a lot of people passing through. There's no restaurant or bar in the lobby. There are plenty nearby. We'll definitely go back here on our next trip to Waikiki

We stayed here for 3 nights in early Feb. prior to a cruise. We chose this hotel based on the price and location. We didn’t need to be “on the beach” because we were cruising for the next 2 weeks.The positives: The price. Good for Waikiki.Nice big room with a little tableWe requested an upper floor and received the 14th. Happy to be above the noise of the “strip” because our partial oceanview actually looked right over the busy street. The location was great…a pleasant walk through Ft. DeRussy Park to Waikiki Beach and picnic tables where we ate breakfast (fruit from Henry’s Place). The valets were fantastic. Personable, efficient and friendly and gave great advice on where to go. We loved them. Happy guys enjoying their job. The only employess that treated us like guests.The negative: The front desk staff and manager (with the exception of John) were condescending to the point of being rude. Since parking had gone from $10 to $25/day when we made our reservations, we were perturbed and they did negotiate a compromise, but VERY reluctantly and after that they treated us with indifference and disdain. And then when we inquired as to why we had to buy those little coffee packets (1st one is complimentary the 1st day only) the 2nd and 3rd days for $1.00 ea., they were indignant. “That is how we keep our prices down!” But housekeeping continued to give us new towels despite us hanging them up to say we would use them again. Doesn’t add up…for $1.00 come on…We had a partial oceanview room that looked over the “strip” but we could see some water. Would’ve liked to have seen more park and less traffic.It is no smoking but someone chain-smoked on their balcony so our balcony use was very limited.It would have been nice to have a microwave in the room (did not reserve a kitchenette which we should have) and a coffee maker that doesn’t require those little packets. We brought good coffee along but had to buy those little packets of sub-par coffee..We would recommend this only if the facts are known as to what to expect.

This was our first time in Waikiki. I choose this hotel because it looked ike it wasn't right up against another hotel. Our room was on the "first floor" , actually this is the 3rd with the messanine and lobby below. Our room faced the strip, but was quiet, as it was near the Fort Russy end of the building. Our lanai was large, but the walls were high so we had a hard time seeing out if we were sitting. Someone from a floor above us kept spitting out their gum which landed on our lanai, a little annoying. The room was great, large, clean, and nicely appointed. The cleaning staff are fabulous. All staff great. The laundry, and ice machine were across from us, thought it would be noisy, but it was quiet and handy to have there. The pool was on our floor, along with the excerise room. We didn't rent a car because of the great bus service. We knew about the expense of parking.There is a restaurant on he looby floor and is pretty good and priced right. We wish we had asked for a kitchennette, but we did have a fridge and coffee maker in the room.

First the Pros - My wife and I stayed here at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki and loved it. The room was very clean and modern. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The housekeeping staff were great. I think we had the most positive experience with the valets. These guys were fantastic with advice anywhere from places to swim (or not) to places to eat and everything in between. The hotel sits on the edge of Fort Derussy in Honolulu. It's a few minutes pleasant walk to Waikiki beach and it's right on the main avenue that runs parallel with the beach so if you want to find lots of shops and restaurants then you are only minutes away from that as well. Now the Cons - Our car rental for ten days was $220 US. To park the car at the hotel for 10 days was $250. Also...their website says $20/day for parking as of 10 seconds ago yet we were charged $25/day. We forgot to talk to them about that when we paid up. I will try and resolve that from home. Wish me luck. We wanted a kitchenette and by mistake my wife did not book that type of room. She phoned back when she realized her mistake and the person she spoke with said no problem just upgrade when you get here. When we arrived in Honolulu the hotel was booked and we had no upgrade possible. The air conditioner was a little on the noisy side but then I find that with most hotel AC units. Despite these cons our stay was great and we would stay there again.

Next time I stay (and I will stay again) I will get a higher floor kitchenette unit. It would be worth the extra money and it would be quieter to be higher from the street. My room was very nice, but on 5th floor so street noise etc prohibited leaving the lania door open at night. Disappointed that the coffee was a dollar to replace, but next time I will get some at ABC. Every person there was friendly and helpful from the valet to the front desk to the housekeeping fellow. It is a block from the Trolley and City Bus stop. AND the gift shop beat the prices at the Market Place and ABC Stores. I checked and came back to buy.

We enjoyed the service the staff provided each day during our 4 days at the Outrigger. We have traveled to Oahu and stayed in many hotels in Waikiki in the past 8 years. This was the best service experience we encountered to date. We appreciated the clean rooms and tile floors. The pool is on the small side but quiet and relaxing. The walk to the beach is about 5 minutes and we welcomed the exercise after our yummy meals at local restaurants. Would stay here again..best value for the price. Note... we were not aware of the parking charge ($25 a day) prior to arriving so make sure you read the information available and add this into your budget.

Everyone from the bell hop, cleaning staff, to manager were wonderful. Friendly. Fun. Their restaurant was the best food that we had on the trip.Also, I am a coffee snob. Their coffee is excellent. It made me think of a touch of chocolate. But it does not have chocolate in it. Not sweet. Just a great cup. Maybe even better than Seattle.Comfort: The bed was great. Be sure to get an upper floor. There is some traffic sound. Furnishings fine. Actually the kitchenette was bigger, nicer than I expected.Beach: On the beach in 5 minutes, walk through the park. Really nice part of Waikiki. Easier to find a spot on the beach there.Fun: You can see the fireworks Friday night. Some rooms have a view of it. We watched from a fire escape cement alcove on our floor. If you want to go to the international market, zoo, it is a jaunt. You might want to take a bus.

I stayed at the Luana Outrigger for a week in January 2011. I have been tavelling to Honolulu for the past six years and this was the best hotel for value. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms clean and quiet. The pool, exercise room and other hotel services were excellent. Will be staying here on my next trip to Honolulu.

The Outrigger Luana is in Waikiki, but it is a couple of blocks from the beach and off the west end of the strip -- just a couple of minutes away by foot from the bustle of the beach and shops. The room -- sort of a mini-suite -- was big. It had a fridge, kitchen sink and full set of dishes ... although, strangely, it lacked a microwave or cook top. This may have been peculiar to this room since we saw similar rooms with such appliances.The staff was friendly and helpful. For Waikiki it was well-priced. Heck, on our first late afternoon there, the room came complete with a rainbow out the window!

Stayed at The OLW for eight nights 2/2-2/10. Booked a cityview kitchenette. The room was exactly as described on the website and we were located on the top floor (great views)but it was located on Kalakaua and every siren headed through Waikiki could be heard. To be expected. We did have a problem with another room and their music, the walls are a bit thin. The best thing that this hotel has going for it is the customer service. I was always greeted and thanked by the staff during the entire stay. The standout were the valet guys, "the best!" Always willing to give directions, wish us well. My guest was amazed that the guys were so friendly. Have stayed at 5/6 star resorts before and never had that kind of service. Be sure and try the cafe just outside the lobby. Has great breakfast items and pizzas. Had a very relaxing time. Make sure you get to the pool early. While we were there all of the seating would fill up fast. BTW the pool is unheated and can be deep (8ft) for those that don't swim well. Overall a great experience.
The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The location is perfect. and the price is the best in town. I highly recommend the Luana.

Aloha everyone! I just got back from a great weekend in Waikiki! I just found my new get a way spot! Outrigger Luana! Go check out bruddah Chris @ the front desk! He'll take care of you there! The service is awsome & the location is prime! Go have sum fun in da sun! A hui hou...

Walked in and right away, thought HOW NICE! Very clean and maintained. We had a room on the 15th floor of 16. Our room was a corner so we had 2 views off our balcony, one overlooking the city with Diamond Head in the distance, and the other overlooking the ocean. Just beautiful! No smoking which was just fine with me! Nice closet set up, and close to everything! Love those ABC stores! 2 computers to use for no charge. And the staff there are WONDERFUL!!

We stayed at the OLW Jan. 29-Feb 4, 2011. We found this hotel to be quite nice as we had a kitchenette; microwave, fridge and 2 burner stove. It was a bit noisy having our room overlooking the main roadway, probably would have been better on the park side.However, it was close to buses, shops, 2 blocks to beach through the Fort DeRussey Park, which is beautiful.To get around by city bus is very easy. The hotel gave us a map and on the reverse side was attractions to go to by bus. Follow the bus #'s and no problem at all. The bus drivers are also very helpful. You just ask which bus to take to get to say, the Dole Plantation and they advise you the best route to take.We walked from this hotel to the Diamond Head Crater, which is quite a walk I might say, but if you are not in a hurry, nice way to see a lots of things. When you get to the crater, it is $1 for admission; take lots of water, good walking shoes and a hat. The terrain is uneven and the stairs are steep, but when at the top the view is breathtaking.The Dole Plantation is also very nice. Free to get in to the gift shop where you can get the Dole Whip, (cannot miss that). There is a train to take you around the plantation, maze and garden (at a cost). Pearl Harbour: get there early. We left at 6AM by City Bus (check the schedule on the back of the map given to you by the hotel) and we got to Pearl Harbour around 8AM. They give out times for the theatre and then you take a boat over to the Arizona Memorial. This is free. If you want to go on the Bowfin sub there is a cost. Well worth the trip to Pearl Harbour. From there you can take the City Bus up to the Dole Plantation which is only about another 20 mins.Bus passes are $25 for 4 days and if you are doing a lot of sightseeing, well worth it as you don't have to make sure you have the correct change.There is also the Circle Island Bus where you can take it all the way around the Island, or stop off at the North Shore beaches. We stopped at the Waimea Valley Audobon (cost to get in) $13 for adults and $6 for seniors over 60+. The waterfall there is nice and if there is a lifeguard on duty you can swim in the lagoon.Also, went to Chinatown and if you like seafood and are cooking in your room, seafood is very inexpensive. We bought a 1/2 bag of shrimp for $9.Also, on Thurs nights beside the hotel is a small market. There you can get small lobster tails, produce, etc. On Tues, Thurs, Sat, Sun down Kalakua Ave. by the big Banyan tree (about 6 blocks towards Diamond Head) at 6:30-7:30 there is a free hula show.Overall, I would recommend this hotel as it is close to the beach, transportation and eateries. Only a small coffee eatery in this hotel. We we did not use as we used our facilities in our room.

I've lived in Waikiki and enjoy the convenience of walking to any place I want. This location is perfect for that. It's safe, clean with the most accommodating staff. They are truly friendly and helpful. At many places the staff is nice because they just want to be tipped. These people are real. Tip them well! Views are not important to me as I know where to go to see what I want to see. Pool area is great. Nice to have bistro just off lobby. Good food! Cabs are prompt and public transportation is just outside the door. Not much more to ask for if you are looking for value and being treated very well.

My Mom and I went to Hawaii for a week and on our way through Honolulu on our way to Maui we stayed at Luana Waikiki. I was looking for a well priced hotel since we only had one night there. Also did not care about beach front for that same reason. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived to see how close the hotel was to the beach. Literally a hop skip and a jump across a beautiful park that the hotel rooms look out over to the beach. But what truely inpressed me was the staff. Everyone was great, but especially the bell boy Jacob. We were not even off the shuttle bus and he was waiting for us. I had the opportunity to see him in action the next day while waiting for my shuttle and I have never seen someone go so above and beong for customers. The hotel booked our shuttle back for us and when it was 5min late, without us even saying anything Anthony the concierge and Jacob were following up with the shuttle company. The rooms were simple and clean. We were in a kitchette with a partcial view and I would easily stay there for an enitre week. Also the gym was great. Unlike other gyms that are stuck in dark rooms, this one has floor to ceiling windows and is open to the pool. Also a good selection of equipment for a hotel gym. My travel style I would say is slightly high maintance and this hotel definitely hit the spot..

Of course there are good and bad everywhere but for your money, it is a good deal. The staff were SO friendly and polite. About the best I have ever had in that category. Although I must say the maid service was not up to par, the beds were hastily made but overall the cleanliness was good. A good location for walking to the main street strip, safe, and a block and a half to the beach. The beds are also super comfortable (a nice change for the 3rd world country beds). The downs were that there was no lounge or bar there, the bathrooms are small, the pool is also small and the maid service as mentioned previously. Otherwise, our view on the 7th floor facing Trump tower was great, the little kitchen was a great bonus and the staff were so nice. There is only the small Protea shop for food attached, not a full service restaurant, but it will get you by for sure!

We stayed here for six nights in January. Our room was only on the second floor and it overlooked the back end of the gas station next door. Having said this it is the only hotel on the park grounds and is a short way (a few blocks) from Central Waikiki. I think the location is great as its not so noisy and its the only hotel on the park property. As long as the sliding doors are kept closed the noise is very limited from the outside and as we were located close to the back side of the hotel we didn't get too much of the main street traffic.The lobby is beautiful and we thought the staff, both in and out, were very pleasant.The elevators could be a problem as we had some lengthy waits for them and unfortunately we couldn't find stairs to get to the second floor so we had to use the elevator. There must be stairs down from the first floor to the lobby but we could only find stairs down to the first floor from the second. These stairs also take you to the pool area, laundromat and BBQ area.The rooms were spacious with comfortable beds, fridge and a table where you could eat if you didn't want to go out.Internet in the room is free which is rare in Honolulu.There is no need for a car as everything is in walking distance of the hotel and if you want to see something else on the island you can always take a tour or city bus which go all around the island as well. Ask at the front desk and they will give you an itinerary of all the city buses.

The first 10 floors facing Ala Moana Blvd have road noise that closed windows do not cut out. The older air conditioners in the whole building are loud, they sound like fridge compressors that are about to go. We asked to be moved from 10th floor facing street to anywhere quieter. They agreed on our last (4th) night and moved us to 16th floor facing east, which has side ocean views over Fort Debussy Park. (higher floors have higher price but they didn't charge us) No road noise this side but air conditioner was the same. Fine if you are accustomed to such a noise anyway, not if you come from a frozen country which doesn't need air conditioners. There are no ceiling fans as alternatives. Their interior updates are good, almost 4-star with marble floors & shower surrounds, granite countertops. Weber BBQ's beside pool area. This section of beach in front of Fort DeBussy Park is the best in Waikiki. This hotel is close to shops. The front desk refused to give us a roll-away cot, saying it doesn't fit into the room, but the manager said he could supply an air mattress for $20/night from his on-the-side-business!?? Sears sells air mattresses and the hotel happlily supplied the sheets/pillows and blanket, which kept our extra person happy.

We booked our trip through Costco.com looking for a hotel that specifically had a kitchenette, since we love to cook in, in addition to eating out. We chose the Luana Waikiki and after leaving, we decided that we'd definitely go back to this hotel again and again, not only because it has a kitchenette, but because the staff was so charming and incredibly helpful as well as friendly.The rooms were nice, roomy enough and clean! The kitchen was a dream and came with a microwave, sink, mini refrigerator, stove, coffee maker, and all the utensils, pans, pots, etc. that you need. The free internet was awesome! Not the fastest out there but fast enough so you can look for directions to get around the city and what not. What I also loved about this hotel was its location! It's literally in the middle of everything you want to do. Shops and downtown are just a walk away... and the beach too! A 5 minute walk takes you to sandy shores where you can go paddle boarding, kayaking, etc. Parking is $25 (around) a day for your car, and they valet it for you every time - which is a nice touch.
