I recommend this hotel highly - especially for the staff, everyone was friendly and they made our stay that much more enjoyable :)

From the moment we walked up the steps till the minute we left the island this staff at the Luana was the Best I have ever encountered in my many travels.. beautiful views, and if they dont have what you need just ask and the staff will have it to you in moments.... I would return just to stay with them again.. Marvelous job Luana!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Luana from January 9 to 12, 2011. We booked direct with Outrigger for $119/night for a Park/City View room. Upon check-in, we were told that as of January 1 self-park for $18 was no longer available (as it had been when I booked the room in November), and that we had to pay $25 for valet parking.The room was clean and average, nothing special. The view from our lanai was overlooking a gas station—very disappointing. There was a nice kitchenette with everything you need, unless you want hot food (no microwave, stove/oven or toaster). You get one packet of coffee, and then if you want more, you have to pay $1 a day. The bathroom was tiny, with only enough space for one person. On our second night, the AC went out. Someone from the front desk came up to look at it right away. Turns out the breaker tripped, so it was reset. About 10 minutes later, it went out again. We asked to move to another room, which was a hassle to pack up everything and move (from room 104 to 103). We were given no apologies or compensation for this inconvenience.The small pool area was nice, with cushioned lounge chairs and tables with umbrellas. We liked the location being near Fort DeRussy Park, and a five-minute walk to the beach, and close to restaurants. During the first part of our trip to Honolulu, we stayed at the Lotus at Diamond Head. If we could have done it over again, we would have chosen to remain there for the entire trip instead of switching to the Luana. The Lotus was by far a better hotel!
A superb hotel. We have been there many times, and always an excellent experience. Front desk staff are the very best.Charmaine and Stew Leber
Awesome Staff and very nice accommodations. You will have to try very hard to find a flaw here.

I came here with my son to set him up for college. We stayed seven days at The Outrigger Luana. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. Whatever my question was, someone at least tried to get me an answer. Courteous valet and bell staff. They always were there to assist with baggage or find us a great place to eat. It's not the Hilton, but the price is great! Close to everything.

We stayed in 2 rooms ( 1502 and 702 ) for a week. Our married son stayed in one room and we stayed with our daughter. Location: The hotel location is convenient to both shopping and the beach if you are comfortable walking up to 20 minutes. We walked to the Ala Moana shopping center in 12 minutes and all the way down Kalakaua Ave. to the end of Kuhio Beach in Waikiki in about 25 minutes. The deluxe shopping district is just outside the hotel door and across the street on kalakaua- Chanel, D&G, Tiffany, Dior etc. The Bus stop on Kuhio is just 2 minutes away for traveling further afield. the Hilton Hawaiian Village is a pleasant stroll through Ft DeRussy Park and has a fireworks display every Friday night. Waikiki Beach is about 7 minutes from the hotel.Dining opportunites: Protea Cafe attached to the lobby with healthy, tasty food at good prices and takeout available to pickup and carry to the pool or your room. Eggs n Things just around the corner on Saratoga Rd.Tony Roma's - 5 minutesKeo's Thai Restaurant - across the street.Cheeseburger in Paradise - 5 minutesCoco Cove - 10 minutes down Kalakaua for good take out salads and pastaThere is a Whalers General Store and ABC store for groceries just across the street for cooking in your unit.Rooms: Comfortable and very clean. Due to this being a condo hotel with studio and 1 BR units with kitchens you will experience cooking smells in halls on some floors depending on guest food preferences. We had no problem on 15 but our 7th floor room was affected on some days.Staff: Friendly and attentive. Provided us with good information and even lent us 4 boogie boards for free when we drove up to Waimea for 2 days. If you need any beach equipment just ask and they'll provide it if they have it. Free beach / pool towels available at front deskKey info: Kalakaua is a busy street with traffic until late evening and early morning. Upper floor rooms are quieter but still not soundproof. You will hear sirens and car horns. Request park view if possible. Rooms ending in 1-6 are facing the south park and Avenue and are in shade all day. Rooms ending in 10 - 16 are facing the main park and beach and get the sun all day. After a few days we were glad to have the shady side which meant we could get away with no air conditioning while sleeping. The AC units are noisy.Summary: Staff were great. Fitness center was hardly used and quite adequate. Pool area gets afternoon sun, not heated. We all felt quite at home and would definitely stay here again. We preferred not being in the heart of Waikiki and felt the location was ideal for beach access, dining and shopping excursions either by foot or by bus. Attached photos were from the lanai of room 1502

Great value, a little away from the main centre but just across from the Waikiki trolley so not far at all. Would stay here again due to the friendly staff and clean services. Little bit run down but that just adds to the character,

We stayed 4 nights at Outrigger Luana in Jan 2011 with an ocean view room with kitchen. Not glamorous but very comfortable, very clean, very friendly. The room was of a high standard and the kitchen had everything we needed. I loved the location - out of the madness of downtown Waikiki but close enough to everything. The onsite cafe is small with a basic menu, but friendly with good food - there are plenty of good restaurants close by for more formal dining, We realised too late how close we were to Ala Moana and all tihe facilities closer to Honolulu. A short walk through a beautiful park to the beach, which is relatively quiet compared to the throbbing masses further east. I heartily recommend it and would stay there again. A real gem at a good price if glitz and snob value is not your primary consideration.
Great location. The people at the front desk are amazing, the vallet everyone was great. The restaurant was not good at all. The beds are ok. Too soft for me. But I can't wait to go back.
We stayed here en route to Tahiti and enjoyed the room with two balconies and great views.

We stayed here for 11 night on our honeymoon. It was certainly worth the extra to pay for the 1 bedroom with full kitchen and oceanview, essentially a condo (room 706). The kitchen had everything you could possibly need (huge fridge, full stove/oven and fully-stocked with utensils, crockery/cutlery etc). Plenty of room to relax with lounges and 2 TV's, 2 lanais (balconies). Complimentary newspapers available beside the elevators every morning. Extremely pleased with the friendly service afforded to us by all staff at the hotel. If you want to be right in front of the beach in the centre of all the action in Waikiki, then this is NOT your hotel. If you don't mind a 10 minute walk to that action, or a 5 min walk across the park to the beach, then this is for you. Quite safe location with regular 5 or 10 min patrols of the Fort DeRussy park (behind the hotel) by US Army Police, and Honolulu Police Department seem to use the nearby gas station as their coffee/donuts stop during the late night. 2 x internet-connected Apple Mac computers and laser printer available for free use in the lobby. Fruit-infused iced water was available every day for free in the lobby also. Highly recommended.

Stayed a week with probably the cheapest rates offered at that time. The hotel is great, and the staff most friendly. The room is very large, well equipped (free wifi, kitchen sink, dinnerware, coffee pot). Everything is very clean. The room is facing the street and therefore is noisy...but could not hear my neighbors in adjacent rooms. Everything is as announced. It is an excellent hotel for this price. Stayed in much more expensive hotels in waikiki which did not compare to this one.

Stayed here for 2 nights. The room was clean, bed comfortable, had a view of the park. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is away from the busy part of Waikiki so it was fairly quiet. Location is just a few blocks from the International Market Place and the beach. Ate breakfast both mornings in the small cafe which was also superb. Shuttle from the airport dropped us off just across the street. We used the city bus to go to Pearl Harbor, the bus stop was also close by.

The staff here were probably the best hotel staff I have ever had a hotel. The valets were so friendly and helpful. Checking in and out took less than 5 minutes. Our room was big and clean. I don't understand why anyone complained about noise, our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the busiest street in Waikiki and neither myself or my fiance woke up during the night. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Even the bath soaps were amazingly fragrant and helped give us the Hawaii vibe. The hotel is a great value and conveniently located near restaurants, shopping (if you're into that kind of thing), Waikiki beach and the major interstates. We had a wonderful vacation and Outrigger Luana certainly added to our experience. I did not like paying $18/day for valet parking, which is the only parking option they have- but try to find a Waikiki hotel without the same ridiculous parking cost. The first hotel to offer free parking would be constantly full!

This hotel was right next to the park - a beautiful view and such a close and pretty walk to the beach - maybe 5 minutes. The grounds are modest, but the staff really made you feel special and went out of their way everyday to make us feel taken care of. The small cafe was excellent - had a bit of everything - all quality! I travel quite a bit for a travel TV show and stay in only the finest hotels all over the world and am treated as a VIP. So with high expectations of travel accomodations, I can tell you that even though this Outrigger is not their fanciest one, it sure ranks top notch with service and staff. The grounds are well kept and clean - very quaint. I will be coming back to stay with them.
Great staff......great location.......great pricing The Protea resturant staff and food was awsome.........clean room......need i say more I will be back.

Stayed at this hotel Nov 26 - Dec 3, 2010. It was a comfortable hotel but definately not as luxurious as some of the hotels in Honolulu (not as expensive eithor)POOL - small, only 12 lounge chairs; but generally nobody else was there so not really an issue. They aslo had a gym and BBQ area by the pool , we never used but looked ok.LOCATION - about a 10 minute walk to International Marketplace(east) and a 15 minute walk to Ala Moana Mall (west). There are ABC stores everywhere so if you need to pick up a snack or something it is never an issue.BEACH- a quick 5 minute walk through the Fort DeRussy Park, which is a very well maintained park with great walking paths. This part of the beach is not as busy as the beach further east. (waikiki beach)ROOM- the hotel room was ok. It had coffee maker but only 1 pkg of coffee was provided and any extras were $1.00 each. They did have free wireless in the room, other hotels charged up to $18/day. It was a well equipped room with plates, cutlery, glasses and a refrigerator. We asked about a microwave (which would've been perfect) but they were not allowed to provide one due to some regulation about the # of kitchen units the hotel was allowed to have. Not sure if we upgraded if we could've had a full kitchen, but we were in the basic room. Bathroom was small, the water pressure good, but the hot water gets VERY HOT.PARKING- they only have valet parking which they charge $18/dayLOBBY - they had two computers and a printer set up in the "Business Center" Use was free and was very convenient for online chek in!All in all a good vacation.

Away a little from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki's main drag - a 10 minute walk to the main beach. But that is ok if you like walking. Take the park view room from at least the 3rd floor up (on the left side of the building if you are facing the hotel from the front street) for the quieter rooms (road + other noise) and a bit of a view. Don't get a room overlooking the road or the petrol station - you'll get noise.Apart from the noise tip, it is quite ok. Staff were good, rooms were clean and our room had almost a full kitchen (no toaster though). TV (flatscreen) had almost all cable channels. 15 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, walk through the park behind the hotel to get to the beach. Need to cross the road to the other hotel for the tourist booking centre.

I visited the Outrigger Luana in October of 2008 for business. We purchased a rental car and drove from Honolulu Intl to downtown Waikiki. If you are not familiar with the island, you can always take a taxi. H1 is the major highway that runs the majority of the island from the airport all the way to downtown Honolulu/Waikiki. It is the ONLY main artery to get you to and from so be prepared for heavy traffic especially in the mornings and mid-afternoon/ evenings.When I visited, Outrigger had 3 other locations so be sure if you take a taxi to specify the Luana. If you rent a car, there is private parking available under the hotel for $15/day if you park yourself, $18/day to have it valet parked. The hotel is located on the main strip into downtown, Kapiolani Blvd, so it is easily accessible to many tourists attractions. Check-in at the Luana was timely and conveniently located within the building. The front desk staff was very informative in regards to local activities. The majority of the Luana rooms/suites are actually condos/timeshares and are set up accordingly. Even the basic rooms had a small kitchenette in them (no stove) equipped with a mini-fridge, kitchen sink, and microwave. The appointments in the rooms were tropical mahogany woods and granite countertops. Depending on the location of the room, you either had a downtown or ocean view. The larger suites were fully equipped with a standard size fridge, oven/stove, micro, etc. The larger suites had a separate bedroom from the living area which included a couch, chairs, dinette table, and breakfast bar connected to the kitchen area. They also generally had two different views/balcony’s: a downtown view as well as an ocean one. (Mine was a corner unit so you had both directions). The rooms were very clean and well kept. There was a pool on the 5th floor (I believe) but it was not very large… however I never noticed it full or all of the chairs taken. There was a gym on the same level of the pool which offered various upgraded work-out equipment. The hotel also offered a grill area for guests to cook out and enjoy their food. The hotel itself was located approximately 2-3 blocks north of the beach (depending on which way you went, a 5 to 10 minute walk). Adjacent to the hotel was a large green space called Ainahau Triangle where I ran every morning. There were always groups of people out doing yoga or tai chi in the morning. Also close by is Fort Derussy Beach Park. If you exit the front of the hotel and turn right, straight up Kapiolani Blvd is all of the high-end designer stores, shopping, eating, and activities you can imagine! There are various other resorts right on the beach which have sea-side dining. They offer (especially at sunset) magnificent views of the ocean as well as Diamond Head- but be prepared to wait. Some take reservations, however some do not. So in conclusion, if you are looking for a first-class, on the ocean, resort- this is NOT that type of hotel. As previously stated, it is more catered toward longer stays vacationers and families who may eat out here and there but have to option to grocery shop and cook from their room as well. It is an optimal location for various activities and is priced very well for the amenities it offers. Please feel free to contact me in regards to this hotel!

While I have no complaints about the location of this hotel, there are much else to be mentioned and improved. My wife and I were on our honeymoon when we visited this hotel. As we were traveling on a budget but yet wanted something better (i.e. no less than the $100 price range), we found what we thought is a bargain. Unfortunately, the experience turned out to be much less than what we had paid for. When we checked in, the staff at the front desk was not very friendly and neither was he helpful. When I asked him if there is anywhere interesting to visit around the area, he just told me "No, there is nothing interesting". And when I asked him for suggestion for restaurants that serve local food, he pointed me to "L&L Hawaiian Barbecue"! If I wanted L&L, I could have just visited the branch located in the city where I live in. Regarding the room, it is clean but is very noisy. My wife and I cannot really fall asleep the first night because the street noise together with the A/C noise just kept us awake. To make things worse, the bathtub was clogged, the shower head was broken (shooting water in the wrong direction) and the shower curtain has mildew. :( It's is nice enough that after we complained about it, they have the shower head and the clog fixed the next day. All in all, since we were on our honeymoon, we tried not to let this ruin our happy spirit and just let it slide. Looking for that little bright side of our stay, we did have a very good experience with the very friendly and helpful bell/valet person. And before we checked out, we did get a chance to have a quick chat with the manager. It is unfortunate that there is nothing she could do about this. I will for sure not visit this hotel again.

Military retired family that normally stays at the Hale Koa. This year had a package deal so we selected the Luana. Perfect location for access to the Hale Koa and Waikiki. The staff was excellent and never failed to acknowledge your presence. We had a regular room, no cooking but alot of space with the one bed. Larger than normal under the counter frig that really made ice. Do recommend and will stay again next visit.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Outrigger Luana. We do not actually use the rooms on our vacation for much more than sleeping. The price was very reasonable for Waikiki. Being airline employees, we fly stand by and the hotel was willing to work with us on late check in and possible cancellations due to unavailability of flights. We appreciated that and it was worth it.we arrived in HNL late on a thursday night and took the Waikiki Shuttle. It was a good value, but in hind site we would take a taxi next time. We were the first ones on the shuttle, waited a 1/2 hour for all other passengers and then were about the last ones off the shuttle. It took 1.5 hours to get to hotel. On way back we took the city bus. It is only $2.50 per person and stops near the Luana. It only took 35 - 45 minutes to get to airport.On our last day we took a tour of the island and had to leave at 7:30 am. The hotel staff stored our luggage for us and when we arrived back at 7:00 pm, they gave us towels and keys and allowed us to use the showers and changing rooms in the exercise area to freshen up prior to our trip to the airport.Thanks to all at the Luana.

The worst ,loud, not good customer hotel I have every stayed at! i come to waikiki three time a year.My husband and I were staying at the hiltion for 10days and came over to this hotel that should not be a outrigger hotel chain! We came over three days prior to make sure that we could be far away from the road.We checked in and the customer service was terrible. I would be very upset if I had an employee like this. We were put on level 2 right on the road. So don't wast your time trying to talk to the front desk. By 10pm there were so many cars at the gas station (party down at the gas station). My husband ask if we can be moved. We were move to the 5 floor and thing seemed to be better. Than at 4 in the morning partying was on everylevel. Beer bottles were thrown onto the building below. I would like to aks the VIP at the outrigger to spend a Friday night on level two right at the road (gas station) and see how they judge there hotel NOW! This is a good place if you DO NOT WANT SLEEP! Far away from the beach and city. A waste of your money!

We stayed for 6 nights... I was traveling with my wife, 1 and half year old son, and mother in law. We got a 1-bedroom ocean view condo for the three of us and a studio for my mother in law, who was helping watch the baby. The hotel staff was great, and they got us rooms on the same floor which made things convenient (7th floor). My wife was there for a conference for a couple days, but everything else was leisure.We paid $199 for the 1-bedroom ocean view and $99 for the studio (they upgraded us to the studio from a standard room at no cost to have us on the same floor).The rooms are clean, although the cleaning staff did skip us on two days. On one of the days they called in the late afternoon to see if we wanted it cleaned, but I declined as we were feeding the baby dinner and getting him ready for bed. They don't do dishes at any rate, just standard hotel cleaning services like towels.The water pressure is excellent.They provided us with a nice, metal folding crib.The bedroom was very specious, and really the whole apartment had plenty of room. We even had people over one night for a small party. The kitchen is great-- high quality appliances, well stocked with dishes, etc.This place is right next to a park which is actually quite nice if you have a kid. You have to cross a busy street which runs right through the middle of the park to reach the beach. I recommend you turn LEFT after leaving the hotel lobby and follow the path that starts right past the gas station. This will let you cross at a light and lead you towards the Hilton beach which is great for families. The park also has a par course which I did a few times.The drinks at the little store in the lobby are exactly twice the price as the same drinks right next door at the gas station (bottled water, etc). There's a well stocked general store across the street.The view from our condo was nice, looking out on the park, with a peek at the ocean past the beachfront hotels. It was perfect for viewing the fireworks that the Hilton sets off every Friday.The gym is quite nice, with good quality equipment.They have a nice BBQ area with high quality gas grills, which we used.We did not use the pool. It's quite small and seems to be a magnet for elderly people. We were much more attracted by the beach, which is a 10 minute walk.The condo is VERY QUIET. Other than the air conditioners, we never heard a thing. No street noise, no noise from the neighbors. Did we even have neighbors? Maybe not.My biggest disappointment is the only way to reach the bathroom is through the master bedroom. This is awkward if you've got a baby napping in the room, or you have guests who have to traipse through the bedroom (or someone staying on the sofa bed in the living room). Why they thought this was a good design is beyond me. Having the bathroom access from the common area makes so much more sense.Three free wifi internet works great.Parking is expensive - $18 a day. I don't think we really needed the rental car we got.All in all, I would recommend the place. Would we stay here again? Maybe... but the Hilton looked awfully nice.
Attached cafe is fine for light meals - parking is expensive but valet's are courteous and effiecient

Excellent location as views overlook park and ocean and not another hotel.The rooms were cleaned when we went out .10 minute walk to great beach and the Hilton or downt down Waokiki .Staff friendly and helpful. Several restaurants across the road as well as ABC shop

We're from Oahu so we've stayed at a number of hotels in Waikiki over the years. This hotel was such a great find for the price we paid. The room appeared recently renovated and was spacious and comfortable. Pros: stove, sink, mini fridge, microwave, couch, lots of space, nice decor, extra drawer space under the bed (built into the frame), good a/c unit, pool was niceCons: no carpeting (tiled floors); the drapes near the door leading to the balcony weren't "black out" drapes (even if they were, there was another window near the entry way that only had sheer drapes) so if you like to sleep in late and the sun bothers you, u'd need a blindfold; parking was valet-only and there's not a whole lot of street parking in that area; the convenience store next door is a hang-out spot to biker gangs (they're not scary or anything but their bikes can be kind of noisy at times), kind of a walk to the beach
Outstanding service and room quality was excellent. Hotel located was great, we also enjoyed eating at the Protea Restaurant.

I LOVED this hotel!!! I guess the opinion depends on the person staying there. It is located at the end of the Kalakaua strip so it isnt pushed up against all the other hotels but still walking distance to everything. Conveniently, there is a rental car service (dollar/thrifty) right across the street. The staff waived our parking fee since we were only keeping our rental there one night. We stayed here six nights and enjoyed every bit of it. The rooms are nice and clean and have just about everything you need, flat screen t.v.'s, kitchenettes, hide-a-bed sofas, etc. The rooms are of great size and the beds I found to be incredibly comfortable. Room service did an awesome job at replenishing necessities. We booked this hotel not expecting much out of it since we werent planning on spending any time in the hotel but, I have to say that the Luana exceeded our expectations! I am extremely particular about where I stay...the room has to feel clean in order for me to enjoy my stay and this hotel was right on the money. If you plan to sit in your room all day then you should consider one of the $200+a-night hotels located right across from the beach. But if your looking for a good night's rest, a place to keep your belongings while you enjoy the island, and a great staff, I would definitely recommend the Luana.

Arrived at hotel in the morning and was allowed an early check in. Hotel is starting to show its age. Surprised it is an Outrigger and not an Ohana hotel. Stayed in a One bedroom unit. Quite spacious. Kitchen was great. Balconies are dangerous for young children and there is a sign on the sliding doors about this.Front desk service was ok. You have to use the valet service if you have a car($18/day). The valet staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The best people working there. The front desk people could learn about customer sevice from them.Location is ok. About a 10 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki. It was actually very quiet, but be aware that there is a gas station on the west side of the hotel and it can be a little noisy at times.I would recommend it to families.

I searched reviews of many hotels in the Waikiki area and choose this one and am very glad I did. I have only 2 minor complaints about this hotel, one being they only give you one of those pre-measured packets of coffee to have for your whole stayI If you want more they charge you $1.00, come on. A bit stingy if you ask me, as most people would like coffee daily. They do have free coffee and pastries in the lobby until 10am. The second complaint was the housekeeper didn't change our sheets, ewe.This is a hotel, not our home. The hotel is a short walk (5-10 min) through a park (with banana trees) to the beach. I wanted to be a bit away from the strip because of all the noise other reviewers mentioned and am glad I did. There were sirens going all evening long, but mostly in the distance. The Front Desk was very informative when asked an assortment of questions from where a place was to how to hook up the internet in room. They offer a free trolley service that circles around the local shopping areas, a map included. The Bell Hop and Valet guys were so friendly and we didn't even use their services! The rooms are beautiful. The internet is free here, I noticed other hotels say internet available and charge way too much for a night's use.

The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful during our 10 day stay. The hotel is not quite in the centre of Waikiki (which we liked) but an easy walk to everywhere in Waikiki. The rooms were large although no kettle in the basic room, just a coffee maker. The noise from the main road into Waikiki at night was quite disturbing even on the 7th floor (the one downside). The hotel had a really nice pool area and sunbeds which got the sun from late morning until sunset. Next door was a very functional gym with free weights, weight machines, a running machine, two bikes and a cross trainer. There is a park behind the hotel which leads to the beach, about a 5 - 10 minute walk. Joggers use the park at all times during the day and evening. There was free internet in all the rooms and the hotel was slowly upgrading to wireless.

Hotel very beautiful but reservations, front desk, and housekeeping need to "UP" thier customer service etiquette. The only employees that was helpful and courteous was the valet and bell service. The rest of the staff made me feel uncomfortable. It felt like I was spoken down to, and they weren't very accomodating. Reservations made multiple mistakes, therefore I had to pay alot more when checking in. Front desk made it seem like it was my mistake and I felt as though they felt I was lying about the situation! Had no internet in the room so I called customer service and nothing was done. Found out just before checking out that there was no router in the room. Room service just threw bedding back on bed and tucked only the bottom corners. My 10 year old daughter does the bed better than that! When asked for more Kleenex tissues was given toilet paper. When I repeated what I needed, had the tissues practically slapped in my hand. If the service wasn't so bad I would really consider staying there again because it is so beautiful and they are at a great location.

Outrigger Luana is great for all personnel. It caters to families, couples and for single people on business trips. Rooms are clean and spacious and provide a great means for rest and relaxation. Hotel is ideally located and walking distance away from a variety of attractions. I would recommend this hotel to ALL family and business colleagues!

Just returned from Hawaiian vacation where we stayed at Outrigger Luana on two separate occasions. Both times we found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. As mentioned by other reviewers the location is great with the beach just a short walk away through DeRussy Park. The restaurant Keo's which is across the street is excellent for a nice dinner, Cheese Burger Waikiki is an interesting place to grab a burger. And the main area of Waikiki is only minutes away and has lots of places to eat. Definitely would return to this hotel.
The room was unbelievably wonderful, the staff very friendly and knowledgeable. The room was clean, comfortable and beautiful. Will be staying there again when we return!

I travel to Hawaii 2 to 3 times per year and was looking for new and permanent place to stay each time in January. I found this hotel and booked it again this September. I will returning again in January and every time I travel to Hawaii. The rooms are so quiet and clean. The staff is wonderful and extremely accommodating. The addition of valets was super. All were so friendly. It was great to be greeted every time we came and went from the hotel. Super guys, one and all. The only thing I wish they would change is to have softer pillow top bed and better pillows. Every thing else was great both time I stayed. I have found my new Home away from home.

We just returned from our seven night vacation in this fabulous hotel. We had a large room (park view with kitchen) which was perfect for us and our two children. We found the hotel staff to be very accommodating and extremely friendly. The front desk had ample brochures and plenty of maps with good directions to nearby attractions and destinations. We were loaned plenty of towels for the beach and pool - and we also enjoyed the complimentary danish/donuts in the morning and the chips and water in the afternoons. Our reservations had originally been made at Hilton Hawaiian Village and I am so glad that we chose to stay a little further in from the beach. Our hotel was never crowded and was an excellent place to relax. It's true that there are hotels on the beach with more extravagant lobbies and fancier decor - but the fact is if you want a comfortable and relaxing place to stay that won't break your bank account - this IS the place stay.

I especially like the fact that this hotel/condo is a few minutes from the heart of Waikiki, an easy walk, but quieter and less "touristy". We had a studio room, with a small, but very well equipped kitchenette which makes it economical to make breakfast and lunch in the room..there is s Super ABC store directly across the street where food can be purchased. The staff is helpful and the rooms are comfortable and very clean. I have been here 4 times and like it more each time.

We stayed here for 4 nights in September having already spent 10 nights at a spectacular b and b on the Big Island.We paid $129 per night and got a queen sized bed with full kitchen on the 8th floor. They called it a partial ocean view but once you stepped out on the balcony you got a full sweeping view of both the city of Honolulu towards Waikik and also a full view of the ocean across Fort Derussy Park. Nice large room though the shower nozzle really needed cleaning and the bathroom was a bit small.Large flat screen tv with approx 70 cable channels. Free internet connection as well and lots of storage space. Also a free inroom safe though when we arrived it wasnt working and we phoned down to advise the front desk. Within 10 minutes a maintenance guy came up and fixed it, so very prompt service.They have a small pool area though the pool is nicely looked after. Good quality poolside furniture with 12 sun beds plus 4 cabana's with tables and chairs.Free beach/pool towels area available from the front desk.In the morning there was coffee and pastries down in the main lobby and in the afternoon there was always a pitcher of cool citrus infused water with a bowl of maui style chips. A very nice touch especially if you are coming back from walking in the sun.There is a spa in the hotel that we didn't use and also a fitness centre that you have to sign a waiver for.They have just recently introduced valet parking at $18 a day. When I booked the hotel it was self parking at $10 a day and they honoured that rate which was appreciated. The valet guys always greeted when you left the hotel or when you arrived. Customer service seems to be a high priority at the hotel.If you are thinking of renting a car then instead of the hotel possibly consider the Dollar car rental which is kitty corner to the hotel on Kalakaua avenue. Very handy as its a 1 minute walk but make sure you arrive at least an hour of your scheduled pick up time as the line gets long as they bring in people from other hotels and cruise ships, plus its also doubles as a Thrifty car rental agency.The Luana is about a 5 minute walk from where Waikiki really begins. So about 5 minutes if that to Beachwalk street. Lots of restaurant options within easy walking distance including Cheesecake Factory [10 minutes], Tony Roma's [2 minutes] plus there is the Royal Hawaiian 3 level mall with lots of low end to high end stores including a large Apple outlet and food court on the second level in the middle building.The only downside if you can call it that is that they need to clean the showerheads in the rooms! A bit of CLR [see those tv ads managment] would clear up the problem in a couple of minutes. The shower spray was powerful but it was very narrow. For a big guy like me I had to run around in the shower a bit to get wet!!All in all though this is a good choice for a hotel without having to pay the fortunes that other hotels ask for a small view of the beach or to be right on the beach. You care a very short walk to Waikiki beach itself though we found it so crowded we were more than happy to use the pool facilities at the hotel. From about 11am onwards the sun was overhead all afternoon to early evening and the pool area heated up nicely.Pete

Remodeled and sporting granite counter tops in the bath and new kitchenette, the two rooms I stayed in were clean and comfortable. Plus they recently added free use of the Pink Line tourist bus which runs from the Ala Moana mall and along the Waikiki strip.

The people here were so courteous and helpful. The lobby area is lovely.The rooms seem to need a little updating. The gift store was closed for more than a week. Seems they could have had someone fill in and have kept it open.Good location.

This hotel combines good accomodations with affordability. It is a small hotel so the list of amenities is not long but it is clean and modern with a helpful staff. The pool area and gym are nice and was never crowded. The large park that surrounds the hotel is an asset because of the great views and is good for walking/jogging. The only negative was that parking is now $18/day valet only (beginning Sept. 1) rather than $10/day self-park. I made reservations assuming the old parking rate. Fortunately, the front desk clerk was understanding and charged me the old rate. But the valet guys were first rate!

We really enjoyed staying at the Outrigger Luana Hotel. Very friendly people working there. Very helpful when giving us information.The rooms were very clean and the beds were great.We were only a few blocks from the beach, ABC store across the street, service station next door. $18.00 to park your rental car at the hotel. Free coffee and pastries for breakfast. Not noisy at all very quiet hotel.We would stay there again.

If you live in Hawaii, you know it's tough to find value in Waikiki. We kama'aina (locals) like to spend time in Waikiki, but the prices (especially for families) can be prohibitive. The Luana is close to the better end of Waikiki Beach (aka by the Hale Koa/Hilton area-our opinion); it has no extras like the big hotels, but you don't need that in this area. Parking has gone up (alot) but it's still a good value for Waikiki. You are not looking at a wall of lanais from this hotel. Yes, it's noisy if you leave the sliding glass doors open, but ALL of Waikiki is incredibly noisy (sirens all night) and at least you can look over Ft. Derussy Park. Easy to walk to the Royal Hawaiian Center for shopping and meal values. Easy to walk through the park to the beach. Probably should have microwaves in the rooms, and better coffee. But stay here and save your money for other activities and have FUN! You can't beat it for Waikiki!

i would not recomend this hotel to anyone. they have no ammenities.everything is far from the hotel. the pool has no towels. parking is expensive. do your homework there are many good deals in waikiki and this one is not it. i had to walk far for breakfast, and there is no bar or resteraunt in this hotel. the rooms were okay, but as we knowyou don't spend much time there. this hotel was over rated.

Chose this hotel because we needed a small kitchenette to save money on eating out and the oceanside room with bed and pull out couch was perfect.Large enough for 2 ladies and 2 daughters. The room is supposed to only allow 3 ppl but the GM relunctantly allow us to have the extra person. It worked out fine and slept comfortably but I do not recommend asking for this as it really is against their policy. We just weren't prepared to pay the extra for the larger room and they were very gracious to accomodate us. No frills services - morning coffee & pastries provided but no onsite restaurant was open (looked like they had space for it but was closed)Recommend using ABC and Whaler stores for everyday needs and found these stores prices to be very reasonable. Also found lots of good beach & souvenier items there. Pros: Kitchenette for extended stays.location away from busiest part of Waikiki but easy walk to it. We had a rental car and it was only $10 day to park which was best rate i saw since most hotels charged alot more. Was nice to be able to get in and out as we pleased. Also, great beach park within short walk thru park that isn't the busiest part of Waikiki with $40 day for 2 chairs & umbrella if you don't want to be a french fry. Take time to walk down beach to Hilton Resort on that beach. Also, recommend shopping in gift shop in this hotel because the prices were discounted from other stores and they had some nice things. Cons: no onsite restaurant or food services other than outside delivery.Pool is small if that matters to you but could be a plus cause it is very intimate and great for after beach dip.Overall, good experience for 7 nite stay.

We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The hotel was not right on the beach but it was only a 5 minute walk. For the price we paid, it was wonderful. There were BBQ grills that we used that were wonderful. Met wonderful people just grilling at night. We will not hesitate to stay there again. It was very quiet, unlike down the street in the middle of Waikiki.

I was visiting Waikiki on business travel and decided to get a room with a kitchenette because I got tired of eating out during my last 2-week trip. The kitchen was updated with newer appliances, granite countetops, and tile backsplash. The kitchenette only comes with a queen (king not avail). The bed is platform type so there is no box spring and the mattress slides quite a bit. Not that comfortable to me. There's a 2-person dining table along with a sofa and coffee table. The common hallways were hot and muggy.The A/C unit is basically a window unit and mine was loud. Much quieter if you run the fan only but then it gets hot. I had a mountain/city view looking at Kapakaua Ave. The hotel is next to a gas station so it's always busy and the ambulance runs all night. The room does have a flat screen TV with lots of channels. Internet is free but wired. The ironing board is mini - half the size of a regular one and it sits on 6-inch legs if that. I guess you're supposed to put it on a table but it didn't work for me having to iron pants and shirts for work.Parking is only $10/day and you prepay for that. They will credit your card if you leave early (I checked out after 3 days). Parking is in the basement but only one elevator goes to basement. Sometimes you have to go the lobby first, then get on the elevator that goes to the basement. And parking is limited and it's tight parking. Fitness equipment was fairly new but pool was really small. I counted only 12 lounge chairs at the pool. There is only one ice machine in the hotel and it's on the 1st floor along with the pool, laundromat, and gym.I checking out on my 3rd day of a 15-day trip because it wasn't that comfortable to me as a business traveler. My company paid for more expensive diggs so I'm taking that option even though I lose the conveniences of kitchen. If you don't plan on being in your room too much, it's a great deal.

After reading so many rave reviews, I decided on the Luana. It had it;s good points, but I was disappointed after I got there. The parking was a good price and they did have donuts for the morning which was good for us starting our day. The beds were very comfortable also. But, after reading how the hotel had been renovated, I thougt it would be better. I still thought the rooms looked tired. Somehow renovations just don;t make a place look "new". I have no other hotels to compare it to, so maybe it was great compared to them. The "partial ocean view" was over the roof of the closed retaurant below. Hardly picturesque.The good thing was that you were not looking out right at another hotel. Our lanai door was broken and our sink was clogged. Not what I wanted for my first night in Hawaii. I will probably try a different hotel next time to compare.

We didn't stay in the room that much because we were always out, but the room is nice. Hotel is a walking distance to the mall strip which is nice. Parking rate is awesome although not too much parking available. One mishap, the cleaning lady forgot to close our room door after she fixed the bed (we were out the whole day) and luckily nothing was missing. It could have been a mess! Overall, the rate that we got was good and the employees are very nice. One last thing, they have coffee every morning plus pastries and punch which is nice.

My wife and I stayed 14 days at the Luana. The welcome at the desk was spot on and the room was well furnished. We had the park view room with a complete kitchen minus the stove/micro wave. We purchased an electric frying pan at Walmart and with the BBQ at the pool deck we were able to have many in house meals. The parking is the cheapest on the strip. Ask the bell man for a loan of beach chairs etc. A real money saver and the walk through the park to the beach takes about 8-10 minutes. The beach is good and clean. Not filled with tourists but right next door to the over crowed main beach area. House keeping was great. We will return.

So, we're from New Zealand and we were in Hawaii for three weeks. On our first week we stayed at Waikiki Gateway because we wanted somewhere basic to stay. I'm 26 and my brother is 20 so we don't care too much for what kind of hotel we stay in. So I paid twice as much as this hotel compared to Waikiki Gateway and the service here was terrible. There were hardly any greetings from the reception staff and the valet car parking service was terrible. When I was at Waikiki Gateway we were tipping between $5 and $10 per request, but with these guys I was only tipping $1 and $2! It was almost like they didn't want to get me my car. The hotel manager was even worse. I kindly asked him for a pool towel, he looks at me, grabs a towel and dumps it on the counter and doesn't even acknowledge me. On our first day we left a $10 tip of each of our beds for the cleaners (to make our beds) and all they did was pull the blankets up over the bed. I COULD'VE DONE THIS MYSELF AND SPARED MYSELF $10! I definitely won't be going back here (unless they give me something free lol). If you're old and snobby, I would definitely recommend this place for you.

We were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view 1 bedroom from an ocean view 1 bedroom suite on check-in, which was a pleasant surprise. The suite itself was fine, plainly decorated and spacious with as good an ocean view as you can expect given that the hotel is set well back from the ocean. The location is excellent as it is right by the heart of Waikiki, the service was fine though nothing special. There was street noise early in the morning and the air con is noisy, so light sleepers may want to look elsewhere. Overall though for a price conscious family of four this was excellent value.

The hotel was in the heart of Waikiki. Great if you like the hustle and bustle of stores. The service was good only had one issue with getting some pillows and towels. The high speed internet was great and the nice thing was the hotel had boogie boards and mats for the beach and ocean. Didn't like that you had to pay to park your vehicle at the hotel so we didn't rent a car. It wasn't too bad though because you could hop "TheBus" and travel basically all around the island.

I expected hard beds after reading the reviews, but they were very comfortable. The staff is very friendly, the check-in area very attractive, and the rooms have big frigs with granite countertops! Very nice. It is noisy, but there is not a place in Waikiki that is quiet (that I ever saw). Just wear earplugs and you'll sleep like a baby. I paid over 3x as much at the Hyatt Regency and their room was not nearly as nice. Too bad I spent the $$ there instead of at the Luana. One tip: When looking for this hotel, watch for "Luana" not "Outrigger," on the building, as I drove around 3x before finding it.

I have just returned from staying 19 nights at this hotel this is the second year in a row. Once again we had a great stay. Had a wonderful one bedroom condo on 9th floor it had had wonderful sea view was quiet and well appointed. Highly recommend the hotel location it is quieter than the main part of Waikiki however is very close to action if that is what you want. Only about 7 min walk acrosspark to ocean.I have stayed in Waikiki many times over last twenty years and at many hotels right in Waikiki and honesty think this location is the best.I would be happy to answer questionsLyndaNew Zealand

Our kitchenette room was very spacious. 5 min walk to Waikiki beach and shopping. 2 ABC stores within 5 min walk as well. Beautiful pool area. Pastries, POG, coffee, and water served every morning in the lobby. Parking $10/day in garage under hotel.

The hotel is situated in the center of Waikiki which is a great as a basecamp to get around but can be tad noisy with all the traffic. Manager provided free room upgrade from city view to partial ocean view because this was an anniversary trip. Overnight parking was $10 which is the cheapest in town. Conveniently located across the street is an ABC Convenience Store and the Dollar Rent-A-Car.Free continental breakfest in the morning but quickly runs out by 9 PM. Free wired internet connection in the room. Free backpack activity bags for the kids. Free beach towels for use on the beach. Rooms come with a very nice 42" LG LCD TV.No 24-hour coffee in the lobby or on-site restaurant or room service dining. Our suite had kitchenette sink but no microwave or stove. Very small swimming pool that closes by 8 PM in May.Hotel does offer lower rates to the locals with valid driver's license. Seems like a popular place for military personal staying in HI as we noticed multiple groups of uniformed soldiers from different branches each day.

I recently stayed at the Outrigger Luana after spending quite a deal of time reading the various hotel reviews on the Trip Advisor website. This hotel is excellent, located within a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach and shops ,next to a park and the bus stop is just across the road. The hotel room came equiped with a small kitchen which helps save costs (supermarket is within 10minute walk). The hotel staff were welcoming and very helpful, no request was a problem. They even ran across the road to check the bus timetable for me. The hotel also has an excellent gym and laundry and offers pastries every morning and free internet. I would certainly come back again. Tip: there is a great restaurant "Eggs & Things" just around the corner in Saratoga St very reasonably priced that does breakfast,lunch and dinner. Consider buying a 4 day bus pass (US$25) if you will be doing a lot of travelling. You don't need to hire a car as the bus system is excellent.

After 30 years of marriage, I finally got THAT honeymoon! The hotel and employees were the greatest. Our room was fantastic and the location was perfect. No need for a car rental if you are able to walk. Walking distance to the beach and any eatery you like. Everything was just perfect. If we ever make it back to Oahu again we will definitely go back to Outrigger Luana. No complaints at all. It was wonderful.

If you want a place to stay to use as a basecamp, the Outrigger Luana Waikiki is a good choice. Within walking distance of the Waikiki strip and just a short walk to the beach at Fort DeRousse. After your room coffee packets are used, don't order any more ( $1 each) as there is coffee in the lobby with sweet rolls to help start the day. Go across the street to the ABC store and get breakfast/lunch fixings to take with you. Even the park/city view rooms have a slight view of the water, but since we only spent time sleeping their, don't waste the money on an ocean view room. Desk staff were friendly and helpful and the $10 a night parking garage fee was reasonable in relation to some of the other hotels. Getting into and out of the parking garage can be tricky, but after the first time you get the hang of it. Room was very clean and staff did a nice job of daily cleaning.

Very nice hotel. Seems to be great value. Rooms were surprisingly nice...comfy tropical decor, nice little kitchen area, granite counters, new flat screen TV.. Great pool area, exercise room & BBQ patio. We liked the location on the edge of Waikiki. It's a little lower key & nicely situated basically inside of a beautiful, historical park. Staff seemed genuinely kind & helpful. Try it; you'll like it. Close to the new Trump Beach Walk...great shops/cafes/people watching!

We hired a car on arrival at Honolulu airport and with the aid of our own TomTom (GPS) made our way to the Outrigger, Luana in Waikiki (approx 9miles). And here's the warning if you are driving yourself - the hotel has no visible signage on the outside of the building (except right above the front entrance of the hotel but you don't see this until you drive past), no sandwich boads or flags to alert you to the hotel entrance. There is a set of traffic lights just as you reach the hotel, a gas station immediately next door to the hotel, but you don't realise you have arrived at the hotel until you drive right past it. Managed to miss it a couple of times even after we'd checked in!Anyway, after a loop around the block we eventually found the driveway and found our way to reception and then waited, probably for 10 minutes or so before anyone showed up at the front desk. And when the receptionist did arrive, there were no apologies for keeping us waiting, I almost felt like I was intruding..... Certainly no warm Aloha welcome for us!I then headed to the room with the porter, who by this stage had worked out it was probably quite a good idea to help to get our luggage out of the car. Hubby parked the car in the hotel garage (can't remember the daily charge but I don't think it was too expensive). On arriving at the room, neither of the key cards would open the door, so the porter used his and then returned to reception to acquire new cards. This became an ongoing issue the entire stay with the key cards, we probably had them replaced every day, sometimes more than once. Really annoying....We were on 14th floor facing the street. Quite a nice outlook over the city but a little noisy at night. It was nice though to have a reasonable sized balcony to sit out on. The room wasn't huge, the bed I believe was only a double and it was on a divan type base. The mattress was comfortable enough, but everytime one of us moved, there was a terrible creaking and groaning from the wooden base. Certainly didn't encourage too much activity for fear of the bed breaking!! Pillow points on this occasion rate a very poor 3! The bedside tables were really inadequate too, simply because they had these really large bedside lamps on them - really quirky wooden lamps - Hawaiian hula dancer on one side and an Hawaiian surfer with surfboard on the other, but they were so big, they took up most of the bedside table. And along with the telephone on one side and the radio (with Ipod station!!!) on the other, there was little room for any personal items. And only one small drawer.The lighting in the room was really poor too. Well done for using eco friendly light bulbs, but they are useless to read by, and they kind of defeat the purpose when you have to have every light in the room on, just to be able to read the map for the next day's activities.My other moan was there was nowhere to put our luggage. No luggage stand, so one case on the pull out sofa bed. ( Not sure what you would do if you had a third person in the room), and the other case on the floor. Another irritation was that the coffee was never replaced. We asked for more but were told to purchase it from the front desk. But on the positive side, a great location. A walk through the park gets you to the beach. It's just a couple of blocks from the main shopping area, and a great Thai restaurant straight across the road.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pillows were great,very soft and fluffy, bed good. A great value for the price. Was close to the edge of Waikiki.. fine if you are a good walker. They have a nice pool also. Right on the bus routes. On the city side there was a bit of street noise but later it died down and never had any trouble sleeping there.. at all. Nice lobby and some good bargains at the little store inside the hotel. it's a good value for the price. If I wanted luxury on the beach.. I'd have had to pay a pretty penny. So it goes. Would stay again and recomended it to my son for any friends or relatives who visit.

This is a fabulous find! We thoroughly enjoyed our nine days at the Outrigger Luana. Lily at the front desk, Pam in bookings and all the other staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Our room was very clean and had all the facilities we needed, including a kitchenette enabling us to have meals in our room if we wanted them. There was also a small but lovely balcony that we could sit out on and watch over Waikiki and surrounds - great view! The gym and pool were added benefits. We also enjoyed its location - very near to the hustle and bustle of the main Waikiki strip but not in it so you could get some peace and quiet without forgoing the convenience of being able to stroll to the hustle and bustle within five minutes. Equally great was the lovely Fort de Russy park on our doorstep! All these benefits at a very economic price, which is perfect for those of us who travel with children and can't afford the large dollars that some hotels try and charge for similar facilities.We can't recommend this hotel highly enough and if we return to Waikiki, we'll definitely be staying there again. Aloha and Mahalo!
nothing flash, but clean and quiet. Very helpful staff. Close enough to everything, far enough away to be peaceful

My wife and I stayed in the hotel for two weeks. It's a second year we are choosing this hotel to stay in at Waikiki. We stayed in the one bedroom unit with the ocean view on 15th floor. The unit is very cozy unit with breathtaking ocean view. We were pleasantly surprised by the complementary coffee and pastries the hotel started to offer its guests this year. And surely we made use of this offer not once during our stay.The stuff was very friendly and offered us an excellent services we were very pleased with.

The staff here are friendly and the hotel is located on the main road. The beach is only 10 minutes walk and the shops are only 5 minutes from there. Staff are v friendly and always willing to help. There is complimentary coffee/juice & cakes in the mornings at reception and a complimentary bowl of snacks late afternoon. The room is spacious and we got upgraded to partial ocean view because we were celebrating a special occasion. Laundrette is only $1 to use. We were not sure about the hotel at first because it was not on the beach but it was a great location. We have stayed at the Hilton before and it takes 5 minutes anyway to walk from the furthest tower to the beach so this was not a lot different.Downsides: The pool was not very big but that was not such an issue because we could go to the beach. There is no restaurant there but there is Kios (Thai restaurant opposite that is great) and Eggs n Things for great pancakes and omelettes on the next road down...Also because the location is great you can walk on Kalakaua Avenue and get to all the other restaurants like the cheesecake factory.Would definately recommend this to anyone who does not want to spend a lot of money on a hotel.

This hotel which has rooms and apartments is a great base for exploring the Waikiki area. It has ocean views (over the park) and there's a lot to be said for not being right on the ocean. Although it's on the main road it's very quiet and our studio apartment (partial ocean view) was perfect, had good facilities. Think this place has been upgraded, but the bathrooms could still do with a bit of modernisation and better storage space if you are going to be there for more than a few days. Gas grills are provided and there is a nice pool. If you are doing your own catering it is a bit of a walk to the nearest proper grocery store but there are a couple of convenience stores just over the road for essentials. We were very satisfied and would stay there again and had a great welcome from the bell boy - he was the best.
Very nice room with good location. Clean, comfortable and convenient. Our room had nothing to cook on even though it had a kitchenette.

This is not a resort hotel or even a full service hotel but simply a place to bunk down for the night. We had a "partial ocean view room" on the seventh floor for $129/night base rate, plus $10/night to park our rental car in the small underground garage (which would not be charged if you didn't have a car), plus $16.72/night tax, which is $155.72 per night total. A room without any "ocean view" is less expensive and that's what I'd probably get if I visited again assuming I could be on an upper floor. The hotel is about four city blocks from the ocean, and you really can't see enough of it from the hotel to make a difference. There is no restaurant or bar, but, although unadvertized, they had some juice, bread and coffee in the lobby in the morning. We opted for a full breakfast at Vit's Steakhouse which is no more than two blocks away, an excellent recommendation by the hotel. The hotel also has a free business center for internet access, rare in our experience in Hawaii, which we used, and a pool, which we did not use. The room was clean, comfortable and reasonably up-to-date. The mattress was firm, which we like. All staff members we dealt with were friendly and helpful. When we first went to our room the sliding glass door to our balcony did not work properly, but when notified the hotel sent someone up right away to fix it. We had a TV and small refrigerator and bar sink in the room, along with some cups and glasses (the housekeepers did not clean the cups and glasses for us day to day, however). The hotel is located on a city street at the west end of the Waikiki beach area. It is an easy walk, about four-city blocks I'd guess, from the hotel directly across Fort DeRussy, which is actually a very nice park, to the Waikiki beach and the hotel is otherwise convenient to all of the Waikiki beach resort hotels and shopping. All in all, it is a great place to stay, if this is what you are looking for.

This hotel is in an excellent location with an great price. We loved the room, the view, and the service. We paid extra for parking our rental car but it was a reasonable $10 per day and worth the extra cost. The only complaint I have is the bed - it was a little hard and the queen size was a little small for my husband and I together. So our sleep was not as good as we would have liked. This hotel provides easy walking access to the many shops, beaches, and activities within the Waikiki area while being on the edge of all the activities which allows you to enjoy the quieter side of the area. Definitely a good value. Finally, our friends and family had 3 other rooms in the hotel at the same time. Each of them said that they also loved the room and agreed that the hotel was a good value. Thanks Outrigger for doing such a great job!

This hotel is perfectly placed between Waikiki and Ala Moana. It is approximately a 10 minute walk to either, so unless feeling a little lazy, or with too much shopping to carry, there is almost never a need to catch a bus or drive a car. We had a "partial" ocean view room but the actual view from the room was much better than "partial". We also looked out over extensive parkland so did not feel crowded in.There was a top Thai restaurant, Keo's, across the street, as well as the obligatory ABC and Whalers which sold a tasty fruit salad as well as any provisions you might need. Our room was 1107. It was quiet and we could not fault its size, cleanliness, view or facilities. The only improvement we can think of is if there were to be a ceiling fan in the bedroom. We don't like to use the air-con whilst sleeping because of the noise so a fan would have been great. Having said that we would still highly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

I have stayed in Luana Waikiki with my family. We have booked garden / city view, but we actually had a bit of ocean view, so we were very happy. Also small kitchen in the room was handy. The bed was comfortable, so we slept quite well.My other family members stayed in two other rooms, and they were complaining noise from next door, also their rooms were too close to the escalator area, so they kept hearing the bell when the escalator arrives.Overall the hotel is value for money, and you can't beat the location. I would defenitely consider to stay in Luana Waikiki in the future.

I stayed here for a month while in town for work. The hotel was just steps away from the shopping and restaurants in Waikiki, and just two blocks from the beach. The location couldn't be more convenient. Parking is cheaper than the surrounding area (unless you are military and can park at the Hale Koa garage around the corner). But, if I didn't have to drive to the base every day, there is no need for a car. Trolleys and taxis are plentiful. And really, you can walk everywhere.I stayed in a studio room. The kitchen was well stocked - the only thing it lacked was a wine opener/bottle opener ;) The pool was nice but very chilly! The only real inconvenience was that the fitness center opened late each day due to a broken lock. But, if you don't have to get up early and work out, no big deal. There's plenty of running paths around. The Thai restaurant across the streen (Keo's) was fabulous.The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The high-speed internet was free in the rooms (cable connection), and the TV was a nice, new flatscreen.All and all, a great place to come "home" to after working all day. I would absolutely stay here again, even if on vacation!

This is one of the best values in Waikiki. We had a city view kitchenette, with 2 queen beds and a surprisingly well-stocked kitchen area. It had a reasonsbly sized outdoor balcony with chairs and a nice view of the Honolulu skyline and a view of the ocean if one looked to the left. The kitchen had a 2 burner stove, a microwave/convection oven, a sink, and a large dorm-sized fridge, and all the cooking and dish equipment one could ask for. It was fine for breakfast and lunch and quick evening meals. The rest of the room consisted of a small bathroom, two queen beds, a table large enough for four to eat at (we brought in the chairs from the balcony as there were only two at the table), and a 32" flat screen TV. There were lots of drawer space, as the beds had large drawers under them. Tile floors, very clean, maid service every day. Pool area (not heated) and nice service at the front desk. All for $139/night plus tax -- what more could you ask for at that price! (Parking was an extra $10/day in an underground garage at the hotel.) The walk to the beach from was through a lovely park (Fort De Russey Park) and the park setting also made the hotel quieter. We would recommend this to anyone wishing to stay in Waikiki but away from the hustle and bustle.
Very good hotel, close to a park and the beach. Spacy rooms

I found each front desk staff never smiled but had a chip on their shoulder as though they encountered dishonest guests and had defenses up, very careful even spying from the bell hop to watch who parked in the garage, immediately reporting to front desk. you felt you were always being investigated as a guest. The room was comfortable, great view but staff unprofessional, unfriendly, NEVER SMILED ANY OF HEM IN 7 DAYS. They made me feel uncomfortable and unwelcomed. This feeling uncomfortable decreased the value of my stay thus room rate was a little too high. My profile said PHD but they showed the opposite acknowledgement by disrespecting me. I enjoyed the energy at the Maui Outrigger in Waimaia so I thought the energy would be the same. Please investigate staf problems.

A much better value than the Outrigger beachside. A block from the beach and with far better beach views, placed right in the center of a beautiful park but very near to shopping and good restaurants. Rooms are tiled so not musty. A small balcony gives you a great spot to enjoy the sunset over the sea. Upsides: view, price, park surroundings, clean tiled rooms, pleasant and available but unobtrusive services, free broadband. Downside: no room service, and little info on the local restaurants and their hours/cuisine. I think its the best value in Waikiki by far.

This was a great hotel. Walking distance from the beach ,nightlife, shopping, international market, park.Cab charges 45.00 from the airport, limo charged 40.00 to the airport, Bus 2.50 only. Buses are good means of transportation but keep change, they dont have any. We loved the room, with a huge downside.....upon check in we were told only one child per room was allowed. They asked for my sons ID also, 16 year old. 18 year old no place to stay.

I sometimes stay a big hotel like Embassy Suit, Hilton or Regency. They are nice, of course. However, a big hotel is the same all over the world. Luana, which is not gorgeous nor 5 stars, has something that such a big hotel doesn't have. That is Aloha spirits. I spent my vacation sometime alone, sometime with my family, sometime with my friend. Staff have changed but their warm welcome is always the same. They treat us more than a hotel room guest but Ohana( family members), who share time and space together.

We stayed there for 12/27-12/30. I liked the hotel because it was away from all the street noise and next to a park. The lanai had room for 2 chairs and a small table and we had apartial view of the ocean. It had utensils and a large refrigerator but NO microwave. We took our food down to the front desk and used the microwave in their office; other people were doing the same thing. They also charged $1.00 for each bag of in room coffee after the 1st day and 10.00 for parking each day. It wasn't close to restaurants but there was an ABC store across the street (mini-mart) and a Whaler's mini-grocery next to that so it helped. Eating in restaurants is very expensive; we ended up driving to a new Safeway and their prices were same the states. Safeway is also the place to buy souvenirs; same stuff but much higher on the street. It was a good hotel, tho, staff was definitely friendly and patient, beds were great, good hot water pressure.I don't know anybody who sat in their hotel room all day so it worked fine for us except the microwave part.

We are retired military and were frustrated to find the Hale Koa completely booked for the dates of our trip. After researching on-line, it seemed that the Outrigger Luana Waikiki was going to be the best value, but I was very hesitant to believe all the reviews that I read...been burnt before by having too high expectations. WOW~ was I surprised! Right off the main area of Waikiki, within easy walking distance to the beach, the shopping, and the restaurants, we found a hidden gem! The hotel was beautiful from the outside, and the staff was super friendly! Everyone was always smiling and extremely helpful...even after an extremely grumpy customer was at the desk loudly complaining of something (I never figured out what it was...she was pretty loud, though), the desk clerk still turned to me and answered my questions with a huge smile and very friendly attitude.The rooms were spacious and VERY CLEAN. Surprised to find a small lanai outside, didn't expect it and I loved spending my mornings watching the sun come up and hearing the birds. Actually spent more time there than in the room! Coffee was only provided the first morning, but was available in the lobby every day. We did not have a microwave...would have been nice, but there were plates, glasses, and utensils when we ordered in. Parking was onsite for $10 a day...not too bad when compared to elsewhere in the area, and I had expected it before, so was prepared. The pool was small and chilly, but the deck was great and the lounges were comfortable and plentiful.There were even grills available to use...pretty cool if I'd wanted to actually stick around and cook! :-)Walking to the beach was a pleasure. My husband HATES to walk anywhere, but he even enjoyed the walk :-) and all you had to do was step out the front door and head to the right to enjoy great shopping, dining, and street entertainers (ok, maybe some of those could have used a little practice... but some were pretty good! lol).Overall, we would DEFINITELY stay there again and recommend to our friends... and guess what? The nightly rate here was even LESS than the rate we would have had to pay at the Hale Koa! $$$ saved...gotta love that!

Decent hotel but Tripadvisor reviews led me astray. I was expecting more. Yes, the rooms are updated. The furnishings are somewhat outdated. There was rust on the bathroom floor. We booked at kitchette studio and were upgraded to a partial ocean view kitchenette studio - it was more like a park/ocean view - very nice view. But, the room was very small. Only 2 chairs/2 towels, etc. even though we have a 7 yo son (total 3). It was almost too small to want to cook/prepare/eat meals in the room. The lanai is very small. One day 2 of arrival, I woke up to my face directly on a MATTRESS. They do not use fitted sheets. RANK. Health issue. Disgusting. I complained. The mgr wasn't very supportive. They got a king sheet (for a queen bed) and tucked it deep under the mattress to rectify it - that worked. Also, enough dust under the TV for us to write our name in - also disgusting. The toaster was broken. They came up immediately and switched out one that worked fine. We had a microwave that worked fine. They make the beds daily but left dirty dishes in the sink. The internet connection was good - it is not "wireless" as you do need to plug it into a phone cord. Can't google on the Lanai - no reach. They have free donuts/coffee in the morning - my kiddo loved the donuts. In the afternoon, they had Hawaiian chips + iced-lemon water. The pool closes as "sunset" and had I known that, would not have stayed there. Small lobby but clean. No restaurant. Gym was small but decent. Rather go for a run outside anyways. No introduction when we checked in as to pool hours, bbq, laundry, etc. No bell person to help carry bags up the stairs to the lobby. Also AC unit very, very loud. Slow elevators. Cheesy gift shop - closed for holidays which was fine by me!PROS: nice walk to beach - 10 minutes (walk through the park)nice view (if off street)nice BBQs (open to 9pm) for your use near the poolwithin walking distance to most of Waikikikitchens do come equipped with almost everything you need to cookfacilities to print boarding passesfree donuts in the am w/java

Very nice hotel. On Waikiki strip, but not right in the middle of everything. Rooms very nice. Only concerns was coffee was provided on the first day, but no other days. We were informed that we had to pay for the in room coffee after the first day. Also, room could use a microwave. Had high speed internet, but was wired internet. Little things, but overall, I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Very quiet rooms. We have stayed in other hotels in Waikiki and paid a lot more for worse rooms and hotels. Good value

We stayed here one night before taking the Pride of America cruise and two nights after. We could not believe how nice everything was at this hotel for the price. Clean, updated, beautiful pool with the most comfortable lounges. But what really made our stay was the staff and the way they all went above the call of duty to make our stay wonderful. We were especially grateful to Kenrid who not only handled our luggage but gave us great advice on places to eat and helped arrange transportation always with a great big smile. We loved the location, off the main strip, right on a beautiful park and the walk to the beach was not bad. Thanks for a great stay in Waikiki!!!

We stay at the Luana fairly often and the improvements are obvious--from the flat screen TVs to the teak furniture around the pool area. Very upscale look to the cabanas also. And there will be a restaurant on the ground level soon. Only downside is that the pool gets cooler and cooler as the nights become cooler and heating the pool with solar panels or some other method would make the Luana ABSOLUTELY perfect. Morning coffee and snacks add to the ambience.

We knew Oahu would be expensive so we looked for a place that offered condo/kithenette. This place was perfect. Right on the bus line. Walking distance to my convention site, shopping, and the beach. Really can't think of a single complaint and made this trip affordable. We took the bus to a grocery and were able to eat in the room for breakfast and dinner so we could max out the credit card with fine dining at night (see our other reviews). Good internet connection.

My husband and I were freshly married only 3 days when we arrived in Honolulu. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a partial ocean view at the Outrigger Luana in Waikiki. We really researched in to many hotels and condos before deciding on this one. We loved the layout of the whole room with a large wrap around kitchen and TWO private lanais. I think this was the best feature because we could choose where we wanted to have our breakfast-overlooking the ocean or on the bedroom lanai looking at the wonderful city line. The bathroom had extra large counter space which was perfect for all of my extra stuff...and there were two tvs that both came equipped with dvd players. The staff were very friendly and willing to help. Beware that this condo is a bit far from the actual beach and even though you can see it from your window, it lines up with the Fort DeRussy beach which is not accessible to "common" folk. Still, walking to the beach is not an issue when you go from the main Waikiki strip...it is a pleasure to wander around and see the sights. An important tip for those wanting to go to the Waikele Premium Outlet mall, right across the street from the Luana is the Ambassador hotel, just outside from there you can catch the shuttle out to Waikele for only $5.00 both ways...if you are lucky enough, the driver will drop you right off at the condo on the way back but it is a very short 2 minute walk.We enjoyed our stay and liked that it was rather quiet in our area. The pool was quite nice although we did miss having an actual restaurant in the building, there were several nearby. If you want a nice quiet space that is very large and private for honeymooners, the Outrigger Luana is perfect. We didn't need to rent a car because it was still close to the shops and the price was extremely reasonable...oh and a big thing..their wireless internet access is perfect...not too slow or terrible like we found at our resort in Maui!
