I've been traveling to HI since 1999 and every time I've stayed at this hotel, it's comfortable, affordable and central to Wikiki, it's easy to get around whether diriving or walking.

We stayed for 5 nights in the Outrigger Luana Waikiki. It was a great location - close enough to walk to Waikiki (although not extremely close), but also away from the chaos. Our room was very clean, spacious and nice. We had a fridge, sink, bowls/plates, and utensils, but no microwave, which would have been nice. We had a balcony with a small table, an indoor table, and a sofa.The staff was very nice and helpful with information about directions, etc. Parking was plentiful, although it did cost us $18 a day.We did have one minor housekeeping issues - we found a half-eaten mint on the counter the first day that was definitely not from us - we left it there in plain sight, but the housekeeping staff never did get rid of it during the stay. Maybe they thought we left it there.There is no restaurant in the hotel, nor are there very many restaurants very close. You either have to drive or walk down to Waikiki. We didn't mind that - we prefer to be in a quieter location, which is exactly what we got. From here you are very close to Fort Derussy, which has a nice small beach - not as busy as Waikiki.I would stay here again without hesitation and would suggest this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to Waikiki but in a quieter location.

We stayed three nights at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki. It was our third time at this hotel and we have stayed at a number of other Waikiki hotels. We have found all of the Outrigger Hotels to be outstanding properties and good values. The Luana is only a short walk to the attractions of Waikiki. We don't rent a car in Waikiki and are able to walk where we want to go or cross the street and take the bus into Honolulu. On arrival at the Luana we were upgraded to an ocean view unit, as we have been on two previous trips. Ocean view, however, is a long view over Ft. Derussy park. Our unit had a kitchen area but did not have a separate bedroom as some of the units do. Everything worked and was completely clean and neat. We have found the staff to be very accomodating. They allow us to stay in our room as late as possible when we have a night flight home and then hold our luggage while we go out to dinner and wait for the airport transfer. We have always been completely satisfied with the Luana and hope to return again in a couple of years. I would recommend this hotel to anyone except those who want to be able to walk out the hotel door on to the beach.

We were actually in Hawaii filling a "bucket list" for our very ill brother so no nightlife. But the rooms were wonderfully clean and comfortable, great views from the balconies, amazingly friendly and helpful staff. There were seven siblings in three different units and we all would rate the stay A+ and we'd all return to this hotel.

This hotel was alright, the location was OK. There is no breakfast, which is common in that area.I had a studio that had a full kitchen and balcony. The kitchen was new and nice. My main complaint is that the staff didn't make it clear that I would be paying an additional charge per night for an extra guest, I thought it was a lump sum (and I talked to 3 different people about it). They weren't very responsive either.It wasn't that far away from the beach, within walking distance, but it wouldn't have been too much more to stay closer.

I stayed here the night the lights went out in Oahau. They were helpful in getting you set up. The hotel staffing was light most had a fair attitude. The rooms were average for a three star hotel. This hotel is more along the lines of a Holiday Inn Express. The room price was also along those lines so it was a good value. Very easy walk to the beach and close to downtown. I would stay here again.

We stayed at the Outrigger for 10 nights, overall pretty good. The hotel was clean and centrally located, close to shops, the main strip, beach and pretty good value for money.However, I was a little disappointed with the customer service. They didn't have a tour desk in the hotel and the staff at reception were not very helpful. Usually staff at reception desks are forth coming with helpful information, but unfortunately even when I asked questions they were not that helpful.If I ever went back to Hawaii I would probably look into staying somewhere else.

We had a fantastic stay. The Room was clean and well maintained. it was the best we have had yet. This was our 10th trip to the islands. I manage nine hotels for a living and the service from the Front Desk to the Doorman was great. They were friendly and helpful the whole time. Thank you for making this trip so fantastic.

My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki for 1 week mid-October. What a wonderful stay. We had stayed there previously before the Outrigger chain revamped it - and it was nice then too. Great centralized location, you can walk to Ala Moana or to Waikiki beach with ease. Diamond Head is a fair hike from here but still do-able. The hotel itself is very nice. Wonderfully maintained. Beautiful lobby - Hawaiian decor, clean, friendly desk staff, always an elevator waiting for you. The room itself was lovely - just like the pictures. We had a corner studio room c/w comfy queen bed w/storage underneath, sofa, table and 2 chairs, tile floor, A/C, t.v., internet, iron & small ironing board, fridge, large kitchen counter w/sink, dishes, cutlery, bathroom had a hairblower, small tub. Balcony had 2 wicker chairs and end table. The carved wooden Hawaiian lamps in the room are great - one is a man the other a woman both in hula poses. There was no toaster or microwave though but for $8 we picked a toaster up at WalMart and saved on breakfasts and lunches by having them in our room - not to mention the pounds we avoided gaining by not eating large meals 3 times a day. The pool was crystal clear, cleaned daily, had lots of pool chairs - towels at the front desk. They also have a very nice gym c/w 2 treadmills, eliptical, 2 exercise bikes, free weights and several weight machines. Overall, only 2 minor complaints. The shower could use a new shower head. A bit of street noise but was eliminated by the A/C running. Neverthe less, we'll be back!

It was our first visit to Hawaii and really had no idea of where to stay. After looking at several hotels I narrowed it down to a few and ended up picking this one, but after our stay, I don't think we'll be back.PROS-location is excellent. just a few blocks from shopping, many good places to eat, nice green park next door, and beaches close by.-room size is good-rooms with kitchenette nice and convenience-quiet in the halls -pool,BBQ area, and work out area on site-room decor nice-really liked the toiletriesCONS-stayed in room with partial city view - NOISE WAS HORRIBLE. Every night could hear traffic, sirens, car alarms, etc...I don't know if rooms on the opposite side of the hotel are much better-if the outside noise didn't wake us up, the in room AC units would. When that sucker kicks in, IT IS LOUD-every time I got in the shower I could smell mold. I actually cleaned some off the shower curtain, but smell still lingered-staff were not that nice. I think only twice were we greeted when we entered the bldg-parking $18/day and only 1 elevator would access the garage so you hoped that would be the one that would stop on your floor when you wanted to leave-first day and a half only one elevator worked. I climbed to and from the 14th floor a total of 5 times each wayIf you're willing to spend a little more I think it'd be well worth it. Stay in the area, but off of this main street.

We chose this hotel specifically because the online description said to quote a particular code if we wanted a honeymoon upgrade. When we checked in, we asked about the code and were informed that there was no such thing. When we complained, we were told that perhaps the code was useful at one of the other Outrigger locations. Upsides included cleanliness, full kitchen, good value; downsides (aside from no honeymoon code) included lots of street noise for the city or mountain view room we had and the parking isn't free. The parking garage is also narrow and the exit onto a busy street is tricky, so beware if you are bringing a large vehicle. Overall, I probably would stay here again but I am kind of annoyed that the honeymoon upgrade was not available as advertized.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and the Outrigger Luana was a great hotel/condo. I booked a city view with kitchenette. All the kitchen amenities you could ask for. Very nice pool with cabanas if the sun gets to be too much. They even have a barbeque area if you feel like getting some fresh fish from the market (highly recommended). The staff is very friendly and accommodating, still allowing me access to the garage and a shower room 8 hours after I checked out. The $18/day for parking is a little steep, but if you want to get out and explore life beyond Waikiki, it is great to have this hotel at the beginning of the main strip. Their Tour Desk was not open (probably because I went off season), but the front desk put me in touch with the tour desks at the other Outriggers in Waikiki, who were happy to make arrangements. The beach is only a five minute walk away, so why anyone would pay upwards of another $100/night to be right on the beach is beyond me!

My husband and I stayed at the Luana for 3 nights, prior to a cruise to the other Hawaiian Islands. Everything went like clockwork. We liked our room, the view was nice, check-in went very smoothly,and I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. It's a few blocks from the International Market Place, and a short walk to a beach, but not really far from anywhere. I would recommend it. We booked with United Vacations and it was their choice for us to stay there.

Very impressed with this hotel. I attended a 4 day training class and trip was paid for by the company. The class was relatively easy and left me AMPLE time to enjoy this hotel and other sights. I was on the seventh floor, with a view overlooking the main strip (ala moana blvd) and had a great partial view of the ocean and Waikiki from the balcony. Two queen size beds, which if I dig deep, would be my only complaint; I found the bed to be too soft. BUT this is minor! Room was very clean, with sink and seperate bathroom with sink as well. It had a small refridgerator and service was sublime! John the night clerk recommended a most excellent pub when I arrived late in the evening (The Yard House, 130 beers on tap!) Tired and a little razzzeled from Honolulu's slightly confusing maze of streets, John knew the look and instantly recommended the place. Outstanding! Service was well maintained on all levels! The hotel front is located right on the Ala Moana and within easy reach of everything you want...shopping during the day, nightlife, and Waikiki is but a couple blocks. Not directly on the beach, but who cares...outstanding facility!Another person who attended the class had a slightly different room on the 6th floor, with king bed, and overlooking the park (no ocean view). He did however have a two burner stove and microwave in the room, which mine did not. But I did not care, I enjoyed some fabulous food at other places.Parking is available; however I am not sure if they charge for this or not. As I said, company paid the bill. I had G2 parking with my own slot assigned. My companion had G1 parking and did not have a specific spot assigned. He did try to park within G2 one night, but received a notice not to park there again, only on G1. So G2 may cost more to park.And if you like Ribs, Tony Roma's is a block up the street on the opposite side and a good Thai Restaurant, Keos is located directly across. 'nuff said, enjoyed my time at Waikiki! Brilliant hotel!

Just returned from our second stay at the Outrigger Luana. Once again our stay was fantastic. We have stayed at several other hotels in Waikiki in the past but the Luana is the best - it is ideally situated in Waikiki within walking distance of the best shopping and restaurants, it provides lovely units which are well kept and very clean, and importantly all the staff are friendly and helpful. We requested the same 1 bedroom unit as we had had the previous year and they obliged – not only that but as it was a special anniversary for us they left a small bottle of champagne and a card for us on our arrival. We also traveled with a friend, it was their first time in Hawaii – they rented a studio with kitchen and they loved the hotel as well. We all can’t wait to go back.We would recommend this condo-hotel to anyone looking for more than just a hotel room in Waikiki – having kitchen facilities can be very useful even if you don’t want to use them everyday.

This was our first visit back to Oahu since 1975. A lot has changed. We booked a week at the Luana. It was everything the other travellers had wrote. Check in was easy and friendly. We had a corner room on the 5th floor. The view thru the kitchen window of the Derussy Park was gorgeous as was the city view from the balcony. The unit was spotless. Daily maid service was excellent. The pool was great. However, non-swimmers will not like it as there is not much of a shallow end. The best part was the location. Easy walking distances to the beach, the Marketplace and shopping at the Ala Moana shopping centre. The only negative was the air conditioner. It was a bit noisy, so we just shut it off just before we went to bed. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would return next time we visit Waikiki.

This was our third stay at The Outrigger Luana Waikiki, and it just keeps getting better. This 16 story "CondoHotel" is sparkling clean, reasonably priced, and wonderfully staffed with helpful people. Rooms are good sized, attractive, well provisioned (many have full kitchens with glassware, cutlery, tableware, etc.), and have beautiful views.The Outrigger Luana Waikiki is located adjacent to the only large park left in Waikiki, and is within a short walking distance of the best shopping and famous Waikiki Beach.Definitely a little known gem in this ever expanding city. As my lovely wife says, "This is the only way to visit Waikiki!"

I needed to book a hotel pretty quickly for a 2 week stay and my agent booked the Luana for me.From the moment I drove up in my rental car, I was greeted warmly. I was upgraded without even asking to a nice room with a kitchenette and a great view. The kitchen came with more utencils and flatware than I needed which was great. My luggage didn't make it with me on the plane and after I checked in and went to get something to eat, the luggage was in my room safe and sound.The fee for parking is a little outrageous, but luckily because of my Military ID, I was able to park at Fort Derussey for $6 or $7 a day.The staff was courteous the entire time and very helpful with advice. The room, when I requested it, was impeccably clean. The location was fanatastic, in walking distance of everything in Waikiki and not too far from H-1. I'd wake up and go on a run to Kapahulu and back which was a good distance.The pool was gorgeous. It was a great alternative when I didn't want to mess with getting sand on myself or with the large crowds.My only complaint would be the rusted weights in the work-out room. I expect to come back to Oahu for the same exercise next year and I will request to stay here again.Thanks so much to the staff for being so wonderful!
Great little secret in Waikiki. I always try to book this place during my business trips. It is very convenient having a small kitchen in the room.

I booked this hotel after reading very positive reviews on this site. For the first two days of our vacation, we stayed at a sister property - The Outrigger on the Beach and were very satisfied. I arrived at the Luana with high expectations. I knew that the rate was $70 less per night than I had paid at the Outrigger on the Beach but felt that I had previously paid a premium for staying at an oceanfront hotel. When I arrived at the Luana, I was a bit taken aback by the unimpressive lobby. It is very, very small. The staff was very friendly. I arrived very early as we had just disembarked from a cruise and I was immediately given a room. I went upstairs to my room and noticed that the halls were very warm. I entered my room and it was OK - on par with a Quality Inn or Best Western. The walls had no wallpaper but were covered in a textured paint as was the ceiling.I had tons of kitchen cabinets - most of them empty and a fridge. No microwave or stove so I have no idea why anyone would need so many cabinets. Didn't really matter as I hadn't planned on eating in anyway. The bedcovers were clean as was the room but looked like they had been washed more than a few times. The remote for the television was actually cracked and the lid to the battery compartment kept falling off. The bathroom was very small and when I looked in the tub there was some sort of small spider. Later, when I went to shower, the water was rust colored and I had to let it run a while. My air conditioner was very noisy. Turned on and off constantly and loudly. The location was nice during the day - a 10 -15 minute to the beach. I went to the beach near the Hilton Hawaiin Village. Since chairs by the Hilton were expensive to rent, I walked a few blocks down the beach and was able to rent beach chairs for considerably less. There is a nice coffee shop on Ala Moana Blvd across from the Hilton. Very crowded for breakfast. At night, I felt the area was less crowded than by the International Market Place and I was nervous about walking about. I am not saying that the area was unsafe but I just didn't feel comfortable walking around the immediate vicinity of the hotel at night.

For our first stop on our Honeymoon we stayed at this centrally located modern hotel. Most of the rooms in the hotel overlook the Fort DeRussy park offering a good view of the water. If you don't have to be right on the beach, but still in the thick of the shopping district, this is a perfect place. The amenities were modern, the room spacious. The tile floors offered a clean feel. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel room, but its central location made it great if you don't plan on renting a car. We found that for a short stay (3 nights) a car isn't necessary - especially if you plan on doing tours that will pick you up at your hotel. Only complaint, they did not replace the little coffee packet on the second day, apparently there is a charge for more coffee. We bought some coffee ourselves, but found this a little tacky after we already paid a good bit for a room.

We stayed at the Luana for a week this past May. I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised. We had a one bedroom condo for 3 adults and 2 small children. They were very accommodating and did not require us to book a 2 bedroom due to the fact that we had 5 people total. They took the fact that we had a 2 and 5 year old into consideration and said it was no problem. This was a problem with other condos. Check in was quick and pleasant. Bell man was very friendly and gave us directions to the nearest grocery store. The condo was very clean and modern. Kitchen was wonderful with granite countertops, fairly new appliances, plenty of dishes, pots and pans, glass ware, etc. The bedroom was large enough to fit a rollaway without being too constricting. There was a large walk-in closet with a safe. The bathroom was big enough and clean. The couch bed was fine, my father had no complaints. We did use the laundry facility with was sufficient. Overall we were very pleased. We had been to Waikiki in 07 and stayed at another hotel where the room was tiny, the bathroom floor was old and stunk, and the staff could care less. At the Outrigger Luana it couldn’t be better. The price is great, staff is very friendly, and the condo was fantastic. As for the location we didn’t have a problem at all. We were able to walk all the way to the Ala Moana Mall and in the opposite direction to the International Market Place with no problem. It took us a day to figure out a good beach for the kids that was within walking distance. We found if you walk out of the hotel and head towards the gas station, turn left at the park (immediately after you pass the gas station), head towards the ocean, cross the street at the light and turn right. The first side street you come to turn left. Walk all the way down and you will be in front of the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has a really nice beach and the waves are fairly calm for little kids. It sounds far but my 5 year old walked it twice everyday with no problem. There is also a nice patio restaurant there that serves burgers and sandwiches. We really enjoyed our vacation much more this time around because we had a pleasant place to stay. We would definitely stay there again.

I don't usually "gush" about hotels but this one is "gushable". Luana means "live in comfort" and we sure did. Great room with full kitchen, fridge, Flat screen TV (even tho we were out most days) since this location is at the start of Waikiki. From our balcony we could see Diamond head and the Atlantis subs out at sea. And it overlooks a 66 acre park. The Beach walk is 2 blocks and you can't believe the list of big name stores that line the street just outside. It looks like Rodeo drive, too rich for me but fun to stroll and window peek. I would move to Hawaii if I could live at the Luana.

This is the third time I am staying at Outrigger Luana and I am very happy that I to have found this place when I came to Hawaii for the first time.The place is always very clean and proper (and new).The hotel faces a lush green park, unlike many other hotels in Waikiki where you would often see a grey wall of the next door hotel from the window of your room. The walk to the ocean is very pleasant, especially when there are a lot of flowers in bloom (pretty much always in Hawaii).This time around, I found that they have added a free internet in every room (which might be a good or a bad thing, considering how many things you can see here if you don't waste too many hours browsing around). Overall, I would highly recommend this place. It may not necessarily be the cheapest one you may find in Waikiki, but it is totally worth your money.

We stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki for 1 week, and the entire stay was fabulous! Right from the moment we checked in - we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view 1 bedroom from the city/park view 1 bedroom and what a beautiful room. And not only that when we got to our room, as requested the baby crib and high chair were already in the room, which usually we have to call and ask for. The room was very clean, the maid service was excellent. All the staff were very friendly and helpful - especially the girls at the hotel information travel desk. The location was equally great - the beach is a short walk thru Fort DeRussy Park, and the beach there is very nice and not to busy. There is also a bus stop right across the street of the hotel as well as a ABC store and it is very close to the lively beachwalk and lots of great shopping. After seeing some of the other hotels and properties I was considering I was very happy with the location of the Luana. The other amenities at the property were also great - the pool area is very nice, cabanas and lounge chairs. The pool was never to busy and the water temperature was perfect. There was a BBQ area as well with 2 gas BBQ's (no charge) that we used quite often during our visit. They were kept extraordinarily clean - they must scrub them down every day! There were also tables and chairs by the BBQ area to eat there as well. There are coin Laundry facilities and a very nice fitness center. We absolutely loved our room, from the lanai we could see the fireworks that the HIlton puts on every friday and the view was to die for, how sad to come home and look out the window at our boring view of the neighbours back yard! The bedroom was huge and also had a lanai and the bathroom was very clean. The kitchen - we had a full kitchen - was fantastic! All the appliances were top notch. It was a godsend to have such a nice kitchen with 2 small children. And also in room internet was provided at no charge. I just cannot say enough nice things about this hotel and would definitely stay here again when we travel to waikiki again. The only thing missing in my opinion is a hot tub in the pool area.

spent one night here, as we waited to board a late flight home. The room was very bright and modern. Had full kitchenette, which we were not able to use, unfortunately. Very roomy. Quiet, even though we were near elevators. The walk through the park to the beach is very nice.Hotel staff were extremely helpful 2nd day as we waited on a late flight out of Honolulu. Let us keep car in garage all day for free, held our luggage securely, and allowed us to change out of beach clothes and into flight clothes. Romantic wonderful meal at Orchids Restaurant.enjoyed walking Levers street at night with torch lit sidewalks.Buy your souveniers at the Aloha Stadium Swap Market on Wed./ Sat./ or Sun. Prices better than street vendors.

Nice hotel at reasonable price. Employees were very helpful and welcoming. Hotel is centrally located, but in a quiter block which was nice. Some mold in bathroom shower, but rest of room appeared clean. I would recommend taking bus to Hanuamana Bay for snorkeling. Oahu is a beautiful place.

My husband and I decided to stay at the Outrigger our first night in Hawaii - assuming we would be tired from a long flight and trying to adjust to the time change. We had some trouble finding the hotel - drove by it a couple times before realizing the correct entrance. The location of the hotel is great - it's right by several good restaurants and shopping. The staff was very friendly - checking-in and out wasn't a problem.We were not very happy with the room we were given - first floor, right on top of the road. The room was missing an element of "luxury" that other hotels in the area have. In fact, later in our trip we stayed at another hotel in Waikiki for $25 more per night and were much happier. The Outrigger isn't a bad hotel - the room was clean, TV worked fine, bathroom was comfortable. But once we compared it to another hotel in a similar price-range, we were convinced we'll stay in the other hotel next time.

Although other review sites, including who we booked with show moderate to high ratings (3 stars or higher), it was less than expected or described in our package. We should of had a kitchette, but only had a partial kitchette. Had a small regrigerater, sink, dishes and coffee pot, but no small microwave to warm/heat up food or beverages. Bathroom did not have a fan. Our room was close to road, so a lot of traffic noise if had door open. Noisy A/C unit. Had a rental car which cost $18.00 per day...no mention of paying for parking in our package. (maybe mentioned elsewhere)On the other hand, we did see some beautiful rainbows almost every day! The pool was nice. The walk to the beach wasn't too bad especially via the park. Nice coffee shop.Our overall stay in O'ahu was wonderful. Would return again, but not sure would stay at the Luana.

This is honestly one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had in my life. We are a young couple in our mid 20's who enjoy traveling alot and are not difficult people to deal with. However, this one is truly a hotel experience to remember forever. I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Outrigger Luana and booked it through Travelocity, which I will also never do again. So before booking this hotel, we read great reviews about it on Trip Advisor and searched for the lowest rate. It turned out that Travelocity had the best rate because the site clearly stated that there was "Free Parking" at the hotel. Since most hotels in the Waikiki area charge $15 to $25 a night for parking, we decided to book it with Travelocity. To ensure that Free Parking was a guarantee, we even called the Customer Service number and was confirmed by one of the staffs that Parking was included for free.When we got there, the hotel manager told us that parking was $18/day even tho we had the confirmation printed out with a print screen saying that Free Parking was included as one of the amenities. She told us that they never had free parking even tho it stated on our reservation. So she called Travelocity on the spot when we tried checking in and they said that they don't have free parking stated on their site. Turns out that Travelocity updated their site since we booked it 2 months ago and deleted the free parking. The manager then insisted that she would try to figure out how the Free Parking even got there in the first place. At one point, they were even trying to accuse us of modifying the confirmation even tho we had a print out of it! Can you believe that? First of all, why the would you ever put your guests in this situation where you have doubts on how the confirmation turned out. I thought that was extremely unprofessional of them and was highly disappointed. We also felt so uncomfortable staying there because all the staff knew that we were the ones who had the "parking issue" and was not too friendly to us. Anyhow, they really ruined the reputation for the Outrigger chain hotel. If I were them, I would just easily have taken care of the $90 parking especially when we had the confirmation printed out and was so upset over it. I thought overall it was so unfair and that it was a false advertisement. Bottom line is regardless if it's Travelocity's fault or not, they should just cover it and somehow try to get reimbursement with Travelocity and not inconvenient the guests by making us call and contact Travelocity directly. This was our vacation! We did not have to even deal with this! If it wasn't for the parking mess, I might stay here again. But because of it, I rather stay somewhere else where it's closer to the beach and provide me with better customer service. Enough said, just never again at this hotel! Awful experience!

I read the reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor.com and took into account the plusses and minuses of this property before booking my reservation. I just returned from a five-night stay at the Outrigger Luana and I'm happy to say I made the right choice! For $135/night, I got a "park view" studio room, which faces Fort DeRussy R&R Park and the ocean, which was very nice! I found the queen bed and furnishings extremely comfortable and nice to look at. There's an "eSafe" in the armoire closet for your laptop and other valuables. There's a good-sized TV and an Ethernet cable connected to the Internet! Granted, it's not wireless, but it's cable Internet (Oceanic Cable) and it's FREE. No dial-up here.While I didn't have a kitchen room, my studio room had a nice granite countertop, sink and mini-fridge, which kept my leftover dinners fresh. (Just go downstairs to the friendly Front Desk folks and have them microwave your meals.) I bought fresh fruits, veggies, bagels and cream cheese, and guava juice. Having the fridge saved me money. There are kitchen amenities like utensils, plates and glasses too.I had a handicapped bathroom without a tub, which was fine; the shower was great. Some reviewers mentioned there's a lack of space for personal toiletries, which is true. So I kept them on the granite countertop outside.I exercised at the small Fitness Center, mostly for weight training (machines and free weights). There are two treadmills and a bike, which is just right for this small condo hotel.The Luana staff are extremely friendly and helpful; they greet you when you leave and greet you when you return. Check-in and check-out was extremely fast and efficient. Security is always a concern for someone traveling alone and I felt very safe; it's very comforting to see hotel security walking the property. The Bell Staff and Housekeeping are also friendly and helpful too.I didn't bother getting a car since I'm from Honolulu and know my way around by bus (TheBus) and by foot. The Luana is so close to everything, just get a good map (ask the Front Desk for one), buy a multi-day bus pass and explore on your own. The Luana is centrally-located and close to shopping and transportation. I'm a runner so I ran all over Waikiki and Honolulu with a runner's backpack, water and food. You might see runners training for December's Honolulu Marathon (they run in packs).Something fun you might want to try is going on the Outrigger Reef Hotel's catamaran, which is within walking distance of the Luana. Supposedly, it's the fastest catamaran ride in Waikiki. The hour-long experience is better than an amusement ride that last mere minutes.

Me and my wife were looking for a hotel that was in our budget for our honeymoon. I work for the airlines and this was the hotel who was giving be a better rate than the rest. We arrived at 11am to the hotel and were not expecting to have a room ready. To our surprise we had a room ready and to our amazement had been upgraded from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view on the top floor. The rooms were desent in size and beds were comfortable. Appart from the excellent location to the beach and shopping I would recommend this hotel and I would definately stay here again.

I booked a hotel room at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki because of a convention at the Hilton Hawaiian Villiage where I usually stay. The Luana is a very good value and just about as close to the beach as you can get without being on the beach. Even though I booked an "Ocean View" room, I was still told on checking that I was upgraded to an ocean view room. Weird, but I didn't really care that much. The room on first glace was very modern and clean. The kitchenette was furnished with kitchen maid appliances and was spotless and the rest of the room was just as nice. The bathroom was very small and seemed clean, but I noticed later that there was quite a bit of rust around the tub. It appears that the only part of the room that wasn't refurbished was the tub and shower. Housekeeping failed twice to replace the remote that had been broken (the tile floor must have done a number on the remote). I'm not sure if they were ignoring me, or that they just didn't have any extra remotes for the 27" Sony TV. The view was nice across the park and I could look right now to most of Waikiki and Diamond Head.I felt that I did get my money from the hotel, but the room was a little disappointed given the glowing reviews on this site. I can only guess that maybe my bathroom wasn't completely redone. I probably wouldn't stay there again, but families looking to save some money but still have an ocean view will probably be pleased. Not really a business hotel, but I'm guessing that isn't its target market.

I went with my wife to this hotel in September 2005 and we had a very nice experience. Good hotel for its price and fantastic location. We have stayed also at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado and have also a nice stay. You can book this hotel without any problems. Just a few blocks from Waikiki beach and easy access by car to all important spots of Oahu. Nice shops close and amazing restaurants just across the street.

Room was on the 1st floor (actually the third floor from the road) with a view of the city. The lanai was large, albeit the lowest one in the building. The room was very clean and an adequate size. Furnishings were in good condition. The front desk and room service were friendly and courteous. The marble countertop is a nice touch, and there is tableware but no microwave.On the minus side, the elevators were slow, and the doors would sometimes close then open up again. The parking garage is on the small side, but I never had a problem finding a space, even at night. Parking is typical Waikiki at $18/day. The driveway is tiny and can sometimes get jammed with taxis waiting.Overall, a good hotel for the price.

I stayed here in early December 2006 and found it to be a great value for Waikiki. I had a studio with a good partial ocean view, also overlooking Fort DeRussey. My room was on the 9th floor over the fans, but I did not find them to be much of a problem at all. Frankly, the noise from Kalakaua Avenue is more of a problem at times. I would say overall that this hotel is a little more noisy than average, given the noise from the street and also from door/lanai slamming. That's really the only negative I can think of.The kitchenette was fantastic!!! I had everything I needed to do light cooking, including an executive sized refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave. Also, I found the room to be very clean and never had a problem with bugs. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Just a lot of aloha in the place. It is nicely located to walk to good restaurants, the beach, and the rest of Waikiki. There's an ABC store across the street, as well as the Dollar rent-a-car if you want to rent a car for a day. You're also within easy walking distance to several major bus stops, if you want to use TheBus. Oh, yes, and the shampoo, conditioner and lotion that they give you do smell fabulous!
user_name:
Lara67
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were upgraded to a full ocean view 1 bedroom unit on the top floor (15) with 2 balconies. Views of the park and the city were awesome. What a great place! Granite countertops, Braun applicances including a washer/dryer ( 1 of the few units that had one), super clean.... the bathroom had nice space, nice fixtures, very good. The bed, king sized, was very comfortable with tons of pillows. Kitchen, full sized, was very well equiped with nice appliances.Staff at the desk was tops, our room was good as new every day with excellent maid service.If we were to go back to Waikiki, we would definitely stay here. Use the Expedia desk in the lobby to book tours... Katy is excellent and funny! If you want a great burger, go to Waikiki Burger, out the front door, left, 1 block...excellent!Good Italian, turn right, go 3 blocks, turn by the blue/pink hotel and eat at Arcino's... we had a great meal for about $15/each.Waikiki is crazy traffice, kind of like mixing Myrtle Beach with Chicago.....

We stayed at Outrigger Luana for 5 nights in June 2007. The hotel is located about 10-15 minutes walk from the main beach at waikiki. It was an ok walk, past all the shops :)The hotel has parking available underneath the hotel (keycard activated). It was safe parking, we always managed to get a parking spot, but we often took the last one. Parking is US$18 a day too.We had a partial ocean view room. The view from the window was nice. we were on the 14th floor. We could see over the park out to the ocean in the distance. The hotel is right next to the main road though, so with the window open it was very noisy. The air conditioner was noisy too..so a bit of a no win situation there!The room was large, and included a kitchenette. The bed was a queen bed, but it was not comfortable and the sheets were not big enough for the bed. The bottom sheet was not a fitted sheet, but a flat sheet, and it constantly came up leaving us sleeping on the mattress. The staff didn't make the bed very well each day either, but this could have been because the sheets were so small.The overall room seemed a bit old and in need of a face lift. The bathroom was bit old. But it all worked as it should. Free internet in the rooms too (with your own laptop).The pool was very nice. Lots of lounge chairs for sun baking.Overall, the hotel was ok. Staff were friendly. There are so many hotels in waikiki though, you could no doubt find somewhere better.

We booked this hotel through Expedia based on other people's ratings, and the star rating, as well as the Outrigger name. I read some negative reviews about insect infestations, and bad customer service experiences - and I have no idea where these came from! The hotel was great - the staff was friendly and courteous, and I didn't notice any insects anywhere. Besides - in Hawaii, cockroaches will show up even in the nicest 5-star hotels - that's what you get for being in the tropics. Anyways - the room they gave us was pretty nice - a studio with two queen beds, a kitchenette, and a lanai with a city view. The kitchenette didn't have a microwave - which would've been a great amenity - but otherwise, everything was clean and in good condition. Since the floors were marble - it would've helped if housekeeping had swept the floors during their daily cleaning - as the sand you accumulate at the beach starts to accumulate. The pool was nice, there was a big patio area to relax and sunbathe on - with some shaded areas for those who preferred to stay out of the sun. It was a small pool, but clean - and refreshing. The location was good too, not far from the beaches - but close to other attractions as well. There were lots of places for food around - a short walk to the other hotels in Waikiki - and there was an ABC store right across the street (which anyone who's been to Hawaii knows - you're in there numerous times over the course of your stay). I'd definitely stay here again, and recommend it to other people who are looking to travel to Hawaii. However, there were plenty of hotels I'd also like to try out - hoping that the service and amenities match, or rival that of the Luana.

A group of 30 of us were sent to the Outrigger Luana when accommodations were not available at Hickam Air Force Base. We showed up in mass and the staff of the Luana handled us in a professional, polite manner and had us in our rooms in under 15 minutes total! The entire staff is to be commended for their above and beyond approach to service and taking care of their guests. If we needed anything during our week long stay, we just had to ask and it was done. The facilities are very nice; the rooms are very clean and comfortable. There is a very nice gym with modern equipment, all of which is in excellent shape. The pool is small by some hotel standards but is cool and refreshing and fairly private. Having a refrigerator and microwave in the room is very nice when you have left-overs from the various nearby restaurants. The Outrigger Luana is in a very nice location, just a few blocks from the beach and you are surrounded by shopping and have access to a lot of activities. There is an activities desk at the Luana that can help you purchase tickets to almost everything happening in Oahu. You don't even need a car because the bus and trolly systems are very convenient and will take you anywhere you need to go. Starbucks is on the site and a great place for breakfast is a restaurant named Eggs and Things which is a short walk away and Keos Restaurant is directly across the street and is a fantastic place for Thai influenced cuisine. At the corner is a burger restaurant named Hawaiian Burgers and is very good too. Try the Yard House, a few blocks away for 200+ types of beer...all on tap! The Cheesecake Factory is also nearby and the food is to die for!!!! Again, the Outrigger Luana is an exceptional place to stay, relatively inexpensive by Hawaiian standards and the service is way above what you expect. Thank you Lilly, Chris, Joseph, Shane, Cess, and the rest of the staff for a fantastic experience! As service members away from home you made our time in Hawaii a very enjoyable stay.

We stayed at Outrigger Luana Waikiki for three nights on our Honeymoon. We stays first 7 nights in Maui in a private condo. I really wanted to see Wikiki beach and we chose Outrigger because of its price and location. We got upgraded to a suite with an ocean view which was wonderful. This stay was a highlight of our honeymoon. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and full of information. We had a great time staying there. We walked to Wikiki beach several times and its not far at all, just few blocks. Room was very clean, granite counter-tops, new Hawaiian decor. We would definitely stay there again.

Stayed in1 bed OV deluxe 15 th floor.Beautiful view jogged around park evey am Ft DeRussey ,and fitness room clean and equipment in good condition.People commented on bugs in condos.need to be careful in any tropical client with food but the unit was spotless.Pool small but gets sun as opposed to obstructed pools as other condos have.

had trouble deciding where to stay as we had never been to hawaii before-unable to get clear picture of things from all my research prior to the trip. wanted kitchen facilities as we often prefer simple meals.this place was fantastic and really met our needs.i must admit it is a little tired and could to with new a little freshening up but was spotlessly clean-no cockroaches or ants as mentioned in other posts!we stayed in a studio room with kitchenette-on the 16th floor-had views of the park/city and also could see the ocean! there were 3 of us and we shared 2 queen size beds! very comfortable beds at that!the rooms are quite large so we did not feel cramped but we really only were in the room to sleep, shower and change and occasionally eat.this hotel/condo is very close to everything you need-1 block from beach-easy 5 minute stroll.easy walking to great restaurants and shopping-we walked to ala moana shopping centre twice and found this an easy walk also but the bus is just on the next corner if you're not into walking.kim, the most wonderful, friendliest concierge, ever was a delight and couldn't do enough for us-as were the rest of the staff.the pool has been described as very small but i found it great for relaxing and cooling off and the deck chairs were very comfortable and plentiful-pool no good for lap swimmers however there is an excellently equipped gym if you need exercise and fort de russy park next door which had a great path around the perimeter to run around.we will definately stay here again-we are not into resort accommodation so if that is what you are looking for you will be disappointed but dont overlook this place if you want everything else for much less than similar hotels charge

We booked this place looking for somewhere functional for our first and last nights.Hotel was clean and staff were friendly (although the room keys never seem to work first time you try to use them.) Good sized room with a fridge and food prep area (no cooking facilities though.) Good concierge service for taxis, directions and table booking.Booked a partial ocean view for the last night and had a really clear view of the ocean.Overall - very happy.

We stayed in a hotel room at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki for three nights in February. The place was nice, but unspectacular. It's well maintained and the folks who work there were all very friendly and accommodating. Our room had two queen beds and unfortunately didn't have a kitchenette. Internet access was free.Parking is available in their 2-level underground garage. The cost is $18 per day -- it's a steep price, but there aren't too many other options if you have a car.The location was pretty good. While it's not in the heart of Waikiki, it's still close enough to walk to all the restaurants, shops, and beaches. TIP: for breakfast, "Eggs 'n Things" down the street was a great place to go for an inexpensive meal.If you're not planning on spending much time at the hotel and aren't looking for the perks of a luxury hotel, this is a good place to stay. Most of our time was spent exploring the island, so for the 8 hours a day that we actually were in the room it fit our needs perfectly.

My wife and I stayed at the Outrigger Luana 1 bedroom deluxe ocean view room for 4 nights on January 21st. We actually stayed at the hotel in October in a partial ocean view hotel room and liked it so much we booked the best room they had. Our first stay we had zero problems, but this stay we had several.The first thing that happened was they charged us $18 a day for parking. It was $15 in October. When they gave us room 1106 we were rather excited to be up so high. When you walked in the hallway and kitchen had 15 inch marble tiles on the floor. The kitchen counters were all granite as was the bathroom vanity. The deluxe room has a balcony off of the living room and a second one off of the bedroom. The living room one faces the ocean and the bedroom one faces the Wyland painting and the gas station with all of the exotic cars for rent. I noticed that one of the kitchen cabinets was locked, as this is a condo owned by someone, as was a drawer in the bathroom.The next morning my wife killed a roach type bug that was hiding behind the toaster. Later that morning I killed one on the counter next to the kitchen sink. I also found a dead one in a drawer. We went across the street to the ABC store and bought a can of Raid and sprayed the entire can in the entire unit. I also killed a live silver fish in the hallway. Before bed I killed a roach on the wall over the bathroom door. In the morning I found a dead roach next to the TV in the living room. When we went out for the day we told the front desk and I showed them one of the bugs that I had killed. We told them that there was rice and crumbs all along the baseboards, and they said they would send the “super housekeeper” up to clean our room and the exterminator would be called. When we got back from our day out, the rice and crumbs had not been swept up, AND I found a dead roach right in the middle of the kitchen floor. I brought the dead bug down and asked to be moved to a different room. They moved us up to room 1506, which is next to the top floor. This unit did not have any cabinets locked in the kitchen or bath. It also had a ceiling fan in the living room, two dvd players, upgraded remote controlled a/c units, and a washer and dryer in the unit. This is what we had expected all along.The location of the place is really good. A 5 minute walk to the beach, right on Ft Derussy park, lots of shopping and dining very close. But the bug thing really creeped me out. But the nail in the coffin was the courtesy room. I have stayed at many Outrigger places in the past and have always used a courtesy room. It is usually the worst hotel room that they let you use for 30 minutes to take a shower on the day you check out. They list this as a feature on the internet and we even asked about it when we checked out. They said no problem just ask. So we put our suntan lotion on and went out all day. We had an 11pm flight and wanted to shower up for a late dinner and a long flight home. When we asked at the front desk they told us the courtesy room was the two outdoor bathrooms by the pool. We were told to lock the doors so no one would walk in on us. The men’s bathroom had 2 sinks, a toilet stall at the back and a small shower right across from the urinal. The floor was soaked with urine and I wouldn’t take my shoes off, let alone take a shower. The women’s bathroom was right across from 2 outdoor gas grills, and my wife said there were so many ants crawling around she was afraid they would crawl into her suitcase if she opened it up. Needless to say, neither of us showered and went home dirty and uncomfortable. When we turned the key and pool towels in the front desk person was so ashamed of what he did he wouldn’t look at us or ask if things were ok. He knew what he did. I really am sorry to say I can’t recommend this place to anyone. I love the location and the remodeled rooms. The parking increase was unpleasant, the roach infestation was totally unacceptable, and the courtesy room sealed the deal. Most people were very helpful at the front desk and the bellman was great, but there are way too many other new places opening up on Lewers Street to try rather than stay here. Beware.

We chose to stay at Outrigger Luana after reading the traveler reviews...I believe I'll do more careful reading between the lines next time I read the reviews. Our studio room (515) had a nice and recently renovated kitchenette with a decent supply of dishes for 4, tableware, and cooking accessories. We had a bit of a view of the ocean from the small balcony which surprised me since we were to have only a city view. The air conditioner worked very nicely. My husband liked the exercise facilities. The pool is small but nicely kept. The pool deck is on the smaller side but equipped with comfortable chairs and tents to shield from the sun. Other than that, the positives mostly end and the negatives begin. To start, (and this is a big one for me,) there is no fan in the bathroom...puhlease!! We tried to call the main lobby when we couldn't access our phone messages and couldn't dial through. When my husband went to the lobby, he was told that our phone "buttons" hadn't been set up yet. What on earth kind of excuse is that? There were cockroaches in the room (I hope we didn't bring them home with us in our luggage.) There was no information book in the room to explain where the pool, laundry facilities, ice machine, etc., are located or to give information on restaurants, boutique hours, check-in, etc., or any of the usual information found in a book in hotel rooms. When I asked the front desk about one, I was told there isn't one. The queen bed was more of a large double. I sincerely doubt that was a queen bed. There was a small baby ironing board...the kind that sits on 2 inch legs on a table and moves all over the place while you're trying to iron. The coffee for the coffeemaker had to be bought at the front desk. The first night is supplied in the room, but after that, the supply is not refreshed...which is fine, I guess. It was poor quality coffee. The bathroom door squeaked loudly and had to be pushed with your weight against the door to close it. The bathroom is supplied with two rough towels, two washcloths, two hand towels, nothing extra. The toilet was the cheap plastic seat type with a rough surface as if something had gotten stuck to the lid and never completely removed. The floor was only swept by housekeeping when I left a tip and a note to request it. The housekeeping staff, however, were very nice and left the room neat. The sheets were barely large enough to go 6 inches down the side of the bed and there wasn't much on top to fold over the bedspread. They do not do dishes. You need to wash your own dishes. The furniture had many worn spots in the wood stain. You pay separately for parking and internet access (which is only accessible in the lobby). I would not stay there again. This hotel was not what I had expected for $200 a night and the many positive reviews I read. Granted, staying in Waikiki is not inexpensive, but when I have it to do again, I'll pay the extra money to stay at a better hotel where the amenities are included in the price, the sheets fit the bed, and the other negatives are hopefully minimized.
stayed in early Jan. Great studio, nicely rennovated, great kitchen. only negative was the long walk to beach, but would stay there again--good value

We just returned from enjoying our wedding, and honeymoon in Honolulu, Hawaii. We traveled with a small group, and we rented six rooms at the Luana. We were pleasantly suprised by our stay! The Luana staff was very helpful, the rooms larger than expected, and at a very convienent location! Everyone in our group had a great experience. We quickly found out that the walk to the beach is only about three blocks, and there are many restaurants located within walking distance of the hotel.The expedia desk in the lobby provided great, and accurate information to anywhere we were interested in going in Hawaii. This is the place to stay if you want a hotel room located close to Waikiki, but not directly in the middle of all the major hotels. We had friends stay at the Reef on the Beach, and they enjoyed time at our hotel as it wasn't as busy, and the rooms were larger. We will return to the Luana during our next stay in Honolulu!

Based on the reviews I found here at tripadvisor, my fiancee and I booked our honeymoon stay at the Luana. We are not big on sunning or surfing, although we like ocean view, and the Luana was perfect. You can see the sunset every evening out the balcony. The rooms are quaint, clean, and the customer service was great. We were put in a room above the exhaust fans from the neighboring restaurant, and while it was noisy, it's not like we expected for it to be peace and quiet. It's Waikiki! There are horns blowing, and traffic noise anyway. If you don't like noise, don't stay in Waikiki. I am not a big fan of it, but the location of the hotel was appealing to us because it was close to everything and we wouldn't have to have a car all week. Most activities provide transportation to and from Waikiki hotels, free of charge. It's right on Kalakaua Street, which has tons of restaurants, shops, etc. within walking distance. We prettty much walked everywhere we needed to go in Waikiki, and took TheBus to places that were a bit farther away. We went to Wailana coffee house (which was a short walk away) nearly every morning because it was the closest place open. I couldn't wait to try it, after reading all of the reviews on here. I was dissapointed with it...it's just like any other breakfast diner with the exception of the guava juice, fresh pineapple (which is served with nearly every meal in Hawaii), and coconut syrup. The pool for the hotel is dissapointing if you are planning on spending a lot of time at the pool. There is no direct sunlight until afternoon, either. I tried laying out there for a short while but became impatient waiting for the sun, and walked to the beach. We had a partial ocean view and a kitchenette, although we didn't even use the kitchen. It has a two-burner stove, a microwave (which is difficult to use I think), a small fridge, and a sink. It's supplied with forks, knives, plates, and bowls. There is a TGI Fridays right across the street, which is convenient for lunch. I would also recommend Todai, which is a short walk away - they have a great sushi and seafood buffet. I think it was $30/person, but it was completely worth it.The activities desk in the lobby is also helpful, as you can just call them, and they will do all of the homework for you and set up basically any activity you want. So in conclusion, great place to stay! Affordable and great location!

This "boutique" hotel was decent for the money. The staff was friendly, the room adequate and clean. It is well located --- virtually across the street from Keo's of Waikiki, Tony Roma's Ribs, and not far from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. On the "downside" while we had a refrigerator, we didn't have the microwave oven we expected and were told it would cost us another $30 per day for a room with a microwave oven! (We passed). The garden view was crummy, overlooking the adjacent gas station.Neverless, we felt we got our money's worth.

I have done a lot of research for all my vacations especially my honeymoon. Furthermore during my Island hopping adventure in Hawaii the Outrigger Luana was the cheapest hotel I stayed in and the most accommodating. For the first night I was there I was in park view studio for a very nice rate and I came back to the Outrigger for my last three nights and I have no complaints the resturant fans did not bother us and we did have the sliding glass door open. I also stayed in the Turtle Bay Resort and the Outrigger in my opinion was better the Outrigger did not have fees and other unrelated charges. When I come back to Hawaii I well most likely stay at the Outrigger again.

My wife and I loved this hotel. We stayed in the middle of November 06. Yes, the pool is a bit small but does the job. Yes, there is the noise of the exhaust fans from the Japanese restuarant on the East side of the building. We found the noise to be ideal white "sleeping" noise however.The location is perfect. Right by the park, and easy walk from the strip, and in close proximity to the outstanding "Todai" buffet where we went three evenings. The rooms were clean and we saw none of the insects mentioned. The one bedroom with kitchen was perfect for the two of us providing us with a great breakfast and pinapple cutting area. The staff was absolutely as helpful as can be for a non-full-service hotel. Be aware that the concierge at the hotel is from Expedia so you may not always get completely objective advise at that desk. When we checked out we received a bill that was PRECISELY what we had been told when we booked. That single fact pushed me from "above average" to "excellent."

We stayed in a one-bedroom suite with an ocean view. The room was gorgeous, & the view was breathtaking. The walk to the beach was a pleasant 10-minute stroll through a park. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, we encountered huge problems which spoiled the beginning of our trip. First, the kitchen flooded and my 3 year old slipped and fell. Apparently the piping wasn’t connected properly behind the dishwasher. Then came the cockroaches! Lots of them! In the kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, and living room. Total infestation! At midnight, we had to move all of our stuff and our 4 sleeping children into a different room. The hotel manager did very little to compensate us for our inconvenience. Overall, I’d have to say that I can’t recommend this hotel…unless of course they fix the pest problem. Then it’s a great hotel for a very fair price.

The Outrigger Luana Waikiki proved to be the perfect place for my husband, myself and a friend to stay this past December during the U2 concert. After carefully reading reviews on TripAdvisor, I booked through the resort directly and requested a room on a high floor, away from the restaurant. We wound up on the 10th floor with a park view (I was told the ocean views are all close to the nearby restaurant which several TripAdvisor reviewers said was very noisy) and we really enjoyed the view of the park and the high rise buildings of Waikiki. No complaints about restaurant noise though Waikiki is a busy city so there was noise (lots of ambulances) throughout the night but as long as we kept the windows closed, it was fine.The room was tastefully decorated with an island theme but I do have one complaint: It's hard to call these rooms condos. They are basically one hotel room with a kitchen decked out with everything you would need for a one-week stay in Waikiki. The rooms are a bit small when you factor in the kitchen but we did book a standard room so perhaps the property offers other options (at a higher price). The beds were comfortable, the TV large, a nice amount of drawer space, the shower was OK (some problems with hot water), the service at the front desk was excellent (kudos to Malia at the Travel Desk - very friendly and helpful) and maid service was fair though our tile floor was never vacuumed and we had tracked in quite a bit of sand. We loved the postcards and free postage we were given upon check-in the and hotel gift shop offers a decent selection of souvenirs.Parking is an issue everywhere in Waikiki so, if you are planning on spending most of the time in the city, I would forgo the rental car. We did rent a car to explore the island and learned that the hotel does not have enough parking spaces for all of their guests. We had to park across the street and about a block away (near Nike Town) - not a bad walk. Whether you park at the hotel or the overflow lot, you will pay $15 per day so you really can save some money by relying on public transportation (the hotel is located within walking distance of great shopping and restaurants so bring some comfortable shoes).Other tips: Nick's Fishmarket right across the street is very unassuming from the exterior but was our favorite meal of the trip. Keo's, also located across the street, has excellent breakfast options at reasonable prices. Outrigger Luana is located very close to the Hilton Hawaiian Village - only a 10-minute walk - and the beautiful beaches in front of the Hilton are open to anyone so check those out (great swimming and views of Diamond Head).

We stayed at this hotel for two nights on our way home from Kauai and it was an excellent stay! We wished we could have been here longer. Excellent value. We paid $145 per night; we originally reserved a studio with kitchen, partial ocean view. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a one bedroom with kitchen, partial ocean view for free. The room is clean and modern, with granite counters, a full kitchen with all the dishes you would need to prepare any meal, clean bathroom, lots of storage space and a great view of the ocean and park. There is a pool and laundry area for guests. We wished there was internet access, but there is a kiosk with a few computers in the second floor lobby ($5 for 30 minutes). Since we work in consulting, we need to be able to check messages! The resort is near a beautiful park with views of the ocean, and it is only about three blocks from the luxury shops of Waikiki. It is about a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach, and you pass many luxury shops as well as at least three or four large shopping malls and many restaurants from nice chain restaurants like Cheesecake Factory to more upscale dinining in the luxury hotels. Some of the reviews mention fan noise from the restaurant next door. Yes, it is true there is noise, but we were not bothered by it. We wanted to have the air on anyway, and did not hear the fan in our room when we had the doors closed. Don't worry about the fans when you stay here, it is not a bother unless you like to keep your windows open all night. But, it is just white noise. This is definitely worth the value. No need to pay more than double for the hotels on the beach when you can stay here for a great value and excellent room! We highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

We chose this hotel after conducting extensive research on hotels in the Waikiki area. We booked a one bedroom suite (city/park view).The exterior of the hotel was not overly impressive...but this was quickly forgotten when we checked in & were told we'd been upgraded to a two bedroom suite for free (they must have over-booked the one bedroom suites). They told us the two bedroom suite they were putting us in had been recently renovated.We were thrilled with our suite! It was MUCH nicer than we expected, & it was HUGE! We had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, washer/dryer, tons of closet space, a full kitchen, 2 small lanais off of the bedrooms, plus a HUGE patio off of the living room that looked out over the park & the city.The bed was not the most comfortable that I've ever slept in, but was typical of hotel beds. Parking in the garage below the hotel was VERY limited, although we were lucky enough to find spaces every night. Other than that, everything was terrific. The staff was friendly & helpful the few times we approached them, our suite was well-appointed & clean, maid service was reliable, it was quiet at night, high-speed Internet access on the mezzanine level, free newspapers, etc. There are several restaurants nearby, as well as stores where you can buy food to prepare back in your room/suite. It's about a 10 min. walk to the beach, but it's a nice walk by/through the park, & it feels safe, even at night.NOTE - this is a condo hotel, & from what I understand, the units are privately-owned. This may explain some of the variation from one room/suite to the next. We were on the 7th floor, but I can't remember the room #.Thumbs up!

I have rated my stay as excellent because there was nothing I could find fault with.I had a large clean room on the third floor with fridge and crockery, which I was not expecting, so was a bonus.I had no problems with noise nor with the view since hotels situated in the main area of towns don't usually have panoramic views! The hotel, as far as I know, does not promote itself as being on the beach.I found all the staff that I had contact with to be courteous, helpful and friendly.I only stayed 2 nights (cost about $260 incl. tax) and would certainly return.

For anybody who wants to whine about the noise, well, if thats all you can complain about in freaking busy Waikiki then that tells you all you need to know.My girlfriend and I came to Waikiki for her birthday on the 8th of September. Check-in was a breeze and we managed to get a room on the 15th floor. Let me tell you, the view was absolutely amazing! You are situated right next to beautiful Ft DeRussy Park and it's just such a serene sight. When you head outside the hotel you can walk through the park (or down to the next block which leads you to the Outriffer Reef) and you're only about 5-10 minutes from the beach. The great thing about the Luana is that it is right at the start of the Kalakaua strip. It's not as busy and as hectic as some of the other "bigger" hotels. Right across the street from the Luana is a nice statue of King Kalakaua and there is an ABC store right there (one of about 100 on the strip!). Also I would recommend Keos restaurant across the street, absolutely great Thai food!The room itself was cozy, if not a little dark as some others had mentioned. Only other weird thing was that there was an armoire in front of the bed where the TV should have been. Minor complaint since when you're in Waikiki the TV is the last concern, but still. The kitchenette came in handy when you're storing drinks and microwaving leftovers from the great restaurants.The only real complaints outside of the room are the lack of restaurants in the hotel and the noise. As I mentioned before, the noise isn't really that bad. It's only a hinderance if you want to have a picnic on the balcony or something like that. With the patio door closed it's really not noticeable. The lack of restaurants was my only legit qualm, but thats the price you pay to stay at a nice condo without the fuss of all the bigger resorts.I would highly recommend the Luana to anyone. Absolutely a great bargain for what you get. If you're looking for world class amenities then you'll want to look more central strip on the oceanfront. If you're looking for a very nice place with an even nicer price then the Luana is for you!

Over rated. The decor is quite nice but the rooms are dark and uninhabitable due to traffic noise, the gas station, and the restaurant blowers. Your view looks like industrial Pittsburg.You have been warned.There are better places to stay in this price range !!
